3.description: I started coming here probably 10 years ago after another local barber raised his price $5, for the second time in a year and became too expensive too continue with.Mila at Springfield Trim Shop consistently gives me a great haircut every time at half the price today of what the other barber charged me 10 years ago!   She's always smiling and friendly. For a haircut, she is happy if you call in advance for an appointment, phone the day of, or simply just walk in.  She is very easy going.I think she certainly is the best hidden secret in the area and deserves a chance to give you your next hair cut.  I do not think you will regret it, as you will get a great hair cut while at a great price!

1.description: Just a heads up to Mila's loyal customers.  She will be moving next week to 6402 N. Trumbull which is about 9 blocks east of her current location. Directly across from the Auto Zone and 2 doors north of Devon Ave.  The name of the establishment is Razor's Edge and you can contact her at the same phone number. 773-478-4164.Please spread the word as this came on quite suddenly and many customers are unaware of the move.And if you happened upon this review because you are looking for a new barber give Mila a call now. As you can see from the other reviews she not only does an excellent job but she is a real sweetheart too. She has been cutting my hair for over 10 years now and I won't go to anyone else. And just for the record, she still uses the warm shaving cream and straight razor on the back of your neck and sideburns. Ahhhhh!  It doesn't get any better than that!

2.description: I have been taking my now-15-year-old son to Mila since he started growing hair. Even after moving out of the neighborhood we still return to her shop. She does a great job, her fee is most reasonable, and it's like visiting a member of the family.

0.description: I've been coming here for a few years now. I had passed by it and wanting a barber that knows me. I think I'd just like to be a regular somewhere, this place fits the bill. It's a one woman operation and it seems like Mila knows just about everyone that comes through her door. She's always friendly and quick to ask how you're doing, how's the family but if you're not in the mood to talk she doesn't mind that either. I've been coming to her for haircuts now for about 5 years and I've had no complaints. It's cash only, and the price is comparable to any other barber shop, but with just her there she knows you and you build a rapport. I've gotten free shampoos from her, just 'cause and around Christmas time she sets out brandy and she'll do a shot with you.The only downside is is if she's busy then you'll have to wait a little bit, but most don't mind. I know I don't because I just walk in and hardly ever set an appointment.

58.description: This is the kind of restaurant that should be right up my alley, because I eat a ton of mexican food, but try to go with healthier options most of the time.  A prior experience I had with a Protein Bar (there are several around the loop) was pretty disappointing, but this one was good.  The Guac and Roll was excellent.

56.description: Protein Bar was conveniently near my hotel and I love getting juices whenever I can. I had the Hi-5 juice which was delicious. I could really taste the pineapple in mine. I'd love to try the other juices available. I didn't try the food because I felt breakfast AND a juice was too much for me. This place can get really slow in the mornings, so had I been in a rush, I probably would've left before ordering. It's a also a little too expensive for me, but when the company's paying, who cares, right?? Sometimes quality does come at a price.

29.description: I used to love this place when it first opened, but now that they have gotten popular, the quality of the food has gone downhill. Portion sizes reduced and their supposed "Super 6 salad mix" is basically all iceburg lettuce (see pic) with a few spinach leaves thrown in., super 6 of what? and to top it off today the avocado in my salad was brown(see pic)! ewwwwww...I buy a salad and a juice and it's $19, maybe its just me but for  $19 I expect quality food! I am done, to many other healthy options in this area for that price to not get quality good.

42.description: Good mix of convenience and satiety for a salad stop.  The staff is pleasant, and while the location is in a hospital building, they maintain a sense of airiness to the place.  Salads are very large with a lot of greens, and their marinated tofu is very good for the vegan crowd.  One can easily calculate nutrition information on their website, and there's a goodly selection of soups, wraps, and even craft sodas to maintain interest.  I like that the snacks hedge toward the healthier side (e.g., fruit bowls), as opposed to being the obligatory salad + roll or cookie place (Saladworks, I'm looking at you).Prices are very reasonable, and the lines move briskly during my lunch.

23.description: The juices were not fresh squeezed, instead they were cold pressed so I'm taking a star off for that.  I had one of the quinoa bowls, Saigon Spring, and it was very tasty!  I liked the atmosphere and the staff was very friendly.

47.description: Came here for the first time for breakfast. The pesto scramble is pretty good, and they even put chicken in it for me since there are no breakfast proteins. Unfortunately, they stopped serving iced coffee but I was able to pour my hot coffee (with almond milk, pretty excited about that) on ice. Service was good, and so was the music.

8.description: Protein salad with quinoa and avocado was good. Quick and easy for lunch. Clean restaurant. Good service.

31.description: I get the feeling that this is the place you tell your friends you're going to after your SoulCycle class but before you stop at Lululemon for some new crops. Because only those pretentious, Goop loving people would go here and think the food DOESN'T taste like wet cardboard.We stopped in for a quick lunch Sunday afternoon and the place was dead. i ordered the Quac & Roll barritto and my partner ordered the Buffalo barrito.  We both grabbed a bottled juice for a grand total of $34.00.  In my head I'm thinking "We should've gone to LYFE kitchen". We took a seat and waited for our barrittos. When they were ready, the guy behind the counter yelled my name and handed us our food in a plastic bag.  Yes, it didn't matter that we were eating "here", our food was given to us in a bag. As for my quac & roll, it was "meh". Definitely could taste the quac but that was about it. There was barely any chicken and nothing else noticeable taste wise. My partner said is Buffalo barrito was good but not enough to make him come back. I ate my barrito and drank my beet juice but the whole time I had to keep telling myself "It's healthy. You'll get big muscles from all this protein. Ignore the soggy cardboard taste". We finished up and headed home, passing LYFE kitchen. A single tear rolled down my cheek because I felt so bad for passing up LYFE that day. LYFE has a better menu and food that's still healthy but actually tastes amazing. You sucked me in one time, Protein Bar. I learned my lesson and won't be back.

34.description: Stopped in for late lunch after a long day and was pleased with the yummy and super healthy options.  I tried the pesto chicken quinoa bowl and the Hi 5 smoothie.  Very nice spot.  Will definitely be returning to check out more of their smoothies!

16.description: I get the feeling that this is the place you tell your friends you're going to after your SoulCycle class but before you stop at Lululemon for some new crops. Because only those pretentious, Goop loving people would go here and think the food DOESN'T taste like wet cardboard.We stopped in for a quick lunch Sunday afternoon and the place was dead. i ordered the Quac & Roll barritto and my partner ordered the Buffalo barrito.  We both grabbed a bottled juice for a grand total of $34.00.  In my head I'm thinking "We should've gone to LYFE kitchen". We took a seat and waited for our barrittos. When they were ready, the guy behind the counter yelled my name and handed us our food in a plastic bag.  Yes, it didn't matter that we were eating "here", our food was given to us in a bag. As for my quac & roll, it was "meh". Definitely could taste the quac but that was about it. There was barely any chicken and nothing else noticeable taste wise. My partner said is Buffalo barrito was good but not enough to make him come back. I ate my barrito and drank my beet juice but the whole time I had to keep telling myself "It's healthy. You'll get big muscles from all this protein. Ignore the soggy cardboard taste". We finished up and headed home, passing LYFE kitchen. A single tear rolled down my cheek because I felt so bad for passing up LYFE that day. LYFE has a better menu and food that's still healthy but actually tastes amazing. You sucked me in one time, Protein Bar. I learned my lesson and won't be back.

13.description: It's alright. We just wanted something quick so stopped by here, but wouldn't come back for breakfast. I thought the Denver Scramble was bland.

11.description: I was so happy to discover this place when it first opened. I was intimidated a first because everyone in line was fit and lean. But I really wanted to try it so I did. I was hooked immediately and actually ate there everyday for a week in a row. I always get the chicken parmesan bowl and the ivy burrito. I have also had the red line shake. I still come periodically but the menu has become stale to me. Otherwise clean and affordable.

39.description: Meal was delivered an hour earlier than scheduled.The concept is good - perhaps great: healthy food, neatly packaged, calorie count front and center. The product is good - I had the Healthy Parm which is: organic quinoa blend topped with all-natural chicken, house-made marinara, and parmesan, for a total of 390 calories. It was tasty! We ordered around 9:30 for a 1PM delivery. Lunches arrived one full hour early. So my supposed-to-be-warm meal was cold by the time I was ready to eat. I don't care how good it is, I want it at the time agreed.

37.description: honestly the best. used to stop by here for breakfast every single morning, and get practically the same thing - pesto scramble! it is delicious, and doesn't require any additional seasoning, but i usually douse it in choulua - which is available for free, as is the sriracha! so clutch! the wide selection of breakfast and lunch items for under 500-600 calories is unbeatable. why eat anything else?  the service is friendly, and they will remember your order after about a week ;) the manager is nice too. excellent healthy food with a smile is what i like!

0.description: one of my favs in Chicago

38.description: Great food!! Love the Orange ginger carrot cold pressed juice. Great healthy food in a flash! I could see myself eating here a lot!!

51.description: I stopped into Protein Bar for lunch, and it was a great choice! The service was quick. The restaurant is very vegetarian friendly with lots of options for vegan and gluten free as well. The setup is similar to a Chipotle. I'm not from Chicago, and I was very impressed with the concept of this restaurant. I would recommend this as a quick healthy lunch option.I got the vegan original burrito with tofu. I could only eat half. It easy very filling! There was so many things on the menu I wanted to try.

27.description: First time at Protein Bar and Marie made our experience amazing!!! She could tell we were struggling reading the menu by the door and came over to help us with any questions and figuring out what we would like. She was so friendly and warm and continued to give excellent service to us until we left! Restaurants need more people like her, we will definitely go back to this location!!! Thanks Marie!

32.description: Sure the name says it all but I'll keep my review to a couple of comparisons below. Today was my first trip to any Protein Bar, since there seem to now be everywhere in Chicago. I was greeted by a helpful cashier and upon learning it was my first trip, he made a couple of recommendations. I ended up getting the Red Line smoothie with Vanilla protein, banana, strawberries and almond milk. It was a solid protein smoothie and tasted pretty good too. I also got a salad with Chicken, Avocado, pipito seeds and it was amazing. I say amazing since I recently got a salad at LYFE Kitchen and that was a small portion that wasn't satisfying or filling. I also got a discount for being a first time customer. Thank you Mr Nice Cashier. I will certainly be back to try more of their salads and smoothies but also their breakfast oatmeal and egg dishes.

54.description: I am one of those people for whom eating healthy is a struggle. Call me crazy, but I do not find a salad all that appetizing. Luckily, Protein Bar makes it so easy to eat healthy. It is freakin' delicious. And, I don't mean in that way where you say "oh, this was pretty great...for a salad." FOODSo far I have only tried the Quinoa bowls that are really flavor. The bowls may look small for $8, the bowl really fills you up and keeps you full for hours.- Spinach and Pesto Bowl - This is the menu item that turned me into a believer. It is absolutely delicious. Unfortunately, this is the quinoa bowl with the most calories coming in at just 480 calories. -Quinoa Chili Bowl (Chicken) - This bowl is good, but I found it a little underwhelming. The chili just tasted like a marinara of sorts without the usual kick of chili. I do love that they substitute the sour cream with a dollop of greek yogurt. It really works. Overall, both bowls are delicious. They are a tad bland, but luckily Protein Bar had TWO varieties of hot sauce (Cholula and Sriracha).  With some hot sauce, the bowls were perfect.SERVICE/AMBIENCEProtein Bar looks like an upscale fast food place. It is a little bit like Chipotle except a bit trendier looking. The service is great. Despite a pretty long line, they got the orders done really quickly. I went at 12 pm and I was out of there within 10 minutes. Definitely the best lunch spot out there - healthy, affordable, delicious, and quick.

48.description: Very Poor service. Food is not great and no hot tea. There's much better food and service one block away at Life Kitchen.

44.description: While I was staying in the city, I saw this place and wondered what it is. So after reading all the reviews I came here after running along the river. I got the millennium perk and it was pretty good. The combination of coffee and protein really have me a boost. Basically if I lived in Chicago I would come here all the time!!

24.description: I love that there are so many healthy fast food places in Chicago. This helps with budget. This place was okay. I got the Chicken Chili Bowl that came in a to-go container. The food was decent, but the portion sizes weren't great for the price you pay. The peanut butter protein shake was amazing though. I'll go back for that especially since its made with Almond Milk.

7.description: It's nice to have a protein bar outside of the loop near my home. The location is great for weekends when I want to pick up something healthier before running errands. The food is consistent and service is super fast at this location. Every staff member I've encountered here has been efficient and knowledgeable. Venue wise this is one of the more spacious protein bar locations. There's enough room for most customers to find a seat. I recommend trying the Millennium Perk or BGT with chocolate protein.

49.description: I loved this place!  Can't get any healthier than this!!!  I had their Hi-5 smoothie and their Baja salad.  Everything was delicious and their portion size was awesome!  Wish there was one here in California.  We need more of these around instead of yucky fast food joints.

40.description: Fast, fun, flavorful food!  Thank you!

53.description: Ate here for my first time after walking by a million times. The Comiskey Cocoa Smoothie is unreal. Such a great taste!! I also ordered the Super Original BarRito. Simply excellent. I will come back for sure!

30.description: Traveling from CA and was looking for a healthy breakfast in a deep dish pizza city. Found this place and walked about 1/2 mile. Food is awesome, clean and calm environment and very affordable. Well worth the historic walk and the little bit of money...

46.description: I tried Protein Bar for the first time this past week and boy, have I been missing out! I ordered the Wrigley Peeled which was a mix of chocolate protein, peanut butter and banana (aka the perfect combo). Not only was the shake really tasty, the staff was friendly and the service was quick. If you haven't been yet, definitely give Protein Bar a try!

1.description: I am so happy Protein Bar is in my neighborhood! Lots of vegan options and healthy ingredients.  Their salads are flavorful and nutritious.  Big portions.The restaurant is cute and simple, not too big, not too small. Good option to grab a healthy meal for a reasonable price. The staff is friendly.

55.description: Delicious and healthy. I don't feel bad at all for eating the burritos.

9.description: This location failed in many ways:1) They gave me a hard time about ordering over the phone. I was on my way to the airport with no access to a computer, nor did I have time to get to one. 2) I arrived at this location and my food hadn't even been made yet. In fact, 6 people who ordered while I was waiting still received their food before I received mine. 3) They did a poor job filling the soup bowl. Really? Come on, not cool.

26.description: Marie was so awesome and helpful at this place! Very knowledgeable of the menu, especially with the menu making it so hard to pick! Great customer service, happy with the salad and bar-rito that we got. I will definitely be back here this week! Great post workout meal after my soul cycle class!

25.description: I came here the other day to pick up lunch for my spouse and I. I ordered a gauc and roll and it had no avocado in it which complete defeats the point of it. I emailed Protein Bar and they apologize and reconciled the issue very quickly. My spouse and I ate there again and I loved my southwest salad. The service is really good and the staff is polite and courtesy. Though protein bar and I got off on the wrong foot, they made it up and made a customer out of me.

12.description: The Protein Bar was literally a few blocks from my hotel when I was in town for the Fare Thee Well shows on the 4th of July weekend and I was pleasantly surprised. I had their Buffalo    Bar-rito and the Buffalo Salad (not on the same day). Both entrees were really delicious and compliments to the staff who were super friendly! Wish we had some Protein Bars in NYC!Not sure why there are so many negative reviews here - I definitely have no complaints about the food or service, which is ironic, considering most people think New Yorkers can always find something to complain about :)

59.description: Thankyou protein bar for providing lean, healthy food on the run.It's very hard trying to find good places to eat at a reasonably low price that isn't covered in saturated fats.Thanks again, see you for breakfast!

21.description: The Protein Bar was literally a few blocks from my hotel when I was in town for the Fare Thee Well shows on the 4th of July weekend and I was pleasantly surprised. I had their Buffalo    Bar-rito and the Buffalo Salad (not on the same day). Both entrees were really delicious and compliments to the staff who were super friendly! Wish we had some Protein Bars in NYC!Not sure why there are so many negative reviews here - I definitely have no complaints about the food or service, which is ironic, considering most people think New Yorkers can always find something to complain about :)

17.description: I love that there are so many healthy fast food places in Chicago. This helps with budget. This place was okay. I got the Chicken Chili Bowl that came in a to-go container. The food was decent, but the portion sizes weren't great for the price you pay. The peanut butter protein shake was amazing though. I'll go back for that especially since its made with Almond Milk.

10.description: What a great little spot for your healthy, protein-heavy meal. I was contemplating one of the smoothies but decided to go with an egg bowl - the one with hot sauce, tomatoes and spinach. It was heavy on the eggs and light on the greens (which is probably what most people prefer) but it would be nice to have a bit more greens. At about $7, it's a pretty good value for a quick, protein-packed meal.

5.description: I stopped by this Protein Bar location twice during my visit to Chicago (I admit, I was semi addicted to Protein Bar in general). Service was good at this location, but not as good as the one in The Loop. The smoothies were a little thin here, but this location prepared the Fruit Loop'd much better than other locations.I also tried the Wrigley Peeled for the first time here. I enjoyed the smoothie overall, but I definitely prefer the Millennium Perk.The Pancake in a Bowl was somewhat of a miss. The oatmeal was tasty, but it was lukewarm and didn't really resemble oatmeal.Overall, I still love the smoothies at PB!

3.description: The food is good and relatively healthy - but it's expensive.  Their version of a burrito is $3 more and smaller than chipotle (and honestly, about the same nutrition).The staff here are not particularly knowledgeable - I have a food allergy and the staff struggled to know the ingredients in their smoothies.  For a restaurant that prides itself on being healthy, you'd thinking asking about ingredient wouldn't be such a big deal.   I'll go back but probably to a different location with more helpful staff.

35.description: Stopped here for breakfast. It is a nice healthy choice to start the day. They do a nice job of making healthy still have some flavor!

19.description: I used to love this place when it first opened, but now that they have gotten popular, the quality of the food has gone downhill. Portion sizes reduced and their supposed "Super 6 salad mix" is basically all iceburg lettuce (see pic) with a few spinach leaves thrown in., super 6 of what? and to top it off today the avocado in my salad was brown(see pic)! ewwwwww...I buy a salad and a juice and it's $19, maybe its just me but for  $19 I expect quality food! I am done, to many other healthy options in this area for that price to not get quality good.

28.description: First meal is free. Can't beat that. I got the vegan salad, pow juice and a coffee. All pretty good. Pow juice is tasty but tastes a bit sweet for a health drink. Coffee is fair. Salad was definitely filling. Tofu prepared well. I'm not a big fan of the large chunks. I would definitely return but would probably try other items in the menu.Also, a health store should probably have a recycling bin next to the trash.

45.description: We all had this for lunch today at my internship I has the pesto spinach bowl it was so healthy and yummy. I'll go back here

33.description: I was visiting Chicago and wanted to try this place around the corner.  I was pleasantly surprised with the variety of food, wasn't just protein smoothies but burritos, salads and quinoa bowls. Not only was it "health conscious" but the ingredients actually looked really tasty and amazing.I had the southwest salad.  It was $11 but easily 2 servings and TOTALLY DELICIOUS.The South Acai'd smoothie- Good name, full of detoxifying acai berries and also delicious. Came here two days in a row because I was so excited to get the South Acai'd smoothie again and try something new.  Wish there was a location in Milwaukee

43.description: This location failed in many ways:1) They gave me a hard time about ordering over the phone. I was on my way to the airport with no access to a computer, nor did I have time to get to one. 2) I arrived at this location and my food hadn't even been made yet. In fact, 6 people who ordered while I was waiting still received their food before I received mine. 3) They did a poor job filling the soup bowl. Really? Come on, not cool.

2.description: Wonderful, healthy & diet-friendly fast-food! Food: Protein Bar is wonderful because you can truly have it your way. Almost anything can be substituted, if you don't like the way they already make it. Protein options are endless: whey, egg, meat, etc. Milk options follow: soy, almond, 2%, etc. People with diet-restrictions would appreciate this place, a lot of vegan, gluten-free, vegetarian options... and options for those of use that can eat meat, cheese & everything in between as well. The quality of the food is great, but I will admit, flavor is lacking. I had a breakfast Santa Fe wrap and I had to douce it with sriracha to add some flavor and spice. The smoothies on the other hand are super tasty & filling. Like I mentioned earlier, you can easily substitute ingredients for others to fit your needs! This sets Protein Bar apart from anything else in the area.Ambiance: Set-up reminds me of Chipotle, clean, large & airy. Menus contain calorie & other macro values.Service: Could be better. The employees I interacted with were not the friendliest, not rude either, but definitely more involved with talking about what they did last night than serving the customer.Price: It's pricey, but the quality of their ingredients is really fresh & you can do so many things with your meal (substitutions, etc.)Overall: Tons of healthy options that allow the customer to be in control of what they're going to consume,  quick service & reasonable pricing. I'd definitely come back.

18.description: After running our 5k this am and walking around the city we decided to try the Protein Bar. Excellent choice to help us refuel after a run. The menu is written on the wall as you walk in the the nutritional values are listed below each menu item. I loved the option of having our breakfast scramble in a bowl or whole wheat wrap. Breakfast is served until 10 so that's good to know in case you were wanting something with meat. All meat dishes are served after breakfast. Healthy menu options with items high in protein count that are so filling. This place is great for a quick bite to eat that will tie you over until later in the day. Conveniently located across from the gym and yoga studio it is sure to attract all the health enthusiasts and those simply wanting to go the healthy route. Lots of great eats here in Chicago!

41.description: Second time I got the vegetarian chili, second time there has been chicken in it... Taste terrible as well

52.description: As a business traveller, it's a challenge to find healthy options. 5, yes 5 stars to Protein bar for the amazing tasty nearly 'clean' eating options! The southwest salad is perfectly spicy and delicious! It is so refreshing to find fresh made juice without a ton of sugary fruits added in too. I  (luv!) Protein Bar; and my body thanks you! Picked up some little snacks to get me through these long meeting days too; bye bye to the carb jumbo pretzels with chemical cheese sauce offered during the meeting breaks! Hello Skinny Pop and Think Thin bars :)

50.description: a good place to find complex proteins from food. Plus they show the all macro grams and calories for each item on their menu. The price is not bad too. Too bad it's only in Chicago.

4.description: Pricey!  Bring your checkbook along with your appetite.It's a good thing I don;'t mind paying for what I want.  I'm a picky/healthy eater, I need to be able to toss a menu aside and say, "Can you do this for me instead"  This was a problem at Protein Bar.  The place was packed right before the lunch rush around 11:45am, but there was an employee promptly greeting and willing to assistant with orders and questions at the door.  This aided in the assembly-line flow of business.  I ordered a salad, my nephew ordered a wrap and a drink.  The bill was nearly $30 sheeeesh!However, it was filling and nutritious so I shall not complain.

6.description: I have been to Chicago a couple of times for work and I finally found a good go-to spot near the Four Seasons Hotel! This location is inside the hospital building so you definitely have to know it's there... I found it on Yelp and was determined to try it!I like how they are transparent about ingredients and have such diverse foods. I could eat every meal here -- oatmeal in the morning, wraps or bowls for lunch & dinner...They also deliver but you have to reach a certain amount. Kind of hard since Protein Bar is reasonably priced, at least compared to places in SF!

22.description: Awesome wraps.  Great shakes/juice. Suitable for both vegans and meat eaters.  A great option to mix it up.  Efficient. Friendly.  You can't go wrong.

15.description: Good mix of convenience and satiety for a salad stop.  The staff is pleasant, and while the location is in a hospital building, they maintain a sense of airiness to the place.  Salads are very large with a lot of greens, and their marinated tofu is very good for the vegan crowd.  One can easily calculate nutrition information on their website, and there's a goodly selection of soups, wraps, and even craft sodas to maintain interest.  I like that the snacks hedge toward the healthier side (e.g., fruit bowls), as opposed to being the obligatory salad + roll or cookie place (Saladworks, I'm looking at you).Prices are very reasonable, and the lines move briskly during my lunch.

57.description: Ahh if there was one of these near by my house..I would probably go every single morning. My bank account would officially hate me. I ordered an acai smoothie and the chicken pesto quinoa bowl. Both were really good and refreshing! The quinoa bowl was packed with flavor and filled me up without making me feel 15 lbs heavier. I wish Virginia had Protein Bars all around the area like they do in Chicago. I definitely will check out the ones we have here near D.C. whenever I'm in the area.

20.description: After running our 5k this am and walking around the city we decided to try the Protein Bar. Excellent choice to help us refuel after a run. The menu is written on the wall as you walk in the the nutritional values are listed below each menu item. I loved the option of having our breakfast scramble in a bowl or whole wheat wrap. Breakfast is served until 10 so that's good to know in case you were wanting something with meat. All meat dishes are served after breakfast. Healthy menu options with items high in protein count that are so filling. This place is great for a quick bite to eat that will tie you over until later in the day. Conveniently located across from the gym and yoga studio it is sure to attract all the health enthusiasts and those simply wanting to go the healthy route. Lots of great eats here in Chicago!

36.description: Everyone raves about Protein Bar in Chicago so I decided to finally give it a try the other day. I tried the vegetarian chili and it was pretty good. The rest of the menu looks tasty too and I would like to come back and try a burrito, especially the breakfast burritos. I will add to this to the every expanding brunch list.

14.description: It's an okay alternative to breakfast.  No egg whites only whole eggs. It's a pretty healthy menu but lacks flavor. Staff very friendly.

28.description: Umm, going back to bed sounds like a great thing to do right now!  Unfortunately, for the Back to Bed store, I won't have to go back to them for many years down the road since I bought a wonderful mattress that has taken strain off of my lower back, and provides a motorized way to sit up or lay down.  Yes, I admit it; I got an old lady bed and it's freaking amazing!Terrence was great.  He allowed me to spend over 2 hours in the store laying on beds and different pillows while I tried out every foam mattress I could (including all the brands).  If you're looking for a bed in a non-pressure environment, come here.  My bed is expected to last 10+ years, so I won't be back soon, but I will be recommending this location to many of my friends.

1.description: Damion and Earl took great care of us. They were able to do a price match with another competitor and we saved a few hundred dollars. They threw in free frame for fun, hopefully because it was the 4th of July and nothing says freedom like buying your own bed. 'Merica!

39.description: My boyfriend and I tried to do some price comparison online, but didn't know enough information, it was too confusing. We decided to go to three stores all near each other and figure out what bed we wanted. We first went to Back to Bed and were very impressed with Nick. He was very knowledgeable about his products. He gave us some basic information on the construction of beds, but mainly let the beds do the selling for him. I liked that he listened to what we wanted and worked with our price range. The other stores either ignored us or didn't listen to what we wanted and tried to get us into beds that were too expensive. Our bed gets delivered on Friday and I can't wait!

9.description: I bought a brand new Stearns & Foster memory foam mattress at this location, the manager (Patrick) was extremely helpful, kind, just awesome. Got me financed for a great deal and helped me schedule my delivery around my crazy schedule . Stores in a great location and has a large variety of beds to try. Very happy with my purchase, thank you Patrick!!

29.description: I love my purchase in this store. Terrence Murphy was very patient and knowledgeable. The whole process of delivery was professional and fast. The delivery was on time. I have been using my new mattress for three months. I am still very happy that I bought a good mattress with a good price. Thanks to Terrence Murphy, the delivery men and Back to Bed!

42.description: Great place to get a cheap frame and a reasonably pricedmattress set. This store is huge and has lots of mattress sets -- many different prices ranges, different sizes, and different brands. Great one-stop place to get your bedding.

23.description: I put off buying a new mattress for a couple of years because I was so intimidated about spending so much money on something I know so little about.  I lucked into this store on a Sunday when no one else was there, and Terry Murphy, the manager, was on the floor. He spent a long time explaining everything there is to know about mattresses. No rush. No high pressure. The mattress, box spring, frame, and mattress cover were delivered on the appointed day and time by two very professional delivery guys. I decided right away that the bed (deluxe pillow top) was way too tall once it was in place in the room.Terry worked patiently with me to find a solution -- either a low-profile frame or low profile box springs. I expect the low-profile box spring to be delivered next week.The bed is divine, and Terry is absolutely wonderful.

5.description: We had a great experience buying a new bed from Patrick!  We knew we wanted to get a Tempurpedic, but after looking online at all the different models, we really had no idea what the differences were between all of them.  Patrick was awesome.  He was so knowledgeable about the company and their different mattresses.  He answered all of our questions and he was so patient with us, never pushy.  He is super friendly and just a really nice guy.  We were trying to decide between two models and it took awhile!When we were in, their system was down, so Patrick took down all of our info and when everything was up and running again, he made sure to email us a receipt and a personal message the same day.  If you need a bed, go see Patrick!!!

31.description: Just bought a mattress without any hassles from Terrance.  He was polite and knowledgeable. He was respectful of my choices and didn't try to push me towards products I wasn't interested in.  I would recommend Back to Bed in Lincolnwood for anyone looking for a pleasant mattress shopping experience.

25.description: Terrence helped me find a great mattress.  He was patient and very knowledgeable.  Very honest and friendly! Great sales over Memorial Day and Labor Day

12.description: We went to this store because of the good Yelp reviews.  We weren't disappointed.  Jim (the manager) was very helpful and friendly.  Although he started by showing us the higher priced mattresses, there was no pressure to dissuade us from purchasing one slightly less expensive.  And he even offered sane day delivery (which didn't work for us) so it will be delivered Sunday morning.  All in all, a painless, pleasant experience.

37.description: My actual experience inside this Back to Bed store was excellent. My salesman, Terrance, was polite and knowledgeable. He was not pushy like many other salesmen. He negotiated and we received a nice price for a great mattress. The problem is in the afterword. On delivery day the delivery guys showed up an hour early. I feel like this is extremely unprofessional. It was also extremely inconvenient. I was moving at the time and I had the movers in the house.  Things are crazy and hectic when you have the movers here. So, they dropped off my mattress and box spring and had me sign for it. They did not really explain what I was signing (and granted, i didn't ask), but at the time I signed it just to get them out of the way since I had so much going on. A few hours after they left I realized that they did not drop off the mattress protector. I called the store and talked to Nick. Let me tell you about Nick. First, Nick did not believe me. Second he wanted me to come into the store to get it. Third, he said "well this is a good lesson for you to learn, you never sign something without knowing what it is". This is the part when I went off. Nick, you are not my father, and you have no right to teach me a "lesson". Then nick claimed that now he was the one paying for my protector and it was coming out of his commission. GIVE ME A BREAK.When the protector got delivered they wanted me to pay cash on delivery. I wasn't having that. when all was said I got my product. So, moral of the story. Terrance was great. Nick was not. My experience over all was  unorganized and I don't know if I'll recommend it to anyone.

21.description: Great experience with Salesmen Jim! Helped my cousin find a great bed within his price range. Was very professional and straight to the point! We were there for less than 30 minutes and walked away with a full size bed, frame and delivery set up for a great price. Would defiantly return to buy another bed from Jim!

16.description: I just bought the dreamiest bed! From the moment my friend and I walked into Back to Bed, we were met with smiles, wit and knowledge. Jim was our salesman, and he did a great job of providing really helpful advice as well as letting us take our time to lay on just about every mattress in the store. Not only that, he stayed late to help us close out our sale after hours so that our mattresses could get out on the delivery truck tomorrow. I can't say enough and I cannot WAIT for the best night of sleep of my life on my amazing new mattress!

17.description: When we walked in on a cold snowy evening, and were the only people in the store..a salesman walked right up and started his pitch. We thought we were in for an awkward time...but couldn't have been more wrong. Jim walked us through our options and explained all the mattress types to us thoroughly. He even had some jokes. And when we explained our budget, he wasn't pushy and helped us right to the perfect mattress for our wallet. Financing was a breeze and our new mattress is scheduled for delivery!He also helped with a DIY solution to support the new box spring in the middle of our bed frame when we realized the solutions in the store wouldn't work for us. Go talk to Jim and get a good night's sleep.

10.description: Great store. Awesome bed.  Earl did a great job. Thanks. You can shop here with your eyes closed. That's for sure. Great discounts!!!

11.description: We went here knowing exactly which mattresses we wanted to test-drive.  Jim B. didn't hard-sell us, answered all our questions, knew his merchandise, and treated both me and my husband equally and respectfully. We were out of there in half an hour with smiles on our faces.  The delivery guys came the very next morning --  on-time, friendly and spatially talented (our stairs are very narrow).  Unless you can summon a magic mattress fairy by waving a magic mattress wand, I recommend going here as the next best thing.

26.description: The stores offerings were the best out of its competitors, and Terrance's product knowledge was superior to service reps at other stores. I got a free bed protector out of the deal, along w a fantastic bed. Like some of the other reviewers, I was in there for hours, and Terrance was so patient. I highly recommend this store and will refer all my family and friends

27.description: As others have stated, Terrance was wonderful to work with.  I was looking for a memory foam mattress and he showed me all the different options, price points, and differences between each brand.  I then spent the next hour going back and forth trying each and narrowing down to my favorite.  He was able to answer all my questions with extensive knowledge.  Delivery was good.  The queen box spring I ordered for another bed in our basement didn't fit down the stairs so they returned it and I changed the order to a split box which was delivered the following day with no hassles.  A great experience overall.

35.description: Jesse the girl helped us pick out an awesome bed. Then she told us everything we needed to know about purchasing it. The delivery went smoothly and the guys took my old mattress away. It was a great buying experience. They threw in 2 $100 pillows for free too.

8.description: Umm, going back to bed sounds like a great thing to do right now!  Unfortunately, for the Back to Bed store, I won't have to go back to them for many years down the road since I bought a wonderful mattress that has taken strain off of my lower back, and provides a motorized way to sit up or lay down.  Yes, I admit it; I got an old lady bed and it's freaking amazing!Terrence was great.  He allowed me to spend over 2 hours in the store laying on beds and different pillows while I tried out every foam mattress I could (including all the brands).  If you're looking for a bed in a non-pressure environment, come here.  My bed is expected to last 10+ years, so I won't be back soon, but I will be recommending this location to many of my friends.

0.description: Went in to look for a new mattress and came out with a new mattress ready for delivery. Anthony and Billy both were great with the service they gave me and my wife. Billy was able to get me a great deal on a temperpedic mattress to fit my budget.

38.description: Ok this isn't the EXACT address of the Back to Bed in Lincolnwood, but if you find a guy named Nick running it then you're in the right place. I'm moving in to a new apartment and of course did a lot of research online about exactly what type of bed would fit me. I decided to settle with a Simmons and Back to Bed carries this type among a few other competitive brands. Nick was very informative about the specs of each bed and gave me all the time I needed to "test 'em out". Not a pushy type at all, and even though I didn't make my decision that day, I still ended up coming back to buy the Simmons from him! Trust me, you can't go wrong with this guy and he definitely wants to make the customer happy. He works with your budget and helps you out as much as he can. Can't wait to get many beautiful nights of rest! Thanks again Nick!!

20.description: Finally decided to test out a tempurpedic and was quite pleased to find many different options here. Jim helped us find the right one for us. After being on the fence about the high cost, Jim was able to provide us a few options. In the end we got a good finance deal that fit our budget. The mattress was delivered 2 days later. They even picked up our old one.

19.description: There are SO many places to buy a mattress in Chicago.  How could you pick?  I will save you some time: go to this store in Lincolnwood.  Spacious parking, a spacious store that is clean, and knowledgeable salespeople who are not condescending or rude.  They are there to help and lend advice and counsel.  I felt complete confidence in our wonderful salesman, Jim.  He was patient, he listened and guided, and never once pressured me.  Plus, he stayed late to make sure I was happy and that the mattress got delivered tomorrow.  Here's the other thing: this store carries excellent quality mattresses.  You spend 1/3 of your life in bed; get a good one.  You won't be sorry; I'm not.  Thank you, Jim!!

33.description: We just bought a condo in Rogers Park so we needed another bed for our extra bedroom.  Terrence was extremely knowledgeable and helped us find the perfect bed at an affordable price.  I would highly recommend Back To Bed for all your bedding needs; we will never go to another company after our wonderful experience with Terrence and the delivery crew.

2.description: Earl was awesome! He showed us different beds before he helped us find the right one for us. We're gonna love our bed as soon as it gets delivered! Thanks Earl!

34.description: Had a great time the other day with Terrence Murphy, a helpful and bright person.  He helped me to spend my dollars wisely - just previous to my visit to his store, I'd gone and voided a transaction at American Mattress that I admit was a little foolish on my part.  With what I would have paid for that crazy looking princess bedframe - which after some hindsight and a second look really did look like Cinderella's carriage got run over and separated into a two-piece cage for a closeted corporate goth - I spent at Back To Bed instead and managed to get a beautiful, elegant headboard with the option to purchase the footboard and canopy later, if I want to go that far into bedding that requires more curtains than a country home.So now I'll be having two concurrent deliveries on the same day at my new digs, one from American Mattress and the other from Back To Bed.  I'm happy to say I spent more money at Back To Bed; I feel that I got great value for the dollar.   Plus I was able to enjoy a massage from the mechanical 2,000 wonder massage chair... while engaging in clever banter with Mr. Murphy, who had me in stitches.

32.description: My experience with the previous sales satff (nick H) was quite disappointing. They have no clue what they are selling in terms of their bedframes and mattress. I should have insisted to return their product when they delivered it. But in an attempt to help him with the sales, I agreed to resolve the issue but I now suffer from back soreness everu waking day. The mattress was Simmons and was supposed to be firm but the frame did not support it well. I would not support this business and even promote it to my friends because their  knowledge about their products and customer service is very poor especially if you spent $1300 on them. I should have stayed with Stearns and Foster instead of believing in their sales strategy. I wasted so much time with this business. They attempted to rectify by sending an inspector who placed a thread with weights on the bed and have comcluded there is no problem with the mattress. I lay on this mattress for a minimum of six hours daily and i would not that there is a problem with the mattress especially when I find myself sleeping on the edge because the support is better.

18.description: Great experience with Salesmen Jim! Helped my cousin find a great bed within his price range. Was very professional and straight to the point! We were there for less than 30 minutes and walked away with a full size bed, frame and delivery set up for a great price. Would defiantly return to buy another bed from Jim!

41.description: Helping my Ma with mattress shopping we popped our heads into this store to see what deals they might have.  It's a lengthy store found in what used to be a very small strip mall.  Outside one can see many signs stating a liquidation sale, pricing up to 75% off.  Parked in your car looking in you can see they have about twelve models of beds and a stack of mattresses on clearance, typically I would not walk into such a tiny store; only because it's harder to find a good deal / price on a bed. Which is what happened when visiting here.  Long story short, Ma had her heart set on a Tempur-pedic which is great for people with back or arthritic problems.  It's top of the line memory foam, they say if you sleep 8 hours usually you can do the same in 6 hours on this bed.  You won't move once, you just feel perfect and can sleep.  The best the saleswoman offered was $200-300 off the price of the set because we didn't need the box and two Tempur-pedic pillows.  I guess Tempur-pedic is not included in their going out of business sale.  WTF?  Even with free delivery the price was not the best price, but we still had other bed stores to visit.  Before walking out we looked over a few other styles.  The saleswoman wasn't as professional or customer savvy as I would've liked.  Which is boasted about on their website and in this mini confessional (below) listed per the owners.  When a customer asks politely that a salesperson remind them the cost of a bed they quoted minutes ago, I expect the salesperson to be able to quote it again quickly without sarcastic remarks.  Even a polite response that they would check on it, would be suitable  "I just told you the price before, you don't remember?"  Is something a disrespectful, sarcastic child says to their parents; not a reply a salesperson gives to a prospective customer ready to purchase bedding worth over twelve hundred dollars.  I don't think some sales people respect customers enough, also this sales lady could use some good cross training, but that's what you could expect from a stand alone store I suppose.  The Tempur-pedic bed was not purchased here.  We found better deals and service down the street at a bedding store which isn't going out of business.  What's sad is, if this lady had a better approach and was more respectful when giving details to my Ma, I would've closed on the purchase here.  On a rainy, lazy afternoon, I wasn't looking forward to a long afternoon of bed shopping.

13.description: I had a great experience in the store. I was convinced that finding and buying a mattress would take hours but Jim made it so easy and we were out of the store in 30 minutes. He was very nice and helped me find exactly what I was looking for. Thanks Jim!

4.description: Patrick H. was patient, knowledgeable and kind. My husband and I had no idea there were so many mattresses to choose from. We were lost in a sea of foam. Just like a superhero, Patrick rescued us from our indecision, and provided the perfect balance between guidance and reprimand. We will surely sleep better because of his expertise.

24.description: This update is a tad overdue, but wanted to make sure tip my hat to the fantastic service I keep receiving here. Returned to Back to Bed for a bed for the guest room - Terrence was there again and remembered my partner and I - he was just as welcoming and helpful as before. It seemed to be a pretty busy day for them (Memorial Day weekend), so another gentleman helped us out with our purchase (didn't catch his name... my receipt says the salesperson was LAW. Lawrence? Lawson? I'm not sure...) Regardless, he was very helpful through the entire process. And once again, the delivery guys were on time and the actual delivery of the mattress set was incredibly quick. The bed itself is great - we went for a less expensive mattress this time around, but every guest we have say that the bed is great and they sleep really well in it. Honestly can't say enough nice things about this place.

6.description: I thought it was going to take hours to find the right mattress.  It took..maybe 20mins?  I went in on a Friday night.  Jim (the manager) was the only person there.  He asked me some questions to help figure out what I was looking for.  I tried out 4-5 diff mattresses.  I knew that I wanted something on the more firm end, less than $1500 out the door, and wanted something that wouldn't flinch/cave when i got on it.  I'm 6ft 2, 240...I don't mix well with plush/pillow top, or foam/latex mattresses.  I need support.  Jim was great.  I never felt like he was trying to push me towards a more expensive mattress just to get the money, rather that he was helping me get the right mattress for me.  Fast forward to today (Sunday).  The delivery guys called 20-30mins prior to arriving just like Jim said they would.  They were beasts.  I'm on the 3rd floor of a walk up, and they had the old mattress gone, new mattress set up the stairs, and then the whole set assembled/setup (frame, box spring, mattress) in under 15mins.  It seemed like they didn't break a sweat the entire time.  They were also very friendly.  I would not hesitate to buy another mattress from them, or to send my friends/family there.  Great experience.

22.description: When we walked in on a cold snowy evening, and were the only people in the store..a salesman walked right up and started his pitch. We thought we were in for an awkward time...but couldn't have been more wrong. Jim walked us through our options and explained all the mattress types to us thoroughly. He even had some jokes. And when we explained our budget, he wasn't pushy and helped us right to the perfect mattress for our wallet. Financing was a breeze and our new mattress is scheduled for delivery!He also helped with a DIY solution to support the new box spring in the middle of our bed frame when we realized the solutions in the store wouldn't work for us. Go talk to Jim and get a good night's sleep.

15.description: We just had THE BED Of OUR DREAMS delivered.  While at the store yesterday we had an amazing salesperson Jim Baranski. Jim was so helpful and gave us a lot of time to decide on which bed to choose.  It was very evident how many years he had been in this business.  If you are looking for a new bed I would 100% recommend Back to Bed and go and see Jim Baranski.

40.description: Before picking our mattress my partner and I looked around for good deals and checked out the Better Business Bureau. We decided to check out Back to Bed and American Mattress, but when we drove past both the exterior of Back to Bed seemed more approachable. The sales lady was very helpful and encouraged us to shop around rather that leading us to the pricier beds (its was probably very obvious that it was our first purchase). She was friendly and chatty; maybe a little too chatty but I didn't mind as much as my boyfriend did. She cut us a good deal and we were able to get the split-box spring we needed as well.  Our bed was delivered within a few days and the delivery guys were quick. Later that night a sales person called to make sure we didn't have any problems.

7.description: Patrick helped me get the right bed for me while still staying in my price range. Patrick was very friendly and helpful and took the time to educate me on the different types of beds so I could make an informed choice yet he didn't try to get me to buy something he knew I couldn't afford. I really appreciated that. Plus I was in and out in 20 min! Would definitely recommend.

36.description: We got great service from both Kwame and Nick. They hooked us up with a great bed at a great price and helped out with a financing deal. Delivery was smooth and happened the next day.

30.description: The store was clean and nice. Delivery was fine. Prices were competitive. But the 5 stars are really for Terrance. He really stands out; he tells you what you ought to know, answers your questions, doesn't try to sway you, and then let's you shop and make your decisions in peace.

3.description: Great experience, awesome bed, even better customer service.  Damien was super knowledgable and accommodating.

14.description: Jim (the store manager) was very helpful and informative. My partner and I purchased a Beauty Rest mattress - it's very comfortable and well made - much nicer than the 17 year old mattress I replaced.

3.description: First of all, you're looking at a minimum 10-minute wait in the morning. If you want to be late to work, this is the place to stop for breakfast. And second, I would be shocked -- SHOCKED! -- if this location ever, EVER got an order correctly.

1.description: RACIST!!! I just wanted to share what happened to my brother when we went to this McDonald's with our uncle and was served a coffee with "CHINO" and a slanty-eyed smiley face drawn on the cup.  "So, when I asked for the manager, a lady claimed that she was the manager. From there, I asked if this was supposed to be funny, or if this was appropriate. I asked her who, based on the receipt, or the procedure, would be responsible for this, as I would like to confront them. At this point, she looked at the receipt and said that she took the order. And that was it. She did not apologize, or show remorse, or offer any course of resolution. She ended the line of inquiry with the repetition that she had taken the original order. So I told her that it was fine, I'd take it up with McDonald's at the corporate level, to which she did not react in the slightest." I continue to become increasingly more upset as I think about this incident. However unlikely, I can't help but feel that someone should be held accountable. It is disappointing to see that racism in America is alive and well.

0.description: Its the 2nd worst McDonalds I've been to in the city... Some chicken nuggets and fries weren't fresh. You ask them for extra ranch dressing to go with the Bacon Ranch salad and they don't give it with the orders. I go to the counter asking for creamy Ranch dressing you use for chicken nuggets since they tell me I'd have to pay for additional ranch dressing for my salad... One good thing is they have free refills and adequate sitting. I don't like the 30 min limit they have at this store even if it's near a school area!

2.description: I always stop at this restaurant and the service is great, the store is clean, friendly crew, and the food is always great.

5.description: Worst McDonald's ever. Grabbed food in a hurry, and didn't get half the order correctly. The sundaes weren't even close to full, and I was missing several burgers from my order.

6.description: This location has at many times been the most local and nearest, so I've got fond memories here.  I try to avoid Mcd's for many reasons, but really, when you are drunken or hung over, what does your body want.. but McDonald's.What pisses me off; above the quickly inflated menu prices is they charge for sauce! Sauce!!  McDonald's you rotten succubus, leech of life and wallet.  How much you've taken from me and never given enough back.  First you got rid of coupons (old school), then you force me to adhere to your rules and your specials.  Fine.  Now you take away free sauce!  15 cents for BBQ or Sweet and sour sauce, is ridiculous.  And lately your employees have been charging tax on top, so it's 17 cents!  You know what, I'm gonna need a receipt for all these increases.  No longer will I allow you to steal from me! Also, WhyTF did you remove the Boston Market which was here ?

7.description: I will never patronize this McDonalds again. The cashier totally disregarded my order by placing his own order for me. I orderedan egg white and cheddar biscuit and he ordered me one with bacon. First I don't even easy pork so I know I didn't accidentally order that. His response was he thought that's what I meant to order. Then he over charged me saying that's how they do it they just take the bacon off. Then he says they don't have just egg and cheese biscuits so I asked for my money back. You think he gave me the right change? No, he tried to short me a dollar. I finally asked for the manager, Peggy Ayers, and I heard her tell one of the employees that she was busy. McDonalds should be too busy to cut her a check since their customers aren't important enough for her to deal with. The only reason it got one start is because I had to rate it or my review wouldn't go through. I truly give it no stars.

8.description: As far as McD's is concerned, this place is cool. They're fast, friendly, and although they charge for extra sauce (most of them do now) I'm cool with getting my coffee on occassion or even the #2 for breakfast. I'm actually glad they got rid of Boston Market. It was too weird. But you have to be craving mc food, otherwise this is not an everyday thing.

9.description: I got a cup of coffee and found a raisin in my java.  WTF !!!!!! So, I called the manager, who promised me a free cup of coffee and a meal my next time there.  He was nice and polite over the phone, but his offer didn't impress me to go back.  I said to myself, "I live in Lakeview.  I'm not driving to Foster and Kedzie for that shit."

10.description: I will never go to this McDonald's again. The service one two different visits (about 5pm) have been rude and unprofessional. I left due to the service on the first visit. From someone who worked at McDonald's when I was younger, I understand everyone does not like working the front counter. This is why they developed the matrix for each worker to display to the managers each employees strenghts and weaknesses in each area. I could never work food prep. I understood, and work the drive thru or the counter. Please use this tool! I hope this place never gets a secret shopper. The wait time and rude service will get you marked down!

4.description: This place should get security on weekends for all the punk kids sitting around swearing, being disruptive and 1 of 7 actually made a purchase.  Kick them out!Also... slowest counter service EVER! I often find myself making jokes with other customers about the wait. I dont hate the food, unfortunately.

3.description: I looked online for membership /tanning packages and suntanz came up #1. So I  went in with  a sceen shot of their coupon for a free 10min tan in the super bed.  The guy there w spiky hair told me I can't get my free tan bc I don't have it printed out. I was very up set that I couldn't check out the tanning bed before buying  the silver membership for three months. He then offered me a buy one get one free offer with a attitude.  I'm so disappointed tht suntanz couldn't find a way to work with me, I just walked out. #thissucks

1.description: Since I've moved to Rogers Park, I have been searching for a great tanning salon, reasonably priced, near me. I just went to this place yesterday (9/27/2014) , with a free tan coupon (which you may find online from their website).I was extremely happy to find out that this salon has a private parking lot and even reserved spaces for their own clientele. I walked in, and was impressed with how this place looked like on the inside. Very modern, with a spacious waiting area. I was greeted by the girl who was working- she was extremely great! She had to call her boss on how to figure out how to validate the coupon. She said that the coupon was for the turbo bed (the best level 4 bed), and pointed to where I needed to go.Soon as I walked into the room, I was definitely satisfied. The bed was sparkly clean, with high tech looking bulbs. Just as I started to get undressed, the girl who was helping me, began knocking on my door. She stated, " I was looking at the coupon again, and its actually for the level one bed. I'm sorry!"OK, not a big deal at all. So I walked into the level 1 bed, and literally stopped at the door. I've never seen a bed like this; very dinky, and even to the point where it looked unsafe. I thought I was over reacting, so I got in the bed anyway. I was kind of scared tanning in it (just because of how small it was, and it was really old). As the session wrapped up, I came out a tiny shade darker. I think this place has very high potential, but they definitely need to upgrade their level one beds (there are three of them) The level 2 is a stand up, btw. The pricing is a little high, from what I'm used to, but not having to pay for parking is a plus.The photo attached, is the salons's recent pricing, as of 9/27/2014. *The unlimited level 1 membership is $24.99 (as long as you purchase 3 months out) THIS is definitely NOT worth it. I recommend going here, as long as you don't go in any of the level 1 beds!

2.description: 'methinks not' star is due to it being CLOSED. Stopped by only occasionally and did sotoday to see "For Rent" sign. Web site gone also.

9.description: Awesome place! Very helping employees. Clean place and plenty of parking in front. Cheap prices! A must go tan place.

10.description: Great place! First and foremost, clean clean clean! Beds are very clean as well as the whole place. The beds are well maintained, I get color with less time in the bed.  The owner is very nice and is there every time I go in. Last but not least, the price is right!

4.description: I just recently moved to the Chicago area from Miami so I was definitely looking for a tanning salon to keep the tan I have! I was alittle skeptical about the area but the salon is very clean which is a must! It's Modern & the front desk girl is nice & is eager to help! The tanning bed I used was level 3 for 15 mins $17.99..I tanned perfectly & I will definitely be going back since I also received a free session for being a new customer! :)

6.description: I've been going for a few weeks now to prep for a vacation, and Suntanz is exactly what I want in a tanning salon.  Friendly service, variety of clean beds, and decent pricing packages.  I'd recommend it.

11.description: Place is terrible.  Signed up for a buy one get one free as a new client and I asked the woman specifically if it expired, she said one year, I went in a month later and was denied.  Owner had fired the woman but still would not give me the one I was owed because its written in fine print on some flier that the woman never showed me.

5.description: Honestly I'd been here once before and had a pretty decent experience. It's right by my work and the only place to go mid-day tanning. That being said, I will never go back again. If you walk in, and just want to buy a single tan in a mid level bed but not go the full 15 minutes (because most people would fry if these bulbs are as 'strong' as he claimed) it does not matter, you pay the full price. I have never, ever, gone to a place that won't sell you a reduced number of minutes. If you aren't prepared to buy a forty dollar package of 'points' then you can't buy any points. It not only makes no sense but it seems like a con and the guy was so rude about it, that I will never go back.

7.description: Came here to get a base tan for a tropical vacation. Very friendly and helpful staff and it's a great price! The owner is awesome!

8.description: Love this place! It's clean, efficient, and the vibes are so chill. Monty, the owner, has great knowledge (as well as a great tan himself) in tanning and he always has my best interest in mind, which I appreciate and that sets him apart from other tanning salons I've been to. From day one he accounted my skin and lifestyle to guide me on the healthy route to an awesome, natural tan. He also recommended me products which I use every time! I just love how personable he is and how I feel homey here. I've been here only twice and I'm hooked on everything. I glow every time I walk out the door!

0.description: Honestly, I usually only tan in the sun, but I figured, why not try the beds!This is not your "chain" tanning place, and that's good! I hate chains of anything!This place is always shiny clean! The beds are ALWAYS clean, there's not even a small mark anywhere. They have new bulbs which is a huge plus, you can actually get the tan you want!Owner is awesome! He explains everything to you so you know exactly what to do, and they have some great tanning lotions!Love it!

3.description: This Korean kitchen supply store is somewhat of a hidden gem, tucked away on Pulaski next to a *gasp* cemetery. Fortunately, there's a neon sign outside proudly flashing "Hi-Mart OPEN" for those new to the store. I stopped by here on Sunday and checked out some of the goods. A few items I saw: -Rice cookers -Bamboo steamers -Cutting boards (I saw a bamboo cutting board for $10) -Tea sets -Bento boxes -Chopsticks, soup spoons, bowls, plates, cups -Sake sets -Cast iron pans, woks -Knives And a whole lot more. Many of the items were marked 20% - 50% off, too. For those who remember, there used to be a Chicago Food location here, but it had burned down a few years ago. They haven't rebuilt the food store, unfortunately, but Hi-Mart remains open.  If you're looking to expand your Asian kitchen supplies, check this place out.

1.description: Ughhhh. I hate the service there.  It's horrible. The cashier and the employees are so rude and mean. I can't believe I actually bought something from there. I feel extremely mad and horrible right now. The prices are much more expensive than other places. Plus, they don't accept the prices that were tagged; they get higher prices than it's tagged.

2.description: I don't cook Korean food, so I can't comment really on the grocery provisions.  HOWEVER, their kitchen supplies were exactly what I needed.Admittedly, all I needed was chopsticks and some servingware, but the price was right, and I was intrigued by the kitchen gadgets I want (rice-cooker, woks, etc.).If you need anything Korean for the kitchen, I suggest a trip.  Don't worry, it's not empty.  It's set back pretty far, and looks like a warehouse.  And it's next to a graveyard, not really helping the "abandoned warehouse horror-movie set" feel...but once you get inside all is well and the staff is very friendly.I'm going back!

0.description: UGH. UGH. UGH!!!! A friend of mine had told us about getting food at "Chicago Food Corporation" and so we trekked all the way down there just yesterday. With salivating mouths eagerly awaiting all the korean food goodies we had heard about, we arrived at a warehouse, far removed from the street entrance, and next to a cemetary. I thought I was going to die. Little did we know Chicago Food Corp is no longer?! Is this true or is that an old review (we went on a Sunday, so I thought it might have been just closed for the day)?When we got there, a car had pulled into the Hi-Mart side so we followed suit. We walked in and there was a bunch of kitchen and misc supplies, rice cookers, etc. spread out over two rooms. We didn't buy any supplies, but I guess this is a good place to get them. There were several workers there, but only one had asked if we needed help (right before we left).

3.description: Just wanted to send out another shout out to the girls here. They are always really knowledgeable and helpful -and I feel they really know what they are talking about. Many are either naturally talented and do their own hair and make up but many are students in cosmetology school. I had another good experience and got some great products. Another happy customer!

1.description: This Sally is alright, girls are nice.A little messy at times, no complaints though...it's only beauty supply products - nothing life nor death.

2.description: My hair was getting rather crunchy (yes, crunchy), so I was in fast need of a really good deep conditioner.  Sally was the place!A staffer gave me some good advice (I didn't know which one to select) and she actually suggested something less expensive then the one I was leaning toward (so it wasn't about the up-sale). She was so nice, and even signed me up for their club card which sends me really awesome coupons via email.I asked her about a dryer heating cap to lock in the moisture...and she gladly showed me which one works well.My hair is silky smooth now and when it gets crunchy, I've got my go-to products for the fix.

0.description: Wow...I don't remember a time when an employee was more helpful and knowledgeable about what I needed.  I went to Sally's looking for a flat iron, with no real idea of what I was doing.  The worker pointed me to a product that was the best seller and came back with the best results.  There was no hesitation and when I asked about burning hair, thin hair, temperature settings...all the stuff I didn't know about, she was on point with information.  She was confident and claimed that if I wasn't happy, I could return the product with the receipt and there'd be no problem.  She also pointed me to some protective heat spray I should use, and it didn't feel like she was trying to get me to spend a ton of money.  She spoke to the qualities of each spray and which one would work best for me (not the cheapest or the most expensive).  The straightener works great, the spray is so-far-so-good, and I liked her attitude so much, I got a Sally's card!  They know what they're doing here, so fear not if you have no idea what you're doing.

3.description: My friends and I go here almost all the time. Their blueberry mint is on point, well sometimes. Check it out. They also have rooms for privacy.

1.description: If I could give less than one star.. I totally would. I'm a frequent hookah smoker, visiting from California, and came here and it was the worst Hookah place I've ever been to. There were underage kids (under 18) smoking hookah AND CIGARETTES INSIDE, there was a finished bottle of alcohol on their table. The music was hooked up to a cell phone and the texting ring tone interrupted the music every 2 minutes, or the kids would switch the music half way through songs. They would randomly scream and yell, especially when other people would come in. My group will never come back and I do not recommend anyone coming here. We ended up walking out.

2.description: Been coming here for a while,  like the environment and when K is working she is really friendly and nice and makes really goos hookah's. She gives out good options and flavors. Try the blue mist with pink mint, my favorite.  Also its always clean in here and have pretty good selection of cold drinks n snacks.  Their booths have comfy seats and couches. Their music selection varies but its always upbeat. You definitely won't fall asleep here. Come on in and enjoy your time here.

9.description: I've been consistently disappointed with their hookahs over the last few months. My friends and I use to come here often, but we've all agreed this place doesn't have the pep that it use to. However, I have absolutely no complaints about the service. The waitresses have always been very  attentive.The decorum is great--I love the archways. Improve the quality of the hookahs and I'll come back as a customer.

10.description: i've been to this place several times, because they're open so late, and close to the heart of 'little arabia.'the hookah is a lil rough, and sometimes it tastes like the pipes haven't been cleaned.the decor is awesome though. i adore the gold etched piece of artwork on the wall, with the ancient egyptian woman smoking a hookah. i'm trying to find one to buy.i wasn't impressed with the food. their vanilla chai is very good, but their shawerma is NOT. i had to ASK for the sauce for it, and it didn't not taste the same as the traditional garlicy sauce that is used on shawerma.their mix of music is very good though - it's eclectic. at any time you can hear rai (north african), arabic pop, turkish, reggaeton, or trance.oh, but the servers are hot, and the prices are fair.

4.description: There is no food being served here anymore!  But you can bring in your own food.Hookah was not bad, but the benches are not so comfortable, I kept feeling like I was going to fall off!  Hookah kept going for a few hours without any problems and being smoked consistantly.  Decor was nice, but I feel bad for the houseplants that are grown, aren't they choking on the smoke and lack of sunlight?Music was not so great, I got sick of the old school R&B fast....sorry I don't feel like smoking hookah and listening to RKelly's "Your body's callin"....

6.description: Great for BYOB and hookah but uncomfortable benches and too loud with the music.  Some days it's good for studying and chatting, other;s you are better off just drinking and being annoying with your friends

12.description: I am a regular customer of Carthage cafe. I live a couple blocks  down the street, So on occasion will  go here to hang. the foods not half bad and is priced well.  The inside is also decorated very tastefully. But I must say after a reviewer was attacked by a obvious employee of Carthage cafe I have lost my taste for this restaurant. I for one will never step foot inside this place again. I feel  that the review was fair and was very constructive.  There was a comment made in talk thread where Kalina y.  says she has plenty of regulars. Well say good bye to this regular.

5.description: Three stars.Mainly, because I liked the food.  All dishes are under $9 bucks.Sandwiches, Apps, salads & sides all under $5 bucks.  Shwarma is pretty good, not traditional, but it is tasty. Vegetarian entrees also available.They've got fresh smoothies, but, my friend said it tasted like over iced watered down, sediment water. You could taste the mix particles in your mouth. Blah.Hookah is $10 bucks.  This place is fairly new and they must be new to Hookah.  The pipes weren't secure, so when you take a drag, air is seeping in through unsecured areas, its like jump starting a jalopy. Pointless to smoke it.  I think they use the flavored water instead of like most places adopting the Gel.  The flavored gels give a more pure taste to the hookah.  When we smoked here, we thought maybe they didn't clean it out well, so, though we ordered Double Apple, it tasted like a mixture of all the flavors that had been through the hookah that night. Management also needs to learn how to divvy up the hookahs to incoming patrons.  You could wait up to 20 mins or more at a table.  Some tables have less than 6 people and 3 hookahs.  The smoking area could be alot more cozy.  They've got loong benches, covered in a fitted stitched covering.  Its cushioned, with a few throw pillows scattered. Not comfortable for long sittings.Check it out though, very nice layout.  One day, this could be a great place to chill.  Customers are mostly 17-22, maybe even younger.  Music is varied, dance, hip hop, whats' popular.

13.description: My rating for this place would be higher, except for the terrible service.  The servers are excellent here, but the kitchen, even after this restaurant has been open for a year or so, still can't get its act together.  If you're willing to be flexible, have a lot of time to spare, and won't freak out if they mess up your order, this place is worth a try because of the good food.  They recently changed their menu, adding more salads and breakfast.  The salad ingredients are very fresh, and the menu contains some rather unusual combinations not often found at Middle Eastern restaurants.

11.description: Really good shisha, mediocre service. A friend of mine really loves this place and so we dropped by the other night. Doesn't really seem to be anything special. Ok music, sub-par food. Everyone here keeps raving about the food, but when I tried their hummus it was watery and tasteless.
