Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but it seemed like they just opened a pack of Jewel brand hummus, watered it down and threw it on a plate. Oh well. Not in a rush to come back, but I didn't have a terrible experience or anything.

8.description: The hookah is so bad here. I have a feeling they never clean out their hoses. I ordered mango...why the hell do I taste mint? The parking is so inconvenient. "Who's driving the....you're blocking so and so." Horrible. It's full of high school kids and the music is funny at first but after awhile you're begging for them to shut off that 90s R&B. The waitresses take your drink order AND they never show up with your drink BUT they want to charge you for it. What kind of shit is that? No ma'am! I will never waste another cent nor minute of my life here.

0.description: Not bad for the price you pay. Upon arriving at this place you may find it a bit run downish but don't let that deter you from the hookahs here.Service is mediocre but they do have a variety of flavors Must try rose jasmine mint.There is no food as expected at many hookah joints but they do allow you to bring your own food and drinks.

7.description: This place is okay as a last resort. This place is kinda small, so finding a place to sit on a weekend night is pretty hard. Especially if you want one of those spaces in the room with the benches. The parking in this place is also horrible. Instead of parking your car on the street, people pack their cars behind other cars in the parking lot. Almost every time i go there, they're paging some ass hole to move their car cause they're blocking people who are leaving. Other than that, the price is right... esp on Student night when they give discounts to college students (no student ID needed)

28.description: My service at this location was great! The girl working the drive thru window was very friendly and energetic even at 7am. After ordering the new Salted Caramel mocha frappe, I was disappointed with the taste. This location happily made a new one for me within seconds. I appreciate them going above and beyond to keep a loyal customer. It is moments like these that keep me coming back. I love this Starbucks!

1.description: Love love love this location. I come here fairly often on my way to work.. Or anywhere really. I usually use the drive thru, which is fairly quick, even when it's busy. Everyone here is extremely nice and they remember you. It's hard not to with how often I go here but it's nice when you see someone leaving their shift and they stop and say hi to you outsideI try and only go to this location

9.description: Please don't put sugar without asking. Too damn sweet! Got a grande latte with whole milk, they put sugar in it. Didn't drink until I was a couple of miles away. I can't have too much sugar per day. How could you do that? Wasted my time and money, had to throw it way and buy a new one. Worst experience in Starbucks ever.

29.description: Standard starbucks. Nothing too flashy, nothing to subtle. I don't care much for the location or parking lot. I would also like to state that the seating is not very study friendly because of crammed quarters at one end and a VERY NOISY machine at the other end. I do have to say, the doublt entrances and glass windows make this a very bright an inviting starbucks on the flipside. But other than that it is just a startbucks.

23.description: Great easy drive thru location on the northside.

5.description: Worst of them ALL drive thru sucks staff doesn't pay attention to your order i Had to say same order 3 times and on the end i got wrong coffee i gave up drove away now i go to new location on McCormick ave

31.description: My absolute favorite starbucks!!! Every so often i splurge on a hot chocolate and a danish from starbucks, and this place puts a smile on my face every time. The staff is so friendly and they have yet to run out of my favorite cheese danishes. AND THEY HAVE A DRIVE THRU!! The only bummer is that the drive up window can be a drag, but even that seems worth it sometimes because the baristas are so funny. Keep it up guys, keep brewin what you brew!

25.description: Just like any other Starbucks except this one has a drive thru. Staff is friendly and fast. I rather go inside so I can get the stuff I want.

12.description: Coffee and service is great but this location is just way too crazy. Drive thru is super awkward especially when there is a line and the absolute grouchiest people go here.

21.description: My dog, Mocha, love going for a car ride. I take her with me every once in awhile to go drive thur here. They offer her a doggie treat. We leave here satisfied every time. :)

16.description: It's airways very chilly in here but there are always plenty of places to sit. Free parking but the Internet is very,  very slow. Baristas are much friendly than nearby Starbucks.

17.description: I am a pretty constant customer of this Starbucks.  The staff is always friendly, the java consistent, the prices, well, what do you want?The person who designed the drive through must have needed a bit more coffee himself as it possesses an almost impossible curve for some cars.  I can do it in short nosed vehicles, not in ones with a front end.  You can see the number of people who have problems by the scratches on the pole and the building itself.  The barristas just laugh about it. One caution, when you are headed inside, double check the advertised price of the baked goods vs the charged.  I have had them differ as much as a dollar (more than once).

10.description: Beautiful new renovation! They make great coffee and the baristas are super friendly.Drive thru option is a huge plus!And if you're a local and frequent often you will find one of the baristas dancing outside with headphones on his break. Very entertaining!

11.description: I have to give a special shout out to Matty -or as I like to call him, "Matty-Matt!!" I'm not sure if he is new, or just changed his schedule; he is new to me. He makes the drive-thru experience extra special because he is just so darn friendly. I'm not talking about fake / chirpy annoying friendly either. He has this kind of surfer-dude vibe: like no matter what, he shrugs it off with a smile and moves on. PERFECT for the chaotic morning drive through! It is really hard to put into words but he is so genuinely nice, it brightens my day. When I hear his voice, I'm like, "Is this Matty-Matt?" and then we proceed to joke around for a minute. He is a really special employee and really embodies what customer service / building relationships is all about. Now, when I can't make it to Starbucks, I actually feel a little guilty that I'm letting him down!Overall, a very efficient and friendly staff. Starbucks sure knows how to pick them!

26.description: I love this place. This place is definitely my second home. The workers are best and very professional. Service is the best around!

27.description: I am a pretty constant customer of this Starbucks.  The staff is always friendly, the java consistent, the prices, well, what do you want?The person who designed the drive through must have needed a bit more coffee himself as it possesses an almost impossible curve for some cars.  I can do it in short nosed vehicles, not in ones with a front end.  You can see the number of people who have problems by the scratches on the pole and the building itself.  The barristas just laugh about it. One caution, when you are headed inside, double check the advertised price of the baked goods vs the charged.  I have had them differ as much as a dollar (more than once).

35.description: We stopped at this Starbucks today, on our way to Lincolnwood Mall.  First, why can't they just open a Starbucks in the mall?  That would be so much more convenient.  But, anyways, this particular Starbucks has a drive thru, but the line was ridiculously long.  We, instead, parked and went in.  Go figure, no waiting inside!The staff was friendly enough, but a little slow.  I guess they were busy with the drive thru folks.  The parking lot is a zoo.  I prefer other Starbucks stores in the area.

0.description: This Starbucks is unlike many of the other bougie locations. People here tend to be down to earth and exceptionally nonchalant. Ive been here a number of times and have gotten familiar with management and the baristas. The manager always seems to be enthusiastic and vibrant and gives this place a pleasant personality. For Halloween some of the baristas dressed up in costumes!This is a great spot to relax and unwind after a long day of work. Just grab a drink meet up with a friend and enjoy the rest of your day! They offer complimentary wireless phone charging stations for both iPhones (5 and up) and Androids so don't worry about bringing your charger. This location also has a large joint parking lot. Most the regulars tend to be professionals or college students making it a conducive environment to get work done.

20.description: Not just a normal Sbux. This one has a drive thru! ALL Starbucks should have a drive through so you can avoid listening to everyone order their tall double pump skim bla bla's while you patiently wait and check Facebook.

19.description: This is one of the greatest Starbucks of all times! This place is near and with the drive thru it makes it so easy to get my drink! The only thing that bothers me is that the drive thru line is so long in the morning and right afternoon it's about 12-15 cars but they try processing it accurately and fast. Even after that long drive line the drink makes up for it. The staff is friendly, the drinks are amazing and they open early and close late. Never ever had an issue at this Starbucks and I have been going here for years every morning!!

33.description: This is my favorite Starbucks!1. They have a drive-thru (but it can get super long!!!)2. They make the best iced soy caramel macchiatos I've ever had!3. The staff is super awesome and always cheery.(although I hoard some animosity since I couldn't get a job here)

2.description: After shopping in the area, we stopped here for some coffee.  It was just like most Starbucks, nothing really special. It was large and they have indoor and outdoor seating. So there is  seating if you are looking to stay a while. I ordered a coffee and was annoyed that the barista didn't ask me what kind of coffee I wanted and just started pouring one.  Next please ask me what kind of coffee and will like before pouring it.

34.description: I needed my morning Misto.  Yes, I had already had 3 at home.  But I needed another one.  AND I had a gift card.This location is on my way to work, from the city to the burbs.  The staff is upbeat and friendly, and often a little silly.  This location has a drive through, so my lazy ass doesn't even need to get out of my sunset pearl orange SUV.  Hot.I like drive throughs, because I wear big Gucci sunglasses, and I know that they all think I'm a movie star.  Also because I make no effort to turn down the blasting opera music that is usually playing, so they probably think I'm a foreign celebrity.  Which is why I bet I get such good service.Oh, and I'm totally eye candy...so I think that helps too.My coffee is always fresh, and I know its a chain, but it is about the personalities that work there.  I do suggest visiting this Starbucks the next time you feel the urge to drive from the city to Evanston or Skokie.

32.description: I'm really liking this location. Love the double entrance although I usually drive and park in the back on occasion when I go for a long walk I'll come in through the front. Staff is super friendly and patient if you're like me and can't decide what to get. I mean it's just coffee, right? Some of us are just indecisive. Sorry.

18.description: Super nice employees. Great seating.

13.description: When it comes to Starbucks, you know what you're getting.  The menus at each franchise are just about identical, but there are distinct differences that make some branches more favorable than others.  This review is meant to reflect what makes this Starbucks unique more so than the company as a whole.This location is great for commuters.  Whether entering or leaving the city, the drive through is convenient for quick grabbing a coffee on the go.  The inside space also is designed to handle a significant flow of people.  It is not a location that is as conducive to sitting and working.For frequent coffee drinkers, I also strongly recommend pursuing a Starbucks Gold Card if you do not already have one.  By simply reloading and reusing a gift card, you can easily reach Gold status.  By doing so you get free flavors, free soy milk, and a free drink after every 15.

4.description: Service is bad .. The barista was emptying the garbage .. He didn't wash his hands when he served me ... Big disappointment but I'm not picky .. Then I ordered dark roast .. They don't have .. They only have medium roast ...I'm hesitant but I said ok thinking it was a fresh brewed .. He didn't offer to brew me dark roast where other Starbucks usually do .. Then at the mixing area where you put your creamer and sugar .. Empty and I have to ask for skimMilk .. The other staff just shouted and I have to walk to the counter to get it .. Then finally ... Started to drink my coffee ... It's stale .. Probably brewed 5 hours ago .... I'll never go this Starbucks again .. Bad Service .... Stale products ....

24.description: When it comes to Starbucks, you know what you're getting.  The menus at each franchise are just about identical, but there are distinct differences that make some branches more favorable than others.  This review is meant to reflect what makes this Starbucks unique more so than the company as a whole.This location is great for commuters.  Whether entering or leaving the city, the drive through is convenient for quick grabbing a coffee on the go.  The inside space also is designed to handle a significant flow of people.  It is not a location that is as conducive to sitting and working.For frequent coffee drinkers, I also strongly recommend pursuing a Starbucks Gold Card if you do not already have one.  By simply reloading and reusing a gift card, you can easily reach Gold status.  By doing so you get free flavors, free soy milk, and a free drink after every 15.

6.description: Typical place to get your starbucks coffee.

22.description: Nice people work at this Starbucks. They hussle and do their best, not easy since they have a drive thru to deal with.

15.description: Just went through the drive-thru and got complimentary coffees just for asking. Now I did buy a holiday blend and a gift card, but it's nice when a half kidding request follows through. Great service!

7.description: Traveling down Hwy 41 toward downtown Chicago on a Friday afternoon requires some form of caffeine. Luckily we stumbled upon this friendly Starbucks. There were only a few patrons, and no wait. Baristas were friendly and efficient. I had the caramel mocha crunch and it was everything I wanted and more! It was delicious, and did the trick - got us through the traffic and into downtown.There is outdoor seating, a large parking lot, and they have a drive thru. I recommend stopping here if you are in need of a pick-me-up  :)

8.description: This starbucks is great and I've had one of the nicest, courteous starbucks employee. Thanks Albert!!!

30.description: How can I rate just one Starbucks?! The coffee is great!Wonderful staff, only ran into one bad seed , who was a Hispanic young man who had the guts to yell at me when he got my order wrong and continued to tell me that its what I ordered, clearly it wasn't cause it was something I never even heard of . . . .But the nice long blond haired manager person . . . offered to fix it right away, that was nice of him!

3.description: My Starbuck's barista-Izzy was very good at recommending my soy venti mocha with caramel syrup drink!

14.description: Starbucks... I know there are plenty around the country when it comes to this franchise. Many people come through morning, afternoon and even sometimes during the night to get their fix. This particular location is great.Location - To being this location does have a drive thru which is great for people on the go. Also the location is in a plaza which is never really crowded to the point where there is no parking.Service - The service at this location is excellent! Fast and friendly staff that gets you your drinks at a quick pace (I know some customers can be quite on edge without their fix). They rarely make mistakes on orders but if they do they are quick to fix it and serve what you ordered. All the baristas I have ordered from are also very friendly and courteous! Nothing gets your day started better than a fast friendly service with a smile.Atmosphere - The vibe of the place is pretty standard when it comes to Starbucks. They have their self of products such as mugs, thermos', coffee, and other goods. Seating is available both inside and out which is a nice option. They also do have a few tables inside as well for those of you who like to get some work done inside Starbucks although I would recommend other places for study.Overall - All in all this is a great location and fast friendly employees to attend to your orders. There are also many goodies and and accessories that you could purchase to brew or use at the comfort of your own home.

29.description: An ok store like any other Home Depot can be.

42.description: Am I nuts for assuming a hardware emporium would have Christmas lights?  Their selection was completely picked through.  While I was trying to sift through the sad looking mess that might once have been a display, a customer next to me asks an employee if there are any other lights to be found."No, and we aren't ordering any more either."Ooookaaaaay.......guess the myriad of people who need Christmas lights - and I - will take our business elsewhere.

23.description: If you're ever really excited to get started on a new painting project, head over to the paint department at Home Depot and they'll take care of that for you. :::bangs head on wall:::

47.description: I dislike this location, and I don't know if it's the fault of the company. Why do you need to check my receipt after I JUST purchased items at the cash register? Oh, yea! It's because a lot of people steal from your store, and now I have to suffer with these practices. I would rather drive farther away to a different Home Depot than go through the steps in trying to get to my car.

8.description: You know that commercial of a couple at a hardware store who split up to find someone who can help them,  then come back with a guy from fertilizer who can't help them?  I'm pretty sure the commercial is a parody of home depot. Went to home depot this evening to order carpet. My hubby & I were told the girl went on lunch,  that they'd find someone else to help us.  Little did we know we'd wait the entire duration of her lunch to finally receive help.  When we finally sat down to place our carpet order,  the system wasnt working.  She said it hadn't been working all week. We left without having placed an order,  & having just wasted an hour.

31.description: This is a far more organized location than the Home Depot off Addison or Elston. For one thing, everything has pricing and labels! Yay! For another pleasant shock... hold your breath... there are lots of multiple open registers so you are not stuck behind the one shouty person effing up the self-check line extending epically longer than those found waiting outside Hot Dougs (ahem)!!!Speaking of Hot Dogs, the Hot Dog counter here is awesome incentive prior to walking randomly up and down aisles when your Boyfriend needs a lot of stuff. The mom and her daughter working were so sweet and hardworking, Love that! We encountered a lot of wood chips perfect for our smoker... we love our barbecues in the summer and to support Home Depot had Hickory, Mesquite, Apple, Cherry... it is hard to make up your mind when you are flooded with so many flavorful potential smoker options. We bought a sprinkler, a big new curtain rod and meandered thru shelving options.I bought a big lavender plant, because I want to test and see if it takes to the Chicago soil outside and make my yard smell like Provence. I'll be back to buy more if it grows well!

34.description: I would say this location is "OK". It's a good location with plenty of parking. The cashiers and clientele are nice / no issues. I have had issues with getting keys cut and they didn't work when I got home, so I would recommend getting keys elsewhere. However, I have been pretty satisfied with their lumbar section. My boyfriend has built me a few shelves / organizational type things for my house and the wood cutting guys do a really good job and measure your wood spot on (that sounds so naughty but you know what I mean!) I've always been happy with my purchases there so I give it a solid 3 stars A-OK!

16.description: It's always really busy here but they have everything I need. Very convenient and lots of parking

13.description: As I'm standing here, waiting for the woman working the paint section, I'm getting annoyed. She could be the most unfriendly service worker ever. Not sure, but maybe. Is it too much to ask to be an acknowledged??  Maybe a smile and hello?

11.description: I ordered a washer online but tied to this Home Depot location..The washer arrived broken. Home Depot's delivery crew took it away (and the new hoses we purchased). They said a replacement would have to be ordered. They couldn't offer ANY time frame for availability or delivery. Whirlpool would not offer a firm availability and delivery date. Home Depot was unsympathetic and could not offer a time frame on replacement either. Home Depot also would not offer an exchanged based on models in the store. They spoke over me, ignored my concerns, and rushed me off the phone. They also referred me back to the manufacturer. Terrible product and support. Also, I tried to post a review on Home Depot's website. They rejected it with an offer to repost if I only discussed the defective product, and not their customer service (which apparently is a matter on par with national security.)  So much for an open forum and honest reviews, Home Depot. Bottom line: beware of expecting support for your purchase.

39.description: For convenience to my house, parking, friendly and abundant staff = 5 stars.For renting anything, they have one poor guy working all by himself with ten people in line = 0 stars.This man was so helpful, had to explain how each piece of equipment being rented works, had to go through a contract with each customer, and they can't get ONE of those TEN people who greeted me over by the grills to come and expedite this process?! I just needed a power sander and had to wait in line for at least thirty minutes. I now know how to fill the detergent into a carpet cleaner and that if you're a four-foot-tall Asian woman you can still rent a ginormous truck as long as you have proof of insurance. They seem to be trying to up their customer service, but instead of filling the place with teens in orange aprons that only know how to say "How ya doing?" maybe they should have some detailed training seminars for the staff.

37.description: Everything was organized and easy to find. Helpful associates for the most part.

0.description: I go to this Home Depot for hardware, tools and supplies for fixing household related problems. They have some very knowledgeable staff that help me find the right product for the job and the right location. I like the easy of self checkout aisles when checkout is just taking way too long and the added security of having a camera recording the checkout on these self checkout machines.

38.description: I was feeling motivated. Must. Paint. Baby's. Room. I am woman. Hear me roar. I can DO this. I haven't painted a room in like 10 years, back when I was young and stupid. Now I'm old and lazy and hire people to do things. But, seriously, one room... Dude and I can handle it. But he sent me out to get paint. I had no freakin' clue what I was supposed to buy. Color, that was easy. But then I had to pick a finish. And a nap on the roller. And a size. And whether or not we needed an edger. And what paint to use on the wall vs the ceiling vs the trim. Paint counter dude: TO THE RESCUE. He was really nice and helped me pick a finish (will you need to wash the walls? How shiny do you want it?). Then he talked me through everything including the nap on the roller, whether I needed a brush or an edging tool, ceiling paint, trim paint, wall paint, etc. He was incredibly helpful and I'm glad I asked him for help cause I was feeling a little lost. Thanks, paint counter dude!

51.description: Boy, am I glad I'm not the only one who thinks this is the worst Home Depot.  While one of the paint guys was helpful, everyone else was a complete dud.  The keys I had made didn't work (0 for 5) and when I went to Customer Service to return, they sent me to the Returns Counter--5 feet of walking for them, as the counter was behind Customer Service, but about 25 feet for me--I had to walk out into the front entrance way and come back in through another door.  While I enjoy walking, I don't enjoy inconvenience.Also, this location has fewer staff actually running cash registers, forcing you to go through self-checkout.  When I first purchased paint here, it took me over 15 minutes to scan everything, mostly because on every other item the machine had to stop as it didn't realize that the merchandise HAD been placed in the bagging area.  No one smiles, stops and asks if you need assistance, even if you clearly need assistance.No wonder this location's parking lot is consistently empty.

27.description: I ordered a custom made sliding door for a closet. Upon opening it, I found the item sloppily made.  The top metal piece/cover had a ragged edge that could cut you.  It was also bent.  The part was also scratched.  Do not purchase any custom made door at Home depot!

32.description: The service is hit or miss here. However, I found some great plants and light fixtures. You never know, what you will find on sale for your home, so stop by and you may just find a great deal :)

48.description: As I have preferenced my other reviews of The Home Depot, I will say that I currently work for a building products company and I spend most of my time in THD at various locations throughout the city.I will disagree wholeheartedly with the reviews on this site to this point. This location is always fairly busy when I'm in there and the staff is very knowledgable. Although I will not put this location in my top 3 Chicago stores, that's because its not in the top 3 in terms of volume, so they don't always neccessarily have THE best people working there. The managers are all very helpful and the pro desk folks are fantastic. Granted, most people that review on this site aren't contractors, so ya'll probably won't be going through contractor services. However, my product is a flooring SKU and one of my best flooring guys I've met in a THD works there. Go see George if you're redoing your floors! He's fantastic!

44.description: ***HOME DEPOT itself 5 STARS***This review reflects my encounters with the people who work at this location.  Home Depot's motto "you can do it we can help" HA not from most of the people who work here , NOT HELPFUL, RUDE, AGGRESSIVE  I was afraid I would be knifed or assaulted by some of the male and female thugs who I am shocked are employed here. I had some questions and was asking the clerk about her opinion and she said " I dunno , WHAT! do I look like a carpenter?". I was so angry I went to find another clerk hoping he or she could help and saw a male and female employee dry humping and tickling each other how inappropriate!I am done with this location!

24.description: 4 stars = yay! I'm a fan. Not quite, but, compared to other area Home Depots, this place stands out. Which, if you've spent any time in north side Home Depots, you know that means something. Some of the employees are idiots, and their stock is hit or miss, but if I have to get anything complicated or involved, I've learned to go here instead of the marginally closer Kimball and Addison store. Overall, I think Home Depot needs to work on their employee training in terms of knowledge and customer service - I can't tell you how many times I've gotten bad or just completely incorrect advice on projects - and I'm sure that other chains like Lowe's and Menards have taken notice.Oh, and beware of their inventory system - I've had many instances where a product was supposed to be in stock according to their website, only to find that the store actually has none, and be told by an employee that the online inventory and actual store inventory aren't the same system, and to always call to check the actual store stock. Huh?

7.description: 9 out of 10 times I will be asked if I need help, only to explain what I am looking for and be met with a glazed unresponsive expression. Most employees are clueless & appear they could care less.Having a rental property close by as well as my primary residence, it's worth it to me to travel to the Evanston store. More choices for everything including garden center to store inventory.Add employees with more information and a better attitude.

49.description: Damn you Home Depot for not having the rolls of cork board I needed to contruct my it's-a-rainy-day-and-I-refuse-to-go-out-so-instead-I-will-organize project!And for not employing anyone who knows where anything is in the whole damn store!Lucky for you, Lowes is mere blocks away.Get it together!

40.description: I came here to get some garden stuff. I was looking for onion sets and sure enough I found them... moldy with little flies buzzing around the rotting bulbs. Now keep in mind the Home Depot garden center in Niles sucks and this has been an alternative.I'm really disappointed with this place.

30.description: What. A joke.I came here looking to buy  screen door & 2 ceiling fans, and wanted to have all 3 installed. This means I was prepared to spend somewhere between $750-1000. Sure, we didn't need to buy in contractor quantities or have our entire roof replaced, but that's still a fair amount of money for us (probably for most people) and you would think they would appreciate the business. Well, you'd be wrong.Upon entering, someone near the door said hello and as I passed the guy making popcorn, he said something unintelligable about popcorn. I smiled and continued on to ceiling fans. I looked around a while and see they have prices displayed for installation ($139 for the first fan & $119 for the second). I decided what I wanted, but moved on to the door section to have a look there before asking for assistance- not that I saw anyone around.I looked through screen doors, utilizing about as much experience as I had with the ceiling fans. To be clear, my experience level is that I have used both a ceiling fan & a screen door before, so...obviously vast experience. I probably looked like a real expert, which is why no assistance was offered to me at any point during my visit. In any case, there were a couple options I liked, and so I returned to the front of the store in hopes of finding an employee to help. On my way, I passed one employee who lowered his eyes to the ground & walked way as I neared. I was still feeling pretty positive & excited about my home improvement project at this point, and figured "Well, he's probably in the middle of something." As I reached the ceiling fans again, 2 customers were being helped. I thought "I wonder how they got help? Maybe the employees are all queued up somewhere like cabs outside the airport, just waiting for  customer to engage them. I better find that magical place." I saw an orange apron passing by & asked if he could help me. I started with the ceiling fans. He told me I could purchase it & then they'd have an order written up to have somone come out to quote me for installation. I pointed out that the installation prices are posted, to which he said "Well they have to come out & quote you." Whatever. He took me to their "lead generater." OMG. This guy. First of all, he was really odd. He was standing around at the popcorn machine with a bag in-hand, eagerly waiting for it to start popping. When the 1st guy told him what I needed, Lead handed him his empty popcorn bag and said "Fine. Get me popcorn." He then proceeded to write up the lead in writing so unintelligible that I couldn't recognize my own phone number. He added eloquent notes such as "their [sic] is an existing elec. source their [sic]" amid the popcorn grease stains. After we were done, he sent me to the desk back at doors and windows to arrange for measuring & installation.After walking back & waiting for the one person who was back there to finish with other customers, I find he can only help with windows. He tells me he knows who can help me though, and I follow him...back to Lead! In spite of being the one who directed me back to the doors & windows section, he pulls my folded up and now somehow far greasier lead sheet out of his apron and adds notes to have someone "mesure [sic]" my door and tells me they will quote installation. I ask if they'll honor the posted installation special of $57. He says "probably."I purchased nothing beause my experience with Lead left me very uncertain that anything would come of my visit to this store. I would not wonder long. Within an hour I got a VM from Lead saying I need to do him a "favor" and call another guy about the screen door installation.

46.description: I was looking for some basic items (staple gun, eye screws, drill bits) and found it to be pretty good.I bought a lot of plants and the woman working there was really helpful with picking out a soil and finding things, though it would've been nicer if she knew about the care of the particular plants. At the same time, I couldn't tell if she was assigned to the garden department or not, as I later saw her in different parts of the store.The guy working the hardware department was very nice once he came to the customer service desk. I don't know why it took him so long to come, perhaps because the store was understaffed (I've noticed this at other home depots as well).Making returns was simple, as was check-out.It's a good-sized home depot and so the selection of items that I needed was really good.Overall, I'm happy with it and will gladly come back for any other items I need. I'm also glad that the staff I talked to were familiar with their products and where nice and helpful. It made shopping much easier.

1.description: I hate writing reviews, but having just gotten of the phone with their corporate customer service I am not happy with any of the locations in this area nor their customer service agents.I have been treated with distain every time I walk into one of these stores.   I have had an employee threaten me, when I asked for help simply finding an item   I have had an employee refuse to return my property, when I determined he would not be able to understand my need and he continued to pull me in the wrong direction.   I have had stuff I ordered online but shipped to my home shattered upon arrival needing to be returned to the store   I have had stuff I ordered online and shipped to the store sit on their docks for a month because nobody could get the bar code scanner to work properly. In this case I worked with 2 online customer service agents to try to track down the parts, the first hung up on me, the second claimed to have contacted the store but apparently didn't when i went to pick up my mangled and destroyed parts.  I just tried to return a 3 month old rechargeable battery, and was told nothing they could do, may as well throw it out, no mention of the 1-2 warranty. I left the store, the battery, and receipt.So, Corporate Customer Service said that our store mangers should train better, they might be able to find the battery, they might be able to work with the manufacturer, and I might get my battery back, I can get you a $15 store credit? But other than that, "Tough, it is a store issue" My interpretation, "Please come back so we can treat you horribly again."

9.description: This review concerns Kurt an employee who works near the large appliances department, specifically he works in the counters and kitchen department at 6211 N Lincoln Avenue, Chicago, IL, Store # 8598, and I am taking this information directly off my receipt from today's (5/23/2015) purchase of $729.04. My son and I were in Home Depot in and around the appliances section today starting at about 9:30am. We were waiting on Rochelle, who we have worked with before on our purchase of a dishwasher. For the record I have no problem with Rochelle, rather she is a good employee and gives great customer service. We're it not for Rochelle, when the incident I am about to describe occurred I would have cancelled the aforementioned purchase. When my son and I arrived at the appliances section, Rochelle was busy with other clients. My son and I waited over thirty minutes for Rochelle to help us, as unfortunately she was the only employee available to assist us on a Saturday morning. During our wait my son was well-behaved not making a peep for anyone else to hear. During our wait, I actually asked Kurt if he could help us and he told me "No, I only work counters, you will have to wait for the young lady over there" as he pointed to Rochelle. Also during our wait, I witnessed Kurt, anger a customer before me. There was a 35ish year old male customer waiting for assistance and Kurt very sarcastically yelled across an aisle of appliances, " what the matter, why are you standing over there frowning?" When the customer told him he wasn't frowning but he was frustrated and trying to get some assistance Kurt told him that all representatives were tied up and that he would have to wait, but that he should stop frowning. This, reasonably upset the customer and the customer asked Kurt to Call a manager. Kurt refused to do so and told the customer to walk to the front of the store, go to the customer service desk and request a manager. The customer, again asked Kurt to call a manager and Kurt simply told him "No, go to customer service." The customer stormed off and I did not see him again.Several minutes after this, Rochelle had finished with her customers and was able to assist me. I sat down at her kiosk and started to work on my order with her. While we were working together and I was simultaneously attempting to keep my 2.5 year old son entertained and content, my son began to do some toddler screaming. This went on for about 1 minute as I was telling my son to stop screaming and attempting to pull out my phone and put on a "Mickey Mouse Clubhouse," which for my 2.5 year old is the ultimate pacifier. While, I was in the process of doing so, Kurt, from the adjacent cubicle, stands up half way looks at my son and literally shouts, "Young man, you need to keep quiet down there!" This Home Depot employee spoke yelled at my son in a much louder tone than I have ever taken with him and I saw my son's chin crumple and quiver immediately. Any parent recognizes that toddler facial expression of shock and fright.Instantly, I felt my blood boil, and contemplated, canceling my order, and storming out with my son. I took a deep breath, handed my son my phone with his Mickey Mouse Clubhouse, and attempted to calm down. I knew if I reacted immediately and answered Home Depot employee Kurt, it would not be a very fatherly exhibition for my son. So, instead I calmly apologized to my son for this ignorant, insensitive, and unprofessional behavior in a man of perhaps 60 years of age.Rochelle and I exchanged glances and told her that after my transaction was complete I would like this Home Depot employee's name and that I would like to speak with a manager. Rochelle agreed, and told me that Kurt's behavior was, "not cool" and she apologized for him. After my transaction I spoke with a woman named Ashley who stated that she was a supervisor and that she was very sorry for my experience and that she would speak with Kurt. I did in the same conversation tell Ashley that I was pleased with Rochelle and that Rochelle was the only reason I didn't cancel my over $700 order.After speaking with Ashley I decided that I couldn't leave Kurt actions unanswered so I pushed my cart back over to Kurt's counters department and very directly interrupted him and the customer ( same customer he was working with when he decided that my son was his to teach manners to). I told Kurt that not only was he out of line by speaking to my child in a raised voice but that he was also extremely unprofessional. Kurt countered my commentary by stating that this was a place of business and that he was unable to concentrate over my son's screams. As he retorted, I cut him off and told him that I was not going to debate his unprofessionalism.I expect a response from Home Depot and for action to be taken on this employee who yelled at my shopping cart bound 2.5 year old son. Parents be warned if visit kitchens or major appliances at this Home Depot.

26.description: I went into Home Depot at Devon and McCormick Thursday evening looking for "food grade mineral oil" or a product made with it to season wood cutting boards. An online search said you can get it at hardware stores. I saw a product on Home Depot's online site but couldn't remember the name of it. I asked at least 6 different people at Home Depot and none of them had any idea what I was talking about. Oh, just checked online again, it's called Howard Butcher block conditioner and that store is supposed to have 17 on hand! I was kind of surprised that they didn't have a way to look it up on a computer or something. But I would have to say on a Thursday evening their whole staff was totally clueless. It really was comical. As a business model it stinks.

25.description: Wow, I'm really surprised to see the low rating this store has from so many other reviewers.  I don't go in here on a regular basis, but on the times I have been in I always find it clean, well organized and the employees helpful.  While I don't discount other peoples bad experiences I can only base my review on my experiences there so I'd say stop in here and check them out and find out for yourself.  In case you're wondering why I've rated it 4 stars instead of 5 the reason is during my interactions with employees they've always been friendly and professional to me, but they just didn't blow me away.  I don't mean that in any sort of negative way since I'm very happy with them and they treated me good, but like I say it was very good service just not the kind that made me want to say, Wow that was an awesome experience.

12.description: The customer service is horrible. We are waiting here to put in a special order for vertical blinds and a worker tells us that the guy in charge of that is taking his lunch. Well I dont care if he is on lunch they should have a replacement for him because I dont have all day to wait for someone finishing up his lunch. This is unacceptable for a detail store this big.

21.description: Ugh-  Why do business such as this insist on hiring incompetent people!!I'm a new homeowner in the area and have made several trips to this business and each time I have a negative experience with the staff here.  Highlights: (or not)1.  No discount or credit card available meaning no perks2.  Staff in the garden/outdoor area is useless, solely interested in talking to their friends on their phone3.  Parking lot is FULL of "contractor special parking" which is ALWAYS empty and takes up all of the good parking spotsSo most places want you to get their in-store credit card to qualify for perks and discounts.  Home Depot does too, but guess what, it comes with NOTHING. One guy tried to tell us that yes we did get 5-10% back purchases made using the card.  So the next weekend we went in to apply.  Then another lady tells us no, no such thing with the Home Depot credit card.  The way it works is if you find the same item for cheaper at Lowes, they refund you the difference, or something along the lines if Lowes offers a discount, they will match the discount, or something.  She was confused and confused us even further and said screw it.  If their "perk" is based on what Lowes is offering, why shouldn't I just go shop at Lowes?  Not very well thought out in my opinion.Next we had questions and were looking for hedges to plant in our front yard, we asked the associate who was hiding himself in the booth in the garden section.  When he finally decided to glance away from his cell phone he said he wasn't sure if they had any.  We had to basically coerce him to find out, he calls someone over the PA and proceeds to continue browsing through porn or posting selfies on his cellphone....who knows.  We wait about 8 minutes, no one shows up, he seems to be equally disinterested, so we said screw it and left.There is a Lowe's 5 minutes away from this location, we'll see how that goes.

17.description: Wow, I'm really surprised to see the low rating this store has from so many other reviewers.  I don't go in here on a regular basis, but on the times I have been in I always find it clean, well organized and the employees helpful.  While I don't discount other peoples bad experiences I can only base my review on my experiences there so I'd say stop in here and check them out and find out for yourself.  In case you're wondering why I've rated it 4 stars instead of 5 the reason is during my interactions with employees they've always been friendly and professional to me, but they just didn't blow me away.  I don't mean that in any sort of negative way since I'm very happy with them and they treated me good, but like I say it was very good service just not the kind that made me want to say, Wow that was an awesome experience.

10.description: This was my neighborhood big-box hardware etc. store for 3 years when I lived in Chicago. It continually met my expectations, and saved my rear end a few times by being open until 10pm. Met and exceeded expectations frequently.

5.description: Just bought a tree for $20.  It's full and fresh. They cut it, bagged it and put it on my roof. Eddy from Garden was super professional.

3.description: Rude, rude, rude ! Every time I purchased, it's a rude cashier. Today's experience was the final straw, no hello, no total given to me. In fact, if I hadn't ASKED for a bag for my plant pot, there wouldn't have been any words spoken in this transaction. Are you serious? I have to ask for a bag???? I'll take my business, hard earned dollars a few feet away to the Lowes. Thank you!

35.description: I have lived in my Condo for 4 years and have procrastinated about getting a screen door for my porch.  I took the leap last month.  I called Home Depot and they told me to schedule a time with the installer to do the measurements for my door.  I called, we scheduled, he was on time, and he left.  He told me HD would call me once he turned in the info and then I would need to go pick out a door.  I went there early on a Saturday, picked a door with the help of Nicole (?) and another staff person, paid, and scheduled with the installer for the next week.   He was again on time, efficient, and I LOVE MY DOOR.  Worth every penny.  I can say a lot about big box, under-staffing, etc, etc.  I have to say I was suuuperr satsified with this purchase.

19.description: Ugh-  Why do business such as this insist on hiring incompetent people!!I'm a new homeowner in the area and have made several trips to this business and each time I have a negative experience with the staff here.  Highlights: (or not)1.  No discount or credit card available meaning no perks2.  Staff in the garden/outdoor area is useless, solely interested in talking to their friends on their phone3.  Parking lot is FULL of "contractor special parking" which is ALWAYS empty and takes up all of the good parking spotsSo most places want you to get their in-store credit card to qualify for perks and discounts.  Home Depot does too, but guess what, it comes with NOTHING. One guy tried to tell us that yes we did get 5-10% back purchases made using the card.  So the next weekend we went in to apply.  Then another lady tells us no, no such thing with the Home Depot credit card.  The way it works is if you find the same item for cheaper at Lowes, they refund you the difference, or something along the lines if Lowes offers a discount, they will match the discount, or something.  She was confused and confused us even further and said screw it.  If their "perk" is based on what Lowes is offering, why shouldn't I just go shop at Lowes?  Not very well thought out in my opinion.Next we had questions and were looking for hedges to plant in our front yard, we asked the associate who was hiding himself in the booth in the garden section.  When he finally decided to glance away from his cell phone he said he wasn't sure if they had any.  We had to basically coerce him to find out, he calls someone over the PA and proceeds to continue browsing through porn or posting selfies on his cellphone....who knows.  We wait about 8 minutes, no one shows up, he seems to be equally disinterested, so we said screw it and left.There is a Lowe's 5 minutes away from this location, we'll see how that goes.

28.description: So, since becoming a homeowner, I find myself at Home Depot every weekend.  At least, it feels like every weekend.  They have everything I'm looking for from paint for the bedroom to houseplants, and a runner for the hallway.  The employees are friendly and attentive, and even though checkout can sometimes be a wait, it's mostly a pleasant experience.  They have free extra-salty popcorn for anyone who wants it while you're walking around, which I am sure boosts their soda sales.  Their parking lot is huge, but you can either park near the entrance or near the exit...you can't have both which isn't fun when you're rolling out anything big.  I've tried the local Lowe's, and I didn't know there could be such a quality difference between these shops, but there is.  Home Depot is the way to go!

45.description: I still dislike this location and their employees need to be cross trained and reprogrammed by Terminators.  The staff is useless the new crew in the painting department act like high schoolers left alone in a class room for the first time.  The other day I'm looking for something and have to wait while the peons go on and on back and forth with taunts to each other and the peon army Ohhhing and Whoa'ing with every taunt said.  That shit is high school, man.  Can't even find one person that would walk with me to the correct aisle and locate the item I'm looking for, they all just point and run away.  No accountability.  Except in material handling, if you get the right guy some of these fellas will step up and take care of your loose material needs.  Summer time here blows ass, the plants / nursery items are on the south side of the building and split by the street which brings traffic in and out of their parking lot.  They've blockaded one side of the parking lot so traffic has to be routed through this area, since there are no employees routing traffic its a free for all.  It's nuts and a time waster on weekends.  Only saving grace is all the cute ladies that come to purchase flowers, plants and etc.  One last thing.. ladies isn't time to throw away those UGGly ass boots?  Summer dresses and Ugg boots, seriously?  They get two stars, one for sucking and the other for attracting cute eye candy.

33.description: I've been to this Home Depot a few times lately. Mixed experiences. One time I wanted to get screws for some cabinet handles and the guy gave me the wrong length, even though I told him how thick the wood I needed them to go through was. Without thinking I bought them and got them home just to realize they were just long enough to get through the cabinet, but not long enough to go into the hardware. So I had to go back. Funny thing is I planned on getting the size I actually needed, but just took the one he handed me, so it's partially my fault for not paying attention.Another time I went for paint. The guy at the counter was available to help right away. He suggested a Behr ultimate which has the primer in the paint and I'm hoping it works as well as he says it does. I'm happy with the suggestion that may save me work. But we haven't used it yet and I'm really really hoping it works well, otherwise that'll be the second bad thing sold to me and A LOT harder to fix....Last time I went was for a fire extinguisher and it took awhile to find somebody to point us in the right direction. But once we found someone we got it right away. And did the self check out, which is nice.Overall, it's average, but eh, what do you expect from any huge chain store? Def not the service you get at the local hardware store, but it is closer to our house than the nearest one of those

43.description: I should have come here first before I went to the Lincoln Home Depot.  I just wrote the President of the company about my experience.I bought an oil-filled radiator online and had to return it to the nearest HD on Lincoln.  They gave me a store credit to exchange for another radiator.  The ones they had were Pelonis brand, and half of them had been taped up, like they were returns.  I took one to the cashier w/the store credit and asked the cashier, "is this a return, the box is open" and she said no, there's paperwork inside.  So me like a dummy believed her.  I got home and there was no paperwork, no warranty, no manual, nothing.So I called HD and wanted to know could I order online and have the replacement shipped to store -- NO!  Now Sears and Walmart have ship to store....I wanted to buy another brand and pick it up at the store. NO!And then called the HD on Lincoln and went into so many black holes of telephone hell....hangups...voice menus....it took about 10 minutes to get someone on the phone.  She was very pleasant and they didn't have the brand in store.  So I asked could I special order it and pick it up -- NO!  I had to keep calling back to see when it was in inventory.NOT!  I'm going to take this one back, get my money (if I can, but I doubt it, they're big on "store credit") and then go to Sears or Walgreens and get a heater.

2.description: Ho Ho Ho!! It was time to get our annual Christmas Tree like we do every year from Home Depot.  We used to get it at another Home Depot, but figured since we've always went to this location for other things, we'd give them the business.  My fiancé and I walk into the garden center last night, (November 24, about 6:30) and were the only ones in there.  There was a little older man doing something in and out but never once did he acknowledge us or asked if he could help us.  Hmmmmm ok.  So as we walked around looking for our "perfect Christmas tree" we basically were on our own.  We finally found one that we liked.  We had to locate the guy.  I found him finally, his name was RICH.  Short older guy with glasses.  I had to carry the tree over to the cutting table & put it up there.  He goes "what do you want?"  with this snippy attitude.  I go "just the usual, fresh cut, trim the bottom branches please".  his response "well what ones do you want off?"  I was taken back thinking he'd know how to trim the tree or suggest which ones he would remove.  so I just pointed to the ones I thought should come off.  finally he put it in the orange mesh cover, tossed it on a cart and goes "the twine is over there & the scissors are next to it.  Make sure the scissors stay there" and he walked away.  WOW.  What a rude employee this piece of work was!  Here it's the beginning of the Christmas Season and he basically made our trip to get a Christmas Tree so unpleasant.  Every other Home Depot we have bought trees for were very polite, helpful and even offered to tie it to our car for us.  Not Rich.  Rich was a miserable person who seems to hate his job, trying to get rid of us as soon as possible.  He for sure is one Angry Elf!!!  I just hope someone would say something to him, heck even make him take "Customer Service 101" classes. Put it this way, we were the ONLY ones in that Garden Center buying a tree and look how miserable he was with poor customer service.  Imagine what he will do as it gets deeper into the Christmas Season with many more people buying trees.  The guy for sure doesn't represent Home Depot like he should.Looking at other reviews of this store from January 2015.  January 2015  ONE star March 2015 ONE star    May 2015 ONE starJune 2015 ONE starJuly 2015 TWO starsAugust  3, 2015  ONE starAugust 19, 2015 ONE starOctober 2015  TWO starsNovember 2015 ONE starseems like there are a lot of complaints, I see a pattern here.  I really would hope that management would see these reviews and take action.  Merry Christmas to all, Bah Humbug Rich!!

18.description: I like to fix stuff.Mostly because I really enjoy buying old things.  The furniture, and decoration I purchase (or am given) usually need to have some serious TLC before they make their debut in my flat.And given my penchant for making my space as cozy as I can make it, I have taken to painting, replacing switch plates, and re-caulking my counters.This place is right down the street, and around the corner.  While not ALL of the sales staff is schooled in home repair, many of the guys who look like 55 year old Dads are.  And the ones who look like Grandpa's are usually even better.  The exception: the folks in the paint department.  I've yet to encounter a single person who wasn't buttoned up and on point.  They seem to love that department, and take ownership of their jobs.I also like to hang art work.  I have plaster over lathe walls.  Which means every time I move something, I have to spackle, smooth, and sand - and touch up with paint.The store offers a myriad of other products, but as I rent - I am not ready to invest in a new kitchen appliance, or install a deck.  But I could, if I wanted to be naughty.Also, I like how I am not photographed, and grabbed at by the paparazzi when I shop here.  It's nice to feel like a regular person once in a while.Despite my celebrity, I enjoy shopping here.  If you decide to visit a Home Depot, pick this one.  A friendly staff and well stocked shelves go a long way to the do it yourselfer.No autographs please.

41.description: Wow, I am generally not a fan of Home Depot, but this location consistently fails to meet even my very low expectations of the chain.If you want to learn how NOT to run a store, check this place out - it is pretty entertaining to watch. Employees basically taking a **** you attitude with each other, and only minimal civility towards customers. Stocking and facing are a disaster. Even the layout of the store is bizarre. Don't ever ever ever ever ever try a special order. You are asking for frustration, delays and disappointment.  In my opinion it all comes down to the hiring practices of this store. the average age (outside the hard-core building supply area) seems to be about 17. Nothing against young people, but exactly how mature were you at 17? Do you want to trust this 17 year old kid to have the knowledge and experience to sell you a product that is going to be PART OF THE STRUCTURE you and your children live in? Go to your neighborhood Ace, Do-it-Best or Crafty Beaver if you want good advice.  If you want cheap (but not necessarily inexpensive), run-of-the-mill, made-in-who-knows-where-tools and supplies, with the added bonus of being treated like an idiot, then go to this Home Depot.

52.description: Have to agree with the other viewer.  The staff here are the stupidest I have ever encountered in a chain store and they always seem to be out of stock on things.  I do go here, but only if I am ready to go a bit further to Lowe's or Menards if I can't find what I am looking for.  I am guessing that when they opened this one they felt it would not attract people who spend as much money so they purposley made it a schlocky store.

50.description: I went to this Home Depot 3 times yesterday to get stuff to replace the wax ring on a toilet. (Yuck!) Each time, I was in and out of the store in 5-10 minutes. I guess it helped that I more or less knew exactly what I was looking for and didn't need too much help finding what I needed.As usual, I wish there would be more people with DIY repair knowledge assisting customers. It would have helped to have someone explain the different types of wax rings to me. (With funnel vs. without funnel, regular vs. reinforced, etc)I also like the fact that they have a bike rack right next to the entrance/exit.

4.description: Not a bad place to go if you know exactly what you need and want to be sure that the store will have it in stock.   They are also way cheaper than speciality stores (although I have to say that Home Depot's in the city are not the cheapest big box home repair option.)  The place is huge and they have every kind of variety of any thing you need for home repair / maintenance.   That being said, the service can be pretty unhelpful (I have never had anybody in the store I have asked for help be rude, but they usually are unable to answer any questions beyond, "Can you direct me to this section?".)    Usually no lines at self check out.  The return process at this store is very efficient.

6.description: Wow, I wish I had read these reviews before coming here so much in the last months, as I spiral down further and further into disbelief at each visit.   My many visits here in the past months have related to moving apartments, gardening, and other projects.  Universally, my experiences have been terrible.  The staff is generally not knowledgeable, but sometimes pretends to be, in that, after the staff member walks me around in circles for 15 minutes, I am told firmly, 'no, we don't have that', then I wander around for a million years, and come across the thing they 'definitely don't have.'  Possibly, if you have the patience, the third person you ask will actually know something... What might be helpful is an online store directory showing where items are located.  The store map on the website is just a layout and has no information about where items are stocked.  The recurring outcome of these visits is that I leave empty handed or nearly, after a wasted hour, then buy the things I need online for cheaper than their HD price, if I had even been able to find the item in store or it had been in stock, neither of which usually occurs.  Nightmare. #neveragain

22.description: If you ever go to Home Depot and ask them to make keys for you, think again... They have no clue how to make them. You are much better of going to the Korean owned locksmith on Lincoln south of Foster. Home Depot stinks on making keys. Sorry but it's trueBy the way i got my money back for the bad keys

15.description: We bought our Christmas Tree here this year.  We got a Fraser Fir.  I am from the west coast so out there, it is usually a noble or douglas option.  We like the fraser fir because it doesn't shed so much.  The people here are helpful and nice.  I was looking for something and they walked me to where it was it. Also, they help you load the tree on your car.

20.description: I like to fix stuff.Mostly because I really enjoy buying old things.  The furniture, and decoration I purchase (or am given) usually need to have some serious TLC before they make their debut in my flat.And given my penchant for making my space as cozy as I can make it, I have taken to painting, replacing switch plates, and re-caulking my counters.This place is right down the street, and around the corner.  While not ALL of the sales staff is schooled in home repair, many of the guys who look like 55 year old Dads are.  And the ones who look like Grandpa's are usually even better.  The exception: the folks in the paint department.  I've yet to encounter a single person who wasn't buttoned up and on point.  They seem to love that department, and take ownership of their jobs.I also like to hang art work.  I have plaster over lathe walls.  Which means every time I move something, I have to spackle, smooth, and sand - and touch up with paint.The store offers a myriad of other products, but as I rent - I am not ready to invest in a new kitchen appliance, or install a deck.  But I could, if I wanted to be naughty.Also, I like how I am not photographed, and grabbed at by the paparazzi when I shop here.  It's nice to feel like a regular person once in a while.Despite my celebrity, I enjoy shopping here.  If you decide to visit a Home Depot, pick this one.  A friendly staff and well stocked shelves go a long way to the do it yourselfer.No autographs please.

36.description: Home Depot is probably my least favorite of the three big home improvement stores (Menards, Lowe's and Home Depot). This Home Depot is an OK store that's in a pretty good location. I just don't think the selection is as good as Menards or Lowe's. Home Depot has more "builder grade" products, especially when it comes to light fixtures and fans. I guess if you're a developer looking to buy any type of fixture, Home Depot is an ideal option, but if you are a homeowner looking for more unique fixtures, you're better off shopping elsewhere. I guess Home Depot is good for things like tools or supplies, like caulking or something. Really, I only go to Home Depot if I need something simple that I could get anywhere, and Home Depot is the closest option.

14.description: OK.  While I had a good experience on 2/19, I have just lost $4,000 due to Home Depot's mistake with three kitchen counter tops.  They never finalized an order and delayed it by one month.  They offered me $200.00, but I refused.  I never received a return call from three managers until I finally confronted a fourth.  Lousy service, terrible follow through, no concern for their actions, and placed my wife on hold for 30 minutes before dropping her.  I had to update my rating after this horrible experience.

3.description: Service was good, seating area was clean, and the food quality was very good. It was a great place to kill some time while my car got serviced at the Firestone next door.  Free WiFi too!

1.description: I preface this by saying I am not a Burger King fan. It's okay in a pinch, but not a destination spot for me. We heard they were now serving hot dogs, grilled to be specific. Mom likes hot dogs and I thought it might be a nice option for her. I ordered one grilled and one chili cheese dog. When I got them home,much to my horror, the regular hot dog had KETCHUP on it. Good grief, this is CHICAGO. Ketchup on hot dogs is a mortal sin for anyone over 12. It never occurred to me to even mention it. Anyhow, both were baaaaaad. I'd never order it again.

2.description: Let's just say the main reason I'm writing about this location, is unlike many BKs within city limits that I've been disappointed with in the past(i.e. running out of food items at random times such as breakfast items, and other various probs), this one tends to be one of their better locations in the city. It's also an older location, so I would second Jacob about the bathroom situation here, and agree with him on how much I love the convenience of their back door to the parking lot. :)I'm not holding the bathroom thing against this location, since the only times I ever come to this location anyway are usually when I happen to crave a BK fix when in the area, and get food to go. This location also has a 24 hour drive thru, which is a nice bonus right there!

5.description: OK, I don't usually do reviews about chain restaurants, so I automatically subtracted a star for that. I've been here so many times when I wanted a quick lunch and got just that. This place is usually very fast. The manager, a middle-aged guy, is usually running the front at lunchtime and things move along quickly from the time you walk in to the time you're done. They got the order right every time I've come here in the last 3 years, usually 1-2 times a month. It's run very efficiently and that makes it a place I return to.The food is well, y'know, Burger King. You got your Whoppers, fries, and drink like at any other one in the universe.I never used their bathrooms, so I can't confirm or deny Jacob J's report. There are a couple of lonely, weird old men who frequent the place and sit around drinking coffee. One drives a junker station wagon that looks like it contains all his belongings. He might be the one responsible for the aforementioned exploding bowels...

0.description: I love the staff at this BK.  They are always so professional and never get my order wrong.  I also love the fact that Burger King now sells Dasani Bubbly soda water.

4.description: No comments on food.Convenient parking in the back, you can enter through a rear door.  Bathrooms are back there also, not a great feature, since its easy for tards to use the washroom, allow their bowels to explode all over the place and leave the area a stinking mess.  Rotten.Tables are usually clean.  They've got Ice in the summer, 99 cent bags, not sure about the pounds.  yeah!

1.description: We had to order pizza from here because it was the only place open near us and because of a special circusmtance..couldnt drive so this was our last resort.....Oh my..what a bad pizza we had...the tomatoe sauce was completely bland.plus..I dont think I've ever had a saltier pizza than the one we were served...granted we requested ham..(really we wanted canadian bacon which they said they had but turns out it was just ham)..the pizza is cheap but so are the ingredients used...not sure if this place changed owners and therefore the drop in quality or my taste buds have evolved since the last time I ordered here.....a few years ago.

9.description: The worst pizza delivery experience. Ordered a large pizza on a Sunday night. Estimated delivery time was 37-47 minutes. We live 1.5 miles away from this store. Took 1h20m to deliver and the pizza was stone cold. Completely unhappy with this domino's and will only order from Giordano's or one of the many other pizza outfits that actually deliver on schedule and the pizza comes hot as they should be!

23.description: It is just not good pizza.  You can't use frozen ingredients, dump it in garlic salt, and expect it to beat the plethora of neighborhood joints that just have flat-out good pies.  First and last time I've ordered Domino's.

5.description: never in my life  i call for. deliver order  they was  so  rude a mexican guy and  then  they said  no  deliver to my area  is only 2 miles  so he scream to me  pleaseif you guys whant  costumers please be nice to them

25.description: Corporate muscle forces across the board reforms.I have ordered from Domino's before and thought the sandwich was too bland and the wings to be a hot mess. After watching the new Domino's marketing strategy being rolled out and test driving the Domino's at Yelp Fantasea, I decided to put the new corporate messaging to the test and order some pie.The online ordering process is some of the best in the business and it's very simple to use with ample customization options for pizza without having to make an account. An amusing feature of the online ordering process is being able to watch the 1) Order Processing 2) Food Prep 3) Oven time 4) Quality Assurance 5) Delivery timeline. Watching their timeline, I saw the food took about 2 minutes to prep and then 6 minutes to cook. I wish I could have put to make it well done for the pizza but oh well. The pizza that took 8 minutes to complete after my order was then loaded into the car. The pizza then took 30 minutes to go four blocks from the store to my  house.All in all the pizza was similar to what I ate at Yelp Fantasea, better than frozen pizza, but not good as your local neighborhood pizza joint. The main advantage was pricing so we'll leave it at that.

12.description: ok. let me start to say that I am not a Domino's fan.  I haven't eaten it in at least 20 years.  I don't eat pizza often because I am gluten free (GF)  and there are not a lot of good options out there. However, I was doing a search and ran across  a fellow Yelper positive review  regarding Domino's gluten free pizzas.  I said to myself "No way!" So I decided to try then because they have a promo of 50% off all online orders. So what is there to little.  Why not!I ordered 3 pizzas: 1 ultimate pepperoni w/ x cheese , 1 wisconsin cheese w/ sausage, 1 ultimate feast with bacon . all for about 29 bucks incl 2.75 delivery feePleasantly surprised that they arrived hot and were really good. perfectly cooked ( crispy crust) which those who are GF know is hard to find. All in all good deal. good pizza

21.description: I hadn't eaten Domino's Pizza in probably 15 years and recently tried it after seeing those commercials about how they had changed their recipe. I was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the two medium specialty pizzas for $7.99 each. I thought that was a pretty good deal. We ordered the Wisconsin 6 Cheese Pizza and Memphis BBQ Chicken Pizza. They were both very tasty and had good crust. Not many pizza places in Chicago have BBQ chicken pizza, and for $7.99, this is a good option. One issue I do have with Domino's is their online pizza tracker, which is supposed to show where your pizza is at various stages, like prep, baking and delivery. The last two times we ordered pizza, the tracker said the pizza had been delivered and that we should be eating it, when we hadn't even received it yet. The tracker is a cool idea, but unless Domino's can make some strides to improve its accuracy, I think they should stop making it available to customers. It was just really annoying to see the tracker be like, "Your pizza is here! Yum!" and we're like, "Ah ... no it's not" and trying to look out the window to spot the Domino's car. Overall, I think Domino's is a pretty good value for the price and will order from there again.

16.description: I chose Dominos because they have a gluten free pizza option, I ordered a pacific veggie which was delicious. I wish they had other sizes available for gluten free they only have small for some reason. It was crispy and delicious and I would order from them again cost $16.00 . I picked up and it was ready when I arrived. The employee could not answer online questions like how the coupons work, if I order I online can I use coupons they had no clue. But there are lots of coupons available on web site but none for small or gluten free. Nice clean store , good location and plenty of free parking.

17.description: Whoever is running the place lacks customer service skills.  I ordered chicken once and it was raw.  He gave me an attitude and was real rude.  He made me return the pieces that I didn't spit out and made the driver count them before he gave me new ones. What a jerk!

10.description: two stars goes for serving me 4 medium pizzas that were all way over cooked in the oven! i mean come on...the oven is supposed to be pre set on a certain temperature!! simply aweful. and i posted a picture of the cheese pizza.. picture is worth a million words....Customer service sucks here. they need to be managed abit better.

11.description: If i can give 0 star i will but yelp wont let me.. Anyways, customer service totally sucks.. The manager was so rude.. We ordered for pick up few times a week and every time we pay for extra cheese but they never gave it to us while they charge us for it..  One time we called for delivery and they said we weren't in their delivery range while we live  less than 1 mile away.. Now we just make our own pizza at home  and it taste way better than what this restaurant offers and we save more money.. Never ever coming back to them!

26.description: What horrible service!! I've ordered delivery twice from them and this was the last time! One time the guy taking our order was so condescending towards my mom telling her what a "Hawaiian" pizza had on it when she wasn't even asking, she simply asked what the specials were. This time the special was 2 Hawaiian pizzas for 20 bucks and it came out to $26.00!! tax and delivery I'm sure but when I simply asked the delivery guy if his tip was included he quickly turned away with attitude and said "that's ok, never mind" I was the one asking the questions and he was acting like I was refusing to pay him a tip. Sounds like 2 bucks tax and 4 bucks delivery charge. They have a major attitude problem and maybe because of my ethnicity he thought I was being cheap, which I wasn't, I like to think I'm generous when the service fits! I said I'm not going to call them after this and I won't. I'd rather drive through a Chicago snow storm, out of my way, than have this nearby joint deliver to me. Nacos!!

27.description: I thought I would never be back for more, but what can you say?  I like delivery, and this is the Domino's Albany Park is stuck with.  I love the American Legends Pacific Veggie Pizza, and this time, it was at my door within 20 minutes.  Thanks, Garcia.

0.description: Have always had good luck with this place. Had a bad experience recently. The owner made it rite. Now, it's a good experience. Lots of respect for the owner. And, if I'm being honest, the sandwiches aren't supposed to be this good at a freaking fast food, chain franchise. They're loaded with cheese, and the bread is toasted just right. I ordered them because of the convenience, but didn't expect to be so food if them. Bottom line... Good food, convenient, and typically good service. Sure, it's somewhat homogenized. But, so now is that artisan Korean sandwich spot up the street (that's assuming you live in hipsterville). Hahaha.

20.description: This place is one of the worst. I ordered online, then received a message saying it would be ready in 19-24 minutes. We got there 25 minutes after ordering and the tracker online said it was still in the oven, which I understood. However, it then changed to say it was ready and boxed for pickup. We had to wait 20 minutes after that to actually get our order.what is the point of telling me my food is ready if I still have to wait 20 more minutes! We also weren't the only people there waiting longer than we should have for food, while we were there we saw someone obviously upset that his order wasn't ready after waiting so long and the workers proceeded to tell the customer they cancelled his order and to leave because he was causing a disturbance. He was understandably upset because he had already paid for the food though. I am NEVER ordering from here again.

19.description: This place is one of the worst. I ordered online, then received a message saying it would be ready in 19-24 minutes. We got there 25 minutes after ordering and the tracker online said it was still in the oven, which I understood. However, it then changed to say it was ready and boxed for pickup. We had to wait 20 minutes after that to actually get our order.what is the point of telling me my food is ready if I still have to wait 20 more minutes! We also weren't the only people there waiting longer than we should have for food, while we were there we saw someone obviously upset that his order wasn't ready after waiting so long and the workers proceeded to tell the customer they cancelled his order and to leave because he was causing a disturbance.
