39.description: OK, so here is the deal: It's a Mexican restaurant but has pizza there as well.Tacos are pretty good and I wouldn't say pizza was that bad either but I wouldn't go out of my way to check it out.On the flip side, my buddy LOVED their cheeseburgers. He said that if you want to get some, get em with extra bacon!Pros: Good tacos, decent pizza, good place to grab a quick bite that doesn't cost you any arm or leg.Cons: The bathrooms didn't impress me much. I am very anal when it comes to going places to eat and have dirty bathrooms but at the same time, it could be "one of those days" when the person who cleans the bathroom called in sick or something.

37.description: Great place!

0.description: When I first heard of Sergio's, I was skeptical of a place that claimed to be both a taqueria and a pizzaria.  For the first few times I ordered, I refused to even look at the Italian side of the menu.  The carne asada nachos here are awesome, as are the shrimp fajitas (the shrimp have a small kick to them!). I only eat refried beans if they taste really good, and these ones get finished every time. Today I wasn't in the mood for Mexican again, but not many places around here deliver before noon on weekdays, so it was Sergio's again.  Their lasagna is actually very good!  Comes with plenty of tasty meat sauce and fresh bread.  One order is 2 decent sized meals, so I have lunch for tomorrow as well!Norma is always sweet on the phone, and the delivery guys are quick and friendly.  Sergio's is our go-to place for lunch deliveries.  I hope to actually make it into the restaurant sometime soon!

38.description: I went to high school right up the street from Sergio's (bet you can guess where!) and it used to be a place called Jonathan's.  The only thing that changed, really, was the name.This place is really as good as it gets.  The guys and girl who work there got to know us fairly quickly, because my friends and I were there really all the time.  It's dirt cheap; as of like a year ago, a huge slice of really good cheese pizza (amaaazing crust) was $1.75.  For high schoolers working on nothing more than a weekly allowance, Sergio's was a godsend.  Also cheap and really good is the guacamole and homemade chips, which is what I frequently got for a snack since I was a vegetarian all through high school.The prices on the menu are really good all the way around, and you can do your own quality control since you can sit at the counter and watch exactly what they're making you.  This place really is a dive.  It's tiny, just the kitchen, the register, and maybe ten seats at a counter.  As for ambience, there is none.  It's all fast food, but they make it all fresh.  They have a pretty expansive menu of Mexican classics and Italian snacks.  They keep cans of pop, bottles of water, and many flavors of Jarritos in a cooler behind the register.Now, the best part.  The cheap, greasy, crispy, heart-stopping, just-slap-that-baby-straight-on-my-thighs wet dream of guilty pleasures.  Sergio's has calzones.  You can get them baked, or if you're short on time, they'll drop it in the fryer.  It's a wad of fresh pizza dough, rolled out, stuffed with a ridiculous amount of cheese, sauce, and topping, pinched closed, and deep fried.  I can't even imagine the calorie count, here, and I refuse to even try.  It's the most comforting comfort food I think I've ever had.  It's heavy, hot, stretchy and gooey on the inside, golden, cripsy, and a bit chewy on the outside.  I always got mine with fresh tomatoes as a topping, and the diced fresh tomatoes with the thick sauce and the mozzarella... OM NOM NOM NOM.And if I remember correctly, the whole thing was under $5.I don't care if you don't like Mexican food, or pizza, or dives.  If you're short on cash (and who isn't nowadays?) and need something that can fill you up for the entire day and make your tummy happy to boot, go to Sergio's and get a deep fried calzone.  Thank me later.[EDIT, but not needing an "Update"] 01/30/10:  I went into Sergio's again a few weeks ago needing serious dinner seriously quick.  It was almost to closing time, so the place was empty, and the prices had gone up only so much as would be expected in five years.However, the important thing to take away from this edit is that they have expanded into the space next door with an open, airy, quaintly decorated seating area in addition to the sparse and oft-crowded counter.  It's always great to see businesses expanding in this economy.  Three cheers!

27.description: Sucks that they charge for sauces and condiments but the pizza is good but not authentic mexican food.

32.description: I miss this place sooooo much! I never expected Sergio's to be that good, but I was pleasantly surprised. I always order the same thing...chicken flautas and a large orchata.The staff is so nice and they recently added a seating area.  Highly recommended!!!

44.description: I just moved back to the city, and there are plenty of nights when my lazy ass doesn't feel like cooking.Some friends had suggested this place, because it is within walking distance of where I live.For about $5.00, you get a drink and a pretty darn good burrito dinner.  For a few dollars more, you can get guacamole and chips.  They make it when you order it, so you know its fresh.  They even make their own tortilla chips!The service is fast, and the folks that work at Sergio's are bilingual.  I always give a little extra credit for places that are multi-lingual.  And they remember faces, so they always greet you warmly when you return.You can call ahead, and pick up OR they will deliver.  Now, I'm lazy but not that lazy - so I haven't actually got delivery.  Not that it stopped in the past. I used to order pizza from the pizza shop across the street from my house and have it delivered.  The portions are filling.  The atmosphere inside Sergio's is totally old school... looks like it was a coffee and donut shop in the 40's.  It seats about 8 people at a small bar - thats it.  And it is open really late, which is great for someone like me who kids himself that  he will cook, and then at 9:15 pm decides it is too late to dirty dishes.

24.description: Just wanted to mention that it's still good. Just a little neighborhood place, caters to the school kids around 3300 Bryn Mawr.The expanded into the next-door storefront.Consistent joint.

7.description: UPDATE MY REVIEWBest pizza ever.. seriously.... you guys are the best. :-D definitely definitely definitely definitely definitely! Be back.

40.description: Sergio's menu is diverse: pizza, fried food, Mexican, chicken, sandwiches, and Italian... so have at it!  In general, the food is ok.  When I feel like going against my diet... I order a baby cheese pizza or appetizers or a chicken burrito - always piping hot.  I deplore luke warm food.What's even better - price, quick service, and hours.  When everything else in the area is closed, you can count on Sergio's.  They accept cards... so no need to go to an ATM in the middle of the night and risk life and limb just so you can get a snack.  Street parking is available, so whether you choose to dine-in or pick up its convenient.  As many of the reviewers' noted the Hollywood is right across the street.  Or if you opt for more wine and spirits you can head to Arcadia, the liquor store, on the corner of Bryn Mawr and Kedzie.  Yes... I said liquor store, what about it??All in all, if its late and you want to get in and out... Sergio's is on the mark.  I would give Sergio's 3 1/2 stars if I could.

30.description: I really like this little hole.  The prices are a little high, but there is plentiful menu to choose from

46.description: This is a great little dive restaurant.This is just good food, cheap.They have scrumptious cheeseburgers...just add the bacon and wowow...yummy.If you go to one of the colleges in the area...spread the word, baby, because this place is open late and the food is great.I am not, though, a big fan of their beans or rice...so maybe skip that.

1.description: "I have to many deliveries and I can't find your house.  I am not delivering your food."What!  I have never had a delivery driver say that!  Wow!  We never got our food and they were being difficult with the refund.  What a terrible business.  Avoid.

9.description: You can get good food anywhere, customer service is KEY.I placed an order through grub hub. An expensive order. I used a coupon, off of Sergios menu, for a free small cheese pizza.I received a phone call AFTER my order had left the restaurant to let me know that I cannot use a coupon when I place my order through grub hub, because the already pay $5 for the service. Are you kidding me?! One less customer to worry about losing that $5 fee to Sergios. Very bad customer service gets a very review.

26.description: I went to Northside for high-school, so I was in here and in Java and Mug next door all the time. Lots of fond memories. Decent pizza by the slice, but the tortas are where it's at. The Hawaiian torta is excellent! The burritos are big and tasty and so are the NACHOS!

25.description: I ordered the flautas here like I do at basically any restaurant that offers them. The delivery was quick and the driver was very pleasant. He seemed very gracious for the tip I gave him, even though it wasn't that much. The food arrived in tact. Normally when I get Mexican delivery, the presence of beans, sour cream, guacamole etc make the flautas mushy. They put everything on the side which was a good idea. The flautas were crunchy and damn delicious. The rice and beans were a little bland but some salt and pepper easily fixed that problem. The guacamole didn't look very appetizing but it was good! I'll have to try the pizza next time!

12.description: I order from Sergio's regularly on grubhub. I've only had their mexican good.. But I am obsessed with their enchiladas Rojas. Holy ess. Also, their delivery is always fast and their delivery drivers are always delightful. Om nom nom.

21.description: I love my local Mexican joint. I support all local business to go grow and this one of them. Good average price if your in a budget.

17.description: One of our family favorites. We started coming here because it's a short 1/2 a block away from our house. After years of being regular customers, the staff at Sergio's is practically family to us. I've got to admit, we don't often stray from our order of the Carne Asada burrito dinner so I can't comment too much on the menu. However, what I can tell you is that we're never disappointed with our regular order (we literally order Carne Asada burritos on weekly basis... sometimes more often). The service is friendly... you can tell these people are very family oriented. I love that about them!!! This is a clean establishment with plenty of seating. Though we always take to-go (because it's so close to home), I wouldn't hesitate to dine in.

10.description: I am totally confused by all the "GREAT PIZZA!" or "you have to try the XXXXX" reviews on here. I feel bad dumping on a family business but here's the facts: Dingy, not so clean anywhere, especially the bathroom and not in that charming run-down kind of way. The dining area seems to also be a storage area for random things. The presentation of the food is bad. The food is tasteless AND ALL 3 OF MY CHILDREN GOT FOOD POISONING as confirmed by their doctor and have been vomiting for the past 2 days on average 1-2 times per hour or whenever they try to drink anything. I suspected something was up with this place, ala they are going out of business and are trying to skimp on things like keeping meat past its go bad date. I'll give an example, the single ply half napkins wrapped around the fork and knife, the reused paper pamphlet menus given to us which had food stains on them and were wrinkled. I wish I could have given a better review as the people working there (assuming the owners) were nice and I didn't even mind their daughter running around the place and coming up to us while we were eating though that seems pretty bush league when trying to run any sort of shop.

5.description: They make an amazing burrito! And their sauces are also amazing! Spicy too so be careful. I have had this placed delivered twice and went in once. Delivery and service in their place is great. Very friendly! I highly highly recommend it to anyone who wants a legit, authentic Mexican Food.

3.description: Just ordered for delivery for my first time and I was surprised on how good it was since it's also a pizza place, but it was so good. I would be ordering again.

35.description: Nothing better than chorizo and pizza!  Very friendly and open for Bears kickoff which the other pizza joint in the neighborhood isn't aware of.

19.description: I ordered the flautas here like I do at basically any restaurant that offers them. The delivery was quick and the driver was very pleasant. He seemed very gracious for the tip I gave him, even though it wasn't that much. The food arrived in tact. Normally when I get Mexican delivery, the presence of beans, sour cream, guacamole etc make the flautas mushy. They put everything on the side which was a good idea. The flautas were crunchy and damn delicious. The rice and beans were a little bland but some salt and pepper easily fixed that problem. The guacamole didn't look very appetizing but it was good! I'll have to try the pizza next time!

28.description: This little place is one of those gems tucked away on Bryn Mawr. A  family tended mexican joint AND pizzeria. I know, sounds funny, but they excel at both. Their Hawaiian Torta deserves a trip. I remember my first one. A friend told me he had discovered them and so I sat down on the little 50's style counter (back before they added the dining room) and wondered what I was getting into. OMG. Spicy al pastor pork and fresh jalapenos dance in your mouth with pineapples, embraced by melted cheese. The bread holds this fine mess together valiantly. Spicy, not too sweet, flavorful! And so satisfying. Have it with some guacamole. Hands down some of the best I have had in a restaurant. You watch them cut it up and make it in front of you. Even the chips are deep fried in the moment. How sexy is that? Hooyah!But I don't want Mexican tonight? PIZZA, says you? This isn't Pizza Hut prices, but the pizzas are tasty and cooked perfect. Cheesy, not skimpy on ingredients, nice thickness and doughiness, ugh- I'm hungry just thinking about it. Also, very prompt with delivery. Where else can you get amazing pizza *and* guacamole delivered to you? Edit: The pizza that rotates is kinda sad. Don't order that one, it is no indicator of what they can do. Their fresh pizzas are where all the magic is. Their sopes are also pretty filling with a crunchy base and lots of stuff on top for your belly, the chile relleno dinner is a simple and hearty option I enjoy, but objectively, I know the quality does not rival my other favorites. If your in the area, I recommend stopping in and trying it out, hell, I would even say it merits a trip. That Hawaiian torta has never met a belly it didn't like.

45.description: It's not the greatest taco place on earth, but it is pretty good.  They have a huge variety of tacos (steak, al pastor, bean)....as well as pizzas, burgers etc.  Pretty quick service, pretty friendly people.  I just like the fact that it's a taqueria tucked away in a korean neighborhood.  I usually go there for lunch, pretty empty most of the time, so it's recluse-friendly (which probably doesn't make sense).  They also serve brain taco also makes it zombie-friendly (which also doesn't make sense).  I have never tried it, but i've always wanted to say "ahh yes, i'll have a brain taco please".

33.description: EEK Methinks not indeed.  The owner has been very rude on several occasions.  This place is so bad that when I am given the choice between eating here and eating at the place I call The Tummyacher down the street, I choose the Tummyacher.  If you want good pizza, go to Martinos or Delisis or Lou Malnatis.  This place was better when it was Johnathons or the Hollywood Grill.

43.description: I used to stop by here mostly to grab a quick snack when hanging out at the outdoor cafe next door... but Sergio's quickly became a destination in and of itself... for only one reason: the Hawaiian Torta. Now I know its probably scary to hype up a single entree from a hole-in-the-wall place like Sergio's... I won't tell you to drive all the way to North Park from the South Side just to sample this delicious treat, but I will say that if you're in the neighborhood, its DEFINITELY worth a try.You got a flavorful medley of ham and pastor, grilled pineapple, avocado, jalapenos, mayonnaise and cheese on sweet Mexican bread... its a great late night combo that will satisfy even the most severe cases of the munchies.anyways, this is a good place, with good people and in a nice neighborhood, but really for me its really all about the Hawaiian torta. So hope you check it out and enjoy!

2.description: Their vegetarian tostada dinner is the BEST!!!! Love their fresh sauces!

18.description: Great for a quick lunch!Order in quick dinner!Game day food!Pizza partyRelative Late night munchiesSergios is a great local stop! Northeastern students appreciate this joint. I can't even reminber how many times I've opted for this place over everythg else around. Excellent pizza, tacos, burritos, yummmmmmy hawaiian torta. Good burgers. Make sure you rock the gaucamole. Also the salsa verde is... Amazing on everything you can think of to put it on! It's not crazy expensive. This family works hard to give their customer good quality food at an afford price. Woo. Love this place.

41.description: I just wanna say they really know how to make pizza and garlic bread. Friendly staff and cozy eat-in area. I had it when got wasted from hollywood. And as far as i remembered, the bread was surpringly good. Later i had it again when i was sober,, it was twice as good. Or it must be something wrong with me.

4.description: Honestly I'm giving four stars for their tacos. I have been coming here since I first started high school over eight yrs ago and started coming back since I'm back in school in the area. Honestly the tacos were good back then and they still are. It's nice to go in and always be greeted by friendly faces. Now u can sit down and eat. My favorite is the AL pastor and steak tacos. Food tastes homemade. I can't comment on the other food. But when in the area I'm definitely stopping in for my taco fix.

6.description: This place is not a good place to get your pizza fix, so let me get that out of the way. Great authentic Mexican food, tastes home cooked. I'd recommend getting a burrito. They leave you a choice of two salsas at your table; I'd say try them both and see which you like better.Dining area could be larger. There's a bar area in the back the seems to be taking up space, considering they do not serve drinks behind it. Also, if you are going to give it a try, avoid after school hours ~4 o'clock, as the place gets crowded with hungry high schoolers on their way home.

22.description: I love their tostadas. Had it both there and delivery. Tacos are decent too. They also have pizza. Haven't tried it but the place is good. Not many Mexican restaurants around this area. This is the place to order from, good food and good prices.

15.description: Great little place run by very friendly folks.  The guy who took my order warmly urged me to sit down in their dining room while I waited for my food.  He even offered me a glass of water to drink despite the fact that I ordered carryout.  I was craving a calzone, so a Yelp search (thank you Raven M.) led me here.  I wasn't offered a choice of baked or fried--it was fried!  That sure is unusual but it worked.  I wish that the calzone had more sauce or came with a side of marinara.  Otherwise it was damn tasty.  The cheese, pepperoni, and green peppers were all great; the dough was a little greasy and crispy as you would expect.  As I said, it was light on sauce and maybe a bit heavy on cheese, but the whole package worked overall.  I'll give it a B+.Oh, and I forgot to mention that the calzone is only $5.51 including tax.

20.description: Local North Park Mexican place -great prices and good food. I am very particular about my tacos and the portions here are good and they use fresh ingredients that I can taste in the food. The lunch rush is pretty intense with a mix of loud HS students not knowing what to order mucking up the efficiency of getting orders doled out so go before lunch or a little bit after to avoid the mindless teeny-bopper banter. Otherwise, i recommend this mom & pop place for its good food, good prices and nice location.

36.description: Great little place run by very friendly folks.  The guy who took my order warmly urged me to sit down in their dining room while I waited for my food.  He even offered me a glass of water to drink despite the fact that I ordered carryout.  I was craving a calzone, so a Yelp search (thank you Raven M.) led me here.  I wasn't offered a choice of baked or fried--it was fried!  That sure is unusual but it worked.  I wish that the calzone had more sauce or came with a side of marinara.  Otherwise it was damn tasty.  The cheese, pepperoni, and green peppers were all great; the dough was a little greasy and crispy as you would expect.  As I said, it was light on sauce and maybe a bit heavy on cheese, but the whole package worked overall.  I'll give it a B+.Oh, and I forgot to mention that the calzone is only $5.51 including tax.

14.description: Well today was a big commit a home neatness day, so I was not up for cooking anything or going anywhere.This place is in my neighborhood and I have never ordered from here, so I thought I would give it a try.. My order was fairly large because it was going to have to cover lunch for mom and I and supper for mom, Christopher and I. For lunch mom had a torta (ground beef) and a baked potato. Thumbs up on both of them. She does not like beans and rice so was great to have an alternative. I ordered a small Tex-Mex Pizza #1, which is thin crust and has sausage, fresh tomato and jalapeno on it. I really liked it. In my post menopausal dotage, I find my craving for hot food is escalating!!! For dinner I got 2 orders of spaghetti with meat sauce and a small chef's salad. The salad was very nice, lots of cheese and pepperoni in it. When I first looked at the spaghetti, I thought they were being a little chintzy on the amount, but DANG, the sauce was so meaty and rich that the 3 of us split one order and the salad. It was pretty darn good, better than a lot of the sit-down Italian restaurants in the area that I have eaten at. All in all everything I ordered ranged from solidly good to really good. AND, the best part, I still have a full order of spaghetti and most of my pizza left. The order was well packaged, all the little side things like spaghetti cheese and salad dressing and good bread were included. Delivery was prompt and we are blissfully stuffed.

58.description: Pro: Big place, Various selections on food and cheap charge esp. for lunch. not crowed. .$7.XX with tax included per person.Con: food is average. I think most Chinese buffet their food is not fresh. but their sushi just does not taste right. Their floor is ok, but the tables are sticky. forks, cups and plates are ok. those waitress are dumb.Overall, I recommend casually for lunch.

56.description: I have been coming here for awhile and I only really like the shrimp and the crawfish.  They offer a lot of Chinese dishes as well as sushi but it's nasty.  I like their fried rice and the rice noodle.  This is a huge place though and it is always pack especially on weekends.  There were a lot of kids running around.  But what do you expect in buffets.  So overall i would come back if i want to eat shrimp.

29.description: After all the bad reviews I was scared to try this place. It was the opposite of what many said. We went on a Sunday afternoon. Maybe it depends on the time of day.Only complaint is that the food was very greasy... But it's Chinese. What would you expect?Food was steaming hot. Everything was being freshly refilled every few minutes.  Service was great. Never returned to dirty played at the table. Best service I've ever had at a buffet. Lots of seafood! Tons of fish, shrimp, and crawfish. Almost wished they had fewer seafood dishes. Also had sushi. Of, and don't forget that they had yummy Hispanic food to! Plantains and flan and these taco things that were good. Price is 7 something for lunch and 10.50 for dinner.

42.description: Been here a few years back, the food is okay. Which means the food is not horrible, but it's not good either.

23.description: To start, the owner rang up my family and I at the register.  He was on the phone,  yelling at someone in Chinese.  What he didn't realize is that my brother, who was with us, speaks Chinese.  He was complaining that he didn't want to put out any fresh food because there wasn't enough costumers to justify it.  He was complaining that he didn't have enough customers to make any money that day.  He sounded very upset. In addition to the rude behavior of the owner,  I was not impressed with anything else.  80 percent of the food was not fresh and you could see evidence of this as buildup on the edges of the table pans. The bottles of hot sauce had a build up on them,  disgusting. Overall,  the restaurant was dirty and unimpressive. Never going back.

47.description: I get it.  This is a chinese buffet.  If you are expecting gourmet, don't go to a chinese buffet.  This, however, was the absolute worst chinese buffet I have ever been to in my entire life.They had a massive selection of food.  There was a variety of chinese stir fries, fried rice, lo mein, and all the other usual suspects.  There was also, oddly enough, pizza, onion rings, and chicken nuggets.  Let's go down the line with dishes that I had:Chicken with broccoli.  First off, it was cold.  It wasn't even a little warm.  It was literally cold throughout the dish.  The dish was oversalted, oversauced, and the Broccoli was brown mush. Beef with broccoli was the same story as the chicken with broccoli, but with one thing that made it worse.  The beef was fatty, full of gristle, and stringy.  It was awful beef.Lo mein wasn't half bad-tasting, but it was cold and there were some crunchy noodles indicating that it had been sitting there a very long time.Green beans were cold, saltey mush.  Salmon was cold, and had two tastes to it: super fishey and super saltey.  Don't get me wrong.  I love salmon.  I expect salmon to taste like fish.  It's certainly not a bland fish.  But, this salmon had a strong rotting fish taste to it.  It was putrid and nasty.  The overwhelming amount of salt barely covered it up.  I had to spit it back out onto the plate.    If you read through the above dishes again, you will notice that every single dish that was supposed to be warm was cold.  Literally, the food on the buffet was cold.  I get that it is a buffet, and I am not expecting everything to be super hot as if it was made special just for me, but something is wrong when the food is literally cold.  The one dish that was warm: sushi.  The sushi also had crunchy rice in it making it even worse.  You know a buffet has a serious problem when the lo mein is cold and the sushi is warm.  Fresh fruit for dessert looked appetizing, but then I got a closer look at the pineapple and apples.  The apples were brown and mealy.  The pineapple had massive brown spots and was literally rotting in the tray.  It also was improperly cut, with large chunks of the rock hard center (normally removed) still intact along with big pieces of pineapple skin on the outside.  Whoever cut up the pineapple was either  being lazy or just doesn't know how to cut pineapple.    That was just the problems with the food.  The dining room was filthy.  I literally had to search to find a clean table.  I went through 7 plates and 13 forks to find a clean one of each.  My glass appeared clean, but one I filled it with water, I noticed several things floating in it.  A second glass didn't do the same but the water had the chemical taste of dish cleaning detergent as though it had been improperly rinsed following cleaning.  They also go down a point in my book for serving pepsi products (I prefer coke).  If you're looking for cheap eats, save your money and go elsewhere.  There are too many great cheap restaurants in this city (including other chinese buffets) that it simply isn't worth it to waste your money or your time at this place.In the words of the Dean of Students at UW-Madison, "Don't go".

8.description: Run, don't walk!  I had very low expectations going in, and yet it was still extremely disappointing. Food was cold and disgusting, the service and atmosphere was just as bad. I could go on for hours...just stay away.-UPDATEDI had the runs all day :(

31.description: Went here because I was Starving after going to the Home Depot across the street, and I didn't feel like waiting for a Table or Ordering/Cooking Time. The Food is OK (Good Variety and Acceptable Taste). The Facility is Extremely Dingy. The Bathroom is Gross to the point of Walking Back Out without Using. Staff is Friendly and Quietly Competent. Wouldn't go back, but it is what it is.

34.description: Great seafood selection, I had crawfish, octopus, salmon, two kinds of peel and eat shrimp, bottleneck clams, and california rolls.  Great selection of food, including pork, chicken, and beef dishes.  They have soups, crab rangoon, pot stickers, fruit for dessert, along with cakes and cookies, and soft serve ice cream.  Dinner is $10.96 (plus tax) for adults, includes soft drinks and coffee.

16.description: The food there suck. It is cold and disgusting. Avoid the calamari at all cost because it has a weird smell and taste to it. When I got there, the cashier was on his phone yelling at someone and he was very rude as well. AVOID AT ALL COST. ITS A WASTE OF MONEY EATING THERE!!!

13.description: To start, the owner rang up my family and I at the register.  He was on the phone,  yelling at someone in Chinese.  What he didn't realize is that my brother, who was with us, speaks Chinese.  He was complaining that he didn't want to put out any fresh food because there wasn't enough costumers to justify it.  He was complaining that he didn't have enough customers to make any money that day.  He sounded very upset. In addition to the rude behavior of the owner,  I was not impressed with anything else.  80 percent of the food was not fresh and you could see evidence of this as buildup on the edges of the table pans. The bottles of hot sauce had a build up on them,  disgusting. Overall,  the restaurant was dirty and unimpressive. Never going back.

11.description: $12 for dinner, $8 for lunch, good bargains for various foods including seafoods, meat, vege, snacks etc... Tylical Chinese buffet, great taste for Asians, fresh  and hot foods, noisy environment, it's not perfect, but definitely worth the price if ya like Chinese cuisine.I won't ask for more at this point and it's the only Chinese buffet  that cheap around Skokie, another good one is Ginza Buffet but almost triple price of this one. Btw, it offers big tables for party and one more thing, do not try sushi there unless u are a vegetarian.

39.description: The place got better. They began to use less fat, and the food became tastier that it was before. A lot of selection of meats, and they are good when it comes to salads as well. My only current complaint is that when they opened at 11 am, the food is not ready yet.

37.description: In terms of Chinese buffets, I found this one decent. If people want a Michelin star Chinese buffet, they better learn to cook and do it themselves. No Chinese buffet is "good," only "decent." This one is definitely decent, but shitty nonetheless. And for a $9 lunch, this is definitely worth it (if you're craving crappy Asian food).

0.description: Heard this Bosnian guy Seid G. Put y'all out of business bc you guys made such amazing tasting food.

38.description: I definitely agree that this place is a bit sticky, and I wouldn't be surprised to find a dead bug in my food, but since I haven't yet...  I've been there about 3 times, and though it has never been crowded, I've never been alone.  The food, though buffet quality,  has always been hot and fresh, with a high turnover rate, and a nice selection.  I love the glass noodles and the many different chicken dishes.

51.description: Honestly, i see a lot of people giving it a 1 star review but it's a chinese buffet for under 9 dollars!Don't expect champagne on a beer budget.  I really like the variety of food they offer and the food isn't bad at all.

27.description: THIS IS THE WORST PLACE I HAVE EVER BEEN TOO!!   I HAD NEVER BEEN IN THIS CRAP FILTHY PLACE BEFORE TONIGHT. You could not pay me to go back there, No way, NO WAY.  Tried the Chicken with broccoli, had some kind of perfume type sauce on it, had to spit it out. Then tried the Beef with brocooli, and this had a putrid fowl odor and taste to it. I had to spit it out. Though I'd be safe trying plain green beans, but they had some type of fishy greasy taste and had to spit them out. Then thought at least I could eat some of the cantaloupe, but that was harder than a Jawbreaker.   I had to go to bathroom. It was a war zone in there, toilet paper everywhere, slippery filthy floor, dirty sinks, overflowing garbage everywhere.I kept my receipt in case I get food poisoning or worse than that. I truly don't feel well and my ears have turned into a deep pinkish red color. I pray to God that I will be ok.I PLAN TO CONTACT THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH SOON. I FEEL STRONGLY THAT THEY INSPECT THIS DUMP.

32.description: Worst Chinese buffet I ever had. Some of the foods were cold. The place wasn't clean. The food wasn't that tasty. Don't go to this place if you want good tasty Chinese food.

54.description: Absolutely unappatizing and a waste of money. Unfortunately I did not check the reviews before impulsively saying "Hey, lets try that place for dinner" *makes a quick lane change*. I dunno what was in the food but it tasted and smelled awful, especially that dim sum. I took a bite (didn't even bite through) before smelling an obnoxious odor. Best part was getting our cheap quick serve and leaving. I want my $23 bucks back....

48.description: No thanks lol the food wasnt that good :(

44.description: I have to admit when this first opened It was a great spot but now it seems like they fell off. They are really dirty and the service is bad. So when I give them a 3 stars its a avg of the first time I ate there and now. The food was great  when they first opened now its just the normal Chinese buffet items but with the same high price.

24.description: This place is smelly, dirty, food was cold, and the ice cream is super generic. Absolutely terrible. Do not go here.

7.description: I thought this place was gonna be better than other buffets, but instead it's even worse, the enviroment is not good and also the food is the lowest quality you could possibly find. The tables, food, crew, etc will let you feel that you want to get out of there as soon as you can. There are of course few things you can try because taste good like pot stickers, shrimps, chicken, and glass noodles and that's it.. Not even the sushi is good tasty. I know we can't be too picky with this places but compared with others, this buffet is not a good recommendation.

49.description: I had this review saved as a draft since around Oct of 2011. Though I have eaten there more than 10 times in the past, I decided they will see me no longer here is my reveiw from Oct - "Never coming back! My girlfriend and I have come to this place many times. Sometimes we even bring family but after today's visit we will not return anymore. There was only about three other occupied tables during our visit. The staff took their own break at a table near ours, while we stacked our dishes three high before anyone removed them. The floor was greasy throughout, even in the restroom. Sticky cups, silverware with food particles and film u could scratch off. Dirty plates. The waitress was only nearby after dropping two fortune cookies in a tip tray.

40.description: The jalapeño chicken was juicy and spicy, the sesame green beans nice and crisp.  Vegetarian LoMein was fine.  But one item stood  out- the fried pork chops!  Wow- they alone are worth a return trip!

53.description: One suggestion when coming to HKB, do not come starving! It's OK to be hungry, but not starving!I come here once in a while when I have a crazy craving and I walk around the buffet tables. I scope the food before deciding if I'll be dining here or not. Typically, I'll stay especially since I've already had some misses so I go for the hits whenever possible.The hits: the clams, mussels, the peel yourself shrimp, whatever the fish of the day is, hot and sour soup and glass noodles. I'm typically satisfied with those items when available or I make do with whatever looks OK. I try to take tiny samples of different foods and usually, a small bite will help me decide if it's worth the calories and if it is, I head back up with a fresh plate and refill with the items that are tasty.The misses: most of everything else.It's a China Buffet for crying out loud. My expectations are not very high but I do think it's one of the better buffets in the greater Chicagoland area. It's not cheap for a buffet but if you can find a Chinese restaurant close by that you can get a dish and a drink for under $15 and immediate service, definitely go. Otherwise, just try it out. It could surprise you.

30.description: I went there with my son for lunch . I had to wait for 15 min to get my drinks it wasn't like they were busy my drinks were served with my desserts i had to ask him myself first to bring us some water and then in my sons water there was some sticky disgusting paper . I told the owner what happened she seemed like careless. Not clean , not a good customer service and not good food

46.description: I've been here dozens of times, and will be going back I'm sure. For buffet quality Asian food there's a good selection for the price. I've only found one comparable place in the area, and they're much worse. I always go for lunch, and at the beginning of lunch, so the food is usually fresh and warm when I'm there. They don't get all the food out until 11:30 or later, despite opening at 11am, which has been very annoying at times. If you go when they first open, there may only be a small fraction of the items there. Also, very slow service at the door, and must pay before sitting.

1.description: Some of this food is pretty damn good. - hot and sour soup: some of the best I've had- jalapeño chicken: super flavorful- glass noodles (don't remember the name): yum!- fried meatballs: my husband loved them- egg rolls and rangoonsI'd probably upgrade this place to three stars if I ate a lot of seafood. There were people getting down on calamari, crawfish, mussels, fish galore. Stay away from the Mexican food or other ethnic varieties (duh)!Overall, much of the food was good, although lacking some variety. Much of the food was cold (off and on), but the meal is $12. I've never been to a buffet that cheap since I got off my last cruise ship!Sure, it's a bit dated, but for a quick and cheap bite, it hits the spot. Also, self-serve, all you can drink soda, so no wait staff involved! Although, your orange soda may taste like ginger ale, but at least it's unlimited.

55.description: We have been to many chinese buffets all over the country and must say that this is one of our favorites. The place is huge and the price is very reasonable. They have a huge selection of food, which includes a variety of seafood (crawfish, shrimp, crabs, fish, etc etc). Of course, we didn't go for the sushi because sushi is never ever good in chinese buffet places. If you select your dishes carefully, you could definitely have a great meal here. Recommended!

9.description: By far the absolute dirtiest most disgusting Chinese buffet I have ever been to. I ate rice and watermelon, it was quite literally the only things I trusted. I came in around 8 pm. Two more hours of being open with about 10-12 people inside. Level with the influx of people only the rice and clams were refilled. Everything was cold and sitting for a long while. Even the clams they messed. They brought fresh clam and then dumped the old ones on top. Do not go here.

26.description: I have no idea why anyone should be leaving 1-star review of this place, but I suspect it's because they were trying to eat the pizza or chicken nuggets at this cheap and cheerful Chinese buffet. If you ate the actual Chinese food, you'd find it hot and flavorful, replenished frequently, and generally an excellent value. They usually have a really nice vegetarian mushroom dish and excellent steamed dumplings with pork. Get the steamed (not fried) rice and start with those and some of the seafood, if that's your thing. Many of the ethnic Chinese I see in this place come primarily for the seafood, in fact -- not a bad thing to make a note of as you make your selections.Of course, if you want the hottest, freshest food at a buffet, you don't show up an hour before the restaurant closes. You also don't come in the middle of the afternoon when the restaurant is nearly empty. Also note that this is generally not a place where the server gets and refills your drinks - some servers are more entrepreneurial than others on that count, but you just don't expect it. The cups are set next to the fountain drinks for a reason.I've never sat at a sticky table here. (The floors, sometimes, could do with a but more attention, but they do try to keep on top of it.) The bathrooms could certainly use some work, unfortunately, but overall I don't have any major qualms. If you do have a concern, the owner/manager sits right up front, all day, and he is very friendly.

25.description: First of all, shame on the owner of this restaurant for not sprucing it up a bit.  It is dingy, dusty and faded and in dire need of at least a good cleaning.  The overall presentation and tattered around the edges appearance can easily lead someone to believe the food will be equally mishandled, sloppy and inedible. In other words, Hong Kong Buffet ... Clean up your act!The food is average at best and unappetizing on some level as well.  I have had better and this establishment can place extra effort at securing a more satisfied repeat customer base.I may return but would not fault anyone for staying away.  good luck!

12.description: I totally agree with the review from Annette B. The conversation her brother overhead is consistent with my recent experience. There was a good flow of people coming in though,  but even then you could tell that some of the food wasn't fresh. The "busgirls" were nice and attentive.There is a lot of free parking in the plaza lot. Unfortunately, those are the only POSITIVE things I have to say.Ice cream was "watery"-ice cream without the cream.. blehFood was mediocre looking and tasting.Food temp was only warm for some dishes. Place wasn't clean looking.Seats Are Torn and Dirty. Silverware wasn't clean, I had to keep checking for clean silverware.

59.description: Ok, most of the reviews are unfavorable, but I'll try most any Asian buffet once.  I didn't expect much, and that's pretty much what I got.  Several of the dishes, when they were hot, tasted pretty good to me.  Examples include: sweet and sour pork, beef with broccoli, general tso's chicken, stir fried noodles, and "crab rangoon."  That's the only reason I don't give the restaurant 1 star.  The fried rice tasted "off" and even directly from the kitchen was not very hot.    I pointed out to the manager that many of the dishes were not being kept hot enough to be safe, and he responded by having me served freshly cooked dishes of the ones I had on my plate.  It's beyond me why they don't keep the foot hot enough, but I suspect the problem is that most food goes from the kitchen to a warmer, where it gets too cool.  So, if you go, a couple of tips: go at a meal time rather than in between -- turnover of the food will be greater at that time and therefore it's less likely to have been sitting long enough for the nasty bacteria to multiply; watch for the dishes going direct from the kitchen to the steam table -- they will be piping hot and most likely to taste good too; avoid the dishes that go to the steam table from the warming oven.

21.description: I'm not sure why the average review of this restaurant is not better. I work very close so I am usually here once a week for lunch. The food is always fresh and the vegetables have a lot of flavor. I take the broccoli from the beef dish and the mushrooms and string beans are always delicious. And I'm not even vegetarian. I always walk out of there satisfied and at $7.99 + tax think it's definitely worth it. It's the taste of the food that's the key ingredient at this buffet.

17.description: The place is utterly disgusting and awful. The restaurant is a dump and the food is uneatable. The hot food was luke warm to cold and definitely not being held at 135°F or hotter as required by law. I will be notifying the Department of Health regarding that.

10.description: I've eaten lunch here about a hundred times going back as far as I can remember. It's the best value in the area (the Old Country Buffet is in the same complex and is more expensive, and OCB dosen't include drinks). They have a good selection of a good variety of food items and their lettuce wrapped sushi is great.

5.description: If you want to get food poisoning then come here, I came here last Tuesday.  My first thought when I walked in was that it was very very dirty and the booths were all broken and the seats were ripped. The food was cold and not good. I want to call the health department on them because it's soo bad.  I got food poisoning from here. DO NOT GO.. IT'S  VERY BAD FOOD!! The service sucked so I didn't even tip. I will never go back.. never I promise you.

3.description: FYI...whenever you walk into a restaurant and there is a gift shop at the entrance, turn around and walk out.  Only reason why they would have it is to try to make more money because their food is not worth it. Everything is just sticky.  Sticky forks, sticky tables, sticky cups, stick floors.  The food quality is so generic that the Panda express across the street has better and more fresh food choices.  Plates are very small, so you will need to make multiple trips across the sticky floor to get more of the food.   Avoid the booths because they're sticky as well. If you do HAVE to go, bring your own warming plates to warm up the food, your own forks, spoons, cups, knives, and whatever else you need.

35.description: Tried all the chicken dishes...all were rubbery. Fried rice was tolerable. Soup was good. There was no single dish that I liked, although my teenage son liked all of them!This is one of those restaurants that are for people who have, shall we say,an "acquired-taste". The lunchtime crowd was about 15 strong and they all seemed like regulars who have developed a taste for this kind of food. Sorry, not me!

19.description: First of all, shame on the owner of this restaurant for not sprucing it up a bit.  It is dingy, dusty and faded and in dire need of at least a good cleaning.  The overall presentation and tattered around the edges appearance can easily lead someone to believe the food will be equally mishandled, sloppy and inedible. In other words, Hong Kong Buffet ... Clean up your act!The food is average at best and unappetizing on some level as well.  I have had better and this establishment can place extra effort at securing a more satisfied repeat customer base.I may return but would not fault anyone for staying away.  good luck!

28.description: wow.. just wow.. food here was horrible! i came here after shopping around the area because we dont know what we want to eat.. so we picked a buffet because it has varieties..when we went.. the food was cold or luke warm... some of the food was really hard that it was almost impossible to eat...  you can tell some of the food there has been there for quite a while..i will not return back here.. never in my life i ate so little in a buffet...sigh

45.description: How they are keeping the lights on is beyond me. They have hundreds of tables yet, there are only a few occupied. The food was just the average china buffet food. However, most carry at least one high end item like crab legs for example. This place had no high end items on the buffet. Most of the seafood was spicey, a trend I am seeing across all china buffets. I am not sure if its to appeaze to their spanish customers or to keep others from eating to much by loading it with spice. I wish them luck in the future but I believe the end is near.

33.description: First time, not wonderful but I will return. Clean place, stocked buffet ..

43.description: I'm going to go ahead and join the ranks of the one star givers.  Cold, old looking food, stinky seafood, some old chinese lady harassing a young boy in very broken english about his eyelashes being too long to serve himself at the buffet.  We came for dinner on a Sunday.  The food should be freshly prepared as it was very busy.  They had green beans, so they have achieved one star.

2.description: There are only a few times in life where I've regretted the choices I've made, this is one of those times. This Chinese buffet has absolutely the worse Chinese buffet I've been too. And being quarter Chinese, I love Chinese food. The food was semi warm at best, the sushi has been sitting out there more than a few hours. The only thing hot was the cold fruit. Some of the food was over salted. The rest of the food was a combination of too much salt and oil. It took me a few minutes to figure out were the forks and spoons where located. This place was an absolute mess. The guy at front counter tried to sell me some of the toys they had sitting out on display. I noticed him stairing down my sister who is 17. Like if she were about to steal one of their knock off toys. He did the same to me when I went to closely inspect a knock off Steve McQueen toy. I found the starting to be a bit rude. Although the other staff members seemed to very helpful and nice. The building on the outside was a mess, beer bottles and trash everywhere. The inside was a little better, but you exchange the beer bottles and trash for a greasy atmosphere. When walking around the buffet area, I found the floors to be sticky. Some of the serving spoons were extremely greasy. A lot of the food looked like it had been sitting for more than half the day. The drinks were nasty. It tasted like they havnt cleaned the soda lines in a while. The table we sat at was the same story, greasy tops. Chairs where ok. When I decided to sit at a booth after the dislike of the table being greasy. I knew I made a mistake and went back to the table. The booth had a greasy table, the booth chairs were not secured. I literally took the chair with me when I tried to slide out. There were also a lack of napkins in the dispenser. Overall this place has super salty and oily food, the service needs work and the out side and inside appearance needs a lot of cleanning up. Although the price is cheap,I would try to avoid this place. Spend a few more dollars to go to a better buffet. This place just isnt worth the money or the time you will spend sitting on the toilet.

18.description: first of all yelp should offer  an  option for zero stars as one star is too generous for this place. Lousy food election,poor food quality and dirty. worker was eating food as he was checking the trays in the buffet area.

41.description: My favorite buffet in Chicago. The food is always hot and stocked. ... many items to select from. The Green Beans are killer. Double kudos.

52.description: Those people here who gave this restaurant a good review must be a relative of the owner. It was a mistake to even give it a try..  i knew we shouldnt really have tried it the moment we got inside and saw how filthy the whole thing is: the place, the food.. you name it. food were old and cold, the bathroom is terrifying. it's like a germ reservoir. i don't know man... this place should close for good. I mean it! it's a warning to everyone... DON'T EVEN GIVE IT A TRY! total waste of time, money and effort! you might even get sick!

50.description: I will never, ever, go back to this establishment again. I cannot believe they are still in business. I had to calm down a bit before I could even write this review. I went on Friday evening with guests from out of town hoping to enjoy a good mix of Chinese cuisine. This place was so disappointing! I should have known it would be bad, when I realized we were the only people there to eat! The food was cold and crusty, the servings were not replaced once they were gone, and there was absolutely no service! None! No one came to clear a plate, ask how we were doing, or check on us at all. After looking at the food, I immediately wanted to leave, but my guests wanted to stay because they were so hungry and we'd already paid. I was willing to lose my $40 though then to have to eat but I listened and stayed. Big mistake! The furniture is loose and the booth seats fall when you sit on them, the tables are rickety and constantly move when you shift your weight. The food selection was the absolute worst though. All of the food there had to have been sitting there since they'd opened. Cold shrimp dishes, white rice that had congealed together, nothing was steaming hot, and everything had a weird after taste to it. Im so surprised none of us got sick! It was that bad. Please save your money and appetite and dine elsewhere! You've been warned!

4.description: If I could give a zero star rating I would. Completely unsure why this restaurant is so crowded as the lack of quality food it serves is terrifying!!! My family was unable to find one item at this buffet that we liked. We left this place hungry and feeling completely disgusted. Never again.

6.description: This place is really disgusting they seriously don't know what cleaning is I was craving Chinese and just looking at this place I was like NOPE! & Turned back around

22.description: Food was cold.. But some food was ok ..actually I like it better then old country buffet .. But they still need to improve on their service.

15.description: Despite the current 2 star status Hong Kong has, my pregnant self was really needing some Chinese. But not just any Chinese, I needed a buffet. I went at 1:30 on a weekday and the crowd was pretty thin. Oh well, less lines!as for the food, some was a little Luke warm, but overall it was the same as any Chinese buffet.  The lady manning the food replaced quite a few dishes while I was there.  The main reason I came was for sweet and sour chicken, which they did not have. Bummer! Overall, the meal was average but what I expected.

57.description: As a Chinese, I had more than 5 similar Chinese buffet restaurant around Chicago. And I believe this is the best I've had. I really believe it didn't deserve the rate right now. The buffet I had before even has 3 stars average, but this is just 2.5. Yelp reviewers must be kidding me.I went for it for lunch with my girlfriend at Saturday noon when we planned to shop at Lincolnwood town center.  The price is 22 for two, the weekday lunch is 7.5 for one, since it's weekend and I believe there were more food provided.There are so many kinds of seafood you could choose, including lobster, clam and crab. Maybe I just luck. Others are not bad. There are some very innovative and delicious dishes I had never tried before. Yes, it's not perfect. But consider the price and the food you enjoy. Nobody should complain much about it.

20.description: All buffet restaurants are expected to be dirty. Well, so what? Gotta love the food at Hong Kong Buffet. Been going there since I was a child.

36.description: Cold food.Poor selection.Bad quality. Bad taste.I live Chinese buffets. This place is simply not good.

14.description: This is my favorite Chinese buffet. The food is great and the staff is friendly.  We'll be coming here often.

58.description: This restaurant has been on my regular list of rotations.  I've always enjoyed it but I have to say that I probably won't be returning unless I have a Groupon (although they do have a lot of 'em) or it's convenient for whereever else we may be going - not that it was particularly bad, but they have other restaurants that are owned by other family members (Nonno Sylvia and Pasta D'Arte) that I think are a little better. I had their Braciole which is on top orecchiette pasta.  It was a little dry compared to Pasta D'Arte, who features the same exact dish.  The other diners all had a stuffed chicken that they did say they enjoyed a lot.  Atmosphere seems more geared for an older crowd.. The staff is attentive, but not overly enthusiastic.

56.description: It's a "Mom and Pop" type of restaurant and although the owners and workers and attentive and helpful, the food was overall lackluster for the price. My chicken was a bit dry and lacked flavor. I had to bury it with sauce and mushrooms to make it taste decent. My husband's rigatone was average, but the Italian sausage made it taste MUCH better. The complimentary bruschetta was a nice touch as well. Since I had a coupon, I didn't feel I overpaid, but without the coupon, I would go elsewhere for Italian food.Food: 2/5Service: 4/5Ambiance: 3/5

29.description: fantastic experience, good old italian food and service. Recommend it highly

42.description: This place was a pleasant surprise. The food is delicious and authentic and the restaurant has a great warm vibe to it. Great for special occasions, they often have live opera singers entertaining their guests. I highly suggest this to anyone.

23.description: Pregnancy Cravings called for Italian. So Italian, baby gets. My fiance found this great deal for a Restaurant.com gift cards. Via Veneto has been in that neighborhood for a while and I have been meaning to try this place forever. We arrived and found street parking immediately. There were people dining al fresco. We were greeted right in the door and were sat at a booth. We were happy to see that they had a private room for special events. they also had the restaurant sectioned off as well with booths-a-plenty. Right away were were brought bread with the cutest little olive oil/ balsamic dispenser (see pictures) and a cup of parmesan as we perused the menu. Lots of choices. I settled on the stuffed pasta (much like a ravioli in a tomato cream sauce) and my better half had the chicken parmesan. What a well cooked meal. You can really tell when someone uses fine ingredients and makes things fresh.  The pasta was perfectly al dente and the chicken was still very juicy. The service was exceptional and the pricing was really reasonable. Via Veneto is good for dates, family, groups, or even solo. The location is very easy to get to with plentiful parking and Valet service on the weekend.

47.description: I planned a lovely night out with six of my best friends at Via Veneto on the advice of a friend.  worst experience ever.  The food was horrible.  the replacement dishes were raw and disgusting.  The server was sweet....but has stupid cooks backing him.  worst food ever.  WILL NEVER GO BACK.  NNNNNEEEVVVVEEERRRR.  So embarassed that I brought my loved ones to this horrible place.

8.description: I come here for lunch about twice a week. I love this place! The servers and owner are super friendly and the food is delicious. I recommend the pistachio ravioli (with amaretto - unlike anything I've ever tasted - I absolutely love it!!) and pumpkin lasagna (mmm!!) with house salad. Mmmmmm!!! Really - come and eat here :-) :-)

31.description: I don't understand all of the mediocre reviews. Had a celebration retirement luncheon with 10 others at Via Veneto. The service was excellent and everyone enjoyed their food. I had the pork Marsala which was tender and delicious. It came with soup or salad. I had the spinach egg soup and I ate every drop. They have some really nice small party rooms for any occasion. Don't listen to these naysayers and give VV a try.

34.description: The food is all pre made from a food service and just warmed up. The service is ok but doesn't make up for the overpriced food.

16.description: Its a record cold day here in Chicago so figured would support and try out one of the restaurants by the house. Went to eat with a good friend and old business partner. We got there a little bit late, since they close earlier on the weekdays. They were very friendly and sat us at our choice of table since there was just another table there.We ordered right away dice we had little time. They sent us out some filling bread, especially that we were starving. We ordered calamari, which tasted nice, fresh and crisp.My buddy ordered lasagna and I had the ravioli di zucca (stuffed with pumpkin and goat cheese). Was absolutely great. Had a sweet taste in the middle, obviously was the gourd and complemented great with the cheese.Food was great, staff friendly. Definitely will be here again, especially when it's not as cold...but support your small/family businesses during the Winter!

13.description: The male host/server was rude to me when inquiring about the specials on the menu, as if I should not inquire about the preparation and accoutrements offered in conjunction with the entree. He was completely unfamiliar with the menu, did not know anything about his coffee /espresso bar and felt it was appropriate to be condescending to me vs give me a clear concise description of what exactly it is they are selling. The $36 Chilean Sea Bass entrees was terribly prepared with a boiled appearance, it was not properly filleted as I ingested nearly a dozen large rib cage bones and gave me an upset stomach for almost 2 days. When notifying the waiter he did not care that the bones were present or that I was dissatisfied with the meal. I know this business will be rotating out the door quite soon if they do not make some major changes as of last month to their staff and training to managerial staff. I would never even recommend this location to my worse of enemies. What a waste of time and money. Glad sites like Yelp do exist to ensure the public is aware of what a terrible restaurant this is.

11.description: Very disappointed in Via Venento's meals tonite.  My husband ordered entrees as takeout When we got our pumpkin ravioli and the meal ravioli, it looked great until we tasted it. The red sauces were so acidic we couldn't even eat our dinner.   I was so hungry and we wound up throwing out the entire dinners.  Mind you, the entire dinner.       The Minestrone soup was good, however.  I took it upon myself to call and tell them just how awful the pasta sauce was and that it was inedible.  The owner told me to let him know the next time and he would give us something off the next meal.   I wasn't looking for something off the next meal because we will never order from them again.   Query:  don't they taste their pasta sauce?????

39.description: Me and my fiancé tried this place for lunch. The caprese wasn't very good, flavorless. But I was very happy with our main courses. I had the chicken scaloppine n it was delish. My fiancé had the tuna. It was pretty rare, but the sauce was very good. Guess you would need to tell them if you want it more done. Green beans that came with it weren't too crunchy, which I like. I would def try it for dinner sometime!

37.description: I went with my parents and we all got our eat on.  We started with a big salad to share and then  moved on to the balsamic octopus (Polpo Alla Griglia)-. This is a substantial portion of tender loveliness that literally falls apart in your mouth for 14.95. My mom and I ordered our own because neither of us wanted to share! For the money, I have never had more octopus on a plate anywhere.  The house Chianti is a fruity, rich party for your palate.  I adore gnocchi and  I ordered their pillows of potato love with a Bolognese sauce. I know I shouldn't ask for  a substitution (it is usually served with a plum tomato sauce), but I swoon over a complex and meaty Bolognese and  the waitresses never batted an eye when I asked for it. My father ordered the veal--tender, buttery bliss. Love me some capers. No italian meal is over until I have eaten the cannoli and Via Veneto's version of this classic dessert is perfectly accented with the teensiest bit of lemon in the filling and laced with chocolate sauce. I loved that  the servers had a sense of humor and pride in their establishment's food and that is what you will get here. You have essentially entered someone's house here--if you have an Italian grandmother or aunt you get the semi-pushy attitude of the servers. They know what is good and were not afraid to make the suggestions that enhanced our meal. Our waitress dropped a twenty dollars of the next visit card on us with the bill. I was already planning my next visit. . .Italian perfection. Period.  I loved the crowd early last Friday evening: pure moonstruck type oldsters.  Three quarters of the way into our meal four opera singers accompanied by a classic pianist performed a mini-opera for the crowd. It was over the top for sure, but  I love that kind of thing with a read wine buzz.  You are not going to be bothered by anyone you know here if you are under forty. Go here when you need a cozy, quiet, yet bustling place to tuck into a comfortable and  traditional italian feast.

0.description: We are ate at Via Veneto exactly 1 year ago to the day.  The first time we not very impressed with the food and wrote so on my review.  Tony the owner/chef contacted me in regards to my review and invited us back to give the restaurant another chance.  He was very genuine and persistent in his invitations to come back again.  To be honest I guess I wasn't sure what to expect because the reviews were all over the spectrum from good to bad.  Well we finally went back last night.  I realize that everyone has there own level of what is good and what isn't call it personal preference.  When we went in Tony wasn't there, Doreen the hostess was she seated us.  After we were seated we asked her for recommendations since the last time we didn't do such a good job on the selection process.  She suggested a few items off the menu. Our waiter Rani came and asked if we wanted anything to drink.  He then proceeded to bring out some warm bread.  We ate the bread dipped in olive oil, vinaigrette and Parmesan cheese it was very tasty just like last time.  Then we started with and appetizer Zucchini Ripiena.   This is Acorn Squash stuffed w/grilled vegetables & goat cheese.  This was also very good.  On Doreen's recommendation we ordered 2 of the items.  I ordered Vitello Al Barolo - Veal W/Shiitake & Portobello mushrooms in Barolo wine, tomatoes and touch of cream over pasta and my wife ordered the Fagottini Di Riccotta E. Pere - Stuffed purses of ricotta cheese, pears & smoked chicken I creamy broth sauce both of our entrees were much better then the items we selected 1 year ago.  After dinner we asked for a cup of coffee.  Rani brought us a complimentary piece of tiramisu which was delicious.  Rani did an exemplary job (thanks Rani)I'm not sure why, but the food this time around was light years better then the first time.  Thanks Tony, Doreen and Rani (and the busboy whose name I didn't get (sorry))

38.description: The eggplant appetizer was good. The service was excellent. I ordered the smoked chicken rigatoni and it was loaded with liquid smoke, and was terrible...Also the table next to us received free  brushetta along with other tables.I thought that was a little tacky either none or all. First and last trip.

51.description: Very nice Italian restaurant and I will visit it again soon. The owner's food suggestion was very good. The atmosphere was really nice too. The food was delicious and they served a lot. I liked everything about this place and recommend everybody to check out.

27.description: You can toss all those negative yelps out the window. There is no way this place deserves less than 4 stars.Arrived early for reservation. Immediately offered a drink in an adorable lounge/waiting area. Very nice touch.Beautiful decor. Delicious bread, olive oil, and parm brought in abundance. I ordered the angel hair, which was pretty perfect. He ordered the Tagliaettele ala Cabanara, which was delicious. Dessert were amazing.I don't know what else one could want from an Italian restaurant. I think the clientele in this area tend to be a little high maintenance and complainy, which does this gem an inservice on yelp, but it was adorable, efficient, tasty, warm, and affordable. What else could you want.

32.description: Awesome!!!!! Have the smoked chicken & the vanilla custard for dessert. The custard is what dreams are made of.......it's called panna cotta (sorry if I misspelled) Jan 2014 Edit-The menu has changed slightly but if you like the pollo afumaccato, they will make it for you :)

54.description: Solid Italian restaurant all around. Reasonable pricing and the portions are generous.  The seafood is always fresh. If you are lucky when they have pasta with baby lobster... Get it. You wont' regret it. They are real baby lobster and very delicious. Their fresh gnocchi and homemade sauces are great.

48.description: I went to Via Veneto for my Valentine's Day Dinner.Having read a lot of reviews, I've anticipated a lot. When I walked in to the restaurant, the tables were all crammed in one space. I felt like there was no privacy or intimacy at all. Not only the atmosphere wasn't romantic but also the interior and other designs were poorly done. Although the service was great, the food was bad. For appetizer, we got Cozze Da Brivido (mussels), I got angelhair pasta and my boyfriend got Petto Di Pollo Vesuvio. The sauce for three of the dishes were very dull and at this point, we didn't have any expectations for the dessert and just left.

44.description: I don't know where to start.When my friend and I walked in, we said that we had a reservation. The lady told us it didn't matter, took us to our table, and threw menus at us.  Most of the staff is as surly and discontent with their job as she was.  We ordered, and the food was delicious and plated beautifully.  The caprese salad was delicious, and the tiramisu was out of this world. Two stars for food and presentation.  We told our server that we had a Groupon before she brought us the check, but she forgot and it was like the end of the world to trouble her to re-do the check with the Groupon.

24.description: This review is only for a wedding reception I went to here so I can't comment on the full menu or the price. However, they did a great job with a 150 person wedding. It was buffet style but the food quality was very good. They handled the alcohol situation very well with a wine and beer bar inside and then a full cash bar outside for liquor. U understand they work different scenarios depending on your price range. The dance area was a perfect size and the staff handled everything perfectly. I know that the price is very reasonable compared to other wedding reception sites. Plus plenty of parking. A good choice for any large event!

7.description: We've been coming here for over 10 years, and the great food, service, and fantastic cocktails keep us coming back, year after year.

49.description: Every time I eat here I feel like I'm on the show "Kitchen Nightmares". I feel for the place because it's an Italian family owned restaurant, but I've had really bad experiences here. The only time the experience was pleasant was the 2nd time when the male owner served our table. Food:The food here is terrible. For an Italian restaurant, they don't know how to cook pasta or decent Italian food. FAIL! I had the stuffed gnocchi, don't order it! It tasted bad where I didn't even want to eat my left overs. The second time I tried the Ahi Tuna which was surprisingly really good. The third time I had the Ahi Tuna again, but it was overcooked, did not taste good, the outside was pan burnt, and the green beans tasted like they were frozen vegetables. My what is suppose to be raw tuna, came out as medium cooked tuna. FAIL. Other guests at my table also complained the pasta was disgusting and undercooked. Another person found "stones" in the seafood pasta. The chef also drenches food in olive oil or butter sauces. They definitely need a new chef or better training. The food is WAY OVERPRICED for horribly poor quality food. Service:The older lady server is not friendly. She has this "I'm better than you and don't want to serve you" smug attitude. You can tell at times she tries to be nice, but the forced fakeness is extremely obvious. We all got a really bad and negative vibe from her. The male owner on the other hand was very nice and outgoing when he served our table. Cleanliness:FULL BOTTOM LIP LIPSTICK ON GLASSWARE. Enough said!! Negligence to clean and check glassware before placement is a major FAIL. On top of that, the menus are all dirty with crumbs all over them. For a place that is often empty or not very busy, they sure do neglect simple cleaning duties. This causes a red flag for me about the cleanliness behind kitchen doors. The banquet hall looks nice. Unfortunately the accumulation of all the other negatives is not enough to make me suggest this place. The dirty glasses and overpriced disgusting dishes is the last straw for me. I gave an extra star ONLY because the male owner was so nice.

40.description: This restaurant is awesome. Very Friendly staff, affordable and they take the coupons from restaurant.com.  I'm a very picky eater and I can say the food was amazing. I would recommend anyone who wants real Italian food to go there.

53.description: Old Skool!Yes Thank You!Stop wanting everything to be hip, trendy, and how you expect it should be...This place is wonderful, charming, and most importantly, the food and service is just simply delightful!Thank You!You are on my list now, watch out because we are coming back!

30.description: We really want to like this place.  Family owned, dark walls, old school booths, good service, and a pretty good dirty martini start off the experience right, but when it comes right down to it, the food just isn't good enough to come back for.Panzanella: No love!  It looked like the bread was croutons from a bag!Cauliflower salad on special: No flavor, and missing brussels sprouts-- I hate it when a dish does not come out as advertised.Desserts: Come out nearly frozen.  Clearly these dessert might have been good if they were kept at the right temperature, but instead they are too cold, and dressed with what looks like store bought caramel and chocolate sauces.One exception: The simplicity and freshness of the angel hair pasta dish (simple marinara and mozzarella) made this dish a standout.  I really wish I could say the same about the rest of the menu.

46.description: I'm in love with their desserts.  My cousins and I shared the salted caramel vanilla crisp cake, the tiramisu, and the vanilla custard.  As soon as I got a taste,  I wanted to make my cousins disappear and take all the desserts for myself!!The entrees weren't bad but they didn't leave the same kind of impression as the desserts.  I had the Lasagna Di Carna.  It was alright.  The taste of the meat sauce was a little off. I think this dish would have tasted better meatless.Anyway, the place definitely has that old school Italian charm.  The owner ( I assume) was at the entrance to greet us and say goodbye when we left.  Our waitress was such a delight!  I'd definitely go back for the dessert.

1.description: This was by far the most horrendous meal imaginable. I took my family here and have never regretted a decision more. Everyone's food not only smelled gross, but tasted abysmal as well. At first I thought it was a joke when my brother told me the food was worse than dog food, but after trying it I agreed wholeheartedly. Never am I rude or would I make such a mean post, but this was absolutely the worst experience of my life. To sum it all up, I wouldn't serve this food to my dogs. STAY AWAY.

55.description: Had my bridal shower here and had a pretty good time. The set up was nice because they worked with our party to make a private event. It was before their dinner service and so they were able to attend to our party and the other one in another banquet room.The family style options were more than adequate to serve our large group. My favorite was a mix of their penne pasta and their Italian sausage and peppers. They even let us bring in a dessert and offered to put ice cream on it since it was part of our package.Worth checking out again, possibly before a race when I need a good carbo load.

9.description: Tony and Antonella are wonderful! The food here is outstanding!! I had their special surf and turf which was out of this world. The cannoli's were delicious! Will come again and again.

26.description: I don't know where to begin! The food is absolutely FABULOUS, with each visit I fall in love with a new favorite! The service is always superb, & we dine there several times a month. It's really the ONLY Italian restaurant for us - a great experience at a very reasonable price. Try the Stuffed Acorn Squash, and 2 of my faves: Stuffed Eggplant & Chicken Marsala.

25.description: Was referred here by a friend and was told to try their chicken and it was AMAZING! The staff was very friendly and the service was great! Definitely will be coming back!

12.description: I am a freelance food critic from Los Angeles, and my husband and I were enjoying the culinary gifts Chicago and cities in Illinois have to offer.  After visiting friends in Lake Forest, we drove through the area and happened upon the restaurant.  First off, the woman who greeted us was not friendly.  Second, we were traveling with our baby and we were seated at a booth with a television above us.  The server asked us if we would mind the television being turned on because someone wanted to watch the game.  Being hard of hearing, my husband was visibly upset, and a bit annoyed when the tv drowned out our voices.  We moved, and the service was a bit hostile after that, even though I kindly tried to explain we could not hear with the television going.The food leaves much to be desired.  Tastes were that it may have been frozen, canned and/or jarred and is overpriced.

59.description: The reviews here are right in line with reality. The food here is good, but not amazing, especially for the price. We have only visited once, but the ambiance left something to be desired. The restaurant was nearly empty, but a large party was seated directly next to us nonetheless, which made the atmosphere loud. I can only assume it gets very busy here on other occasions but in this case a reservation hardly seemed necessary (5pm on a Friday).Overall the staff was attentive if not enthusiastic. We were pleased with the service and the meal was average, but the price somewhat overblown. Will choose another place next time.

21.description: I have visited a few times, and tried a few things on the menu. I've never been disappointed.
