Especially St. Patrick's Day weekend. Overall, their food is delicious, their auditorium and library are amazing! This is a MUST go even if you aren't Irish, cause I'm not!

25.description: I haven't been here in years, and remembered thinking that this place was a boatload of fun the first time I was there for a Celtic celebration of some kind. The old school building has been converted to multi-use and includes a pretty amazing Irish pub on the first floor which every time I have visited has a spirited band playing Irish patriotic songs and some American rock and roll classics. This place is family friendly so if you want a place where you can bring the kids, have a beer, and listen to some Irish music this is the place. We saw people with kids everywhere. The children were enjoying the scene and while people were drinking and having a great time, the kids were too. My friend said it reminded him of an American transplant of the village pub idea in Ireland. Everyone is welcome, and you can have fun, but also be careful about dropping the F-bomb since there are some 4 year old kids dancing in front. The space is used for rental (weddings, parties, other Ethnic group celebrations) so we saw ballroom dancing in the ballroom, some Bulgarian folk dancing group in another room, and an African-American celebration in another. It was cool to see the "Irish" offering space to other people and groups. Very cool. While the beers on tap were typical Irish beers and cider, there were a lot of people drinking Miller and Miller light. So, no need to be fancy. Beers were $5 for imports. The band was lots of fun. They even tossed in a BoDeans song!

12.description: I come here at least twice a year... 1. St. Patty's Day party... It's full of families, drunks, and drunk families. You can pretty much do anything and NOT get kicked out (except fight, that'll get ya kicked out for sure). Can you fall over a table and spill everyone else's beer at said table and not get kicked out? Yes, you can do that as my brother learned first hand. 2. The huge Irish Fest in July. This is fantastic! Irish boys, Irish music, Irish pours on the booze... Yeah, you'll find that all here. p.s., do yourself a favor, come here when the Mickey Finn's play, they are AWESOME!

21.description: What's better than drinking Guiness at a bar? Drinking it at an authentic Irish bar. The Irish American Heritage Center (IAHC) has a bar!!!I've never been to Ireland. But I imagine that a bar in Ireland would be just like this. I believe the folks in charge of IAHC went out of their way to make it as authentic as possible. They did a good job stacking the bar with a variety of alcoholic beverages. You'll also find a pretty cute gift shop. Anything green and Irish, you'll find here.It's been a long time I've had this much fun. If you're looking for something to do over the weekend, then definitely consider IAHC. It's not a night club - but it's still a ton of fun for those of you who like to find good company, get a good groove, and enjoy good drinks.

17.description: What's better than drinking Guiness at a bar? Drinking it at an authentic Irish bar. The Irish American Heritage Center (IAHC) has a bar!!!I've never been to Ireland. But I imagine that a bar in Ireland would be just like this. I believe the folks in charge of IAHC went out of their way to make it as authentic as possible. They did a good job stacking the bar with a variety of alcoholic beverages. You'll also find a pretty cute gift shop. Anything green and Irish, you'll find here.It's been a long time I've had this much fun. If you're looking for something to do over the weekend, then definitely consider IAHC. It's not a night club - but it's still a ton of fun for those of you who like to find good company, get a good groove, and enjoy good drinks.

10.description: We love this place. Family friendly, prices are great and staff helpful. We will be using them for many of our events.

5.description: IRISH FEST 2014Let's see I walked in and immediately had lucky charms put the arm on me for $40 admission for my wife and I. That $40 admission gave me the ability to sweat my balls off and see some mentally challenged adults perform "Grease" and a woman  doing a Q&A about Irish dogs.  The extra $3 for the kids are allowed my child to play with a human dressed up as a dog and was corporately sponsered.  Aside from the grounds and facility being very beautiful and clean Irish Fest 2014 was not magially delicious.  There was nothing to do but buy merchandise,  beer or food.  I remember in years past irish Fest was always a good time,  well Jesus Mary and Joseph what happened it was horrible.

3.description: The IAHC was such a great find!  In a city that you think would have tons of options for events, there aren't a ton of affordable options on the north side and this is exactly that.  It's a lovely space and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating to us.  It's not very well known and so even on short notice (less than 2 mo.) we were able to find an open time.  We held our daughter's adoption party here and it was perfect.  Lots of parking, a private space, easy with kids, and clean.

35.description: Christmas Bazarr and Santa!!! :)I have to say, that this is one of my favorite places to go. The Christmas Bazarr was great, HOWEVER the Santa was skinny and did not make an attempt to be friendly. The kids seemed reluctant to go near him, and he didn't help things by being silent. I would not go back to see this Santa, but do recommend this place for all other events

19.description: The Fifth Province Room is a unique and wonderful venue, very reasonably priced, and Natalie was so great to work with.  The pub room worked great to give me the casual club atmosphere i wanted so everyone could dance.  Having the foyer and attached large ballroom gave my guests a place to sit and chat if they wanted a break from the band.  It also allowed plenty of room for the buffet set up and tables for people to come and go to eat. The free parking also was a plus. The facility is very clean, but the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the upholstered benches in the pub could have used a cleaning. i would definitely book there again.

28.description: My daughter takes Irish Stepdancing here through Trinity Irish Dance. It's a lovely building and you can research your Irish heritage here, and there is a small Irish restaurant pub that looks promising. Office staff really helpful and tours are offered too! WOuld be an awesome venue for a party or wedding.

45.description: Even though we had a bit of trouble navigating around here due to the expressway, it was worth it.Saw a play here last night - "Dancing at Lughnasa"., performed by the Seanachai Theater Company (reviewed separately).  As an aside, this is a great play about 5 Irishwomen set in the fictional town of Ballybeg in 1936, and definitely worth seeing if you're into Irish history or just want to experience some really fine live theater.The building itself is cool, old, big, and full of history. Tons of stuff going on and plenty to do and see.A truly unique venue to see a play, take a class, or attend an event.Alas, the bar was closed on my visit, but I'll be sure and check it out on my next visit.

33.description: What a gem this place is!I had the opportunity to host a Drivers Survival Seminar here just last night, and I was really blown away by how cool this place was.  A converted school, the center is now home to a tons of community events, irish dance classes, a library, a really cool bar that had live music playing, and a slew of random people just hanging out and enjoying themselves.  Hanging out here for the night made me feel like I was back in high school, except without all the really attractive dressed up chicks.  The nature of place was extremely outgoing and fun and I really don't have another comparison for it in the City of Chicago.  Maybe I'm just weird, but I would love to come back here again and just hang out for the night.  Maybe read a book, check out one of the events or just have a drink.  I would highly suggest checking out this place if you are looking for something different to do in the city.All around good times.

43.description: Love, love, love this place. Great service and servers. True Irishmen and women are always in attendance. Great live music on the weekends. The Irish Fest is great every year! There are beautiful banquet rooms to rent upstairs. The Fifth Province Bar is Beautiful. Overall this is a great place to sit down and have a pint and listen to traditional Irish Music.

2.description: This place is awesome!! The staff are great to work with and are eager to please. I have planned a few weddings there in the short time that they have opened as a venue and they truly strive for perfection. As everyone knows - s%#& happens sometimes and especially things that are not in our control (like when volunteer workman forget to leave the keys to a crane.) I am sure they compensated the bride for that.They really do aim to please and are very accommodating. Yes the elevator does pose a small wait to get up there - but it is well worth it. The ballroom is awesome and large enough for up to 300 and can definitely be a wow factor for any event. This event space is in the city - right off the expressway and has two large FREE parking lots! The building is a functioning center with many things going on but is totally transformable for any kind of event. I love this space!!

18.description: I held a gathering for the friends of my parents in the McGinty room following the burial of my father. Planning this event was my first experience with the IAHC as I live out of state. Following the first couple misfires with attempting to establish phone contact, we communicated via e-mail and things went beautifully!My primary point of contact was Natalie. She was delightful to work with: efficient, friendly, attentive to details and very accommodating with the last-minute changes I dropped on her. Thank you, Natalie!!The preferred vendor list on the website guided me to all I needed to pull the food, flowers and aesthetic touches together. We opted for a cash bar and our assigned bartender also did a great job. Nobody was left thirsty ;-)Planning a memorial gathering is not an [inherently] pleasant, festive event.  I am glad my mother chose the Irish Heritage Center as the venue. It proved to be the ideal gathering place. After our event in the McGinty room was complete, some of the guests headed down to the Fifth Provence for a 'parting glass'. After all, we were celebrating an Irishman.  "Goodnight and joy be with you all"

41.description: This was quite the interesting place.  It appears to be an old school converted into a recreational/community center including a bar!  Completely unexpected, but pleasantly welcomed.  I was here for the Yelp Summerfest and had a good time.  There was plenty of room to move around.  I didn't venture up to the other floors, but I was definitely intrigued enough to want to check it out again on another occassion.  I believe they rent their space for private parties... another thing I'll be checking out.  The staff was very nice... bonus!

52.description: This hidden gem on the northside is a terrific place to get back to your roots or get some culturing! The interior is quite spacious and the bar on the first floor is incredibly cozy with warm wooden decor and an inviting fireplace to sip one of their Irish draft selections next to. During the summer they host a great, intimate festival on the grounds open to the public. The calendar on the website features all of their current events from Irish Dancers' performances to dinners (some activities are members only).

50.description: Are you 1/16 Irish? You can research your ancestors here at the Heritage center to reconfirm the best part of your lineage. Or maybe you want to learn Gaelic. This is your place. I have been going here years. I have attended the following events:-COUNTLESS St. Patrick's Day's-Dozens of christenings and baby/bridal showers-Watching my many cousin/neices step danceThey have several private rooms. And the bar, The Fifth Province is the best Guinness pour outside Ireland.

4.description: Irish American Heritage Fest: Review based solely on the prices... Paid $15 just to walk in?  Then each beer was $6-$7?  Seriously ridiculous shit/ I was wondering why nobody was really there..good bands but that's just too much dough unless you have The Black Keys onstage and topless bartenders!! Get dat did

6.description: So my previous experiences with Irish-Fest were limited to either St. Patrick's Day at any random bar in the Chicago area, or a certain festival on the south side over Memorial Day weekend, where it was nothing more than a bunch of drunken yahoo's acting like a bunch of drunken yahoos.  When my girlfriend insisted that this place was different, and was a truly great Irish Fest, I was skeptical.  Fortunately I was proven wrong.  This place is a real find, and it makes me happy to know I can celebrate my Irish heritage without a bunch of drunks acting like overgrown children.This place is located right off the Kennedy Expressway and Lawrence Avenue, in the Mayfair neighborhood.  It used to be a community college of some sort back in the day, now it's a full-blown dedication to Irish culture and heritage, and a great one at that. The music was awesome (we saw The Tossers on Friday and Red Rebel County on Saturday) and the sound was great.  There was a wide range of acts throughout the grounds, and there were even some dancing troupes, which I really enjoyed.Food was OK.  If you've been to Ireland, you know that the phrase "Irish Cuisine" is an oxymoron.  Corned beef is also non-existent on the island, at least the few times I've been.  They did serve corned beef sandwiches, bangers, and the always-Irish pizza rolls.  Of course they had Guinness on tap along with some other Irish beers (Smithwicks, Harp, etc) and the usual American swill.Overall I'd give this place 4 stars.  The Irish Fest was terrific and made me realize how awesome many Chicago Irish people are.  Prices were definitely steep... $15 to walk in Saturday, $20 on Sunday, and $6-7 for a 12 ounce beer, but parking was free and the music was outstanding.  I'm definitely coming back next year.

22.description: Love this place. How could you not. After all it is an entire building devoted to all things Irish. We typically start our St. Patrick's day here. They offer Irish dancers and raffle prizes (don't laugh, Hubby won $400 one year) and plenty of beer (not green, thank God!). And they offer Irish food. But this place is great year round. They have classes all year long. Check their schedule and you are bound to find a class that interests you. But best of all, they have a PUB!Yep, a great Irish pub located inside the building. It's a comfortable space with nice people in front of the bar and behind. Plus low tables and comfy chairs around the room for chilling with your friends. And they offer live music on certain days. You can check their schedule and make sure that someone is playing when you plan to attend.

15.description: My sisters, son and I went to the fest,and had a great time.Got there aaround 5.00 after the rain(good timing),and got a table just outside the main tent. Saw the Larkin Moran Bros. and they were amazing.  And of course the Tossers closed the evening and were even better than last year...at least Tony Duggins didn't forget the lyrics to some of the songs this year. The drinks were reasonable at 5 tickets a drink,plus we brought flasks to add a little nip to the weak drinks. Also,I have to mention the Pipe and Drums of the Emerald Society who sounded great. All in all just a great evening.

20.description: Its an old school turned Irish center.  I went two years in a row to the Bagpipe fundraiser.  Both times it went great.  A nice family event with Guinness, everyone's happy!  It does feel like a school but that's why its great for family events.

36.description: this is a great place to know about!

14.description: Shelby Baron at the Irish American Heritage Center along with her team were very accommodating.  We had last minute changes to the set up, no problem!  We rented the 4th floor room for a charity event with 200 people, the room was beautiful.  Highly recommend for charity events, weddings, large family functions, etc.  We will hope to book this venue again for future events.

1.description: My friend and I decided to be adventurous and try this restaurant! Admittedly it was a little awkward to go in and find that we were the only customers on a Saturday night, but I would not let that deter you from going in.We were not handed menus, and instead, my friend ordered from the Korean menu on the wall.. I did sneak a peek at the counter and see menus available, so I'm not quite sure if they just limited their options and were not making other menu items  (which were more variable AND in English) or if they thought we were just interested in what was available on the wall.. I would say that this should not deter you, however. The person serving us was very friendly and I'm certain she would be very happy to help explain what is on the menu. (I also have a feeling she just forgot to give us the menu)Either way, I will say that the food is great. You can tell they know what they're doing. Traditional side dishes were very well prepared and the kimchi was yummy!! :) We had a calamari, stir-fried squid dish (ojingeo-bokkeum), and for someone who honestly dislikes calamari unless it's fried, the dish and flavor was surprisingly delicious!Now, the main reason I am writing this review, however, is to say that this place serves ox tail beef soup (sul lung tang/seolleongtang). After Han Bat closed, I needed to find a new go to, and I HAVE FOUND IT. It isn't as flavorful as my memory remembers the sul lung tang from Han Bat being, but it definitely comes close, and provided the difficulty in preparing this dish, I am happy to say that I will be coming back, if not to see if other menu items are available, then at least for my sul lung tang cravings!!!!

2.description: There's no shortage of good, small, authentic Korean restaurants around here, but this one's my favorite.  Parking is easy out in front on the street, and the big windows facing Bryn Mawr make the place friendly and sunny during the day.  No one in here speaks much English, but you're not in there for the conversation. The interior is sparkling clean, casual, but tasteful, and you can watch Korean soap operas on television while you wait.  By the way, Korean soap operas seem pretty similar to American or Spanish language soap operas, and I don't understand why otherwise diverse cultures all like the same strange soap opera plots and characters, but that's a tangent I'll have to explore elsewhere.  This place has a yummy Korean style omelet (rice on the inside), delicious noodle soups, and the best bibimbop.  It's cheap, well worth it, I've eaten everything on the menu and liked it, including two items not on the (poorly translated) English menu but listed up on the wall in Korean (once because a Korean friend ordered it, another time because I just had to know and the server was unable to explain in English).  You're not going to be disappointed, unless that is, if you're the sort of person who is always disappointed.  In that case, this will just be another disappointment.

0.description: Authentic Korean Ox bone soup restaurant. I love Korean Seolleongtang ox bone soup. This place mainly makes the soup. People come here for the ox bone soup. I'm glad that I found this restaurant.  I don't think the store is not interested to attract American customer. The menu is in Korean. I can't read Korean but my boy friend can read it and translated it for me. We will go back there again.

12.description: This is an office supply store?/?/? You're kidding right? Actually, it looks more like a dump than an actual store. Plus, the merchandise is old and broken. I asked the manager about the fax machine I saw on sale there, and he said, you can buy it if you'd like, but it's yours once you walk out the door. I asked him what he meant by that and he said, well, there are ABSOLUTELY NO RETURNS on ANY MERCHANDISE IN THE STORE. Not even an exchange.Geez. I guess they're doing really bad, that they cannot even accept merchandise for return, or exchange for credit. If I purchase something that doesn't work, then I'm stuck with it. I left the store immediately and went to OfficeMax instead.Buh bye! You just lost me as a customer, FOREVER.

3.description: Great, prompt and courteous service. Super helpful and phenomenal - thanks to everyone there, including Miguel. It's hard to find impeccable service and I'm glad I found a place like this to help me out. Thanks!

1.description: My laptop's hard drive crashed one day, and I went into to this office depot to get help.  I was assisted by Wesley who was very friendly and knowledgeable, however the laptop they sold to me initially wasn't functioning properly.  Miguel (another manager) ended up helping me get it replaced with a new model that was quite comparable.  All in all a good place to get some last minute assistance.  Experience was a little stressful but they fixed it in the end and that is all that matters!  I dealt with Wesley, Roger and Miguel.

2.description: Maybe it was A.fluke, but that was the best shopping experience I've had in a long time.

9.description: I printed promotional flyers in the Office Depot and I'm disappointed of the final result! Besides that, they are pretty expensive... There is many more sensible companies, who can deliver much better quality for much more competitive price.

10.description: I went there today to find plain white 8.5 x 11 cardstock, when I looked through the really slim paper selection for like 5 minutes I went and asked the manager where the cardstock was, his reply was this: "uh, it should be by the paper."Really?  Really? Then he proceeded to walk around the paper aisles scratching his head, said "I'm sorry" as he was walking away from me and I was still left with nothing.  I ended up getting one of the five things I needed so this Office Depot gets one of five stars.That one star is because of the checkout clerk, I think her name was like Neesha, she was very nice and I could tell she took a lot of grief from other less compitent employees but still smiled at me.  So that gold star is for her.

13.description: I should point out this review only pertains to business cards.  I designed my own cards of Microsoft Publisher.  The first box of cards I bought were horrible and looked cheap so I had them send the cards back and try again after the store designer "fixed" the problem.  Unfortunately the cards were still messed up the second time around so I got a refund.  The people were nice enough and gave me no hassles about the refund but the bottom line was hours of frustration and 2 weeks later I do not have business cards.  I will wind up paying twice the price to try a print shop- its worth the price to get them done right.

16.description: Unfriendly staff & the store doesn't carry the products they advertise.  Nuts to them.  I gave them an extra star because one of the cashiers was at least able to tell me about another nearby store where I could find what I was looking for.

6.description: I'm glad to see that this particular location already has the reviews it well deserves. What a deplorable experience minus them actually having what I needed.This review is based on the purchase of:1 Quantum Series - Black Mesh Multi-Function Midback Chair Sku # 510-830 1 Ativa 6 Sheet Micro Cut Shredder (MDM6000)Office Depot - 24hrs to assemble a chair vs Staples 30 minutes give or take how busy they are. Same price for the service. Office Depot...are you kidding me??? What's hilarious is when I got the chair home it took less than 30 minutes to assemble and comes with all necessary parts and tools. Ugh!I guess the more expensive chairs, due to the wired hydraulic controls come more assembled than your less expensive office/task chairs.I've assembled all my chairs in the past but this is by far the nicest and most expensive one I've bought to date and the hydraulics were a little more advanced than I was used to. Once opening the box however, I realized not only was it going to be a cinch to put together but the salesperson on the floor either did not know what he was talking about or purposely bent the truth to suggest I purchase the assemble service. FAIL.Staples was happy to communicate with me well after it was obvious I was going to be purchasing zero items from their store. After purchasing almost $500 worth of merchandise at Office Depot, the conversation immediate went cold with two associates because I would not buy the warranty for the new chair or shredder. I guess this store doesn't seem to be to concerned with repeat business.Next time I need office supplies I'll be heading over to Staples where I felt like a really customer whose need were being handled a little better than at Office Depot.

15.description: This location is no bueno.  They're understaffed and inefficient.  'Nuf said.

0.description: ABSOLUTELY GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!I came to this office depot after encountering terribly poor customer service at the evanston office depot. This place has amazing employees. I was greeted immediately and asked what I needed. I purchased an office chair and was offered warranty for it..(explained thoroughly). They even assembled my chair for free right there and then, and assisted me to my car with it.THIS is the office depot i'll be going to from now on! :)

5.description: I must say, I'm reviewing the Copy and Print Depot at this Office Depot because that's mostly what I used.  I had a simple file I needed to print, but I wanted it on cardstock and my rinky dink printer won't print on even one sheet of it...so, off to Office Depot I went.  The printing was pretty cheap with 8 cents for the paper and 10 cents for the printing, so it was all under $5.  They also have a table where you can use a paper-cutter and other paper tools, and they're pretty laid back about you sitting there for an hour or so working on things...which I did.  I went on a weekday afternoon, and the store was pretty quiet.  The service was great, and they were even generous with their paper when I got a little too excited with the paper-cutter and needed some extra sheets.  I went back to work on something on the weekend, and there were 9 workers in the printing area...so, I'm sure if you ever need anything copied or printed, you'll have plenty of help.

11.description: This review was for a few months back, things might have changed. But if this truly is  great place the reviews will even out for themselves. I made a purchase here and the girl wearing a baby blue dress shirt at the main center register was just rude when I declined warranty for an item. While putting the item I just purchased into the bag, she made innocent attempts of trying to smash it.

8.description: For the few needs I do have its OK.  Hard to find store associates to ask questions about products.  They sell computer hardware and software, but, none is knowledgeable enough to answer any questions.  Which points you to other chain stores.  Some of their merchandise goes on sale at a better price than some stationary and electronic stores, sometimes.  Their coupons blow.  Spend $75 dollars and save $5.  Wow, what a great deal.  NOT.  Jewel has better coupons.  Spend $50 dollars and get these ugly pens for free.  WoOhoO, Not.

4.description: I don't go to office supply stores often, but when I do, I just want to get my stuff and get out. I had actually been to Radio Shack but they did not open on time. I popped in here to buy a cord to connect my computer to my TV. They had what I wanted plus I found a super cute planner for the new year.I was in and out, got what I needed and made it home on time.I have to say, it was a good experience for me!

14.description: Is this an Office Depot or a prison camp? Due to the blinking lightbulbs, high prices and surly employees, I felt like I was serving time. Who at Office Depot is letting this store get away with a penal ambiance? I'd like to have a talk with them.

7.description: These people here are really nice. I don't know why the ratings here are so bad. I was greeted shortly after walking in and a nice gentleman escorted my mom and I to get everything we needed. He was very helpful and even ordered something for us that we needed that wasnt in stock, free delivery since we were in the store and they werent stocked with it. He was very professional and knowledgeable. I will continue shopping here for my office needs.

12.description: Very nice location. Small, but not a mess like some other locations. My only complaint is that they don't utilize all their registers. Why have them if you are not going to use them? Long lines are never fun.

3.description: While I love "dollar tree" & am a very loyal customer, I don't love this particular one.  (3521 W. Devon Ave.)Customer service isn't good. It's 1 thing from a cashier, and another from a manager. I was not treated with respect or courtesy.

1.description: I can't say enough good things about this Dollar Tree, especially Brendon the Manager.It is always clean, organized, and well-stocked. The employees are always nice and willing to help (I once had a big load, they helped carry and put it in my car).Wonderful experience every time!

2.description: I love Dollar Tree, and I need Dollar Tree for buying several bulk items with my very small work budget.  This store, in particular, has a pretty good selection of items, but the service can use some improvement.  The employees are usually yelling at each other across the store, and they move pretty slowly so lines start to back up with more than 2 people checking out at a time.  The manager is often on duty and he runs hot and cold with attitude toward customers; I've also heard the employees argue with him while checking out.  I don't come here to see how businesses should be run, but I do come here for cheap, cute, goods...and that's what they offer.

9.description: Brought dollars!!

10.description: Maybe it's because it's new but it's my favorite Dollar Tree.  Clean! Less clutter! Wider aisles!Yes, I shop at Dollar Tree. No, I'm not ashamed about it. They have a craft section with great project ideas to keep kids busy on a rainy day for super cheap. Suncatchers, paint, coloring books, markers, clay... you name it. You can play with it, make a mess then just toss it!They have a lot of wedding themed stuff here... more than I've seen at other locations. Bubbles, party favor boxes etc. How much is this? $1! how much is that? $1! Love it.

4.description: Less clutter?!?! At the start of day, but as the day rolls on and customers plow through their doors it becomes a wasteland of strewn dollar goods. Not to say I haven't picked up one of them for purchase, from time to time. I like this store and not because they offer decent quality frozen items. Like what?! Like Smuckers brand fruit pies or Banquet brand pot and fruit pies, pizza and puffs, Popsicles, ice cream, deli slices and more! It doesn't stop there, brand name cleaners, personal products, soaps, baking sheets and my personal favorite... baking cups for cupcakes and the foil baking pans. I buy a lot of candy here, mostly stuff for the candy bowl at work. They have a large selection of decent stuff. In the front they show off their seasonal items and most often I can find a few items that would make it into my holiday mix of stuff to have for the season. Again, it's all a dollar, so why not look! I like taking the kids inside, nieces and nephews that is, give'em a Lincoln and let them go to town. They feel empowered and important with their own bags and I feel awesome for bringing smiles to their faces.

6.description: You know that you're slow when you're wondering how much is the fancy plastic serving wear. It's a dollar store, everything is pretty much a dollar or less. Huge gift bags, Santa servers, new years attire all for a dollar. Not bad really.People are pretty friendly too. Parking can get a little dicey for a private parking lot.

0.description: Dollar tree!!! I love this place!!! They have so many things you wouldn't expect them to have... all $1. I mean EVERYTHING is $1 (with the exception of the poster board, .50, awesome).Got some great supplies for my daughters project. They have a nice variety of things.I also like to get cleaning supplies, stuff for parties, party bags. I mean everything here is great. Speedy check out too. No complaints here.

5.description: Gotta love Dollar Tree even more -I bought a whole bunch of glow sticks today for a glow in the dark race later downtown. Beats the prices they were trying to charge at packet pick-up. Each item was $1, so I bought about $20 worth my my little team tonight! Plus, cashier Gabriella was super friendly this morning -she schooled me on all the birthday balloons I asked about. I bought some from Jewel for a coworker and they ran me about $25 for 4 balloons. Here they are just $1. She told me I can pre-order and pick them up the night before and they should last until the next day. Good info to have -some good money saving info! I love that this store is so close -and it opened early on a Saturday morning! Can't wait to make my next birthday balloon purchase here!

13.description: Check out their fridge, all the good stuff are just a dollar! Cheeseburgers, Rib Sandwiches, and Fudge Popsicles you name it!

11.description: can you believe that everything is a dollar????? lllooovvveee it here!! i really do!!!

8.description: This dollar store would be my dollar store of choice. I really appreciate how clean this place is.  It's carpeted and organized well.  I would even do christmas shopping here!  Haha for the "just in case" gifts.  But really, I do shop safe here.They have a wide variety (even kitchen eatery like plates and glasses) that don't look super cheap.  I've gotten pretty glass picture frames from these guys in the past, and they even have a "Michaels/Frank's/Jo-Ann Fabrics" ish area where there's little decor items like little procelain angels and what not. There's a separate section for inflatable balloons like a party store as well.In short, I think that these guys are definitely aiming for affordable items that people may really need-  not just junky trash that piles up with dust in other dollar stores.There's moving room to shop too where you won't be scared if you take a step back, you'll cause a domino effect or cause a whole aisle to collapse in like the Cave of Wonders with random packages.Check it out! for a dollar store, it's sure to impress.

14.description: Large, clean, organized, well stocked and....everything really is $1! This is probably the best dollar store I've shopped in. I will definitely keep coming here.

7.description: I used to live in the neighborhood that this dollar tree was located in and it had thee best things you could ask for a buck! A buck! The staff is fairly friendly and they can help you when you ask them. The products are neatly placed in each aisle. Ok so if you go at night it can be a little messy but what do you expect after a long day at the dollar store where people pick stuff up everyday. They've got everything from dollar gatorades to dollar prescription itch cream (which works really well btw). The only downside is that sometimes there is only one register open which can lead to long lines. Don't worry though! The staff works fast and the lines go smoothly. Great parking spaces and plenty of it. If you wanna break the bank bring 20 dollars with you and you'll walk out like you've spent 100.

0.description: One of the best shops  in the area. Very clean and orderly, well organized, and the staff are quite nice. A few tables inside and two outside with canopies.

58.description: Wonderful little gem that, because of its location, gets missed by a lot of foot traffic from nearby North Park University students. Friendly service, plus all food is cooked by Merla her self. Prices were reasonable. Food was filing, tasty and available in a speedy manner. Very welcoming atmosphere as well. Definitely give this place a shot if you're looking for a hidden treat on the north side.

56.description: I ate here several times I loved their food so I decided to order several party trays for my sons birthday. I enjoy supporting local business. But what I received for my sons birthday was not nearly the same quality that I got when I ate there. Hence, the low stars. I will not order from there again, their prices for party trays are over priced and LOW quality!! I am real disappointed and would NOT recommend this place for party trays.

29.description: This is where I go when I'm in the mood for a Filipino breakfast; even when it's for dinner. My favorite is the tapsilog.  The servings are enough for two and definitely fulfill my cravings.  Great place for first-timers of Filipino food.

42.description: If you're new to Filipino food, The Signature Platter is an awesome way to sample some of the dishes.  It comes with pancit, chicken adobo and your choice of an empanada or siapao.  Although nothing ever compares to my mom's pancit, it was pretty tasty here.  The adobo wasn't the normal 'overpowered by vinegar' style, so that was a nice change.  My mom and I split the platter and ordered an extra beef empanada.  We also can never resist calamansi juice (like, lemonade, but a little tart-er), so we got a can each.  All of this was seriously $15!  Great meal...all without breaking the bank.

23.description: Cute little Merla.  You can see her in the background cooking up a storm when you walk in.  Jo Koy could probably do a skit on her...her scowling face as she pan fries her longanisa.  Hey Merla! Scowl away, if that makes you focus while you work your magic.  Your Filipino breakfast was great!!!!Prices were reasonable and for a longislog. (that's longanisa, garlic rice and a sunny side egg), it ran about $7.  The best part is that this Filipino spot has about 8 different types of Filipino breakfasts, where most have only 3, including the beloved corned beef hash. I still think my dad's is the best, but if I needed to try someone else's, Merla's would be my option. The only thing I didn't care for was their beef empanada. It was double the size of a regular fist sized empanada portion.  The empanada was really oily and the filling wasn't exactly my cup of tea.  Maybe I had it on their "off" day, as a lot of reviewers stated that they loved her empanadas.  I'd be willing to try her chicken one on another visit. The decoration is Manila décor, the service is with a warm smile. The parking though, fairwarning, is a pain.  Not many meters, and if your park on Kimball, be prepared to walk since it's a residential area.

47.description: WOW. Merla's is a fantastic little place serving delicious food at ridiculous prices. The ham, potato and jalapeno cheese empanadas are amazing, and at $1.99 each you almost feel guilty. Everything we've tried on the menu here has at the very least been tasty and filling, and well worth its price. I'm craving those empanadas all the time now! Good stuff all around, super friendly service, well worth a visit. Thanks, Merla!

8.description: Filipino home cooking and positively delicious. It's in a small strip without a whole lot of activity. You can dine in or carry out. The restaurant is small, has a super nice lady handling the orders and her mom cooking in the back so you know it's going to be good. They played great music of different styles. I would recommend the empanada platter. I had beef and chicken, next time I would do 2 beef because that was a stand out fave or try Merlas signature platter and get a small taste of everything. Also the lumpia shanghai was really tasty.

31.description: I love this place! Everyone is always very friendly and helpful. It is cute and clean and the food is delicious. I love the veggie empanadas. My husband really likes the ham ones. We've tried the Siapoas which were very tasty and the topsylong was also good. The food does take time, but it's worth the wait :)

34.description: This little gem is a MUST DO if you're looking for a good home cooked meal. They are very, no-extremely family friendly. The meat is hand picked choice pieces, and it shows. The selection is great, offering for the vegetarian & carnivore types. It's clean, friendly, and inexpensive. I made it a point to come on here & encourage other people to treat themselves to this place.

16.description: MERLA'S!!!   I love you.  Quiet, small, quaint and oh-so-delicious.  You have fed me many of times on my way to my night classes.  And at a great price.  I advise every Yelper out there to get their butts up to Merla's and try it at least once.  You will not be disappointed.  They really pack a punch.  EVERYTHING I have had here has been delicious.  There are items on the menu that change or rotate.  They have lovely desserts available as well.  Bonus - this is a family establishment.  I have seen Merla in the restaurant, cooking and saying hello to the customers.  Beautiful food, family and establishment.  Make your way to Foster & Kimball and say hello to Merla, pronto!  Lumpia!(Be careful, they close at 7 on weekdays!)

13.description: I discovered this place a few months ago and quickly became a regular. I swear the first time I ate here I thought my abuela was in the back cooking the food. It's that good! Everything is made fresh to order and you can taste love in the food. I have had just about every item on the menu and I can't say which is my favorite, because they all are amazing and bring about feelings of nostalgia for my grandmas cooking during my childhood. The dining area is small but that makes it quite cozy, and I highly recommend eating the food there while its hot. There really isn't much else I can say about this place but to go try it out for yourself and see what I'm talking about.

11.description: If you're new to Filipino food, The Signature Platter is an awesome way to sample some of the dishes.  It comes with pancit, chicken adobo and your choice of an empanada or siapao.  Although nothing ever compares to my mom's pancit, it was pretty tasty here.  The adobo wasn't the normal 'overpowered by vinegar' style, so that was a nice change.  My mom and I split the platter and ordered an extra beef empanada.  We also can never resist calamansi juice (like, lemonade, but a little tart-er), so we got a can each.  All of this was seriously $15!  Great meal...all without breaking the bank.

39.description: First of all, I'm from the DC metro area where we only have turo turo restaurants. This whole waiter-service sit-down-with-a-menu business is completely new to my Filipino eating experience (the only other eating experiences coming from my family... so high expectations here). *** come just from the presentation of the restaurant before the food even comes in.+ Really, really cute and colorful decor. I love how Merla's history is on the walls. Looks like they're involved with the community and they're into recycling. REAL mini flower arrangements!!! I don't know who has the floral arrangement hobby in the family, but it definitely adds to my dining experience!+ Friendly and prompt service. I even waved to Merla on my way out!0 Signature dish is pretty standard. Sio pao is nothing special, the pancit is different from what I'm used to (lighter seasonings, more subtle flavor) but delicious. Chicken adobo wasn't the best. Eh.0 Empandas are pretty tasty. Prepared in a very Filipino way (with raisins, ground meat) which isn't my favorite but it's true, they're made to order and are crispy and I don't think I've ever had that before.+ The best thing there? The "fish fritter." I don't know how these guys make this but it is GOOD. It's called like otoy or okoy or something? Anyway it's like... a savory funnel-y cake deep fried thing with fish and spring onions. I've never had anything like it before (in my immediate family or my extended family) and it's fantastically crunchy and flavorful and what gets me is that it has a lightness about it; despite its deep friedness, it isn't oil-logged. Genius!Summary: atmosphere and service = :ODD food = :o|

37.description: I loved this place when I lived in Chicago. Really good Filipino food. The lumpia is delicious. You will love the adobo here, it tastes just like how mom used to do it. =}

0.description: Merla's kitchen is basically at the corner of Foster and Kimball. It is somewhat hidden and wouldn't appear to be a go-to place. But, right when you enter, you might get why people come here. Nice atmosphere and friendly service (Merla came out of the kitchen to say HI). Considering it was my first time, I got the platter and did not regret it. The rice, chicken, empanada, and noodles were a yummy, unique mix. Definitely could be a plate for two! The price on this was reasonable and they accept card for purchases over $5. I'd rather go here than to a big box restaurant. Parking is better found on foster - keep in mind that you may have to pay. I'll definitely come back, glad I have another North Park spot to add to my list!

38.description: The empanada's  were amazing! Never had that before and my family is from the Philippines so I wasn't sure if it was authentic filipino food or not, I didn't quite care. It was so delicious and they used all the right ingredients and spices. The price was reasonable but the Halo Halo was waaay over-priced and definitely wasn't made correctly, but it of course wasn't bad. I definitely recommend Merla's Kitchen, also very friendly!

51.description: This place is great! The empanadas are out of this world!

27.description: So many different reasons to patronize Merla's--where do I begin?Being married to a Filipina, I was introduced early on in our relationship to pancit, but was never that impressed with the dish; wherever we ordered it from, I always found it too greasy and difficult to eat, which probably discouraged me from sampling other Filipino dishes. Merla's pancit is way different, however: not greasy at all, full of a nice mix of veggies, and best of all, I don't feel disgusting after consuming it. At Merla's I've gone on to enjoy the chicken adobo, pork menudo, stir fried chicken, empanadas, siopao, which have all been top notch.But the most important reason I give Merla's five stars is their hospitality--Merla is like the beaming, laughing Filipina grandmother I never had, and her daughters who help at the counter are just as friendly, and the way they accommodate my family's special dietary requests (between them, my wife and daughters have almost every food allergy you can think of) makes us feel more like family, not just devoted customers.

32.description: Just picked up to-go here today and am LOVING it right now.  Merla rules!I got the signature platter with the veggie empanada to try out a sampling spread and it is FANTASTIC, especially the empanada.Adobo chicken is nice and moist + the noodles have a good and different flavor.  Can't wait to come back and eat-in, the place is super cute on the inside.

54.description: Best empanadas I have EVER had!!!  Wonderful service. Sweet decor.  Can't wait to go back for more!  Bravo, Merla!  Bravo!

48.description: This is my new favorite place! The food is fresh, tasty, and even comforting.  The chicken adobo, tilapia, and pork siopao are delicious- I can't wait to keep working through the menu to try everything.  This place is a great value for the price.

44.description: Tiny, hidden away jem, in Albany Park. This place is in walking distance from my work so I stop here from time to time and am always satisfied. Your standard Filipino fare. Empanadas (these can be addicting), menudo, adobo, and pancit bijon. All have been tried and enjoyed thoroughly. The ladies who run the place are extra friendly and will always recommend something. They got me on this ginger beer I have only seen there and it is so refreshing. Talking to the owner she said she likes to bring her favorite things from the Philippines to her restaurant and it shows. What a great place! And did I mention it is cheap?

24.description: Its fair and reasonable price

7.description: I was not happy with the service at Merla's Kitchen today. A group of four of us, who work at a local school, decided to change up our lunch routine. We thought we would support local business and try Merla's. Merla's Kitchen catered a teacher appreciation lunch last year, and we remembered enjoying the food and thought it was time to check out the actual restaurant. I called waaaaay in advance to find out more about their menu, since there was no official website/menu. I thought it was weird that they offered beef, ham, and tofu empanadas, but not chicken. I found out that they DO, in fact, have chicken empanadas and that I would need to call an hour in advance to have our food ready. An hour ahead of time seemed a little excessive, but we were on a time crunch in between classes, so I took her advice and made sure to order an hour before we arrived. When I did call to make the order, I asked about the empanada platter I saw listed on the internet ($6.19) and wondered if we could sub out the steamed rice for fried rice. The girl told me that was no problem and asked what time we would be there, I told her and I said I was looking forward to it. I also asked how much it would be per person, and she told me $10.91. I thought that was a little steep, but I assumed that the prices online were extremely outdated. We show up to find a quaint, little shop that had a few diners in there. Good sign...not completely empty during lunch time and even a little kid was eating his food, and enjoying it. I let the one lady, that we saw, know that we pre-ordered our meals and she never really responded, but I assumed she was pretty busy, especially since she was power walking back and forth getting things ready. After about 5 minutes, our server arrives with 4 bowls of soup, chicken broth with some vegetables. We didn't realized soup came with our meal, so we we pleasantly surprised. The soup was a little greasy, but a nice gesture/ start the meal. We did have to ask for water, since no one offered us any beverages. Not 1 minute later, out comes our food. We all ordered the empanada platter...half of us got veggie/tofu and the other half chicken. The plate of food was very large, with two large empanadas, a side salad made up of mostly napa cabbage and a drizzle of dressing, and a serving of rice. I noticed right away that the rice was very white and I let her know, that we actually ordered fried rice. She informed me that I never told her what to fry up the rice with, so they just did oil and garlic. Whaaaaat? At this point I didn't want to seem rude or ignorant, especially since I never dined at this restaurant before, but usually fried rice has SOMETHING in it and doesn't just taste like plain, boring, white rice. We dig in, everything is tasting fine, but the boring rice. I dump the rice into the chicken soup just to add some sort of flavor to it. It really was a large portion of food, most of the ladies packed up their second empanada and it was time for the check. She handed the check over, with zero warning, and it read $52.79....EXSQUEEZE ME?So, we where charged $9.99 per platter. Then they deducted 50 cents per person for NOT getting white rice....but then charged us $2.79 (or something close-they kept the original receipt) for fried rice. WHAT fried rice????I thought there most have been some misunderstanding, so I bring up the receipt to her and said that the bill is much higher than we expected. "Oh yeah, I told you the wrong price on the phone"....oooookkkkaaaaayyy. So, I then calmly continue and just mention that we called ahead of time on purpose so we were prepared and we are trying to support local businesses...and it was falling on deaf ears. Rice costs pennies....and for a business to charge almost $3 for a cup of rice...with some oil on it seemed like highway robbery.Since I recommended the place, I was too embarrassed to ask my co-workers to start scraping our money together to have enough for the bill and tip, so I quickly paid with my credit card just so I could leave. It was a frustrating Friday lunch outing...which is unfortunate. The whole point of getting out on Fridays is to start celebrating the weekend. Ugh.

49.description: . Basic Filipino fare. A good start off point for none Filipinos who wants to try Filipino dishes. Bland at times. Cute, clean place. But I've had better food.

40.description: So I was trying to find somewhere close to school to get something to eat and I decided to look on yelp.  This is the first time I ever had Filipino food and it was phenomenal! I got the signature platter so I could try a bit of everything and my favorite on that plate had to be the chicken adobo.  So freakin good.  I will definitely be going back!

53.description: I am a student at Northeastern and my girlfriend goes to North Park. We are always looking for great little places to eat and I have seen this place on my way to class everyday and we finally decided to go in. It is a gem. The food is really well priced and very hardy portions. My girlfriend is half Cuban and loved the Pork Adobo dish because it reminded her of her grandmas lechon. She even took her mother who adored the place. This place is a great option for the college kids in the area who want good food that does not hurt your wallet.

30.description: I've been here a number times and will continue to go.  The food is simple and delicious.  It reminds me of eating at grandmother's house, though it's not my grandmother's food.  But it has that essence of homemade Filipino foods and flavors I crave.Have tried several of the dishes.  Some of the best empanadas I've found.  The beef ones are my favorite.  Fried and so expect them to be a little greasy.  Lumpia is thin and crispy.  Chicken adobo is made simpler with only boneless, skinless chicken breast.  My boyfriend likes the apritada, a chicken stew with potatoes and tomato sauce, because of the green olives added in.  The sinigang soup has ample sourness.  Ensaymada is a perfectly baked, soft, sweet bun.  I could go on.  The servings are nice sized for the right price.A quaint place with small tables.  Charming atmosphere and family run.  Counter service.  Order, sit down and they bring your food to you when ready.  This is a place to go if you want to support local mom and pops.

46.description: MERLA'S!!!   I love you.  Quiet, small, quaint and oh-so-delicious.  You have fed me many of times on my way to my night classes.  And at a great price.  I advise every Yelper out there to get their butts up to Merla's and try it at least once.  You will not be disappointed.  They really pack a punch.  EVERYTHING I have had here has been delicious.  There are items on the menu that change or rotate.  They have lovely desserts available as well.  Bonus - this is a family establishment.  I have seen Merla in the restaurant, cooking and saying hello to the customers.  Beautiful food, family and establishment.  Make your way to Foster & Kimball and say hello to Merla, pronto!  Lumpia!(Be careful, they close at 7 on weekdays!)

1.description: I love Merla's! I always get the signature platter with the chicken empanada. So good! They're great for catering and to visit to grab a bite to eat. The staff is so welcoming, and the price are great. You can't get much better than that!

55.description: merla knows her stuffseriouslyi tried the empanadas and the veggie sand riceeverything i tasted WAS FANTASTICmerla is my new role model

9.description: It's not too far from Isla, a Yelp darling that I usually go to for Filipino food. Merla's is smaller, but overall I liked the dishes better because they were not as salty as Isla. Isla does have better Lumpia and a bigger menu.The price was right and everything tastes like home cooking.

26.description: This was another great discovery by my wife.  I came in having no idea as to what to expect, as I'd never had Filipino cuisine before.  Being uninitiated, I ordered the signature platter.  This consists of the chicken adobo, which went great with their sweet hot sauce, the pancit bihon, which was a rice noodle dish, and a choice of any of the empanadas or the siopao.  I washed this down with a glass of calamansis juice.  At the end, we split a halo halo dessert.Given my unfamiliarity with a lot of this stuff, it's not easy to describe everything.  The chicken adobo was interesting, but damned if I could say how it was made.  The pancit bihon was a great dish.  I could see coming in and getting a big helping of it for lunch.  I had the ground beef empanada, but I liked my wife's chicken empanada much better.The  halo halo dessert was really the coup de grace of the evening.  The combination of shaved ice and dry rice was so different from anything I had seen in a dessert, along with the white beans and all the vanilla ice cream and I don't know what else.Anyway, I'm not doing a great job of describing what I ate.  I can say that the lady behind the counter was very gracious, and we enjoyed the musician who was performing in the background as we ate.Go give this place a shot.

25.description: Have been back several more times. The extra star is dedicated to Tapsilog! YUM!

12.description: I felt really guilty stopping in here because I was feeling like I was cheating on my favorite Filipino restaurant, Ruby's Fast Food which is on Montrose, however after trying Merla's I won't be unfaithful to Ruby again.  Well, at least not here.When I read the reviews here on Yelp before going here I wondered if maybe Miss Ruby had met her match.  She has nothing to worry about she's still my number one lady here in the city!  Personally I thought it was overpriced for what I got, but I realize I am a bit of a cheap skate so I'll list the prices for the things I got and you can decide for yourself.Merla's Specialty Plate - The name may not be correct but it's the plate with poncit, chicken adobo and I selected the beef empanada to go with it.  It was priced at $11 (I'm rounding all prices to the nearest half dollar).  It came with a small serving of poncit that had a slightly burnt taste to it and other than that was a little on the bland side.  As far as the adobo chicken goes it was a medium size serving with OK flavor, but there wasn't a lot of the flavor so the use of more adobo seasoning would have definitely helped it to make a better impression.  The beef empanada was tasty and good.  My only complaints about it was that it was literally dripping a pretty good amount of grease out of it which was gross and it was also slightly burnt.  By slightly burnt I mean cooked long enough to have a few small areas that were black on the exterior and had a slight burnt taste.  The steamed rice that came with the meal had a good flavor, but it was slightly dried out.I love longinisa sausages so I got an order of 3 pieces since I like them for dessert after eating Filipino food (yes, I know that makes me kind of weird, but I love them that much).  The 3 longinisa sausages and a small helping of rice came to $5.  The longinisas had nice flavor, but nothing to get excited about.  On this one particular item I felt it was actually not cooked long enough.  It may well be my phobia about eating pork products that are undercooked so it's possible that it may have been fully cooked.  I like to dip my longinisa in a vinegar dip.  Unfortunately all they had was a plain vinegar instead of vinegar with diced garlic and onion in it which makes for a nice dipping sauce.  If they'd offer a vinegar dip with some other flavors added to it it would really enhance the taste.Finally I ordered an order of sinigang (a salmon soup) to eat later for my supper.  The sinigang was $8 for a pretty good size serving with no rice or anything with it.  I took one bite and ending up flushing the rest down the toilet.  For some people I suppose it may be OK, but it was nothing close to the sinigang I've had from other cooks.So for all of the above food I paid about $25 and was completely unimpressed.  Actually not happy at all.  I will not be returning here and from now on I'll return to Ruby's Fast Food when I get the craving for authentic Filipino food.  For the same amount of money spent today I would have gotten at least 3 times as much food at Ruby's Fast Food and would have been much more satisfied.The one bright spot was that the young man working behind the counter was very friendly and seemed happy to be there so kudos to him.

59.description: This is great food, served with unassuming charm, in a cozy atmosphere. My Filipino husband raved about the pork siapao, he said it was fresh and delicious just the way his mother used to make it (before she started buying the frozen kind, lol!). We also had adobo, the tilapia, some pork skewers, fried rice, and lumpia. Yes, we were hungry! If you are out to impress some high rollin' friends this is not be the place for you - there aren't wine lists or uniformed wait staff or anything fancy. If you are interested in delicious food, you will adore this place and start plotting your next visit even before the check arrives. Next time, we're bringing my father-in-law, and we're definitely ordering the empanadas....mmmmmmmm.

21.description: It's a cute little Filipino restaurant, where you can find your Lola cooking in the kitchen.  It smells like your Lola and Lolo are in the kitchen cooking, which is a great thing becuase you know the food is excellent. Onto the food:  I had ordered the Topsilog with fried eggs and garlic fried rice, which was spot on.  The only thing was that the Topsilog was a bit salty, but I was able to work with it.  And I ordered the little egg rolls (I can't believe that I forgot the name), it was tasty, just the way my mom would season the meat.  I wanted to get more food like the chicken adobo, but I was going on the plane and I didn't want them to tell me to throw it away.  I read about all the great review of the chicken adobo.  The next time I am in Chicago, this my first stop for food rather than those fast food chains.

17.description: I actually met Merla 'cuz you can see her in the back cooking. Her daughters are in the front working and I got a history lesson from one of them. I noticed that Filipinos speak with a Spanish accent and some of their words are in Spanish. Turns out that the Spanish colonized in the Phillipines awhile back. Also, their language (Tagalog) is pronounced Tag-ga-loo, not Tag-ga-long.Anyway, I had Merla's Signature Platter, which is a sample of a few things on the menu. It was Chicken Adobo instead of pork adobo, Pancit Bihon (rice noodles), white rice, and a chicken empanada instead of siopao. My mom had one empanada and was full. It was delicious as most dumpling sort of foods are to me. The rice noodles and rice weren't as tasty with the chicken as they were when I realized the restaurant offered soy sauce and sweet and sour sauce and I put them on the noodles and rice. It tasted much better then. Merla's food was so good. No Steve Dolinski (food critic) came to visit.The coconut juice or coconut water was good at first, but I'm not used to drinking coconuts with my meal so I couldn't drink the whole thing.The restaurant was so small that the bathroom is through a door on the right. It's next door in a place that looks to use to have been a flower shop. The bathroom is neat. It has a chalkboard on the whole with chalk so that you can comment on the restaurant. The restaurant was neat too. It can see pictures on their website.For dessert, I had to try the Halo-Halo. I got a large and split it with my mom. It was so delicious. With all the fruit that was in it, it could be a healthy alternative to ice cream though one of the ingredients was ice cream. It also had leche flan, ube (purple yam), crushed ice and some kinds of flakes. I don't know what all was in it because there were 11 ingredients, but it was more tastier than ice cream alone, especially with the ube. You guys should try it.

10.description: I love this place so much!  The food is awesome but it's the service that keeps me coming back.  The owners/employees are so nice and welcoming.  I recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

5.description: This is Filipino Home Cooking done right.After a long week, I really needed some comfort food, which for me is Filipino food. So it was the perfect chance to finally try Merla's Kitchen. My first impression was that it was a filipino mom and pop shop, or rather nanay and tatay shop...pretty small in size, but cute. I loved the decor and the colors. There were probably only about 6-8 tables all together. When we walked in I noticed more people getting carry out than dining in. Service was very friendly. Now, to the important part, the food. I will have to say that it did take a little longer than expected to prepare, but when I say this is home cooking, I mean it felt like I was eating lola's (grandmother's) cooking. Sooo worth it. We ordered the signature platter which included: white rice, pancit (rice noodles), chicken adobo (chicken simmered in soy sauce and vinegar), and beef empanada. It may seem that ~$11 is a lot, but considering the portions, we ended up splitting it between two people. We also ordered a side order of lumpia (egg roll), which 10 rolls for ~$3.50 is a good price. I thought the food pretty much hit the spot. My husband loved the empanada. It was a little different for me because I've never had it with cheese before, but I thought it was good overall. I also ordered some good old calamansi (lemon/lime) juice, yummy.I will have to come back because there were so many other things on the menu that I wanted to try!!

3.description: Do you have passion?  That is a question you must ask yourself. What are you passionate about?  Are you passionate about your family, a relationship, a hobby?  Once you find passion, you are truly alive.  I am passionate about many things, and one of them is...FILIPINO BREAKFAST!!! You like how I started off the review with a serious tone?  I felt like I need to change it up, and that was my feeble attempt at being creative.  OK enough of the high jinks, lets get to the matter. This review is for a little place I discovered driving down Kimball Avenue.  A quaint little Filipino restaurant hidden in plain sight.  A diamond in the rough, just like Aladdin was.  Came in here on a whim, and left with my shirt feeling tighter from the awesome grub.I ordered one of my favorite things to eat on this Universe. Tocilog, which is tocino, fried eggs, and garlic fried rice.  I would like to go in depth about what tocino is, but that's what Google is for.  Just take my word here, this place is good. I know Uncle Mike's gets all the shine, but honestly the food here is *gasp* better. I hope they don't read that and think bad of me. Just speaking the truth. I will try the rest of the menu in time, but when it comes to Filipino Breakfast this place is legit.

35.description: Hands down probably the best food I have ever eaten! This is also my only experience with Filipino food. I tried the signature platter. I ate every thing on that platter! The beef empanadas. I could write a song about how delicious they are. And addicting. The pancit was decent, not my favorite but it's worth a try. The chicken adobo was so good too. I've been there a few times since then and I have also ordered the siapao. I tried both the pork and chicken. They are different, but still quite good. The dough surrounding the meat was sort of sweet and the sauce they give you for it is what makes the siapoa really really good. My favorite thing about this place other than the empanadas (the ham one is good too!) is the lumpia. I LOVE it. I hate Chinese eggrolls but I could attack an order of lumpia all day. They are also some very friendly people who work there! The prices are good, the people are nice and the food is awesome. You won't regret Merla's!

19.description: Food reminds me of home. Adobo was delicious. We also had the sinigang which complimented the adobo and dinuguan we had.Very friendly and pleasant staff and if you are lucky, you could see a glimpse of Merla working hard in the kitchen!

28.description: I love this place.  The food is perfect, particularly the stir fry veggies, chicken adobo, and empanadas (i highly recommend both the soy and beef varieties, not as fond of the ham).  The decor here is really nice, and the staff couldn't be friendlier.  I just love it.  I go at least once a week, even if it's just for an empanada snack, and I am never disappointed!  My only wish- STAY OPEN LATER PLEASE!!!! Us college kids have a rough time getting out of class and over to a restaurant before 7 or 8, so if you could stay open til 10 that would be perfect.

45.description: The lumpia was yummy (and Merla gave me 3 extra! Thanks, Merla! :D).The pork menudo was very tasty. maybe a bit too salty though for my tastebuds seeing as how I downed one of those Arizona Tea cans in 10 min. I love anything with green olives in it.Only thing I didn't like, the chairs. And it was a bit warm in there, even though the A/C was set to 66 I think (it's probably because of the heat coming from the kitchen). My chubster self needs to be comfy while eating. :POh and I'm part Filipino. :)

33.description: Pretty damn good! I've been looking for Filipino restaurants here in town, and I'm glad I came across this one. The staff is super nice, and the food is delicious. It was my first time here; I ordered the lumpia(very good) and pork adobo. The adobo was not quite my mom's or grandma's but pretty damn close. Also, the prices are very reasonable. I'll definitely be back here to get the -silogs (Longsilog's my favorite!). Oh, and the turon was on point!

43.description: Great food and friendly host.  I liked everything in the signature platter.  The empanadas are fantastic.  The service is great, and you will be treated well.A great destination in North Park.

2.description: Passing by Merla's Kitchen, I've always wanted to try it. The reviews on yelp made me want to try it even more!Today, I did. And i was very disappointed.. I ordered the pancit bihon, and it was absolutely flavorless. It tasted mushroomy and icky. I also ordered a meat empanada with egg and such. Extremely greasy and salty with absolutely no dimension..  I thought there were raisins in it?? It just tasted salty and greasy.The prices on yelp are also way off. The sampler platter was almost 12 dollars.I don't know if I just had a bad experience or if it was an off day, but I've had better pancit and empanadas from my Filipino neighbors.

18.description: Cute little Merla.  You can see her in the background cooking up a storm when you walk in.  Jo Koy could probably do a skit on her...her scowling face as she pan fries her longanisa.  Hey Merla! Scowl away, if that makes you focus while you work your magic.  Your Filipino breakfast was great!!!!Prices were reasonable and for a longislog. (that's longanisa, garlic rice and a sunny side egg), it ran about $7.  The best part is that this Filipino spot has about 8 different types of Filipino breakfasts, where most have only 3, including the beloved corned beef hash. I still think my dad's is the best, but if I needed to try someone else's, Merla's would be my option. The only thing I didn't care for was their beef empanada. It was double the size of a regular fist sized empanada portion.  The empanada was really oily and the filling wasn't exactly my cup of tea.  Maybe I had it on their "off" day, as a lot of reviewers stated that they loved her empanadas.  I'd be willing to try her chicken one on another visit. The decoration is Manila décor, the service is with a warm smile. The parking though, fairwarning, is a pain.  Not many meters, and if your park on Kimball, be prepared to walk since it's a residential area.

41.description: My family and i were starving and just happen to pass Merla's so we stopped. My four year old eyed the fu. Little play area and was off. I grabbed a menu and was immediately greeted by the owner, who happily walked us through the items on it. Merla's, you had me at flan. I ordered was a sio pao (sp) and flan and i'm dying to go back and try more. My son also had one and ate it so fast i didn't get to try it. Which is cool cause usually the new food battle is exhausting. See ya soon. Yum.

52.description: First time at Merla's Kitchen tonight. WOW! everything was delicious. We had Merla's combination plate (pancit, empanada with beef, rice and chicken adobo. Boy!! everything was delicious but the empanada was the best I have ever tasted. We also had the BBQ Pork Adobo (wonderful, not greasy, flavorful and not chili hot). We split a Siopao with Beef( Steamed bun with filling). For dessert I had the flan and Jason, my partner, had the Chocolate Swirl ANgel Food Cake. Both were excellent. I am used to the mexican/spanish flan which is much lighter than this one. THis flan was quite heavy but extremely tasty.  We ended up taking 2 beef empanada and a vegetable stir fry for tomorrow's lunch. I can hardly wait to go try their Pork Menudo, Chiken Afritada, and Lumpia SHanghai.The total bill (with a $3.00 corkage fee for our BYOB of wine) was $38 all inclusive. Truly a gemJohn Hasan

50.description: The empanadas are awesome. A little pricey but I suppose the price equals the size of these super sized empanadas. 2 of these will definitely fill you up, toasty and flaky on the outside and hot and steamy on the inside. I love the raisins and hard boiled egg with the beef, that's how I know this is authentic Filipino food. The cheese makes it a little Americanized but that's fine by me, you have to keep your non-Filipino patrons intrigued and happy. Merli, your Mom has a great empanada recipe. I'd eat two at the restaurant and take two to go. They easily toast up in the toaster oven. :)

4.description: Very good.  Tried it on a whim today.  Everything was perfection and will definitely eat here again.

6.description: Soooo goood. I will be back. Went there with a friend on a weekday, ordered pancit, lumpia, and lechon. A lot of food, great price, super tasty.

22.description: I actually met Merla 'cuz you can see her in the back cooking. Her daughters are in the front working and I got a history lesson from one of them. I noticed that Filipinos speak with a Spanish accent and some of their words are in Spanish. Turns out that the Spanish colonized in the Phillipines awhile back. Also, their language (Tagalog) is pronounced Tag-ga-loo, not Tag-ga-long.Anyway, I had Merla's Signature Platter, which is a sample of a few things on the menu. It was Chicken Adobo instead of pork adobo, Pancit Bihon (rice noodles), white rice, and a chicken empanada instead of siopao. My mom had one empanada and was full. It was delicious as most dumpling sort of foods are to me. The rice noodles and rice weren't as tasty with the chicken as they were when I realized the restaurant offered soy sauce and sweet and sour sauce and I put them on the noodles and rice. It tasted much better then. Merla's food was so good. No Steve Dolinski (food critic) came to visit.The coconut juice or coconut water was good at first, but I'm not used to drinking coconuts with my meal so I couldn't drink the whole thing.The restaurant was so small that the bathroom is through a door on the right. It's next door in a place that looks to use to have been a flower shop. The bathroom is neat. It has a chalkboard on the whole with chalk so that you can comment on the restaurant. The restaurant was neat too. It can see pictures on their website.For dessert, I had to try the Halo-Halo. I got a large and split it with my mom. It was so delicious. With all the fruit that was in it, it could be a healthy alternative to ice cream though one of the ingredients was ice cream. It also had leche flan, ube (purple yam), crushed ice and some kinds of flakes. I don't know what all was in it because there were 11 ingredients, but it was more tastier than ice cream alone, especially with the ube. You guys should try it.

15.description: I love this place.  The food is perfect, particularly the stir fry veggies, chicken adobo, and empanadas (i highly recommend both the soy and beef varieties, not as fond of the ham).  The decor here is really nice, and the staff couldn't be friendlier.  I just love it.  I go at least once a week, even if it's just for an empanada snack, and I am never disappointed!  My only wish- STAY OPEN LATER PLEASE!!!! Us college kids have a rough time getting out of class and over to a restaurant before 7 or 8, so if you could stay open til 10 that would be perfect.

57.description: I love this place! They have a good selection of vegetarian food, which is always good. The best thing is the empanada. I've only had the vegetarian one, and honestly, I have no idea what is in it, but it's incredibly delicious. YUM.

20.description: Traditional Filipino cafe! So delicious! The Lampai was my favorite, the skewers also delicious, small cafe, but totally worth seeking out. It would be easy to miss when driving by, very nice little family business!

36.description: I had the pleasure of sampling Merla's food before she opened this place and am glad now that I can just get it on demand instead of hanging out at her house looking hungry. (Not that looking hungry matters, she feeds you anyway.) The empanadas are always the divas of the show, but don't let the rest of the menu escape you. Those noodles, the chicken adobo, and the stuffed pork rolls are so satisfying. You may have to wait a bit for your food because everything's made on the spot, so make sure you've got time to hang out in the charming dining room - there's even playspace for little ones - or call ahead to make sure you're ready to go when you pick-up. Merla's always there so you know the food is mom-quality good and Tina and Leni, her daughters, treat every customer like a friend. A much needed, long-awaited, and welcome member to the neighborhood.

14.description: Coming from the Bay Area which Filipinos are the majority. We are use to a complimentary Pork Sinigang soup. Food was ok and service was great. I guess wejust have different flavor here in the Bay Area. But we were still thankful and exited for having home cook meal from miles away.

1.description: While this our go to place, there are foods you should just stay away from. Good: orange chicken, chow mein, egg drop soup, egg rolls (ok)Bad: fried rice, pot stickersTo be edited as we try out more food.Parking available. Watch out for nearby speed cams. If you try calling See Through through Grub Hub, the call will cancel.

9.description: If you're in the market for that specific kind of cheap Chinese food, See Thru is definitely your place. Great portions for the price (the x large rice is huge) and the food is actually pretty good. If it's what you're in the mood for, it's the place to go.

23.description: 3 star cuisine with 5 star service.This has been our go-to for delivery and takeout for the year we've lived in the neighborhood. The food is nothing special, nothing you couldn't get at any other Chinese take-out place.
