5.description: booked a week before the event. adult is $13.95, 7-12 only pays half, and 6 below is free.  asked a deposit of $50.  my guests, 30 adults, 8 7-12y.o., and 7 6y.o. and below.she charged me 45 pax and she said she did not even count the 3 years old and below and there were 5 of them. in other words she overcharged me.paid $789 for 45 pax that's including $65 tax and service fee of 15% which is $94.the room was big. the waiters did not even serve a pitcher of water on the table.  they just came out when they started cleaning the area when the guests left.FOODno lechon and i even asked during the booking if they are going to serve lechonthe food looked like it's been sitting there for hoursnot much selection of foodthe taste is fairI am a filipino and will support a filipino restaurant in the US. But how can i recommend this?

3.description: My friend had her bridal shower here yesterday. It is roomy - she has a big family and many friends and this place was pretty big to host us while leaving the other part of the restaurant available for other customers. Parking lot is big, too.This is a Filippino buffet - very cool. It's a very casual setting. This is probably my 5th time having Fillippino food and it was great. I tried the food that was served - the  lumpia was very good. The flan was very good, as well. Those were my favorite items served. Staff was decent - a couple of them didn't speak English very well but that's okay. Overall decent time. Roomy, good food, and lots of parking!

35.description: There are a ton of choices to pick and I like the overall setup. I wish the bbq sticks they had tasted more like bbq. Instead they put some sauce on these chicken skewers and it doesn't taste like it was grilled. It'd be awesome if they had some without the sauce and actually GRILLED it over an open flame! The lechon is good but I haven't seen any arroz caldo here either. Wish they had that too! The bathroom is pretty disgusting, since there was piss all over the floor last time I used it. (this is the dood's bathroom) Of course this isn't entirely the restaurant's fault, it's also the d-bag who decided it was awesome to piss all over the floor instead of the actual urinal. I mean seriously I have a penis too and it's not that hard to aim. You just point and shoot. Anywho I recommend eating here and if you go here during the weekend Sundays and Saturdays are pretty packed especially if they have one of those festive filipino parties going on. It'll get pretty noisy in there with mang and ung so be prepared to talk loud.Their catering and take out meals (large portion for parties) are pretty awesome. Their lumpia aka filipino eggrolls are awesome!

19.description: A gathering w friends and family brought me to this location in the midst of heavy rainstorm and street flooding but it was worth it!  There's lots of parking and the  wide choices of Filipino dishes excited my palate considering I eat CLEAN.  Still had to watch my portions of course but I even had the crunchy lechon with no pangs of guilt!  The kalamansi juice and halo halo were to die for not to mention all the rice deserts I could think of.  The Leche flan was great but I prefer it thick like the way Mexican flan is. All in all the waiters were attentive and service very quick when needed.  It's a buffet style setting.  Do go!

28.description: This place is amazing! The price is worth it and its hands down delicious.I dunno why on earth would ANYONE compare this to home cooked meal. If you want a home Cooked meal, go HOME and cook it. Who in there right mind is going to prepare all the dishes LQ offers and make it all you can eat??? Under $10 during the week? Under $15 during the weekend? The food is prepared fresh, the recipes are solid and very tasty.People need to stop being so prejudice to the food. Why go there if it isn't what your family makes???It's absurd to demand that, rude, and very arrogant!I have no complaints, I've tried almost every dish, and it was great.I enjoyed it for what it was, and the staff was friendly and attentive.The ambiance itself feels great, I felt like I was in a home away from home.Too bad they aren't open on Mondays.If you want great food for an amazing price, do so here.Leave all those expectations at home when you are cooking at home.Enjoy the food and shut up!

45.description: Considering the fact I'm Filipino.. I thought food was ok.  I still love my parents' home cooking more than theirs.  I'm giving them 1 star cuz practically the whole party had diarrhea the following day.. even the birthday celebrant!!  Just NASTy feeling the following day :(

33.description: this place was really gross.  everything in the buffett looked all drippy and gross.  I tried to eat one of the fried shrimp and it was inedible.  I tried the soup with clams and it tasted with water.  The egg rolls tasted like they came out of box in the frozen food section at Jewel.   It's a really far drive from the city.  The only thing I could eat were these noodles with vegetables that were kind of like Lo Mein but I could have made some microwave "Simply Thai" noodles and it would have been better.   Service was great.

43.description: me and my husband came here last year (Feb. 2011) for the first time, i was so delighted because we don't have any Filipino Restaurant in Wisconsin, we drove more than 2 hours just to get to the restaurant. The experience was good, i never really pay attention to what the food looks like or how it tastes or how the waiters/waitresses served us because it was my first time and i was just so excited to see the jeepney replica filled with varieties of filipino foods. we were satisfied and promised to come back so we came back exactly after a year and this time i was with my mother-in-law and my 3 months old baby. the food this time was really embarrassment, they look like left over and just reheated. i breastfeed my little one and by the time we got to the place, she is already hungry so i asked one of the waitress if i can go inside the function room which by that time was empty so i can comfortably feed my daughter but instead she directed me to just go to the restroom, so i went to the bathroom carrying my daughter, their restroom is so horrible, i can't call the place a restaurant with their restroom like that. the doorknob is broken, one of the toilet is out of order with lots of newspaper on the floor(wth), very outdated. I feel so embarrass that i brought my mom-in-law to that place!!! i will never recommend to my friends this place unless they change what they need to change and they should know it!!

2.description: My hubby and I kidnapped one of my coworkers from Indy to come to Chicago for the day during the summer of 2014.  Well, really, she offered to come along with us since we've never been to Chicago and she used to live here.  But I'm glad we took her up on her offer, because she introduced us to Little Quiapo!  We came straight here after our drive from Indy and we were ravenous!!!  It's AYCE buffet style Filipino restaurant!  You can also order off a menu if you like, but why do that when practically everything is on the buffet?!  About the buffet, there were at least 5 food stations, that I can recall.  (1) the main hot buffet station that offerings like kare kare, dinuguan and pinakbet and it's housed in an old jeepney (talk about authentic), (2) soup station that had sinigang, tinola, etc., (3) fried food station with FRIED CHICKEN SKIN!!! and other offerings (but that's what I remembered the most) (4) dessert station with offerings like leche flan and ginataan, (5) the lechon, crispy pata, lechon kawali, and BBQ station, which is pretty self explanatory To me the food was more about quantity, but the quality was pretty darn good!  Granted it's not my nanay's, tita's or lola's cooking, but for what you pay, it's really fantastic!  I don't recall how much the buffet cost, but it was definitely less than $15 per person.  And the service was friendly, too!

18.description: I love filipino food, this place was a little bit of a let down.So went with my good friends and we had the buffet line food.  It was good, but it also seemed over cooked, undercooked, and a little stale.  Maybe it is the side effect of the food just being out in luke warm heat all day.  But who knows.Don't get me wrong, they had a few good dishes, but I think next time I will order off the menu and skip the buffet line.

41.description: It was good... the leching (crispy roasted pork)  was very good. The buffet could stand to be a little warmer as most of the food was lukewarm. Also the restrooms have some room for improvement.

52.description: Headed to Little Quiapo because our other options were closed.  The wait staff discouraged us to order from the menu so we had the buffet.  I've had a lot of Filipino food being that my in-laws are Filipino.  I even make some every so often.  The variety was nice but the food was just mediocre.  Granted, all Filipino food is slightly different but the quality of the meats and veggie were just poor.  The price was cheap though.  But even so, I had one plate and called it a night.  It wasn't worth eating.

50.description: My family and I go to Little Quiapo once every few months or so. We were in the area recently so we decided to stop by for lunch. I really like the ambiance of the place. It feels like you're in the Philippines with a Jeepney right smack dab in the middle of the room.I feel like I had to get the waiter's attention more than once to refill our water, even though there were very few customers at the time. The food itself was okay though. I have had better. They have one area for the fried foods (lumpia, lechon kewali, etc.). The Jeepney holds the main stuff (rice, pancit, adobo, dinaguan). The last time I went they had some longanisa and fried egg. Yum. There's a section for soups, desserts, and lechon (when they have it). We were there early in the morning, but it seemed like some of the food tasted like it was reheated from the day before. Worth noting, I had the ginataan/bilo-bilo for dessert (glutinous rice balls, tapioca, and other dessert type food cooked in coconut milk). Really good stuff.

4.description: A Filipino Food Buffet! Had lunch here, food was delicious and they offered a good selection of the filipino favorites. Prompt service and reasonably priced for their lunch offers. Family definitely enjoyed it!

6.description: Years later these guys still hanging in their excellent food. Made me gain 100 pounds in five years lol

22.description: The quality of their food and customer service has gone down. I used to love coming here. This was my go to Filipino restaurant. Sorry to say this is my last visit to little Q. The majority of  the food in the buffet look like it has been there for awhile. The egg rolls were rock hard. The fried food was was real greasy as if they refried them every hour. All in all I was very disappointed in their food. Should have just listened to my kid and went to Red Lobster.

15.description: I came by here on a hot summer day and had high hopes. High hopes that was quickly shot down upon entry. There was no AC and we were seated off to the side, directly under metal heated ceiling lamps. Jokingly we attributed the heat to the recreation of the "authentic Philippine experience." We overlooked this minor discomfort in hopes that the food would be worth it. Sadly, it was not. The food was creatively housed in a old makeshift jeepney with the plates stacked up on top of the "engine". Much of the food was dripping with grease and flavorless. None of the food stood out to satisfied my taste buds. Everything I ate would be rated along the scale of "eh... to ...ew". I will however hand it to them for making an awesome avocado shake. The service was subpar. The waiters/waitresses quickly walked right out as quickly as they walked in to refill our glasses. Probably due to the uncomfortable heat. We had to make overt gestures or directly walk to the staff to get anything. Quite a disappointment. I would have to say that I would never recommend this place for a non-Filipino who wants to try Filipino food. This would be a horrible first impression and a poor reflection of what Filipinos have to offer in terms of food.

57.description: First of all, this place is buffet style so you should expect that the food won't be amazing but yet it's still good.The crispy pata and lechon (weekends only) are awesome. They do offer an menu if you're not feeling buffet but I think you're better off with the buffet so you can taste all the dishes and have dessert.

20.description: Food was good... Pricey though by our standards. Would recommend if Filipino food is what you seek.

36.description: This is a great place to try assorted Filipino offerings.  The lunch buffet on weekends is $12 pp, and a great deal.  The selection is quite extensive, and dining area is roomy, casual, and comfortable.  Service was good when we there, though we did oddly have to ask for two tables to be put together for 6 people (duh, not separate 4 and 2). I don't know all the names of the offerings (the photos capture a portion of the selections), but there were several offerings of pork - roast pork, crispy pata (fried pork leg), pork and veggies, etc.  There's also shrimp, fried butterfish, calamari, assorted chicken, beef dishes, various fried starters, soups, and a variety of colorful desserts like taro tapioca and sticky rice.  My favorite was the succulent and fresh roast pork.  The crispy pata was good to, if you got the right piece.  These folks have been around a while - 35 years total, the last 5 here, and the previous 30 at Montrose and Clark.

14.description: Little Quiapo is a buffet filipino style food. I've been to all of the famous filipino restaurants in Chicago and I would say this place is one of the best and if not the best. I went with my family here & with one white guy and we all enjoyed the dishes here. Funny thing is we ran into my parents friends who lives 3 hrs away and came to chicago for shopping && little Quiapo. The most notable ones are Palabok, crispy Pata/Pusit/Shrimp, sinigang na baboy, pinakbet, lumpiang sariwa, putobungbong, dinuguan and fresh buko. My favorite are the Palabok - the noodle and sauce was delicious! One of the best! Dinuguan -different style than what I'm used to but the meat was very tender!Sinigang na baboy - very sour, meat has skin, && vegetable were fresh and cooked well!! I didn't bother trying the other dishes which I know would've been great just by looking at it because the dishes listed above were soooooo good that I kept going back for more! Tues - Thursday all day is $8.95 Fri-Sunday all day is $11.95. The price with the food buffet style is a steal!! You get delicious food, great quality, && affordable price! I will definitely be back!!

58.description: The seafood soondubujjigae (spicy tofu stew) is awesome -- flavorful, good balance of tofu and assorted seafood tidbits.  Comes with crispy rice in a hot stone bowl, extra awesome.  Semi-private rooms on the side that make you feel like you're eating dinner at some dude's house in Korea in the 70's, even more awesome.  But otherwise, the banchan was average and the yukgaejang (spicy beef stew) wasn't too special.  Pajun was good.  The service was fine, the decor is what you'd expect.  If you go to a Tofu House, order the soondubujjigae.

56.description: Chilly, wet, gray, snowy, running errands, Chicago rush hour, early evening...blah.Just hearing the sizzling bowl cures what ails you!Yummy, tummy warming Spicy Tofu Soup...ahhhhh...served in a hot stone bowl.Excellent Bim Bi Bop in the hot stone also.Dark paneling, outdated, nothing special decor.But the food and the prices make up for the lack of style.Servers are all Korean speaking, but speak enough English for you to understand what you are supposed to with your crackling rice and raw egg. When they notice you ate certain side dishes (Banchan) that come with the meal...they ask if you want seconds. Love it!They offer Korean BBQ but I have never tried it here.I don't think I'll ever order anything here that doesn't come in a sizzling hot pot...I imagine I would leave feeling like I missed something.

29.description: I love soondoobu, so when Kenny O. suggested that we come here for soondoobu, I was really excited. Unfortunately the place did not live up to our expectations.When dining in a Tofu House, I figured that their specialty must be soondoobu (tofu soup). It may still be their specialty, but we were very disappointed with ours, and I don't understand why this place has a four-star average. It really isn't good.It started out with a waitress who couldn't understand that Kenny O. wanted a large and spicy kimchi and pork tofu soup and that I wanted a small spicy seafood tofu soup. We got what we wanted, all right, but Kenny's tofu soup was the same size as mine, which meant that it was a small order as opposed to a large order.The first set of side dishes came out with the burnt rice. I didn't understand why they didn't just bring all of the side dishes at once, but that's a minor detail. The burnt rice was too burnt, if there's even such a thing. It was crispy to the point of dryness, and it tasted like old rice to me. Kenny described it as "chewy." It was very unappealing. The kimchi cabbage and cucumbers were the only side dishes that I enjoyed. I didn't like the fish cakes, and I normally love that stuff. It just didn't have enough flavor; it was very bland in taste. I didn't particularly enjoyed the kimchi chives nor did I enjoy the potatoes (they were slightly sour). Then the worst part of all: the mackerel was too fishy. By this point, I felt a bit offended. They gave us expired fish? WTF...Back in California, I'm used to cracking my own egg over the boiling bowl of tofu soup and then mixing it all in. This isn't how they do it here at So Gong Dong though. It came out with the egg already in it, and my egg was a little more cooked than I would have liked. Kenny's was still runny. I was really disappointed. And sure, I like all the little baby oysters, mussels, shrimps, squid, and calamari that came with my soup but the soup in general was so bland that there was very little difference between Kenny's and mine. So again, I was met with disappointment.Save your money; don't go here.

42.description: If you want some great Korean Tofu, this is the place to go. They have some great ban chan dishes (side dishes). You know that this place is quite authentic because the patrons are all Korean. I ordered the beef kimchi tofu. I had to specifically ask for that because that isn't exactly on their menu. In fact, it is all the way at the end of the menu. I was a little surprised by the placement considering that the name of the restaurant is specifically called Tofu House. Anyhow, be careful of the rice bowl. It is extremely hot and you cannot touch it. I was accidentally scalded. I think it was only movable from the plastic base. In fact, just have them scoop it for you in the other bowl and remove it from your table so you don't get accidentally burned.When I first tasted the broth in the tofu soup, it was very tasty....the level of quality that I am used other Tofu Houses in the LA area. I would love to come back here again. There is only pay for parking on the street.

23.description: We love this place. We have been back many times. We always get the dukbokki, some type of kalbi, and then a tofu soup. We also frequent this place when we are sick because they have the best chicken soup. You get this little pot with a whole young chicken, surrounded by a delicious and fragrant broth. The chicken is stuffed with sweet rice. It's pretty awesome. You will have more than enough to take home, and add some water and simmer so you can have more chicken soup to feed your cold.

47.description: Ohhh, my. So Gong Dong Tofu House, you have me hooked! Deliciousness comes in so many forms here. For example:-- Hae mul pa jun: seafood pancakes. Tender, filled with seafood and scallions. With their sesame infused sauce, it's a near perfect food-- Soondubu jjigae: seafood and tofu soup. Hot, with silky tofu, it's packed with protein and spiciness. Texture, flavor, heat!-- Dolsot bibimbap: rice topped with grilled seasoned beef, veggies, chili-bean sauce, topped with a fried egg in an EXTREMELY hot stone bowlThe last item has the great feature of making the rice toasty on the bottom. The idea is to use some water to get the last of it out of the hot volcanic bowl. However, when our server found out that I am Japanese, she knew that we like to eat our toasty-bottomed rice without water. How did she know? She scraped it out for me so I could enjoy it without any hint of sogginess. How's that for good service?So Gong Dong Tofu House has a few rooms off the main dining area, so you can pretend you're the only ones in the restaurant if you want. They also do carry out, but call ahead because they make most of their items fresh to order.I haven't tried their bulgogi or jopchae yet, but when I do, I'll let you know how they are. I'm sure they'll be just as delicious as everything else I've had so far!

8.description: A tiny, hole-in-the-wall place with delicious Korean soondoboo, which a spicy stew of tofu, seafood (or any number of options), and a freshly cooked egg. The soup is perfectly seasoned, always served boiling hot in an oven-baked clay pot. It is all served with the usual complement of tasty side-dishes, including kimchi, rice cakes, and various other pickled and cooked items. It is all prepared authentically and with meticulous attention. A must-go, and absolutely worth the trip if you've never experienced soondoboo before!

31.description: It was good to a hungry and cold traveler. The spicy tofu is piping hot and steamy. Just a bit dark inside...They have free parking across the street in front of the market.

34.description: I just noticed that my friend wrote the last review on Yelp for Tofu House and it's completely opposite from my experience.  Granted, we didn't order the same dishes.  I used to go to school around here so this was my go-to for dol sot bi bim bop.  While I was working in Naperville, I ordered it at Jin 28 and it made me appreciate TH's version more.  The crispyness was done just right rather than how Jin's version was just simply overcooked and rock-hard.

16.description: This place specializes in Soon Dubu, boiling hot tofu soup served in a stone bowl. My favorite is the kimchee pork Soon Dubu.  It's one of those dishes that gets tastier and tastier as it cools down and you get to the bottom of the bowl. They also won an award for best Dol Sut Bi Bim Bop in Chicago, it is really good. Like most Korean places in Chicago it's not going to win any awards for the decor but that's not why you go there. Unlike most Korean places they have no in-table barbecue so you don't leave reeking of smoke and Kalbi. My final recommendation is to try the steamed mandoo appetizer, they're excellent and just spicy enough.

13.description: The service was weird... my friend ordered the chicken fried rice and the server made a twisted face and said "no"... which should have been an indication to order something else. My friend pointed to the entree and the server confirmed the order. It showed up looking like no other chicken fried rice we had ever seen. My friend was VERY polite and ate a fair amount anyway regardless of the strange taste and appearance....Then I got the horrible news that it caused her more than a day on the couch with the trash can next to herBe careful when dining here...but really, don't bother.

11.description: Stay away! Far Away!  This place has the worst service.  When I & my mom heard of this place via reviews from Yelp, We decided to go there. However, when we got in, the place was FREEZING! So cold, even the cashier who was about to ding up our stuff was wearing winter attire. When we did get to order, the cashier BARELY spoke English and couldn't really understand us. When we were done ordering, my mother asked how long was the food gonna take (because she heard previously that her old car was ready 2 pick up because she got in an accident and had to use a rental), she originally said 10 minutes. However, 15 minutes later, I ask the time until it's done and whom I believe is the owner said it was gonna take HALF AN HOUR! I just bought a Sprite and left. I went to tell her the news and boy was she angry! That Sprite was my FIRST and LAST purchase from that establishment.  My mom said if Yelp had a half of a star option, she would've given it.

39.description: This place is 3.5 stars. Panchan is a bit sparse- just 6 dishes with  small portions and nothing special. The soon du bu is pricey but ok. The stew is simple and not that memorable but still tasty. Service is a bit stiff, non attentative and takes forever. At one point i just went up to the register to ask for a takeout box cuz it was taking so long. They do serve a huge portion of good white rice. But overall just an ok experience. Maybe I came on an off day, as you know can happen at  tofu restaurants!

37.description: This is an excellent place to get  soup.  This place is a bit pricier than typical Korean restaurants in the neighborhood for the same tofu dish, but the soup is delicious and the portions are generous.I usually order the pork or kimchi tofu dish, and my girlfriend usually gets the seafood version.  I've been here 10+ times, and always loved the food here.  I've eaten the mushroom version before, and I remember thinking it was pretty good.I get the egg on the side, not in the soup.

0.description: One or two star reviews are mostly about their service. Honestly, just because someone uses the word "no" in a very straightforward way, it doesn't mean they are trying to be disrespectful. Actually, our Korean server told us where to find free parking next time we visit.Regarding food, it's pretty standard Korean fare, good quantity for the price. We shared a seafood tofu soup. It had a rich flavor, ample but not overwhelming spice. A nice touch was the barley in the rice. Ponchon was tasty, they gave us a small fried mackerel too. First time trying that at a Korean restaurant. Nice firm texture with a smoky flavor.

38.description: So, when dining at a place with Tofu House in its name, I suppose one should order a dish wit tofu in it, as this is probably their specialty.  Well, I didn't.  Instead, I ordered the bibimbap with shredded beef.  I figured it was a safe bet as I've had it at other restaurants.  My food arrived in a big, fancy white bowl, with fancy greens on top.  It looked very hearty and tasty.  As I started to mix it up, I noticed the amount of shredded beef was lacking.  The beef that was there, was more like hamburger and pretty bland.  Yeah, not what I expected. I'm not a huge fan of spicy foods, so I typically don't use Korean chili paste.  Well, the server noticed this and proceed to grab the bottle of chili paste, and pour it over my meal.  I was in such shock, I didn't know what to do.  My friend jumped in and stopped her and tried to explain that I don't like super spicy food.  I get it, I'm not Korean.  I still know how I like my food.There was also a snafu with my friend's chicken dumpling soup.  She doesn't eat beef.  There were chunks of what looked like ground beef floating in her soup.  Maybe that is where my meat disappeared to.

51.description: I recently came here for the kimchee and pork tofu soup and the quality has dropped immensely. I was so disappointed that I left over half of the soup in the stone bowl. Their prices have increased but that is never a problem unless the quality remains the same. I think from now on, I will go to my other Korean places for the tofu soup.

27.description: Disappointing. I was really craving some yummy Korean tofu soup and we saw this place got good reviews. We had the tofu soup, bibimbap, and mandu. Both the soup and bibimbap were A-OK. Personally I think they both lacked salt, and the soup needed more spice. Mandu, on the other hand, I can say with confidence that it was the worse mandu I've had. The inside had absolutely no flavor, the wrap was saggy and fell off easily. It was horrible.

32.description: When you come to a place that calls itself a Tofu House, you bet I am going to order tofu and hope that the food is worth the drive from downtown. Nestled in the middle of Korean town on Bryn Mawr, it is not exactly the easiest place to get to. The Bryn Mawr buses serve this place but it would be easier if you are driving, especially when you are getting here from Uptown or Lincoln Park.Many of us got the soft tofu stew as this was truly a test of how well the tofu was prepared. As tofu does not necessarily have much taste on its own, it borrows much of its flavour from the broth which is made from a mixture of vegetables, kimchi and stock. I did think that they did quite a good job with the chigae in general. Banchan was so so though in terms of quality and quantity. I would come back to try other items in the menu if not because of the location.

54.description: It's the only authentic soon doo boo chigae (spicy soft tofu soup) place in Chicago with the hot rice bowl and egg to drop into your scalding soup. It exists at a reasonable distance from my home, so this place is all right with me. Another bonus is the pan fried yellow croaker which comes with the side dishes.They also have other Korean food on their menu, if you're not up for soon doo boo.

48.description: The kalbi was really good here, and so was the chap chae(sp?)  All the little side dishes were tasty and I ate most of them.  Prices are good and portions are just right.It was slow that night but thats a plus in my book, hate to deal with crowds.One of the dishes we ordered was a bot complex. It was a small chicken stuffed with rice and sat in a broth.  The waitress came over and showed us how to do it which I was glad because it was one dish I had never seen.  Downfall I burned my arms three times on the hot metal bowls. Hot enough to leave burn marks for days.  But I'd go back.

44.description: OMG.....I love their Sam Gye Tang and Soon Doo Boo!  What can I say, I have a thing for Sam Gye Tang and Soon Doo Boo!Definitely a place that I will always return for some great korean food.  Yum yum yum!

24.description: Good,I like there soooooo much

7.description: I really wanted to love this place! Sadly, this tofu house left me much to desire. My first visit was a take out order. I ordered the seafood tofu soup, a suggestion from the lady who took my order. A short 2 minute walk back home, I opened the take out order to be a bit underwhelmed. The soup was bland and I struggled to find any seafood in there-- maybe like 2 clams and a couple chunks of fish, that was it. It did come with a few side dishes, in which I found the kimchi that came with it also not very good-- like it wasn't fermented enough. I also ordered the mandu, which was filled with noodles (no meat) and broke apart when I picked it up with my chopsticks. My second attempt to fall in love with this place, I dined in. Ordered the yuk gae jang (spicy beef soup). Though there was some flavor, it still did not compare to the flavorful, spicy soup yuk gae jang should be. As this place is known as the "hole-in-the-wall" gem I've read about, I was sadly disappointed. It's not horrible, underwhelming would be the correct description of my two experiences. I mean, if I was starving and stranded, it wouldn't be a bad thing to get food from here. But being surrounded by so many Korean places and having so many other options, "underwhelming" would not be my first pick.

49.description: we came on a sunday night for dinner. The restaurant was completely empty except for 1 table, and the owner actually reserved a private room for us. We orderedspicy rice noodle - very good, spicy and sweet at the same time with 3 different types of noodles and some vegetables. fish hot pot - full of fish pieces, vegetables, tofu, and clams, the soup was spicy but not overly so. I thought it was ok, although quite warming during the winter time.little dishes - ok, i wish there were more variety, there were just 6 different kinds including kimchi, squid, tofu strips and pickled carrot.home made rice - good, burnt on the outside, and very sticky. chop chae - good, sticky with lots of vegetables & meat. kalbi - ok, it was prepared differently than what i'd imagined. it looked like it was steamed, not bbq. i was disappointed at the taste, it was flavorless and chewy.The owner reminded me of the Korean mom i've never had. She taught us how to hold chop sticks korean style (high on top), pour barley tea into our left over rice pots so we can finish every drop, and told us to eat more. I have to say that this is a very laid back restaurant with virtually non-existent service. We had to flag her (the owner) down several times to order, get more water, and get the check. The food was toward the healthy side, very different from what i expected.

40.description: Second time coming here. I was in the mood for shabu shabu, but the place that we usually go to is closed on Sundays. Saw the tofu house on our way driving to Hmart and had the craving for something warm and healthy on a cold day.Make sure that when you come here to order the tofu soup and add an egg. All of their tofu soups are on the last page of the menu and has a variety of different options. I had the tofu soup with beef and seafood and the boyfriend got the tofu seafood soup. I wasn't too impressed with the beef choice, but the soup was still good. I'd rather get all seafood next time because the beef didn't seem to mix that well with the seafood. The food comes out pretty fast in a sizzling cast iron bowl. The soup includes a bowl of rice that you're supposed to scoop out and eat with the soup. The rice is served in a bowl that's really hot that it tends to stick to the bowl after you scoop it out into another small bowl. All you have to do is pour the barley tea they give you into the rice bowl and the rice will peel off. The crispy rice is very good. I mean, it's nothing special, but I do like the crispiness of it. I do remember the soup being more spicy last time. I'll make sure to have them make it spicy the next time we stop by for a quick dinner.

53.description: A great place for some healthy Korean soup and yummy side dishes!Sometimes I just get a craving to speak a little Korean and to dine on some spicy kimchi and bitter ginseng.  Until I found this place last month (based on a recommendation from Paul Kahan at a local food festival), I did not know where to go for this in my new Chicago home.This place is just right!  The owner was very friendly--she brought a magazine over to our table, provided an enormous selection of side dishes, and prepared some of our food at our table--and tolerated my broken Korean.  I had the tofu ginseng soup and my fiance had the hot stone bim bim bap.  Everything was served HOT (temperature) and tasted very fresh.The meal was delicious and cheap.  We will be back soon!

30.description: I used to love coming here for seafood and beef soondubu because it was the best soondubu in the city, but recently the service and the quality of food has gone downhill.  The last three times I ordered steamed mandoo (dumplings) and Haemul Pajeon (seafood pancake), the mandoo wrapper tasted floury and the pajeon was runny.  I sent them back each time only to be served with an attitude and still undercooked appetizers.So Gong Dong raised the price for the soondubu several times over the past year and now is $10 for a bowl.  I thought the price was justifiable with the raw eggs to crack into our boiling stew and large variety of sides, which included grilled sardines.  My soondubu tonight came with just 4 measly banchan sides and no raw egg or grilled sardines.  The soondubu was a little bit too salty for me tonight too.So Gong Dong is a tofu house and is known for its tofu dishes.  They do have good soondubu and that is all I can vouch for.  But I am not sure it is worth the trip from downtown all the way to North Park area to have some tofu stew anymore.

46.description: First time here and the last!I shall call it LIQUID CIG SOUP (read below and you'll see where the inception of this name came from)... this soup really had a distinct taste, one that would leave a long lasting memory & not for the best. I can understand if it tasted bland, but burnt cigarette ashes????! Ugh, I never liked the smell of smoking so the taste of that soup was enough to make my stomach hurl and ruin my appetite. GROSS! My friend and I ordered bulgogi, fried dumplings, and the liquid cig soup (I can't recall from memory the name of the soup that you guys should beware of!)Ok.Ok. Maybe it was busy? Maybe they didn't have time to make the soup? There were a party of over 20 people that came in when we were there. No No No....BUT, they had a buffet style dinner and the food was already prepared by the time they got there, giving them ample of time to make our soup.... or so I thought.Our order came with the usual side dishes and miso soup. The miso soup was also tasteless and watered down! There was also nothing in the soup.. no seaweed, tofu, NADA. How can the restaurant ruin 2 soups? Best believe my instant miso soup is better than that! Even the side dishes were awful. The bulgogi and fried dumpling were EH at best. Overpriced and nothing special. I haven't had a disappointing meal in such a long time... I was hungry as heck by the time I left. The only thing I liked from the meal was the fish that came with the side dishes..... lol.MAYBE I will have better luck with kalbi from here???

1.description: This is my first time to come here ! The food was delicious! They will refill the side-dishes when they saw the dish is empty . I really like the seafood toufu soap ! Definitely will come back ! Yum !

55.description: Great tofu restaurant. When I have a craving for soondooboo, this is where I go.  Simple and great tasting.  Don't forget to break your egg into the soup and enjoy the rice in the stone bowl.  Been three times, and counting...

9.description: I love soondoobu, so when Kenny O. suggested that we come here for soondoobu, I was really excited. Unfortunately the place did not live up to our expectations.When dining in a Tofu House, I figured that their specialty must be soondoobu (tofu soup). It may still be their specialty, but we were very disappointed with ours, and I don't understand why this place has a four-star average. It really isn't good.It started out with a waitress who couldn't understand that Kenny O. wanted a large and spicy kimchi and pork tofu soup and that I wanted a small spicy seafood tofu soup. We got what we wanted, all right, but Kenny's tofu soup was the same size as mine, which meant that it was a small order as opposed to a large order.The first set of side dishes came out with the burnt rice. I didn't understand why they didn't just bring all of the side dishes at once, but that's a minor detail. The burnt rice was too burnt, if there's even such a thing. It was crispy to the point of dryness, and it tasted like old rice to me. Kenny described it as "chewy." It was very unappealing. The kimchi cabbage and cucumbers were the only side dishes that I enjoyed. I didn't like the fish cakes, and I normally love that stuff. It just didn't have enough flavor; it was very bland in taste. I didn't particularly enjoyed the kimchi chives nor did I enjoy the potatoes (they were slightly sour). Then the worst part of all: the mackerel was too fishy. By this point, I felt a bit offended. They gave us expired fish? WTF...Back in California, I'm used to cracking my own egg over the boiling bowl of tofu soup and then mixing it all in. This isn't how they do it here at So Gong Dong though. It came out with the egg already in it, and my egg was a little more cooked than I would have liked. Kenny's was still runny. I was really disappointed. And sure, I like all the little baby oysters, mussels, shrimps, squid, and calamari that came with my soup but the soup in general was so bland that there was very little difference between Kenny's and mine. So again, I was met with disappointment.Save your money; don't go here.

26.description: Chicken and ginseng soup... best thing in the world on a cold day.Only detraction is that (and this first part is my fault) I brought a vegetarian friend here thinking "Hey- tofu! She can eat this!" Not so much, it turns out- as all the soups are a meat-based stock... and the server didn't seem to grasp the concept of vegetarian and kept suggesting soups... minor issue, but you'd think they'd be used to getting idiots walking in and expecting vegetarian eats... maybe it was a language barrier though (we are decidedly NOT Korean and they definitely are). The jab-chae ended up being the only actual veggie dish on there... and even then i'm not sure it was... Also, the atmosphere is a bit intimidating at first for some reason.Not gonna lie, if you're not versed in Korean cuisine or rather adventurous, this place probably shouldn't be your first stop... But, I'm going to say that's probably true of most places in this neighborhood. It's definitely worth a look and a second try if you don't like it the first time. (It took me more than once to warm up to it completely.)

25.description: Me and my gf drove past this today and thought hey why not. At first we were kinda iffy about this place looking from the outside in, but said screw it cant hurt. Good choice on us though. Really amazing food and the customer service was awesome. I had the Sam Gae Tang ( chicken and ginseng ) soup and my gf had the seafood tofu soup and nothing short of amazing. The server was very kind and friendly, showing us how to eat the food lol. Decor is not bad and the tennis balls add a little laugh lol. But food was great, price is very reasonable and the customer service was awesome. Definitely a great find!

12.description: Disappointing. I was really craving some yummy Korean tofu soup and we saw this place got good reviews. We had the tofu soup, bibimbap, and mandu. Both the soup and bibimbap were A-OK. Personally I think they both lacked salt, and the soup needed more spice. Mandu, on the other hand, I can say with confidence that it was the worse mandu I've had. The inside had absolutely no flavor, the wrap was saggy and fell off easily. It was horrible.

59.description: I learned my lesson, when you go to a soup place, order the soup. I took my in-laws here for dinner last night (group of 12) and we ordered a bunch of things, including Kimchi Jjigae, Soon Dubu Jjigae, Dduk Bok Gi, Jop Chae, etc. Anyway, the Jjigae were great and the nurungji bap (rice porridge you make with the crispy rice burnt in the bottom of the bowl) was nice, but everything else was 'meh'. The ban chan were okay, pretty standard - ohdeng, ggakdugi, etc.If you go here, I'd recommend ordering either the Soon Dubu Jjigae or the Kimchi Jjigae. Both were very good. The other dishes were not so great, especially the ddukbokgi -- odd taste, very sweet sauce, and the rice cakes had a stange texture.Also, as others have noted, the service was terse and intermittent, but otherwise fine. The food came out very quickly and the portions were a good size with a lot of rice. I'd come here again for the jjigae.

21.description: This place is a joke, and I wish yelp has negative star option.Went this disgusting place with my girlfriend, it was after lunch hour, and the restaurant was completely EMPTY, again, no one was there at all.We ordered steamed dumpling, pork tofu soup, and seafood tofu soup.Server brought out steamed dumpling first, and it was nasty. Dried, flat, nothing like their description on their menu.However, we were ok with it, since we mainly went there for tofu soup.Now, there comes our soups.Only one stone pot rice came with, been told they are out of stone pots, because they are having a big group of customers soon, fine.Saving stone pots for booked customers which never showed up until we finished our meal.Found 3 pieces of pork in the pork tofu soup, which were looked like some left over porks they put in the soup (how the heck those pork bellies have grilled marks already?) and 3~5 shrimps in the seafood tofu soup, super tiny dried shrimp which you can get from the cheap frozen mixed seafood bag.I called the owner, and asked what these are.'I didn't put many porks, because pork is not good for your health'Yes, you read it correct.Seriously, that was an answer that came out from the owner's mouth. Well, thank you, you care that much of my health, then why did you even offer the pork tofu soup on your menu list?It was and is the worst tofu soup place ever in my whole life (I am Korean and I know tofu soup)I highly recommend you to stay far far away from this place.

17.description: It was early evening on a Monday and it seemed we were the first customers of the day.  This place has a clean and tidy interior.  I ordered the mixed tofu pot with rice, which is served with a raw egg that you can drop into the bubbling soup.  The mixed pot was supposed to have seafood and meat, but I probably only saw one tiny piece of meat in the soup.  Despite that it was very tasty.  The way they serve the rice was interesting.  They serve the rice in a hot pot so it has this nice crust of overcooked rice at the bottom-- this is a good thing.  They will ask you if I want to add warm barley tea into your rice, so you can have those crispy rice pieces with the barley tea at the end of meal.  It was very nice to end to the meal.  I saw another table have dolsot bibim bob and it looked so delicious.  Although I enjoyed what I had I will definitely order that when I visit next time.

10.description: This soodoobu is greattttt but it AINT the best. BUT I did really enjoy it. I would go back for sure but I really like the soondoobu in the suburbs. The banchan is pretty good but there was like this smashed up fish that was gross. It kinda ruined it for me. haha. If you go.. don't try it. the rest of the banchan was pretty good. the owner was a friend of my friend so she stayed open for us and hooked us up. She was nice. I dont want to bash their place but it was just pretty average.

5.description: I went here during the Kfest in the summer. My friend suggested that we go here since she loves tofu. There was a total of 7 in my group.When walking in, it wasn't too crowded. Most tables were filled, but there was enough room for my group to sit. Waiting wasn't long! It was nice how they placed us in a separate room as if we reserved a spot. The noise level was durable, but the separate room made it so much better. Bathrooms were pretty clean, I must admit. Nothing too disgusting...The prices of the food weren't super expensive. It all depends on what you get. I ordered a bibimbap in a sizzling steel pot ($10). They have a regular bowl of bibimbap for $7, but I prefer crispy rice. My bibimbap had a OK taste. It took a long while for the rice to crisp up, but the rice still tasted pretty delicious! The egg was a typical fried egg, although it would be nice if they had a pokey egg-over easy type for my preference. My bibimbap was supposed to have beef in it, but the amount of meat that they put in there was so little! I love meat, so that was pretty disappointing. One thing that I absolutely loved though was the amount of veggies they put. The sides of veggies also were a great add-on to my bibimbap. Their kimchi is pretty delicious. I wish I ordered their tofu soups (beef or seafood). I tasted a bit of my friends' tofu soups, and they were pretty good.The service people were friendly. Pretty much one of the ladies understood english well enough. Though, I thought it was silly how she thought I gave her an $11 tip. This restaurant is one of the places where you have to walk up to the cash register where they have your bill, and you pay (at least that's what my group had to do). I only had a $10 bibimbap, but no $10 dollar. I payed about $21, and the lady just kept the money with no change back. I mentioned to her that I paid with a 20, and she was like, "oh, you did?". So, luckily I did get my change back. I understand people may make silly small mistakes, so it is not a big deal. if I could, I would give this place a 3.5

3.description: I love the ramen & soondubu together! They have other kinds of soups, you can choose the spiciness level (which is great for my non-spicy friends), and you can choose whether you want it with rice or ramen. And the banchan was good (with variety) too. However, having gone many times, the service isn't always consistent. Some days they would be friendly, and other days not so much. This is a convenient place to have dinner/lunch and then some good coffee/ dessert in the same strip mall area, all in one.

35.description: Service here is scary but sometimes fun...? If you don't take it seriously.This is the place that made me fall in love with Korean food, yessesir-ee! Now Korean food is def one of the top top foods. The tofu stews are to die for!

19.description: Spicy Seafood soup aka "soondubu jjigae" order it again and again. My favorite spot for this tasty dish is Chicago. Prices are great, service is what it is, beer is cold.Just go and try it for yourself, prove me wrong........

28.description: I'm a fatass and I couldn't even eat the stuff.

45.description: Nom nom nom!! Grabbed a quick bite here last week before the show at Hollywood Lounge. Service was quick,efficient,just what I needed.My dinner companion and I shared the Seafood Pancake appetizer.It was different,but delicious. Thin pancake stuffed with sqiud,shrimp and other seafood. It was yummy and I could have eaten that as a meal.This baby was huge!My friend had Bulgolgi and she proclaimed it perfection. I had a spicy veggie noodle dish. Our server must not have liked the way I was tossing my noodles together.She came over and helped me do it! It was cute,and I,admittedly,. was not giving them a vigorous toss....Food was reasonable,portions huge.I really want to come back when I have more time to relax and enjoy a meal.

33.description: Spicy Seafood soup aka "soondubu jjigae" order it again and again. My favorite spot for this tasty dish is Chicago. Prices are great, service is what it is, beer is cold.Just go and try it for yourself, prove me wrong........

43.description: Highly recommend their soups, very very tasty and filling. My usual go to dish is their bibimbap, havent had a chance to try their bulgogi yet though. The seafood pancake!? Enormous...I had no idea it was going to be that plentiful. Definitely a hidden gem over on bryn mawr, I will be going back for more!

2.description: Definitely an authentic hole-in-the-wall type of place which I usually love. Came Sunday evening and were the only ones there. Our server was a sweet older Korean lady. To note, her English is not great, so there definitely may be some miscommunication.I had the large seafood sundubu, and to me it wasn't that large. It was alright in flavor, could have been spicier, and definitely have had better. However, I enjoyed that it came piping hot and was served with raw eggs to drop in. It was also nice and traditional in the way they cook their rice that is left with a crispy crust. The banchan was quite good and enjoyed most of them. I also enjoyed that we got to sit in one of the private rooms. Satisfactory no frills place with reasonable prices, but definitely better places around.

18.description: Solid sundubu complete with surly owner and side dish smorgasbord.  Service is a tad on the slow side.  Haven't tried anything other than the tofu soup and the pretty good japchae (not mind blowing but it'll do if you are in the mood) so can't speak to the rest of the pretty diverse menu, which is stew heavy.  I only wish they gave you raw eggs to drop in the hot broth, as is custom in some similar joints.

41.description: Spicy tofu soup is one of my favorites growing up and such a treat when I get it now...my parents used to take me here when I was younger and we'll still go sometimes when we want soondoobu and mom isn't in the mood to make it. The food is always consistently good, and I like pretty much everything I've gotten here. I usually also go for the mackerel which is done fairly well too. They give you the main banchan (couple of kimchis are there, but the selection seems to rotate based on my memory), but you don't go here for the sides. Once you get your rice into the bowl, throw some of the tea into the hot metal bowl and let it sit...the leftover hot rice will eventually turn into a porridge that's delicious and a perfect way to finish the meal with the rest of your banchan.The place is somewhat  of a hole in the wall and as other reviewers stated, service can be slow. The last time I went one of the servers asked me to help her fix her phone so that was a bit random, but hey, I was able to fix it! I love coming here, and I'm very happy that I have friends that literally jump at the chance to go whenever I suggest going. Give it a shot - you probably won't be disappointed.

52.description: Been here twice now and had the spicy tofu seafood soup twice. The place is a bit small and not around many things, but this is a destination if you're feeling under the weather or any other time you feel like having some warmth in your system!

50.description: My friend knows that I have a thing for soon du bu, as I regularly visit BCD in California and have not found a suitable substitute. Hence, he suggested we go to So Gong Dong. It was empty when we came in, probably due to the massive snowstorm going on outside. I had the beef soon du bu, which was really flavorful and the mild version was just the right amount of spice for me (I am a total spice pansy). The rice pot was filled with barley tea, which is much better than the plain water that they use at BCD. Side dishes were also good. I will be back! =]

4.description: A large group of my friends went to So Gong Dong Tofu House last night for a going away party. I had seafood and beef tofu soup (with a raw egg, of course), and it was absolutely delicious. Our servers were attentive, refilling our water classes and making sure we had everything we needed throughout our meal. They accommodated multiple credit cards (I love places that make it easy to split the bill between diners!), and they were delightfully personable. It was a truly wonderful experience. I'll be back!

6.description: I actually happened upon this place during Korea Fest because all the street vendor food was over-priced and looked unappealing. My meal was probably less than what I would have paid if I purchased food at the fest. I tried the seafood soondubu and I was satisfied. The banchan was okay but most of the dishes were way too salty--I was so dehydrated the rest of the day and I felt so bloated afterwards due to my high salt and water intake (it doesn't help that the water cups are tiny). The bf ordered a soup as well, but was disappointed by how little meat there was in his dish. Although the waitresses were nice, the service was slow.

22.description: This soodoobu is greattttt but it AINT the best. BUT I did really enjoy it. I would go back for sure but I really like the soondoobu in the suburbs. The banchan is pretty good but there was like this smashed up fish that was gross. It kinda ruined it for me. haha. If you go.. don't try it. the rest of the banchan was pretty good. the owner was a friend of my friend so she stayed open for us and hooked us up. She was nice. I dont want to bash their place but it was just pretty average.

15.description: The Spicy Tofu Soup here is Totally Awesome! The Stone Bowl Bi Bim Bap is Very Tasty. The Ginseng Chicken Soup is Outstanding. Other Dishes are also Pretty Good, but the Standouts are the "Soups." The Decor is Low Rent, but so are the Prices, so everything evens out. Definitely Worth A Try.

57.description: I think I need to go for their tofu soup because I wasn't wowed by their rice dishes.  I had ordered korean bbq from this place, it was flavored great and cooked perfect.  The service was not the best.  I'd rather go to san soo gab san.I was really looking forward to this place.  I may need to give their soup a go since it's what they are known for.

20.description: This is definitely one of my go-to places in Chicago for Sundubu Chiggae-I absolutely LOVE Korean spicy tofu soups :DI always get the seafood tofu soup medium spicy. They usually serve a pretty good variety of side dishes (panchan?) that taste good as well. What I really enjoy about this place is the value. I get so full off about $10 and usually still have some leftovers to bring home and enjoy later!The area is a little shady (my friends car got broken into once while we were eating here) and the restaurant itself is by all means not fancy, but I like the food-

36.description: I really wish I could like this place, but I really really really don't.My favorite tofu place in the world is Cho Dang (which is in Mt. Prospect) but I don't always want to drive out there to get my tofu soup (soon doo boo) fix! Therefore, I went here w/ a friend w/ hope. GOD WHAT A BUMMER! First of all, I like it when my tofu in the soup is nice and chunky big.... they like mixed it in the back or something, b/c it was teeny tiny & did not make it look appetizing at all. Second, the consistency was way too watery. I like mine spicy & not watered down. Third, my meat was all clumped up in a ball (I got the beef soon doo boo). It's like she threw in a ball of frozen meat & they never separated in the bowl. Last but not least, the service sucked. I'm Korean & I understand Korean restaurants & sometimes their lack of service, but I was already annoyed by the food that I just wanted her to give me a reason to come back. In the end, unless you like really watered down soup, this is not the place to go. I'm just going to have to drive to Mt. Prospect to eat soon doo boo (which is so worth it!)

14.description: I used to love coming here for seafood and beef soondubu because it was the best soondubu in the city, but recently the service and the quality of food has gone downhill.  The last three times I ordered steamed mandoo (dumplings) and Haemul Pajeon (seafood pancake), the mandoo wrapper tasted floury and the pajeon was runny.  I sent them back each time only to be served with an attitude and still undercooked appetizers.So Gong Dong raised the price for the soondubu several times over the past year and now is $10 for a bowl.  I thought the price was justifiable with the raw eggs to crack into our boiling stew and large variety of sides, which included grilled sardines.  My soondubu tonight came with just 4 measly banchan sides and no raw egg or grilled sardines.  The soondubu was a little bit too salty for me tonight too.So Gong Dong is a tofu house and is known for its tofu dishes.  They do have good soondubu and that is all I can vouch for.  But I am not sure it is worth the trip from downtown all the way to North Park area to have some tofu stew anymore.

1.description: I am in love with bargain shopping. LOVE IT! My love for shopping and good prices has helped me to return to this store. As of yet, I've had no luck with a purchase. I am not in love with messes, disorganization, sloppiness, or rudeness. I have tried to shop this store a few times. I have found it to be messy, and disorganized.I have found some merchandise to be lovely and well priced. The checkout lines (on the days I was present were incredibly long (more than 12 people stacked and waiting).The sales associates were kind, helpful and friendly!!!!

9.description: Even though the shoe section is fairly limited I love it!  Every time I've stepped in here, I have seen shoes that I like in my size, for a great price.Now besides the shoes, everything else is...eeeehhh....ok.  Lots of families come here with their children who like to run around.  The layout is horrible, very little space to walk around, I found myself having to walk around a lot because I couldn't get through an aisle if there was someone else there.  And the place is seriously disorganized.  I understand with all the chaos it is difficult to keep it neat, but it was so bad I didn't feel it was worth rummaging through, and I am the type of person who usually loves to scour the racks for something good.  But then again, maybe I just wasn't feeling up to the task that day.  Anyway, if you're not the type of person who likes to hunt for a good deal, don't come here.

12.description: This store Ross dress for less is really bad they have bad management  lately they have the dirtiest washroom lately and the store is always a mess , shop there and you will see that is the truth , waiting in line is so long no employees to help in line even though price are ok  overall the store is bad to shop , rather shop somewhere else and pay for the price but with the proper service and clean washroom

21.description: Kudos to Lorelei for beating me as the "first to review". I was sure I was gonna be on top of this one! ;0) Anyway, I had a pretty decent experience at some other locations and decided to check this one out, as it is super close to the house. I agree with Lorelei that It is much smaller than other locations. Most of the women's stuff is downstairs and men's and housewares is upstairs, which I was too lazy to check out. I went early this morning (Sunday), just as they opened and everything was super organized and clean. It seemed all the employees were on point trying to make the store look good for the "grand opening" weekend.Again, this is like a TJ Maxx / Marshalls type set up, but I would liken the clothes a lot more to CW Price. I would say there are some gems if you are willing to look through the chaotic racks, but not as much quality stuff as TJ / Marshalls-I feel like they get the leftovers from better stores and therefore you find better stuff. This is like the leftovers from cheap stores so the selection is not as impressive. HOWEVER, since I am a "digger", I love to sift through the crap and find the gems! I did spot a few Calvin Klein business dresses I had seen at Marshalls for about the same price. I got a Calvin Klein "looking" dress (same cut / style / color scheme) for a mere $19.99. I also scored a very nice, classy looking Guess bag for $57. Way more than I'm used to paying for purses, but it is a really nice everyday bag. I also feel in love with these crazy shoes (they were *very* CW Price) for $19.99 but they had every size but the one I needed. I may have to check out a few more locations to score those shoes!Overall, a good experience. It would be fun to pop in from time to time to see what other good deals I can score!

16.description: I REALLY want to like this store because it's on my beaten path. They have some good buys and have gotten great garden décor and housewares, but it is definitely hit or miss. What I find are the biggest turn offs are the lack of manners & consideration of the fellow shoppers. I have been pushed, shoved and smacked with a shopping carts and never once did I hear one 'excuse me' or 'sorry'. Then after being assaulted by the etiquette-challenged , you get to wait 25 deep in line while there are 2 very unmotivated cashiers that look like they would rather be having root canals than wait on customers. Not sure the savings are worth it.

17.description: This New Ross was just ok.I expected more.... There wasn't much production the boys section. Meh.Ill go only because it's two blocks away but the Location on Touhy is still my favorite!

10.description: This locations customer service and staffing is VERY poor. To begin with, while in the dressing room, I heard some employees talking about leaving early. Then, my blood pressure dropped, my hands began shaking, and I found that it was time to go. I waited in line for about 15-20 minutes to check out. I found it hard to stand while in line due to my blood pressure. Once I got to the register, I spoke to a man (I believe his name was Dave) and tried telling him my situation and that another register should be opened. Before I could finish, he began ranting in a condescending way that he was sorry and that he understands. He repeated this same statement, loud and rudely. He then mentioned that I would have to talk the woman whose picture was on a board of the front entrance.  He says this to me as he points to the board. I had to tell the man to stop talking because he was not helping the situation or my current health. He also had to ring up my order twice. I went Panera right after and got amazing service there - feeling much better. The reason I am making this review is because I had filled out a survey with Ross and never heard back. Something as serious as this should have been acknowledged.

5.description: I guess I expected too much!I came in to Ross today during the grand opening celebrationand I was excited thinking everything would be brand new, organized,and there would be lots of merchandise on the shelves.Boy, did I miss the call on this one!This store is very small, it has 2 floors of various merchandise.I couldn't believe how disorganized it looked already, confusing storeset-up, things thrown around.And.. waiting in line to check out.. total confusion!They had 1 line of people waiting to check out and then I found outthat I was in the "Returns" line..So, this cashier/associate tells me to come up to his register and I saidObviously I was in the wrong line.. he looks at me and says"It Happens"Yes, and it will continue to happen to others as well if they don't designatewhich line is for returns and which lines are for purchases!So.. I was not in the least impressed by this stores "Grand Opening"because it was a total disappointment.However, I did buy a great purse that retailed for $60.00 for $26.99..That was a sweet little deal..Other than that.. no reason to return here..What a let down...

11.description: I discovered Ross in NYC, and the downtown store is amazing!  I was really looking forward to the chain coming to the Chicagoland area.  Unfortunately, the few Ross locations that are here are pretty lackluster.  This particular one seems to be the smallest/messiest one I've been to.  If you go on a weekend, it's a huge mess and hard to shop anything - clothing sizing is mixed on the racks and the shoe department looks like it was bombed.  I was able to pick up some a BCBG shirt for 19.99 (picked it off the floor), but it's not worth the effort to go here and spend lots of time digging.

22.description: I guess I expected too much!I came in to Ross today during the grand opening celebrationand I was excited thinking everything would be brand new, organized,and there would be lots of merchandise on the shelves.Boy, did I miss the call on this one!This store is very small, it has 2 floors of various merchandise.I couldn't believe how disorganized it looked already, confusing storeset-up, things thrown around.And.. waiting in line to check out.. total confusion!They had 1 line of people waiting to check out and then I found outthat I was in the "Returns" line..So, this cashier/associate tells me to come up to his register and I saidObviously I was in the wrong line.. he looks at me and says"It Happens"Yes, and it will continue to happen to others as well if they don't designatewhich line is for returns and which lines are for purchases!So.. I was not in the least impressed by this stores "Grand Opening"because it was a total disappointment.However, I did buy a great purse that retailed for $60.00 for $26.99..That was a sweet little deal..Other than that.. no reason to return here..What a let down...

0.description: A very critical person will give this location a two (2)-star rating.  I typically have my morning coffee and am more cheerful than the most, so I will render a 2.5-rating on this Ross Dress for Less.  I gave this location a benefit of the doubt when they had their grand opening last year, but they never really improved.  The organizations weren't too bad this morning, but there was no wow factor on their merchandize: the same old boring tops with a "matching necklace" on it (the most peculiar fashion design...ever) or sequin dresses that are only good for clubbing.  If you want to find some serious or grown-up clothes, this Ross isn't going to be the best location for them.  Shopping at a discount store, I can somewhat overlook the service component.  However, I've got to say something about what I witnessed today.  As I was waiting to get rung up, there were customers who wanted to return the merchandize they purchased previously; on the other hand, they were customers, like myself, who wanted to make purchases.  I understand that a store can experience a shortage of working staff from time to time, yet this cashier (yes, I mean you...you were the only one on duty at 1200 hour on Wednesday, 02/04/2015) was way more concerned on when she could take her break than a line of customers in front of her.  Sweetie, I get it!  By law you're going to get one most definitely.  Would you mind clearing the line and offering a better attitude to the customers who volunteer to shop at your store?  I promise that Jesus will give you a break even if your supervisor vetoes.  Other than the lackadaisical service I received, I was able to find the olive oil lotion I wanted to try to see if it works on my ultra dry hands.  My recommendation on shopping for beauty items in any discount store is to "inspect" the cover or the lid to ensure that nothing has leaked or tempered by any means.On the side note, this Ross isn't so pedestrian-friendly.  If you're on public transportation on a snowy or a post-snowy day, make sure you are wearing a sturdy pair of snow boots because all the snow is shelveled to the roadside where pedestrian walkways are supposed to be.

20.description: This store very small & didn't have a lot of Stuff. The line is also confusing seems like. All Ross have the same mess up cash wrap & always have only 1 or 2 cashiers. The selection here is very slim as even though 2 floors the racks are not full nor really organize. If u r in area stop by if not don't go out of your way not worth it.

19.description: Very little to choose from compared to the Ross's in CA. A lot of small and large tops but what about clothes for people that wear med tops? Also very limited selection of shoes for large feet. Since when should people who wear size 10 shoes have such little selection ? I don't plan on coming back to this Ross.

2.description: I've heard of this store, but had never been so I popped in one day on my way to the Lincolnwood mall. I still need some things for my new apartment, like rugs, and don't like spending on fortune on them since my cats love to ruin them. I once caught my declawed cat pulling tufts out with her teeth! Maybe one day they will realize that I don't like shag rugs! My first thought upon entering was, "Is this place going out of business?" The shelves and racks were so barren! A lot of the merchandise was damaged and some shoes looked like they had been worn a few times then returned. Those scuff marks don't fool me! I guess this is the place where leftovers from Marshall's/TJ Maxx go to die. The home goods section was better than the clothing. There were a lot of cute throw blankets and organizers, but other than that it was slim pickins. I was happy to finally find a neat kitchen rug ($10!) that did not have a coffee, wine or a creepy chef print! Not everyone wants their kitchen to have a restaurant theme, as much as I love having food made for me. I dug around the clearance shelves and found a metal, vintage typewriter hook thingy for a few bucks. It makes an awesome key holder in my entry way! Oh and they had some fun Hello Kitty kitchen gadgets, but most were damaged or had some weird gunk on them. I managed to find a spatula for $2.Despite being unimpressed at the paltry selection, I managed to find some treasures! If you're on a decorating budget and don't mind digging around, you can find some goodies. There's always a silver lining!

18.description: When the store first opened, it was way more organized and actually had stuff on the shelves, recently, I'm not sure if a new manager took over or if they staff just don't care but the store is a complete mess. The shoe department for women looks like a disaster area, you are walking and tripping over shoes constantly, not a good selection in styles or sizes either. The clothing is also very disorganized, and not much choice. Up stairs, barren shelves seem to be the norm, they seem unable to fold the towels, items are left on the floor and had foot prints all over. I have no idea if the staff actually bother to put items away in a neat manner, a lot of shelves just seem to have items thrown on them. This store is very crowded, long check out wait times, people leaving carts in the middle of aisles everywhere. No actual customer help when you need it. I bought a comforter from the store, it fell apart not too long afterwards. Cheap merchandise to match their cheap prices and lack of customer service and clean store. After a few visits, the store is on a downward spiral, I think I will just save myself the headache and go to Target and just spend a bit more and not have to wade through all the junk on the floor.

13.description: The deals are OK! it's a hit or miss. There are times where you can find great shoes and clothes. The staff is friendly but not organized.

4.description: I've been to several Ross locations in the area. This one by far is one of the worst. It is an old Barnes and Nobles or Borders.  It's one of the few that has two floors. The first time I walked in, the store smelt horrible. I cannot exactly describe the smell. This should have made me turn around but I stuck through it. So, I checked out their ladies department. The clothing was bleak and not cute or chic. I checked out the non-existing shoe department.  There were only a few pair of shoes, mostly gym shoes. I then went upstairs. This is where the kids, house goods and men departments are located.  I went to the home goods department nothing grabbed my attention. Their children's department had four racks of clothing for babies and youth (both sexes). I didn't go over to the men's sections; but I am pretty sure it was probably lacking as well. I lefted empty-handed.

6.description: The most depressing store of its kind I've been to; so disorganized, so messy, the merchandise looks like lowest grade hand-me-downs. Don't bother to look for your size in a section where you would think it should be, and surely don't come with a plan to buy something specific, you'll never find it!

15.description: I was so excited when I found out that Ross was moving into our neighborhood. That emotion quickly turned to disappointment when I entered the store. Dirty Chaos is the best way to describe what I saw. For being a new store it certainly looked tired, dirty and disorganized. The sad selection of clothes (strewn all over the store) only added to my disappointment. What a bad selection of merchandise!This neighborhood really needs a "Anchor Store", sadly I don't see this one lasting.

7.description: Pros: amazing deals and they mark things down weekly based on when the item arrives and if it sells. So it's really stupid but my friend picked out two wallets that were the exact same but one was a lower price. Cashier wouldn't let her take the lower price which was just dumb IMO.Cons: small and crowded. You are only allowed to see one piece of jewelry at a time. This policy is enforced literally bc I was comparing rings and the sales manager held up one with his own hands bc I wasn't allowed to hold both of them with my hands. The rings were $10.00 or less; they acted as if I was holding a Rolex or Patek. The customer service is subjective but generally you get the feeling that most of the employees aren't happy and are prob underpaid bc they act in a manner that isn't classy or even mildly friendly.The point of this store is to get an awesome deal and Ive walked out of this store w some amazing deals- which brings me back each time! Caveat emptor!

8.description: Kudos to Lorelei for beating me as the "first to review". I was sure I was gonna be on top of this one! ;0) Anyway, I had a pretty decent experience at some other locations and decided to check this one out, as it is super close to the house. I agree with Lorelei that It is much smaller than other locations. Most of the women's stuff is downstairs and men's and housewares is upstairs, which I was too lazy to check out. I went early this morning (Sunday), just as they opened and everything was super organized and clean. It seemed all the employees were on point trying to make the store look good for the "grand opening" weekend.Again, this is like a TJ Maxx / Marshalls type set up, but I would liken the clothes a lot more to CW Price. I would say there are some gems if you are willing to look through the chaotic racks, but not as much quality stuff as TJ / Marshalls-I feel like they get the leftovers from better stores and therefore you find better stuff. This is like the leftovers from cheap stores so the selection is not as impressive. HOWEVER, since I am a "digger", I love to sift through the crap and find the gems! I did spot a few Calvin Klein business dresses I had seen at Marshalls for about the same price. I got a Calvin Klein "looking" dress (same cut / style / color scheme) for a mere $19.99. I also scored a very nice, classy looking Guess bag for $57. Way more than I'm used to paying for purses, but it is a really nice everyday bag. I also feel in love with these crazy shoes (they were *very* CW Price) for $19.99 but they had every size but the one I needed. I may have to check out a few more locations to score those shoes!Overall, a good experience. It would be fun to pop in from time to time to see what other good deals I can score!

3.description: The atmosphere here is pretty ghetto. Not much items to choose from. Overall I would say this place definitely not an average three stars.

14.description: Yikes! Total disaster in here. Disgusting, dirty, stuff thrown everywhere. No one cares about anything !! I did the loop around the store just to be slightly polite not to vomit and walk out. As I quickly left the store the security officer chuckled (probably at the disgusted look on my face and how quickly I ran out). Seriously I was afraid to touch anything and I'm an avid tj maxx abd Marshall's shopper so um this was a shock.

3.description: I met Milanie in April 2012 when she gave me the BEST manicure/pedicure of my life! If you can't catch her on the go ... you can find her at Huma Salon on Milwaukee Avenue.  She is truly the best in the business.  She came to my house once and it was such a time saver, but really I go where she is!

1.description: Lanie was so sweet and professional.  It was a real treat having her come to my home for a manicure.  The French mani she did was amazing.  I topped off the evening with an eyebrow threading!  You feel so pampered.  I highly recommend Her services to all busy ladies.  It was so nice to not have to get a sitter and just relax at home while getting pretty.  Looking forward to working with her again!
