2.description: Lanie was fabulous!  She was able to come to my house with only 24 hours notice, she was courteous, sweet and fun. She had a great selection of colors and did a wonderful job on mani pedis for me and a girlfriend.  I would definitely recommend her for your mobile mani pedi needs!

5.description: There was a spa party hosted at my home on December 21, 2012 for a family member's birthday party. Not only was Milanie and her team both friendly and professional, she was very flexible as arrangements for the party were made at the last minute! In addition to this, not only have I received various compliments on my nails, I was extremely satisfied at how my eyebrows looked after getting them threaded. I am VERY picky about my eyebrows and she did an excellent job on them the FIRST time around. I would without a doubt recommend Lanies Mobile Spa Services to anyone. I look forward to having another spa party soon and I will be giving Milanie a call!

0.description: Lanie is the best!! I hired her last week to come do a mani/ pedi for a friend who was in the hospital. Lanie was so friendly, professional & well prepared! I've been telling all my friends about her.

4.description: I hired Milanie for my daughter's 7th birthday party.  She was very easy to work with, and her rates were very reasonable.  She did an amazing job on the girls' nails, and the girls loved her.  I plan to use her again and highly recommend her!

58.description: The burgers are great here but pricey. I haven't tried the other stuff but I like this place before the remodel.

56.description: Overall a good burger chicken and Gyros place. Not great at anything in particular just solid at pretty much everything. Sometimes you just want a good meal at a fair price and charcoal delights has got you.

29.description: Good food and good service! We had the charbroiled chicken sandwich and the hotdog. Both were cooked fresh and flavorful.

42.description: Been going here since I was a kid... Best quality fast food for super cheap IMHO. Two scotty dogs with everything on em and your all set. The broasted chicken is absolutely amazing as well.All around this is a classic chicago fast food establishment. If you want want frozen assembly line food go across the street to McDonalds.

23.description: It looked, smelled, & sounded better than it tasted. I have been passing by this place for years and I finally gave it a chance. 1/2 pound burger cooked medium-rare with the works. The burger was not cooked as I ordered (it was well), the toppings werent even presentable. And the burger had no flavor. First and last time I go here.

47.description: Even before I had the sub par italian beef I would have given his place 3 stars. Do not ever get the Italian beef here. It might have been from the frozen food aisle at 7-11. I've never had a bad Italian beef till here. Moving past the disgusting Italian beef, the gyros here are good. Not a huge portion, but we are in a recession. I've had a burger from here and it wasn't remarkable.

8.description: Really??? This afternoon I ordered lunch which was $ 19 and change: 8.19 meal with two orders of extra pita (.99 each) somehow added to more than double that! The older man in the light green shirt made it sound like a deal :/This evening I went for a Greek sakad- I did NOT say chicken to the young girl! A VEGETARIAN dinner does not call fir chicken! Imagine my surprise to find meat on the salad.My friend wanted the Grecian chicken dinner but they were out...perhaps I should have taken it as a sign :'(  and left then.

31.description: I ordered the "Philly cheese-steak sandwich" and it is by far the worst one I have ever had anywhere. The way they prepare is not the traditional method where the meat is shredded into smaller pieces and mixed with the cheese. Here they put two or three solid pieces of meat with cheese on top and if you have onions and green peppers they put very big pieces, like way too big. I think they must have something against chopping? Their preparation method I could forgive them for but what made me throw my sandwich away after two bites was that half the meat was a solid strip of fat that I could not bite through. I actually couldn't force my teeth through the huge strip of fat that ran the length of all the meat or savagely rip off a piece. So they basically sold me garbage. PS. Even my cat wouldn't eat the meat!

34.description: It's greasy, it is clean and fast and it is perfect for two guys who finished (1st and 4th!) in a 20-gym Triathlon! Heartily Indulging in Burgers after- Nice work fellas! Get the Barbecue Sauce! This sauce made the indulgence worthwhile for me- it is smoky, flavorful and I wanted to douse everything in it from my sandwich to the fries to the pickles... and it was goooood. Ketchup is for sissies compared to this yumminess that you don't want to miss. I would wear it if I could and be perfectly content to huff the smoky sweet goodness as long as possible even if it makes me look like an extra from Stephen King's Carrie- it is that delicious. They ordered the Cheese Sauce too- and while I did not partake, my Boyfriend did and for him, it made the fries and burger even more of a guilty pleasure. The menu is huge. There are many burger size options on the overwhelming menu- any of the options are likely better for you than the McDonald's across the street.

16.description: Very nice chicken kebab pita, excellent flavor, fresh ingredients, but the chicken didn't have much in the way of a charcoal taste.

13.description: I drove by this place and I wanted to try something that was in the neighborhood.  I ordered the cheeseburger combo and my total was close to $8.  The fries were fresh and they tasted ok.  I requested grilled onions on my cheeseburger.  Other toppings on the cheeseburger include ketchup, mustard, delicious pickles, cheese, and onions (which I requested to be grilled).  The bun itself was buttery, soft, and perfect!  Their cheeseburger was much tastier than Portillo's cheeseburgers in my opinion!  I was pleasantly surprised and fulfilled from this meal.  Every bit was well worth it!

11.description: Great gyros! Best i have had so far, in the Chicago/suburbs area.thin, tasty slices with fresh toppings and pita. mmmm :)

39.description: I was in the mood for a good dose of greasy food and their Grilled Cheese sandwich certainly took care of the craving!  Aside from the fact that it was stacked with 3 slices of bread and god knows how many slices of American cheese, this sandwich really reminded me of the homemade grilled cheese sandwiches my mom used to make for me as a kid-and those are good memories.  Their prices are very reasonable and I would definitely come back for another ooey gooey cheesey delight.  After reading some of the reviews I think I may also give their gyro a try!

37.description: I like Charcoal Delights. They have good service, good food, and their atmosphere is average. I think that their food is quite average, so I don't really have a favorite though I like the gyros. If you are ordering for lunch there, I recommend the gyros and fries or a cheeseburger and fries (make sure not to say the 1/4 cheeseburger, it below sub par). Also, avoid the fried chicken. It's way to dry, but their biscuits are delicious.

0.description: Excellent customer service. Workers are so friendly and I felt like they all truly cared about the restaurant. Their burgers are delicious and has a taste that other burgers don't really have. Shakes are good and atmosphere is really warm and welcoming. Definitely coming back.

38.description: The scotty hot dog with everything and the gyro are very delicious. My favorite thing on the menu though is the coffee. Surpasses dunkin donuts coffee with cream and sugar by a landslide. Who'd a thunk that?

51.description: $2.29 for hotdog and fries....complete with neon relish.We usually pick this up for lunch and jump across the street for a large $1 coke from McDonalds.The burgers are charcoal cooked (duh...you're eating at Charcoal Delights) which is a refreshing change from McD's across the street. I love this little local place, stop in or go through the drive thru.

27.description: Everything is good. I haven't had a hot dog in ages because everything else is too good. Especially the charcoal chicken sandwich. Fast service, we call ahead. Nice family.I work near the one in DesPlaines and that one is great too.

32.description: great for chicken , broiled . they give you the whole or half chicken . and very good price. does not have waiter but if your order takes to long they still bring to your table .

54.description: When Charcoal Delights announced their 40th anniversary a year or two ago, I realized that I've been eating there since their second year in business, back when they had a smaller building at the same location and called themselves The Hot Dog Pit. Couldn't tell you how many plates full of burgers, Italian sausage, Italian beef and grilled cheese sandwiches I've eaten there, or how many buckets full of their homemade BBQ sauce. The place isn't perfect (sometimes a "medium-well" burger is noticeably overdone and dry), but it's consistently good, which is why I keep going back. And not everything is the usual drive-thru fare. They make a pretty good Greek salad, which makes a nice supper on a hot summer evening. I plan on eating there for years to come.

48.description: A North Park favorite, this is a great place to go get some fast food.  Commonly known as "The Pit," this place grills all of their meat over a charcoal grill instead of the hot stove.  The place has a great menu that ranges from burgers and dogs to gyros and hot sandwiches.  I personally recommend the burgers.  The fries here are very good as well.  The staff is friendly and welcoming, and the restaurant is clean with plenty of places to sit.  I would pick this place over McDonald's (across the street) any day.

44.description: This place has lost it's way.  It was, at one point, the antithesis of mighty Mc Donald's across the street (they were once right next to each other) and that's what made them special. The owner back then knew they had to do something different; something special and that's where the charcoal came in which they still use to this day.  My visit consisted of a half pounder medium rare for my wife and a gyros special for me. The gyros was off the spit and not pre frozen strips and the sandwich as a whole wasn't too big (about the size of my hand and not my head). Fries were good, not great (not fresh cut) and we ordered cheese sauce on the side which was surprisingly tangy and hearty, not watery and tasteless glue.  The bad thing was the burg. The Swiss cheese was processed cheese and there were bits of bone and gristle in the meat. Yuk.  The meat tasted weird too, like hamburgers grilled by an amateur in their backyard with too much lighter fluid.  The restaurant itself was remodeled but there were hints of yesteryear and it felt a bit grungy with the mop and mop bucket sitting out near the order counter. Unfortunately they've lost their way and could learn from their neighboring domineering franchise; cleanliness and consistency is a must in order to keep your customers.

24.description: I've been coming here since I was a kid before it was rebuilt into what it is now. Food is Delicious! Charcoal flavor makes a difference. SuperDog delicious. DBL cheese burger delicious.

7.description: Overpriced but decent food combined with truly awful customer service.Food: Decent Chicago burgers and dogs type place. Nothing that will let you down but nothing you will remember forever. Prices: For standard Chicago burgers and dogs this is on the more expensive end of the scale. I got a medium coke, Cheeseburger and Cheese Fries and ended up paying around 11 bucks.Customer Service: I have been here a few times and EACH time have had a routine customer service issue turned into a big-time production. Employees are often rude, incompetent and incapable of admitting wrongdoing. The restaurant fails the minimum standards of customer service, like listening to an order, getting it right, displaying contriteness and greeting people. All of the these experiences in this review are from inside the restaurant, so cruddy drive-thru microphones aren't an excuse for consistently screwing up an order. I also am a native English speaker, and have received worldwide renown, fame and monetary rewards for my diction.They screwed up my order on my first visit to the restaurant. It was a simple order of a burger and fries that mysteriously morphed into a hot dog and ice cream. This was not a mere mixup, as in something the other table ordered. Upon checking my receipt I saw that they showed me as having ordered a hot dog and ice cream; a combination that I am thoroughly opposed to on philosophical grounds. So the person taking the order failed in their basic task of BEING THE PERSON TAKING THE ORDER. Correcting the order was left up to me as the employees steadfastly insisted that I ordered what they said I did. (As a person who had worked in multiple restaurants I loathe making customer service complaints. I will not however eat hot dogs and ice cream. In public at least.) The next time,  I ordered a cappuccino. (Don't ask why but I did.) Instead I received a coke. Told them I did not order a cappuccino. They told me I ordered a coke. I corrected them. They tried to correct me. Wow. Finally, the owner came over. He was brusque, unapologetic and seemed as though he wanted me to apologize for wasting his time. Then they asked me to cough up more money for the cappuccino. Wow times two.This uninterrupted stream of incompetence happened again upon my next visit  only insert cheese fries for cappuccino. This third  time, I knew there was going to be trouble. Upon walking in the restaurant, the employee was disappointed at having to put down her smartphone. I must have interrupted an awesome snapchat session with that boy in Algebra who totally digs her for her brain. I approached the register. She stared blankly at me. I offered a hello, unsure anymore that I was actually in a business that served money for food. She then offered an annoyed hello that made me literally feel guilty. As I was ordering I noticed her attention wandering; she was failing to make any eye contact and actually began talking to other employees while I was ordering. Noticing this, I repeated my order THREE times; in plainly spoken English not in my usual morse code. Upon sitting down I discovered that, as I feared, she screwed up the order. I told the server that I had ordered cheese fries. She went back to the kitchen and came back out to tell me I had not. I told her I had. She then hurriedly went back to "order" the cheese. She brought out the cheese and then told me I owed an additional 2 dollars. I coughed it up (why I don't know) and she came out a third time to give me my change, which I had already told her to keep the second time. (It must be noted this person was nicer, if no more competent.)Summary: The employees are not schooled in the basics of customer service. I do not believe that asking an employee to say hello and listen to a customer's order is asking too much. I also do not believe it is too much to ask that upon discovering a problem; the employees should be contrite and act quickly to remedy the problem. I was only asking for the items I ordered. I was not asking for elaborate accommodations and specialty orders. Getting an order right is food service 101. (I know;  I've worked in multiple restaurants. I am well aware of what is normal baseline customer service and what is considered to be going above and beyond. I wouldn't call this passable service by any stretch.)Note: 1 bad employee is not enough for me to give a bad review, but when every person I encounter in three straight visits is either rude or incompetent I consider that to be endemic, not an outlier. Not only are the employees not schooled in being polite and getting an order right, they conduct themselves in a manner that says "I don't give a blank and how dare you interrupt my day."

49.description: Good place and the food is awesome. The have a tv there and it is always on the news but it is ok.

40.description: They donated a raffle prize to an event that I participated in today and they were right next door, so I figured I'd give them a little business.  The menu is huge.  They had everything from breakfast foods to burgers and dogs to pizza puffs and gryos.  If I had seen italian beef on the menu (I'm not saying they don't have it, I just didn't see it on the wall sized menu) it would have been the ultimate Chicago food tour all in one place.  I ordered the Scotty: a dog with the works and fries.  They asked if I wanted everything on the dog, I of course said yes.  They give you a number and someone brings the food to you; a nice little touch.  The dog looks good, poppyseed bun, visible amounts of celery salt, and the relish is glowing green.  I take a bite, no sports pepper.  I just assume that they are smashed into the middle.  I take another bite, still no pepper.  I then use a fry to scoop the relish and tomato out of the way.  NO SPORTS PEPPER!  You can't say a hot dog has the works in Chicago without peppers.  Overall the dog was good.  The bun was a tiny bit too soggy from the steaming, but nothing to really worry about.  However, the fact that they don't serve peppers annoys the bejesus out of me.  And it wasn't an oversight on my dog, their menu states they don't have peppers.The fries also tasted like any generic fry out there.  They easily could have been frozen and needed salt.  My final gripe: they served my food on a styrfoam plate.  The fries were in a paper container, the dog was in a paper boat, and the drink came in styrofoam.  I'm really hoping they are CFC free, but it is still depressing to see a restaurant in 2012 still using that much material for something that could easily use less.

53.description: It's now called Charcoal delights, but back in my days at North Park, it was affectionately known as the Pit. Every visit to the Pit takes me back to my carefree college days when I was thin, cocky and totally fly with my Flock of Seagulls hair style.  The joint has been totally remodeled and actually looks like a respectable eatery now. The food is just like I remember it. It's a perfect example of comfort food. Delicious, filling and artery clogging. If you are looking for a healthy meal, the pit is probably not your cup of tea.  During college, I pretty much lived at this place. Whether it was breakfast, lunch or dinner, you would find me at the Pit pretending to study. I was usually day dreaming about baseball, music or the hot girl who sat in front of me in my history class. Let's face it. Academia was not my cup of tea. I majored in staying academically eligible to play baseball.  Here's the delicious bottom line: Whether you're looking for a Burger the size of a truck, feta cheese omelet, or a grilled cheese sandwich, head on down to the Pit for some good old fashioned, cardiac arrest causing comfort food. For me, nostalgia never tasted so good.

30.description: Points for delicious food. Gyros are good and never dry. Their broasted chicken takes it for me. It is delicious. Reasonable prices. Service varied between slow and efficient depending upon how busy they are. Definitely worth a try.Also. Drive-thru is speedy and convenient.

46.description: They do what they do and do it well. I would rather go here than a sit down family restaurant, the food quality is way above average. I love being greeted by the owner.

1.description: I have given this place several chances to redeem themselves as people do say they enjoy it here, but my experience is very different.The food is always very bland and you can tell they only use the cheapest of ingredients.Staff are always very rude, it is as if you are always interrupting their personal conversations. They are more concerned about having fun at work than serving the customers.Very dated dinning area and not always clean.I've given up on these guys, will never return.

55.description: I really love their chicken kabob sandwich.  It was advertised on their sign ($2.99) so I decided to swing through the drive-through.  Now I plan my mid-day trips down Foster so I have an excuse to get one! It sounds weird, but the meat is always HOT, which is a nice contrast with the cool vegetables and sauce.We went for breakfast & I got a bacon and egg sandwich.  It was nice to eat in one hand while driving but nothing special otherwise.  It would be good with cheese.

9.description: Terrible food and terrible service. The owner or manager is always yelling at the employees in front of the customers. Un professional!

26.description: Really??? This afternoon I ordered lunch which was $ 19 and change: 8.19 meal with two orders of extra pita (.99 each) somehow added to more than double that! The older man in the light green shirt made it sound like a deal :/This evening I went for a Greek sakad- I did NOT say chicken to the young girl! A VEGETARIAN dinner does not call fir chicken! Imagine my surprise to find meat on the salad.My friend wanted the Grecian chicken dinner but they were out...perhaps I should have taken it as a sign :'(  and left then.

25.description: Charcoal Delights has been here forever.  Very popular and very busy, most likely due to location.  2 Colleges, 2 highs schools & cta bus terminal.  For the positive, great quick service, very clean place and great employees.  I have stopped in here many times throughout last &#? years, yeah I've been around awhile.  Sometimes working in area only choice besides McD's across street.  Food is just not good.  Had. burger here yesterday just awful.  My son stopped in later that day also said just horrible burger.  I have also had chicken  on numerous occasions and just dry and taste as if sitting out all day.  Sorry really want to like this place , nice prior here but just not good!

12.description: Great place to eat when you need convenience. However their chicken salad has not been served fresh a number of times and their charcoal chicken platter is probably the most driest chicken I've ever ate in my life.

59.description: I was urged by an acquaintance to give them another try. They used honest-to-God cheese this time, producing a much more satisfactory result. Now my only complaint is that there's just too much grease dripping everywhere, which I wouldn't expect from broiled patties. But I can mostly overlook that because this is one of the best burgers in town -- as long as they use actual cheese.

21.description: I am 100% fine with business owners hiring employees that don't speak perfect English. HOWEVER, please do not put those employees in charge of taking the drive through orders. I tried to order two burgers, the screen kept showing the employee was only trying to charge us for one. I tried to order two large fries, it was showing up as two small fries. I tried to explain to him that the order was wrong on the screen, but he was not understanding me and would take the order off and then reenter the exact same wrong order even after I had repeated my actual order several times. I had to drive away without getting anything because he was just not understanding me. I don't know if I'll be back anytime soon. It's a pity, the food is pretty good here.

17.description: I almost always get the chicken kabob. I don't like fast food.  But the chicken kabob is always tender, flavorful and fantastic. Doesn't take like fast food at all. Really, it's hard to find non-fast food at fast food prices, fast food speed and fast food convenience. So great.

10.description: This little number is in my hood...I can walk to or drive to...and admit that I've tried a limited range of products.  PROS:  Great cooked breakfast at decent price (bacon, eggs, hb's and toast) for under $6.  I'm not a connoisseur of Italian Beef but they have one of my favorites...add mozzarella, double dip, hot peppers...yum!  Service is usually friendly and prompt. CONS:  Fries are very basic, usually a little soft (I like crisp) so I won't be ordering them again.  Main complaint is EVERYTHING IS SERVED IN STYROFOAM!!!!  They have been at this location for a number of years and need to step into the 21st century and be a better citizen regarding the serving products they use.  Can you say "recycle"????

5.description: I have not been to this place in years due to a bad burger.  Do you think that I learn?  Nope.  Thought I would give them a second chance after all this time has passed.The burger was chewy!  Could not finish it.  Lettuce and onion all cut up so that when you go to eat it they fall off.  Maybe they did not want to be with the burger!Not worth the time, cost or calories.  NEXT!

3.description: It's a place where you can find food, almost anytime of the day.  Don't get me wrong.  This place, in my opinion, has better food than what offers in the McDonald's across the street.  They don't have amazing deals in their entrees and combos, but if you have to eat and want something to fill in the stomach, then you've got it!  The patty melt was passable; the amount of cheese was adequate to make it "gooey" enough to hold the two (2) pieces of bread together.  Hubby's tuna sandwich looked like what it should be.  There's really no certain criteria to judge food like this, unless you have a legit compliant for some health and sanitation concerns.If employees were eating their own food, then what you've consumed should have no major problem.They do have a drive-thru and a plenty of parking.  Do me a favor: walk in and order with an employee face-to-face.  Why do you think obesity is a big deal in this country?  People can't walk or refuse to walk, for two (2) freakin' seconds in their lives?  You guys...let me tell ya...that's trippin'!  By parking your vehicle and then walking in, you can avoid the wrong orders, mis-communications, or other unnecessary glitches.  No one sounds great via the drive-thru speaker, not even radio personnel.  Anyways, it's a fast-food establishment there's really no surprises with what you get.  Nevertheless, the business hours are awesome here, so if you have a job with irregular hours, this place can be your saving grace.  Wifi works great!  So thank you.

35.description: I went there with my wife and kids for  last saturday night.I had ordered a Chicago style hot dog. It was just ok. The fries came out full of oil and soggy.My wife ordered the chicken sandwich which was undercooked and loaded up with mayo.After ordering no mayo on her sandwich, we thought what else can go wrong.Her fries came out with even more oil than mine.It wasn't a good start for being our first time here.After telling the girl at the counter for new fries ,she told us those fries were fresh and she would charge us for new ones. I know times are tuff but how can you charge someone for fries that were not up to average.After the greek owner asked the girl whats going on, he simply replied "These american people don't know what good food is".There are definitely way more cleaner places with better food choices in the neighborhood.Since that night at this dump, we found a brand new restaurant up the street on Kimball Avenue {Hot Dog Station} for superior quality of hot dogs, burgers, and fries.Let the other peoples reviews of this restaurant speak for itself.

19.description: So this is the third time I asked for a breakfast steak sandwhich no cheese mayo only. Seems simple. First time got the sandwhich with everything on it, okay so pick stuff off.Second time it comes with cheese...and I mean lots on cheese so I drive back and they give me a new one,Today my hubbie drive the 10 minutes and brings back a sandwhich, with everything. After pulling everything off there are 2 very small very think pieces of meat which do not even cover the bread,,,,REALLY, did ya think people want cheese, lettuce and tomato on bread. Will not be going back for breakfast. Service and quality of food has really declined over the last year.

28.description: I've been going here since before it was called, 'Charcoal Delights,' and the food is as good as ever. Prices are reasonable and their burgers are amazing. I try to go there once a month or so.

45.description: Charcoal Delights is a good option for quality fast food.  Service is always super friendly.  I love their fries.  And their hot dogs.  But the best thing is their broasted chicken...it's so good that I find myself craving it every couple of months, and have to make it over there to get my fix!

33.description: If you want GREAT food and dont have that much time for lunch, then I would recommend this place.  This place has a variety of great options for lunch. !!!!

43.description: Charcoal Delights looks like a slightly larger than average Chicago style eatery, they have basic things like burgers, hot dogs, and even separate breakfast items. On my visit I ordered the charcoal chicken special. This is a charbroiled chicken sandwich.Unfortunately, my chicken sandwich had not just one but several pieces of bone in it. Needless to say I will not be returning any time soon.

2.description: I was starving and in a rush to get to class so it was this or McDonald's. I don't regret my decision, but this is definitely not a place I would consider if I had time and other options. Cheeseburger combo (includes fries and drink) is $8-- not too bad, but the meat and fries are pretty generic. I liked the pickles, relish, and cheese. Staff was friendly. Thank you.

18.description: I've been going here since before it was called, 'Charcoal Delights,' and the food is as good as ever. Prices are reasonable and their burgers are amazing. I try to go there once a month or so.

41.description: For a fast food burger, it's way above average. Terrific, actually.  What really drives me nuts though is that their buns cannot support the 1/2 lb. burger. They obviously use a very cheap bun that simply falls apart. The fries are tasteless and obviously frozen.Both the chicken breast sandwich and broasted chicken are also terrific.Italian beef and sausage good -- nothing special. They're also stingy with napkins, ketchup and for some unfathomable reason, they serve their Polish on a kaiser roll which is too big for the very good Vienna sausage. It's also just not a good combination.  Between the buns for the burgers and the rolls for the Polish, they just can't se to get their bread act together!

52.description: Not a fan of the grilled dog in general, but this was pretty good.  Shake was just out of fa machine so nothing special.  I like that they take your order and allow you to have a seat, then bring your food to you.  Fries are just ok.  Hopefully, I'll be a little hungrier next time to try something bigger.

50.description: Once again, gave this spot a chance hoped not to find hair this time in my food...and what do u know, another curly surprise in my co-workers food. DISGUSTTTIIINNNNGGGGG!!!!!!!!!!!!

4.description: Everyone on NPU's campus talks how good charcol is so I decided to try it out. The first time I tried it I ordered their Chicken Delight Special which is what my friend told me to get. I wasn't really fond of it. The chicken was dry and cold. I came here a couple more times and was disappointed both times. I think the food is overpriced for the quality it is. I would rather spend my $8-10 somewhere else.

6.description: absolutely love this place. Its cheap and has great food!!

22.description: Awesome best place I have ever ate at. I will come back again. Food is very cheap but great quality.  Right next to North Park University.  Try the gyro or hot dog.

15.description: I love the pit. Great food and friendly faces. Get the chicken delight with onion rings!

57.description: Great burger and hot dog joint with a good twist. Everything is cooked over charcoal, hence the name!  The added char makes everything taste like a picnic.  Having a grilled Chicago dog is becoming my standard, so much taste.  And for a dog and fries for under 3 bucks you can't beat that deal.  As for the rest.   The menu is quite extensive from fresh fried chicken, to homemade soup, to gyros, and turkey clubs.  Everything is good and well prepared and the service is always top-notch. So, if your hanging in Albany Park and need a good hot dog fix, check this place out.  You will be happy you did....Did I mention a awesome dog and fries for under 3 bucks! Oh I did but, still its GREAT!

20.description: This place is overpriced and they charge extra for every little thing.  It has consistently gone down in recent years. I only go there when I'm in a hurry.  $20 goes a lot better elsewhere.

36.description: We order lunch from there at least twice a week.The owner is always friendly when he delivers.The. Gyros is great!  Once on a while I stop there for Breakfast  the eggs are made on the spot! Good place for fresh food fast!

14.description: So I'm having a bad day & my mother decides to plan a lunch date at this charcoal delights location on foster. My God was it ridiculous. My mom & I walked up to the register & the girl didn't even acknowledge us. So she says hi, and my mom replies hello how are you she replies terrible it's just so terrible here. Who wants someone taking my order with that kinda attitude, but ok. I should've just order a soup and hot dog like I originally planned but, my mother said no get something out of the ordinary so I got the Greek chicken dinner and it was awful!!! The potatos were rotten you could see the WHOLE potatos were black, the chicken was dry and RAW, the rice was cold only good thing was the pita bread and cream of chicken soup. They forgot my moms cheese on her burger and cheddar fries, and forgot our drinks. The runner who delivers food was very nice and we received our money back for the $12 old greek chicken. I'll be back only for soup.

1.description: This place is such a dive! I miss when it used to be a 7-11.  its now a dark, run down, dust covered hole-in-the-wall.  They only make money because the little lady at the cash register shorts you on your change, then screams at you when you correct her.  The counter that used to serve hotdogs & deli sandwiches is now covered in old tvs, ancient paperwork, and an inch of dust.  The shelves are half stocked, but someone was lazy and now there's just boxes on the ground.  its kinda sad considering they have a quality location between Northeastern & northpark, they could be major competition for the shell station & the corner store.

0.description: The new management is HORRIBLE.The Big Fat White lady is such a troll. She's very rude. I come here all the time because I live near here. I went to the plaza the other day to eat at the korean restaurant. I parked near Vilins Pantry which is a part of the plaza's parking lot. She came out, stared me down, and threatened to tow my car. NEVER will I shop at this place again no matter how conveniently close it is. Fat White Lady needs to learn some manners.

1.description: I came here two months ago because the yelp page said 24/7. I don't know what the deal is if these people are involved with their yelp page or what-just came over here again 2:30 AM totally closed. Get your shit together y'all

2.description: I have tried to eat at this restaurant on 2 separate occasions. The first time I walked in to an empty dinning room, walked to the counter and called out. No one ever showed up, so I grabbed the take out menu and left. The second time I called ahead, the gentleman who answered the phone was very rude. He didn't mention the restaurants name when he answered so i asked, "is this Kabab Grill?" he responded "yeah what do want." When i told him I wanted to place an order he told me he wasn't at the restaurant. I really wanted to try this place out but I don't think I'll be giving them a third try.

0.description: Wonderful BYOB. Excellent food. Kamel the owner is extremely gracious and genuine. Very simple yet attractive interior. An excellent value. Try the combanation plate.

28.description: Compared to the service I received at the store on Elston - this is night and day.I am not sure why the other people had such a bad experience here.  I had to go there because of the shoddy frames sold to me by the other store - I wound up losing a lens in one pair, the other pair never did fit correctly.  I'm not hard on my things - and the lens should not have come out in the 6 months I've had them.The manager was very helpful and told me I should have my glasses back in a week.  I asked several questions and was satisfied with the answers she gave me.  Since I have developed an astigmatism, my glasses are now expensive - with having to also get  bifocals.  if they're expensive even here, I shudder to think what they'd cost elsewhere.I will say, though this store is *pristine* when compared to the dust fest that is the Elston location.

1.description: I find it interesting  (disappointing) that someone commented on my review and asked if there was anything they could do. I responded by saying that they could lower the price of their ridiculously expensive contact lenses so that I could afford to buy them! Even if that wasn't feasible, you'd think they would have responded with an alternate solution or SOMETHING, Even an acknowledgement would have been better than NOTHING. In any event, I've had my trial pair for a week, and my vision has been blurry. My follow-up appointment was today, and the doctor knew I wasn't going to order a supply of these anyway, so she suggested that we try regular distance contacts, then I would need to use reading glasses to be able to see up close. Not an ideal situation, but I have seen cute reading glasses. And because they're so inexpensive, I could get several pairs. So she ordered a new trial pair for me, and we will see how they are when they come in. (Hopefully since these won't be the bifocal/torics, they will be more affordable.)I like the doctor a lot; just not their management and poor customer service. So I'm leaving my review at 3 stars...for now.

9.description: So I tried going back again to buy a box of contacts again. They informed me that they wouldn't arrive for a week. In the meantime I asked to purchase a cheap pair until they arrived. the guy sitting there told me it was up to the other lady who told me to go to visionworks or lenscrafters. So I went a few blocks down the street to Pearle. They took awesome care of me. They didn't have them in stock,but gave me a trial pair and a new pair to try out also. And they were cheaper. awesome service. I have found my new optician. I couldn't believe the difference in the 2 places. I have finally learned my lesson. I for real will never go back.

29.description: Ugly frames, rude employees, three months and still waiting for my glasses.  I just hope they get my prescription right.  I went there because I have no insurance but it's not been worth the frustration.

23.description: First time I went there was a year ago and I didn't like it. Options were great and I thought it was a steal with the "deal/ discount" they had going on but then they mention nothing till they done all the tests, so eventually you rack up a huge bill and thus a HUGE surprise. Also they haven't even called me for a checkup. I'm probably gonna try Pearle Vision or something else.

5.description: After a stressful few visits and my starting to think this was an incompetent business, I finally was able to see the Dr I had initially intended to see and she was helpful, attentive and not only listened to what I had to say, but also set me up with the contacts I needed. Now, just waiting for them to arrive and hopefully everything works the way it should this time.

25.description: horrendous service. Probably the worst customer service i've ever experienced in any way, shape or form. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!!!!

12.description: A coworker recommended Americas Best which is one of the choices for our insurance.  Having read the mixed reviews, we were pleasantly surprised to have a great experience there. Everyone was helpful, especially Carlton.  He explained all the options for our insurance and helped us maximize our benefits.  Rosa provided our contact lenses - she gave us all of our options.  Dr. K was great too.   Fast service - my husband and I both had exams and were done in under an hour. We were told up front what we would have to pay - and that was what we paid - no sneaky hidden extra costs.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

21.description: wow, i feel really bad for those who've had horrible experiences here. various locations of america's best have been taking care of my eyes for years. i was thankful when this one opened as it is much closer to where i live than niles or schaumburg. they don't exactly pamper you, but no one's ever been rude to me.granted, i'm a pretty low maintenance customer. i do the eye care club, which gets me a yearly exam for 3 years for something like $75. then i buy my disposable contacts a year's supply at a time, which ends up being about 2 boxes free. all that averages out to less than $150 per year... for the gift of sight. i'll take it.

16.description: Just got back from Lens Crafters because, um, apparently THERE WAS HALF OF A RIPPED CONTACT STILL LEFT IN MY EYE FROM MY DOCTOR'S VISIT HERE!!!???????Absolutely horrific. Shame on this place.

17.description: Worst place to go. Been there like a couple times and always have bad and rude staff who make me wait long all the time, who just sit around and chit chat, and even pretend I did not exist or forgot about me when I was done with exam. They wouldn't give me my PD when I asked, and the manager had the nerve to tell me that 'by law they do not have to give it out" but she definitely did not know that by law it is patient's property and if ask, they must. I had to file a complaint to their headquarter and was replied with an apology saying whenever I want my PD, go to any of their location and ask for it (so I was right, duhh). Not only that, the exam was always quick. The last time, it was so quick, I was told that my vision improved a little. But my eyes got red and tired quickly (due to straining), so I went to VisionWorks, and found out that one eye improve and the other one got worse. So basically this place did not measure my eyes correctly cause after I got the new prescription at Vision Works, my eyes are not red or straining anymore. This place truly suck. Never coming back!!!!!!!!!!!!!

10.description: I have been contemplating whether to write this review or not..But.. since my review count is at 169 and I dont like uneven numbershere it is.. Review number 170!170 just sounds better than 169 somehow..So.. I am 51 and I have been having some vision problems lately..Just so everyone knows that when you get older you may fall apart..And.. your eyesight may be involved in this falling apart experience..And.. I'm sure I have now made everyone's day..My friend MichElle took me to America's Best for a much neededoverdue eye exam..And.. they were offering a free exam with 2 pair of glasses for $69.99..Oh God.. Another Uneven Number..:(But.. the thing is.. If you have your exam and something is wrong with oneof your eyes but not so much the other you are not eligible for this offer..(We must always read the fine print!)So.. I actually had 2   exams and I definitely was not eligible for the $69.99 deal..Boy.. was that a pain in the ass because the final cost came out to be near$150.00 for my new pair of glasses.. 1 pair.. not 2..So.. that in itself was frustrating..But.. I will give props to the staff at America's Best, Erica, Carlton,and Dr.Kechker(Tanya)They are nice people..But.. in the long run I wound up going to an Opthamologist at Northwesternanyway and am scheduled for surgery on the 17th..So..in closing review number 170..Would I recommend these type of walk in eye clinics/centers?Probably Not if you have any other option!And.. if it's not a serious eye issue you may do okay here..Just make sure you do read the fine print..

11.description: I'd give 0 stars if possible! I don't even know where to begin. Firstly,  I think the female eye Dr there is very nice, however the manager and the other employees are rude.  I first started coming here a few years ago . It was okay- it was close and inexpensive. It was like McDonalds- don't expect much- you won't be disappointed.  The employees are right out of high school or act like it. Employees with attitude, poor phone skills and poor customer service seems to be increasing and it seems to have gotten really bad this year. I will never return.  I went for my yearly eye appt. in late May.  I wear contact lenses. The female Dr. informed me my prescription had changed therefore  2 different  types of trial  lenses were ordered for me to try as I have dryness issues with certain brands. The girl said they would call when they come in so I can pick them up. I never received that call . I call the location 2 weeks later asking about my lenses and was told they were in. When I asked why I never received a call as I was told, the young girl told me it was an computer generated call and I received it. She wanted to argue with me.  ''Um no . If I received it- I wouldn't be making this call.  "One set of lenses were great, the other set was not even the same Presciption. Thrown away in disgust!(I can't expect everything I guess.)Fast forward to my ordering online, I call the company, Vision Direct, that I have ordered from for over a year to order my new lenses and ask why my lenses seem to take almost 2 weeks to be received after ordering. The lady tells me that this location of America's Best has NEVER verified my prescription during the time  I have been ordering from them. (Really? Over a year and no verifications ?) I double check the fax number they use for Americas Best- it's correct. I get from Vision Direct what they would need for a fax verification and what would be needed for a voice verification thinking I could prompt this process (I did need the lenses before July 1)I call Americas Best and get a very rude girl who transfers me to an even ruder Adrian, who said she was the manager. Adrian informs me that she does verifications daily at 8am( website says they open at 9am)   When I asked if the Dr could call the company to verify as I needed the lenses by July 1' . Adrian stated , "the dr ain't gonna do that".  Adrian begrudgingly agreed to fax them my prescription and I gave her the fax number to Vision Direct. However, I knew she wasn't going to do it. You could tell by her attitude and tone of voice. Today I received this email from Vision Direct stating they had shipped the order. "However, when we attempted to verify your prescription, we received no reply from your eye care provider. " Not much of a surprise there. I'm done. I will go somewhere else and will tell everyone about this experience. Rude , lazy employees . America's Best? Far far from it!!!!

26.description: As Florida Evans from "Good Times" would say, DAMN, DAMN, DAMN!.  I should have read the reviews first.  As far as contact lenses go, America's Best IS AMERICA'S WORST.  I went to the store because its really close to my house.  I had my own prescription and thought I could save a few dollars since their ads are so convincing.  What did I have to lose?  How about my LEFT EYE!  Seriously, I wore the contact lenses one day and my left eye began to secrete some grayish film (I hate to be gross, but I need you to understand the severity of the issue).  Here's the nitty gritty:1.  I immediately took the lenses back to the store only to be told that I can't return or exchange them because I opened the box.  Ok, huh! WTF?  Tell me how in the world would I be able to find out that something was wrong with the lenses unless I opened the box TO PUT them in my eyes?  Even the all knowing Susan Miller would not have been able to predict this.  2. Once I explained how the lenses affected my eye, the manager said, and I quote, "that's the RISK you take when you don't purchase your lenses from your optometrist's office."  Are you kidding me?  Had I been given this caveat prior to purchasing the product, I would have walked my nice round tosh right outta that joynt.  Yep America's Best robbed me of my $60 hard earned dollars.  But you better believe that I will make sure everyone knows this important caveat, so at least you have fair warning.  Something is terribly wrong with the products they sell.

27.description: Just got back from Lens Crafters because, um, apparently THERE WAS HALF OF A RIPPED CONTACT STILL LEFT IN MY EYE FROM MY DOCTOR'S VISIT HERE!!!???????Absolutely horrific. Shame on this place.

0.description: Americas Best was recommended to me by a friend but reading the other reviews, I was honestly super hesitant to even give this place a try. I've been going to this optometrist for 12 years and always felt like he wasn't listening to any of my problems. Glasses were expensive. Contacts were even more. I was wearing the same glasses for 7 years because he felt there was no need to change the prescription but every 6 months he wanted to give me new contacts with a higher prescription. It didn't make sense but I stayed because my family went there.At Americas Best, everyone was super friendly from the moment I walked in the door. Im super picky which made finding glasses a little difficult but I found two pair that I'm in love with. The eye doctor was amazing! I wish I remembered names so she knows how thankful I am but she explained  that my old glasses were closer to the prescription I needed and the contacts were WAY off. Then walking out of my exam, the other two women made sure I was getting everything I needed. My glasses were ready before the 7-10 days they told me and even when I felt like one of my glasses were a higher prescription than the other, they took them both to the back and scanned the lenses for me just to make sure. I've been wearing them for almost a week now and I haven't had any headaches like usual. I can see!! I cant believe how bright everything is!The only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because of one person who I felt was a little rude and inconsiderate with myself and my boyfriend. Otherwise, people need to experience America's Best for themselves. It seems like people only leave negative reviews instead of positive ones. So here's my positive post to say thank you.

20.description: I just went today to get my contacts and eyeglasses prescription done at this location and the customer service was great.  The price $69.00 for both contacts and eyeglasses prescription is very reasonable.  I almost cancel my appointment due to the bad reviews.  I'm really glad I didn't.  I just need to go back and get my eyeglasses done with them.

19.description: Customer service here is rude and I am not going to hold back anything at all.  I highly recommend customers to report rude employees and their bad experiences here. Remember that if you are the victim of bad customer service, chances are you are not the only one. Help out the community by letting management and higher authorities know about what's going on. Now I see a reason for why the overall rating of this place is two stars. I hate to have to go elsewhere due to the fact that the people they hire here provide rude service. This place is sort of like the service at Aldi's, little to no service for cheaper costs, only the experience is worst. Employees with visible tattoos definitely gave me even more of an added bad impression of this place.  At this point we can pretty much put a label on the types of people that are hired here at this location. Every time I call into this place I get an uneasy feeling and I shouldn't be feeling that way. It makes me definitely feel unwelcome, in which that's probably what the rude employees want for customers to feel. So customers would just stop coming so the employees here can just sit around and get paid.If that's what they want, don't give them what they want. Continue to go to this location, report all of your bad experiences. Something must be done about all of this, we cannot just give in and let these rude employees get their pay treating customers the way that they do. Rudeness is a sign of disrespect and with money coming out of our pockets. We shouldn't let these rude associates stay and get paid that easy. Note to management: I definitely recommend making your screening/background checks strict and very thorough for this location. If there are any notion of the individual not fitting in to the job. Please do not hold back and be lenient to let applicants work here. At this point, the place is 2 stars overall. May not be long till it reaches 1 star.

2.description: I'm getting older and my Eyes are going to hell in a hand basket. That leaves me with two choices. I can lug around reading glasses everywhere I go, or start wearing prescription glasses. I opted for the 2nd choice.  My Wife and I went to AB on a Sunday afternoon for an eye exam. They were crowded and I didn't have time to wait. No big deal. We looked through the selection of frames and picked out two pairs that my Wife and I could live with. We were told their system was down and they could only accept Cash. No problem. I was assured that their system would be back up the next day and I could use my Debit Card from my HSA account.  The next day I left work a little early to get my eye exam. When I entered the store there were a couple of angry looking customers complaining to the staff at the front register. I guess their system was still down from the previous day. The 12 year old at the counter told me the only way I could put a deposit down for my glasses and exam was to pay cash. That would negate the whole point of having a debit card from my health savings account now wouldn't it? At that point, I just turned around and left.   Here's the bottom line: They should really call this place America's Worst. I'm more than willing to pay a few extra dollars to purchase my glasses from a store that's not completely FUBAR. There's a Pearl Vision center, Costco and Target within a 10 minute drive from my house. I guess America's Worst is a perfect example of a Bargain not really being a Bargain at all.

18.description: As Florida Evans from "Good Times" would say, DAMN, DAMN, DAMN!.  I should have read the reviews first.  As far as contact lenses go, America's Best IS AMERICA'S WORST.  I went to the store because its really close to my house.  I had my own prescription and thought I could save a few dollars since their ads are so convincing.  What did I have to lose?  How about my LEFT EYE!  Seriously, I wore the contact lenses one day and my left eye began to secrete some grayish film (I hate to be gross, but I need you to understand the severity of the issue).  Here's the nitty gritty:1.  I immediately took the lenses back to the store only to be told that I can't return or exchange them because I opened the box.  Ok, huh! WTF?  Tell me how in the world would I be able to find out that something was wrong with the lenses unless I opened the box TO PUT them in my eyes?  Even the all knowing Susan Miller would not have been able to predict this.  2. Once I explained how the lenses affected my eye, the manager said, and I quote, "that's the RISK you take when you don't purchase your lenses from your optometrist's office."  Are you kidding me?  Had I been given this caveat prior to purchasing the product, I would have walked my nice round tosh right outta that joynt.  Yep America's Best robbed me of my $60 hard earned dollars.  But you better believe that I will make sure everyone knows this important caveat, so at least you have fair warning.  Something is terribly wrong with the products they sell.

13.description: Have you ever wanted to punch someone in the throat?  If you haven't, but are in fact curious about the desire to do so, I suggest you hurry on over to this little gem of an eye care establishment. The customer service is so ridiculously nonexistent that I got fed up with the condescending attitude of the front desk staff BEFORE my appointment even started, and I ended up offering my apologies to the worst offender of all- Kristen and expressed to her that I was very sorry that she was having a terrible day, but explained that she certainly did not have to take it out on me after i simply inquired further about an erroneous statement she made about my insurance benefits and coverage. Due to the attitudes- spcifically hers, I ended up walking out of the place before the eye doctor was even able to see me...If America's Best employees had their own Garbage Pail kids, she would probably be called Condescending Kristen and would be pictured with an insurance card slicing her in the eye.

4.description: America's Best should be America's Worst. My 9-year old daughter was having difficulties reading the board at school. I wanted to get her eyes checked and if needed, fitted her for glasses asap. I called and they were able to see her the next day at 5:15. We sit in a waiting area until a technician calls her in for preliminary tests, then brings her back to the waiting area and asks us to wait for the doctor. It's past 35 min. by now. Doctor seems to be in a rush...looks at her and tells me that all kids need to have their eyes dilated so she can see her eyes better. I told her it was fine. She told me I had to come back tomorrow to finish up my appointment because she had to leave in 5 mins. I was dumbfounded. WTF! That doctor must think I have nothing better to do than drag my two kids to the eye doctor and play this waiting game again tomorrow. If that wasn't enough, the deal breaker was when I overheard the salespeople tell the customers in front of us...that they'll get their glasses in 7-10 business days...or longer depending on type of glasses. This was their standard delivery time after I confirmed with the salesperson. All I wanted was to get my daughter's eye examined and get her glasses right away so she can see the board. Was that too much to ask for? Stay away from this place...any other place would be better than this eye place.

24.description: I will have to update this once I get my glasses so I will comment on my experience today in store. ...Initially the experience wasnt anything special, basic, no frills, no warm fuzzy atmosphere. I turned down the $15 diabetes glaucoma thing. The optometrist was friendly and pleasant. she actually seemed kinda bored. but still no complaints...Im not hard to please. Finally, the reason for the four stars....the lovely woman who helped me select my glasses. She was very friendly and helped me pick out my two pair and gave honest opinion on my frame choices (finally someone who wont send me out looking like napoleon dynamite lol) So provided that my glasses come in with no issues...I will be singing the praises of AB from the rooftops.

6.description: Terrible.  Do not go here.  We had too many problems to count.  First, we had appts but had to wait a long time to be seen by a doctor.  Then, the contacts we ordered took forever to come in. Then, I asked them to mail them, but hat also took forever.

22.description: I'd get my eyes check by the optometrist Shira Gelb, but I'd go elsewhere for service. They forgot to give me a computer printout of the receipt for my eye exam. So I called to ask them to fax it to me. The staff who answered my call was the same person who'd checked me out at the store. She accused me of leaving my receipt in the car, etc., because she claimed she was sure she'd stapled the credit card receipt with the store receipt. After a few minutes of assuring her that the only record I got was the non-itemized credit card copy which could have been for any product they sell and that for rebate purposes, the contact lens manufacturer would need something to proof that I had had an eye exam, the staff member reluctantly agreed to fax me an itemized receipt. I was like, Well, first off, you don't accuse a customer outright of mislaying a receipt. Second, what is so difficult about faxing a receipt to a local number, which doesn't cost the store much?

15.description: America's Best Contacts and Glasses offers super cheap eye exams, glasses, and contacts... But the experience is no-frills all around.

7.description: I am here 30 minutes before my appointment to fill out paperwork and things are going extremely well here. I've been to the Wabash location before, this is my first time here. Everyone is very social and friendly. They made me laugh. It's all going by very fast. I saw the eye doctor before my scheduled appointment time and I couldn't be happier. Thanks so much for that! Having read past reviews, I expected a shit show but to my surprise, America's Best was the best.

8.description: As I always use yelp for reviews, I never have written one.  I recently needed an eye care facility immediately.  I googled eye doctors and Americas best came up. I called and they were able to see me immediately.  After I arrived and checked in, I was informed that the 1240 appointment I had was no longer available and they pushed it back to 1 pm. No big deal.  I saw the intake nurse and she was nice. I then waited 20 more minutes to see the eye doctor who was not worth seeing. She did absolutely nothing to accommodate me and was basically moving me along in her so called factory of patients. I would never recommend this location for even a basic service.  They are unsympathetic to your needs and questions. They want you in and out and are quick to collect your MONEY.

30.description: Unless you are really hard up on cash and want to partake in the  2 pairs/$69.95 (including a free eye exam), DO NOT GO HERE. i was attracted by the "two pair" deal (yes, it's for real, no strings attached) so me and my fiancee went to get some glasses. i wear contacts but just needed glasses at the moment. he needed glasses because his pair was in bad shape and wanted a new pair before our wedding. the selection was fairly decent, considering the prices. the eye exam wasn't anyting out of the ordinary--the optometrist was very friendly. She asked if this prescription was for glasses or contacts. I told her I wore contacts but do not need any at the moment. So she wrote me 2 prescriptions. I was then directed to the Store Manager, I believe. He was "friendly" but reminded me of a used car salesman. I do not even know where to begin with this guy. Maybe it's because he told me i have astigmatism (I do not) or that my lenses would be really thick (they are not--at all!) and that i should shell out more money to get thinner lenses, or is it the fact that he scratched out the doctor's prescription for contacts, even though i told him i will be getting more contacts soon. ugh. but i think the worst thing he said was to my now-husband--"you will look bad if you don't get the thinner lenses." i swear he said that!!!but my friends, it gets worse. when ordered, they told us it would be ready in 7 business days and they would call us when they were in. we placed our order 1 week and and half before the wedding, cutting it close. i wasn't sure if they would be ready in time, but we weren't sweating it. well, the day before our wedding and still no word. so i called and spoke to THE rudest woman ever. i explained the situation (that we were getting married the next day) and gave her both our names and asked her if our glasses were in. she said "no." i asked her when she thought they would be in. "7 - 10 business days." (ahhh this is the first i've heard 10 business days) i asked her what day that would be, about, and she gave me the SAME answer "7 - 10 business days." she then decided to end the conversation and said "we will call you when they are in." ok, whatever.DAY OF THE WEDDING: my husband tried calling the store for 2 hours but no answer. so he calls the customer service hotline, who (earned the 1 star) were very friendly, helpful, and sympathetic but delivered some bad news: one of his pairs of glasses were in (YAY!) and had been in since tuesday (what?????) but the store was closed because they had no power (understandable but still BOO). bummer. BUT IT GETS WORSE!!!!!!!!!we go there after we get back from our honeymoon and waited about 5 minutes in front of an employee (who never said "hi", "hold on one sec", not even a smile). finally we said "Hi. we are here to pick up our glasses." She was so resentful as she found our glasses. She sat us down to see how they fit. My husband went first. She asked them how they fit and felt. They were clearly crooked and he told her so. She denied they were crooked, so i piped up and agreed they were, indeed crooked. She sighed and huffed and puffed and "fixed" them (not really, though). The next pair of his clearly did not fit him. The ear piece was clearly 1" too short and was squeezing his head. She asked him how they felt and he told her. She brushed this off with "they're plastic, they'll stretch." Ugh. I couldn't take it anymore, I said "I'm sorry but you are asking us how they fit and we are telling you." She was very put off at that point and clearly did not want to do her job. Thank god my glasses fit, so we left. So all in all, this place blows. The concept is great but that's about it.

3.description: Terrible! So initially I had a free eye exam and got 2 pairs of glasses- great! However, once my glasses came in, one of the pairs which had a bigger frame, was totally not the right script! I told the technician that and he looked at me like I was crazy. What they "forgot" to do prior to me buying glasses was measure where my eyes line up so when the glasses are made, the script is in the right place. Anywho, they sent the glasses back and when I picked them up, same thing! Well the tech said theres nothing they can do about it and now I'm out 250$ for a pair of glasses I can't even use. Are you frickin kidding me!? Back to For Eyes I go.. at least there, the eye glass assistants actually care about how your prescription feels and if it's comfortable.Oh and the glasses that I was actually able to wear... the lens is starting to have a small line that looks like a crack. How the heck does that happen when they are on my face all day? Poor quality product, poor customer service, what a waste of money.

14.description: No matter what time I come to this place I wait a minimum of 45 minutes past my supposed "appointment time." Do not bother coming here if you have any other obligations after your visit because you will most definitely be late.   The prices are the only thing that keep me coming back.

3.description: I'm young, but I'm not into wearing super short dresses with plunging necklines. I need stuff that I can wear to work, but still look cute and attractive and I think this is a great place to check out. Yes, I do think some of their stuff is boring, but I think you can still find a lot of great things in this store if you're a young woman.I do understand b.n.'s reviews about the staff though. Some of them can be somewhat staff-offish, but I've met a few that have been absolutely amazing and friendly.

1.description: This is great shopping for your mom or other older woman in your life. I always find hose for my momma and accessories that she actually will wear. Not sure if I would ever wear anything in here but I probably would in a few years.Prices are reasonable for nice blouse and slacks and skirts. There is a petite section so my mom can look fabulous and fashionable at her wonderful age.The ladies that work here are also very helpful and eager to get you in and out in a hurry. I'm all about the in and out when not shopping for me! Thank you very much!

2.description: I stop in occasionally if I am in a pinch for something to wear somewhere and it is usually a last resort as most of their clothing is old lady-ish   I'm not old! So I have found a tank top or cute sweater but that is about it    The problem is the attitude whether it's the younger women working there or older they are rude I can't stand it which is probably why I only stop in there occasionally and never think to go in there on a regular basis. They should be thinking about their job security when no one wants to go back because they're so snotty and by the way I can't imagine why they would have any type of an attitude working there.  It's not exactly high- line fashion!

5.description: The sizes are pretty big here....at least I find them to be on the bigger side. Their stuff really isn't my style, but if you search around I think you can find some nice, casual sweaters. Some good workwear too. Its a pretty big store and they always seem to be having some sort of a sale.

0.description: This is a great destination if you're looking for moderately-priced dresses. I stopped in here recently and found plenty of options that I could wear to work, as well as to fancier events. I'm 30, so I wasn't looking for super mature styles and I think they had a range of fashions that would suit many tastes. I was actually pleasantly surprised at the quality of the dresses, too!While I'd stopped in specifically to pick up one dress, I walked out with 3.Also, big props to one of the store managers, Mary. She was super sweet and helpful!

4.description: I have been going there off and on for years.  The fashion, like mentioned in other comments, goes from old lady to pretty nice stuff.  The part I don't like is the staff.  They can be so rude and turn their nose up if they don't think you have money.  I have gone in there after work, dressed nice and they treat me ok, but when I go in wearing jeans and a t-shirt, they treat me rather poorly. In addition, they aren't consistent on their pricing. Ive been to other Dress barns which are much more pleasant than this one.  It just so happens this one is in my neighborhood.

1.description: Maria is a very sweet lady. She will work with you to get you what you want. For the prices services she offers are well worth it. Salon can use some facial improvements. but hey! at the end services are more important and if the provider is friendly and easy to work with what is there to complain. I got my hair straightening done with her. The result were not as great as I expected but it worked it made a difference my hair is more manageable now but not perfect.

2.description: Maria is fantastic. I love this place.Great Mani/Pedi for great price, she also does no chip! Great conversation, Maria is super personable and cares genuinely about her customers, she definitely turned me into a long-term customer.

0.description: I've been going to Maria for mani/pedis for more than a year. Not only is her place convenient to my job, and she is super nice (I'm not just another number to her), but she does a very careful cuticle job on my nails. She also does a really good cleanup job on my feet. Her place is NO FRILLS, and it is just her, but you're also not paying extra for fancy chairs and setups.

3.description: First time customer. Had a little mixup with the order online. The manager on duty Jim was very helpful and resolved the situation very professionally and courteous. Worth the 5 minute drive back.  As for the wings? Awesome! Will be back for the food and of course the service. Thanks to the staff, very polite, and Jim who went the extra step to keep a customer happy and return.

1.description: I love classic style buffalo wings. I'm not trying to do boneless or teriyaki or whatever is trendy. I'm old school. Just give me some wings drenched in that classic style sauce. When I first started going I got the "hot" style wings and it wasn't what I was looking for. Finally realized that their medium sauce is exactly what my taste buds desired. They come a little light on the sauce so ask to make them wet. Get the $10 combo. Ten wings, fries and a drink. Pshh, yes please. It's a no-brainer. I usually place the order when I get off work, then drive there and eat in. It's nice to have the convenience of sitting down but not having to wait for the food to be ready. If not, it takes about 10 minutes for them to make it. Everything I've had has been cooked to order so it's nice & hot. Did I mention their fries are amazing? It's the perfect blend of salt, pepper, and sweetness. I only have one request: get a trash bin!

0.description: The wings? I give 'em four stars, which is about what I expect from almost any place selling wings these days. So why the fifth star? EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE!It's Super Bowl Sunday. I go in to pick up the three different orders we had placed in the days leading up to the game. The place is a madhouse. Phones ringing off the wall! People picking up their orders. People storming out in a huff because they've waited an hour before the game to come in to place an order and are finding out there's a two hour wait now. Harried counter people, harried cooks, craziness abounds. I go up to the counter and two of my three orders are ready. The third? Not a trace of it in their system even though I've received email confirmation and my credit card charged. I immediately feel my blood pressure start to rise. What do the folks at this Wingstop do? They apologize profusely, don't ask to see my receipt, don't question in me in any way, they just drop everything and get my missing third order ready. I'm out the door in five minutes. Courtesy and politeness the entire time. Show me customer service like that under those conditions and I'll be back each and every time I want chicken wings.P.S. - Seasoned fries? VERY tasty.

2.description: Jim and Lucy were so helpful! Thanks for the great customer service and of course always great wings!

5.description: New to the area. Love Wingstop but this joint is not good at all. Went there tonight with the bf and got the most unfresh driest food ever. Very little sauce on my wings (Cajun) and stale fries. I would have complained but by the time I go back home, they were closed :/

6.description: good wing spot for take out for a quick dine in

7.description: It's a newer eatery in West Rogers Park/Peterson Park and I am impressed! I've ordered food from this particular Wingstop a few times now and have not once been disappointed! The service has been amazing as well!

8.description: The chicken has always been fresh the 5-6 times that I have been to this location. What I found today most inviting was the attitude and energy of the manager Jim. I have encountered Jim 3-4 times when going in to get dinner or a snack. I must say  that this guy takes pride in managing and serving the public. On top of good food is good customer service and Jim pulls through on both!

9.description: This location has serious service issues. I sent my order in 20 mins before I got to the store, and had to wait another 15 mins for my order after I got there.

10.description: Great service, good food, friendly people, clean dining.. Can't go wrong with WingStop

4.description: How did I miss these guys opening up in my neighborhood?  Picked up a combo meal the other night. Everything made to order, no heat lamps, no microwaves.  Thumbs up on that, guys. The parmesan crusted and mild were our pick for the 2 flavor meal. Both were very good, but I would say the parm was my favorite of the two. The fries are decent and not soggy.I will be back to try other flavors.

3.description: I love Yellow Paper Bouqet!  I am not an easy person to work with.  I wanted my wedding invitations to be perfect, and because of Natalie, they were.better than perfect!  Natalie didn't mind that I changed my mind a hundred times because it was important to her that I had the invitations that would make me happy.  Natalie is talented, dependable, and incredibly fun to work with.  Creating the invitations for my wedding was an amazing experience that I'll never forget thanks to Natalie!  I love her!

1.description: Yellow Paper Bouquet is AWESOME!!  When I got married, I had NO idea what I wanted as far as invitations were concerned.  I just knew what colors I liked.  Natalie met with me and we chatted about ideas, which was super helpful.  Her demeanor is refreshing; she never once pressured me or tried to sell me things I didn't need.  She simply made creative suggestions that turned out to look wonderful; she really got a sense of who I was and portrayed that in the invites-NICE!Can't recommend Yellow Paper Bouquet enough!

2.description: We used Yellow Paper Bouquet to design the invitations as well as the wedding program for my daughters wedding which is coming up. I was so thrilled with how everything turned out, I did not want to wait until the wedding to get the word out about this fantastic wedding vendor. Natalie, owner and designer at Yellow Paper Bouquet was amazing to work with. She met with my daughter and discussed my daughter's concept of a theme extensively, until she was sure she could capture that feel and expression in both the invites and the wedding program. And that she did. Her creativity shows in the final product and we couldn't be happier. Natalie is a very easy person to deal with. She was also most helpful in helping with the appropriate wording on all the printed material.  Natalie also coordinated the printing of all our material.  Without a doubt, I recommend Yellow Paper Bouquet to handle all your design and printed needs for any function.

0.description: I am a HUGE fan of YPB.  Natalie designed the invitation to my themed "Black and White" party a few years back (when I was still living in IL) and I loved it!   It was one of those last minute decisions to mail out invitations for my guests and she was able to work with me and meet the tight deadline.Her style, expertise and professionalism is greatly appreciated.  I enjoyed working with her and will continue to recommend her to anyone who is looking to design their own invitation for any special occasion.  I'm confident that her versatility and attention to detail will meet and exceed your invitation needs.My personal experience with Natalie was efficient, convenient and the final product was exactly what I envisioned.

28.description: My new favorite Starbucks. I did my undergrad at North Park and just moved back for my soon to be husband to do Seminary! I love this Starbucks because I always see familiar faces, and the people behind the counter are so friendly!I DO miss Tom Yum and Open Hearth, but I guess it's time for a new era of hang out spots around North Park!

1.description: I've been to many Starbucks and this by far is the worst i ever stepped foot in. A few of the baristas are very unprofessional and rude. I guess that is what is expected with college kids running it. It isn't nice to roll your eyes and be sarcastic with your customers, it is also not nice to try and charge them more and refuse a refill, wanting to try and charge you full price instead of the 55cent fee. I'll never step foot in there until those baristas are removed from the establishment, which is sad.

9.description: Friendly staff, very warm and engaging. Drinks are consistent, patio is nice, store is clean.

29.description: Woohoo!  Starbucks FINALLY opened in this 'hood about a year ago.  I just LOVE Leslie especially because she remembers my order, knows my children's preferences and even sneaks decaf into my hubbies drinks when I'm not there to order for him (hee-hee!!!).  Their birthday party is coming up soon and we will be there with ready to get the blood pumpin'!
