23.description: Nice, friendly people with quick baristas. Parking out front for cars is usually available; a bike rack nearby would be nice.

5.description: This is my local neighborhood Starbucks I usually would stop here when I was in school but now swing by when I need a pick me up. Everyone is spectacular. However, today Alex was helping me out and she was the sweetest asked how my day was, we chatted about summer plans, she's a darling. Thanks Alex!

25.description: Good location with easy to find parking.  Since its on the corner you could easily pull up, hit the hazard lights and be in and out quick.  Not that locals appreciate you doing this..  Inside this store they make great use of this long dark wood shelf which does a great job to divide the room and makes me think, I too could use that in my place!  Too bad they didn't have pricing info for me, but what they did have was a perfectly made Chai latte.  Weird how each Starbucks makes drink after drink, differently.

12.description: ...a usually place of travel I hit-up before work. I like this Starbucks most of all because of the great morning crew. They remember names/orders and most of all, are friendly, which is nice. Service is always fast. They have never messed up a order. This place is always clean, wifi always works (and is very strong even across the street), and everyone is usually here once during the school semester. I have had a few meetings here and while it can get cramped very quick, its still a nice place. Sometimes you need a little coffee, tea, or snack; NP's Starbucks is the way to go!

21.description: So I decided to stop here for my zen tea instead of my usual place on Clark street. I must tell you all, sometimes it not good to stray away from what you know.I always get tea from starbucks. It's always piping hot. Why does my tea taste like it came from a lukewarm faucet?! I'm irritated about my tea, so this is all I'm writing about this review.

16.description: This is a very nice SB. I usually hit it in the morning on my way to work. I'd like to visit it in the evenings but it's too bad it's too small for such a perfect location for the school kids. You get a mixture of people there though, so don't fret about the kids. They behave perfectly and the service is great! Went there today since I've been on caffeine withdrawal. Had a perfect triple latte. I feel so good now. I think I'll go get my nails done with my BFF. Laters.

17.description: So I decided to stop here for my zen tea instead of my usual place on Clark street. I must tell you all, sometimes it not good to stray away from what you know.I always get tea from starbucks. It's always piping hot. Why does my tea taste like it came from a lukewarm faucet?! I'm irritated about my tea, so this is all I'm writing about this review.

10.description: First time at this specific location.  The food & drink are the same as expected.  HOWEVER, the place was filled to the brim with what I can only assume to be North Park University students.  So it had the similar "studious" vibe with students on laptops, writing papers and so on.  However, there were also three pairs of lovebirds that were taking up valuable chair & table space.  While I forced my self to wedge in between 8 people on the big table and work standing up, they were taking up 6 perfectly good seats and 3 tables so that they could smooch, hug, hold hands, and make out.  Nothing against PDA, but if you aren't even drinking or eating anything and people have laptops in hand trying to get some work done, find another place to make out.  Especially since their poor excuse of a university is right across the street with several buildings and enough space to waste their time.Frustrating.

11.description: This place is better and better every time! The fastest friendly and knowledgeable many of them have been here for a long time unlike other locations that have high turnover

26.description: This is a very nice SB. I usually hit it in the morning on my way to work. I'd like to visit it in the evenings but it's too bad it's too small for such a perfect location for the school kids. You get a mixture of people there though, so don't fret about the kids. They behave perfectly and the service is great! Went there today since I've been on caffeine withdrawal. Had a perfect triple latte. I feel so good now. I think I'll go get my nails done with my BFF. Laters.

27.description: Best Starbucks! Best Barista's!  Always friendly and remember our names every visit!

0.description: The food is great-greasy and done on a fire grill instead of a gas grill. The burger meat is fresh, not frozen- seen it with my own eyes: )Might wait but it's worth it.

20.description: Of course it's just another starbucks chain, you can't deny that. However, it has a really great homework environment. They play great music that is nice for the background. It is also right across from my school, Northpark university, which is handy. I really wish it was bigger. But that's the city life I guess. Hope you like it!

19.description: Ahhh starbucks! I look forward to going there (compared to places like DD, it's a gem). My go-to drink (even though I'm not a big coffee drinker) would be the mocha cookie cream crumble (or something like that). The baristas are great and so is the atmosphere.

2.description: Standard Starbucks quality & service - I've visited this Starbucks several times and never had an issue.  The location near North Park means that this locale is very busy and table space is often not available. I'm also not a fan of the high top tables - trendy, but not really what I'm looking for in terms of seating at a coffee shop.  The shop is really too small to accommodate a large number of patrons, especially with so many university students using it as a study space.  If you want to stay and work for awhile, this is not the place!

18.description: I have been to this starbucks only once (so maybe I should give them 2 stars?) but their service was horrid and the drink they made me sucked so much I had to stop at another starbucks to had it remade.

13.description: Since I'm doing my master's at North Park, I'm pretty much a regular here- they have my order memorized (for the most part)! However, I do wish they had later hours. They close early for a Starbucks practically on a college campus (around 9 or 10pm I believe), when I'm sure many students would love to keep doing work there (and drinking more coffee) until much later.

4.description: Baristas not welcoming and rude. Have been going to this location since it opened and this by far was the worst visit. if you don't like your job then don't come to work. Ordered two coffees. One was a decaf and was told we had to wait 10 minutes for coffee because they were cleaning coffee maker. Um wouldn't you think they would clean it before the morning rush. I ordered a breakfast sandwich, I started to eat while waiting 10 minutes for the coffee for my friend. Well as I bite into my sandwich it was completely cold in the middle. I go up to the counter to let them know and they seemed bothered to actually heat my sandwich properly. You think they would have it right with the fact that I'm paying 8plus dollars for a sandwich and coffee, nope not them. Guess back to Dunkin Donuts it is!!!

24.description: Small little starbucks, efficient staff, satisfactory drinks. They have a bigger selection of merchandise than a lot of the starbucks I've been to. Free wi fi! that's a plus. But I think what I like most about this Starbucks is the little drawings on the chalkboard with caricatures of the baristas working that day. Also, there was an adorable little drawing of a rabbit with a mustache taped onto the Tip Jar. Needless to say, I gave em all my quarters just for that. I always enjoy a coffee shop with some unique flair to it. :]

6.description: This location is the best! Devin and Jake are so friendly. While I'm waiting in line (that always goes fast) Devin or Jake will have my drink already at the counter for me by the time u get up there to pay. They know exactly what I order. I pass another Starbucks on my way to go to this location.  They go above and beyond at this location.  These guys actually show they like what they do. Most of the customers I see in there know them by name as well.

22.description: This is my local watering hole. It's right down the street from where I live, and right across the street from my school. I love the staff, they're all friendly, and they know their customers. They have a ton of great mugs and other merchandise. I love that they have a sale shelf, and an announcment board for community events. The only downside to this location is its size. The seating isn't very spacious, and ever since the free wifi went up, tables and chairs have been hard to get. Still this store has been good to me and many of my friends.

15.description: Got a little iced coffee and met seemingly every dog in the neighborhood outside! Glorious day, made new friends!It is dark but clean, the baristas friendly, the space small but that is good because you can see the puppy outside while you wait for your order. As good as it gets on Sunday morning for a dog walk!

7.description: Almost a year since this became my "local" starbucks and they're still not getting my drink right. I've been going back about twice a month when I get desperate for a starbucks vs home-made (or have a coupon about to expire). Now learning the names of baristas, Devin is probably the most proficient of the baristas. The others are all very friendly but seem to get flustered and can get unprofessional and unruly at times. I've learned to place my order very slowly and to make sure they write it on the cup...but it's a bit of a tedious thing, when you have to calm your barista down in order to get the right drink.

8.description: My usual go-to starbucks since its across the street from NPU. Usually here early mornings when it opens at 5 to study for exams. I like it because it's quiet at that time and their music is always on point. Around 6:30/7am is when it starts getting busier. I try to never go when the high schoolers are out which is around 2:45/3pm just because they like to loiter. There is also a worker who can be rude but the others are fine. Other than that, this location is pretty good. They seem to almost always get my drinks right so for that four stars!

30.description: this starbucks is there best there is. the people who work here are real, especially this girl chiquita, she hooks it up!

3.description: I love love love this Starbucks. The staff is so friendly, Joy has to be the nicest employee there. Whoever makes my drink it always comes out so yummy! This has to be one of the cleanest Starbucks i have been to yet. Jake also has to be one of the coolest Baristas i have ever met . Love love love!

14.description: Good location with easy to find parking.  Since its on the corner you could easily pull up, hit the hazard lights and be in and out quick.  Not that locals appreciate you doing this..  Inside this store they make great use of this long dark wood shelf which does a great job to divide the room and makes me think, I too could use that in my place!  Too bad they didn't have pricing info for me, but what they did have was a perfectly made Chai latte.  Weird how each Starbucks makes drink after drink, differently.

1.description: I walked in at 8:30 PM, sales associates told me they were closing in ten minutes (they close at 9 PM). Apparently on their computer it said 8:50. I told them their clock was wrong. They gave me an attitude....I took my sweet time with my purchase. When I rung up 20 minutes later, the time on the receipt was 8:50. The entire time they were harassing customers about the closing time.Corporate, where are you?

0.description: I had a very good experience last Friday at this store -it was the last day of an Oprah sponsored promotion / coupon for 50% your ENTIRE PURCHASE (sweeeet!) Despite the long lines and obvious crowded-ness of the store due to the special offer, I remember thinking that the girls at the registers were really sweet and had good customer service skills. I was very impressed with the treatment I received and was excited about the great coupon deal -I got a few pieces of cute costume jewelry -each $5.00 with the coupon! This is really close to where I live and was happy to find out they are open until 9pm. Some city stores close very early (at 6 or 7) so it's good I can stop by here on my way home from work and know they will not be closed! Way to go girls! You really kept a brave (and smiling) face despite that never ending line!

58.description: It's finally great to see solid hip businesses moving into the neighborhood. Rice N Roll's sign alone gives the neighborhood some funk - similar to what you see in Wicker Park or Belmont/Clark.The taste is great. Service is great. Portions can make a grown 200lb man catch a food coma.Visit them. Mike is one of the friendliest guys and always will take some time to chat with you while your food is being prepared.Three thumbs up.

56.description: Talk about delicious! I checked out Rice & Roll during my visit to Chicago and I've been craving their Pad Thai ever since. I also enjoyed the friendliness of the staff. This place is awesome.

29.description: Best Thai place in the city, hands down.  I especially love their strawberry bubble tea, which is fresher than I have had anywhere else.  The lunch specials are a great deal and the Pad Thai is amazing.Mike is always there to happily greet customers and provide suggestions and the food is great; not too oily or fatty tasting like some other Thai places.  I highly recommend Rice & Roll if you're in the mood for Thai.

42.description: Probably the best place to have Pad Thai in the city of chicago. The pad thai can be varied with taste and if you mention spicy then it is spicy! I love it!!...You can't beat the servings portion you get for the prices and people there are nice would definitely go back there again.

23.description: Pretty decent drunken noodles.  A large plate.

47.description: I'll admit it-- I'm partial to small, tailored menus executed fantastically. So when I first glanced at Rice and Roll's menu I was, well, skeptical. How could a tiny storefront execute Chinese, Japanese, and Thai deliciously? Rice and Roll somehow pulls it off.Nicole C. and I swung by here for a quick meal before heading downtown for a concert and were super impressed. Quick, fresh, and, surprisingly, ALL homemade. Literally, nothing appears to be frozen and reheated here-- not even their homemade crab rangoon.I ordered the aforementioned crab rangoon and spicy salmon maki. The former came out piping hot from the deep fryer and CLEARLY made from scratch. Cream cheese, tons of pepper and green onion, and bits of krab (yes, krab) lovingly rolled into perfect pouches of delicate wonton skin. Sweet, tangy, neon orange dipping sauce appeared to be the usual Chinese-restaurant fare. The sushi was incredibly fresh and beautifully assembled! Mine contained big, pink chunks of raw salmon, a sliver of green onion, and a large dollop of spicy mayo in sticky, well-seasoned sushi rice.Service was quick and friendly and the price was definitely right.Can't wait to go back this winter for a piping order of my favorite cold day treat, Tom Kha!

8.description: This place is awesome! My cousin told me about this place so I decided to try it. He said their sushi was awesome and indeed it was. Had a great experience here. Walked in and the owner acknowledged me right away and applied a coupon towards my order that saved me three bucks. I was shocked, who likes to save you money these days. Afterwards, while I was waiting for my Godzilla sushi, the owner brought me and my friend free egg rolls. It was a nice gesture and felt that he really cared for his customers. Next, we got the sushi and was shocked at how big they were. The owner also checked in on us to make sure everything was perfect which was also really nice. We barely finished our food and had to take some to go. Fact of the matter is, this place is friendly, their sushi is great and it's super cheap. Definitely a new classic for me and will defiantly be a repeat customer.

31.description: What a great place to get really decent Chinese and Thai at. I haven't had any of the Japanese but the Chinese and Thai are satisfying for my taste and money. It's not the best I've had but for when I'm at school and I'm craving Chinese/Thai this is my to go place. Plus, the owner is super friendly and always checks on you to see if you need anything. The food gets out fairly quick so for that and everything else, this place is pretty much a win.

34.description: I should have updated this a while ago. Micheal saw my review and actually delievered my food for me and threw in some pot stickers just the way I like them. Soft. So all you have to do is request it and they will cook it to your liking. Same with the crab rangoon. The smoothies are very good as well. They always have amazing service. I will keep ordering for the service, the price and the mongolian beef! :)

16.description: I've had several menu items & plan to try more.  I like this place & I pass it often so it's easy to grab some carry-out on the way home.  Sushi rolls are good, the thai dishes I've had so far have been yummy.  It's a nice atmosphere to sit & eat at the place.  The service is quite friendly & the owner is often around.

13.description: Great sushi, great service, great prices and a very friendly staff. If you're close by go here and if you're not, go anyway!

11.description: I've been enjoying the food at Rice & Roll for almost a year.  I wasted a couple of years riding by the place thinking it wouldn't be very good, because there's nothing about the exterior of the restaurant that would lead you to believe that it's not just another run-of-the mill Asian food joint.  But don't repeat my error! The beauty appears on the plates in the form of excellent Thai and Chinese food.  They also serve some Japanese rolls, if that's your thing, and these seem to be very popular because I see them ordered often when I'm there.  As a result of living in Thailand for 3 years, I'm partial to the Thai offerings.  The curries are great, along with the Pad Thai, Spicy basil leaves, Pad Woonsen, Vegetables Combo, and plenty of others.  You can select what protein you want in your dishes, or go vegetarian.  On the Chinese side, I'm very partial to the Pan Fried Noodles, and Orange Chicken.They also serve good appetizers and soups.  They'll adjust the "heat" to your personal preference, so if you like it spicy or you don't, you've come to the right place.  This restaurant is owned and operated by a very nice Thai family.  They employ what I'd call an honest approach to running a restaurant.  The food is all freshly prepared, the portions are more than ample, and the price is more than reasonable.This has been a great Chicago "food find" for me.  I hope you feel the same.

39.description: Oh happy day when my evening stroll took me smack into the front of Rice n Roll! Both times I've been there, the owners' son was at the counter and actually seemed happy to be there. Which to me is pretty darn impressive bc when your mom says you've gotta work the counter at the biz on Friday night,happy 'tudes probably don't immediately follow!  Aside from the food being delicious, fast, and cheap, it was brought to me when I was literally like two steps from the counter.

37.description: I've been here twice, and the owner (?) remembered us from the first time we went. We live nearby, so this is a good place to grab something close, fast, and cheap. It's fast food, so you aren't going to get the best quality. Taste-wise, it could use a little refinement. But if it tasted better, I would expect prices to be higher as well. For the cost to taste ratio, I think it's pretty good. The service is excellent, which is why I added an extra star.I've had a couple Chinese dishes, padthai and pad see ewe, eggs rolls, seaweed salad, and a curry. The Chinese dishes were a bit on the salty side for my taste, but this is the case with most Chinese food for my taste buds. I liked the padthai and curry. The pad see ewe was just ok. I love seaweed salad, and their was a tad bit heavy on the sauce (and a bit too sweet) but otherwise pretty good. I liked the cucumbers in the salad.

0.description: They have their own spin on egg fu young that includes carrots and peas.  Now I can't imagine it any other way.  Must try!

38.description: Stopped for a quick snack of pot stickers from here during my lunch break. Their own description says they are chicken... What I got was greasy fried dough filled with cabbage that was cooked in chicken broth. Not a single piece of chicken to be found in any of it. HIGHLY disappointing!

51.description: Rice and Roll is a solid Asian cuisine, serving the North Park community constantly good food on a low dime. I've been here many times before, so its a good time to write a quick update!I called today after being very hungry at work! I wanted Thai fried rice without eggs..no problem! I walked over and my food was ready to go with two veggie spring rolls! Lots of veggies in a large serving of rice, light on the soy sauce. In and out, back to my office with a health lunch. For $6 and some change, my wallet was happy too. Great and friendly service, good amount of seating, and fast on getting the food to you. Other things I have ordered and loved are sweet and sour chicken, egg rolls, and Chinese fired rice (usually with shrimp). Much love, Ride and Roll!

27.description: I only had the sushi here and it was ok.  It seemed like they used really small pieces of fish in their rolls and the two different rolls I ordered looked quite similar.  It was hard to tell them apart.  The disappointment for me was that because the fish pieces were so small, I couldn't really taste it.  Wish I had taken a picture so you could see what I mean.

32.description: The cashier was nice, service was very prompt. If you come here for food, be disappointed though. I tried all 3 styles of dishes.The beef and broccoli portion was small, and it was put on top of crispy noodles, so it was even smaller than I anticipated. It doesn't taste like it comes from a good Chinese restaurant.The pad thai was alright, but I found it had too much ketchup or sugar for my taste. Too sweet.The sushi is the biggest joke of all. It has a very small sliver of fish, low quality fish that does not at all taste sushi grade. It was rolled with a piece of green onion. WTF? It tastes like it cost 30 cents to make.I came in on a weekday, and I suppose its popular with high school students who flooded the establishment at around 11 or so. 4th period lunch I suppose. Just an afterthought.For the service  and speed they get two stars, but don't expect it to taste very good or be worth the money. The gyoza is tasty and the so are the free spring rolls. But... I came to eat not enjoy an appetizer and be disappointed.

54.description: Really good--fresh--nice-sized portions--and all entrees (only $5.95) come w/2 small egg rolls. They have 3 daily specials, too. Guy at the counter is friendly and helpful. Definitely recommended.

48.description: The food here is a little below average when compared to the typical Lincoln Square quality.  However, the portions are very generous and the dishes are very cheap.  A $5-6 entree may even end up feeding two people!  This probably not a place where I would take out of town guests, but if you need to fill up on a budget then definitely give it a try.

44.description: I have yet to eat anything from Rice and Roll because they fail to work their phone correctly. Honestly, it could just be bad luck, but it is still a bad first impression. I called and immediately put on hold. I'm fine with that. However I'm not actually put on hold, rather the man just puts the phone down so for five minutes I listen to him talk to other people or asking if customers need anything else or how they would like to pay. I hang up and try again and now the phone line is busy. It has been about five minutes (EDIT: going onto 15 minutes now) since I hung up and still the phone is off the line. You cannot get business over the phone if you do not hang it up. Juuuust saying.

24.description: I have to lower a star due to a last visit. I ordered vegetable chop suey that was awful. It didn't have the correct vegetables or sauce. They cooked it with gravy. The veggies were hard and I didn't get the free rolls. Not happy with the food. I may give them another chance, with the sushi.

7.description: Terrible, pad Thai was not good, I got only ,like ,5 shrimp... "Crap ragoon".. Was the worst I ever tasted I only stopped in because it was on my way home from work..wasted  $13

49.description: What a drag! I NEVER order take out but I was exhausted and starving and wanted to treat myself after a long day. I ordered the spring roll and the buddah roll.  The paper on the spring roll was so dry that it was actually cracking. And, the buddah roll was comically large (bigger is NOT better when it comes to sushi!) and the rice was like sand paper. I wound up eating the veggies inside the roll and throwing away all of the rice.  After spending $25 I still wound up making myself dinner!  There are way too many other options for me to waste my money on a place that can't even cook rice.

40.description: Great find in North Park / Albany Park. Usually places say their stuff is spicy, but it's really tame. The Pad Keimow here is actually spicy, and super good! Like melt your face off spice awesomeness enjoyment. Great prices as well.4 stars because the crab rangoon was not good. The 2 entrees we got were really good though. Really nice family runs it too.

53.description: i'm a huge fan of asian cuisine, and sometimes i have a hard time deciding which type i want to get. restaurant hopping isn't practical, so i go here since the menu is composed of thai, japanese, and chinease dishes. awesome, isn't it? first off, the food is delicious. the pad thai is tasty and you get complementary spring rolls if you buy a lunch portion. i have had the california rolls and they too, are awesome. the staff is super friendly, and i usually chat with the owner while waiting for my food. very chill ambiance, cute decor, plenty of tables if you choose to eat there. PLUS. it's so cheap! i definitely recommend.

30.description: Hands down THE best pad thai ever.  Everything about this is on point, from taste to spice to portion.  Also they have THE best crab ragoon i've had.  I would def. recco this place to any lover of awesome authentic thai food!

46.description: Dear Rice and Roll, you were there for me when I needed you- and for that I am thankful. You're tiny, and clearly running on love, which is great. Amy G and I stopped in before some other activities for the night. We went the rout of the sushi roll, and I was not disappointed. For the price everything we got was worth it, and the service was good too. They even brought our food out to us- even though we were a mere 5 feet from the counter, and could have gotten it ourselves. Since we didn't venture into actual entrees, I cant comment- but I would be willing to come back and try them.

1.description: Ordered food for delivery, food came in approximately 20 mins which is great if you're starving. But it posed questions on the freshness of the food.Ordered spicy Tuna roll, gross!  Should be called a Green Onion Roll because when you bite down you get an overwhelming taste of spicy onion, Yuck Crab Rangoon were pretty standard, and can't go wrong with shrimp fried rice.. Wouldn't order from here again..

55.description: A hidden Gem of awesome. The owners were sweet and the counter man(son?) was extremely friendly. I took my mother and niece here and they were extremely happy. My mom kept going on and on about her thai dish while we enjoyed sushi rolls from avocado and sweet potato to the spider roll I had. We finished it with the taro pudding. Everything was very tasty and CHEAP! how do they do it? We ate like kings and were very satisfied. You wish you can get this kind of quality at some higher end places. You might not be getting some college kid in a black shirt and a smirk giving you sashimi on a lacquered wooden platter but we got quality food you would find in a small shop in asia. this has renewed my faith in pan asian diners. Good job guys. You just won yourself a crop of new fans in my family.

9.description: Decent middle-of-the-road Thai, Chinese and Japanese food that is very inexpensive, and easily accessed by hungry NEIU students. Proximity and low price for the win. I was expecting their curries to have some spicy heat in them, but they were pretty bland, Americanized I guess. The Tom Kha soup tastes mostly like sweet coconut milk, missing the distinctive lemon grass and kaffir lime leaf tang that makes the soup so savory. Guys, add a second stalk of lemongrass, 5 more kaffir leaves and half a teaspoon of nam pla fish sauce and it'll taste AMAZING. The thickness of the coconut milk is already perfect, you just need some citrus kick to make the soup really sizzle.The sushi was well-rolled, appropriately portioned and tasty, A+ on that!The veggies taste pretty fresh and the meat is pretty good quality too.Overall, the portions are a good bargain, they do nice lunch specials and are an all-around solid restaurant for comfort food.

26.description: I have eaten at least a dozen things on their menu, ALL good! Decent prices, good portions. Fresh veggies, good quality food. Delivery was timely and the order was accurate. Two thumbs way up!

25.description: The staff was nice, the prices are good, delivery was fast. That said, the food was impressively unimpressive. The food was just plain/bland. Like when your grandma used to boil everything and then add a little salt at the end for flavor.

12.description: Great food, great service, great prices, and clean. Loved the experience I had at Rice and Roll, and can't wait to try more of the menu!

59.description: After discovering Rice n Roll on Yelp awhile back, we've become regulars. The service is awesome (the owner's son works the front and is very attentive and helpful). The food is really good and very affordable. We've stuck to the Thai and Chinese dishes, although they have sushi, too. The spicy basil dish is a favorite as well as the Tom Yum soup. It is nice and spicy and they will even make it vegetarian. A great place to eat a quick dinner! Also, their fruit smoothies are delicious (I'm a fan of the mango).

21.description: Decent middle-of-the-road Thai, Chinese and Japanese food that is very inexpensive, and easily accessed by hungry NEIU students. Proximity and low price for the win. I was expecting their curries to have some spicy heat in them, but they were pretty bland, Americanized I guess. The Tom Kha soup tastes mostly like sweet coconut milk, missing the distinctive lemon grass and kaffir lime leaf tang that makes the soup so savory. Guys, add a second stalk of lemongrass, 5 more kaffir leaves and half a teaspoon of nam pla fish sauce and it'll taste AMAZING. The thickness of the coconut milk is already perfect, you just need some citrus kick to make the soup really sizzle.The sushi was well-rolled, appropriately portioned and tasty, A+ on that!The veggies taste pretty fresh and the meat is pretty good quality too.Overall, the portions are a good bargain, they do nice lunch specials and are an all-around solid restaurant for comfort food.

17.description: This was my first experience at Rice N Roll and it was a carry-out experience. I called and ordered two orders of Salmon Rolls after viewing their online menu. My food was prepped in less than 10 minutes. I walked in and the cashier, owner I suppose after reading their "about" online, greeted me and knew I was there to pickup. My two salmon rolls totaled out to $10.93 average price for Sushi in the Chicagoland area, not too expensive, not the cheapest I've had. He then asked where I went to school, and gave me an instant discount of 10%, which lowered my total to $9.93. Honestly, the salmon rolls are one of the worst that I've had. I expected way more and do think they can do way better with their sushi. - The rice tastes like normal white rice and not sushi rice. - Each roll consisted of 6 pieces, but the pieces were small.- The salmon was thin, and doesn't look or taste like any other salmon that I've had in a salmon roll, tastes like smoked salmon. - The avocado was the only good part.

10.description: I come here for lunch almost once a week, it's close to my work. I have tried most of the appetizers, Thai, and Chinese dishes and have enjoyed them all. What I cannot speak to are the Japanese dishes. But this place has very good, well presented and reasonably priced food, which is why I keep coming back.

5.description: This place was really good! I got the Tom Kha soup to start. I subbed the meat for tofu and it was good! Not the best I've had, but I would have it again. I got the awesome roll, which was also good, and pretty large for only $9. For desert, I asked for strawberry mochi, but ended up with mango. No matter, it was still delicious. I would return here for some decently priced sushi.

3.description: I called and the person who answered the phone was very polite and understood perfectly what i was saying big PLUS! Delivery came in within the time it was promised on a friday night! Again big plus! Food was hot another plus! Lets get down to food my boyfriend got orange chicken whis was amazing. I got shrimp fried rice it was my first time that i got chinese delivery and the shrimp was bigger than what we used to and butterflied! How awesome was that! Anyways overall the food was great it wasnt greasy they are really taking care of the business.

35.description: I am OBSESSED with Rice n Roll - I used to eat here almost every day for lunch when I was a student at North Park. I would get the Cucumber Salad almost everyday... AMAZING and only $3! And their Sweet Potato Roll is unreal! Craving this place big time and will be making a trip ASAP now that I live in Irving Park!

19.description: it's on my way home from work so I said I'll try it..bad idea  "crap ragoon" was terrible, pad thai not good, don't even give you your monies worth..I'll stay with star of siam, thai valley, and spoon thai..REAL thai food!!!

28.description: Their delivery drivers are prompt, friendly, and the food is cheap and tasty. 5th star withheld b/c their avocado maki is mostly rice...not much seaweed or avocado. But everything else about their food is fantastic, and well worth 4 stars.

45.description: Rice & Roll is a welcome addition to the North Park neighborhood and their food doesn't disappoint.  I've gone there repeatedly to get their Pad Thai and it is delicious every time.  The place is small and casual, and the staff is fast, friendly, and professional.  They even offer water to waiting customers and have sports on their television.  The only reason why this isn't a 5 star joint is that I have tried some of their Chinese food, and it wasn't nearly as good as their Thai.  I do recommend visiting this place for a nice cheap dinner.

33.description: ordered from grub hub.com meal was supposed to be delivered by 6:39 PM and arrived at 6:30 pm. Meals are very cheap so I gave this place a shot for dinner. I got the gyoza dumplings which were very greasy when they arrived. Complimentary spring rolls were good. Pad see ewe was okay. The panang curry i wouldn't get from here again. There was no other flavor except spice. It also came with the option of noodles or rice. I took noodles like a crazy person. I say crazy person cause there are hardly any in the container. I guess if you want to try this dish go for rice.

43.description: Still great food & wonderful service! So glad to see this family own place is making it & not cutting corners. All the food is made to order & is fresh. The son runs front of the house is really cool & nice guy, he knows customer service he welcome me back since it had been several months since we had order there. We def be ordering from Rice & Roll again soon:)

2.description: My wife and I sopped in here after driving past here a couple of times.  The mural on the window is actually what caught our eye and we figured wed give it a shot. We ordered a couple sushi rolls just to see what this place was all about  Spicy Salmon Roll and Spicy Shrimp Roll.  They were both sub par.  The rice was too mushy and the salmon and shrimp didn't taste fresh at all.  There seemed to be onions in the rolls too amd it was almost too overpowering..  The wasabi looked like it was just squeezed out of a toothpaste tube and it was lacking the kick we have come to expect out of our wasabi, and the soy sauce was way too sweet for my taste.  So all in all it was a disappointment, but that was only the sushi.  So I would not go back for that, but I would like to go back to try the Thai food or Chinese food.  That is supposedly what they do well.

18.description: Flavorful, fresh and delicious food all cooked by the owner who was born in Thailand.  It's delicious - especially the Pad Thai and Miso soup.  The food is really well priced - a great option for the two local colleges (North Park and NEIU). Their bubble tea is super fresh and delicious. The lunch specials are insane - great food and lots of it for less than $6.

41.description: Last night my boyfriend and I used our Groupon Now coupons and headed over to Rice n Roll.  I had bad experiences in the past, but I wanted sushi badly and I decided to give them one more shot.I got three rolls and shared them with my boyfriend- the Alaska was by farrrrr the best!! Very tasty.  The sushi tasted fresh and, though some of it was a teensy bit bland, it was overall delightful, especially for the price.My boyfriend got fried rice (Chinese) which he liked but I thought was just ok, and we shared crab rangoons which were awesome!!! The dough they used was less heavy and thick than most other places, and i loved that!  They were less greasy and fry-y than other crab rangoons.Also, the service was great- both the cook and the guy at the front counter were very pleasant.  I'll be back- at least for sushi and rangoons!

52.description: Worse Chinese food ever.  Had the Mongolian beef and it had no flavor, tasted more like it was steamed in a wok and no stir fried, and had an odd smell.  Willing to give it another shot because it is on the way to work and easier to pick up food than order something when I get there.

50.description: Just had a spontaneous dinner there after work with my boyfriend. We were greeted with a smile by friendly Mike. Surprisingly, the menu had "duck over rice" so I ordered it, and I am now here yelping about it that tells you that I was satisfied! My boyfriend had a curry dish and enjoyed it too. We'll def be back to try more...

4.description: I don't understand how you don't offer lunch special when you're located between two main colleges. Other than that the environment inside was nice, Calm and relaxing.

6.description: Great little place.  Super casual hole-in-the-wall type of place.  If you like spicy, they can make you "cry" and "sweat" with the best of them.  But if you are not into that sort of heat, they can dial it back no problem.  Haven't tried a whole lot of variety because I like what I like, and haven't strayed from it in years.  Though everyone I know that tries various dishes is always satisfied if not really happy.  You place your order and pay upfront whether ordering "to go" or dining "in." If you're sticking around to eat, have a seat after you order.  They bring your food to the table.

22.description: Quick, good, cheap, however, a little light on the meat. Closed Sundays, which I find annoying.

15.description: this is literally the worst sushi i've ever had in my life. i don't know how this place has decent reviews, they must have sold their souls to satan. the rice is super mushy, it's exactly like minute rice. the salmon was unlike any sushi i've ever had. i think they were using packaged cheap smoked salmon for salmon rolls, it made no sense. they hardly even put any fish in their rolls at all. OH and i found two short black hairs in my food...i couldn't believe how bad this all was. i'll be lucky if i don't get food poisoning. just a grubhub order gone terribly wrong, and a complete waste of money. i ended up making myself some damn toast for dinner instead.

57.description: Soild Asian food.  A mix of Thai, Chinese, and Japanese. Always friendly service and freshly made food.  This is a regular place for me.  Its in walking distance of my workand always satisfies an Asian food craving.  Food is fairly cheap, 4-6 bucks for a dish and it comes with some small fried spring rolls and a side salad or soup.  I have tried most of their noodle dishes which are always good.  I think the Thai stuff is their strong suit while the sushi is not the best but works.  You can always count on a copy of the newspaper and the Bulls game on.  Fast, cheap, and friendly. A great little find in Albany Park.

20.description: This was my first experience at Rice N Roll and it was a carry-out experience. I called and ordered two orders of Salmon Rolls after viewing their online menu. My food was prepped in less than 10 minutes. I walked in and the cashier, owner I suppose after reading their "about" online, greeted me and knew I was there to pickup. My two salmon rolls totaled out to $10.93 average price for Sushi in the Chicagoland area, not too expensive, not the cheapest I've had. He then asked where I went to school, and gave me an instant discount of 10%, which lowered my total to $9.93. Honestly, the salmon rolls are one of the worst that I've had. I expected way more and do think they can do way better with their sushi. - The rice tastes like normal white rice and not sushi rice. - Each roll consisted of 6 pieces, but the pieces were small.- The salmon was thin, and doesn't look or taste like any other salmon that I've had in a salmon roll, tastes like smoked salmon. - The avocado was the only good part.

36.description: Friendly and informative servers. I will definitely come back to try something else than Rama chicken w/noodles, it could have been good for other people but not my type of food, i like spicy. It was good tho! I like this place for it's cheap but decent portion of food. Ask for their daily specials!

14.description: My sister and I have been coming to Rice & Roll for years now. Since day one, Mike has provided outstanding customer service and the food has been superb. The portions are large and reasonably priced. Try it out, you'll love it!

29.description: Damn Panera it's typically decent service and it's return customers.  Why does it always have to be busy?  I wish this location had a drive-thru.   Tons of parking available.

42.description: since i've been studying alot lately, i've been hitting up numerous paneras around the city/burbs.  i love panera because of the free wifi.  however, i've discovered that from 11am-2pm, you're only allowed to access the wifi for a max of 30 min!  bummer.  anyway, this panera is pretty cozy (they have a faux fireplace, i think) and there's tons of booths to study in.  however, the downfall is that there's only ONE noticeable outlet!  honestly?  people were constantly fighting for the tables by the outlet.  other than that, the service is fast & friendly.

23.description: A great place that is very comfortable and the staff is very friendly. I have the Panera card and I've gotten a few free meals and drinks with it :) I tried the new Mediterranean breakfast sandwich and it was ridiculously good!

47.description: Typical Panera fare. Staff was super friendly and the coffee was good.But the music is too dang loud! It's like they don't want you sticking around having a conversation or reading or studying, so they crank up the jazz saxophone so loud that you leave.

8.description: Great customer service! After I seated my 90 year old aunt,  a courteous young man helped me find a menu. The table delivery service was impeccable. I even asked the man who delivered our food for help with my wifi. As I rose to clear our dishes, Oscar smiled and took them from me. I wish I had gotten the names of everyone so I could mention them in this review. This is my aunt's favorite Panera.

31.description: This place is awesome because it has free wi-fi, and you can sit and drink coffee in a public place while working on your laptop. But what's the fun in that when it's packed and there are Jr. High kids giggling and making a lot of noise and talking about cute boys?  The food is good but beware. I used to get the portabella sandwich but for some reason they don't have it anymore. The guy working there suggested the tomato and mozzarella sandwich, which was really good. I was curious and I went online to check the nutrition information on their sandwiches and realized that they're not as healthy as they make you think. Gourmet bread and fresh ingredients does not necessarily mean it's good for you. The coffee is mediocre. I actually get the frozen lemonade in the summertime. The brain freeze is a small price to pay. I'm going to give Panera props for having tasty sandwiches, even though it's probably best that you only get them once in a while, and for the free wi-fi, which is great if you can't find a library or a quiet cafe that has also has free wi-fi. Just make sure you wear your blinders and ear plugs, becuase the place can get noisy and distracting.

34.description: Nice location down my block.The food is alright, I always get the combo - 1/2 sandwich, 1/2 salad, and cup of soup - you pick two.  Unlimited refills on fountain drinks. Spacious and comfy seating. Free wifi too! And they don't care if you sit there for a few hours =)

16.description: Damn Panera it's typically decent service and it's return customers.  Why does it always have to be busy?  I wish this location had a drive-thru.   Tons of parking available.

13.description: Comfortable atmosphere nice fireplace. Wide variety of seating options computer friendly. the housekeeping is questionable. They have very good taste.

11.description: Always quick . Even when there is a line it moves quick I love their steel cut oatmeal I needed to lower my cholesterol level and there you ll find the best oatmeal ever. It comes with brown sugar and granola but I asked to be removed ..

39.description: My honey was craving some Panera this weekend so we ventured out to this location that is close to our new home. We both enjoyed our meals but I had to deduct a star because of a customer that was indecent and ruined my appetite.We walk in and there is a larger man wearing shorts and a short t-shirt. Well, he was exposing his butt crack and I'm not just talking the top, I mean almost to the middle of his behind was exposed!!! Also, his stomach was poking out under his shirt! He was definitely causing heads to turn and not in a good way. We will be back at this location since it's not too far from our place. I just hope the man who likes to moon stays away!!

37.description: Originally, I would have rated this Panera a 4 based on my typical morning experience.  When I manage to roll out of bread and get my day started on a Saturday, my first stop is usually Panera for some coffee and a bagel (although their breakfast sandwiches are also quite tasty).  Service is usually fast and polite.If you go in around lunch time, service can be hit or miss.  They're typically fast and usually get what I order.  Also, their IC or freeze drinks or whatever really make summer  a little easier.  Their outside seating is nice and usually clean too.Going for dinner was a totally different (and unfortunately, unpleasant) experience.  Our order-taker was on the impatient side and didn't understand what we were ordering at the same time.  We tried to order two things on the menu that they were out of by the time the order made it to the people who put my order together.  There were maybe 2 orders in front of us, but it took 15 minutes to get two sandwiches and two bowls of soup.By the time i got to the bathroom, I was disgusted - The women's room TP was on the floor (because the dispenser was broken) and half wet.  All the garbage cans were overflowing and the floor was wet.Most of the tables had assorted "stuff" on them, and the seating isn't for more than four people - they need a little more variety in their arrangements.If i go back here, I'll stick with the morning crew - they seem to have a better handle on what they're doing.

0.description: This is one of the best locations I have ever had the joy to visit!  The food is always well-made and brought out quickly.  The customer service is superb.  The last time I visited, there was a young man working who was very prompt at bringing out our food, asking if we needed anything else, and then bussing our table.  I would have left a tip on the table if I knew another customer wouldn't grab it!

38.description: I go here pretty much every Saturday with a couple of my girlfriends for some good chica chat time.  Of course we go after we weigh in at WW :-)  It is a great place to catch up with friends over coffee & some bagels and being right across from a Borders is a major plus.  However, it is not the greatest coffee in the world (tis okay) & sometimes you can get pestered there by pan handlers (do not love that!!).  The bagels are yummy--although they could use a little more variety--I know they are not Einsteins--but still stir it up a little.  The salads are pretty good, and I love the Frontega chicken sandwich.  The servers are super friendly & pretty helpful with clean upAlso, as one yelper noted--I think people forget how close you are sitting in there or how loud they can be, but I am not interested in hearing the sorid details of your life--so please be aware of your surroundings!

51.description: I'm pretty fond of their soup bowls.  Their bagels are great too.  I love the french toast with the hazel nut cream cheese.  The staff is usually friendly and very helpful and they give out samples of their product so you know how things taste.

27.description: We love Panera Bread because my granddaughter, age 2, who is a picky eater, will eat most if not all of a small chicken noodle soup while dunking her bread into it and eating that too. She also eats most of their sweet, delicious apples.The summer time strawberry, poppyseed with chicken salad is super good, and with a reasonable amount of calories.  My favorite though is their Salmon mediterranean salad that's available in the winter. It has feta cheese, olives and a mix of salad greens. Terrific.I like the atmosphere, but that may be because I work at a high school so the teens using free wi-fi seems like home to me.

32.description: I'm trying to eat healthier so I tried the asian sesame chicken salad, one of Panera's "signature" items, with one of their whole wheat baguettes, and although the light vinaigrette dressing was a tad too sweet, I finished the whole thing! The little wonton crisps add the perfect texture to the mix. So I'm sold, Panera is great for having your laptop out, with plenty of outlets near the perimeters, while you enjoy a salad, and some coffee, although it's crowded on the middle of a Saturday and there's a bit of a draft running through the restaurant that everyone had their coats on.  The parking lot is a bit congested with the odd shaped Lincoln Village configuration.

54.description: I really like Panera, but for some reason almost every time I go to this one there is some kind of problem.  They've given me the wrong orders, given me broccoli cheese soup instead of chicken noodle (still not quite sure how those 2 sound alike...), had to refund me after overcharging me - and once they were out of bagels.  ???  Isn't that like McDonald's being out of hamburgers?

48.description: Really good food at moderate prices. Lot of high carb stuff:-), but you could get a soup or something. They are good too. My fav is the frontega chicken. You HAVE to try that.

44.description: Alas, because there is no Panera in New York City, there is none listed on yelp, so I had to search for other cities that harbor this curiously addictive chain in order to review it. My first experience with this place involved having a Garden Vegetable sandwich at a Panera-catered party, which included a tremendous salad, other sandwich varieties, apples, and various cookies and brownies. I remember it as being small yet ver filling and delightful to eat. On another occasion, I enjoyed their French onion soup encased within a sourdough bread bowl; I hate the whole damn thing, it was so good, and despite feeling like my stomach might've sprung a leak, continued to rave about it. Now, I'm going to skip over all of the other sandwiches I've had, as many of them were only available for a limited time. What I want to discuss are the BAGELS.I kid you not, I ate the equivalent of five bagels in one morning, just because of my utter obsession with these chewy morsels. Asiago cheese is a savory delight, while chocolate and dutch apple provide just enough sugar and spice, respectively, to make them irresistible. French toast was five, as was blueberry, and I fondly remember a cherry vanilla one made in the shape of a breast cancer ribbon. I highly recommend these plain or with a minimal amount of spread for maximum flavor domination.

24.description: It could be better. They ass'd one of my smoothies. First of all, they didn't make enough as it filled halfway. So instead of making a new batch, they made a little bit more to pour it on top of the former. It tasted like crap, watered down, bubble, eughhh! I only go here for the soups. Btw, they're not very clean.. they have cockroaches.

7.description: The service standard has been dropping at this location, but has never been ideal. I have encountered lost orders (both catering pickup and rapid pick up), late catering deliveries, wrong and missing food items within my catering orders, etc. I would notify Management anytime I was met with an issue, and was promised better service. This morning I had a catering order set to deliver between 7:15 AM-7:30 AM. I placed the order a week in advance, and received my email confirmation yesterday afternoon. As I was waiting for my food - at 7:32 AM I received a call from the store to inform me that they would not be delivering my food as they didn't have a delivery driver. Now, I have 20 people waiting for their breakfast, that was supposed to be served AT 7:30 AM, and instead I am met with poor customer service and a lack of food. I asked that they pull someone from the store to deliver my food, as we are nearby and was connected to a Manager, who gave me no further help. They claimed they called my office phone and left a voicemail, but I received no voicemail, not even a missed call. The same goes for my email cancellation notification - they claim it went out, and I received nothing. I came into the office at 7:00 AM specifically to accept this meal delivery and have been left with nothing. This has set my meeting time back, left me with unfed business guests, and made me very unsatisfied. I ended my conversation requesting a full refund; should this not happen, there will be an even larger issue. I will not recommend this location for catering, nor will I order from them again. Poor Management, Poor Execution, Poor Service.

49.description: Panera is a great soup and sandwich type place. The service at this particular Panera is actually pretty nice and attentive...at other Panera's that really hasn't been the case. I think one of my favorite meals at Panera is the Turkey, Artichoke Panini with the Black Bean Soup. Ooo so good! The restaurant itself is really cozy...you got the fireplace, comfy armchairs, booths and tables and the lighting is very soft. Panera isn't probably going to win at Zagat surveys but if I want a nice tasty soup and sandwich combo...Panera is where I'm heading.

40.description: i stopped by here to pick up some tea and possibly a sweet snack if something looked good. their tea selection was weak and not clearly displayed, and they didn't really have any vegan treats other than bagels. there was no mention of the availability of soymilk anywhere but they did have some so that was good. they had some tomato bread samples out and the sign said "tomatoe bread" which reminded me of dan quayle so that was a bummer! plus there was this lady ahead of me in line that was stuffing her mouth with it and then she ordered some beef sandwich or something - that sort of made me feel yucky.the cashier was nice so he gets the extra star (the first star is for the soymilk). while he was helping me, he pushed a hot cart of baked stuff from the back to the front of the store. he yelled "hot rack" as he was moving the cart as to warn people so that no one got burned. right then, his creepy manager came out of nowhere and reprimanded him right in front of me saying "um, we're not gonna say "hot rack" anymore. we're now going to say "hot muffins" or whatever it is that's on the rack because we sell hot paninis and hot cookies, not hot racks." he was totally serious too. the cashier just stood there embarrassed and proceeded to ring me up. what a douche that manager is! he couldn't wait 2 minutes to talk to him after i was gone? i mean, come on - that's customer service 101. if i know that a business treats their employees poorly, that's reason enough to not go back. so yea - i won't be going back.

53.description: Great food.I have never had the problems like the previous poster.Try this sandwich.....tuna salad, avocado, cucumbers, tomatoes, chipotle mustard on a nice rustic bread.omg......delicious.Also try their green tea.Lovely.

30.description: The location is pretty convenient. I come every once in awhile and order the same thing. The service is good. The food tastes delicious. I've tried the coffee and it wasn't satisfying,

46.description: I love Panera!  Nothing better than a sandwich and bowl of soup and french bread!!!  This Panera is pretty good....workers are pretty friendly for the most part.........but you always have the same problem at all of them.  Old people saving seats for everyone!  What the heck!!   Then they go up one by one to order.  Now if i order a sandwich and bowl of soup and a drink.....my tab is almost close to $11 or $12!!  thats a little much!a few questions here is why they ask for your NAME and then call out your name when your order is ready?  hello!  i have my pager!  and the ongoing debate, do you throw your own garbage out or leave it for them to take!  they actually have taken my garbage from me here........on occassion!

1.description: Oh Panera! Once upon a time I would've happily headed here for lunch every single day of the week. It seems that my taste buds have grown or changed.I took my mother here for a quick salad and half sandwich. The people at the cash registers were friendly,helpful, and quick. The friendliness is greatly appreciated. I used to eat their asiago roast beef sandwich when work ordered platters. It's been changed to an asiago steak sandwich. My sandwich was not the greatest on this day, the meat had little flavor, was tough to chew, and contained a large streak of fat. The half Caesar salad was as good as it ever has been.I do enjoy their scones and cookies :)This location, packed into strip mall, appears large at first. Once you try to navigate to a table, you are tripping over people, purses, backpacks, and chairs. There's not enough room between the tables and the booths for people to walk. I can't imagine trying to maneuver a wheelchair through this location. Watching somebody use a walker was rather fear inducing.They do offer a nice outdoor patio.As you can see, quite a mixed review. If you came in ordered and picked up dessert you'd be in good shape!

9.description: This is a great Panera location.  Nice staff, clean facility and good food.  One of the other nice things about this location is that it's right off the bike trail - so if you're heading up the North Brance trail - then stop off at this Panera for a quick bite.

26.description: I used to enjoy coming here with my two sisters, and ordering one of their sandwiches. They have pretty good bread too.

25.description: When you want to try to go the healthy route for lunch, Panera has my vote. I love the way they post the calories of all their sandwiches on the wall menu. I always get the Smokey Turkey sandwich without the tomatoes and onions plus a slice of cheese. A total of 460 delicious calories. I used to do the Pick 2 (half sandwich and a soup). However, once I found out that the Broccoli and Cheddar had 16 grams of fat, I decided that this cannot be allowed anymore. Recently, I have tried the black bean soup, it is absolutely delicious. Unfortunately, they do not have nutritional information on this particular soup, I even checked online to make sure. Lately, I've been doing the pick 2 with this soup, but next time I visit the place, I won't buy it again until I know what I'm eating. I give this place a 4, because ever treat that I have bought from them has not met my expectations of deliciousness. It's not like I get treats often, but when I do, if I going to commit the crime of eating junkfood, it better be worth the taste. Panera falls short on this note.Last but not least, the staff has always been friendly to me. I will say that the reward program kinda sucks. I always get rewards for drinks or for discounts off drinks. Perhaps Panera thinks they can sucker me into buying a drink if they give me a discount, not the case, I only drink water and an occasional milk. It's funny how they try to market me an item that I obviously never buy. That said, I guess I won't buy a treat for a while. Maybe the system will realize, "Oh look....this guy does't buy treats, maybe if we offer him a reward on one he'll be hooked to always buy one with his meal in the future." Anyways, I don't hold anything against Panera for having a lame reward system. That is a bonus that they do not have to offer. So this fact does not reflect any part of my rating, it was just something that I got a kick out of mentioning.

12.description: I think my biggest disappointment is with Panera in general. All the food seems to be microwaved. The highlight is going to have a meal there and watching them toss a plastic bag full of ravioli into a microwave oven. You charge fresh prices and give microwave food. Really I don't get it I can make this myself better

21.description: Road Rage Alert!!  There's something about this parking lot, that upon entering, everyone turns into a psycho freak-show that is in the biggest hurry of their miserable lives. I can't figure it out, maybe they're sad because the Borders closed. In any event, I would suggest that you park very far away and walk to the entrance.This is my go-to place to meet my girlfriend for lunch. There's never a line more than 3 people deep, and always plenty of tables available.Staff is friendly, and come to take your dishes when you're finished eating. There's a nice fireplace in the middle of the room - and some nice large tables if you're with a big group.I like their Mediterranean Veggie sandwich, it's very flavorful and filling. I split it with their vegetable soup and get a lunch that's under 400 calories! As long as I stay away from their bakery items (which always look really good) I can stick to a healthy lunch.Just watch out for the crazies when you leave to go back to your car. Seriously, they're not paying attention!

17.description: I am here about once a week for my business meeting. They allow us, and everyone else for that matter, to stay for hours. I like the sammiches and salads and they have decent coffee.The best part are the employees, starting with the managers ( one of them is expecting and she is the most helpful). They have gone out of their way for my requests and have never batted an eye. Only issue, I wish they had more seating.

10.description: Attentive waitstaff and never had an issue. Quite a large Panera and plenty of outlets in case you want to bring your laptop to sit! Very comfy seating and there's even a fireplace.

5.description: This is my pleasure to take time to write this review. The nicest most friendly staff I've ever encountered at any Panera ever!! The new manager Jen was fantastic! She stopped by to say hi and check on us while the other staff cleaned our table!! What a nice place!! Thanks ladies

3.description: Cozy Panera Bread to spend your time checking your email and having a warm coffee when snowing outside! I like the chimney area, although too busy offers a nice touch to this restaurant and does not feel so fast-foody. Good location next to a Ross store.

35.description: I always get the same thing...cup of hazelnut coffee & an asiago cheese bagel.  I might go a little crazy sometimes & get a cinnamon raisin bagel. Never once have I been disappointed from this location.  It's laid out nicely, the staff is extremely friendly & it's a decent place to people watch.  On a side note, I think this is the place that every drug rep hangs out at when on the North Side.  You can spot them out quite quickly...there the ones with the perfectly pressed suits & taking advantage of the free Wi-Fi.

19.description: I love coming here for breakfast and lunch. the asiago bagels with chai latte is my usual for breakfast. I like the diferrent combos with the "you pick 2's"... the location is very convenient for me, and I like the atmosphere to get work done... free wifi and outlets for laptops, beats going to barnes n nobles!

28.description: Great Bagels for breakfast......but that's all!!   I've eaten at this Panera 3 times....once for a salad.  The dressing was TERRIBLE!  Once for their new advertised Cuban sandwich.  Bread was so hard I couldn't eat it.  TERRIBLE!  Another time a friend wanted to go there so I had a different salad.  Again....the dressing was terrible and the salad was wilted.  If you want bagels and cream cheese OK....but anything else....skip it and go to Corner Bakery for good food instead!

45.description: Three reasons to go to Panera-The Asian Sesame Chicken SaladThe Chicken and Rice SoupThe Turkey Artichoke PaniniNever go for-The coffee (weak, bad aftertaste)The Baked Goods (lest your thighs swell up like water balloons)The Atmosphere (take out is your friend)

33.description: I like the half sandwich/ soup combo and IM a fan of the italian on asiago (YUM) Im also a broccoli cheese soup  zombie. I've never eaten in since my 4 year old isnt feelin the atmosphere. But I know they offer free wifi and a cozy setting for a nice kid free adult hour or two...ahhh now that sounds almost as good as my soup/ sandwich combo.lol

43.description: I like Panera.  I mostly like Panera because if you are watching your weight, this is a fast food place that you can actually not blow your diet on.  They have plenty of salads and low fat soups to choose from that are very decent.  On the other hand, if you are dieting and have no will power, then best you stay away.  Their baked goods are pretty yummy.  What bummed me out about this morning's visit, however is the very unfriendly person at the counter.  I will say that I usually do have nice people here, but today....not so.  I usually go to Starbucks a couple doors down but today I wanted something to nibble on and I am not crazy about the food offerings at Starbucks.  So I decided on going to Panera instead.  But I gotta tell ya, at least at Starbucks, everyone is very friendly.  This girl at Panera today was just either not liking her job or just a big old snob.  (maybe both).  My whole thought on that is if you dont like your job and you cant fake it anymore, time to move on cause people are paying for a service.  At any rate, I will still go to Panera because I like their food.  I hope that counter girl quits, though.

2.description: My sister had order the cobblestone muffin and it was actually pretty good! Service was good and I like the atmosphere of the place!

18.description: Panera offers great food and beverages, some of it can add up to be quite costly but I enjoy the atmosphere when it's not overcrowded and loud, like every lunch hour and weekends.

41.description: first I will indulge you with the coffee complaint.  The dark roast was watery and weak in flavor.  So I was using the cafe blend, not my favorite but it was the best one there.Then the internet was coming in and out all day.  They said there was a limit for lunch time internet use.  Well that excuse should not be valid at 4pm.Thirdly, there were three ghetto dudes discussing producing a porno at the table next to us.  They were talking about getting a loft for some scenes, then asking where to film the outdoor scenes.  One said he knew some girls, but they didn't have money for makeup so maybe they can tell one she can do the makeup for all of them and just put her on the credits.  So yeah interesting day at Panera

52.description: Have not had service problems here like one reviewer and in fact have found the service faster and efficient than some other Panera locations.I like the Panera chain becuase their bread is chewy and excellent, they have good soups, and the sandwiches are well prepared.  Everything seems about $.50 less than Corner Bakery, which I do not care for as much.  This place has free WiFi and does not seem to kick people out even if they are sitting there for a while using it.

50.description: I'm not a fan of this Panera.  The staff is friendly enough, but I've had fresher food elsewhere.  And when they bake the bread on site, its kind of not cool to serve stale bread.  Honestly though, I'd look past that if I could get a decent seat in this place.  Its so cramped, and they have only a handful of tables that seat more than two people comfortably.  I came in here with two little boys for lunch, and due to it being lunchtime (crowded!), we sat at a table built for two, and then received dirty looks from the multiple single people sitting at tables for four spreading out newspapers, etc.  because the boys were talking excitedly - not screaming or making a mess, just talking.  I wouldn't come back to this location with kids in tow and I doubt I'd come in by myself because there are better, more comfortable places on my way home from work.

4.description: A cozy cafe with free wifi and plenty of seating. Even a fireplace. My girlfriends and I meet for coffee here, and it's also a great place for short business meetings. Their coffee isn't as good as Starbucks in my opinion, yet they do have decent iced coffee, teas, and a variety of other beverages, as well as healthy breakfast options like oatmeal, breakfast sandwiches, and their wonderful pastries. My personal favorite is their individual souffles. (Spinach and artichoke, spinach and bacon, 4 cheese). My husband loves their french onion soup. They always have several soups each day, and you can have a cup, bowl, or bread bowl. They have a nice variety of salads, sandwiches, and pasta entrees for lunch or dinner. I appreciate the fact that they list the calorie content on every item.I only subtracted one star for their rewards program, which seems inconsistent. And today of all days, I DID achieve an award (a free pastry or sweet), yet when the cashier swiped my rewards card, she didn't inform me. (They usually do, and they also ask if you want to use it on this visit.) I only knew because it was on my receipt and I saw it after I sat down.Other than that, I really like this place and go to both locations near me. They do a great job keeping the place clean and tidy as well.

6.description: This place is so dirty! The tables smell like they were cleaned with a moldy rag! Can't eat with the bad smell of the tables. The floors are gross and dirty.

22.description: Food is good. Wish sone of the portions are bigger. Prices are decent. Great thing is the free wifi and free refills on pop. If you don't like their coffee selection. There is a Starbucks next door.

15.description: I wanted to get me a roast beef asiago sandwich and soup but no where to sit.So I did not order and eat here.                       Boo!

20.description: I am very fond of this Panera, as they let me host my 40th Ward phone banks here - they let any group meet here, actually, and they have free-wifi as well as some outlets scattered around.  You don't even need to make an appointment!  Lots of free parking in the lot.I like the food at Panera, I find it fresh and tasty for chain food.  Today I had the garden vegetable soup which was hot and tasty, and came with some yummy bread.  Mango smoothie was thick, yummy, and pretty low-cal.I'm sort of glad I'll be here once a week for phone banks, because it's an excuse to eat more tasty Panera food.  It's nice and cool in there from the A/C, so it's always a good time for soup!  Some people come here to study and others come to chat, so the noise level varies - it's definitely not quiet, but it'll do!  Oh and they have a fireplace in the middle - haven't seen it lit (duh, since it's July), but I bet that'll be a nice touch come fall!

36.description: This place has become part of me. lol. I literally will come here once a week, without realizing. The food is good, being a vegetarian they have some yummy options. I like how they are willing to change a meal for you, you can substitute things, etc. and they don't start charging you like petty people (ie- 50 cents for cheese, 20 cents for tomato -like other places do).they are friendly, polite and very respectful. they have a good system going, very organized and with a huge line of people, they seem ot move efficiently. the seating is comfy, and with free wifi, you can get some studying in if you want. I like it because it has comfort food, soup and salad. soup being a rare thing to find other than at a restaurant. The only thing that is annoying, is the small space. it is a big location but it is usually so popular that, you are sitting close to other people. Sometimes you have to change your order to take out, bc you realize there is no seat for you. I can't ever decide if this place is expensive. $7 for half a sandwich and abowl of soup. hmm. i really don't know. but it is filling, wholesome and i feel a little bit better, than eating a burger or some other junk. Since i first went there, i have taken all of my closest family and friends there. Usually, when i am seeing a friend after a long time-we go there to catch up, relax and get some food in. The staff is nice and don't mind how long you sit there for. try it -you won't regret it.

14.description: I am very fond of this Panera, as they let me host my 40th Ward phone banks here - they let any group meet here, actually, and they have free-wifi as well as some outlets scattered around.  You don't even need to make an appointment!  Lots of free parking in the lot.I like the food at Panera, I find it fresh and tasty for chain food.  Today I had the garden vegetable soup which was hot and tasty, and came with some yummy bread.  Mango smoothie was thick, yummy, and pretty low-cal.I'm sort of glad I'll be here once a week for phone banks, because it's an excuse to eat more tasty Panera food.  It's nice and cool in there from the A/C, so it's always a good time for soup!  Some people come here to study and others come to chat, so the noise level varies - it's definitely not quiet, but it'll do!  Oh and they have a fireplace in the middle - haven't seen it lit (duh, since it's July), but I bet that'll be a nice touch come fall!

58.description: I've only ever come here for the bing soo.  Usually I get paht (red bean) bing soo, because I love the sweet red bean.  It's always tasty, especially when it's hot outside.  I love the shaved ice topped with sweetened red bean paste, ice cream, mochi, and fruit drizzled with sweetened condensed milk.  So good!Sometimes we'll meet up with friends here and play cards or jenga or something.  It's a very relaxed casual atmosphere.  There are sofas with coffee tables as well as regular tables and chairs to sit in.

56.description: I love the concept that the owners that Outdoor Cafe depicts. They have adequate seating (most of the time) and decent food and drink and a small selection of board games. When its not busy, its even a nice place to study (however, it can be impossible when crowded). Having one of your friends work at the place doesn't hurt either. However I have a few complaints. There are times when some friends and I come in a large group and they force us to order more food so we can stay, otherwise they will ask you to leave (they've done that before). From a business perspective, its understandable as any small business owner wouldn't want unpaying customers loitering. Another complaint I have is that the owner is just plain rude. Let's just say that she shouldn't talk smack about her customers in front of them because it makes them feel unwelcomed. With that being said, I will probably not return to Outdoor Cafe because the owner is rude to me. I've had better service at their competition.I would also like to put it on record that I have been to Outdoor Cafe SEVERAL in the past with a lot of Friends, and it is usually our Go to or meeting place because they are open until Midnight. Their food is also not bad, and their prices are reasonable. Literally, the customer service is the ONLY reason why I am giving this place poor two stars. If the owner wasn't so rude I would up them to four stars.

29.description: I don't think people understand that this is a mom-and-pop shop! The owners are very friendly people who make it a priority to become acquainted with their customers and take time with the orders making sure everyone is satisfied. I have noticed they have very few workers when it gets busy, but people should be more understanding. One person can only do so much, especially when they are left with the responsibility of taking orders, cleaning tables, collecting money, handling traffic, and making sure everything runs smoothly.. All with a smile! If that isn't hard. I don't know what is. Oh yeah, their bingsoo is soo much better than Java's because they add a special ingredient! TLC. Thanks Sammy! (I think that was his name.) Lol

42.description: Used to come here when the inside decor actually resumed an outdoorsy theme, hence "Outdoor Cafe." Drinks used to be good, food was okay.Went again for nostalgia and the decor has changed. The drinks were terrible. Green tea latte tasted like warm milk with green food coloring. They do not serve drinks in the order received. They do not offer soy milk substitute if you can't drink milk. They were understaffed and overworked.Headed down the street to another cafe and got better food, drinks, and service without waiting for 30 minutes.  I'd like to think they were having an off night, but why would I bother coming back when there's better results literally a two minute walk away?
