23.description: I don't know what it was like before the new management took over, but my experience tonight was great.  I had a high expectation on the red bean bingsoo ($6.38, as of 12/30/2014), but I was slightly disappointed and felt the bingsoo in Java & Mug was better.  However, their coffee made up the deficiencies.  The young man who was in charge of the cafe was also a good barista.  We had the green latte and raspberry mocha.  They were delicious and artistic.  We enjoyed them a lot.  The entire atmosphere was relaxing, with the 2014 pop music playing in the background (except the TLC's "no scrubs" came up from nowhere...that's ok since I'm a super fan of TLC).  There were quite many patrons in the house on a chilly Chicago night.  Hubby and I had a great time hanging out as well.  We will probably be back for the coffee, since that category is more of their forte .

47.description: Yummy treats and comfy sofas to sit on! I love that they have board games to play! A tad too much church stuff everywhere but who cares, its about the tasty treats! bingsoo is on my list for my next trip here! 4 stars since Java n Mug is still my favorite non-starbucks place to go :P

8.description: My fiancé and I come too this place often we love it so much we always play uno and other awesome board games. This place is the is great too just chill with friends. We love this place so much. The food coffee and deserts are amazing! LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! Definitely recommend this place.

31.description: Ham n cheese Panini was plain, no veggies. Quiet place for WiFi

34.description: My friends and I came here because we wanted bingsu and the place we like to go was closed that day. This was our second choice because of the games. The café is okay. It is not cozy as the other café, but the bingsu was good. I had the Red Bean Bingsu because I had the Fruit Bingsu before and wanted to try something new. The bingsu is delicious; IT HAS MOCHI!!! Everything was great except for the games. I remember the last time I came here with my friends and the games were old and sometimes sticky. Many of the games are missing pieces - disappointing. The night ended well because we had bingsu with mochi. I still prefer my first choice because of the atmosphere and games. Both places have delicious bingsu. This café easily deserves 3 stars. Because of the games and the atmosphere the other café provided, it falls short of 4 stars.

16.description: NEW MANAGEMENT! Stopped going here and switched to Java after that one Vietnamese guy, Cuong, stopped working there and the old manager started covering the place with church propaganda. There was seriously a framed picture of Jesus in the bathroom right in front of the toilet, judging me and looking at my lady parts while I was peeing.Now that they have a new manager, they've gotten rid of all the Christian decor and have even added to the menu. BRUH, THEY HAVE BANH MI NOW!!! The new manager is friendly and doing an awesome job turning the place around.Suggestion: Please add Thai Iced Tea to the menu! Thai iced tea is awesome.

13.description: Came here for some late night dessert for a friend's b day. It was nice and cozy.  We had a good time. They had games for customers to play. The dessert looked good. Lots of different varieties dessert from fruit,  cake to ice cream.  Will go back.

11.description: Outdoor cafe is a super cute and very calming place with lots of plant decorations inside. The tables and chairs feel like they belong on the patio and along with the decorations, it makes you feel like you are lounging outside rather than inside at times. Now I know why it's called Outdoor Cafe! (+) Very good music volume. I enjoyed their selections too. (+/-) Food and drinks take awhile to come out which is okay if you're planning on staying for a bit anyway. I can see why it may become more of an issue when it gets more crowded.(+/-) Almond milk tea with pearls - way too little pearls :( but to their credit, they were cooked well - very bouncy and chewy! The drink itself had a good almond flavor though I hate that it's from the powder. It also didn't taste much like milk tea. There was way more milk than tea, making the entire drink very creamy. I personally didn't have an issue with the creaminess but again, I can see this being a problem for those who expected the milk tea part. One thing I found super annoying was that the ice chunks were too big...they definitely took up more than half the drink. Always a pet peeve of mine! (-) Internet was exceptionally slow, even when there weren't many people around. Outdoor Cafe can be a very family friendly/kid friendly/group friendly place so expect times when it can get pretty loud!

39.description: A good hangout spot. It's warm, cozy and welcoming. I forgot the name of the thing I ate but it was a panini with banana and nutella it was good!

37.description: Nothing is extraordinary. This is just the only place I know of in the Chicagoland area that serves ice cream fondue, which is the reason I went.

0.description: This cafe space has a cozy and friendly environment. Highly recommended for friends who enjoys board games or friends that needs to study or even catch up after a long week. The menu has a variety of bubble tea to fresh sandwiches. However: Cold or not this desert will warm you up. The flavors brings me back to the tropical islands of the Philippines. Everything here just feels cozy and comforting. Kevin is awesome!

38.description: Their Bingsoo is awesome. Take one bite of bingsoo is like another place of dreaming you were there.

51.description: I came here by chance because the library closed and my friend suggested it because he had been there before. Honestly, I'm surprised this place is in business with how horrible the customer service is. I love cafes and tend to go with friends very often so I'm usually a reoccurring customer at cafes I like. Too bad the staff is rude so I'll never return. Here's the whole story:My initial reaction was positive. The cafe was nicely decorated, giving the cafe a comfortable environment. The food selection looked really tasty and worth something to try the next time I visited. At this point I was planning to return to the cafe in the future. Sorry but it looks like that will never happen again thanks to your wonderful wait staff. Like I said, my two friends and I came in by chance because the library closed and we desperately needed wifi to finish the last few minutes of a group assignment. Normally I spend a lot of money at coffee shops getting coffee and food when I study, but this incident I forgot my wallet because we planned on staying at the library. The older couple (possibly the owners or the owner's parents) were helpful with trying to fix the wifi, which we were very thankful. However, the service was so horrible.  The server had a rude attitude and forced us to order more on our bill because what we ordered was "not sufficient enough" for three people.  When our waitress wasn't hassling us to order more, she just sat at a table talking with her friends the entire time. Next time, I'd rather go to Starbucks and not get hassled.

27.description: More of a 3.5. Enjoyed the various fun comfortable seating areas. Definitely a good place for a hangout. Came Sunday evening after dinner and the place was pretty busy with almost every seating area filled.Got the red bean bingsoo and enjoyed it much more than I thought I would. I was pleased that it was not overly sweet and found the fruit to be pretty fresh. Tried a board game but seemed to be missing something and was falling apart.Wasn't sure if they should bring us our check or not, but after waiting awhile, we just went up to pay. Somewhat slow service, but friendly.Wouldn't mind coming back.

32.description: Loved this place in the past and haven't been back for a while. I tried going to Java n Mug a couple of stores down, which I love, but I forgot it was closed that day. Since I was with friends from the suburbs, I decided to take them to Outdoor since it was right there and we wanted a place to chat. When we walked in, no greeting and no service. What I noticed was that all the decorations changed and I felt like the cafe was trying to convert me with all the religious decorations. It was beyond ridiculous. The workers were rude and had a "I don't care" attitude. Things seemed to be tossed at us instead of being handed. Service was horrible, drinks were gross and overly priced, and the religion aspect was a huge turn off. It made is all oh so very uncomfortable. If you're looking for a nice customer friendly place to just have a nice cup of coffee and hang out, not the place to go! Better off at Java couple doors down.

54.description: Food/Drinks/Dessert:-ppatbingso tastes good-tea:  tastes like tea, can't go wrong with making tea right?*haven't tried any of their food items yet..Customer Service:-good customer service, the people there are usually friendlyAtmosphere:-i like the feel that the atmosphere gives...comfortable and casual place to just go and hang out with friends (group setting) or to go to study (individual setting).Costs:-reasonable pricing (within norm for coffee/dessert shops)-ppatbingsoo portion is small during k-festParking:-street parking is available

48.description: I came here searching for good boba milk tea. I had it "hot," something I've never had before, and it was delicious. However, the tapioca balls melt, which defeats the purpose of having boba tea. You would think the servers would let you know, especially when you say "I've never had boba tea hot- what's it like?"I then wanted to order an iced one so that my brother, who has never had boba (hot or iced), could try the amazingness. I wanted plain, iced milk tea boba, but they brought me a smoothie version of it. I asked the waitress why she brought us a smoothie because I ordered "iced" and she said that if I don't specify, I get a smoothie. Does "iced" mean blended/smoothie in Chicago? Their menu states that if you do not ask for an order exactly the way you want it, and then it comes to you in a way you don't want it, they will not replace your order. Awesome customer service...They only get 2 stars because 1) their interior decor is cute and cozy (but their couches will dislocate several of your spinal discs) and 2) their hot milk tea boba is delicious. But they need some serious customer service training, as well as better looking (and spelled) menus.

44.description: A friend and I chose Outdoor Cafe as our catch up spot one Wednesday evening. I love the interior- it reminds me of the cafes I so miss in Korea. Very cutely decorated with lots of board games and books/magazine in both English and Korean. Plentiful seating and it wasn't crowded at all when we were there, though it was a bit late (btwn 7:30-10ish). More than anything I appreciate that this place is open until midnight! Awesome. Contrary to other reviews the lady who was working was very sweet, although a bit slow with our order.I ordered the fruit bingsoo as an angry, defiant fist shake at the crazy cold Chicago weather. Good portion with lots of fruit, but I did feel really cold haha- it didn't help that the heat was turned on really, really low, we were both freezing! My friend ordered the ramyun and we shared a pot of hot peach tea, which was delicious. Overall everything was fine but definitely overpriced- the bill came out to around $17. Outdoor Cafe feels like a Korean cafe in that you don't go really for a quick caffeine fix- it's about enjoying the ambiance with your friends. I would never come here to pick up a coffee to go as it just isn't worth your money, but would definitely return to sit around with friends and play some board games!

24.description: I love that this place is now open for lunchtime! I've been to outdoor cafe a couple of times, and with the new management, I think this might be my best hangout spot in the area. The Affogato here is AMAZING! It's the best dessert for the ice cream lovers, coffee lovers, or both. I suggest not pouring the whole thing on your coffee, or it'll all melt! I've also had the bubble tea and it was really good. Not too overly sweet and good taste. One of the coolest thing, I think, is that the owner meets and greets with the customers. I think that's a good touch for a business, especially one that relies a lot on word of mouth to spread the word. Great atmosphere, great food, and all the prices are fair. I will definitely be coming back and I suggest everyone give this place a try!

7.description: Though most only go for the bing soos, I was starving and tried the ramen and turkey prov panini.  Surprisingly, the panini was simple and delicious!  The chips were just "freshly" opened from the bag.  The ramen was just...ramen that you could buy from the store but a good option if you're hungry.  There's also games there to play!

49.description: I love this place. Cool Korean magazines. Nice seating. Its a cozy atmosphere and the tea is great. I also love the hot bubble tea.

40.description: This place use to be one of my favorite places to come for great tea and the atmosphere. They also had board games abd it was a fun place to come. I came back here a few days ago and this place is a glorified church! There is propaganda even in the bathroom! The quality of the drinks are terrible it's obvious the guy that was there does not know what he is doing. To top things off my phone was low on battery so I casually asked him if he might have a charger...would you believe I saw that it was listed on my bill...HE CHARGED ME FOR USING HIS CHARGER! Not to mention as I was paying the bill and about to sign the tip he asked me if I would like extra water for my tea! Looking for a tip much?!!!! This place SUCKS! Aaaand their hours are never clear! Screw you outdoor!

53.description: Green Tea Latte a muuuuuust folks!!!! A little too sweet when they gave it to me but I love that they will fix it for you to taste. After they tweeked it. Heaven. Just heaven. The ambiance here is just awesome. SO comfy, cozy and relaxing. There are tons of games and magazines to read.Prices are reasonable too. Had some ice cream here with some bean sauce... yes bean sauce... dude. Delish. Highly recommend this spot for a nice place to kick back and enjoy some cafe & sweets.Service is also decent too.. & open late. Don't forget to get your drink punch card!

30.description: You are welcomed by the sweetest lady in Chicago! Tonight I tried the fruit bingso and my boyfriend had the green tea latte. Both were very good. Hands down though, I would keep going back just to be served by that sweet woman.

46.description: I used to love this place. Their bobas were good, their tea was nice, it was just a nice fun place to go chit chat with friends and play games. However last time I went the entire place was covered in church propaganda. On the bookshelves, the tables,the walls, even the bathroom! What happened to the cute lounge place?

1.description: Originally, we were going to go to Java 'n Mug but it wasn't open at the time. So, we decided to stop inside here. The interior is very nice - super cute and trendy. It reminds me of a chic cafe you would find  in an old movie. Their menu has variety whether you want to dine in for ramen or sandwiches. There is also bingsoo and many drink options. When I was talking to the cashier (& he was the barista for the day), I wanted to know what was in the green tea frappe. I wanted to sub the whole milk for 2% or skim. However, he said the place only carried almond & whole milk. It didn't really make sense to me because that means they're making their lattes out of whole milk or drinks etc. In my opinion, that is not very accommodating to your customers which I was disappointed about. The drinks were mediocre. The green tea milkshake was way too heavy for my liking, and it tasted like milk more than the actual matcha flavor (which is why I wanted to opt out of the whole milk option). The thai tea was not that great either. I most likely won't go back, but if you need a place to study this is a good place to study at since it is relatively quiet with WiFi!

55.description: I love this outdoor cafe place, because I love the desserts. Bingsoo is so refreshing and yummy. The place has a cozy atmosphere and friendly service.

9.description: It's about 4pm and there's a couple people studying. One person is working behind the counter and it took him half an hour to make me a smoothie that was horrible. Somehow, my favorite smoothie flavor, avocado made me gag. Other times I went, the food and smoothies were decent. Just decent.I'm not a fan of inconsistency but I do have to admit, it is a pretty cool place to just hang out because of the board games and free wifi.

26.description: I've been to outdoor several times now. It's a good place to study or catch up with your friends. I go there sometimes to go study with friends, or just to hang out. The atmosphere is very relaxing but not the biggest place.When I go there, I usually get the same thing. I usually get the sandwhich and bingsoo. I get the turkey sandwhich I believe, which is called the study abroad??? Don't quote me on that but its very delicious. I get the strawberry bingsoo and those are great too. What I don't really like about it is that it's self served. You have to get the water by yourself, order up front, and pick up the order from the front. The lady or the guy who works there in the front is very nice. It's not a big deal. I dont mind going up, but it is convenient if there was a server though. Overall, I give them 4 stars because I enjoy my time there.

25.description: The decor is cute, and the service is friendly but the drinks are just not good. Two-stars for the drinks, but three stars because everything else is okay, this is a fun place to sit and hang out with people for a few hours.

12.description: Few reasons why I like this place:1. Study cafe near NEIU that's open later than most cafes. 2. New management which means new decor. The old Christian decor was vexatious. It was really damp and sad in there. Now it's very inviting, alive, and chic. Love all the plants in the cafe! I also know there are board games available to play. Always a bonus. 3. Service is very welcoming and attentive unlike Java a few doors down (don't mean to bash). Pretty inexpensive.4. Pretty big paninis and they're delicious especially the Let's Go Bananas and I always enjoy my pot of tea with it. 5. Always available street parking which is pretty stellar. Overall, great for students looking to study, chat, or even kicking back and playing some board games in this cold Chicago weather.

59.description: loooved the strawberry bing-soo! generous amounts of fruit and mochi piled on with shaved ice and a scoop of ice cream. just make sure to mix it all together before digging in because my friend ended up taking a big bite of the shaved rice cakes (with barely anything else) and nearly choked.

21.description: Few reasons why I like this place:1. Study cafe near NEIU that's open later than most cafes. 2. New management which means new decor. The old Christian decor was vexatious. It was really damp and sad in there. Now it's very inviting, alive, and chic. Love all the plants in the cafe! I also know there are board games available to play. Always a bonus. 3. Service is very welcoming and attentive unlike Java a few doors down (don't mean to bash). Pretty inexpensive.4. Pretty big paninis and they're delicious especially the Let's Go Bananas and I always enjoy my pot of tea with it. 5. Always available street parking which is pretty stellar. Overall, great for students looking to study, chat, or even kicking back and playing some board games in this cold Chicago weather.

17.description: More of a 3.5. Enjoyed the various fun comfortable seating areas. Definitely a good place for a hangout. Came Sunday evening after dinner and the place was pretty busy with almost every seating area filled.Got the red bean bingsoo and enjoyed it much more than I thought I would. I was pleased that it was not overly sweet and found the fruit to be pretty fresh. Tried a board game but seemed to be missing something and was falling apart.Wasn't sure if they should bring us our check or not, but after waiting awhile, we just went up to pay. Somewhat slow service, but friendly.Wouldn't mind coming back.

10.description: It took 30 minutes to get one smoothie! A lot of their quality has been failing me. It's a cool spot and all. But when you've served 3 groups before me?! Seriously

5.description: I don't know what it was like before the new management took over, but my experience tonight was great.  I had a high expectation on the red bean bingsoo ($6.38, as of 12/30/2014), but I was slightly disappointed and felt the bingsoo in Java & Mug was better.  However, their coffee made up the deficiencies.  The young man who was in charge of the cafe was also a good barista.  We had the green latte and raspberry mocha.  They were delicious and artistic.  We enjoyed them a lot.  The entire atmosphere was relaxing, with the 2014 pop music playing in the background (except the TLC's "no scrubs" came up from nowhere...that's ok since I'm a super fan of TLC).  There were quite many patrons in the house on a chilly Chicago night.  Hubby and I had a great time hanging out as well.  We will probably be back for the coffee, since that category is more of their forte .

3.description: Excellent place to grab a little sweet treat and hang a bit with your friends. Or even study! They have free wifi. The staff is really friendly. I love coming back to outdoor. Their bingsoo is really good so I do recommend that!

35.description: This place brings back so many memories of loitering and late night discussions with friends. Just when I feel like I've tried everything here already, they seem to pull something new, whether it be desserts or drinks. While the food is nothing to really write home about; the portions on some of the desserts are huge, the staff is usually very accommodating, and the place is a very soothing/relaxing place to chill/have a conversation/play board games. Here are the items I've tried.Red Bean Bingsoo - I think this is probably what I have had the most here, and it's usually someone else's choice. I'm not a big fan of the red bean they use, and usually eat around it. But the ice cream, mochi, and fruit make it still a solid choice. Fruit Bingsoo - my favorite of the Bingsoos. Remove the red bean and add more fruit! Problem solved. Banana split - this thing is massive. Definitely something to be shared (especially after a meal prior to this). A mountain of chocolate,  vanilla, and strawberry icecream and a ton of whipped cream. It's awesome, but not quite as good as...Red bean ice cream sundae - also massive like the banana split, but this one has red bean, green tea, and vanilla ice cream toppled with delicious mochi. Probably my favorite dessert here. Even if I have to eat around the red bean (you could also tell them not to pour that on too...). Raspberry Cheesecake - took a few bites, didn't really think much about it.Pineapple sorbet - it was pretty good, but it wasn't something I would want to order again, considering the other options.Chocolate Fondue - it was definitely cool to have that little set come out and dip various things into the chocolate.  But I would say it was more of a one time thing. It wasn't really worth it, and was more fun than tasty. I've also tried various drinks and they have varied from good to bad. But,  I find their regular Latte very consistent and passable. So that is usually my go to. Overall, the rating is more based on the ability to come in after a meal to extend the night (without going somewhere loud and expensive). It's a great place to chill and drink a coffee or have an after dinner dessert. It's also a great place to get your ice cream fix in the heat of summer (it'll fix you good). The food and drinks are ok, but the other factors deserve considerations as well.

19.description: First time here. There were only a few people in here on a late Saturday morning. The service and coffee were good. Comfortable coffee shop to work or just hang out with friends. I will be coming back.

28.description: I really appreciate Outdoor cafe for three main reasons: the food and drinks that they serve, the environment, and the customer service. In all three of these aspects, they do a phenomenal job. They have quite a list of options to choose from when you're deciding on what you want whether it be a hot flavorful panini or simplistic, yet very tasteful ramen for a savory taste or mouth-watering, delicious bingsoo or humongous banana split for the individuals with a sweet tooth. Nonetheless, you will definitely get your money's worth. The environment that they provide nurtures a friendly, cozy, and comfortable place to be. It makes you feel at home while enjoying food and bubble tea with friends and family. The board games and cards add to that fun mix. Lastly, I respect the customer service for they always are willing to cater to you. The owner and workers are always attentive to their customers. It can get quite busy, but the employees always work as quickly and efficiently as they can and are mindful enough to apologize for any of their shortcomings (ex: slower service when it's busy). Highly recommend!

45.description: I've come here several times throughout the years and always enjoyed their bing soo. I'm a huge fan of shaved ice topped with fruits, red beans, mochi, ice cream and condensed milk. That being said, I'm not a fan of the drinks here. By looking at the bubble tea menu I could tell they use powder mixes so I opted for a green tea latte (thinking it was real green tea powder mixed with milk, or at least a semblance of real green tea). When I got the double green tea latte I discovered it was made with the fake green tea bubble tea powder. Ugh. And they said I can only buy a double if I'm taking it to go because they only offer double to go cups. Why can't they put a single in a double cup? I don't know. Well, actually I do, it's called cheap. On the other hand the server with glasses was very nice and polite and apologized multiple times for forcing us to buy doubles. One thing I noticed has changed since I came here a while back is the decor. The place is covered in Christian flyers, books, pamphlets, notes, etc. If that's your type of thing then you'll feel comfortable. If it's not really your jam you might feel a tad out of place.I'd come back for the bing soo.

33.description: I have Outdoor to thank for my dukedom at Java. The two most recent times I've tried studying here I've either found the place full or closed (well within their hours of operations). From what I remember from previous visits, it is worth the visit if you're in the area. Respectable bingsoo, delicious boba, and hot drinks. I personally really liked the nutella panini and their enormous banana split and would recommend those if you want something more filling.I still would only be here if it's the last resort though (plenty of cafes in the area that's stepped up their game unlike Outdoor who, unfortunately, have slid a bit in quality and atmosphere). Also, many of the games available for patrons are missing pieces/cards/etc. Bummer.

43.description: I came with three friends after dinner, around 9pm on a Thursday, after hearing great things about their patbingsoo. It was pretty empty with 3-4 other customers there, and the lady, who I'm assuming is the owner, was reading the newspaper on the couch. When we came in, she jumped right up and welcomed us very warmly... I'm surprised by these reviews about the bad service, because she was super nice and friendly to us!We got 2 orders to share - 1 with red bean, and 1 with fruit. It turns out that they're actually pretty similar - with all the fruits being the same, except the red bean doesn't have bananas, while the fruit one does. Both were delicious! My only complaint is that they were fairly small portions, considering each one was almost $7 after tax. But still, I would definitely come back... I guess I'm just willing to pay so much because good patbingsoo is rare in the Chicago area.My friends and I were discussing how we wished that a place like this existed near Northwestern - The mood in the cafe was just perfect for studying and having a small bite to snack on! PLEASE OPEN ONE IN EVANSTON!

2.description: Need a late night study spot? Perfect place! Their low light and relatively quiet ambiance is a plus for students. And I keep coming back for their iced coffee. The blend tastes like its been cold brewed and you can go back for refills! Plus they have the best bbq chips (also refillable) for your simple carb needs! New management definitely helped the business thrive with their simplicity, nice staff, and Vietnamese flavor. Regulars are here on a daily basis. Come by, bring a date, or your books, or yourself; just come!

18.description: Come back to outdoor with some friends. Love the new look and the new management is really nice. Got a chance to tryout Thai Ice Tea. It's so good...can't wait until it come out in the menu. Perfect drink for a hot summer day. Definitely come back again

41.description: I felt very good here and was treated well by the hosts, I felt at home there.. The coffee was exceptional and they have a good selection of drinks , I mean drinks as in milkshakes and smoothies and hot chocalate etc. The inside was very cozy and there was good reading, great grilled cheese sandwich. My family loved it, it's family friendly, the staff is kind, the service is great.

52.description: Came here to relax and catch up with friends after eating my weight in burgers and mac n cheese at Kuma's Corner. The cafe is quaint with a welcoming and warm atmosphere. There is plenty of seating from large armchairs to couches and benches. It's perfect for studying, relaxing or just hanging out with friends. There are also a large variety of board games and magazines to choose from as well. Although we had just eaten dinner, we decided on order some desserts to share as we were talking.FRUIT BING SOOFor those who aren't familiar with this asian dessert, it's basically shaved ice that's topped with fruit and ice cream. The fruit bing soo wasn't anything special, but it was fine. It came topped with strawberry ice cream and mochi along with fresh fruit including strawberries, kiwi, peaches, mandarin oranges, cherry, etc and topped with condensed milk. Outdoor Cafe also offers sandwiches and a large variety of coffee drinks in addition to their desserts. The owners are visible, incredibly friendly and hospitable. My friend had a special request and the staff member was more than happy to make the accommodations for us. I'll definitely be back!

50.description: Kenny O. and I ordered the fruit bingsoo, after making the erroneous (?) assumption that the difference between the fruit bingsoo and the red bean bingsoo came down to: bananas or red beans? We didn't even realized that it's the red bean that makes the paht bingsoo. Oh well. We'll know better next time.So how do you eat bingsoo? We googled this, and our search results told us that there are two ways about this:1. Mix it all up and eat.2. Eat the ice cream and your favorite (fruit) topping first before mixing it all up.We tried the first option, and it was pretty tasty. We've tried the taro boba drink, the citron tea, and the ginger tea. I like the ginger tea the most, even though all three are very sweet drinks. The least sweet option happened to be the taro boba, which is a bit surprising because I made another erroneous assumption that tea can't possibly be THAT sweet. The cafe also offers free wifi, so Kenny and I spent a few hours here reading and working. It was quite nice.

4.description: They seem to have changed owners.  This cafe used to be very popular a decade ago.  They have been on the decline for the last few years.  The new owners updated the menu and the decor.  Hopefully, they can bring this place back to it's heyday.

6.description: First visit and can't wait to return and try other goodies!They also have a good selection of old school board games and WiFi.

22.description: They've changed management! thank goodness! they're open during posted hours consistently and still provide the same delicious milk tea and smoothies. they've changed up the seating and gotten rid of all the Christian decor that was nearly forced down your throat months ago. glad this place has gotten itself together!

15.description: New management brought additions to the menu. Brought the kiddos here and they loved all the board games. Prices are fair, and the menu has a selection of hot and cold drinks, as well as smoothies and milk shakes. Furthermore, there are banh mi sandwiches, paninis, noodle soups, a selection of sweet delectables, bing soo varieties, and banana splits. The place is kept clean and has a relaxing atmosphere with free wifi. The chief complaint and main reason they're not receiving 5 stars is that the 1 person that was here working was extremely, extremely, extremely slow.. And our banh mi sandwiches weren't as good as it could've been. It definitely lacked more meat, not that I like a whole lot of meat... But a sandwich shouldn't be lacking that! Our noodle soup was decent.. I mean, it's a $.50 package of noodles boiled in water with a poached egg in it. (The egg was cooked perfectly, btw).. Overall, I would come back... The employee being slow isn't enough to not have me back... He was nice, after all.

57.description: Atmosphere: Warm, cozy, crowded, loud, full of Chinese people. (I'm allowed to say that cause I'm part Chinese ;)- 2 starsService: Okay. Rushed and sometimes blunt but they get the job done- 2 starsFood: Grilled Cheese-3 starsChocolate fondue- 3 stars (fondue with fruit, marshmallows and ice cream)Conclusion: I like this place because it's open till midnight and there are a variety of games you can play at your table. (Jenga, cards, scrabble, monopoly etc) I don't like this place because it's often too crowded at night and the crowd is not usually diverse or particularly friendly. However,  it's a great place for a group.

20.description: First time here. There were only a few people in here on a late Saturday morning. The service and coffee were good. Comfortable coffee shop to work or just hang out with friends. I will be coming back.

36.description: 4 stars for the bingsoo, 5 stars for the service. I love the bingsoo here, it tastes just like Korea and the atmosphere is very relaxed and perfect for just hanging out. They have a few flavors of bingsoo but I love fruit with red beans. I also like how they add a dollop of ice cream for creaminess. Lastly, the staff is really kind and friendly. When me and my friends came to order a bingsoo to go 5 minutes before they closed, the workers were really nice and stayed the extra few minutes instead of kicking us out. I just wish it was easier to reach by public transportation.

14.description: I want to like this place, reallyyyy, I dooo!  But unfortunately, the so-so food is really a downer for me.  What I like:  the atmostphere is tops.  I can describe it as beautiful, eclectic, basically an urban oasis.  You can go there to study, host a private meeting, or just hand with friends. Another positive is their desserts.  OMG, their shakes are the bomb!  they come in a variety of flavors.  Their bubble tea is good too.  Negatives:  I've been there 3 times and have not had a decent meal.  I found their sandwiches to be very dry and unimaginative.  The only substansive food I actually enjoyed were the bbq potatoe chips and terriyaki chicken sandwich.  I would suggest eating first and going for just the dessert and drinks.

0.description: I can't wait. This festival get's better and better every year. This year Chris Martin and John Hagstrom, trumpets of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, will be doing a joint recital!!!March 11-12, 2011!!! Be there!!!

3.description: Was refused service because I did not show my ID when using my credit card that had my signature on the back for a $6.00 purchase. Visa/Mastercards policy state you cannot refuse a transaction if a consumer does not wish to show their ID when the back of the card is signed. I wish businesses would read their merchant agreements. Just because your a franchise owner or owner of a small business does not mean you are above the law if you sign an agreement to allow MasterCard & Visa in your store you must follow their rules or face fines or risk having them remove their credit card machines from their stores. I will keep fighting this and reporting these types of businesses to Visa & MasterCard as it is my right not to have to show my ID.  Also FYI it is also against Visa's and Mastercards policy for a merchant to require a minimum purchase amount for a consumer to use their credit/debit cards.

1.description: This place has wings my friends fresh. Very clean sport people and more. Every place has its problems but the chicken is a thingh. Good wang

2.description: It is what it is. On occasion I get a taste for KFC. I have nothing profound to say about the food. It is KFC ... you know what it's all about, just like doing the Hokey Pokey.The one thing that this particular KFC has that sets it apart from many of the others is a horrible parking lot. It is long and narrow and traffic comes from both sides, along with pedestrians.  There are times when I have contemplated picking up some chicken and kept driving when I saw the gridlock in the lot.  It's rarely worth the effort.

5.description: It is fast food plain and simple. It is KFC! I am not expecting any major surprises here. My biggest pet peeve about chicken places is that they are most always running out and there is most always a wait for food. I have never had to wait very long here at all. I work really close by to this location so I bring home chicken now and then on the way home form work. There is a guy that works there and always seems to be there whenever i go in. He is not especially friendly, but he is the master of efficiency. He tries to get you in and out of there in the least possible time. The food is KFC good and I have never had anything old served to me. The staff is relatively friendly also. My only problem is that sometimes this place can get downright dirty looking and disgusting. However I can forgive the occassional dirtyness when I get that crave.

6.description: New store location, bad placement. The parking lot is narrow and quite difficult to maneuver when the parking lot is semi-full and other motorists are about. A drive-thru window would've been useful, although there isn't space back there. No spicy chicken available. Since it's still a new location I find that the counter staff are too new to really know the menu, so for example when you have a specific order in mind, they could get you into a better deal / meal deal, where you'd save some money.. i.e. I was ordering a few side dishes for a holiday party, the total came to approx $17 dollars. At no time did anyone try to up sell me or offer their opinions on my order. After taking another look at the menu I realized I could've gotten a 9 pc box of Chicken with what I ordered and spent less money. Maybe it'll get better. I wished they could have saved some of their staff from their old location, few blocks east on Peterson. If you check out KFC.com you can print out coupons.

0.description: Best KFC in my area. Clean and staffed by capable polite and efficient staff. Location is an awkward corner with a pretty small lot. But service is very good.

4.description: I've stayed away from KFC for a number of years now. With the recent free grilled chicken giveaway, I decided to give it a try. Any of you who know me are probably aware I'm like a rat who's a sucker for the free cheese in a mouse trap.The KFC on Peterson & Kimball opened in late 2008. While it looks pretty from the outside, it has issues inside. First, the parking lot is indeed tiny and difficult to navigate. I agree with Jacob J. There's no drive-thru lane, as it would mean no parking at all. I got there right at 11:30, before the usual lunch crowd shows up. Well, I was maybe in a line 8-10 people deep. In about 5 minutes, the line tripled in length. I noticed almost everyone in line had a printed coupon in hand. The few people who didn't must've felt stupid for showing up in the first place. It began to look like a ghetto soup kitchen on Thanksgiving Day... or a toy store at 5 AM on Black Friday. At KFC, I saw a school bus driver, a pair of CTA drivers, cops, heating/AC repair guys, college-age kids and even a homeless-looking guy with a jar of lollipops for sale. All came for the freebie.Ironically, this store was not prepared for it. There was one person preparing food and 2 people working the counter. To alleviate their people shortage, they took a dozen orders at a time, then stopped the line to fill them. So it didn't matter if you were #1 or #12. You just waited with everyone else. They dished out the orders as a group and then took the next group and so on.Now the whole idea of this free chicken giveaway was to introduce people to this new chicken product or to bring back people like myself who stopped going to KFC long ago. I don't think they succeeded. I saw a few people walk out and go to Popeye's a half-mile away on Lincoln. Others crowded in and the line wrapped almost around the store by noon. It took me about 30 minutes to get my order. I felt sorry for the few paying customers who stuck it out. OK, so the 2 pieces of grilled chicken with the mashed potatoes, coleslaw & biscuit were a great freebie, but the workflow of this particular store was simply too chaotic and understaffed to move this group quickly enough. I doubt I'll be coming back, even when the giveaway is over.

58.description: May Flower is fast and reliable. Service is just fine and prices are right.Favorites: chicken wings, Mongolian beef, pan-fried noodles.

56.description: I used to work with a Taiwanese engineer about 10 years ago who came here almost daily and said this place was the closest to home-made Chinese food. I never wanted to try it until today. Since I was at the nearby Kinko's, I walked over from to try May Flower for the first time. The restaurant is in the strip mall with the Jewel-Osco on the corner of Foster & Pulaski. Inside, it's rather plain and seems like it could be a little cleaner. A giant light box on the wall shows a photo of a huge Chinese temple. The chairs looked nicer than fast food restaurant seating, but seemed a bit dingy too. Otherwise, the interior of the place is pretty bare and it could use a paint job or facelift.I have established General Tso's chicken as my baseline standard for measuring Chinese food, ever since I had it at Dragon Inn. Lucky for me, they had it as one of their nearly 30 lunch combo specials. And since they had fresh fruit smoothies featured on their window, I thought I'd try one - strawberry.While I was there 2 other people came in to place orders or pick up phone orders. Then a whole family with kids walked in. And you know what... everybody ordered a smoothie too! It was delicious! A big, maybe 22 oz. cup of pureed strawberries with smoothly blended slush containing  shreds of real strawberries and tiny seeds, not sugary syrup and fake coloring mix. They also have pineapple, mango and banana among other flavors. Now this smoothie came with one heck of a sturdy straw too. It had to be almost 1/2-inch round and was made of a thicker plastic. Without explaining fluid dynamics theory I studied at Purdue, let's just say it maximizes smoothie throughput when you suck it down and keeps the straw from collapsing from the vacuum pressure.The meal came a few minutes later, heaping with chicken fried rice, an egg roll and my Tso's chicken. Nothing spectacular. I thought the sauce was a bit gummy and the flavor not quite as savory as I've had elsewhere. Still, the serving size was huge and I didn't eat that much before I felt full. I had quite a bit left over for later.If anything, I'm definitely coming back for more smoothies at this place.

29.description: Really good chinese food. note,  the people working there are pretty rude though.

42.description: We use to live in the neighborhood and we ordered almost weekly Hunan Spicy Chicken from this restaurant.  Al large portion is big enough for two. Now we moved to Schaumburg and tried few Chinese places but non are good as here. Every time we'll go to Chicago will stop to this place and have Hunan Chiken- is so goooodddd.  Try it!

23.description: ....Amy, Ryan, Amanda et al... eggrolls? Really?  Guess I was brought up with different standards, Mayflower's eggrolls are just average.  Toooooo much cabbage.  They (Chinese restaurants in general, not Mayflower) used to actually PUT other stuff in them like shrimp, pork instead of fillers.   And they're usually undercooked, they should be crisp!     Sigh.  Dem was da good ol' days.    Anyway, I gotta get over there, I need some good Chinese food.   ** Recommended highly ** to help alleviate depression caused by your favorite football / baseball / basketball / hockey etc team ALMOST LOSING THE DAMN GAME.  Or ACTUALLY losing it, even.

47.description: Who would think one of those ads you find on your doorstep have such great food. I only had the orange chicken and I was very satisfied. All white meat chicken with a very realistic orange taste. The chicken was very tender and it came in under 35 minutes piping hot and very fresh tasting.

8.description: I was referred to this place by a coworker who said their food was pretty good.  I ordered the sesame "chicken" lunch special which came with an egg roll and chicken fried rice.  I honestly think my dish was made with whatever pork and chicken was available at the time.  I truly hope this isn't the meat they use in all their chicken dishes.  It was AWFUL!I tend to cut open meat before eating it and one piece was pinkish-brown on the inside; I'm 99% sure it was pork ( and under cooked pork at that)!!!!  Mostly all of the sesame "chicken" pieces were fat disguised by the deep fried breading on the outside. I ended up throwing the whole thing away and seriously thought about vomiting up the food I did eat.Never ordering from here again... If I get sick they will be hearing from me!

31.description: Good Food! Order delivery here all the time

34.description: Average at best. Take the time to go to or call Hunan Wok. They're on Bryn Mawr at Kimball. Much better!!

16.description: Haven't tried much, but the veggie egg rolls are 5 star, big time! The pork fried rice was pretty good, absolutely LOADED with pork, but wasn't very BBQy. Delivery was very fast. No doubt I'll be back!!

13.description: Best Chinese food in the area. I order from here once a week, and it's always delicious.  My favorites are the fried chicken wings,  Hunan Beef, and Mongolian Beef.  Never disappointed.

11.description: Good food, generous portions, good prices, no complaints!

39.description: I have been a neighborhood fan of Mayflower. It certainly is fast. There are a few things I recommend from their menu. The Yang Chow Fried Rice, not dark.  The Chicken and Broccoli is an average favorite.  The Shrimp lo mein is good.  There have bubble drinks too.

37.description: Just to qualify, we're not talking about a four or five star restaurant here. But, in the category of: Blandish, Americanized Mandarin Chinese Delivery, I give Mayflower really high marks.I've ordered from here more than a few times and each time, it exceeds my expectations. For me, this is the comfort food of my childhood, when Mandarin take out was considered exotic and a big bag full of little white boxes and chopsticks seemed cause for celebration.FOOD QUALITY: The food at Mayflower is very fresh, the meat very tender and the vegetables are crunchy upon arrival. The little white boxes are filled well beyond capacity and there are so many shrimp in an order of Shrimp Fried Rice, that you'd tire of counting if you were so inclined. (I think there was a Curb Your Enthusiasm episode about this very topic.) DELIVERY: Sometimes so fast that I can't imagine how they had time to cook.SERVICE: Same delivery guy each time who is the nicest delivery person I've ever encountered BY FAR! Last night, I ordered from there and when he saw me he said, "I haven't seen you for awhile. Since February, I think. How have you been?" Really? Did I hear you correctly? The clouds parted and the angels sang and I said, "Oh, yes, it's been awhile." Face it, everyone wants to feel valued...as if their business matters. On that point alone, Mayflower has earned my dedication. I'll have to get the delivery man's name next time so that I can share it publicly.

0.description: Always delish!   Take out or delivery is great.......you CAN eat there, but it's like you're in the kitchen with paper plates and plastic cutlery.  That said, the food is scrumptious!Wonderful large shrimp in the chowmein, delicious egg foo young in all varieties (try the mushroom pork) the best Mongolian beef ANYWHERE5 stars and then some!!!!

38.description: This is a small, strip-mall located Chinese place near my work which is pretty standard fare. However, the meat, chicken and shrimp they use are better quality than most Chinese places and the won-ton soup is hands down the best I have ever tasted in Chicago. They hand make the won tons in the kitchen as you watch. They use plenty of pork. The only complaint I have heard is that its a little too fatty, but I'll still take it on a cold day or if you are home sick. The lunch and dinner portions are ample and include an egg roll and shrimp fried rice. They also deliver as far down as Addison which is a bonus.Edit 3/13/13I think it got better! Fast delivery. This is the best Chinese takeout on the Northside.

51.description: Among the many paradoxes in our universe there is this: sometimes bad is good.  Mayflower Chinese is a "so bad its good" kind of place.  Its greasy, its salty, and its not entirely sanitary-- but God help me, sometimes its all I crave and there is no satisfying until I get it!Its a dingy little storefront Chinese kitchen.  Standard Chinese-American fare.  I almost always get the lunch/dinner specials which include generous portions of fried rice, an egg roll, and soup with the dinner special.  Prices are pretty good, most things run about a dollar cheaper than other spots in the neighborhood.  Food is always served hot, and its tasty.  Like I said, greasy and salty can really hit the spot sometimes.  I get the Kung-Pao chicken most often-- not overly spicy and has big pieces of ginger and vegetables for some flavor depth.Delivery is not always timely; so I usually do carry-out.  Nothing about it is really stellar, but it's cheap and it's pretty yummy most of the time.

27.description: I ordered for the first time last night and I was pleasantly surprised at the quick delivery and really impressed with the price, quality and portion size of their entrees.  It looks like I have found a new favorite restaurant. Just wish I could order online.

32.description: It's safe, decent Chinese food at a very reasonable price.  It's the first place that comes to my mind when Chinese take out comes up.

54.description: The combination of rain and nothing apetizing in the fridge had us Yelpin' for some delivery and we found May Flower.  We ordered the "dinner for two" deal for $22.50 plus $2 delivery fee. It came with tow egg rolls, two huge breaded shrimp (delicious), two ribs (nothing special), a big container of empress chicken (sugary breaded chicken), one of pork fried rice (the pork was a bit overdone) and one of mongolian beef. Overall, a lot of good food for the money, enough for three meals, actually. They delivered pretty quickly even though we're pretty far.

48.description: Chinese food delivery from random new place who left a menu on my door.  Bad idea? Yes.  Desperate with hunger? Yes we were.  Regret the choice? Hellsssss no!  Recovering from a late night out, we ordered fried foods galore and to my surprise, it was delicious!Crab Rangoons - um, talk about actual handmade, filled with fresh chives rangoons!  Not one of those rangoons that looks like it came out of some frozen bag.  The cream cheese filling was great and filled with yummy goodies.  Very nice.Egg rolls- Loved it. Oh, and this was free with a purchase of 16 bucks or more.  The coupon was on the menu so I asked for it, it came and it was delicious.  Yum.Fried Wantons - You ever get those wimpy wantons? Yeah, not here. These were fat won tons with lots of filling and nice thick wrapper. So good, especially with the sweet soy sauce it comes with.The fried chicken wings were a pass, nothing spectacular.General Tso Shrimp was good also, but I should have asked for the sauce on the side to avoid the sogginess.My fave thing about them was the quality of their food.  This is my new place for chinese deliveries now. I'm so glad I gave them a try.  Good chinese delivery is hard to come by in the area.

44.description: I don't know if I'm speaking too soon, but I think I found my local Chinese restaurant.  I've been in Jeff Park for 3.5 months now and I almost gave up on local Chinese food. We tried 3 places before this and they all were god awful. My husband likes the Gen. Tso chicken and I have a few veggie dishes that I have the option of consuming.  They are super reasonable, and their portions are huge.   This is not anywhere near being one of my favorite Chinese restuarants, but for delivery in Jefferson Park, I'll take it!

24.description: Horrible and Absolutely RUDE service! Placed my orders and I kindly asked the guy to make sure there's no nut contamination when he makes the fried rice bc my kids are allergic to nuts. He practically yelled at me that there's never nuts in fried rice (I already know, I'm Asian). Told him that I wanted to make sure it's not cooked with peanut oil.  Him: we never use nuts here.   Me: you don't make Kung pao chicken?  Him: "we only use peanuts in egg roll like all other restaurants but I need not tell you bc you not order egg roll. Do not eat here!!! Chinese restaurants are dime and  dozen in the city, no need to take this kind of attitude!!! These are the people who wouldn't care if you got sick or died from eating their food!!!  Shame on them for not caring! They could care less if they fed you lead too!!!

7.description: I dropped by here on my way home from Physical Therapy and had their Shrimp and Lobster Sauce with no rice. I hadn't had anything to eat that day so a nice big meal would have sufficed nicely. Later on that evening I noticed very bad abdominal cramps. The kind where you're bent over in pain after an hour and shaking because you're finally realizing you now have food poisoning from the cooks' lack of possible hygiene. It took 4 hours for the pain to subside enough for me to sleep that night and today I'm still fighting it.  Never again will I drop into this place and unless you enjoy being stuck in the bathroom and dehydrated, in pain, I suggest you do not eat here as well.

49.description: Still looking for a new Chinese place in our new hood, so I thought we'd give May Flower a shot (now that I've recovered from the last gross place we tried a couple months ago).Language barrier created some confusion in placing a delivery order over the phone, but everything arrived as requested.  We were told 45 min, and our dinner was at the front door and piping hot just  35 min. later.Veggie eggs rolls- not good.  At all. Chicken with peadods- sizeable portion, tender chicken, fresh pea pods.  Yum.  Combination Fried Rice- hubby inhaled it, so I'm assuming it was good.  Free Crab Rangoon- nice touch, May Flower.  Nice touch. We'll definitely order again, but I won't bother with eggrolls.

40.description: Ive been ordering from this place for a long time.  Your basic run of the mill chinese take out joint.  Consistent and dependable.  Ive never ordered anything that I knew I would never order again.  But theres not much that stands out as over the top.  The one thing that I always make sure to include in the order : Chicken wings!!  Crispy, greasy goodness!  Six pieces for $2.25 +tax.

53.description: I'm from the Midwest so I like my Chinese food Americanized and greasy.  My family has been ordering from this place for years - the stuff crab ragoon (basically imitation crab meat and loads of cream cheese deep fried in a shell) to the sweet and sour chicken which is literally diabetic coma inducing to the shrimp fried rice and mongolian beef.My family and I go all out b/c we're fatties so with 2 orders of crab ragoon, 2 orders of shrimp fried rice, 1 order of mongolian beef, 1 order of sweet and sour chicken, 1 order of general tsa's chicken rounds out to be $40. SAWEEET. Oh and we get complimentary egg rolls and fortune cookies.Greasy goodness galore!

30.description: We just moved in the area in Dec. & tried one place & it wasn't so great. Friends told me about May Flower & we tried it tonite.  OMG! The best crab rangoon I've ever had!! I thought the egg rolls were great, but, I prefer the little cups of sweet sour sauce over the packets & I have had better hot & sour soup, but, the sweet & sour chicken was very good & my husband had beef chops suey which was also very good & the meat was very tender. Definitely will go back!

46.description: I went there one time and ONLY one time. I ordered some chicken dish and it was grissley and fatty. Stay away from this cat food joint.

1.description: When I was going to NEIU I would come here for lunch. You could see your food being made and it was good.

55.description: Pretty good for a fast food place.  I always order the Kung Pao beef lunch special, which comes with chicken fried rice and an egg roll.  Tender beef with diced carrots, bell pepper, peanuts, and whole dried chilis.  The vegetables are always crisp and portions are huge.  My bf loves loves their crab rangoon, which has bits of veggies in it.  He's also a fan of their strawberry smoothies.  Delivery is fast and the food always arrives piping hot.

9.description: So moving to Chicago in 2010, I had to find some new Chinese restaurants. I was 0-10, and was getting frustrated. Then I dialed up Mayflower Chinese. Now this place is delicious! Some of the best fried rice that I have ever had, and that's all that really matters to me. Not super greasy, and doesn't make me sick either. Now that I'm living in Skokie, and am 0-7 here, I usually just drive the 20 minutes to grab my grub from this place.

26.description: I live right down the street from this place. My husband and I ordered one dinner that left the two of us feeling full. He picked it out, so I can't remember the name of the exact dish, but it was basically chicken and vegetables (sorry for the non-helpful description). If a Chinese place doesn't give me diarrhea it is at the top of my list, and this place is now at the top!

25.description: Hands down theeeee worst Chinese food I have ever eaten in my entire life. And I'm definitely not exaggerating. I work in the same strip mall as this place but I had never eaten there until fairly recently. I called maybe 30 minutes after they had opened,and ordered a very simple meal. Long story short,I was rushed off the phone by someone who could learn more English from a toddler. Seriously,I was surprised when he repeated my order back to me and it was right. After getting my food,I took two bites of it and gave it to one of my co-workers. The portion size was reasonable but the food itself was terrible! Never...ever again.

12.description: Order the chicken wing appetizer.  You'll get 6 of the most crispy, juicy, large wings $2.95 can buy. I take all my out of town friends there when they ask me for wings.  The other food is pretty good too.  I enjoy the egg foo young a lot. Egg rolls are ok, nothing to write home about. The place looks like a total dump and has no ambiance whatsoever but the kitchen kicks out some really decent food. They also make very good fruit shakes.  I've tried the avocado and melon, both were delish.

59.description: Good Chinese take-out.  Fast delivery and they always get it right.

21.description: If you're used to what appeared to teenage, anti-social, little Chinese girl taking your order, then you will notice if you go there now that May Flower is under new management.  However, they still serve good quality Chinese food:Cons:-Unless you ask for none, THEY now DO USE MSG-I brought a friend there this past summer and noticed that some of the food was not as good. For instance, their pot stickers are not as tasty (and the wrapping is thicker). Also, Crab Rangoon aren't filled with the common filling (they're not bad, just different than before if that's what you're looking for).-Their egg rolls now have MSG.-They raised the prices some (what used to cost about $20 now cost me $26).-Their packaged soy sauce now has MSG, also.Pros:-You can order with no MSG (even their soup!). You may just have to wait a little longer for your food.-I think the portions are bigger...definitely with the Crab Rangoon and fortune cookies.-Lots of good (free) parking-Good location-Nice seating area-The food still tastes good without the MSG.Will I go back? Sure. It's still one of the better Chinese restaurants I know of that can keep MSG far away from me.

17.description: We were left a flyer for this restaurant on our doorstep, and when our favorite Chinese place suddenly closed its doors, we decided to try it out. We ordered:Combo Appetizer (2 egg rolls, 2ribs, 2 fried shrimp, 2 fried wonton, 2 bbq pork, 2 fried wings, 2 crab rangoons)Egg Drop SoupWonton SoupSesame Chicken dinner specialShrimp & Broccoli (small)Total with tax came to around $30.The food was pretty good. The shrimp fried rice was delicious, probably some of the best I've had in awhile. There were plenty of shrimps, and lots of flavor. The chicken wings were delicious. I would definitely order them again. The shrimp and broccoli was pretty good. The broccoli was crisp and fresh, but there weren't many shrimps, and the sauce was thick and gooey. When I reheat the leftovers, I'll be rinsing the sauce off. It was kind of gelatinous, and not a nice texture.The sesame chicken was covered in a sweet and sour sauce. We would not order this again. It was my husband's meal, and he woke up sick all morning. I didn't eat this, and I'm not sick today. We didn't care for the ribs/bbq pork, which are pretty much the exact same thing, except that one is on a bone and one isn't. The sauce tastes like the same as the sesame chicken sauce with a bit of bbq sauce thrown in. Not good.All in all, the food gets a 3 out of 5.We ordered at 7:30, and our food didn't get to our house until 9:45 pm. This was on a very ordinary Tuesday night. I told the delivery driver to let the manager know that I am very upset that it took 2 HOURS to bring us our food. His response was that he is actually one of the cooks that lives down the street and that he was told to deliver our food on his way home. So basically, they were waiting for his shift to end so that he could bring me my food over 2 HOURS later. I won't be ordering from them again. It's a shame because I really did like some of their food items, but the fact that they care so little about their customers just isn't acceptable and they certainly don't deserve my business.

10.description: For the soup alone I used to come here often, they would replace my green onions with ginger when I was sick. I stopped coming for a while sad to say they do not offer ginger anymore. Needless to say, great bubble tea.

5.description: My friend and I went here yesterday for our first time. I fell in love with the sesame chicken so quickly. And the mango smoothie made my afternoon. I will be coming back here soon.

3.description: A good option for fast cheap takeout.  I always order the egg foo young, fried rice and the hong sue chicken.  So far it's the best I can find around the area!

35.description: Greasy !! You will need to change your clothes after you leave this place from the grease chinese food smell. Food is salty but the portions are large. Dishes tend to be swimming in the sauce. Mongolian beef was disappointing.

19.description: So I'd say more like 3.5 stars, but I've been going here since I was a kid so I give them the benefit of the doubt. Food is greasy, good, and quick. I usually get the beef fried rice or anything fried rice(except pork) and a small is more than enough for one person. Good portions, great prices, and neighborhood friendly.

28.description: I've been going to this place ever since I was in college (a good 10 or so years) and they've never disappointed me.  Sure, there are classier, cleaner places out there, but if you're in the mood for cheap, greasy Chinese food, you can't do much better than this.  (Heck, this place suffered a fire and they still managed to reopen in a town full of near-identical restaurants, such is the loyalty of their customer base.)Favorite go-tos are the pork fried rice and egg rolls (Nice and substantial, not wimpy like those from some other places).  The rice seems to be cooked a bit differently these days, but it's still more flavorful than the fare I've gotten at other similar joints.  I'm also a fan of their wonton soup and their egg foo young.  Portions are pretty big, so you'll generally wind up with leftovers enough for another meal.

45.description: I've been coming here for over a year now, and I have to say that it is a very reliable place for fast Chinese.All the appetizers I've had here are good, especially the crab rangoons.  The pot stickers are a close second, though.  I've mainly ordered their sesame chicken or General Tso's chicken, but the few times I've had Mongolian beef, it's been good.I have to say that their egg rolls deserve special attention.  I really can't put my finger on what it is that they put in there, but something about them tastes super-meaty, but I can't really detect chunks of meat or anything.  It's definitely up there on my Top Eggrolls list.The one negative thing I have to say about this place is the fact that the owners' kids are running around every time I go in there.  They are typically running around, annoying each other, or a few times that I have been there, one of the little ones was deliberately coughing as loud and as hard in the other kids' faces.  Yeah, that's REALLY what I want to have happening near my food, guys...Other than that, giant portions served in microwavable containers.  That's what's up.

33.description: Decent greasy chinese food.The combination fried rice was good minus the burnt bits, had lots of yummy meat and was not thinned out with tons of veggies.Tried a mango smoothie it was good and huge a great value for $3 however it did have some unidentifiable strands of what could have been plastic or could have been something edible, not really sure yet but it was 2 days ago and I am still alive so.....*thunk, head hitting keyboard*I would go back in a serious pinch but there are definitely better places in the vicinity.

43.description: An above average experience in an average looking "strip mall" Chinese Restaurant. Got the Kung Pao Chicken lunch special. This delicious dish was expertly cooked and seasoned, with a good balance of chicken, veggies, peanuts and chili. And the fried rice and egg roll were also delicious. I don't usually expect much from places like this, but I was pleasantly surprised. I will come back again when I'm in the area.

2.description: Great everyday food!

18.description: My mother and I have come back to this place to eat three days in a row! This is old style Chinese cooking in the flavor is out of this world on all of the dishes we have tried and we try something different every time!

41.description: I've ordered from here several time and just like any other Chinese takeout I'm very careful on what I order. I'm not a big fan of Americanized Chinese takeout but once in a while I'll give it a try. The food is average and pricing is about average for a takeout restaurant.

52.description: This place is great. My boyfriend and I can never agree on a place for Chinese until we found this one. I LOOOVE their eggrolls. I usually get the beef n' broccoli or the Singapore rice noodles. Delivery is usually quick and although it usually costs about $30 for the two of us, we do get HUGE portions and always have leftovers for lunch the next day.

50.description: Had delivery from them twice now.  It was great both times.  We are defintly going to be regulars.Being a duck lover I have tried both the duck dishes.  The Crispy Duck was not really crispy but delicious the way it was prepared and the sauces.The Salted Shrimp was also good, so were the eggrolls.  My girlfriend had a dinner special which had a ton of food.  Which is true for all the orders, they are large portions.

4.description: In a mall next to a grocery store. Do not expect to dine in this place, there are tables but I never seen anyone dining in but always see people after people coming in to pick up their take out orders. As many people have been, this became our go to spot for quick take out Chinese food. Our usual items are mix between followings: beef chow fun, egg drop soup, sweet and sour chicken, pork fried rice, kung pow chicken, and mongolian beef. When you make an order request free crab rangoons over egg rolls. Their egg rolls are mediocre at best but crab rangoons are fantastic. All of them are pretty good but their chow fun is exceptional in my book. You would not regret it.There are many take out focus Chinese restaurants around here but so far none has better than this place. I highly recommend this place.

6.description: The food is good, but you will be sorry if you order on the weekend. I ordered food to pickup, they said "15 to 20 minutes"...OK, so I figure 25 minutes since it's Sunday night; WRONG! after I get there it's another 25 minute wait. Hmmmmmmm, then when I get home with my food, the egg rolls are missing. I guess they don't really want my business. It's OK though, lots of other Chinese restaurants around here.

22.description: I've been coming here for years with a friend who lives a few blocks away. Tonight before heading to Mayflower, we agreed that it's "good enough" Chinese. Every town seems to have a place like this--quick food from a takeout window, and you have the option to dine in. But tonight as we feasted on moo shu vegetables and sweet-sour chicken, I decided that it deserves more credit than that. For one thing, it's an amazing value. I spent under $20 and came away with dinner and leftovers to last me days. (Plus complementary crab rangoon? Yay!) For another, they cook the food to order. Does that seem like a given? Think about those restaurants where the food comes out too quickly. I have one in my current town, and I refuse to dine there. There are tricks up those chefs' sleeves, and I shudder to think any deeper than that.Best of all, the food here is consistently good. Ok, it's not inspired in any way, but it doesn't need to be. If you want amazing Chinese food, make the trip to Chinatown. But if you're in the Albany Park area and hankering for a meal that's well prepared, affordable and satisfying, I know just the place...

15.description: worst orange chicken and sesame chicken ive had! what a waste of money!The kids ate the fried rice and left the meat for garbage....A girl there i think their daughter kept giving us a weird look!

57.description: Honestly, I don't even know what a quarter of the entrees here taste like, and I ate here practically every week in high school. But the reason Mayflower is so near and dear to me is because I adore their fried chicken wings. It's in the appetizer section and it's six pieces of salty, greasy deliciousness for under $2. There are times when I even used to get two orders of the chicken wings (I had a hearty appetite, alright) and a thing of white rice-- and that would be my dinner. I haven't gone back in awhile so I don't know if the recipe has changed or if they've hiked up the price . . but, boy, was that chicken good . . .

20.description: We were left a flyer for this restaurant on our doorstep, and when our favorite Chinese place suddenly closed its doors, we decided to try it out. We ordered:Combo Appetizer (2 egg rolls, 2ribs, 2 fried shrimp, 2 fried wonton, 2 bbq pork, 2 fried wings, 2 crab rangoons)Egg Drop SoupWonton SoupSesame Chicken dinner specialShrimp & Broccoli (small)Total with tax came to around $30.The food was pretty good. The shrimp fried rice was delicious, probably some of the best I've had in awhile. There were plenty of shrimps, and lots of flavor. The chicken wings were delicious. I would definitely order them again. The shrimp and broccoli was pretty good. The broccoli was crisp and fresh, but there weren't many shrimps, and the sauce was thick and gooey. When I reheat the leftovers, I'll be rinsing the sauce off. It was kind of gelatinous, and not a nice texture.The sesame chicken was covered in a sweet and sour sauce. We would not order this again. It was my husband's meal, and he woke up sick all morning. I didn't eat this, and I'm not sick today. We didn't care for the ribs/bbq pork, which are pretty much the exact same thing, except that one is on a bone and one isn't. The sauce tastes like the same as the sesame chicken sauce with a bit of bbq sauce thrown in. Not good.All in all, the food gets a 3 out of 5.We ordered at 7:30, and our food didn't get to our house until 9:45 pm. This was on a very ordinary Tuesday night. I told the delivery driver to let the manager know that I am very upset that it took 2 HOURS to bring us our food. His response was that he is actually one of the cooks that lives down the street and that he was told to deliver our food on his way home. So basically, they were waiting for his shift to end so that he could bring me my food over 2 HOURS later. I won't be ordering from them again. It's a shame because I really did like some of their food items, but the fact that they care so little about their customers just isn't acceptable and they certainly don't deserve my business.

36.description: So as a service clerk for Jewel-Osco on Pulaski and Foster, I had a great pleasure when on carts duty to smell the freshing cooking of Chinese food during my execution of bring the shopping carts back to the motherland.  I gave into the smell and after my shift went to attain some awesome Chinese goodness.All I had was a rude old uncle who told me I might be disappointed with my Chow Fun because it was "different" and cooked without sauce. Say WHAT?I took him for granted and got myself Chow Fun for my bro bro and a beef dinner special and went home to have a small feast.YEAH.  DIFFERENT.My brother's Chow Fun was pure mass oily goodness, same with my dinner special.  We were so hungry we just finished what was there.  Our boxes done, we could see almost an eight of the box occupied by just PURE oil.Yeah.  Different.  As in abundance-in-veggie-oil different.  Screw this place, and if you spend your money there, you're a sucker too.  For Albany Park Chinese food, I'd rather recommend See-thru Chinese Kitchen on Pulaski and Argyle.  The lady there is very nice and they take pride in their Canto-American cuisine.

14.description: Quick and easy. Good food. All the typical Chinese food we expect. Delivery available. A pretty nice local spot when you get the hankering for Chinese food. Nothing pretty, but solid. Friendly people too. Just thinking about this place is making me hungry.

58.description: Best pho spot ever. They deliver it to your door  too! I can't say enough good things about them. I've been ordering from them for 4 years or so. This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.

56.description: Ordered Pho (take out) here a couple times. Plenty of options when it comes to ordering. I personally like the rare beef pho. Never had a bad bowl here check it out! Friendly service and efficient with orders.

29.description: This place is delish and very welcoming.  We've been a couple of times with my folks because my mom loves the banh xeo and spring rolls. I convinced them to try the pho for the first time tonight. The waitress double checked that we really wanted the "mixed beef" because it includes tendon and intestines along with roast beef and meatballs. That was reasonable to check since we were a table of white people with little kids and grandparents, but the tendon was seriously the best part. Last but not least, you should order the spicy fried squid.  It's like the most tender calamari ever.  And my 4 year old wants to add that the mango smoothie was her favorite part.

42.description: All I have to say is they are quite generous with the meat portion in their Pho. Love it!

23.description: Great food, good prices, nice people. Been coming here since day 1 literally. It's the Pho spot if we don't feel like driving to Argyle (which is less frequently since this spot is closer).

47.description: We are regulars and love this place.  Any reviews that comment about the wait staff being unfriendly must have deserved it!!!  They are very friendly but also very busy.  We always get the same thing every time.  We love the appetizer chicken wings--which are HUGE and we always split them.  Then we order #60 spicy squid.  It comes on a platter and we split that as well.  Plenty of food, always consistent, great service--(and by the way, the reason it is brought out sometimes sooner than you want is because it is always brought out HOT and last time I checked that is the way we want our food.  And the icing on the cake--BYOB with no corkage fee!  This is one of our go-to places.  The pho is great too--I go sometimes for lunch by myself and order the rare beef pho.

8.description: This restaurant has become my most favorite Vietnamese restaurant. Forget Argyle. They have variety of dishes and they taste good. My friends and I ordered:-Papaya salad with beef: the best. The marinated beef is so good. So flavorful. The papaya salad is a bit salty, but still good.-Vietnamese crepe (banh xeo): Crispy and tasty.

31.description: I love Pho. A big bowl of Pho is so comforting and a great way to warm up during cold weather.  I had HL bookmarked for a while and finally figured out a day when I could visit. The space is comfortable, clean, roomy and family friendly. Their menu is huge--everything just sounds so delicious.  I went with my usual Goi Cuon (fresh springrolls with shrimp) and the Pho Tai Gan (Pho with beef and tendon). Service was fine and food prep was timely. I loved the springrolls--they were smaller than what I normally see but still made well. The peanut sauce served on the side was delicious and had a tad of spice--the spice being something a little different from what I've found elsewhere, but a nice touch. The Pho was good and really warmed me up, the broth fragrant and a little on the sweet side.  I was pleasantly surprised that the beef had a lot of flavor too--something I don't always find when I order Pho. The noodles were plentiful although a little too al dente for my taste. Looking around and spying on other diners, it seemed like the papaya salad with beef was one of the most popular dishes and I definitely plan on trying that next time.  The menu, being as large as it is, has a lot to offer folks.
