14.description: Exp vapor and this shop didn't disappoint me! They have Glas juice for god sake !!! Employee and owner was there and had great service and they have a Great layout, with plenty of space. Great spot people; if in the area drop by them. Oh and they have parking great shop , product , and people ! Thanks for the new vapor shark and the Glas pound cake is a awesome juice

3.description: Sadly, the owner of this store is retiring and it will be closing either at the beginning or end of March.

1.description: I have lived down the street from Leo's for years and I went in for the first time two weeks ago. I wanted to see if they had essential oils and they did! Not only that, their prices were extremely reasonable. I went in today to purchase a Neti Pot and two more oils. I also noticed they have natural foods and snacks. They also have cod liver oil, another supplement I use. The prices for everything were easily comparable to any drug or grocery store you would go to. I would highly recommend this place as the "Natural" mecca of the North Park/Albany Park neighborhood.  I'm definitely going here before I go to Whole Foods.

2.description: Ahhhh! I love the feeling of supporting local small businesses.Every two weeks when I visit Leo for my herbal and supplement needs. The owner is very helpful. He is always letting my know abut the differences of A brand or a discount he just placed on a item. The store is well stocked as prior post suggest and I find majority of my needs here. Leo also has great prices with usually two cost options for many products I purchase. They do open a little later, I think 10 am and close about 6 pm, so take to visit on a lunch break or right after work. I like this place so much, I try hard to avoid Walgreen's or CVS for my herbal and supplement needs. I love Leo's !

5.description: Leo Naturals is a beckon of hope for good health in the North Park community. Typically, LNs have a plethora of mineral and vitman options. And if they don't, just ask and they can get it in an an reasonable time. The ONLY issue is the cost, which cab add up quickly if you're a min/vit buff as I am.

6.description: Cool neighborhood place to get supplements from. They have a good number of items on hand. Prices comparable to larger shops. Excellent customer service! A North Park gem!

7.description: Don't let the cruddy, cluttered window turn you off: this is a great little store, with organic snacks, herbal remedies, vitamins, beauty supplies, essential oils. The owner found me everything on my list minus one, and is ordering that one item for me. He even had other recommendations for me. Good prices. Open everyday except Sunday, 9:30-6:30.

8.description: Great store! Great inventory!- Don't let the small sales floor fool you. It's a one stop shop with the wide selection of heath food items such snacks, drinks, and supplements. There's wide selection of beauty care products for your skin and hair as well. The owners are very helpful. They are very knowledgable about herbs- he provides recommendations/suggestions. Don't be shy with any questions.

9.description: I love Leo's. The owner (I refer to him as Leo but I don't think that's really his name...) is super nice and always helpful. He can always find me what I'm looking for. They are suprisingly well stocked and much CHEAPER than your chain stores. I buy things here that I've bought at Whole Foods for $5-$10 dollars more. Definately check it out. They've been around forever and I hope they stay around for a long time to come.

0.description: The hours are a bit challenging for me, but I love what they have packed in this tiny shop (which is a lot). Correction, my sunburned Boyfriend loves what they have, but being a guy, he will do anything to avoid shopping... even suffering a painful scarlet, peeling, sunburn. Leo Naturals has a few things to soothe sunburn that I had no idea existed- for instance: Aloe Vera Soap (very soothing and gentle), 100% Aloe and 100% Cocoa Butter creams, Cocoa Butter Scrub (okay, that was purchased for me) and Rosewater (also purchased for me, but I notice the bottle a little depleted post purchase...) all a million times better than the overpriced, alcohol based products with artificial dyes and ingredients that make up most of the so-called "aloe" product at your standard drugstore. I can't help but think that the moisturizing properties will also be beneficial in cold winter months soon to come... will keep you updated. They have Kiss My Face, Queen Helene, Alba... all those lovely beauty brands that sell for so much more at Whole Foods. I also bought Cedar essential oil (which you can make a mild cleaner with: mix the oil, vinegar and tap water in a spray bottle. Spritz liberally, swab the walls of your closet for a good smell and this keeps bugs out of your closet. The vinegar smell fades leaving the rich woodsy cedar smell- kinda sexy). I know, genius, right? Leo Naturals also sells Coca-Cola, so you can caffeinate yourself to compensate for all the good stuff you you are buying for body and home. Love Them!

4.description: Love this place.  It's a perfect neighborhood store.  They mainly carry herbs, vitamins  and medicinal foods, herbs and tea but also have juice, some grocery staples shampoo, lotion and lip balm etc.  The owner is super knowledgable and warm. A great selection of vitamins and supplements

3.description: A classic McDonald's. I think it was the 56th one built but updated with a play place. Years ago, before the play place it had your general concrete picnic tables out front on a patio and the front still had the complete mansard roof. On the trees next door by the park they put birdhouses up in the 60's or 70's. They're still there today if you care to look. A solid restaurant. Well managed and organized. Always a helpful crew staffed to provide.

1.description: I didn't know so many old folks go here on a friday night! We tried the Jalapeño Double, but I prefer the Jalapeño Kicker Chicken Sandwich.The bacon ranch salad with crispy chicken was good! I didn't like the one refill per customer rule(the soda being behind the counters).when I asked for no ice on my refill,I thought he'd discard the ice then refill my cup instead of refilling the cup with all that ice...I guess I was wrong.wait time was decent with all the people there at the time

2.description: Update... They still over salt their fries. Ordered from there and had to park and wait because I asked for no salt on my fries. I saw there "maintenance man" changing the garbage on the outside.  Less than 1 minute later, the same man was delivering my food. In that time, he wouldnt have time to put the garbage away, wash his hands and then deliver my food. I did not want to yell at the guy, so I called and told the man who answered about what I saw and he apologized and said that "that was our maintenance man and he shouldnt be doing that."  Hopefully he really follows up on that and that it doesnt happen again. Disgusted.

9.description: Yes, I'm sure we all know that this is McDonalds and not a five star gourmet restaurant. But this mcdonalds in particular sucks. Cold stale buns are not cool. Neither is never getting a freakin straw when you go through the drive-thru. And that play place? It is FILTHY. Please parents, don't let your kids play in there.

10.description: I don't need to tell you a thing about the food here, so you can stop with the eye roll or the "Why is Kellie reviewing McDonald's" head scratching.  Keep reading.What I'm going to tell you is a new secret weapon to combat wintertime/bad weather kid cabin fever and sluggishness.  Yes, at Mc Donald's.  Head to the back of the restaurant and just past the sliding glass doors is your destination.  Parents or other adults in charge of children: this location has a great play land area for kids, and better yet, you don't have to pay an outrageous fee to use it or stand in a line just to get in.  While I haven't seen any kind of purchase enforcement to use the play area, I know keeping up with the little ones tends to make a grown-up thirsty.  Grab yourself a coffee or other beverage that suits you and relax a bit while the little ones burn off that energy.  It's that simple.The equipment seems to be kept fairly clean, or as clean as it can be kept with little hands constantly climbing all over it.  It can get a little busy on a Saturday afternoon, which is to be expected.  My only complaint is that the sliding glass door is sometimes left open, which is probably noisy for the rest of the customers and one less obstacle to keep the little ones corralled when they get distracted and run away from the play equipment.Save those pennies and give it a try.  Then, do yourself and the kids a favor and take them home, or anywhere else, to eat something a bit healthier.  Besides, it'll probably be naptime or bedtime anyway after all that running around.  Yeah, for everyone.Bring the hand sanitizer and I'll see you there.

4.description: Food was typical for mcdonalds-no complaint on that. The ac was on very low on a humid day.The cashier was somewhat slow. The play area smelled like a zoo. I'll be sticking to the drive thru.

6.description: Clean and nice. One of the good McDonalds to visit.

12.description: The only reason why is particular McDonald's is still in business is their playhouse. If they didn't have it, they would have been closed. Overpriced, yes overpriced than other McDonald's. 50% of the time, they don't have the deals they have on TV. They add 20 cents more. No free refills, sorry. This McDonald's is the only one I know that doesn't have free refills.

5.description: If you go to this McDonald, make sure to check your bill every single time! I ordered a special $3 meal (egg mcmuffin w/small coffee) and a regular breakfast meal at $5.19. They charged me $3.49 for the special set minus the coffee. Apparently the mcmuffin sandwich costs $3.49 without the coffee so they typed that in instead of what I really ordered to charge me more. When I asked for my small coffee, they said $2 more. I asked to speak to the manager and he spoke to me and said the same thing. I pointed out that the special meal is $3 for the sandwich and meal so why would I pay an extra $2 for small coffee on top of the extra .49 cents I had already paid. Long story short, he gave me the coffee and was supposed to refund me .55 cents but would NOT refund me that amount! They did the same thing to me last time, shorted me $2 in change and thought I would not notice! People count your change!!! Every time I go they try to short me .04 cents or more saying they don't have enough pennies and "it's just a couple pennies." Why don't you give me a nickel since you are just losing ONE penny, how would you like that?! NEVER again playland or not!

11.description: Prices are higher than other McDonalds, they charge a fee for drive thru orders, charge for sauces other than ketchup or BBQ sauce, add an up charge for getting a drink with a kids meal that isn't soda (so milk or apple juice cost extra) and don't offer refills. Not just "no free refills."  They don't do refills, period. It's a McDonalds!  How is that even possible?  I won't be going back.

8.description: With this economy the owner here has raised prices on combo's.  Find the Big Mac combo at a whopping $6 dollars and change.  There are three other McDonald's locations on Kedzie that are within a mile that charge less.  WTF?This location is where I attended my first McDonald's party where I met Ronald McDonald and Hamburglar.  It'd be sad to see it closed, on this trend it may soon be.

0.description: Love it. What makes this place great is how clean it is and how nice the staff are. If their is a problem with what you ordered, there is no need to go crazy because as soon as you tell them the problem, they usually help make it right. Especially if you have your receipt.

7.description: Dude it's McDonalds. As usual I sent back the fries and told them I wanted fresh... they said no problem 3 minutes. Didn't care for the Angus Mushroom Wrap but it had nothing to do with this location in particular because every McDonalds tastes exactly the same.My kids had a blast in the play place. It's McDonalds guys don't take it so seriously.....

3.description: One of the advantages of living in small town is that you can count on there being a nearby grocery store with all the basics, so you don't have to run all over just to buy what you need each day. "What?" you say. "You don't live in a small town! You live in Chicago, for crying out loud!" True, but Chicago is known as the City of Neighborhoods, and a neighborhood is like a small town. I'm fortunate to have in my neighborhood a super little grocery called Bryn Mawr Fresh Market.Truth be told, this market did not used to be so fresh. It was crowded, disorganized, and dare I say, a bit dingy. When I first moved to the area a few years ago, I stopped in and was unimpressed. Then I noticed a change a couple of years ago: renovation was taking place! I'm not sure if the place changed ownership or if the owner got inspired, but the sad little shop has turned into a useful market. Yes, it's on the small side, but they pack in loads of goodies, mainly Asian. Tofu and produce, fresh deli items including prepared vegetables and marinated meat (hello, bulgogi), noodles and a plethora of sweet and salty snacks -- they have some good variety. You can prepare all kinds of meals from the offerings here. And, they're always cooking up something, so if you don't feel like cooking yourself, just snatch up some tasty spicy wings or Korean pancakes and *poof* instant gratification!They also have milk, bread, eggs and the like, so there's no need to go a couple of miles away from home just to fill in the basics. Hooray for small independent businesses!Bonus if you drive here: there is a FREE parking lot right next to the store. Take that, LAZ Parking.

1.description: This place might have been better once, but the way it is now, it seems to be very lackadaisically managed.  The fish counter has been empty for a long time.  What little fresh meat is available is always off (do not buy chicken here, ever, unless it is frozen solid!)  The produce is more often than not wilty, moldy, or sprouting, and the selection is inconsistent.  The space is also poorly arranged and messy.  You'll probably find the olive oil in the coolers.I shop here because it's the only grocery within walking distance, but I would go elsewhere if I could.  However, I'll give an extra star because they do carry some useful Asian staples, and the owner is actually very friendly, which helps to smooth over some of the inevitable frustration.  The place really feels more like your friendly neighbor's messy garage than a serious market.  I do like the people; I just wish they would take a bit more pride in their work.  It would love it if I didn't have to catch a bus each time I wanted to buy fresh baby bok choy.

2.description: I must have missed something. I wasn't charmed. I wasn't overwhelmed. From the reviews, I was expecting a religious experience. I received a reality tv one (read: ho-hum to briefly exciting). If I am being honest (to borrow a reality tv troupe), I found the market to be dingy and depressing. The produce looked a bit past its glory days, the shelves ranged from fully stocked to sadly sparse and the aisles were few an far between.I get that this is a small, ethnic grocery that's best used when looking for specialty items and not for full-on grocery shopping. I get that. But when you have a beauty like Super H Mart winking coyly at you, why would you ever pay attention to Sarah, Plain & Tall (and in need of product)? I found some Korean sugar waters that I greatly enjoyed (they were colorful and unnatural in appearance; these are pluses). But, other than that, I didn't get the big deal. I certainly wouldn't rush to come back here nor would I implore others to visit. I guess I'm satisfied that I had the experience of coming but, in hindsight, I don't know why I did.

9.description: Like a Chicago local hardware store, this market offers items unique to the people living, shopping and dining on this stretch of Bryn Mawr.  Based on the signs in the store and the greeting by the cashier the owners are Korean.  Many of the groceries are that specific to what vegetables and fruits you would find in a typical Korean market.  I specifically like the convenience of the location, since in years past many other local Korean markets have since closed.  Packs of wooden chopsticks quantity, 20-40 are only a couple dollars.  Interesting choices of noodles and hot sauces.  Noodles made from the mung bean and other beans, great options for those with specific allergies and the prices are low not like the over priced crap found in pretty stores.  Like Caroline A mentioned their fruits are worth a look, Korean pears differ from pears one finds at Jewel.  Korean pears are sold in boxes of 8 - 10 and run about $20-$30 a box.  The pear is the size of your head, very juicy and best when served chilled.  Strange, eating an entire pear alone, it acts as an natural laxative. (Fyi.)  The store has an attached parking lot on its side.

10.description: This place is heaven for fresh produce.  It looks a little sketchy when you walk in - obviously an ethnic market.  However, they have a variety of apples (Gala, Macintosh, Fuji)  the size of your head, boxes of sweet navel oranges, peaches and pears by the box, and even exotic fruits such as lychees and other berries I have not identified.  I also love coming here in the winter for Korean sweet potatoes, Japanese Kobocha squash and bags of chestnuts for roasting.  Ask the Korean dude behind the register what's come in recently, and he'll point you in the right direction.  Conveniently, there is a parking lot too!

4.description: This little fatty went to the market... after spending 2 hours eating Korean grub with lovely folks down the street. I am happy to report that in truly Yanyao fashion, I walked out of here with $20 of ready-to-eat Korean food for my fridge (most of it is gone by now, for those who are curious).This market is pretty terrific. Produce, meat, daily staples, Asian snacks and drinks, noodles, sauces and a ready to eat food stall that doles out pajun (seafood pancake), chicken wings, gimbab (Korean futomaki), banchan of different varieties, kimchi, chapchae... endless possibilities! I grabbed 2 orders of gimbab, a small tray of pajun and one of pan-fried fish and crabstick, and a giant container of mixed banchan that had bean sprouts, radish and 2 kinds of spinach, and some Japanese light cheesecake for a sweet. Delicious as a snack last night and even better for lunch today. Honestly, if I lived in the neighborhood, would I ever use my stove? I don't know, probably not. And while I probably won't come here specifically to visit BMFM (Super H Mart is much bigger and closed to me), no trip to this stretch of Bryn Mawr would be complete without coming in here to purchase Korean food for later consumption. Absolutely wonderful. Thank you to Pam and Alice for recommending and leading the way!

6.description: Again and again I will drive allllll the way up to Bryn Mawr Fresh Market to indulge in the most incredible product finds.  I love the discovery aspect to the store!  Additionally, the Korean Pears this time of year are the absolute best!  Worth it.  A total gem of a place in a city where fresh produce is sometimes hard to find at good prices.

11.description: A wonderful local grocery store.  They just changed the name (it's now Bryn Mawr Fresh Market), changed the layout, and re-opened the butcher shop.  The deals here are amazing, with the fruits & vegetables commonly found in any grocery store PLUS a great selection of Asian specialties.  They carry name brand, Asian brand, and Hispanic brand groceries.  And the new butcher in the back looks excellent!  My daughter loves the funky Japanese candy and snacks, and I love grabbing  whole sack of fresh vegetables for under $10.

5.description: I've rediscovered this neighborhood gem after many years. It is a convenient quick stop to get good produce, freshly prepared Korean food and an assortment of Korean, Japanese and Hispanic food and snack items.I have not tried anything from their meat counter, so I can't comment on that aspect as of yet, but I look forward to trying more items in the future. It is a little adventure close to home.

7.description: So I hate to admit it, but Alice S. is somewhat correct. Since I moved down the street from this place almost two years ago, I have noticed that the store has declined a little. BUT, what is great about it, is that for someone who lives around the corner, they have great stuff! All the ready-to-eat food that they prepare in house is really good. The chicken wings are super good as well as the kimbob rolls. Honestly, if I didn't live super close to this place I probably wouldn't go out of my way except to get the chicken wings. I'm super happy to live within walking distance because if I run out of toilet paper I can get it easily and cheaply and use it as an excuse to get those delicious wings.

8.description: This is one of my favorite places, and I am so happy they have taken advantage of the fact that they are the central place to get groceries/essentials in my neighborhood (besides the 7-11 on Kimball). It's a little bit shocking when you first walk in. The relatively small space is just packed with good stuff: all kinds of neat vegetables and fruits at great prices, korean and other azn candy, noodles and junk food galore, and a bunch of other cool things to try.They recently renovated and opened a fresh food counter. At any given time, there are fresh maki, korean pancakes, and more than a few varieties of kimchi and noodles. The dude behind the counter is Ken, and he is a warm, fantastic personality and a knowledgeable businessman. After a few weeks of shyly scoping out the goods, I quietly asked Ken whether the kimchi had fish in it. "You vegetarian or vegan?" he asked. Music to my ears, folks. This man knows what vegan is and has made a market for it. Who would have thought? He had the chef specially make us a batch of vegan kimchi and it is INCREDIBLE. Pickled cabage, persimmon, asian pear, Ken made it a point to read us the full ingredient list and point out what high quality stuff goes into it. And $3 a jar! Amazing.The sweet potato noodles with veggies has also become a regular treat. For $4-5.00 you get a huge tin of greasy, delicious noodles that would feed 2-3 people for lunch. Also worth mentioning is the fact that Midori sushi, some of the best in the city, is located next door. If you live in the area and you haven't checked out Bryn Mawr Fresh Market by now - get over there!

0.description: Who likes bibimbap but is too lazy to make all the banchan that goes with it?I am!!!!Bryn Mawr Fresh Market is a small grocery store featuring Korean essentials. It's not as big as HMart or Joong Boo and therefore, doesn't have as much. However, when you are need of some K essentials, BM fresh market is the place to go.So getting back to this bibimbap thing. I really like to eat bibimbap and it's really easy to make if you have the veggies already made. The owner of the mart actually makes and sells packages of the bibimbap veggies already to go. He makes his own japchae, too - which is not only very delicious, but reasonably priced. One time I had the opportunity to try his Korean fried chicken. (Which you can also buy) Omo Omo!!!! (korean expression), Dae BAK!  - (meaning awesome.) It was so tasty. They also have a little produce section, banchan section, etc.Overall, great little market featuring the best of your korean food needs.

12.description: I finally made it to this Dunkin Donuts/ Baskin Robbins as its been open for a few years and just steps from my humble abode.  Long long ago there used to be another Baskin Robins just a few stores down.  This location replaced a vacant lot where an old gas station used to be so it is a big improvement.   It was 31 cent scoop day so it was a good excuse to stop in.  I had my old favorite (mint chip) and a new favorite (jamoca) which is their own special coffee ice cream.  The place was mobbed today but the service was fast and friendly.  Someone kept popping balloons and scaring the crap out of everyone but aside from that I enjoyed it.

3.description: POOR SERVICE. We ordered 2 single scoops in a cone at the drive thru. They kept hearing "in a cup". The kid at the window was arguing that we said in a cup and we were wrong. Their menu said there was soft serve, when we asked about it they said they didn't offer any. False advertising. Didn't even hand us a receipt. Will not return and will make sure to tell people we know about the attitude and horrible service!

1.description: This is one of my favorite Dunkin locations. The drive through is always busy from what I have seen but since I do not drive it does not affect me. The workers are very helpful and my order always comes out right! One of the guys that works there is very friendly and it really makes all the difference. Overall, this Dunkin has great customer service, it is clean and I like the location.

2.description: Not friendly. Terrible service. Very old ice cream and day old donuts. On Veterans Day they declined to acknowledge the promotions. It's sad that this place still exists. The day we do not show support for the people that fight for our freedom, is the day we don't deserve it

9.description: Rude and inattentive staff. Usually have to repeat my order several times to the drive through staff. More than once what I receive is not what I ordered. Staff pays no attention when handing you things either, and had dropped my order on the ground before. Convenience of the drive through at this location is wasted with the level of incompetence their staff exhibits.

10.description: Rude staff. Service very bad and slow. Even doesnt have much customer. It's not happen at first time. However i will not back agian

4.description: Terrible service. They made us wait for 20 minutes for a scoop of ice cream and they actually charge for water....Why are these guys still in business here?

6.description: Went there for ice cream because it's also a Baskin Robins. Once scoop each or cookie dough and cookies and cream. I went there around 11pm. The people working were very friendly and nice. I have never received two larger scoops of ice cream in my life ! It was delicious!

0.description: Good coffee! But if you like tea, Dunkin' is pushing their Chai Tea Lattes. And for two more Mondays this year, it's a free cup ( 10 oz. hot or 16 oz. iced) to anyone, no coupon required.But what about the Dunkin' Donuts 2014 calendar? I asked for one here while completing my purchase. After a check with the manager, my counter person said they'd sell me one for $1 -- another counter person opined THAT was "a good deal." Since in the past, the calendar was a giveaway, I declined. I see now that the 2014 Dunkin' calendar is selling on eBay for $2.50 + $0.99 shipping, so maybe it WAS a good deal!

5.description: WARNING: DO NOT GO TO THIS DUNKIN DONUTS. IT'S NOT WORTH IT. If I could give this Dunkin' Donuts 0 stars, I would. I waited 20 minutes for a single scoop of ice cream. I know that I am not the only one with this terrible experience at this location. As new customers walked in, I was completely disregarded. When the employee was about to get me my ice cream, he stopped and said that they manager would do it. What? You can't just get me my ice cream? I expected some type of compensation for the amount of time it took me to get my ice cream, but I failed to receive anything to put out my raging anger. I wish I spoke up to the manager. I don't think I have every had service this bad. This Dunkin' Donuts needs a change in manager ASAP. FLAMED

13.description: I went thru the drive-thru here today. It is close to home, so I have been here several times and have never been overwhelmed with the service. Today they took it to a new low. I tried to order a root beer float. I have ordered root beer floats here several times before, both at the counter and at the drive-thru. Today's crack crew however, could not serve me one, because they didn't know what it was or how to make it. It wasn't just one person, even as a committee they were clueless. How hard can vanilla ice cream and root beer be to combine? I guess it does take a rocket scientist.

11.description: Its nice to see the once vacant space that a former shell station used to occupy finally be filled.  You could tell upon construction they were trying to make the space newer and fancy.  But cosmetics do take their toll as the lot itself is a bit on the tight side.  I dont drink coffee..in fact, I stay away from caffeine all together.  Im blessed and cursed with being a natural night owl.  So obviously I dont frequent coffee places often.  But who doesnt have the random carvings for a donut here and there?  Or maybe, you know...a dozen.  You might as well if youre gonna make the trip right?  Its not like I eat a full dozen in a sitting..nothing a few secs in the microwave wont fix.  Bavarian creme ftw!  Thee main reason that lures me here is a certain flavor of frozen treats.  Pistachio ice cream!!!  Youve never had it?  Dont you know the best desserts are salty and sweet?  If you cant commit to even a scoop..at least ask for a spoon sample.  Youll like it.  How many scoops for my sundae you ask?  Skip the sundae...hand packed quart is the way to go.  $6 and well worth it!

8.description: Worst dunkin donuts ever. They never have a steady flow of donuts. They need to just close.

14.description: Usually I find Jacob K. on point, but I do not share his opinion on this location, I lean more and agree with Pam D's review. If you are an avid customer of Baskin Robbins you know that each location is different in so many ways. Customer service is never the same and whether we are talking about ice cream or how something simple like a sundae is created, its always different and that in itself is well... nuts. One of my biggest peeves about this location are the charges. One time I was here for the 99 cent scoop promo, the cashier pressed 99 buttons and when he was done I was overcharged. I showed him the flier I received and the cost I was to pay, he argued that their location charges different. Okay, whatever; makes no sense when you have the same advertising in-store stating the price of a cone with a scoop. During another promotion I went through the drive-thru. I must've had the same luck because I think it was the same associate, again overcharged and given some illogical explanation. I took a photo of the receipt which I don't have near me to post on Yelp, but it shows that I was charged a miscellaneous cost and given a discount but still the final price higher than the promotion charge. WTF. All of these pricing problems on top of the inability of some store employees in understanding simple ice cream orders.. equals sucky visits. The parking lot, who designed this space? Drive-thru closes at their will during late nights. What's good? you tell me. Maybe the coffee and the bagels. I avoid other purchases.. now it's just a cone with soft serve, keep it simple.

7.description: I broke my fast of this Dunkin Donuts location because.... well pumpkin is back! Once again I could tell that the woman that took my order was not really paying attention or listening carefully to me. I asked for a hot black coffee with pumpkin syrup. She got the pumpkin right, but I was given cream and sugar. I didn't sip my coffee until after I got to the office and it was too late to exchange it. To add insult to injury, they also screwed up my bagel order. So basically my order was unsalvageable and I wasted $5.00.

3.description: First time at razors edge. Mila is truly an experienced and talented hair stylist and I will be back to see her. She listens and is very patient even though others where waiting. The shop reminds me of the barbershop I went to as a kid. The shop is barely visible from Devon so look for the barber pole on Trumbull.

1.description: As is often said, stick with what you know. I have been coming to Mila for many years, when she was on Devon and Springfield and now at the Razor's Edge. Before all that she was in a salon in Wilmette and left to start her own business. Always friendly and attentive, taking on young and old clients. I just came back this afternoon from yet another haircut under her hands. Pleased to see the kind compliments here. She can be reached direct at 773 478 4164. Tue-Fri 9 to 6. Sat 9 to 5 only.  Worth the effort. A guy like me, less than $20 not including gratuity.  Call first as walk ins may have to wait.  - Tim

2.description: Mila had cut my hair and did a wonderful job. I completely changed my review from last time. I explained what I wanted, and she delivered just that. She is very attentive, skilled, and friendly. I highly recommend Mila

0.description: This 5 star is for Mila. I started going here because I had to move away from my messy look and mature into a clean cut. I never thought or imagined this day would come. I would always go to a hairsalon and face the anxiety and frustration of each attempt at getting my hair how I Invision it.. Although I have found good salons, and enjoy the hairwashes, I knew my professional look needed to be more clean and less maintenance. Mila delivered my new hair style. I gave her a vague idea of what I wanted and let her translate my thoughts. The result is that I wait to get my haircut when I am visiting Chicago! Its very clean and she knows her way around poorly placed cowlicks! She holds great conversations: our last one was about family and food. I never thought an Eastern European would change the course of my Asian hairstyles but Mila did! She is caring and skilled. Personal takeaway: Asians in their early 20s seeking to move away from awkward asian salon visits because you can barely speak their language to mature their looks should give Mila a try!

1.description: Got their pumpkin spice latte yesterday night & it was super watered down!!

2.description: Buyer beware, I guess. This is mostly a specific review for the worker named Bharat. First of all, he didn't give me my receipt and when I realized he gave me back change for a $15 (when I gave him a $20 for payment--a single bill, in fact so it makes no sense that he could have confused it for $15), he told me that since I couldn't prove it he couldn't do anything about it. Then called "next!" in line after me. I hope he feels good about ripping people off for $5 :)

0.description: Just updating that their alcohol section has grown since 2007.  With more traffic coming in and buying / requesting all kinds of beverages, now they have a section devoted to wines and mini kegs.  Lots more options instead of the usual domestic brews most are used to.  Late nights on weekends I'm seeing more than one clerk cashiering which just feels safer.  Now if only the underage girls would go home, you know.. the ones that drive daddies SUV with a girl pack and wear juicy couture and extra makeup hoping some daft older guy would buy them cigarettes and beer.

12.description: Delivery is a little expensive, but the food is quality. The Philly was the best I had in a long while.

7.description: Super fast and made to order junk food!  Their philly steak was great, everything was still crispy and piping hot through delivery.

3.description: Legit greasy food.  I love the giant chicken wings that are crispy and tasty.  Every time I order here I am getting some chicken wings and cheeseburger and the greasiness hits the spot.  Health food nuts?  Stay away from here, but if you're in the mood to get your junk food fix, go for it.  Powered by GrubHub!

1.description: I've stopped by to eat in and I've ordered delivery 3 times.Things you should never order:The Nachos (stale chips and meh cheese)Pizza puff (This isn't real food and could make you vomit)Things not to order for delivery:Fries (They get soggy and are sometime under cooked)Things that are OK:Buffalo WingsJim ShoeSteak PhillyThings that are amazing:Nothing.  Nothing I've had here was amazing.

2.description: I don't eat much fast food but when I do, come here for the wings. You really get a bang for your buck! The chicken wings are fresh, hot, crispy, juicy & plentiful. FYI: This place is Halal for anyone who is of the Muslim religion. The owners and cook are very friendly. Stopped in for lunch with my co-workers and the owners just got a pizza oven. They wanted us to be there first test dummies and offer our honest opinions. So they gave us a huge slice for each of us. I was pleasantly surprised! They make it from scratch, including the thin crust and it was yummy. Always a great lunch experience here

9.description: Philly Steak spicy!  Spicy Gyros Pizza!  Can't go wrong.  Friendly people as well!

18.description: Gyro sandwich here is excellent. I was a bit skeptical about the place when I walked in, but it turned out to be quite good. My sandwich came with fries and a soda can for $6, so I think it was priced quite reasonably. Not sure about other food items here, but the Gyro sandwich gets a thumbs up. This place serves Zabihah Halal food.

10.description: After walking past Papa's Philly for a few months I finally decided to give it I decided to get a 21 shrimp basket which included a can of pop and a side of fries which totaled up to $6.55; pretty reasonable for shrimp in my opinion. I then sat down and waited for my food. The table that I waited for my food on was quiet sticky, probably from the remains of spilled soda? I don't know, but I was the only one in the restaurant and there were 3 workers present including the cashier; table should of been clean. My food was prepared in less than 10 minutes and off I went back to studying. The food overall was alright, 21 shrimp basket is basically fried cocktail shrimp served with cocktails sauce along with fries.- The 21 shrimps tasted good excellent, not over or undercooked.  - However the fries were very oily and tasted very bland. Overall experience. - Reasonably priced food- Quickly served - Tables were dirty, should have been cleaned in my opinion - Fries were very oily and needed a bit more salt

13.description: In my first few months at NPU, I avoided this place because I always thought it looked kind of sketchy from the outside. However, their Chicago hot dogs are actually amazing!! Get the deal- 1 hot dog, can of soda, and fries (with awesome seasoning) for I think about $6! You can't beat that in the city.

16.description: Had 2 cheese steaks & cheese fries delivered.  Cheese fries are raw, yes RAW!!  Horrible.  Cheesesteaks are okay.

17.description: Had their double cheeseburger with fries and a can of pop. The burger was very juicy and well cooked. In regards to service they were very courteous and prompt. Pricing was reasonable only ended up being 8 bucks and change with taxes already added. In comparison to five guys I would say they are in the same ball park in relation to burgers. Fries were cooked well tasty with a good amount of salt. They have a huge tv in the restaurant which was a plus, it kept me occupied while I ate. The bathroom was the only down side due to it being in such a crammed spot. This is my second time here and I will definitely come back

15.description: Pretty good, and decent prices with fries and a can of pop. The guy that was at the register was super nice, and he was eager to hear feedback. Nice compared to many places where they don't even ask how the food was. I'll be back for another gyro burger. :)

0.description: Not exactly the healthiest food but the buffalo wings are some of the best that I've had in the city.  If they ever lowered their delivery fee, this would become a staple instead of the occasional treat.

5.description: I feel bad giving this place one star, b/c it seems like maybe food is not something they normally do. It seems like there's not a standard, in which case they're succeeding. The food is just bad. They obviously fry everything in the same vat and don't change grease. The food was warm but the fries were like a sponge that had absorbed all the nasty  grease - like months & months old grease. My stomach is still churning. The buffalo wings were not very good either. Delivery took about 45 mins and we're maybe a ten minute walk. The prices are great, but the food is bad.

11.description: This place is amazing great management and great food, I would highly recommend this place.

8.description: This place is 0.8 miles away from me and they wanted to charge me 5 bucks for delivery from a 3-5 dollar scale depending on your location!! Sooo where is the 3 dollar cut off? Across the street from the restaurant? I won't be ordering from here. Make sure you live less than a block away to get a decent price.

4.description: Really really good chicken taco, also beef taco!! Meat has good flavor... There green sauce is great too...

14.description: The food hits the spot pretty well, zabiha halal and quick service. You get exactly what'd you'd expect, my personal favorites are the gyro burgers and gym shoes. If recommend this place for a quick, cheap, and tasty trip.

6.description: Amazing food!!!  Its great for those who want to eat Zabiha Halal food. I have been coming here since they opened and I have never had a bad experience. They deliver too.  Best buffalo wings!! Gyros Cheeseburger is a large portion size and will leave you stuffed. Jim shoe sandwich is my favorite with multiple meats.Others I have enjoyed are cheesy Philly, Italian beef, steak tacos, and much more. Highly recommend for their quality and it is well priced. Rashid, the owner is trying to get pizzas on his menu very soon.

12.description: It's a block away from my place and it's got a liquor store right next door. Score! There's only a few cooks working here (for those who haven't been it's usually just one cook taking orders, cooking, etc) and I've developed a real bond with one of the guys, he cooks a mean cheeseburger! It's not the greatest food in the world but it's cheap, open late and clean. You might have some, uh interesting... interactions.... with the locals. We experienced a 14 year old gangbanger throwing up signs and trying to start a fight, but luckily my buddy the cook armed himself with a large kitchen knife, kicked the little bastard out and locked the door.Give GT a shot, I reccomend the gyros!

7.description: Love this place now that it has new ownership!!! I work next door and go there for lunch once a week or so and it is always great. I typically get the beef shwarma that comes with rice, salad and the best homemade hummus.  The owner is super sweet and pleasent and they have done a great job of fixing up the place.  check it out for some great comfort food. I HIGHLY reccomend it to anybody in the area.

3.description: affordable and friendly.a fair selection of foods, including breakfast all day.polish sausage was fire (my partner tells me that's a good thing).burger patties a bit too thin but the value meal comes with a lot of fries and a drink so it'll fill you up.

1.description: Wondering what part of this was what got my review removed.  "There is an episode I kitchen nightmares brewing here. Not. Even. Kidding. Do not try the falafel nor the shawerma. We had the runs for a day and a half. "Let me try some detailI had the falafel. Any fool could tell it was old improperly kept food. It was rancid.And the shawarma.  Gross.  It was so gross.   Stinky wierd texture gross.  We had runny poo for a day and a half.

2.description: This place is vary good and cheap vary friendly service makes me feel welcomed this is a comeback place for me

9.description: Great comfort food at a cheap price for a small neighborhood joint. You have to try their new signature burger and homemade French fries. They have a new owner so things have been changing for the better every day. Definitely worth a visit.

18.description: I've only had Gyros here, but man they are effin awesome. It's a nice small restuarant. Pretty hidden, which is probably why it's never overcrowded. Gyro is the best I've had. After the took down my old Gyro spot I found this one.The undocumented immigrants do hang out there, but who cares I'm Mexican.

10.description: Just a block south of Gompers Park on Pulaski, GT's is located in a strip mall across from the neighborhood Aldi's. Considering I've worked in the area nearly 10 years and never visited this place is unbelievable. I've passed it many times, reluctant to try, but finally checked it out. It is definitely not a dive considering its proximity to the lot next to the Salvation Army building where the undocumented workers hang out along the fence looking for work.GT's is a nice diner, complete with the long counter and the round stools. Very clean and shiny counter you can eat off of - literally. Their menu has breakfast, lunch and dinner items you would expect: eggs, bacon, pancakes, hash browns, hot dogs, burgers, gyros, and even a Mexican selection of burritos, tacos, quesadillas and sopes. Being the observant Catholic, I settled for a fish sandwich on this particular Lenten Friday. If Burger King thinks they have a Big Fish sandwich, look out! GT's stacks about 3 inches tall with all the works included! Lots of fries on the side, and all made to order quickly.Their drinks include Aguas Naturales: Horchata, Jamaica and Tamarindo.Some of the booths have small tears in the cushions, but the overall upkeep on this place is good and the food preparation area looked very clean to me. It's a lot less crowded than Backyard Grill on Devon about 2 miles north of here, and a lot cheaper too. I think I'll be returning here more often for my weekly lunch out.

13.description: this place is still the same, super nasty fries, if they say they will delivered it is a very long wait for pos food. the guy that post pictures of the hamburger and fries lmfao, just look at the fries yuck, every thing u order will be pos food, that should  be the name of this place pos food.

16.description: we were drunk. we were stumbling down the street looking or an atm and a cab. i saw a neon sign (or maybe a piece of notebook paper with sharpie taped in the window) sayin' something about bacon and eggs. we looked at each other and both said simultaneously "you wanna eat there?"obviously the answer was yes. i was so overwhelmed by the thought of delicious, greezy fast food that i didn't even get past the first menu item before ordering. i had a hamburger and fries. from what i remember of that evening (which isn't much) they were delicious. some of the details are a little fuzzy, but i do know that we wound up ordering cheese sticks too. after my meal, i found an atm by the door, filled my pocket with cash and stumbled outside to find a warm cab waiting for me in the parking lot. what luck.

17.description: I stopped by here for lunch and ordered the gyros special, which came with fries and a drink.  It was a huge meal, which I could have easily split with someone.  The gyros was tasty and I'll probably order it again.  They had a vertical gyros spit, which is always a good sign.  Many fast food places cut corners and use the pre-sliced frozen gyro meat.  That's not the case here.  GT's also offers breakfast sandwiches, omelets, hot dogs, Polish sausage, pizza puffs, and various sandwiches for lunch.  Nothing fancy, but go here if you want decent, greasy diner food.

15.description: Great food, great portions!! The food quality used to be five-star. But after they changed management, the food quality went down a notch. I love their gyros, Italian beef, and fries...nice, thick steak fries. Not stringy and super-greasy. I'm usually not a burger guy, but their bacon double cheeseburgers are the best I've had in a very long time. Also, this place usually isn't crowded. Which is always a good thing. You can usually get in and out in under 20-25 minutes. I would definitely drive a few extra miles out of my way for this place.

0.description: Their cheese omelet with gyros is great. They also have home made hot sauce which taste awesome with it! Must try. Great prices too.

5.description: After I got sushi from a different establishment, which my man does not like, he decided to pick up a chicken Gyro from this place. When he came home with it I cringed after I had read the reviews on here. I wish he was a Yelper so he could have been warned.I had a small bite to try. The chicken gyros was DISGUSTING with anemic fries. It tasted funny -like it was actually made from one of those joke rubber chickens. I hope he doesn't get the trots from this- but I will surely update this review if he does just to warn you.If you want really good Gyros not too far from from here go to Eden's on Cicero just north of Peterson - I've never been disappointed from them and I've never gotten sick or felt like I had been poisoned.Time is ticking...I might go out and buy some butt wipes just to be sure.Update: We did not get ill from the food but the thought of it makes us want to boke.

11.description: I finally made it to this diner, and after all it is only a few blocks away from my house. I ordered a couple of things to go, and indeed the food was prepared quickly (fast food, get it?). Like Erika V says, the gyros special is a pile of food with reasonably tasty gyros meat and crispy fries. The ham omelette with cheese came with a pile of hash browns. The food was good and filling, and cheaper than similar meals at Golden Nugget.

8.description: I almost don't have the energy to write this review. The hot dog was ok, but if you don't want ketchup make sure and tell them. They loaded it with so much mustard that mom couldn't eat it. They have a sign in the window that says "soup", but what they offer is a cup of ramen noodles. They add the water and you get it in the Styrofoam cup it comes in. I think not. I don't care if there are undocumented immigrants hanging about, but I do care that the prices are kinda high for what you get. I won't be back.

4.description: I'm sad to say with the change in ownership the food here is no longer good. I tried it twice before I gave them the negative review just to be sure. I first tried a cheesy beef sandwich that I picked up and it was just ok, pretty bland overall but not terrible.However, then I did a Grubhub order and that is when the bad happened. First, let me preface this with the fact that we live less than a mile from the restaurant so there should be no issue getting the food hot and fast. However, it took more than an hour for the food to be delivered and when it was the fries were cold on all 3 meals, the shake was melted and too milky, and my burger was burnt on the bottom. Not well done, burnt to a crisp. I called back and complained and they redelivered a new burger about 20-30 mins later but the new one was bland and honestly not worth the wait. They did apologize that they were trying someone new but still why wouldn't you check his work before sending things to your customers?Overall, I will not be back because there are too many other similar options in the area with consistently good food!

14.description: i wasn't really that hungry when we stopped in here but it was still my 'dinner time' what's nice is that this place is open late. I believe it's until 12am during weeknights and on weekends until 2am. i was dissapointed with the quality of food for a a hole in the wall joint, but i didn't have very high expectations to begin with.the prices are decent i suppose which keeps the star rating at a 3. if you get a sandwich and you want to add fries you basically take the price of the sandwich and add a dollar. they salt/pepper your fries for you if you'd like, but even seasoned the fries are bland and bulky. fresh though!i had a cheeseburger, it was overpriced by about 2 dollars seeing as how i could have gotten a mcdouble for a buck and would have probably enjoyed it more. every bite was a mouthful, the patty was rather large, and it was topped with fresh ingredients, they also don't add mayo to their burgers. that's a major plus for me because mayo is revolting. :) however there wasn't anything so spectacular about the burger that i'd go out of my way to grab one again. unless it's late night and im in the area looking for a char broiled taste.they've got a refrigerator in the back, a cooler with pop which you can grab a soda from with a meal. my boyfriend got a gyro meal with fries and a pop for about 7 bucks. not a bad deal for all the food he got. They do have a spit which they cook their meat on which is cool but when we came around 1am they were cleaning the spit and reheated their meat. i tried it and had to chew a few times before i got any flavor out of it. i wasn't a big fan of how it tasted. however if you're between this place and susies and you want gyros that aren't of the microwavable kind, this place would be your best bet. i'm assuming fresh, the gyros are better.they also have mexican food, breakfast food, skillets, and things of that nature. the two guys behind the counter were nice and quiet. eat in and they have a row of booths or take out and enjoy your meal at home. either way if you're in the area late night it's maybe worth a go for you.

6.description: I love when I am on this side of town. The Gyro's are amazing here! The staff is great and it is a very clean facility. I bring my family hear all the time, and I recommend you do as well!

3.description: Great selection. All sorts of fun stuff. Lots of Halloween costumes and decorations and a zillion different themes for kids birthday parties. I, for one, needed camouflage napkins for a "bootcamp" themed field trip with my fitness class. They had 'em. They also had army temporary tattoos which, of course, I had to buy and make everyone in the class put on! Workers Carlos, Shannon and Christie were very personable and helpful and made sure I found all my army-themed stuff without a hitch! One of the few party places in my area (Rogers Park). Glad it's here!

1.description: I wanted to order balloons for a birthday party I had and I figured it would be easier if i called and place the order. Because a month ago I went there and they said i couldn't get balloons because they had to many orders. Ok so I called to make a order but they do not answer the phones I called over 10 times it picks up tells me the hours they are opened and says for further assistance stay on the line..... Well I do and still nothing and the phone hangs up. Really frustrating!!!

2.description: Great for pretty much any special occasion or even for no special reason type of party.We found some really nice wedding decorations and favors.Always find lots of fun New Years' Eve party favors and decorations.They have decorations for Hawaiian Luau, graduations, over the hill, you think it, they probably have it.Lots of greeting cards and gift bags even costumes. Pretty much anything that you may be looking for to help you celebrate your fun day. Prices are pretty reasonable.

0.description: This location much cleaner and more organized than the Western Avenue store.  I can actually visit this location without breaking out in hives.All your party needs, from balloons, to candy, to Chinese plastic toys you didn't even know you needed purveyed by a friendly staff.

4.description: I had the "WORST" customer service experience with your Lincoln Village store from 2 separate employees. I had an on-line purchase that came but was damaged... I called customer service and was told that I would have someone call me back within 24 hours, never happened. By the time I realized this it was 5 minutes before the corporate office closed, i got through and received a 25% discount on my purchase and 3 stores that might still have my costume. Two stores were a bust but the third "LINCOLN VILLAGE" said they could not help me without the costume number which I didn't have because it was an on-line order, even tho the other two stores could help me. I asked him to hold on while I looked on-line and he said no call back, I call back within one minute and was told they would not help me at all to come into the store, I tried to explain that they were 1 hour away could they please look and they said nope cant help you sorry goodbye... really... I guess that was their take on great customer Service's disappointed:(

1.description: Thanks for the "NOT" towel... Lisa. Ugh, getting a hair cut here was awful.

9.description: Walked in and said long on the top short on the sides and they did a great job.  I never give my name or phone number and they curious but cool about that.  I'll be back.

12.description: Neat and clean place with a friendly staff. It's the only place I go for my haircut. See Aaliyah she's the best stylist I've ever had. Highly recommended.

21.description: Many many years ago this was a business I'd frequent for my hair cuts and each time the stylist was different as was the cut.  If I put a percentage to my appreciation of the cuts we'd be at a 50% of the time, rating.  It's hit or miss and probably a best place for little kids with too much hair or old dudes with thin hair and no care for their  looks.  Can you tell I'm not a big fan of Supercuts and I've tried many more locations than just this one, but I feel prompted to write something about this one.  Your hair is important and whether you're in High School or older; people are looking so it needs to be maintained.  Properly.  Best advice, find one stylist you like and stick with'em.  Don't be shy about asking for them by name and if they aren't there, you really shouldn't risk it.  I tried others a number of times and every time without fail it came out ugly.  Each cut comes with its own "warranty", so one could return a few days later and ask a different stylist to try and fix it.

16.description: Although I used to be a huge fan of Snippets, my family switched over to Supercuts a few years ago. We used to go to the Portage Park location, but it allegedly lost its lease. I've never gotten a *bad* cut at either location and whenever Dianna cut my hair, I got some really great, complimented-by-friends cuts. Sadly, Dianna has left Supercuts after having a child, so she is no longer available. But as other Yelpers have pointed out, there are some stylists at Supercuts who are just as good. And really, for $14, my expectations for cuts are generally pretty low. Admittedly, I have a hate-hate relationship with my hair and am not a huge beauty buff, so spending a lot of money on a haircut is not a huge priority for me. I've never gotten a hack job at Supercuts; I can't say the same for some salons I've tried over the years. And it's not like the folks at those nicer salons spend more time or more product on me: whether I get my hair cut at Renesscence or Twisted Scissors or Supercuts, it takes about 40 minutes total. Outside of Dianna, I can't remember anyone else's name, but I choose the Latino ladies from the Portage Park store when possible. I avoid the Asian guy for my kids as I don't think he does great work with superfine white people hair. The Polish blonde lady gave my 4-year-old a great trim when we were there 2 weeks ago. At that time, my daughter's stylist also gave her a great cut - a graduated bob with a little bit of layering in the back for bounce. She's been getting compliments ever since. For my family, Supercuts is a one-stop shop. We use the frequent-customer card to earn a free cut every few months, and although we've never called ahead to get on the list, the wait is generally reasonable at the times and days we visit. Everyone is friendly, the waiting area is clean and neat, and the staff has always been patient with my children's requests to sit on my lap in the chair, for a shorter cut or for a bit of styling gel at the end. They also always give each of my children a dum-dum lollipop at the end. I'm a fan of this Supercuts!

17.description: Expect that the stylists at this Supercuts will:1) NOT follow your instructions2) NOT make do what they tell you they'll do3) NOT have any good suggestionsWhat you can be certain of is that they will push products (conditioner, volumizers, etc., etc.) while paying absolutely no attention to what they are doing.

10.description: Worst haircut and highlight of my life.  I needed a quick haircut on a Saturday and made the mistake of going here instead of making the drive to my usual place.  I first started to worry when another stylist was quickly trying to teach mine HOW to do highlights.  I explained I wanted brown tone highlights to go with my dark brown hair.  An hour and half later, I look in the mirror and see white stripes!  The other stylist yells "you didn't use toner???!"  To which she gives a puzzled look like what's toner? The other lady frantically throws a book at me and asks what color I want, then yells instructions for mixing toner.  Ten minutes later I look in mirror again and see the white stripes still there but now I notice they are only on the top of my head and dark brown hair all along sides.  I point out how ridiculous it looks and stylist says "that's how it's supposed to look".  I've had highlights done for 15 years and NEVER had this.  The other lady sees this and says she can fix no problem.  Add another 45 minutes and a shampoo .  The lady doesn't use toner again!!  I ask about it and she says "you don't need it!"  I overhear the one lady tell my stylist "don't do highlights anymore".  They still charge me.  I get home, dry my hair, and to my horror see 3 different color highlights, in stripes.  I run to CvS and buy dye to cover up the mess of a zebra on my head.  Do not go here.  I won't even get in to the haircut.

5.description: Sarah is an excellent hard working stylist and over years she has always done a great job for me. She is personable and caring.  I always return. Reasonable price and good location.

11.description: It's clean and neat, and diverse ,when I need  my ends clipped this where I go

22.description: I'm not fussy when it comes to my hair and I'm not looking to get pampered when it's time for a cut.  I've been going to this location for a while now.  The people are always nice and Violet always does a great job with my hair.  No complaints here.

0.description: I've been coming here for a few years now and I was lucky to get Sarah as my stylist.  I've been going to her ever since!  She is great and does an amazing job everytime.

I've never gotten a *bad* cut at either location and whenever Dianna cut my hair, I got some really great, complimented-by-friends cuts. They also always give each of my children a dum-dum lollipop at the end. I'm a fan of this Supercuts!

19.description: Many many years ago this was a business I'd frequent for my hair cuts and each time the stylist was different as was the cut.  If I put a percentage to my appreciation of the cuts we'd be at a 50% of the time, rating.  It's hit or miss and probably a best place for little kids with too much hair or old dudes with thin hair and no care for their  looks.  Can you tell I'm not a big fan of Supercuts and I've tried many more locations than just this one, but I feel prompted to write something about this one.  Your hair is important and whether you're in High School or older; people are looking so it needs to be maintained.  Properly.  Best advice, find one stylist you like and stick with'em.  Don't be shy about asking for them by name and if they aren't there, you really shouldn't risk it.  I tried others a number of times and every time without fail it came out ugly.  Each cut comes with its own "warranty", so one could return a few days later and ask a different stylist to try and fix it.

2.description: Awesome service!  I came in to this supercuts today for a trim and was a little skeptical about coming in because of a previous experience elsewhere.  I originally asked for Gloria,  but she was not there.  So my stylist was Dee. She was amazing and though it wasn't easy,  she managed to cut my hair exactly how I wanted it.  My ends were horrendous but I wanted to save as much hair as I could. See managed to do so  and my hair feels great!  I will definitely be back to see her soon! Maybe I'll have her touch up my purple too

18.description: Natalina - thank you!  First you're smile calmed my nerves. Haven't had a cut in 10months and was tired of putting my hair up in a bun. I said i wanted my hair chopped but with long layers. Yes - i did say the word Chopped, but i guess i should have said, cut up til ends hit my shoulderblade. Well, i tend to be a yapper especially if i'm with someone one on one and she is such a sweet gal. Then it was over and she literally chopped my hair but the layers are soo beautiful! Good bye hairclips (for now). Natalina - you are the QWAN of Layers... I'm keeping your card close to my heart..

13.description: This is my regular stop for haircuts. I always get a fine haircut and fast, friendly service. The stylists treat my daughters like princesses when I bring them in for haircuts, too.I'm subtracting one star because my eldest daughter sometimes gets stylists who seem to have trouble cutting her hair the way she wants. I wish I could take off only half a star for that, though, because she's never been disappointed enough to stop coming back.

4.description: GLORIA IS NOT GONE.  I REPEAT, GLORIA IS **STILL AT THIS LOCATION**Sooooooooooo,Whoever the person was, who works(ed) @ this location and who told me that Gloria had move to another location on S. Archer Street (yes, there's a S.C. located there) is a HUGE and JEALOUS A-HOLE.  Why would a stylist do such a thing?  Perhaps because Gloria is an amazing artist w/hair and has a wonderful and dedicated following?  Likely.Anyhow, GLORIA IS NOT AND WAS NEVER GONE.5 Stars for her.  Lisa is pretty great too.  I hope they find out who is telling dedicated customers this load a malarkey -- fire their butt!

6.description: Gloria is the best hair stylist ever! My boyfriend checked in to get a hair cut. He was nervous at first because many stylist had ruin his hair. Gloria gave my boyfriend the exact haircut he wanted. We loved the result. Good pricing to. Definitely recommend this place.

15.description: Big changes here.  The entire old staff has left, it appears that the franchise store that was at Lincoln and Peterson took over here.  Thank God I was able to find Don, the old manager here.  He's now at the Supercuts at Algonquin Road and Lee Street in Des Plaines.  It's another fifteen minutes to get there but worth the drive.

7.description: Had the worst hair cut-EVER! Got home and saw that my hair was chopped-the stylist's version of giving my straight hair  a "fuller look". I've had layered in the past and it never, ever, looked hacked & chopped. My spouse & friends commented on how bad the cut was. I am now at month 3 post chop, and can have a real stylist attend to my head to clean up the wreck.Wish I could remember the name of the woman who assaulted my hair. I do remember her having what sounded like a deep smokers cough & was/is an older woman.Hope this helps. Stick to a simple trim if you must go here.

8.description: We all get our haircut at this location. It is close, it is cheap and at least for me, with my super straight, baby fine hair, which I keep short, I am not overly fussy. I go in every six weeks, get weed whacked and leave happy enough, so it's all ok.If you are a fuss butt, this is not the place for you. If you pay more to get your dog washed and cut than you do for yourself, Supercuts is just fine.

3.description: Got my hair cut there today from a lady named Dian she f****d up my cut, I told her nicely it was ok I don't think I will be back though, she was daydreaming while cutting my hair, I told her one way she does the other, SMH

14.description: Maria, Vanya and Micaela do great work.Everyone else is crap. I feel like these ladies just need to retire already because their age is showing through their hair cuts. I feel like they dont listen, or are hard of hearing, or can't see or glacoma is kicking in, because you never get what you ask for and to worst thing a girl can as for is having their hair cut too short!  I hate when that happens. . .If supercuts is what you like, find another one because this one is not it.Don't bother "calling ahead" because they feel that if you called ahead its ok for you to wait and will take other people in before you, not just one, maybe two or three so you have to spend your time sitting in that lobby for a half hour, really?

3.description: I purchased a deal on groupon, I was a little hesitant at first considering there wasn't much reviews to base the business on. But I'm so happy I tried it. I had to reschedule one day due to heavy traffic and they were so understanding!I'm a first time customer and Olivia blew me away. She was super welcoming and friendly she knew what she was doing and she fixed my hair. She was an absolute sweetheart! I will definitely be coming back.

1.description: So, just a word of warning to all my younger Yelp Female Friends..As you grow older your hair changes too, It gets thinner with time,and you lose more hair as well.. See what you all have to look forward to?So, it is very important to find a salon/stylist that understands the issueswe may have with our hair, because I'm sure we have all had a bad cutthat we hated at one time in our lives.Just want to say that before today I had never been to Taylor Hair Dezign,and, honestly, wasn't sure what I might be walking in to..Well, I have nothing to say but positive things about Taylor Hair Dezignand it's staff.I called for an appointment 2 days ago, and I stated that I had a Groupon Dealfor a deep conditioning treatment, cut and style.I got an appointment for today at 1:30pm and I was taken right away,no  waiting, greeted very kindly by staff as well.So, I met Rana, who is a lovely young woman who shampooed my hair,and then put on the deep conditioner, which I really needed by the way!I sat under the dryer for a bit and then Rana asked me how I would likemy hair to be cut/styled and I explained that I basically wanted to keepthe length and I wanted some layers.Rana did a lovely job, got rid of all my dead ends, and I was quite pleasedand it looked really nice until I stepped back outside into that killer windand it messed up my new do..So, okay, I was a little crabby/grumpy because that stupid wind messedup my hair but hey.. things could always be worse!So, in ending, I definitely recommend Taylor Hair Dezign if you are inneed of a Hair Doctor/Fixer Upper..They are located on Foster Avenue, about a block East of Kimball.And, for Gods Sake, Go buy the Groupon! It's a Great Deal Truly..Taylor Hair Dezign is a great place,So glad I was stalking Groupon and found it!And what a great find it was..:)

0.description: Being a customer for over 20Years, won't go anywhere else, won't even consider anywhere else, enough saidGive them a try you won't regret

2.description: I made an appointment after buying their Groupon.There was a diverse mix of people in there on a busy Saturday- all races, ages, men and women. Rana washed, styled, and cut my hair, and she did an outstanding job. I will absolutely return.

5.description: HORRIBLE PLACE! I do not recommend it. The owner does not know how to cutt hair. She messed up my hair. It wasn't even! Botha sides of my hair are different lengths! She does not know what she is doing. She cutt my hair literally in 10 min. She didn't even measure it and talks the whole time. I am never going there again not recommending it. She needs to go back to school and learn! I don't know how the north park students do it. I don't let anyone cutt my hair and I don't know what I trusted that place. Only bc it has a groupon special. Biggest mistake of my life and when she did my nails my toes nails were not filed correct. They were all wavy and too SHORT! I'm not trying to get fungus. I regret this place so much! :( now I am sad bc my hair isn't long anymore and now I have to wait untill it GROWS! and have it cutt professionally. I paid this lady $43 for A SHITTY JOB.

6.description: Great neighborhood spot! It's a hidden Gem. They do everything... hair, nails, eyebrows etc.. Love the hand Rasmia has with color!!! Prices are great!

7.description: I needed a keratin treatment really bad, and my curtain stylist wanted to charge me outrage price and said it was because I had lots of hair and very long. I have thick hair but not that thick and not long at all. My sister recommended this place to me and told me to see the owner who has always done her hair. I had my daughters wedding coming up and decided I needed to really get my hair in shape and boy did I. I did the keratin treatment and went back a few weeks later for color and highlights and I was so pleased with the way my hair felt and looked. The best part about it was that Rasmia and staff were so nice and everyone talked to each other. I'm usually nervous about going to new places and don't talk much however this experience was the complete opposite. I LOVE this place. I have now been there for touch up, color, treatment for split ends, eyebrows, haircut and I will continue to go Taylor Hair Dezign. Price is very reasonable and she really does great work.

8.description: I really enjoyed getting my hair cut and treated at Taylor Hair Dezigns.  I live not far and go to school in the neighborhood, so the student discount was a plus.  The staff was also very friend and personable.  The haircut I got was great and I plan on getting many more services at THD.

9.description: I'm a loyal Taylor Hair Dezign Customer!!I've been going to this place for over 20 years now.  When I was a little girl, my mother and I met one of the hairstylists for a wedding, and she gave us her card.  I've been going there ever since.Growing up, I've gotten haircuts at other salons (and even Supercuts which was a NIGHTMARE).  So, after many many MANY experiences at other places, I finally realized that nobody can be as good as the stylists at Taylor Hair Dezign.I've gotten my hair done for all my dances, formals, proms, etc., and they have ALWAYS done my hair EXACTLY how I wanted it.  All I had to do was bring them a picture.  All my haircuts and hair coloring have been done EXACTLY how I like them.Six years ago, I moved to New York, and there are so many different salons here that it makes me nervous.  For my first 5 years here, I'd only get my hair done at Taylor Hair Dezign when I visit my family & friends in Chicago about twice a year.  This past year has been a bit difficult for me, so after some in-depth research, I got my haircut at a salon here in New York.  The stylist did an okay job, but I was a bit disappointed since she didn't do it exactly how I wanted it.  So, after that, I've decided that I will only get my haircut at Taylor Hair Dezign FROM NOW ON!!The place is really clean, and the women that work here are SO nice and absolutely phenomenal!  If you're getting a quick haircut, I'm sure you can get squeezed in.  However, if you're doing something extensive, coloring, curling, hairstyles, etc, make sure you make an appointment, and when you do, tell them what you plan on doing, so that they can book you with the right person and for a right time.  (Sometimes certain things would take a half hour, but some others could take 2 hours.)The prices are very reasonable for the quality of work that they do.Whenever somebody asks me where they should get their hair done, I ALWAYS recommend this place.  No matter if you're all the way out in the 'burbs, it's worth the trip!!

10.description: Looking for a reasonably-priced hair stylist in the neighborhood, my mother-in-law recommended Taylor Hair Dezign.  She has been taking her sons to this local for a decade, now, for their hair cuts.I called on a Saturday to get an appointment, and they booked me for that afternoon!  I was thrilled!  As soon as I walked in the door, I was serviced immediately.Rasmia was my hair stylist, and she gave me exactly the type of cut I wanted...did not cut too much of my long hair off! :)  She also did not jabber uncontrollably, but she showed interest in my life/work.My husband loved the cut, especially since she straightened my normally crazy-curly locks. The price for the cut was only $30 - quite a bit less than the steep $150 I paid in Lincoln Park.Again, I had the chance to support my local businesses - woohoo!

4.description: If I could, it would be zero stars. Got a groupon for my daughter for cut, deep conditioning and style. They washed her hair and cut off a couple of inches and put in long layers. The back of her hair is totally uneven - I will be taking her elsewhere to get it fixed. The kicker? My kid left there with her hair soaking wet - they said she should let it 'air dry'. I called to ask why they didn't style it, and she said that she did style it. Listen sister, I don't know what you call styling, but I hardly call letting one's hair 'air dry' styling it. I'm sure the reason why they didn't blow dry it is because my girl has thick curly hair, and it likely would've taken them about 20 -30 mins to blow it all straight. Unbelievable. Absolutely horrible, do not patronize.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

1.description: Worst experience. They heated up someone else's bread, ordered trader joe hummus, hookah was made by a 2 year old, management doesn't know how to please customers, pandora would've been better entertainment than this and I'm wasting time writing his review than enjoying my time here. Enough said. A true Arab wouldn't come back, otherwise good luck

9.description: I got online delivery from this place. It took 45 minutes between the time I ordered and received my food. I had ordered the shawarma and the shawarma platter. The food is relatively good but not spectacular in any sense. The portions are awesome! They really dont hold back in the amount of meat they give you which is a huge plus. The prices are reasonable.

12.description: Overall, wonderful experience: tasty food, very fairly priced, great service. There's always a crowd. The environment is perfect: friendly and inviting. The venue itself is clean and spacious. Entertainment is brilliant. Awesome place for a night out.Would recommend to anyone and everyone.

21.description: Had the best time at Dandana! We got to the restaurant around 9PM and it was completely empty, but when we asked to be seated the host informed us that all of the tables were reserved. We were a little confused and decided to take a seat at the bar.  Sure enough, the crowed started pouring in around 10PM.  A live band started playing and then a couple belly dancers got on stage. We ordered an apple flavored hookah and sat back and watched the performance.  After a couple of small appetizers and drinks, we decided to join the crowed and dance.  It was so much fun! I cannot wait to go back!
