16.description: I went here last night and what a blast!  They are having monthly parties on Sundays with students, teachers and pros of belly dance and it was really fun!  The food is amazing, I had the kifteh kebabs and rice with baba ghanoush.  So delicious.  The place is very clean, well decorated and classy.  I really like this place, happy they are doing such fun things.

17.description: Entertainment is AMAZING!! Great group of singers rounded up the night I came here. Belly dancers kick butt! The dancers put so much beauty and entertainment to their performance it makes me want to get up and Dance and I don't even dance .The atmosphere is nice and I love the huge pictures of the classic middle-astern entertainers throughout. Good hookah and service is decent.

10.description: Ordered delivery from this place and it took an two hours to arrive. I was very grumpy at this point but the food was still decent. Maybe I'll try going to the restaurant but I doubt it.

5.description: This place blows so bad. The singers suck, service sucks, food sucks, trashy crowd. julianas, Rozana, milos, Alhambra is better, any place but here. Too bad its a nice looking place but garbage everything else. Everything needs to change if they want to make it in this competitive nightclub business

11.description: tip: this place is terrible. A group of us came here to try it out. We called in advance to see if there were any charges such as corking fees for byob or a per person charge. We were told no. Come time we receive our bill, there is a $10 per person charge, a double charge for food we ordered, and an 18% gratuity included for our party of 3. There was no notification or reference to such charges posted anywhere in the establishment nor menus. When I spoke to the owner, I was berated and told I know nothing about the "restaurant industry" which isnt the case. After back and forth arguing, we just paid and left. The experience was exacerbating and I am shaking in anger.

22.description: Love this place! Amazing mint tea, great hummus, some of the best hookah I've ever had! We'll definitely be back!

0.description: Dandana has great food, various hookah flavors, and great ambiance.The place was full on a Friday night, and the crowd was diverse and appropriately dressed up. The music was lively, with guests line-dancing and belly dancing. Music continued all throughout the night!Lots of great looking people frequent this spot, and is worth lounging at. It appeared as though the average group size was 6; however, there were larger and smaller groups all around.

20.description: Entertainment is AMAZING!! Great group of singers rounded up the night I came here. Belly dancers kick butt! The dancers put so much beauty and entertainment to their performance it makes me want to get up and Dance and I don't even dance .The atmosphere is nice and I love the huge pictures of the classic middle-astern entertainers throughout. Good hookah and service is decent.

19.description: The place was good. They catered an event for me.

2.description: Waste of time!  The food was dry, The service was below average, and the entertainment was awful.. They played the same type of music most of the time.. I left with a bad headache.  Stay away.

18.description: Wow, the place isn't the same as it was before. Takes super long to get hookahs, entertainment was mediocre and got boring, overpriced for what it was, and there was some sort of fight between customers, luckily they kicked the people out, but still... Ill just stick to Alhambra.

13.description: The food is barely mediocre.  Go elsewhere for mediterranean food.

4.description: I'm giving them 2 stars because it says 2 stars is a "Meh. I've experienced better" which is exactly how I felt when I was eating this food. I'm not sure if the owners are Arab, but the food tastes more Indian than it does Arab.The first time I ordered from here I had the chicken shawerma platter (came with rice and a salad), and beef shawerma wrap. the chicken shawerma platter was too heavily spiced I couldn't even taste the chicken, and the rice was heavily spiced and flavored as well and it just did not go well together at all. I think maybe a white rice with such a flavorful chicken would be better, or maybe mellowing them both out might be a better solution. Either way, it didn't make me feel like I was enjoying the meal and I didn't exactly feel like I hated it. It was meh. When I tried the beef shawerma sandwich first thing I did after the first bite was take out the beef from the sandwich because that tasted SO GOOD, and the cucumbers just did not go well at all in the wrap. At all. The second time I ordered, I decided to get the beef shawerma plate because I figured the meat would be as good as it was the time before. Wrong. It was OK, and still heavily spiced. Meat arent supposed to be SOOO heavy on the flavor, I'm supposed to be able to enjoy the actual meat and this just did not perform. the french fries were beast though. I'm literally going to go back for french fries because omg so delicious. I feel bad giving a bad review like this, but I just paid $30 for a meal that I left on my table and cant bother finishing because it wasn't good, and I had expected good food given all the positive reviews on this page. I didn't think I should give anything over two stars for being so disappointed for the second time in a row. I don't think I'm going to rule out going here in the future and they're definitely still an option for me, but minor changes like this need to be made. This did not taste like shawerma. Not the first time. Not the second time. And i've had a wide range of shawerma experiences and this just did not come close to being the actual thing. If i order from here in the future and it tastes better then I will update my rating with a more positive review but otherwise it stands.

6.description: I went to Dandana last night to celebrate my birthday; it was my second time there. I had gone there last year for my Uncle's birthday and enjoyed it, so I decided to have my birthday celebration there. I strongly suggest you make a reservation, especially if you have a large group. Saturday seems like the busiest night there. $10 cover charge for Friday and $15 or $20 for Saturday and $5 per person for BYOB. My group and I ordered a few plates of hummus with chicken and beef shawarma. I had the beef and it was very good (they said the chicken was good too). Their appetizers range from $8-11 and entrees averaged about $17-$25 from what I remember (worth the price). What I really like about this place is the live entertainment and hookah. Live entertainment fri-sun only. They don't have many hookah flavors, but they use Mya QT hookahs and they are good. From what I remember, they have watermelon, orange mint, and grape (orange mint is the best). The service was great and were often checked on in case we needed anything. I highly recommend this place for events. You will have a good time.

15.description: The Food & service was great, loved the atmosphere, also pricing was very reasonable. Definitely plan on going back soon.

7.description: Really nice place, if you come on a Friday or Saturday night when there's tons of entertainment! The food is okay, and there is hookah available. However, they have either a minimum or a cover...they keep changing it, so last I heard, it was a minimum (which is okay in my opinion), but if there's a cover now, I'd rather go to a location that is a bit larger.

8.description: Had the best time at Dandana! We got to the restaurant around 9PM and it was completely empty, but when we asked to be seated the host informed us that all of the tables were reserved. We were a little confused and decided to take a seat at the bar.  Sure enough, the crowed started pouring in around 10PM.  A live band started playing and then a couple belly dancers got on stage. We ordered an apple flavored hookah and sat back and watched the performance.  After a couple of small appetizers and drinks, we decided to join the crowed and dance.  It was so much fun! I cannot wait to go back!

3.description: I ordered a relatively simple delivery of hummus, a Caesar salad and a shawarma sandwich. After an hour and a half of waiting, I called the restaurant and was put on hold for 15 minutes. No one ever came to the phone to speak with me, but my food arrived while I was on hold so I hung up. This location is about a mile and a half away from my apartment, so I'm guessing the guy walked here... Slowly. After waiting almost two hours for lunch I was starving and the food wasn't something to write home about. The hummus was watery, the "classic" Caesar salad was nothing like a Classic Caesar, I don't even think it had Caesar dressing... And the sandwiches weren't very warm. Even my cat wouldn't eat it.Needless to say, I probably won't be ordering delivery from them again. There are better places in this neighborhood to get hummus and shawarma.

14.description: My friends took me to this resturant. I was very impressed, the service was awesome. the waitress and waiters were excellent and on point with everything! The  food here is amazing!! the place had live music and a clean environment. I had a great time and was glad my friends showed me this place. I will be coming back very soon.

1.description: So fast I freaked!!! Lol!!! Sub was ready at the same time the cashier was giving me my receipt. Literally  in and out in under a minute.

9.description: Yum!

12.description: I like this Jimmy Johns a lot. The delivery people are usually really nice and really speedy. Only once have they taken more than 10 minutes (my work is a 5 minute walk away ). I'll take off a star because they tend to fuck up every once in a while and put an assload of lettuce, add tomatoes or give me stale bread. While the bread was only stale once! They also saran wrap my drinks a little TOO much. It takes a few minutes to get that shit off my drinks. Oh well. As long as they are so close, I'll keep ordering.

21.description: I fly by here semi-regularly to pick up a sandwich on my way to work.  They are just as quick as advertised, and friendly too.  Unfortunately though, they either have a problem with accuracy, or with understanding what "everything" or "all" means.  Every time, I order a #6 minus the mayo, plus all the freebies.  And every time, I'm either missing the onions or missing the mustard or they have added the mayo.  And that makes me want to rate them a 2.5 (but rounding up, because my half stars are only in my head).

16.description: There is nothing unique about the food at this Jimmy John's - it's as good as any other Jimmy John's that you would eat at.What makes this Jimmy John's supernatural is the speed at which they deliver my food. Never in my life have I hit submit on an online order and then be surprised when the deliveryman shows up fifteen minutes after I clicked submit!Just to make sure it wasn't a fluke, I tried it again and to no surprise they were there in fifteen minutes flat once again! One thing though, do not try to order on Sundays right at 11:00am when they open because I tried that after a hungry hangover night and was dying for some food. Little did I know it would take me 1.5 hrs to get food since they had no driver! I don't mind this little lesson, because I can expect them to deliver my eats in 15 minutes flat.

17.description: There are two things I really look for at a Jimmy Johns: Beach Club and Cherry Coke. My Beach Club was as good as ever, but no Cherry Coke, so it was a little disappointing.Also, parking is street and you have to pay, but it is the only good sandwich place in this area.

10.description: It was a dark and stormy night... otherwise known as Chicago winter... These are the standard- nights when it it is dark outside, it's cold and I don't want to subject a deliveryman to that anymore than I want to go out. Even greasy burgers aren't enough to motivate me to slip and slide along the icy sidewalk!There are the weekends where I'd rather buy a sandwich than put aside the necessary chores and household tasks to make lunch.There are plenty more upscale places to dine, to takeout... Sometimes you are a lazy bum after being too busy, just want easy and fast without grease. Jimmy johns is bland even with salt and vinegar potato chips on the side. It is uninspired... but it is warp-speed fast, you know exactly what you are going to get and you can get it without grease.

5.description: The staff is super friendly here. Sandwiches are your normal JJ sandwich. The manager, chris, is super cute and funny. This location can get busy because its on college campus, but you still get your sandwich right away. For a quick lunch, its a great place to consider.

11.description: My NPU friends and I like to call this Jimmy John's "the diet of North Park" because it's the only food place that is *relatively* healthy and open late. Staff is super nice, and it's pretty much like any other Jimmy Johns you've ever been to. However, years of eating Jimmy Johns all over, I just discovered the wheat bread!!! It's amazing. I think they charge you extra but it's SO worth it.

22.description: This time last year the shop was always full of students, aged high school to college.  Even during dinner times, you could find more than a handful of customers.  Today there are hardly as many people, Jimmy John's has been known for having highly acceptable pricing on their sandwiches.  Due to our current economy that sub which was once $3.49, then $4.. is now $5.75!! Chicago tax on top of that, just makes you sick.  While this sub shop is so convenient to me, I don't even want to go back.  If I really need Jimmy John's I may just hit a suburban location to skip the tax.  But, I hear the rate increase has affected all locations.  Other than the price increase, I have no other complaints.  Well, on weeknights the college kids that work there play their own music selection.  Which is good, it connects with the customer base.  But there are times for Electro, it's not good at all times.  I don't think it promotes eating.

0.description: I like to come to the door wearing nothing but a towel, like in the commercial.  Ok sometimes I'm wearing boxers underneath. So far it's never fallen off but when it does I hope it's one of the hot delivery guys gets to see it..

20.description: There is nothing unique about the food at this Jimmy John's - it's as good as any other Jimmy John's that you would eat at.What makes this Jimmy John's supernatural is the speed at which they deliver my food. Never in my life have I hit submit on an online order and then be surprised when the deliveryman shows up fifteen minutes after I clicked submit!Just to make sure it wasn't a fluke, I tried it again and to no surprise they were there in fifteen minutes flat once again! One thing though, do not try to order on Sundays right at 11:00am when they open because I tried that after a hungry hangover night and was dying for some food. Little did I know it would take me 1.5 hrs to get food since they had no driver! I don't mind this little lesson, because I can expect them to deliver my eats in 15 minutes flat.

19.description: Fast 'n good.  Jimmy John's is great if you're looking for a tasty sandwich.  Something you need to keep in mind is that this place is merely a sandwich shop, aka a better version of Subway.  So if you're looking from something that will blow your mind, this isn't it.  But this is a great place you can get a great tasting sandwich, chips, and drink for under $10.  All of the ingredients are fresh and high quality, and the service here is fast, fun, and friendly.

2.description: I'd give them a zero star if I could. They deliver at my work which is literally 1 minute from my apt and they won't deliver at my apt. They told me to call their other location which told me to call them also. It's like a ping pong ball. I guess Jimmy Johns won't be getting my business anymore. And I'll make sure everyone at work won't either.

18.description: ordered lunch today and as advertised it arrived freaky fast!!food was good, delivery guy was friendly.good healthy choice , especially when you are short on timeThanksJimmy John

13.description: They deliver to my house...quickly.

4.description: Because "fast" is the cornerstone of the Jimmy John's brand, no one expects a delivery less than a mile away to take 55 minutes. We have always had friendly service and good sandwiches in person. We understand businesses get busy. Then it's on the business to say how long it will take. Forget delivery.

6.description: Freaky Fast Delivery is no joke! This location opens at 11:00 am.. I submitted my online order at 10:52 am... My sandwich was in my hand at 11:00 - 8 minutes. Food was yummy, only complaint is they forgot to cut the sandwich in 1/2...but really it got here so fast I can't complain about that!

15.description: So fast. I order from them and as soon as I hang up the phone, one of their hipsters are getting off their bike entering my store. They are really cool and friendly people.Food is always good - always consistent. Oh my, the bread is heaven.They lose a star because they tend to forget to put a straw in my bag a lot and over wrap my drink with saran wrap.  Womp Womp Womp.

7.description: Awesome sandwiches. I order from here pretty regularly. They always have a freaky fast delivery. The staff is very polite as well. My favorite is the tuna sandwich, it always feels so fresh & tasty. Great sandwiches !!!

8.description: Really one block outside your delivery area actually the same mall parking lot and you can't deliver a few doors down or even recomend a closer store. Not what I expect from you guys other locations have gone above and beyond but a few stores down you can't drive to?

3.description: Staff was super friendly and working hard but unfortunately the bread was absolutely stale. Made my lunch unbearable to eat

14.description: This time last year the shop was always full of students, aged high school to college.  Even during dinner times, you could find more than a handful of customers.  Today there are hardly as many people, Jimmy John's has been known for having highly acceptable pricing on their sandwiches.  Due to our current economy that sub which was once $3.49, then $4.. is now $5.75!! Chicago tax on top of that, just makes you sick.  While this sub shop is so convenient to me, I don't even want to go back.  If I really need Jimmy John's I may just hit a suburban location to skip the tax.  But, I hear the rate increase has affected all locations.  Other than the price increase, I have no other complaints.  Well, on weeknights the college kids that work there play their own music selection.  Which is good, it connects with the customer base.  But there are times for Electro, it's not good at all times.  I don't think it promotes eating.

58.description: The food here is a value for what you pay for.  I always leave stuffed and the Dolsot Bibimbap is made as expected, it hits the spot.I noticed that they serve non-Korean customers different sides, which makes me a little sad. I really love dried squid/fish banchan and every time I eat here I make a sad face that I'm not korean and I can't enjoy what the table next to me is eating.*shrug* that's expected from Korean restaurants, however. (Though pretty ***ed up)Buuut I'm still a regular here for lunch, I live close and the food is delicious. :)TIP:If you eat here for lunch, skip the lot parking and park on the side street.  80% of the time ****you will be boxed in****.  It's happened a few times.  Twice no one fessed up to move their car.  Luckily I live so close, I came back later.

56.description: Been going to this place for a long time. My parents like going here, my grandparents like going here. Despite whatever differences there could be over time, I feel like I can rely on this restaurant to be what I want out of Korean food. It's not trendy, it's just food, made from somebody's parents, for families who want to go out to eat (or at least it used to be primarily a family establishment). Let's get something straight folks, it's not really a bbq joint (I think bbq joints are played out and overpriced anyway). Go to the north suburbs for korean bbq.

29.description: Great place! I came during lunch time. They served a plate of fried fish and even purple/black rice with our order. Now that's what got me. Everything was plentiful and cheap!

42.description: I can honestly say the food here is better than any K-town restaurant I ever ate at in LA and the price is awesome. This isn't a "BBQ" place, which is maybe why I like it - (I don't get the big attraction to cooking your own food, plus your clothes stink from all the grill smoke)The Kalbi and Bulgogi are great and the menu has much more than BBQ dishes. You get a whole bunch of complementary food - fried fish, pancake, sometimes soup too. Customer service isn't bad, just not as existent. It's basically the owner and one server for the whole place. But they are extremely friendly.  Here's a tip: if you want your bill or to-go boxes, go to the register and they will come to you.

23.description: they have large menu from appetizer to entree.i tried several soup. It was very good. Now they serve kalbi too. Reasonable price, tasty and good service!

47.description: This is a "hole in a wall" place - yummy & less costly!  Appears to be family owned, decent seating, fast service.  We ordered the seafood pancake, kalbi dish & forgot the name of a yummy tofu soup with clams.  They gave complimentary dishes, aside from the sides that goes with your dinner, 2 small fried fish dish & a scallion pancake dish!  Everything was so yummy!!  There were still leftovers from my older male friend & myself - maybe we just don't have big stomaches?!? :p  I can't wait to go back, maybe tomorrow, try the popular Dolsot Bibimbop!

8.description: Friendly mom and pop run and attentive to its guests, authentic Korean restaurant. No frills, just good food. Can seat a large group if combining tables, but most comfortable at up to 6 guests per table. Fairly small interior. Very small private lot, shared with other retailers in strip of buildings. Street parking is also available.Haemul Pajun (seafood pancake), Japchae (clear glass stir fried noodles with vegetables/beef), MulNaengMyun (cold noodle soup with vegetables/beef), and their Bulgogi (thinly sliced, marinated rib eye) are all good. Good variety of banchan (side dishes).If you're lucky enough to take advantage, their lunch specials are a value.Best Seon-ji-Haejangguk soup.

31.description: People of Chicago must thank this owner for operating one of the best hole in the wall Korean restaurants! Chicago really lacks some good, authentic, and cheap Korean food. If you're hungry for some good Korean food...then you found the right place. I say this place could compete with the Korean restaurants in LA!

34.description: Hidden gem in Albany Park. They updated their menu with pictures and descriptions, so even if you don't much about Korean fare, this place is fool proof to order something yummy.

16.description: The service is terrible and their oxtail and knuckle soup both have zero flavor. They are generous with their banchan and they provide a greasy veggie pancake as an appetizer.

13.description: The owners of this restaurant are the cutest couple in the world with warm hearts. They make great home style authentic Korean foods here. They always serve fishes for side dishes with every meal. Their side dishes are huge with lot of different foods. The price is very reasonable with great healthy foods. I would give this restaurant 10 stars if I could. Highly recommend A+++

11.description: I'm moving here from Hawaii and met a nurse and her brother on Halloween. I asked them for a good Korean Restaurant and they said Ban Po Chung was the best, so I tried it. It rivals any Korean restaurant in Hawaii. This is a classic mom and pop restaurant with great food. 4 of us ordered Kalbi (marinated short ribs), Chopchae (vermicelli/glass noodles with veggies and thinly chopped beef) and dol sot bim bam bop (a crunchy rice base, veggies, and thinly sliced/chopped beef). The banchan (side dishes), veggie pancake, and fried fish were almost a meal in itself. If you've never had Korean food before, read the Yelp reviews...they will help you through the ordering process. Be patient when dining, it is a mom and pop that has food that seriously rivals any Korean restaurant in Hawaii.

39.description: As a Korean this place is pretty decent. Nothing special but nothing is terrible either. So far everything I tried this place is above average and my favorite is gal bi tang (short rib stew). I like how they give fish and Korean pancake as appetizer.Owners are nice and friendly. One thing I would wish to have is variety in side dishes rather than multiple kinds of kimchi.

37.description: I came here with my parents on a Sunday evening and there were a few occupied tables. I was craving some soup to warm me up and luckily there were plenty of choices. I opted for the kalbi tang, which was flavorful and rich. My parents decided to play it safe and ordered bulgolgi and bibimbap, which were pretty standard. In addition to the side dishes, we received complementary fried fish and Korean pancakes. The ahjumma also came over to refill our side dishes when she noticed we were running low. Overall, I would probably come back to try some of their other soups but I wouldn't make a special trip out here for any other menu items.FYI: This place is located in a small strip mall next to a laundromat and hookah bar.

0.description: TOTALLY LOVE.Reminds me of small restaurants in Korea.Simple and down to earth, all about good food.We had blood soup, Seon-Ji-Hae-Jang-Guk (beef soup with ox blood & vegetables), pan cake and some really good side dishes.Enjoyed them all.I'll be a regular.

38.description: Solid food, owned and operated by a really kind family. Generous with the pan chan. Had the seafood haemul pajeon and the beef short ribs; not extraordinary, but tasty nonetheless. Why waste $7 at McDonalds when you can get a much more satisfying meal here instead for not much more?

51.description: This is where you come for classic Han-sheek, Korean style home cooking! It's a hole-in-the-wall and the prices are low! Plus, they have lotsa bahnchan (sides) and give you extra "service" items for free like fried fish or vegetable pancakes!They have the best daenjang jigae in the whole city! And the service is superb. A warm grandma/pa couple run the place. Come here for some solid good Korean food and you want to get "ji-gae" with it! ^^ my favorite Korean place in Chicago this far, better than cho sun ok, darae jung, etc

27.description: Their radish kimchi is really good because it's well-fermented. It doesn't taste like rotten eggs or anything even though it's fermented. It tastes good. I like how they serve multigrain rice instead of white rice. The server was really kind as one of my guests wasn't eating the multigrain rice so she offered white rice instead. We went there on New Year's Day (a Thursday) around 2-3pm and they served us dinner portions... which was a lot of food (we didn't finish it all).The dinner portions must have come with grilled sardines(?) on the side. They also gave us free kimchi pancake as an appetizer. They gave us so much food. The broiled mackerel tastes really good with squeezed lemon juice on top. The bulgogi and kimchi jigae are on point, too.They let customers take their time, as they didn't give us our check until we asked for it. We were a table of 4 and we were talking after we finished eating. I like how they respect us taking our time that way. If you are in a rush, ask for your check directly instead of waiting for the servers to bring it to you.The restaurant is part of a small plaza with at most 10 parking spaces so find a good parking spot if you drive there.

32.description: This is my favorite place for my cousins, friends, and I to come for hot bowls of tasty korean stews/soups. For $10-$15 per head (depending on what you order), it comes with korean savory crispy pancakes, each person gets a little fried fish (sardine?), and tasty banchan.  BPJ does not offer as large of a variety in banchan as say, San Soo Gab San, but the quality of the ban chans are great! Soups are very flavorful, satisfying, and warming. The serving size of the soups are large and I can never finish because I am full from the free sides that come with the meal. I docked a star because the owners always seem to be more attentive towards Korean patrons and not so much to me. Huff.

54.description: Food is hot and fresh, 2 orders will fill up a table for four..:) delicious and priced so low....bottomless hot tea and appetizer.

48.description: I'm entirely impressed. Ban Po Jung is on my commute home, so I decided to kill some time and sop for dinner. It's deceivingly simple, nestled next to a laundromat but the dolsot bi bim bap is exactly what I've been craving since moving to Chicago.

44.description: Price is good. It seems to be authentic home style Korean. However they do not cook the BBQ at the table like OK Cho Sun.

24.description: i am no kimchi chigae connoisseur, but always love hot soup on a cold Chicago winter night.Bf and his brother thought this is one of the best chigae places in town. I enjoyed the chigae, and found it not as salty as other Korean places. Tried their soo-ju-boo, the flavour is different from other places. Not as spicy, and more garlic-ky :DLove this homey little joint in the neighbourhood.

7.description: Best authentic Korean food in Chicago!  If you dine in, you have complimentary appetizers (fried fish and veggie pancake) and of course ban chan.  The couple that runs the place are so sweet.  I live half a mile away, and I get take out at least once a week!  My favorites are yeuk ge jang and dwe ji bulgogi.  Is it fancy looking inside like Tozi or Jinju?  Nope.  But if you want solid food and friendly service, you should definitely check it out.

49.description: I'm giving it two stars only for the food. The food here is EXCELLENT. So if that's the only thing that matters to you, this is the place to go.Customer service. Wait, there's ZERO customer service. In fact, there's nothing called customer service there. Nobody speaks English. Nobody can educate you on the menu. You have to ask for everything, like water, silverware, napkins. The wait staff doesn't check in on you at all. There was a moment I was on the verge of entering the kitchen to get water because there was no server present in the room for a LONG time.I swear to God, I eenie-meenie-minie-mo'd on what I ordered because the non English speaking owner/waiter will NOT help me at any cost. He kept starring at me if I asked him any question about the menu. Seriously?!?! No wonder this place is always flocked by Korean families and students. He doesn't need to learn English! When we were done with our dinner, we waited another 15 minutes to get our check. My mom was about to get up and go into the kitchen to ask for a check. Luckily someone noticed me waving my hand and came up to our table. We still had to ask for our check. I told my husband, "You're seriously leaving a tip?" He said it was a must. That's fine, but if I would've been there by myself, I would've left 1 cent as tip to teach them a lesson!If I ever come back here, I'm bringing a Korean friend with me.

40.description: Price is good in the similar Korean restaurant. Clean and decent.

53.description: I'll keep it short. Really good food. Lots of side dishes. Good friendly service (albeit, it is Korean style, you have to wave them over when you need something but they are nice). Can't ask for much more from a Korean restaurant. Will be returning soon!

30.description: yes yes yes yes yesyesyesyesfavorite place in the city.don't expect anything more than amazing food.

46.description: Been here ten times or so in the past 2 years. It is our go to Korean restaurant in the Chicago area. Food and service are excellent. The selection of small appetizer plates is great and also includes a free scallion pancake. Our favorites are the stone pot bibimbap and la kalbi. We always leave very satisfied and usually have  leftovers!

1.description: My husband and I dined at Ban Po Chung last week. Food was good and NOT salty. The meal came with six banchan (side dishes) and two small fried fish (possibly corvina). The young female waitress was terrible. She sat down to eat her lunch, with her back toward the entire dining room, ignoring all the customers (4 tables). We were done eating, but the waitress was too busy eating and watching TV, and ignored us. Finally after 20 minutes, my husband went over and asked for the bill. For this one reason alone, I would never eat here again. When there is 1 waitress covering an entire dining room, you don't sit with your back to the customers ignoring them.Note: There are NO BBQ stations at this restaurant.

55.description: If you're looking for a delicious slice of home-cooked Korean food, this place is your destination. The restaurant offers a range of authentic Korean dishes, and while city restaurants can often climb into luxurious price ranges, Ban Po Jung is notable for its no-frills approach. Make no mistake, this is not a fine dining establishment, but its not supposed to be. The dining room is small and spartan, but the crammed nature of it only adds to the homey feel of the dining experience. Add a easy (and free!) nearby parking lot, not to mention the great food options, and Ban Po Jung will likely become one of those restaurants you visit (or order take-out from) at the end of long workdays when you don't feel like cooking for yourself.The food is also a great value. You can order a one-person entree (such as the delicious Bulgogi, a beef dish seasoned with a sweet soy sauce) for between $12 and $15. A range of free side dishes, like egg/potato pancakes and fried fish, will make sure you have plenty of food. You might even take some leftovers home! The restaurant also has a few "community" plate options that are big and delicious enough to be shared between (at least) two people. Those meals (such as Jeongol, a traditional Korean stew made with vegetables, seafood, beef, goat, etc.) are between $20 and $30.There's no liquor license at this restaurant, but the owners/waiters are generally pretty cool and will let you bring your own stuff in if you brown-bag it and keep it inconspicuous.

9.description: I used to pass this little gem because my dad once stayed at the Swedish Covenant Hospital on Foster and California.  It, however, has been over a year that I didn't even step to the front door.  As a Korean food lover, I had no excuse for any further delay.  I knew tonight was the night.  Hubby and I walked north to Foster.  It's located in proximity to the Northeastern Illinois University Foster campus.  That area is considered as North Park, but it's in the junction between Albany and North Park neighborhoods.  The location is super nondescript.  How about the interior?  It appeared to be cozy but the decor was simple.  It was a Friday night at 1930 hour, and almost all tables were full.  There were many Korean patrons, but there are non-Korean patrons who seemed to have a great time.  I was looking forward to this.  The service was friendly. We were quickly seated and given a menu.  The menu was helpful for non-Koreans because there were pictures to assist your decisions.  Hubby picked out a octopus dish with soybean paste, and I ordered the Kimchi jigae (soup).  After a few sips of the barley tea, the complimentary veggie pancakes and banchan were brought out to us, along with our entrees.  The pancakes were very delicious.  I had a bite of the octopus from my hubby's entree and it wasn't salty at all, unlike what other Korean restaurants would do due to an excessive amount of soy paste.  My kimchi jigae was soothing.  Since the temperature has been dropping recently, ordering the jigae was a good call.  Out of the banchan assortment we had, I was specially fond of the marinated zucchini and tofu skin.  Half way through our meal, one lady attempted to bring out some mackerel fish, yet we kindly declined it since we were pretty full.  I'm assuming it was part of banchan.  The reason why the full score couldn't been given was that hubby would like some more barley tea, but they appeared to be busy and didn't re-fill our tea.  Nevertheless, hubby should have been more pro-active in asking for it but he was never that way (I know him well).  I don't think they provided you the check; you had to pay at the counter.  The total was about $25 after tax and before tip.  I thought it was fair.  An average of price per entree per person is less than $10, but the seafood entrees naturally will cost more.  Overall, we had a pretty awesome dining experience.  The owners were very kind even though this was a busy evening for them.  Since this location is very convenient for us, less than 20-minute walking distance, we will be back for sure.

26.description: Very good always!!! My family came here on Monday night for dinner and the place was so busy but the foods still tasted good. I gave an excuse for the services attention. It's always a good place to dine in around this area.

25.description: This place is amazing. Our family loves Korean food and we dine here alot. The owners are so nice and make you feel welcomed.  Great food, prices are reasonable and they even let us bring our own beer in. Don't miss this little gem for the best Korean food in the city.

12.description: i am no kimchi chigae connoisseur, but always love hot soup on a cold Chicago winter night.Bf and his brother thought this is one of the best chigae places in town. I enjoyed the chigae, and found it not as salty as other Korean places. Tried their soo-ju-boo, the flavour is different from other places. Not as spicy, and more garlic-ky :DLove this homey little joint in the neighbourhood.

59.description: Great, filling, lots of free appetizers. Delicious and weird Korean talk shows on the big screen. Byob. And after, we went to Home Depot.

21.description: I came here with seven of my friends the other day. We ordered the sea food pancakes, pork belly, army soup, kalbi and bimbimbap. The food is okay and services are not that great. They do offer side dishes which are a plus.

17.description: We went here for my friends birthday. The friend said her friends went there and thought the food was good. First we ordered the seafood pancake. The batter was good but the seafood wasnt cooked.i ordered spicy cold broth noodles. One friend ordered bibibap and the other spicy kimchi pork siup. I didn't like the noodles. There wasn't enough sauce and it was mixed into the broth. I switched with my friend and the bibibap wasn't good. It had lettuce in it. The food was ok. The lady that worked there was judgemental. She looked at us like we were fat people.

10.description: Simple and homely food. I never rate a place for its ambience but it's the food that gets me to dedicate time to write a review.Ambience - 4/5. Compared to a lot of run down places who don't care about cleanliness.Food- 5/5 . Just love the simple home made Koran food.Staff - mom & pop feelIt's close to where to I live and is open at the odd hours I have my lunch. I have a huge addiction to the seafood pancake and have tried almost all places in California but this place here in Illinois is quiet something.

5.description: Amazing spot for authentic Korean food! They even had the TV on a Korean news channel the entire time! Good, quick service! They provide complementary appetizers consisting of a crispy fried fish (one per person in your party) and one veggie pancake. The pancake was a little oily but still delicious. The fish was a good, medium sized for an appetizer, excellent. We got 8 varieties of unlimited banchan, all fresh and yummy. My favorite were the picked daikon cubes, fish cakes, and potato salad. For main, we got the yuk gae jang (shredded beef with clear glass noodles), jae gu tang (cod soup with spicy veggies), soon dubu jjigae (traditional tofu soup), and galbi. Everything was absolutely delicious! I highly recommend the yuk gae jang and soon dubu jjigae. I've had better galbi before but no complaints about the ones here. The doing comes with perfectly cooked purple rice!Very happy about the meal here, definitely food coma inducing.

3.description: One of my favorite Korean restaurants. The food comes out in no time, very fresh. I love all the side dishes that you get. The owners of this place are very nice and welcoming. Parking can get a little crazy on the weekends. Try everything on the menu, it is all delicious!

35.description: On a rainy, slightly chilly mid october evening, a desire for korean soupy/stew overcame me. To my deep chagrin, some other korean places in the area seem to be closed on tuesday evenings, like a strange korean sabbath. But not Ban Po Jung! Having been here before and finding it pleasant enough, off we went again.To my chagrin (again), the parking lot is kind of small and the market blocks off some spaces for their own use (which is really lame, I'm going to give them a scathing review after I wrap up this one). Luckily there is nearby street parking, but I wanted super close parking because of the rain.My kimchi jigae was fantastic, with more pork than the usual places. The broth was also excellent. I dare say, this is the new best kimchi jigae in town. The flavor was very pure and the right amount of salty/umami/kimchi funk.The panchans are also all excellent. Extra bonus, they give you a veggie pancake and a small fried fish too. I knew about the fish and am not a huge fan of sea creatures, so I declined. But if you like it, I imagine it's a nice perk.So, if you are craving homestyle korean on a tuesday night, this might be the best option. Other nights, a pretty good option anyway. Does having the best kimchi jigae in town give you an automatic 5 stars? this is the dilemma I am faced with. Alas, perhaps to Ban Po Jung's chagrin, I'll give it 4 for now, as it's only my second visit ever. But I could see myself getting hit in the head one day, then waking up loving free fried fishes, and changing this review to a 5.

19.description: they have large menu from appetizer to entree.i tried several soup. It was very good. Now they serve kalbi too. Reasonable price, tasty and good service!

28.description: Very good food, and reasonably attentive service.  We had dumplings to start, and an order of dolsot bibimbap, as well as the cod stew.  Delicious!  Plentiful banchan, lovely tea to start.  The veggie pancake and the fried fish were a delightful starter!  Order wisely; you'll have plenty of leftovers after munching on all the little surprises they bring to the table.  Not the most gorgeous restaurant, but it was clean and efficient.

45.description: My favorite korean restaurant in Chicago. The quality of this place is good and the price is cheap.

33.description: I used to pass this little gem because my dad once stayed at the Swedish Covenant Hospital on Foster and California.  It, however, has been over a year that I didn't even step to the front door.  As a Korean food lover, I had no excuse for any further delay.  I knew tonight was the night.  Hubby and I walked north to Foster.  It's located in proximity to the Northeastern Illinois University Foster campus.  That area is considered as North Park, but it's in the junction between Albany and North Park neighborhoods.  The location is super nondescript.  How about the interior?  It appeared to be cozy but the decor was simple.  It was a Friday night at 1930 hour, and almost all tables were full.  There were many Korean patrons, but there are non-Korean patrons who seemed to have a great time.  I was looking forward to this.  The service was friendly. We were quickly seated and given a menu.  The menu was helpful for non-Koreans because there were pictures to assist your decisions.  Hubby picked out a octopus dish with soybean paste, and I ordered the Kimchi jigae (soup).  After a few sips of the barley tea, the complimentary veggie pancakes and banchan were brought out to us, along with our entrees.  The pancakes were very delicious.  I had a bite of the octopus from my hubby's entree and it wasn't salty at all, unlike what other Korean restaurants would do due to an excessive amount of soy paste.  My kimchi jigae was soothing.  Since the temperature has been dropping recently, ordering the jigae was a good call.  Out of the banchan assortment we had, I was specially fond of the marinated zucchini and tofu skin.  Half way through our meal, one lady attempted to bring out some mackerel fish, yet we kindly declined it since we were pretty full.  I'm assuming it was part of banchan.  The reason why the full score couldn't been given was that hubby would like some more barley tea, but they appeared to be busy and didn't re-fill our tea.  Nevertheless, hubby should have been more pro-active in asking for it but he was never that way (I know him well).  I don't think they provided you the check; you had to pay at the counter.  The total was about $25 after tax and before tip.  I thought it was fair.  An average of price per entree per person is less than $10, but the seafood entrees naturally will cost more.  Overall, we had a pretty awesome dining experience.  The owners were very kind even though this was a busy evening for them.  Since this location is very convenient for us, less than 20-minute walking distance, we will be back for sure.

43.description: The perfect place to dine on a cold snowy windy day!  They blast the heat in here so you'll warm up easily.  We came here because we wanted some tofu soup.  We also had the stone pot rice dish.  They have a good selection of banchan (those small plates served with your meal).  We also enjoyed the korean pancake.  Overall, thumbs up.  We will come here again when we crave  korean food.

2.description: I actually give zero stars. The owner tried to cheat my grandmother out of $10 when giving back change for the bill. She paid $40 for a meal that was roughly about $26 and he returned $3 with some change. She did not think anything of it as she normally wouldn't, because it's not too often that owners attempt to blindly rob their customers. When she realized it after we had already left, we went back and asked why he only returned about $4 when he was given $40. We demanded to see the receipt (because he never even gave us a copy) and while turning bright red, he gave her $10 right away, without apology or even looking for the receipt. I know we were naive and careless, but he undoubtedly tried to hustle us thinking he could scam 2 little Asian women. Aside from the owner being an ass hole, the suleongtang was EXTREMELY poorly made. You can tell they do not take the time to boil the bones correctly as you should - 72hrs, and at the least, 48hrs. Seriously, fuck this place. Do not support. Go elsewhere like Da Rae Jung where owners actually care about their customers.

18.description: This is thee place to go for kimchi jigae. Oh my God, it's amazing. They give good, fresh ban chan with the soup as well, which is a major bonus. My only complaint is that lately they skimp on how much they put in the containers - sometimes our soups are only half full. Bonus - they also are in a little strip mall that has a parking lot, but don't be surprised if you have to park illegally because all the spots are taken.

41.description: This is my favorite Korean place to go in Chicago. The food is awesome, service is good.

52.description: Great place and you get plenty of food. Like  everyone else has stated, there's no frills to this place.We tried the Korean seafood pancake, spicy tofu appetizer, kalbi, and the cow tail soup. Everything was good. We definitely return when we're in town and will have to try the Dolsot Bibimbop.

50.description: Burnt Bibimbap, cold soup, no fried fish (they usually serve this with dinner).Food is extremely salty. I used to go here and the food was good. The owners only seem to tend towards other Koreans as they think I don't know what good Korean food tastes like. I used to go here around two years ago. The service was good back then. After coming back from the UK I can't imagine what has happened to this place. Service has seriously declined.However if you're Korean, you're food will arrive piping hot, with all the food items included and you will not be ignored the entire time. Enjoy!

4.description: Santi and I drove across town to come to this Korean restaurant after finding it on Yelp. The aged interior was spacious, with tiled floors, tables, and posters of Korea arranged along the walls. The ambiance was casual and unassuming. It's a regular spot for local Koreans. The banchan items were delicious. It came with two sizable pieces grilled fish, Korean pancake, soup, sprouts, squash, spicy radish, kimchee, fish cake, potato salad, and spicy cucumber. All items were fresh, tasty, and addictive. The Do Ga Ni Tang ($11.95), or ox knuckle bone soup, came with bulky ox knuckles simmered in a delicious broth with noticeable bone flavor. The knuckles were meaty, tender and chewy around the bones. It was hearty, and perfect with a bowl of rice. The Dol Sot Bi Bim Bab ($9.95) came with mix veggies, egg, beef, and crispy rice. The rice was nicely charred at the bottom. The chewy, crispy, and firm textures nicely complemented with a scores of veggies, beef, and hot sauce. The addition of greens was oddly unexpected, but other it was delicious as well.Service was absent, but responsive once we have the server's attention. Overall, it was a pleasant discovery highlighted by fantastic selections of banchan and spot on homestyle entrees. I would be interested in returning to try their casseroles and veal soup.

6.description: Really homey mom and pops Korean restaurant. My family and I tried an assortment of dishes and most of them were really tasty. We got the Galbi, squid dish, bulgogi and one of the clear broth pork soups. The banchans were all very tasty and the food came out fresh and hot. The clear pork soup was probably the only downside to the meal since it wasn't very flavorful even after adding salt - it'd be a good soup to have if I was sick or had a sore throat. Galbi was super tender and bulgogi was nice though a bit sweet. Squid dish was surprisingly super flavorful and the most surprising dish of the night! The prices are all very reasonable and the owners are super nice. Can't wait to come here again to try more delicious food!++ They have a parking lot :) Woohoo!

22.description: One of my fave part korean spots (aside from Song Do). I love the kimchi jiggae (spicy kimchi soup with pork belly)! Huge portions even for the lunch specialsSome days they serve plain white rice, other days red bean. Lots of side dishes, and you get spicy miso soup if you order a non-soup entree. The korean woman who serves us is so sweet and always asks if we would like more sides.-1 star because the korean man (who I think is the owner?) is sometimes super grumpy.. and we always have to wait for a refill on our waters. But all in all, I love this place!

15.description: Their radish kimchi is really good because it's well-fermented. It doesn't taste like rotten eggs or anything even though it's fermented. It tastes good. I like how they serve multigrain rice instead of white rice. The server was really kind as one of my guests wasn't eating the multigrain rice so she offered white rice instead. We went there on New Year's Day (a Thursday) around 2-3pm and they served us dinner portions... which was a lot of food (we didn't finish it all).The dinner portions must have come with grilled sardines(?) on the side. They also gave us free kimchi pancake as an appetizer. They gave us so much food. The broiled mackerel tastes really good with squeezed lemon juice on top. The bulgogi and kimchi jigae are on point, too.They let customers take their time, as they didn't give us our check until we asked for it. We were a table of 4 and we were talking after we finished eating. I like how they respect us taking our time that way. If you are in a rush, ask for your check directly instead of waiting for the servers to bring it to you.The restaurant is part of a small plaza with at most 10 parking spaces so find a good parking spot if you drive there.

57.description: Home-style Korean eat-in, and I really mean homey, b/c for a second there I just had that feeling that you were in some Korean auntie's house, chilling, nibbling on whatever ban chan snacks that just happened to be around, competing for the TV (at first Korean soaps for the party of older ladies avidly watching while eating soup and then switched to K-pop when the older ladies left and were replaced by a larger youthful party) with the server having only a tenuous grasp of English, but comfortable enough to come over and coo at my friend's baby every so often, and seriously, where is the mahjong table because it would really fit. That kind of vibe. The food is good (everything from the kalbi, pork bbq and jap chae we ordered) and plentiful to boot when you factor in the free ban chan, soup and veggie scallion cake that appeared in record time. Good food, good pricing, good service, good vibes all around.

20.description: Best Korean restaurant I have ever been! They serve free pancake, kimchi, fried fish, soup and rice. We ordered BBQ pork and kimchi octopus. They are both really delicious! The service is also great! Strongly recommended!

36.description: I love coming here because this place is affordable and they give you a lot of things for free such as pancakes and fried fish. The service here is pretty good even though I am not Korean, which is pretty rare. They have a parking lot, but it is kinda small and spaces are tight, so I normally park in the streets. I tried bulgogi, kalbi, and soondubu and everything was pretty much really good. The bulgogi flavor is perfect, but it was just a bit dry to me. Otherwise, this dish would be perfect. The soondubu and kalbi were good as well and I will definitely get these again.

14.description: One of my fave part korean spots (aside from Song Do). I love the kimchi jiggae (spicy kimchi soup with pork belly)! Huge portions even for the lunch specialsSome days they serve plain white rice, other days red bean. Lots of side dishes, and you get spicy miso soup if you order a non-soup entree. The korean woman who serves us is so sweet and always asks if we would like more sides.-1 star because the korean man (who I think is the owner?) is sometimes super grumpy.. and we always have to wait for a refill on our waters. But all in all, I love this place!

29.description: Considering I've only had breakfast here, I do like this place. It's clean, food is delicious -- and it's clean. Some things that I could do without? Probably the oil on top of my rice -- i like garlic mixed into the friend rice, not just poured on top. I also like restaurants to be open at the time the sign says it will be so I don't have to wait 15 mins outside while the owners vacuum, set up the tables, etc. Aside from that, it's one of the cleaner Filipino restaurants I've been to -- and their tocino and krispy pata are delicious!

42.description: BEST TURON EVER! Not only was there some chocolate goodness fried in with the banana, but the outside was also topped with caramel sauce.  Um...hello?  Amazing.  (Turon is basically a deep fried banana wrapped in an eggroll/lumpia wrapper.)My parents took it upon themselves to order for the family, so they didn't choose to order any chicken.  (This is not surprising if you know my parents.)  However, my niece ordered a piece of chicken and really enjoyed it (namely, the skin). The kare-kare and inihaw na baboy were delicous...definitely the favorite items of the meal.  The lumpia was also good, especially if you live in the area and are looking for a quick lumpia fix!  Service was great, too!  I was pleasantly surprised and happy to see that our waitress was SUPER respectful of my parents (the typical treat your elders with respect treatment, ya know?).  The restaurant is spacious, clean, airy and bright (which is something that some other Filipino restaurants definitely lack).  It was pretty crowded on a Saturday night, so that was nice to see!I am definitely planning on making a return trip!  I'm already admittedly dreaming of that turon.  Yum!

23.description: Been here so many times , the chicken is outstanding!  The option of adding the batchoy is good since it serves as a appetizer.  But the lumpia shanghai along with the sauce as a appetizer are a great option as well . This place has the best  pancit palabok you can find anywhere hands down . For dessert you must try the turon which is a banana egg roll infused with chocolate perfection or the halo - halo which is a ice cream dessert with mixed fruit and ube flavored ice cream a taste of the Philippines here in Chicago

47.description: Went to this place this past Sunday 4/20/13 early afternoon and of course it's packed. Very impressive the place is full of hungry pinoys, missing the flavors from home. Looking forward for chicken inato, with garlic rice, and special batchoy, and its all a joke. Chicken inato breast is so small, no flavor at all, its a Cornish hen, and the garlic rice is steamed rice  garnished with garlic on top, drizzled with butter, lovely. We ordered batchoy & egg roll and they did bring it over till I asked for it, not even water,very poor service. The server asked us who brought our food and told him the gentlemen in red shirt, ( oh that's my boss)! Even the egg roll is all egg wrap, with tiny bit of meat inside. I will give this new restaurant at least a year, and will see what happened. The burned out customer will never be back, come in there and check it out for yourself, and post your review.

8.description: The bbq chicken here is a hit or miss. One day it's grilled to perfection and Juicy, the other it's dried up. Certain days they only have breast or wing .I'm glad they recently updated their menu and have more appetizers now.

31.description: This is one of the best Filipino restaurants I've found in Chicago. We got Julie as our waitress. She was so friendly.  This restaurant's specialty is grilled chicken and seafood. It's so great to be able to find authentic food with recipes from the Philippines. On Sunday, it can get pretty busy after church so it's a good idea to plan ahead. I would love to go on a Tuesday, but they are closed. Bacolod also has a pretty mixed crowd. Seating is never a problem because they have lots of space. I'm so impressed that I'm going to rent the space for my next birthday party.

34.description: I gave them an extra star because they had great customer service when I went with a group of four.  The food is authentic from the central island areas of the Philippines.  They gave good portions at a good price.  The Halo-halo was tasty too.  I want to go back and try the Kinilaw and Crispy-Pata.  They should start using organic meats.

16.description: I've been here plenty of times with my family and they never disappoint. This is what I consider as authentic Filipino food! The food is great,  and the owners are friendly. I usually stick with the same order, but I should try the rest of their menu.  Their drinks are pretty good too-- that's something I usually don't mind exploring Looking forward to visit this place in the near future c:

13.description: I came here for lunch with a large group today so I got to try a large portion of the menu. The highlights were kaldereta, beef sinigang, mini krispy pata, and halo halo. I would highly recommend trying those out. Everything else I thought were so-so. Overall, I think Isla Pilipina is better than Bacolod, especially the kare kare at Isla Philipina.

11.description: Awesome Filipino breakfast! It's cheap and filling. Though the plates look small, they are well worth it. It was a good move on their part to make breakfast all day.

39.description: We waited for about 45 minutes for our order to arrive.  The garlic rice is cold and does not taste garlicky at all.  The portion is small for the price.  The grilled pork is nothing special.  Their chicken is not juicy. It looks like it's been cooked for awhile before it was served.  Our halo-halo only has one small scoop of ice cream and not sweet to be a dessert.  We told the manager to get an extra sugar or ice cream.  We waited and waited and waited and it did not came.  What waste of time and money! I'm not coming back :-(

37.description: They totally improved their service, first time i came here, service was so poor, food took 45 to an hour wait considering adequate staff, didnt even refill our water, now food was served 15 to 30 minutes, food was good, i definitely come back

0.description: Boodle boodle dining is a fun concept. We were a group of 6. We came during lunchtime and made a reservation. When we arrived the place was pretty much empty and they gave us their full attention. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The food arrived hot, their was so much food. I have food allergies so I really wasn't able to enjoy the full dining experience but our group was happy. It was nice that they call to confirm and discussed food allergies.My family really enjoyed the pork, sausage, egg rolls, egg plant and fried fish.The place was pretty clean and not as cluttered and dark as some Filipino restaurants. The TV was on of course, fairly loud but not annoying. This place has so much more potential, would be nice if they build on it, redo the place and make it more aesthetic to the eye...

38.description: So good food...worth every penny! Superb halo halo. Thankfully they now have the choice of the combination for chicken bacolod and batchoy. I'm definitely coming back for more :)

51.description: Heard about this place through word of mouth and went to try it last Sun for lunch.  I've been waiting for a Chicken Inasal for a very long time and here it is.  The place is clean and tidy and off a good size if ever you wanted a party.  For the food I would grade  it 3 Star for now because they just had an opening.  The taste is ok, presentation is good, menu is confusing because there are some items are only serve as a lunch special and wasn't specified in the menu.  The biggest complain I have is that the food was serve cold.  I do understand that they are still adjusting so that's why I gave it a 3 Star.  They have to make sure the food is always served hot, especially the garlic rice.  I will be back a month from now and hopefully everything is perfect.  God Bless and more power to the owner.

27.description: I've only been here once, however, my whole FILIPINO family loved this place, including my mom- who was born and raised in BACOLOD! yes, my mom told me to write them a good review because she really liked the food. obviously, this is the real deal! that being said, i don't know if non-filipino people would like it here.  if you are not filipino i would stick to the grilled chicken, lumpia, pancit bihon, calderetta and crispy pata. these dishes are awesome, but nothing to weird, like deep fried pork intestines or a eating a baby chicken inside the egg. we had great service, now this might be because my mom said in tagalog that she was from bacolod. however, service was good and our food came out fast. there were maybe four other tables, but they seemed to be handling a 3/4 restaurant fine. for dessert we had the halo halo and a separate order of leche flan.  there was no talking when the halo halo came out. it was soooo good packed to the gills with ube and other sticky sweet island goodness. i have no idea why there is a mardi gras theme in the restaurant, however, the food is what is important! ignore the negative reviews. come here and eat some artery clogging, truly authentic filipino food.

32.description: authentically awesome central islands Filipino Cuisine.  Love the combo chicken inasal and  bachoy..... the halo-halo is to die for !!! lots of ingredients to tickle the palate ... excellent customer service....

48.description: The worst service I have ever had in a restaurant. Ever.  OK. Fine. I get it. Sometimes the restaurant gets busy. But it is no excuse when you see the ladies behind the counter chatting it up and ignoring all the tables. We finally order and it takes 45 minutes to an hour for us to get our food. The food is "Good" but seems expensive for this type of food and the portions are not large. The Inasal chicken is authentic Bacolod Chicken taste, the Crispy Pata was cooked perfectly. The Palabok was decent. However, be prepared to wait... and wait... and wait some more. And then you will wait again and wait and wait. It is as if they imported the food from the Philippines.  Then we wait another 45 minutes to an hour for our order of "Halo-Halo" dessert to arrive. It never arrived. They forget our order and ultimately forgot about us. We were just sitting there with a bunch of plates in front of us for an hour. Nobody goes to check on us.  I am there about to laugh on how bad the service is. There are a lot of workers there so I just do not get it at all. I finally got fed up and went up to the front to ask them to just give us the dessert to go and give us the bill.  Another few minutes pass and still no signs of them making the dessert.  I tell them to just cancel the order and ring me up.  The ambiance was tacky and the chairs were so uncomfortable.  If they expect me to wait for the food for 2 hours at least have something comfortable. I wouldn't go back here and don't recommend it either.

44.description: I love the Chicken Inasal and Batchoy.

24.description: If I could, I would give this place a solid 3.5. This is a decent sized place that looks very clean and inviting. My friend and I went to dinner here and came with our appetites in hand. I am not sure were ready for us. We arrived and were seated immediately.  A very open restaurant with plenty of seating. We ordered the lumpia shanghai, inihaw na Baboy (grilled marinated pork), Pork Belly Sisig, Caldereta (beef stew), and garlic fried rice. The lumpia was good and high suggest anyone to order that. The Inihaw na Baboy was a probably by favorite thing. It was served on a wooden board on a banana leaf with garlic fried rice and some julienned pickled dicon radishes.  The pork belly sisig was alright but it needed a little spice and with a little more crisp on it. Sizzling sisig  is a Filipino street food and would love for them to master that because it was almost there for me, almost. The Caldereta was a bit bland and the meat was still a bit on the tough side for me. Seeing that caldereta is a stew the meat should be fork tender. It lacked that sweet and developed flavor that I am used to. The Garlic fried rice was the perfect pairing to all my dishes. The service was OK but nothing out of the ordinary spectacular. I would have loved to see our waitress be more enthusiastic and make some suggestions.  So for a casual night out and if you are nearby, I would give this place a shot.

7.description: If I could, I would give this place a solid 3.5. This is a decent sized place that looks very clean and inviting. My friend and I went to dinner here and came with our appetites in hand. I am not sure were ready for us. We arrived and were seated immediately.  A very open restaurant with plenty of seating. We ordered the lumpia shanghai, inihaw na Baboy (grilled marinated pork), Pork Belly Sisig, Caldereta (beef stew), and garlic fried rice. The lumpia was good and high suggest anyone to order that. The Inihaw na Baboy was a probably by favorite thing. It was served on a wooden board on a banana leaf with garlic fried rice and some julienned pickled dicon radishes.  The pork belly sisig was alright but it needed a little spice and with a little more crisp on it. Sizzling sisig  is a Filipino street food and would love for them to master that because it was almost there for me, almost. The Caldereta was a bit bland and the meat was still a bit on the tough side for me. Seeing that caldereta is a stew the meat should be fork tender. It lacked that sweet and developed flavor that I am used to. The Garlic fried rice was the perfect pairing to all my dishes. The service was OK but nothing out of the ordinary spectacular. I would have loved to see our waitress be more enthusiastic and make some suggestions.  So for a casual night out and if you are nearby, I would give this place a shot.

49.description: Overall, disappointed :-(Ambience and feel: tacky. Chairs are old, and don't match. Mardigras theme? I don't get it.  The place needs ventilation. Prepare to smell like fried chicken when you leave this place. Service:  good. Friendly staffFood: menu has a short list. For this reason, i expect at least all the dishes to be made from scratch and from fresh ingredients. I was already put off when they were bringing out juice from the can. Appetizer- mini egg roll.  Tasteless. I have a hunch its bought and cooked frozen. The tempura vegetable was decent but nothing to be excited about. We  ordered palabok. The sauce was ok but the noodles was mushy. For the main entree, I ordered bangus belly had the chicken inasal thigh and drumstick. My fish was not completely deboned. The flavor was unremarkable. The mango salsa did not do much for the dish. The chicken lacked the inasal flavor. Size was smaller than what I expected. . Price point: we paid 40 dollars without the tip. A bit steep for the type of restaurant and food quality. Feel bad to write my first review especially for a filipino restaurant. The bright side is customer service was good. They should heed this review for what its worth. Suggestion: change the decor. Don't bring out the drink from cans. Work on the recipe for the dishes especially the chicken if they want to compete with other chicken joints. Re-evaluate their price point.

40.description: Nice airy space, big windows with lots of light, Iloilo and Bacolod festival decor, nice silverware and tiled tables, a big and clean mens' CR (restroom) - what a surprise. Since I'm OCD about cleanliness, these attributes all deserve 4 stars. The food was also served authentically on banana leaves and wooden plates. The place was crowded at lunch time in the middle of the week. My asawa had the paa (a rather small chicken leg and thigh) inasal special with the mini batchoy (she's from Iloilo so she has credible taste buds) and I had the pecho with garlic rice (a big chicken breast serving). The food, ambiance and decor were all fine, I believe they should increase the size of their servings to increase the value of the meal.

30.description: A solid 4 stars for Bacolod Chicken Haus.Service: It was full when we came in today during lunch. Nevertheless, the service wasn't lacking. Our waitress was attentive but didn't hover. Our glasses were never empty. She took our plates and bowls as soon as we were done. We didn't have to wait a long time for the food to come or for our table to be cleared. Food: I wasn't impressed with the chicken inasal. It was bland. It looked appetizing but I was sorely disappointed. Even with the atchara or the special sauce, it didn't taste good. :( The batchoy and pancit molo, on the other hand, were awesome! The pancit molo (similar to dumpling soup) had a lot of dumplings, so happy about that! My husband loved it as well. For $7, there were more than enough for 2 people. The batchoy was very good as well. Batchoy is a noodle soup made with liver, crushed pork rinds, chicken stock, beef, & noodles. It was garlicky, which I liked. It reminded me of home and that, I think, is the highest compliment I can give them.

46.description: Needs improvement...chicken inasal was dry andthe atsara that came with it was ok, i've tasted better.  The adobo rice is what it is, adobo with garlic rice on the side.  Ambience is typical for a Filipino resto but the food really needs to improve. The batchoy lacked flavor, i'm biased because i've tasted the best, Ted's Lapaz Batchoy.

1.description: I saw the restaurant featured on abc 7 and was curious to see what it was all about. I ordered the Paa House speciality combo. (Pronounced pah-ah) It came with Inasal (pronounced in-nah-sal), garlic rice and a mini batchoy (pronoucned bot-choy), which was grilled marinated chicken leg and thigh, with garlic butter rice, a pickled papaya salad, and mini noodle soup garnished with pork, liver, egg and pork rinds. I was very pleased with my selection and the service was very good. We had a party of 6 and they got our drinks and orders right away. They served the soup first and even asked us if we'd like more broth with our soup. Then they served us our meals and it was nice and hot! The chicken was flavorful, juicy and the skin was nice and crispy :) The only bad thing I would have to say is that the parking lot behind the restaurant is small and tight and if you park there it's hard to get out and you can get blocked in. Other than that I would definitely go back there again!! :)

9.description: Always leaves a smile on our oily lips!!! Best bbq chicken and great Desserts .. the banana rolls for dessert are just heaven .. this is where we go when we are homesick !!

26.description: I give it 4 stars for an authentic feel and choices of food. The chicken inasal is good. Not bad for a Filipino restaurant but it could be tastier. I love the atchara (pickled papaya) and garlic rice that came with the meal. The banana leaf on the plate made it more authentic. I had a small portion of the Batchoy but it's kinda bland. It's ok for me so you will have the freedom to add a little salt or soy sauce. You must order the halo halo. So good dessert. I will be back for sure to taste other food. 5 stars go to the service and the owner as he is ver friendly accommodating and approachable. I recommend this place.

25.description: If you like filipino food then this place will suit your taste.  Its not a dive and its not a fancy place, its family casual.  It was packed when we went there.   We paid for street parking but we didnt know that there was free parking in the rear.  Wtae ordered.  Grilled squid - goodpalabok - very goodtanigue steak - we could have skipped that, not so goodlumpia shanghai - good but how can you go wrong with a fried lumpiakare kare - this was very good but the sauce was not creamy like your typical Kare Karetanigue ceviche - okleche flan - it doesnt melt in your mouthchicken breast - okWe were a party of 3 adults and 1 child and we spent $91 and a lot of leftovers.

12.description: This place was pretty bad. The food tasted old and the service was HORRIBLE! You would wave them down and they still don't come. Pretty frustrating. A lot of times, I don't care if the services is bad, if the food is really good. But this place sucks. It seems that not a lot of people go here, so they might be cheap on the food, like they recycle it or something. I was pretty disappointed. The rice was definitely old and boarder line rotten. Like its been in the rice cooker for 3 days. SO gross!

21.description: batchoy very goodcrispy pata very goodchicken good. parking is ok. havent tried the other food

17.description: I enjoyed my experience but some food that we had could be better. The chicken was seasoned very well and was really good especially when paired with the atchara (pickled green papaya). The crispy pata was great and has a generous portion of the meat. Its also nice that its off the bone. The tocino taste great and the best so far. The tocino is homemade. It could be expensive if you buy it to cooke later at home. The molo is not good and is missing the authentic molo taste. The batchoy is descent and could use a little more salt for my taste. The pancit bihon and palabok where just ok, both could use some fish sauce and some calamansi. The bangus belly was great with the mangi salsa. I wish they would offer the salsa as a seperate side too.The turon was good and crispy but didnt care for the caramel sauce. The halo halo is not as flavorful as it can be. The mais con yelo is good. I would go back for some of the items but not anytime soon. Also because the location is hard to go to.

10.description: Came here with a filipino buddy of mines. Located on Lincoln street so parking pretty much sucks. But I parked on the residential side streets  behind this place. I dont know if that was permit parking or not but it was a sunday afternoon and YOLO. As soon as I walked in there was a homey vibe, nothing fancy in here. Having very little experience in this type of food, I got what my buddy got. It was the house special with soup.  The batchoy soup was not bad but not for me. It had a whole lotta things going on. Next came the chicken with garlic rice. The chicken was crisp and moist. That along with the garlic rice worked well with eachother. Finally I had to do it. I tried Balut. For years  I have heard many people talk about eating chick embryos. I googled pics and it seemed horrifying to me. But it was something I had to try, atleast once. Given instructions by my pal on the "right way to eat balut". I cracked the heavy shell open, poured some vinegar and salt on top, and slurpped that chick baby fluid. I am not going to the lie, the more i unpeeled the egg the less I wanted to eat it. But it actually is not that bad. Its like a tougher  hard boiled egg. Just the appearance of it is only imtimidatiing. Overall seems like a authentic place for flilipino food!

5.description: I really don't know what to do with this review, so I'll just tell it like it is...We did the boodle boodle dining in a group of 11 - which means it was a huge table, set with banana leaves and they put a huge feast on the table - you eat with your hands.  Food High points:Rice was great - it's just rice, but it's good riceGrilled pork - super tastyShrimp - not deveined and hard to peel because of it, but they were sweet and not overcooked which for me is a no go.  The non-deveining part is a little ooky.  I know, I'm white.Chicken - it was actually dry, but very tasty, so I consider it a high pointLumpia Shanghai - still not as good as Unimart, but good nonethelessHalo - Halo - ok, I hate halo halo but my husband loved it and I can't judge so I'm giving it pointsFood Low Points:I thought the adobo pork was WAY too fattyDid not like the mussels - wasn't sure what was on them, but I didn't care for them.  Everyone else did, so maybe that was meOther points:  we never could get napkins, or very few.  It also took a long time to get our wine served and the same with anything else we asked for (water, etc).  We didn't have utensils, assume that might have been a problem.  Also, I felt like we were sort of a "bother" for them - considering the bill, I would have expected better service.  Plus, it wasn't like they didn't know 11 people were coming.I'd go back, and my husband definitely would.  I'm just not sure it's that amazing.  I agree with the rater who said 3.5 stars.

3.description: We came on a Saturday morning. I was craving Filipino food so we decided to try something new. The Batchoy here is too sweet for me, but everything else was good! I'd come here again. It's nice to see an ilonggo restaurant in the area :-)
