35.description: Chicken too small and does not have flavor. I think they should marinate their chickens at least 24-48 hours. If you want good Filipino cuisine, go to Isla Filipina in Chicago or Hong Ning in Bloomingdale. I guarantee it'll remind you of home.

19.description: BEST TURON EVER! Not only was there some chocolate goodness fried in with the banana, but the outside was also topped with caramel sauce.  Um...hello?  Amazing.  (Turon is basically a deep fried banana wrapped in an eggroll/lumpia wrapper.)My parents took it upon themselves to order for the family, so they didn't choose to order any chicken.  (This is not surprising if you know my parents.)  However, my niece ordered a piece of chicken and really enjoyed it (namely, the skin). The kare-kare and inihaw na baboy were delicous...definitely the favorite items of the meal.  The lumpia was also good, especially if you live in the area and are looking for a quick lumpia fix!  Service was great, too!  I was pleasantly surprised and happy to see that our waitress was SUPER respectful of my parents (the typical treat your elders with respect treatment, ya know?).  The restaurant is spacious, clean, airy and bright (which is something that some other Filipino restaurants definitely lack).  It was pretty crowded on a Saturday night, so that was nice to see!I am definitely planning on making a return trip!  I'm already admittedly dreaming of that turon.  Yum!

28.description: Let me first start by saying that yes, I am Filipino and I do review restaurants frequently.  With that said, I have to say that this particular visit was disappointing.  Upon arrival, the waitress came up to me right away asking my order.  Told her I needed a few more minutes.  I then waited about 20 minutes for (not the waitress who was either on her computer or watching television the entire time) but for the cook who saw me just sitting there.  I ordered the special (chicken (leg & thigh) with beef soup).  Soup was brought out right away.  Looked like a "doctored up" ramen soup with pieces of beef (which I think was liver), a slice of hard boiled egg, scallions, and ramen noodles topped with crumbled pork rind skin.  Tasted blan.  Chicken came out 10 minutes after.  I expected fried chicken, but it's actually roasted chicken served with garlic rice.  Chicken tasted no different than any rotisserie chicken bought in a grocery store.  Some parts of the chicken were tough.  Overall, not impressed

45.description: Chicken Bacolod lacks taste, needs to be marinated longer. Pancit palabok is soggy and anemic looking, kare kare is bland and also lacks taste. Batchoy and lumpia cut into 12 chiclet size bits were the only palatable items there. Service was erratic and unorganized. Very disappointing and unsatisfying experience. They can do a lot better.

33.description: they call the chicken their special but really there's nothing special about a dry and flavorless chicken,far from what a real chicken inasal should be.the chicken taste like its just been thawed from the freezer and then fried.they even have a BBQ stick on it,but its not even placed on the grill.....

43.description: I am a novice to Filipino food and didn't know what to expect but came away very impressed.  I ordered Kare-Kare and the house speciality combo which came with grilled chicken and soup.  Kare-Kare was very flavorful.  The meat was tender and the  peanut sauce was really good.  The grilled chicken was very flavorful and moist and it came with a good sweet/sour relish.  The soup was good as well and had a really tasty broth.  Overall, great experience and am looking forward to going back.

2.description: Yummy food, especially if you've grown up eating ilonggo or Visayan foods! Brought back alot of childhood memories! Definitely coming back if we're ever in Chicago again!! Thank you Bacolod Chicken Haus!

18.description: Been here so many times , the chicken is outstanding!  The option of adding the batchoy is good since it serves as a appetizer.  But the lumpia shanghai along with the sauce as a appetizer are a great option as well . This place has the best  pancit palabok you can find anywhere hands down . For dessert you must try the turon which is a banana egg roll infused with chocolate perfection or the halo - halo which is a ice cream dessert with mixed fruit and ube flavored ice cream a taste of the Philippines here in Chicago

41.description: The food was definitely awesome!! I read the bad reviews about this place and most of them are issues about the service. I'm gonna have to say, they got their s**t together. Although there are still kinks that needed to be ironed out, the service was decent. I wouldn't consider it as best service in the city but they payed attention. Now for the food, my family is actually from Bacolod and I lived there for about 2 years. So i know what good Chicken Inasal is and their Chicken Inasal here is on point!! We also ordered Crispy Pata... That was delicious too!! Because of Melanie V's review saying "BEST TURON EVER", we decided to order the Turon too, and yes, she was not lying. It was good!!I'm definitely going back to this place.

50.description: Bacolod Chicken Haus' food was pretty good, but they are still working out the kinks with the service and their inventory. We had to constantly ask for plates, silverware, napkins, serving spoons, water, etc. When we asked for bagoong and ketchup, they delivered it to someone on the other end of the table instead of to the one who asked for it. We went on Easter Monday, and they were sold out of chicken legs, adobo and the coconut shells for the halo-halo. We had two orders of pancit palabok. One order was tasty, but the other did not have enough sauce. JP (owner?) kindly sent out more palabok sauce. They also sent out more milk for the halo-halo, since we could not see any. I am glad they do not use styrofoam for their to go containers, but they still need to offer a plastic bag when there are multiple take home boxes. Like the previous reviewer, we too will give them some time to get settled and hope the service improves. The food was nicely plated and all of our entrees were piping hot.  Everyone was very friendly and accommodating, but could use a bit more experience and common sense.

4.description: Friendly staff, great Filipino comfort food, and reasonably priced. Will definitely be trying this place again! (Although husband was hoping it was a byob, cause the sisig needs a cold beer served with it )

6.description: The place is good and the owner is very friendly. The food is really good specially the BATCHOY  "ramen noodles". The price is inexpensive and the service is very good. We enjoyed the food, chatting with the owner and server and lastly, we enjoyed the experience eating in this restaurant. I will definitely come back and eat here if I'm going to visit the city again. From Georgia, Dallas, and California. I will definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

22.description: I've been here plenty of times with my family and they never disappoint. This is what I consider as authentic Filipino food! The food is great,  and the owners are friendly. I usually stick with the same order, but I should try the rest of their menu.  Their drinks are pretty good too-- that's something I usually don't mind exploring Looking forward to visit this place in the near future c:

15.description: Interesting name, rather challenging parking situation, but WOW, great food. The chicken is amazingly succulent and tasty; and the bihon soup is amazing too. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed. This place is not to be missed.

20.description: I really don't know what to do with this review, so I'll just tell it like it is...We did the boodle boodle dining in a group of 11 - which means it was a huge table, set with banana leaves and they put a huge feast on the table - you eat with your hands.  Food High points:Rice was great - it's just rice, but it's good riceGrilled pork - super tastyShrimp - not deveined and hard to peel because of it, but they were sweet and not overcooked which for me is a no go.  The non-deveining part is a little ooky.  I know, I'm white.Chicken - it was actually dry, but very tasty, so I consider it a high pointLumpia Shanghai - still not as good as Unimart, but good nonethelessHalo - Halo - ok, I hate halo halo but my husband loved it and I can't judge so I'm giving it pointsFood Low Points:I thought the adobo pork was WAY too fattyDid not like the mussels - wasn't sure what was on them, but I didn't care for them.  Everyone else did, so maybe that was meOther points:  we never could get napkins, or very few.  It also took a long time to get our wine served and the same with anything else we asked for (water, etc).  We didn't have utensils, assume that might have been a problem.  Also, I felt like we were sort of a "bother" for them - considering the bill, I would have expected better service.  Plus, it wasn't like they didn't know 11 people were coming.I'd go back, and my husband definitely would.  I'm just not sure it's that amazing.  I agree with the rater who said 3.5 stars.

36.description: Four stars for the food! If you keep your expectations low for service, you'll have a grand ol' time. I've been here twice, and the first time, the service wasn't terrible, but that was only because we were one of three tables in the entire restaurant. The second time around, our water wasn't refilled and we had to ask repeatedly for utensils.The FOOD, though! We tried the chicharon bulaklak (fried pork intestines) appetizer; I don't actually usually eat intestines dishes, but this had the perfect amount of crispiness! The mini crispy patas (fried pork knuckle) was also great, both texture and taste-wise; loved the crispiness of the pork skin combined with the fatty, juicy meat. The inasal dishes were also great. I also enjoyed the batchoy, although I liked it better when I asked for no liver because I got more chicken toppings.The halo halo dessert was also pretty good! I wish we had a bigger bowl to more easily mix all the ingredients, though. However, I actually wouldn't recommend the turon (deep-fried banana roll) because the caramel was too sweet but also a bit burnt.

14.description: batchoy very goodcrispy pata very goodchicken good. parking is ok. havent tried the other food

58.description: This restaurant has come a long way in the neighborhood for over fifteen years now.   The quality of the food has been so / so, I think their offerings and taste have deteriorated over time.  It's only natural for costs to rise, but, seriously, $12 dollars for a standard buffet?  You've got to have a serious want to wolf down a lot of food to pay that.  Special nights; like ham, roast beef and pork chops or BBQ rib night, these foods aren't prepared to the best of their efforts.  It's half assed, is the BBQ sauce homemade? It's not tasty.  What's the deal with meats, no offer of any kind of A1 like condiment to accompany.  One can't use ketchup or brown gravy with everything.  Sometimes OC Buffet gives me that Chinese buffet aftermath feeling.  People don't realize that MSG can be found in many foods, not just Chinese.  OCB is a family establishment, weekends you'll find large families enjoying meals together.  Some good people watching; while dining on a recent occasion I'd seen some interesting mixing of couples, (which is awesome) I saw a couple, a Vietnamese guy with his Latin girlfriend, both hardly spoke English, but were having a great date.  I talked to them a bit they met in English speaking class.  Cute couple, then a waitress comes over with complimentary cinnamon buns fresh from the oven.  How sweet they were.Did ya know that you can grab side items for $1.99, their cornbread dressing (stuffing) is awesome.  Equivalent to a large side order from Popeyes or KFC.

56.description: I don't come to OCB often, but it has been a tried-and-true comfort food destination for me since high school. Honestly, I've always loved the excess and variety of OCB, but I've never been completely pleased by the quality of the food. I have no idea what happened recently-- but I came here with two friends this past weekend, and everything tasted wonderful. The mac and cheese was cheesy enough, the rotisserie chicken was moist and flavorful, the dinner rolls were warm and addictive, the carved turkey was tender and well-seasoned, and apparently the potato salad was out of this world. ;) I enjoyed the meal so much that I decided to begin a tradition with my future husband and children to eat here every payday-- and I even suggested to my friends that we should have their wedding rehearsal dinner there because it would be cheap and comforting. Haha.If the place wasn't so crowded and a bit on the dingy side, I would've given them 4 stars. But just know that the 3 stars are full of fondness and appreciation. ;)

29.description: So sad. No cups, no ice, no chocolate milk and NO PLATES!!!  How are we supposed to gorge ourselves on comfort food when there are no plates?!?!?!  Last time we were here it was fine. This time?  No so much :-(All that being said, the manager did make cinnamon sugar for my incredibly picky daughter and came over to check on the cinnamon to sugar ratio. She made up for all the stuff they were out of.

42.description: I love this place! The food selection is great and the price isn't bad.  The only bone I got a pick is the dessert section needs more selection.  How about German chocalate cake or chocalate mouse! Only 4 stars until they get their dessert section on! Oh forgot to tell you ...the salad bar is OK too. Nothing to write home to mom about though. Lol!

23.description: Food is good. But they're so unhygienic. Plates are not properly washed and it's still wet. So disappointing.

47.description: When my boyfriend and I got home from OCB we didn't know what to think, except this is a place to visit maybe every 5 years...minimum!CONS:- Dead fly on the window sill- Kids every where....kids = dirty/messy- Food on the ground- Questionable food- $10/person for lunch!PROS:- Bus people did do a good job clearing plates- They had an Icee machine- Desserts were tastyWhat can I say, we were in the mood for a buffet! Till the next 5 years!

8.description: Nope. Just don't do it. I've never questioned what I was eating so much.  Were they mashed potatoes or cloudy dishwater? Hard to tell.  It was filthy.  Employees standing around while carts with stacks and stacks of dirty dishes sat in the cleanup cart area.  Trash on the floor and no one working on cleaning it up.  I couldn't find one thing on the buffet that looked appetizing.  Tried a plate of things that looked ok-ish and it was all awful.  Not even worth the cheap price.   Did not finish eating and we left.

31.description: Food was somewhat tolerable. What's up with the small ass drinking glasses?

34.description: So all I ever eat here is the tacos and the green beans. So I'll skip the food part. But I love the people-watching. It's very diverse in practically every way you can think of -- race, age, socio-economic class (although less so in terms of the last factor). Last time I was there, these two kids tried to sneak in the back door and eat without paying, and about six tables simultaneously reported them to the management. They snuck back out in time to get away with it, and then the entire restaurant proceeded to talk about it for the next half hour. It was interesting to observe. Love being able to sit there for hours and do nothing. Would bring my reading here if I was still in college.

16.description: Old Country Buffet has been removing popular items such as catfish, spaghetti & meat sauce, butterfly shrimp, pot roast, and cottage cheese from their menu. In addition there seems to be a crowd that arrives just before the 3:30 p.m. dinner time to take advantage of the lunch prices and wipes out the salad bar and other popular items. I would prefer that they raise prices, control the 3:15 "rush" to eliminate the rif-raf. The place is still a good deal but could be better if they raise the price $2 and improve the menu.

13.description: Went to Old Country Buffet on 6560 W Fullerton Ave, today and was so disappointed. We came for dinner around 4pm, there was so many food missing that needed to be refilled, I ate what was available but just disappointed that they didn't refill the meatloaf, taco shells and other food.It was dinner time and they should have enough food available. What got me  sick was going for the dessert and finding bitten cheesecake with the rest of the dessert, also the forks, spoons were dirty like someone put mashed potato on the utensils. I used to love Old Country Buffet but since today I will never go back and won't recommend it to anyone.

11.description: If you want to eat at a filthy shithole, THIS IS THE PLACE!  Garbage is all over the floor, and the carpet is filthy and smelly.  But your kids love serving themselves, so you throw down you cash, and hope for the best.  But seriously...NO MILK?!?  It's FAMILY NIGHT, for Pete's sake!  No white milk, no chocolate milk, not even creamers for the coffee!  And no, it's not because the dairy delivery didn't come!  So I asked the bus lady.  I asked the hostess.  I asked the manager.  Here we are, an hour later, and STILL NO MILK!!!  Do you know why?  Turns out NOT ONE SINGLE EMPLOYEE HERE KNOWS HOW TO CHANGE THE MILK!!!  Never ever ever again!

39.description: This place is ok but there is not alot of food to choose from at this OBC.  I would say go to the one on dempster if u want a bigger selection.

37.description: the quality is not great and the price is cheap.. i would rather go to higher quality buffet for better food and a litte more money

0.description: The  people were very friendly.  The salad bar was good.  The deserts were very good.  Some of the chicken breasts were dry (so go for the darker meet (drum sticks and thighs). Keep in mind you are paying about  $12 for all you can eat, so don't compare it to a $40 Vegas Buffet!

38.description: I have been here many times. Food quality has been down, probably because of the economy. The host aka waiter ate always attentive on clearing the tables. Sometimes they'll refill your drink but they don't have to. Before drink was included. It could be a good and bad thing. They have a icee machine now. It's been there quite sometime now. It's a hit or miss everytime.Another is most of the parents let the kids run around unattended. If they're going to do that, take then to Chuck E Cheese.

51.description: Always a fan of any buffet ever, especially one this diverse!On one visit alone I witnessed creepy boy scout twins, a woman stealing dinnerware, and a child telling her mom that she didn't love her because she was ugly.  A damn good time at OCB is sure to be had.

27.description: For a moderate price around 12-15 dollars, you get some pretty decent food that hasn't changed since it first opened up. The hot fudge sundae cake combined with cold vanilla ice cream alone can keep the place open! It is usually crowded but not uncomfortably so, however it can lead to a lot of bumping into other people if you are not aware. This is a self-service with staff that continuously clean after you in an efficient manner after you get up in order to avoid bothering you while you eat. Simply: A lot of great food for a moderate price with decent service.

32.description: I had a good time here. The food was good. The waiters/waitresses were very nice and got my plate every time I got up. The food: I love buffets and Old Country buffet has almost every kind of food I like. My only complaints are that the mac and cheese didn't taste cheesy enough and the rice was dry. A lot of the stuff wasn't labeled. The desert was good, I wish I had saved more room for it. It was really noisy but that's to be expected in most restaurants. There was one crying baby that was annoying but it was far away. I went on a saturday night at 7 and it was very crowded. when I left around 8:30 people were still coming in.

54.description: OK, it's OCB. I get it. But you know what? For $7 and change for lunch, it's pretty hard to beat. Great salad bar, taco bar, broasted chicken that's out of this world; always a wide variety of veggies (their collard greens are my fave), chicken soup that you'd swear is mom's...I'm sorry. Anyone who slams OCB is a little too fastidious for me. Oh...it's a buffet, but I always tip the waiters and waitresses.

48.description: what up, i'm reviewing OCB because i need to mix it up.  don't come here.  $15 for a ton of crap?  i'll go to big star and get 4 delicious tacos for $12.the plate of fruit they chose to show as the main pic should tell you something.

44.description: Terrible, Terrible, TERRIBLE.So I have always been against Old Country Buffet for obvious reasons, one time my boyfriend were in a rush and needed to just eat something fast.Well its a good thing we went there, I ended up leaving hungry :(The atmosphere here is just unbelievably disgusting. There were children running around, I witness a child drop the corn bread on the floor, put it back and grabbed another one, another child grabbed the speghetti out of the pan, WITH HIS HANDS, another older child, teens I'd say, sneezed directly over the food.Not the cleanliest place at all . . . maybe it was a bad night but needless to say i will NEVER go back!

24.description: I love this place because I am usually so fickle about what I want and it takes me forever to order off of a menu (soooo many choices) unless I go in knowing what I want. But how do you know what you want if you've never been there in the first place? (catch-22)This place has the friendliest servers and everything is gasp- clean! Their "ice-cream" machine is actually behind the counter which makes it super sanitary! (I asked and it's because the City of Chicago has specific sanitary codes that the suburbs apparently do not have).Speaking of desserts, they actually improved a lot on the aesthetics of their desserts and I felt like I was at a Casino buffet (with all of the cute choices in small serving cups).Drink wise- they had everything from ICEEs to chocolate milk to juices to different pops (not soda). Food wise- they had the most amazing fish fillet bites and really yummy mac-n-cheese. The food is hearty and tasty and for the price (11.00/AYCE)- I am game! PS. OCB also upped their game and have a "spice station" full of different condiments to satiate your palette! I WILL BE BACK!

7.description: omg....call the health department!!!!! this place is disgusting and filthy. the 'food' or lack of it is inedible!!!!!!! mold-dirt-bugs-filth-uncaring help, etc. save your money......go elsewhere! too bad you can't give this place negative stars.

49.description: Only reason I go is because of the desserts. Unlimited! Food is crappy. What to expect from a buffet. Haven't found a decent one yet.

40.description: Yum Yum gimme some!Is it the best food you will ever eat? NoWill you get fancy fare unlike any you have ever seen? NoWill you get  solid buffet food and some of the best fried chicken around? Absolutely!Some things are hit and miss here but the fried chicken is dependably solid!Fresh carved roast beef is also very good and the banana pudding tastes just like someone's grandma makes! They are quick about cleaning and there are typically not a bunch of kids putting their fingers into stuff.All in all, when I get the craving for all you can eat and am not in the mood for Polish buffet, I head to OCB!

53.description: I don't even know how many stars I should be giving this place. Lets try and break this down...Food: ZEROew. The only good thing is the dessert section. Its pretty hard to mess up on desserts.The fact that it is ALL YOU CAN EAT (for cheap): 5Icee: 4I mean where else can you go to get Icee's besides 7-11 or a baseball game. Awesome!Workers: 2What can you really say? They dont do much. They dont need to wait tables, or anything. One person takes your money. Another cleans up. Yet they just walk right in front of you when your carrying 6 plates at once. real nice. So i guess in total, ill give it a 3. But thats stretching it. Oh and on a side note, bad gas when your done...yep, now its 2 stars

30.description: I used to love this location it was one of the best.Now, I don't think I will ever return. The food quality has really declined since the old manager left. The food is greasy and badly prepared, it looks more like pig slop. The salad bar looks like they toss the food on it, and the dressings are splattered all over the place. How do you screw up a salad bar?The old manager was always on the floor watching to make sure the customer experience was up to his standard. Our "server" stopped by twice, once to tell us her name and the second time as we were leaving to see if we had left a gratuity. Not only did she not take our dirty plates, but she used the empty table next to us to collect the dirty plates she did pick up from her area.The previous manager had no problem explaining to parents that he was more comfortable with them serving their children. Now children run rampant... I understand that parents should be responsible but as a manager you should care and have some say as to how it impacts your other clients.Finally, Why oh why are my feet sticking to the floor in the bar area? Seriously, put up a caution sign and mop the floor. GROSS!I am really sad, I used to love this location, I miss the old manager. Giant Fail OCB!

46.description: I don't know how to start.

1.description: This was our first time here and everyone was so nice to us. The place was clean and very roomy BUT the food was not so goodWe went at 5pm for dinner and the selection was not good at all.  Most of the food looked like it was sitting out for a very long time. The meat on the ribs and chicken was not cooked well and it bread was hard. I don't think the price we paid for dinner was worth it but the ladies that took our plates and cleaned tables were so nice and sweet, I told them it was my sons birthday and they brought him a small cake that said happy birthday and they sang to him which made his night so it was worth it. The Picture I posted should show that. Nice friendly staff but unfortunately the food not good.

55.description: If i could give this place ZERO stars i would...........I have always HATED going to Old Country Buffet. I just think it's disgusting. First off you know you're in for a adventure when you see one of those "Coach" buses parked in front........oh no....it's a "senior citizen's field trip to Old Country Buffet". All you have at these places are old people and families that have 4-5 kids each. They let the kids go feed themselves.....why??? They then don't wait for new plates and bring up their old dirty plates, scooping food on their old used plate. I've seen people use their fingers to sample food to decide if they want some on their plate. And my biggest pet peeve....people scooping corn on their plate, then mashed potatoes on top of the corn and put the mashed potato spoon back that NOW HAS corn on it! Over all.......AVOID! AVOID! Food & customers at these things are just gross!

9.description: I had lunch here today and I really thought it was a joke.  The clam chowder soup was so thick I thought I was eating oat meal.  They had the usual salad bar and the entrees were basically baked and fried chicken.  They only beef the had there was meat for the taco in the taco bar area and mini hamburgers that was served only once while I was there.  I requested them to bring out some more and I waited 20 minutes and had to leave and still no mini hamburgers.  Oh they have this new thing where they give you a steel cup full of vegetables and gravy and if your lucky two pieces of meat the size of a 50 cent coin.      I guess OCB is cutting back on their lunch menu in order to keep the prices at a price to be lower then the Chinese buffets nearby.  However I think those will be my choices now because they offer more variety and offer more entrees that have meat.I doubt I would ever go to an OCB again.

26.description: I've visited this location sporadically over the past 20+ years.  I was hungry one day and decided to try it out again.  This place hasn't changed much, except for the food and prices.  Over the years, the food quality seems to have worsened and the prices have gone up.  I didn't really enjoy any of the food, even though I was hungry.  That's not a good sign.  I might come check it out again in a few years to see if anything has changed, but I probably won't go out of my way to come here.

25.description: Recently I've been receiving these surveys from OCB.  I complete very truthfully.  This survey asked if I would use a 2/$15.99 coupon. SURE, but not at that location.  And I'm not going on the other side of town (Brickyard Mall) to use it so that kills that thought.  Not when I refuse to visit the 6125 N Lincoln location because it's DIRTY.  Oh, and it generated a coupon after I completed the survey.  Again......NOT.  Revamp, or clean, you location.  And even if you do, how would I know since I won't go back because it's dirty.  Ah well.

12.description: I love this place because I am usually so fickle about what I want and it takes me forever to order off of a menu (soooo many choices) unless I go in knowing what I want. But how do you know what you want if you've never been there in the first place? (catch-22)This place has the friendliest servers and everything is gasp- clean! Their "ice-cream" machine is actually behind the counter which makes it super sanitary! (I asked and it's because the City of Chicago has specific sanitary codes that the suburbs apparently do not have).Speaking of desserts, they actually improved a lot on the aesthetics of their desserts and I felt like I was at a Casino buffet (with all of the cute choices in small serving cups).Drink wise- they had everything from ICEEs to chocolate milk to juices to different pops (not soda). Food wise- they had the most amazing fish fillet bites and really yummy mac-n-cheese. The food is hearty and tasty and for the price (11.00/AYCE)- I am game! PS. OCB also upped their game and have a "spice station" full of different condiments to satiate your palette! I WILL BE BACK!

59.description: So oddly enough, I was dragged here by my parents(and I reluctantly gave in and went here) last weekend, and went here for the first time in a few years. Place hadn't had changed much from when I was last here, but it seems OCB did add a few minor things to the menu since I last was here, such as that they now serve grits here. My dad told me they were decent, but I was ticked that they removed them from the buffet before I had a chance to try them.I think I was a little bit harsh on my original review, but due to the fact they still have a decent selection of desserts(and dare I say, possibly the only thing OCB has improved on since I heavily frequented this location in the 1990s) and nice employees, I've decided to up this to 2 stars. Which overall, averages this place at 1.5 stars. I probably encountered one of the friendliest employee I've ever seen here bussing tables, and I definitely gave her a good tip as I left.If I can help it, I probably won't be back to OCB after this recent time, since I remember the overall quality of this place was so much better in the 1990s(desserts aside). I want my 1990s OCB back right now!

21.description: This location is really dirty. Really dirty. The rug is always soaking wet in one back area for whatever reason, dirty and stained everywhere. The silverware is disgustingly dirty, sticky and pieces of other peoples food stuck on it. The plates too, as well as the inside of all their cups and bowls. This was a huge waste of money. This is by far the worst location we have ever been to. Yuck!

17.description: Recently I've been receiving these surveys from OCB.  I complete very truthfully.  This survey asked if I would use a 2/$15.99 coupon. SURE, but not at that location.  And I'm not going on the other side of town (Brickyard Mall) to use it so that kills that thought.  Not when I refuse to visit the 6125 N Lincoln location because it's DIRTY.  Oh, and it generated a coupon after I completed the survey.  Again......NOT.  Revamp, or clean, you location.  And even if you do, how would I know since I won't go back because it's dirty.  Ah well.

10.description: I was on the north-side of Chicago last weekend, and decided to give it a try. For the price, the food was o.k. Great variety. My server, Elena, was great with a nice smile and very helpful. I felt pretty satisfied that I got my money's worth.

5.description: Never came to a OCB in my life and all i can say is...Depressing, low selections, no good vibes coming from this place at all!I came in on a Sunday hoping to have me belly full of good eats for my birthday dinner instead, i had a mini ass sort of foods thrown in front of me. I walked around the food in disgust by the food.Dry tasting food. My stomach actually made itself full just to tell me to stop eatting this slope.Gotta pay a beverage fee as well? I thought this was a buffet. All you can eat! First and Last time im coming to this disgusting forsaken place.

3.description: This is categorically the worst place I've ever eaten. Baked chicken thigh was simultaneously chalk dry on one side and under cooked tasting on the other. I though Brussels sprouts would have been a safe choice but they were incredible salty and disgusting. Even freaking waffle fries tasted like they were made of foam. Don't go in save your $11 (warning clue#1).!!!If you know anyone frequenting OCB then you need to run to their aid because this is a terrible form of self-hate. I will be writing the health dept. - I'm sure the dishwater tasting mashed potatoes are classified as a form of terrorism. 1 Star assumes a review of a restaurant...Clearly this is a patient zero hangout.

35.description: I've been to this Old Country Buffet plenty of times and my most recent visit was probably the best. The food was better than most of the times I've been here and the people were friendly. Arceli, I believe was cleaning our table pretty quickly and was so much nicer than the servers I've encountered here before.

19.description: Only good thing about this location was the steak. Me and my husband went in on a Sunday evening. Not many food choices which was totally unexpected. The soda machine was flat , desserts had no flavor, salad bar didn't stay stocked and there was a spill that I could tell been there since before I arrived that they didn't have addressed. It's plenty of staff running around there why not attend to it. Another good thing about this place is the table ladies/waitresses or whatever you want to call them were very attentive eve though this is a self serve place.

28.description: So I haven't been here in a while and decided to treat myself. I usually stick to the healthy stuff and indulge in a small scoop of mac 'n cheese.  I don't know what they did to it but it was the worst I've ever had. Nearly tasteless. The deceptive yellow sauce that is usually white trash perfect was just awful. In fact, it was so bad that I am gonna have to make some at home to make up for it. After that disaster, I decided to have some instant potatoes, which I usually abhor, but they were actually not bad with a little fake gravy on it. The meatloaf was decent, too. But in all fairness, it's hard to mess up meatloaf.  What I really liked this time was what had to be an exceedingly fattening soup that looked to be "pot pie" without the crust. I generally get a tiny portion of as many items as I'd like to try - so the baked fish was very good, too. Here's a tip - if you can't have caffeine or sugar - have some FREE "soda" water (it's a small tab near the Sprite) and add some lemon and Splenda. Healthier and even tastes better! Another tip is while they do not offer wifi - I was able to jump on Party City's network without a pass code! There was also a nice woman passing out towelettes which I found shockingly wonderful. When Sizzler was around (they're gone in Chicago - but for a long time there was one in my old hood - Santa Monica, CA). I basically loved the salad bar. Old Country Buffet is like a Sizzler but with a whole lot more.  But, like I said "What happened to the Mac 'n Cheese?" Also, they really need to kick up that airco! Other than that, it was a good experience. I mean, what do you want for under $10?

45.description: Deep breath.  Outing myself to the world.  Here we go.I like Old Country Buffet.  Wow.  I feel better now.  We like to come here with some other friends and whenever we do I feel like I have to lie on Facebook about where we go because people have such a negative reaction to the place!I am sorry, but Old Country Buffet is pretty damn tasty for $9.99.  Yes, the clientele is not fancy.  Yes, some of the food is a bit processed and out of a box.  But a lot of it is really yummy!  I like to have a little of this and a little of that so a buffet is so much more fun then being forced to order off a boring old menu.Yummy-steak (seriously.  Steak night is the best night)meatloafthe chicken and dumplingsfried shrimphuge fresh salad barfried chickenpot roastdesert stationGross and way too processed-Mashed potatoesMac & Cheesethe fried fish (greasy but still nasty tasty)Cheesecake This location has great staff and is always clean.  If you go on-line and register for the birthday club you can get a buy one get one free coupon!

33.description: Did not have any plates. Did not have any cups. Had to wait 5 min. for a steak knife. These comments were saved as a draft from an experience I had there over a year ago. I did not get chance to post them until now. A lesson to management, an agry customer is more damaging than a happy one. "Take care of the customer and the business will take care of itself" Ray Crock said that... I think you should follow in his footsteps.

43.description: OMFG RUN AWAY WHILE YOU STILL CAN.This place is filthy and overcrowded. Our "waitress" didn't stop by our table not once to pick up our dirty plates. I may be short but I'm not invisible.It's way too expensive for the quality of food, its not economical. I'm not willing to trade a full belly for an empty wallet.

2.description: The food here sucks. It is better to go home and prepare your own meal. I am not even exaggerating. I remember going here a few years ago and I will not go here ever again. I don't recommend people to go here either. Simply a waste of money. This place deserves a negative stars not one.

18.description: This place used to be a great place to eat with reasonable prices and plenty of choices of food. But since the manager left (Joe), it has become a disgusting facility in which to eat. I've contacted the corporate offices about this numerous times, where food would remain on the floors, stations were not manned sufficiently, bathrooms were horrendous. But I continued to give them a chance to correct the issues until today. I went around dinner time and had issues getting soup as both were out for some time, they didn't have the steak ready for the dinner roll out so had to go back 3 separate times before they finally had any prepared (and no, it wasn't because other customers had already gotten some, it was just not ready for the first 30 minutes of dinner). At one point they completely ran out of clean plates.....I told a staff member and all they would say is plates would be out soon. Saw 2 people standing at the desert stand waiting for someone to come and serve the ice cream. Milk ran out, then when I went to use the restroom, the hallway leading to the bathroom had a trail of paper towels leading to the restrooms, and of the 5 toilets 1 was out of service, 1 had a broken toilet seat, and 2 had no toilet paper in it. It also looked like it had not been cleaned in days. On top of that, an employee wearing kitchen apparel (apron and hair net) was on his phone talking loudly about a friend or family member that had just been transferred from one correctional facility to another, and using foul language to the person on the other end to explain that he felt the transfer was a f'n good thing. After that, I asked to speak to a manager and when he came out and I started explaining the goings on of not only that day, but how it's been the norm for quite some time now, rather then own the problem he said he was sorry and that he had only been with the location for a very short time as if to use that as an excuse for all the issues I had seen today!I worked in hospitality and if the front of the house looks this bad and the management is ok with it, I can only guess how bad the back of the house, where they prepare all the food, is! I will be contacting the board of health and hope they go in and do a full inspection of this location. I would not be surprised if they are hit hard with numerous violations. They really need to do a complete reboot of this location, outside of a couple of the staff. Shut down, hire all new management, and re-open as if a new location, when they still had pride in the restaurant.

41.description: I'd rather eat dorm food.Was dragged here against my will.  Came in with an open mind ... couldn't find anything that wasn't drenched in high fructose corn syrup.  The vegetables at the salad bar were inedible.  I was sick to my stomach for the whole day after eating here.

52.description: Oh no she didn't?!?!?!?!  Oh yes I did!!! That's right dammit, Old County Buffet. 4 stars. Why? Cause I just love buffet.  Sweet and simple as that.   I love the option of having as much or as little of as many things as I might like.  I get to determine my portions and all for one flat price.  I get to choose exactly what I want on my salad and come back for more if I so desire.  I can have a slice of pizza, a cinnamon bun, roasted chicken, and tacos all on one plate. I come here for the freedom.  The freedom of buffet.No, the food isn't gourmet or the cat's meow. It's not supposed to be hence the low flat price.  However,  I have to say I have yet to taste a peach cobbler up North that can compete with the one at OCB.  Even the soul food places on the S.side can't mess with this in my opinion.  Sure, there are obnoxious kids running around and turning around in their booths to stare at you, but lest we forget some of us probably were one of those kids years ago. Plus, it's no secret it's a family restaurant.  I've been coming to this particular location since 1999 and it has had the same manager since. He's good about keeping the place clean and replenishing food to make sure whatever's out is fresh and hot.  I've witnessed how good he is with his staff and a number of them there take their job seriously.  This is the only location I will go to.This isn't Vegas, so there aren't many choices of buffet here in Chicago.  Some lure you in with the promise of one, but surprise you with all these mean stipulations and additional fees.  It's nice to know that when I just want some freedom, I can count on the Lincoln OCB.

50.description: What do you expect, its a mass market buffet?  The food quality was decent, there place was clean, and it wasn't chaos.  I was happy to see they take their business seriously.  I once was a manager of restaurants myself, so was pleased to see staff organised and making sure food was fresh and the tables kept clean.  Manager was taking temperature measurements of all the tables and checking quality.  The salad bar was great, btw.No, its not fancy.  But, if you don't know what everyone wants to eat and are really hungry, this could be the place.

4.description: This is an update about my pet peeve concerning this Old Country Buffet location: the lack of attention to correct signage to tell people what they are eating. You were waiting for an update, right? :)They still are not doing a great job. Either management doesn't see it as important or staff is just careless about it or both.I came in for dinner at 4:30 or so and I'd say 80% of the entrees or side dishes seemed to be wrongly labeled. It was almost comedic how thoroughly incorrect so many things were labeled. Imagine chicken with the sign above it saying spare ribs, or rice saying corn, or carrots saying potatoes. You get the idea.Now, I understand that lunch becomes dinner at some point at all buffet places, and the menu changes somewhat and new dishes are brought out. So signs have to change.  Dinner is supposed to begin at 3:30 at this chain, so I presume the dinner dishes come out at that point. But it was already 4:30 and everything was mislabeled as far as the eye could see.I pointed this out to an employee, who laughed and said I shouldn't read the signs by the food because "it'll drive you crazy." To his credit, he did  go around changing some of the signs at that point along with another worker to try to sort things out a little better.I got especially irked because I went over to the salad bar and the seafood salad was labeled potato salad and vice versa. The labels were swapped. Not a huge deal to most people, probably, but as I've pointed out in previous reviews, I have extremely bad allergies to fish and seafood. If I start chowing down on seafood salad for whatever reason, I'll be off in an ambulance to Swedish Covenant to breathe steroids through a tube for a few hours (if I am lucky). I mentioned the error to the hospitality manager but he was not so hospitable. He changed the signs around but seemed annoyed and unhappy that I was bringing it up. Instead of thanking me for giving a damn, he said, "Are you OK?" Like I was a freak for mentioning it.I like this restaurant. The food is good enough, in general. The price is affordable for the value you get. The bus staff is attentive and I'm sure overworked for what they get paid. So why can't the managers get this one thing right? Patrons deserve to know what each and every dish is, every time they come here. Not just because it's professional, and because it is what restaurants are expected to do, but because it's the safe thing to do; customers have all sorts of allergies and special diets to contend with.I know management does care about this because they actually reached out to me in the past to discuss it and apologize when I complained online...but problems persist. All restaurants need improvement, so I hope this one realizes that consistent and attentive food signage would be an easy but significant improvement they can make. We shall see. The proof is in the pudding. (Beans? Cole slaw? Cantaloupe? Or will the pudding sign say...pudding?)

6.description: It's old country buffet. For the price point it's fabulous. Don't come here and expect  5 star cuisine because this isn't that. I don't generally like buffets, but I meet on the first Sunday of every month with a great bunch of people.         You can't beat the price. I recommend going right around when breakfast is ending and lunch starts so you get the best of both worlds. I really like that the manager brings around fresh baked cookies! That's an awesome touch. That's all folks...

22.description: Spacious seating, very comfortable place.  Wide selection of food.  Phenomenal cheesecake with strawberry icing for dessert.  One of my favorite places to eat for sure.

15.description: It had been a long time I'd stepped foot at a OCB and when I did - it was at the one on Narragansett. I remember enjoying the food and my specially favorite- the breakfast..buffet fast track to twenty years later..(yes my last OCB recollection was when I was around 10) I came to the Lincolnwood Location and though I am not generally a fan of buffets in general, was dismayed to see how dirty this location looked. Some of the pans were not even restocked with the food that had been wiped out. The man doing the omelets although nice was just not moving quick enough, I do cut him some slack however since he was using an electric stove so maybe that was the reason behind the delay. The ingredients we could add left a lot to be desired - they just looked- cheap. The coffee was a bit bland and although I am not a coffee snob, had never heard of the coffee brand they brew and not because it is an elite brand but rather because it's probably some low-end coffee brand. Definitely not impressed. Also not a lot of healthy options - granted one doesn't really go to a buffet to eat healthy, but would've appreciated some healthier alternatives. Also - when paying you are asked if you would like drinks..kind of a redundant question, I have never been to a restaurant where people opt not to have anything to drink- you say yes then you are charged $2 more...Overpriced and mediocre.. No thanks OLB..

57.description: I love the VARIETY. I can get pasta with meat sauce AND have a taco salad in the same meal. Fast food glutonny! Heehaw.They offer an array of fresh vegetables for the salad. I typically stay away from the myriad of fried offerings. NOT!  The fried chicken is oddly delish, or you can go for the slightly healthier baked chicken.Desert choices galore; including bread pudding with icing, fake cheesecake with whip cream, softserve ice cream, salad bar red jello.OCB attracts large groups so the dining area can get really crowded especially at peak hours. Careful not to trip over one of the myriad of kids  whizzing around grabbing their next slices of pizza and fries. Last time I went, I realized that there's really no graceful way to get to your chair if you're sitting in one of the inside seats at the longer tables in the middle of the dining area. You really just have to wait for the people next to you to get up as well. Someone at the next table is right behind you. The booths are the right way to go for seconds and thirds.Senior citizen discount is not much of a discount. But younger kids can eat for $2- what a steal!Lincoln Village parking lot is roomy.

20.description: Only good thing about this location was the steak. Me and my husband went in on a Sunday evening. Not many food choices which was totally unexpected. The soda machine was flat , desserts had no flavor, salad bar didn't stay stocked and there was a spill that I could tell been there since before I arrived that they didn't have addressed. It's plenty of staff running around there why not attend to it. Another good thing about this place is the table ladies/waitresses or whatever you want to call them were very attentive eve though this is a self serve place.

36.description: I always go to Old Country Buffet when I need to come up with some solutions to my problems. The place is cozy and inexpensive. There are plenty of American food items. However, you can also find Chinese items on some days, such as orange chicken. The food is tasteful. The staff is friendly, The place is also pretty big on healthy items, such as different salads and baked fish. The desserts are pretty plentiful and tasty too. You can sit there for hours and enjoy your food. Better yet, enjoy your food while solving your problems at the same time. It is a good place to be!

14.description: You cannot get a better food deal. The selection of salad items was excellent, they have individual servings of pulled pork, shredded beef and others.The waitresses are very diligent about keeping the plates cleared and continuously straighten out chairs and sweep the floors when necessary. The Saturday and Sunday breakfasts are excellent. I eat here three times a week.

58.description: Yum.  Cheap, fast and delicious.    If you sit in the window, you have a great view of the new North Park U landscape.  The school keeps looking more and more New England.

56.description: Great Bahn Mi yummy authentic sandwiches and wonderful street noodles, Boba tea and spring rolls. So happy there is terrific Asian in North Park

29.description: Love Love Love Vietnamese food...and these tasty bahn mi sandwiches are some of the best around! We often order from 2 Asian brothers for lunch, and are never disappointed....well, I always ask for extra cilanto and it seems that they give me even less! But besides that, quite delish! My fave is the shredded chicken. Their bread here is better than most. It's soft and chewy and not overly crusty and crunchy like alot of bahn mi's. Another great thing to try is the fried rice...get it spicy. You will NOT be disappointed!

42.description: Ordered for delivery. So no bathroom review. Food was delicious. My sister who's very picky really liked it. :)

23.description: It's a good spot if you are in the neighborhood.It's not decorated, it's very blah, the inside is nothing special. It's got tables and chairs, and that's it. It's packed with college students, who are quite loud, rude, self absorbed. The staff is nice, fast, helpful. The food is good, the portions are good. The chicken is not the best. I wondered what type of chicken it was or how the marinated it because it has a funny after taste...eek.The fact that they use mint on a lot of dishes is fantastic, love mint!Their boba teas are really good, they use real fruit, nothing powdered there. Although you can only get 2 flavors added. Maybe if you want an extra piece of fruit it's extra?! Not sure, but I wasn't excited about that. I still made it work, but didn't exactly appreciate the restriction as the boba wasn't exactly cheap. The prices are average for a quick bite.Parking is only by the meter, not the easiest to find. You get your food fast. It's not a place I will go back to, there wasn't anything too different about it that would make me try it again.

47.description: Absolutely love their spicy shrimp fried rice, it's delicious. I always get carryout and they have it ready pretty fast. Employees are always nice. Smoothies are pretty awesome too!

8.description: I tried this spot for the first time today and I'm glad I did. The location is inviting and clean, friendly staff, fast service, fresh food. The egg rolls are good and they're not greasy at all! Big plus! The fried rice with chicken is good, but could use more flavor. Overall I was very pleased with my experience here. I haven't eaten pan Asian food that seemed like a good, healthy meal in a long time. Good stuff!

31.description: I've never eaten here. I tried to. I called them to place an order for pick up so we could have breakfast on our way to work. I asked for, "Bun Thit Nuong." Whoops, they guy didn't understand Viet! My fault. Then I asked for grilled pork which is typical for every viet sandwich place to have. They didn't have this on their menu! So I opted for their special then.If anything couldn't get any worse... They didn't have bread.

34.description: This place is great!  Fast, delicious, and convenient.  I just wish they would make their smoothies with better ingredients.  Still, good stuff.

16.description: I live just 5 minutes from 2 Asian Brothers (not a fan of the name) and work 30 minutes away. Once in a while I order Banh Mi for my office, everyone just gets so excited. Our favorite is Pork Belly, then Roast Beef, and Vegetarian, and a few of us always get 2 sandwiches. The bread is great, and these sandwiches are probably the best in Chicago, even better than Pot Belly's.I have ordered fried rice, it is very good, not as good as fried rice at Viet Bowl in Uptown, but quite close.Chicken wings are good too but I think the wings at Great Sea restaurant (Albany Park, on Lawrence, west of Kedzie) are better.Over all, this is absolutely my favorite place to get Banh Mi.

13.description: I usually order the shredded beef sandwich and it never fails on me. The wings taste great on the side too! It's a nice place to grab a bite and even study in after. The smoothies could be a bit better but they still taste pretty good, but that won't stop me from going there again.

11.description: Was looking forward to trying this place, unfortunately I had a pretty disappointing experience.The good:- Clean, modern interior.- Prices seemed reasonable.- Pork and Shrimp spring rolls were great! Good size portion for $4 as well.The bad:- My entree was inedible as it reeked like wet dog. I got the combination meat fried rice and it looked good but smelled so bad I couldn't eat more than a few bites.- The guy helping me (younger white guy) wasn't too friendly.

39.description: I just opened an office for my business just a couple of blocks away on Foster Ave. I was sitting in the office debating what to do for lunch. Then I remembered I have seen this place a few times and researched them online.The ended up going here and I am glad I did. I got the shredded chicken sandwich and it was amazing. By far of my my favorite sandwiches I ever had. I told my wife we have to go again in the next couple of days for her to try it as well.The only reason I gave it a 4 star instead of a 5 star review is because I did the research of the menu before I went in and I knew what I wanted. It worked out perfectly for me. The menu they have in the the store does not have any descriptions about what is in the sandwich. It is such an easy fix I am surprised they did not already. So make sure to look up the menu online before going in.I am will there over and over again for lunch! So glad it is so close to my new office.

37.description: Good ethnic food at a FAIR PRICE! In my opinion Chicago is starved for places like this. Low priced niche food that isn't crap. Places like this are so rare. An 8 inch Vietnamese style sandwich for 4$? Excellent.

0.description: This was my very first bánh mì spot! Casual place with friendly staff eager to explain anything and everything on the menu.I absolutely LOVE the veggie bánh mì - it's loaded with sweet potato shreds, seasoned vermicelli noodles, shredded seasoned tofu, pickled daikon, shredded carrots, just the right amount of mayo and cilantro, and the baguette is always soft and warm.The smoothies are great too! Try an avocado one for an amazing flavor experience!

38.description: 2 more orders since 1st review and I'm expecting to go back! The shredded chicken was very good although just a tad bit more spice and flavor would have made it * * * * *Don't order from Grubhub within 30 mins of closing. I Live exactly 1 mile away and I couldn't place a pick-up order on GH at 9:01PM. I called on the phone and picked up my order 10 mins later, food was waiting when I walked in!

51.description: I got the #8 sauteed beef and it was pretty tasty. It's on the sweeter side with a little heat because of the jalapenos. The bread was soft and the ingredients were very fresh. They also sell boba tea but I didn't get to try it out Price range 5-7$ per mealI wouldn't say it's the best banh mi that I've ever tried but it was pretty good. If you're too lazy to drive all the way to argyle and you are on the northwest side of Chicago just drop by Asian Brothers. You won't be disappointed.

27.description: I live just 5 minutes from 2 Asian Brothers (not a fan of the name) and work 30 minutes away. Once in a while I order Banh Mi for my office, everyone just gets so excited. Our favorite is Pork Belly, then Roast Beef, and Vegetarian, and a few of us always get 2 sandwiches. The bread is great, and these sandwiches are probably the best in Chicago, even better than Pot Belly's.I have ordered fried rice, it is very good, not as good as fried rice at Viet Bowl in Uptown, but quite close.Chicken wings are good too but I think the wings at Great Sea restaurant (Albany Park, on Lawrence, west of Kedzie) are better.Over all, this is absolutely my favorite place to get Banh Mi.

32.description: I absolutely love this place! Friendly people and even better food. I normally get the banh mi special and or chicken wings. The abundance of meat per chicken wing and the flavors are just amazing. I've taken bites of other dishes like the bun thit nuong and the fried rice - all were delicious as well. They sell smoothies too. All in all, good food, service, and prices. Come get you some!

54.description: 2 Asian Brothers has fantastic food and wonderful customer service.  Their fried rice is full of flavor but not greasy.  Their bubble tea is excellent.  I highly recommend them!

48.description: A bit overpriced but better than Ba Le. I usually buy a few to eat within a couple of days. Heres a tip if you don't plan on eating the banh mi right away. Request that the veggies come separate and bread be not toasted. I usually throw the banh mi in the toaster oven when I'm ready to eat it. It tastes soo much better out of the oven since it makes the bread nice and crispy.

44.description: Good friendly nice comfortably noisy when it's crowded, food is great. My one cleanliness notice is the tables at the edges have a ring of grunge that you could cut your initials into or maybe write your name or draw a picture. The dining room table patrol needs a cutting agent.

24.description: I like to avoid meat when possible and I am a HUGE fan of the veggie Banh Mi sandwich here.  The french bread is very fresh and the sandwich itself is filling with some sort of fried starchy veggie inside (I can't remember the exact ingredient).  My kids love the smoothies and fried rice.  I would recommend this place for takeout, as the dining area is a little bit grubby and lacks a feeling of warmth.  But don't let that turn you off from the tasty food.

7.description: This has to be one of the best places for a beef fried rice. They never disappoint me and are extremely fast. They have the best chicken noodle soup. LOVE IT!

49.description: I am in love!The only place in Illinois that has BBQ Sandwich like this. I have only ever had it once before, and that was in NC.I tried the Boba Tea with cream....coconut was soooo good! Found this place, while we were just passing by.

40.description: A solid grubhub experience. The sandwiches are huge, the wings super flavorful & meaty, and the hot sauce with the spring rolls was HOT. The spring rolls themselves? BLAND. Will I order again? More than likely.

53.description: My first experience at 2 Asian Brother's was a carry-out experience, and it was great.I ordered their Asian wings (8 wings) and it was prepared in less than 10 minutes, fast service is always a plus. My order came with a side of fried rice, and I also ordered a Mango Boba Tea. The wings were around 8 dollars, my drink was 3 dollars. My order total came out to be less than $12.00The FoodAsian wings - Different from your traditional American wings. Their wings are like drumsticks, except on steroids. Plenty of meat, all you have to do is eat around the bone. I ordered the non-spicy and it tasted great. Will be back to try the spicy next time. Side of fried rice - The rice looked plain at first sight, but it tasted delicious. It's not loaded with oil and msg. Healthier and tastes better than your average carry-out rice; it's different. Big portion for a side, in my opinion.Mango Boba Tea - I live around the Chinatown area in Chicago and the average price of Boba Tea is around 4 dollars. 2 Asian Brother's Boba Teas were only 3 dollars, let's just say I'll be getting more bubble tea from 2 Asian Brother's in the future; great tasting tea. The boba can be a bit better though, a bit too soft. Overall: Quick serviceGreat food Reasonable/Cheap priceDifferent from your average asian carry-outDo recommend, and I will be back for more foods.

30.description: It's very ironic that this place is next to a Jimmy John's.  Here's a rule of being a Chicago foodie: when you see a commercial, national-chain restaurant, look around its proximity, and you will find something else...better!  It's a spacious, bright venue where many North Park University students are hanging out (I see lots of students flux into the door, and I followed right behind them).  I stopped by here to pick up some food for my dinner break at work since I dislike any of the choices at the Fashion Outlets in Rosemont.  I ordered the noodle salad with shrimp ($7), and the food was ready within ten (10) minutes.  I didn't consume it immediately, but it tasted just as delicious after three (3) hours of the time span leaving in the room temperature.  They had an ample amount of veggies, shrimps, and two (2) egg rolls that were done in Vietnamese style.  I liked that the sriracha sauce, Vietnamese vinegar, and the peanuts were in separated containers and placed on the side, so I could carry the entire meal on the bus without any sorts of leakage.  Otherwise, it would have been a disaster!  If you're a North Park University student, there's a Sunday meal special after 4pm.  I'm too old to be back to college.  That's for sure.  I will certainly come back for other items on the menu.  I like this place because it's located on Foster Ave., making it accessible to the CTA 92 bus.  There's a bus stop either on Kedzie or on Sawyer (in front of the Kronor restaurant).

46.description: Street noodles are excellent. We often get the classic which is pork, beef, shrimp, chicken. The wings are outstanding as well. Inexpensive, and portions are large enough that each one can be stretched out for 1.5-2 meals.

1.description: I came all the way from Wicker Park to try 2 Asian Brothers and I don't know who I should be more mad at: my friends for telling me it's good or the restaurant for providing not so tasty grub. Idk what to say really, my buddy Jorge and I ordered soooo many items off their menu because we were literally exuberant to be there. Actually, we were at least 10 times more excited then the kid taking our order who clearly saw his job as a burden.  We had:-Tuna bahn mi (not pictured)- chicken noodle soup- 2 orders of spicy wings- 2 pork belly baby sandwich things I forgot what they're called- fried rice& 2 mango smoothies.It was all below average quality.  The fried rice had absolutely no flavor. It actually tasted like nothing. The spicy wings were far from spicy and came out room temperature which is my absolute biggest pet peeve. The pork belly sandwiches were okay, but again were room temp. When I ordered to tuna bahn mi the kid at the register said,"are you sure you wanna get that?""Yeah, why not, is it not good?" I responded."No it's good, it just takes us so much work, because we have to open to can, drain the water and stuff." he said back."um..yeah, I want it." I finally responded.LOL! This kid seriously admitted to being too lazy to make my food. Ugh, I totally shoulda left that second, but was so hungry I had to stay. I'll never give these 2 Asian Brothers my money ever again. Oh and I'm pretty sure those smoothies gave me a cavity. There was such a ridiculous amount of sugar added to them my head and teeth started to ache.

55.description: I really like the food here. Great vegetarian options.  Great crispy bread rolls.  Good bahn mi. They come up short though in the bubble tea area.  They can't seem to get the tapioca right. It's either too chewy or slimy and clumped all together in in a big ball that won't go up your fat straw. They also have a problem with getting orders correct. I don't know if the college aged staff just doesn't pay attention or doesn't care but I'd estimate half of our drink orders are incorrect when we get them. We go there because beggars can't be choosers.  There isn't much bubble tea on the north side (lots of smoothie places though which aren't the same thing).

9.description: It's very ironic that this place is next to a Jimmy John's.  Here's a rule of being a Chicago foodie: when you see a commercial, national-chain restaurant, look around its proximity, and you will find something else...better!  It's a spacious, bright venue where many North Park University students are hanging out (I see lots of students flux into the door, and I followed right behind them).  I stopped by here to pick up some food for my dinner break at work since I dislike any of the choices at the Fashion Outlets in Rosemont.  I ordered the noodle salad with shrimp ($7), and the food was ready within ten (10) minutes.  I didn't consume it immediately, but it tasted just as delicious after three (3) hours of the time span leaving in the room temperature.  They had an ample amount of veggies, shrimps, and two (2) egg rolls that were done in Vietnamese style.  I liked that the sriracha sauce, Vietnamese vinegar, and the peanuts were in separated containers and placed on the side, so I could carry the entire meal on the bus without any sorts of leakage.  Otherwise, it would have been a disaster!  If you're a North Park University student, there's a Sunday meal special after 4pm.  I'm too old to be back to college.  That's for sure.  I will certainly come back for other items on the menu.  I like this place because it's located on Foster Ave., making it accessible to the CTA 92 bus.  There's a bus stop either on Kedzie or on Sawyer (in front of the Kronor restaurant).

26.description: Sometimes during a hectic day at the office, you need something delicious to keep you going for the rest of the work day. My coworkers and I were thinking about what to order for lunch, and someone mentioned 2 asian brothers which was right down the street. All of us ordered the wings which sounded amazing. The food arrived quickly and every thing was accounted for. Overall, delicious. The wings were perfectly cooked and the sauce was awesome, although I could have withstood a little spice. I also ordered bubble tea, which tasted like it was bought from a tea stand in rural Taiwan. New office and personal fav!

25.description: Best Southeast Asian takeout. Period. You won't be disappointed by a single item on their menu. One word: NOODLES. Get them. STAT. You won't be disappointed. Oh, and second word: WINGS. The prices literally cannot be beat on the entire North Side.  This is the stuff legends are made of. 5 trend-setting stars.

12.description: I've never eaten here. I tried to. I called them to place an order for pick up so we could have breakfast on our way to work. I asked for, "Bun Thit Nuong." Whoops, they guy didn't understand Viet! My fault. Then I asked for grilled pork which is typical for every viet sandwich place to have. They didn't have this on their menu! So I opted for their special then.If anything couldn't get any worse... They didn't have bread.

59.description: Good spot! I love the sandwiches and I eat there regularly for lunch. Be prepared for an awkward cashier moment, they are just as consistent as the sandwiches. If you don't do pork, say so most sandwiches come with it. I always get shredded chicken. Good food and ingredients.

21.description: One of my favorite neighborhood places. My favorite is their Asian Wings. They are cooked to perfection and super crispy.

17.description: I just opened an office for my business just a couple of blocks away on Foster Ave. I was sitting in the office debating what to do for lunch. Then I remembered I have seen this place a few times and researched them online.The ended up going here and I am glad I did. I got the shredded chicken sandwich and it was amazing. By far of my my favorite sandwiches I ever had. I told my wife we have to go again in the next couple of days for her to try it as well.The only reason I gave it a 4 star instead of a 5 star review is because I did the research of the menu before I went in and I knew what I wanted. It worked out perfectly for me. The menu they have in the the store does not have any descriptions about what is in the sandwich. It is such an easy fix I am surprised they did not already. So make sure to look up the menu online before going in.I am will there over and over again for lunch! So glad it is so close to my new office.

10.description: We got the street noodles with chicken and rolls . The noodles are very good ! They have a nice flavor to them and it's enough to share . The rolls are not something I would get again . They had a fresh taste to them due to the  mint but the sauces with them needed more flavor . The service is fast and friendly .

5.description: Great food and fast service!! I've had the bbq pork noodle salad and bbq banh mi. Portions are big for the price that you pay. Their coconut milk tea($3) is delicious!! Tapioca (+$0.25) is soft, in a good way!

3.description: Everything here is incredible! I have tried every sandwich and smoothie, more than one time. As soon as you walk in, you definitely smell the fresh bread.

35.description: Just went in for lunch and have to say it was very good.  My disappointment came when I went to wash my hands afterward's (had very tasty wings), there was just one other patron in there AND THE MENS ROOM WAS ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING!!!  No excuses for it to be that bad.  They even had 3 soap dispensers and NOT ONE worked.  Needless to say , it was my first and last visit.

19.description: I absolutely love this place! Friendly people and even better food. I normally get the banh mi special and or chicken wings. The abundance of meat per chicken wing and the flavors are just amazing. I've taken bites of other dishes like the bun thit nuong and the fried rice - all were delicious as well. They sell smoothies too. All in all, good food, service, and prices. Come get you some!

28.description: Always thrilled to find another place to get bahn mi, especially within driving distance. The chicken wings are delicious and the sandwiches (I tried the chicken and BBQ pork sandwiches) are tasty and filling. Wish they offered delivery to my area, but it's not too far. I was thrilled they had a parking lot. Everyone in my family was quite satisfied--even the preschooler. Worth another visit!

45.description: Wings are pretty good and the sandwiches are average.  Soup disgusting.. waiting forever for my food just to see him get my soup out of a gigantic pot and microwave it in the styrofoam.  :(

33.description: Great food where you can taste each natural ingredient. I have not been here before but the food is good and well prepared. Had the shreaded chicken sandwich which is a STEAL at $5.  Can't wait to return and try the rest of the menu.  Lost the last star because bottled OJ tasted old.

43.description: Just ate there for lunch again. Not the most stellar bánh mi but really good. Every thing is always really good. The place is clean and the service is always nice and timely. We will eat there again and again. I really enjoy the smoothies too.

2.description: All you need is the 8 Asian wings with extra rice: super affordable for 2 people, and consistently great! Spread the Sriracha over the fried rice and you'll never need to go anywhere else for Asian wings. Hillsongs fans would love this place as well with it being on repeat almost every time I've stopped by. The atmosphere is great and always clean. Could the layout of the seats been a bit more aesthetic to avoid giving a cafeteria feel? Yea...but free wifi and reasonably priced meals will keep one from skipping the lunch line. Top your meal off with their vietnamese iced coffee and you'll be coming back for seconds soon!

18.description: One of my favorite neighborhood places. My favorite is their Asian Wings. They are cooked to perfection and super crispy.

41.description: 2 Asian Brothers is my staple when it comes to banh mi. I always get the number 4 (shredded chicken) but the number 1 (classic) is quickly becoming my favorite. I haven't tried the street noodles or chicken wings but am excited to do so. The banh mis are always crispy and slathered in mayo and pate, which just brings music to my tastebuds. The smoothies are also delicious and fresh, the boba sometimes too soft but still, very delicious. The employees are always nice to me and orders always come out in about 5-7 minutes. Sometimes the dining area is left messy because it does get busy, but the food honestly makes up for it. Plus unlimited sriracha and maggi sauce!!!Beat that nhu lan. I don't know why everyone loves it so much honestly..

52.description: the banh mi is on point, quick and delicious. smoothies are good too but thats not why you go here. they seem very involved in the colleges/community. parking sucks sometimes. though they recently raised prices its still an extremely cheap meal (depending on the sanwich, about $6) if youre in the area go!

50.description: Was going to stop in for a bite at Jimmy Johns down the street but have been meaning to check out this place an see what it was about. Had the chicken ban mi sandwich and my wife had the noodle salad. First thought that came to mind when we got our food was "Nice, you get a lot of food for the money here."Both things we ordered tasted great, my sandwich wasn't too dry an the salad was real fresh an not at all heavy. The atmosphere is pretty standard, the food comes on plastic trays an the sound of bubble teas being made reminds you that you could have a bubble tea, but also that you wish people would stop ordering them so you could have a moment to think. Overall however we'd certainly go back. Try an watch out for the rush that comes when the nearby high school lets out, nudge nudge wink wink.

4.description: Gotta agree with Juan R. and the other 1 or 2 star reviews.  This place is blandtown.  I have no idea how it got any hype.  My guess is that you got some college kids from North Park that grew up in the Chicago burbs who don't know anything other than chain restaurant food.  They tasted something a little different and new to them and created the hype that is unwarranted.My roommate and I split the fried rice bowl, a roast beef bahn mi, and some crab rangoons.  First, the fried rice was just plain tasteless.  All you need to do is add some salt and oil, and you got some basic flavor for your fried rice; they failed to do this.  The chicken looked and tasted like it was boiled then slightly plan fried.  Even worse is that they charge you extra for the spicy variation. Secondly, while the baguette for the bahn mi was on par, everything else was just whack.  The roast beef was basically store bought sandwich beef, but not even deli quality but the ones that come in a sealed bag that is buy 2 for 1.  Also, too much mayo to hide the lack of flavor.Lastly, the crab rangoon.  I love crab rangoon.  If it's on the menu, I will order it.  If i'm at a chinese buffet, it's on every plate I get.  I'm not a snob about it, but I can appreciate when it is done well.  Well, the crab rangoon was tasteless too. It is cheese and deep fried dough.  IDK how you can make that bland, but the geniuses at 2AB have done it.  Without the hype, maybe I give this place a 2 or 3 star review.  Maybe the owners were good cooks that produced tasty food when it first opened.  IDK if they still cook or not, but this is a place to avoid.

6.description: Great quick food if you're in the area. Packed with college students and teenagers because of the schools nearby. The service is generally quick an the staff is friendly. The decor is plain but clean and modern. I recommend the chicken fried rice! I use to come here more often but stopped after I  found a hair in my food :( The deal on sundays for NPU students is awesome especially if you're on a budget.

22.description: They have very good pork fried rice, but I'm giving them 3 stars cause I'm annoyed they charge extra if you want spicy. Who does that? Their sandwiches are dry, I've had better. Avocado smoothie is not well made, it's full of ice and sugar. I think they use 1/4 avocado , while other places use at least 1/2.

15.description: I heard the hype. Didn't live up to it. Food was mediocre at best. They charge for spice level. And cilantro was on everything.  Not horrible. But not something I would come back to.
