57.description: This place is so awesome!I go to school near this place and I just love going there during my breaks and getting a shredded chicken sandwich or a rice bowl. Cheap, filling, and delicious!

20.description: Great food. The fried rice is a bit on the oily side. It would be great if they can reduce the oil in the foods. The band mi sandwich is awesome but their salad... not so much, there's like barely anything to eat.

36.description: I had a great experience at this place. If I told them we were going to get Vietnamese food, they would've balked. But I told them that we were going to get noodles and smoothies - and they loved it. The folks behind the counter were very friendly and helpful. Best of all, they were patient with my kids choosing smooth flavors. We all got street noodles which come in *very* generous portions and aren't greasy, which is great. My only minor issue was that I ordered mine spicy, and they weren't that hot. But honestly, I think we're going to become regulars.

14.description: Such a treat! Their street noodles are delicious. The flavor is wonderful and you can get them in varying degrees of spiciness. The sandwiches are great as are their spring rolls. The place is super clean and the staff is so nice and helpful. Finish off with a smoothie--especially if you eat something spicy!

58.description: This place is great. Met a friend here this morning. I got non dairy hot chocolate (made with soy milk and dairy free syrup) and since I bought a medium drink I got a free donut. Gave it to my boyfriend (since i'm allergic to gluten) This is a deal they have there daily. They have free wifi. Laura was very nice. It's a new business, they've been here since May. After reading what other people have said in their reviews, I'm hoping they don't go out of business. This place is is on the corner down my street and now that I've been in here, I'd love to return for morning coffee/hot chocolate with friends in the future. They have AMAZING looking pastries and chocolates. I can't eat them with my gluten/dairy allergy, but if they made gluten free/vegan cakes, I'd definitely stop in and get one. They look like they know what they're doing. My friend bought a box of truffles for her girlfriend and Laura wrapped it up really nicely. It was an adorable package. I'm glad i have this option opposed to starbucks. I really prefer independent businesses considering I run one myself. This place has great quality. I'd buy the chocolates/truffles for my valentine.

56.description: I've been here a couple times since my first review and many of the "kinks" seem to have been worked out.  The free donut with your coffee before 11am is pretty nice and tasty.  And as I said before, the chocolate treats are tasty.  I'm still not blown away by most of the baked goods and the coffee is just unoffensive.  I am coming around to it a little more...

29.description: Ok, I only indulged in 2 pieces of chocolate, but they really were 'woohoo!  as good as it gets!'  That award winning dark chocolate that they make is, by itself, worth living for.  I also had a fleur de sel caramel.  Delicious.  I don't know if it was a blessing or a curse that I was already 200 miles away from the store when I ate them.  I do know it is worth seeking out this shop.  My friend who introduced me to them assures me that the brownies are top notch.  I checked the website... it doesn't appear that they ship.  Bummer.Go Green!  Go White!  :-)

42.description: Just stopped in Beijo for the first time this morning.  The owner was very lovely and told me they had an offer for buy a drink, get a free doughnut. I opted for the decaf latte and a sugar doughnut. The coffee was fair tending towards the weak side.  My favorite decaf is Intelligentsia's Black Cat. But... the doughnut was truly lovely, light, airy with just the right amount of sugar dusting. They have beautiful chocolate Easter boxes that I am going to head back to get next week.  I felt very welcomed and am looking forward to trying out their crepes on Saturday!

23.description: Love this place. what a delight and unique experience. A great addition to the neighborhood. They owners are always they're  i love the Portuguese and french combo. The chocolate is amazing: i've had booth of the sampler boxes, tried three types of toffee. If you're having a craving this is the place. They have free wifi as well i ordered a tiramisu coffe which almost to good. My girlfriend got pumpkin coffe but she didn't really like it. That being said the owners are so passionate and the service is great and it really makes a difference. Saturday morning crepes are also a must if you have a chance.

47.description: Beijo is a lovely little chocolate shop, that adds a touch of character to the North Park/Albany Park neighborhood. Laura and Krunch are fantastic people that know their customers and aim to please. They're chocolates are very good. I love that there is always something new in the case. They have a variety of goodies from truffles, to cakes, muffins, and gourmet dog treats. They even hold monthly wine tastings, and serve specialty crepes on Saturday mornings.Beijo is on the pricey side. But the all the chocolate creations are quality goods. You can get a cup of regular coffee there, but I'll be honest it's not that great. Instead I highly recommend their teas. They have a great selection of high quality loose leaf teas. So drop in around breakfast time, order a Beijo (medium) sized tea, get a free monster doughnut, and try some of their chocolate.

8.description: I worked in a chocolate factory for many years and I must say these are some of the best I have ever had.If you LOVE chocolate like I do go now! You will be very happy you did.

31.description: I've been here a handful of times and I've never been disappointed. They have good customer service every time I've come in. Doughnuts - awesome. I've loved every single doughnut I've had from them. Chocolate covered Twinkie - a little too much chocolate for me but it was still tasty. Chocolate Milk- Okay this LOOKED weird. Not what I was expecting, it had ice in it. But it satisfied my craving and it did not taste weird at all. It was really good! Cupcakes - I've had them once. The cake itself is decent but man the frosting is good! I'll be back for more. Chocolate shakes- so good. Again not what I was expecting but yummy. It had a rich coco taste or something. The chocolate milk did too. It's different than what i'm used to but it's good! I've had a couple of their chocolates and they are good as well. When i'm craving Chocolate, this is where I go! :)

34.description: I heartily affirm what John B. wrote:  hooray for the small business owner who is proud of her wares.  I appreciate an interaction with a shopkeeper which imparts me with useful information preparatory to making a purchasing decision, without feeling aggressively sales-y.  After a few minutes of solo browsing, I was certain of what I wanted, but after the owner's description of their international-award-winning Brazilian brigadeiros...well, I had to buy a couple of those too.  So the sales pitch worked, but it was the cheeriest and least pushy sales pitch that you can imagine.So how was the brigadeiro?  Wonderful.  The dark chocolate was my favorite, but the milk chocolate was also delightful.  Of course I didn't walk out with nothing but a couple of chocolates.  The chocolate-covered pretzels were excellent, and for once I have found a chocolatier who doesn't use stale pretzels--or allow their pretzels to become stale before being sold.  And the chocolate-chip cookies ($5.50 for a bag of about a dozen), while plain, are also quite good.I enjoyed several of the truffles, but while the chocolate quality is very high, most seem lacking in their own special flavor.  For example, the chili-cinnamon chocolate was delicious but I would love to feel some more heat.  Similarly, the peppermint bark featured fantastic chocolate but little peppermint.  This was a theme as I tried several other candies--cappuccino, coconut, chai.  Excellent chocolate, but not enough overall flavor.Beijo de Chocolat is definitely worth a visit if you are anywhere near and/or in a sweet mood.  Support your local chocolatier!

16.description: Recently hosted a baby shower and asked Laura to make the cake.  Two layers of amazing!  One guest (happily married) asked if whoever made the cake was single, as he would gladly divorce his wife to marry the baker!We actually fought over the leftovers.....winners were obviously the expectant parents but they had to fight for it.  Love, Love, Love Beijo!!!

13.description: I heartily affirm what John B. wrote:  hooray for the small business owner who is proud of her wares.  I appreciate an interaction with a shopkeeper which imparts me with useful information preparatory to making a purchasing decision, without feeling aggressively sales-y.  After a few minutes of solo browsing, I was certain of what I wanted, but after the owner's description of their international-award-winning Brazilian brigadeiros...well, I had to buy a couple of those too.  So the sales pitch worked, but it was the cheeriest and least pushy sales pitch that you can imagine.So how was the brigadeiro?  Wonderful.  The dark chocolate was my favorite, but the milk chocolate was also delightful.  Of course I didn't walk out with nothing but a couple of chocolates.  The chocolate-covered pretzels were excellent, and for once I have found a chocolatier who doesn't use stale pretzels--or allow their pretzels to become stale before being sold.  And the chocolate-chip cookies ($5.50 for a bag of about a dozen), while plain, are also quite good.I enjoyed several of the truffles, but while the chocolate quality is very high, most seem lacking in their own special flavor.  For example, the chili-cinnamon chocolate was delicious but I would love to feel some more heat.  Similarly, the peppermint bark featured fantastic chocolate but little peppermint.  This was a theme as I tried several other candies--cappuccino, coconut, chai.  Excellent chocolate, but not enough overall flavor.Beijo de Chocolat is definitely worth a visit if you are anywhere near and/or in a sweet mood.  Support your local chocolatier!

11.description: Beijo is Portuguese for 'kisses,' like Bisou in French. It is pronounced 'Bay Joe.'The chocolates are superb. Beijo is across the street from North Park University and around the corner from WTTW Channel 11 studios. Best of all, it is only a short skip and a jump from the Tre Kronor and the Sweden Shop, making holidays a breeze when gathering ideas.

39.description: The chocolates are decadent and the Saturday morning crepes are some of the best sweet-style crepes I've had in Chicago. I took off a star for the limited hours. They close too early for me to stop in after work on the weekdays and my Saturdays are often busy, so I can't stop in nearly as often as I'd like. Also, they should really work on their website. It doesn't reflect the level of sophistication that I would expect for this type of business.

37.description: Went here once this summer & had some great ganache cupcakes & thought I found my new favorite place. One morning a few weeks ago i picked up muffins which from all appearances looked delicious but sadly were hard, tasteless and definitely sitting in the display for a while. What a disappointment!

0.description: Crepes and Quiche Saturdays are the BEST! And the service is always friendly. We love coming here and will miss them when they go :(

38.description: "What can I get you for Christmas?""Remember that chocolate place by your house that we went to? Their peppermint bark was life-changing. I'd love that."During a staycation in a downtown hotel, I first saw a review of Beijo de Chocolat, an award-winning Brazilian style confectionery, on one of those low-budget produced-for-the-hotel Places to Go features. It completely slipped my mind until I was exploring my new neighborhood and realized the danger of being within spitting-distance from a world class chocolate shop. Unfortunately, their hours don't mesh so well with my work schedule so it wasn't until I was walking to weekend brunch at Tre Kronor that I finally caught them during business hours.Homey, quiet, and warm, Beijo is the epitome of a perfect neighborhood hangout. With a menu of crepes, chocolates, and perfect Lavazza coffee, I pray for the day I'm allowed to telecommute and hide in here with my laptop and a plate of sweets. Standouts are their truffles of all varieties. I particularly love the cappuccino and brigadeiros, their specialty. The latter are dense, creamy morsels of chocolate covered in silky milk and dark chocolate shells. Their peppermint bark, too, was delicious with chunks of peppermint stick throughout dark and creamy white chocolate. As far as the baked goods? From my experience-- pass. The chocolate cake tasted dry and stale.Service was enthusiastic and friendly. The man on working the register was very knowledgeable about available products and eager to tell us about the history of the shop. So, uh, anyone want to join me for one of their decadent brunches one of these days?

51.description: My oldest daughter has been here several times.  She just loves Beijo and their many chocolate treats.  So my wife and I decided to stop and sample some treats.  Well about $67 dollars later we left just loving Beijo and their chocolates.  The owners are so nice, they are some of the sweetest people we have met.We ordered two large boxes of their candies.  We had the orange chocolate, mint chocolate, dark chocolate, peanut butter cups and a couple of their award winning varieties.  Two bags of their teas.  And a coconut and pineapple smoothie, heavy on the coconut which I like a lot.So if you are craving some chocolate treats and happen to be near the Albany Park area stop over at Beijo de Chocolat to satisfy your chocolate cravings.  And also received some outstanding customer service.

27.description: Do you have a sweet tooth? Me too!Apparently, my beagle does as well. I was walking my beagle and realized this charming store was open, went inside to see doughnuts, chocolates, caramel, candy, chocolate bars galore! I ordered a coffee and was told there is a free doughnut with coffee purchase. Yes please, Wow, the doughnuts are huge! I bought another doughnut, cinnamon-sugar crusted, to be nice to Boyfriend, sleeping in after a very long week at work. Those cinnamon-sugar doughnuts are so big, fluffy, light and delicious that my Beagle wondered what all the fuss was about... even after I gave him a minuscule bite of my own...Then as Boyfriend slept in, Beagle waited for his moment, crept into the kitchen, jumped the counter and devoured the entire doughnut. Yes, the whole thing, which I'm sure was bigger than his beagle tummy. The sugar-evidence was all over his snout, he even dragged the torn and empty bag remains to his bed, where he cuddled with the sweet smell, remembering how good his free doughnut tasted. My beagle is a hungry thief and a huffing hoarder who appreciates fine baked goods a little too enthusiastically. I tried to take the shredded bag and he growled at me. I can't blame him, That's how good these are. Every morning since, I check to see, wishing we have enough time to go to buy a couple doughnuts and share... with deprived Boyfriend, who sadly, is the only one in the house who has not yet tried these remarkable doughnuts... I always seem to be running heartbreakingly late, too late to buy doughnuts. When I have an extra twenty minutes, one of these mornings, that doughnut will be sublime...They are truly a delightful treat. Un-officially endorsed by my beagle.

32.description: Just had a terrible experience here.  Like another reviewer, we bought a groupon for this neighborhood chocolatier and were excited to use it. However, due to their early closing time, it was difficult for us to get there.  Our first attempt was on December 23rd.  My husband went in to buy some hostess gifts with our groupon for the holidays and was denied.  Mind you there was no stipulation, just something they decided to make up.  Frustrated, we decided we would still give them a shot.  Then we came in today to use it and on the groupon it states the expiration date for today and the business owners argued with us about how it was wrong and refused to bend on it, turning away many groupon purchasers.  They kept stating that they were right and then said oh well you can still use the $15 YOU PAID.  Uhh, yeah. That's no favor.   We had my mother-in-law with us who is an avid chocolate eater, so we cashed in my already paid $15 and it turns out the chocolate was not as smooth and creamy as my mother-in-law craves.  Local businesses are wonderful when they treat you well and serve excellent products.  This is one local business we will never return to.

54.description: [edited @ bottom.]  Okay, so I'm trying with all of my might to love this place.  I mean, it's right down the road, totally cutesy, and locally owned.  Buuut, it's not quite happening.I've been in there a few times now, and don't get me wrong, the owners are so sweet and welcoming!  This place has a great atmosphere, so if you're trying to escape the bustle of Starbucks or the like, Beijo could be for you.I will also note that on weekdays you get a free donuts with the purchase of a regular coffee before 11am.  Mind you, you should bring cash if you want to take advantage of this deal because there is a $5 minimum for credit, or they add $.50 to your purchase. On one occasion, I was in while one of the owners was making peanut butter cookies.  They were fresh out of the oven, and boy were they nummy! However, every time that I buy a typical baked good here, I am severely disappointed. One night, my very sweet husband brought me home both a heart-shaped cookie and a brownie from Beijo.  I was so delighted...until I realized they were both unbelievably stale.  I'm not talking just a little hard-to-chew stale, I'm talking crumbles-when-you-bite-it-and-my-dog-wouldn't-even-eat-this stale.  That was my first Beijo encounter, and let me just say...it left a bad taste in my mouth.Since then, I've been back a few times (seriously, I've tried so hard to love this place!) and every time it's the same.  I bought my husband a dozen cookies...stale again! (I know...maybe I should have learned my lesson, right?)I've also gotten the coffee/doughnut deal, and the coffee is just mediocre.  Also, the donuts are...well, just okay.  I love donuts (should I be admitting that?), but I didn't even finish my chocolate-sprinkle donut from here.  They weren't stale, but were just a little tough or something.  Not that squishy delicious taste you hope for when biting into a donut.On the upside, my husband did bring me some chocolates one day, and they were very good! I think, overall, they have potential, but they need to figure out a labeling/dating system...and when it's just time to throw it away!In the meantime, steer clear of the cookies!//edit:So, it's been a long time coming, but I'm finally taking a minute to update my review. I should note that I really should have made it a point to update sooner- I mean, if I can take time to tear someone down, shouldn't I go all the more out of my way to lift them up? Down to business: Laura & Krunch are just as sweet as ever, and are both genuine and generous. My North Park Spanish class meets there on Fridays, and almost without fail, Krunch will bring us over a treat, or something new to try. This was how I tried a donut again for the first time since my last experience. And I must say, it really was a perfect donut. I won't describe it in detail because unfortunately, I think many of us are well-acquainted with the implications of this. i also have taken a liking to the hot chocolate, especially because Krunch always offers little marshmallows AND whipped cream. Yup! Laura and Krunch have obviously made vast improvements in there labeling & dating system, because I haven't had a stale anything since before my previous review. I really enjoy their muffins- there is a wide selection, and they don't just have the run-of-the-mill options. At Beijo, I really enjoy the atmosphere, the people, and every treat/drink I have tried thus far. I also really like the supporting local part. As with almost any local spot, the prices tend to be a little bit higher, but they are consistent, and It's obvious that they try to keep them as low as possible and still keep their business profitable. So just expect it and you'll be fine. I consider Beijo to have joined the Albany Park family, and I'm so glad to have them in the neighborhood. Great for a date/studying/quick cup of coffee.

48.description: I love beijo. Free doughnuts with a cheap (but good) medium coffee before 11. Great neighborhood alternative to Starbucks! Awesome addition to the neighborhood.  Frequented by North Park students.  Great people too! Saturday Crepes and chocolates are phenomenal!

44.description: visited this place before the auto show.very creamy and rich treats.i'll be back later this year for more.

24.description: i serendipitously found beijo de chocolat when i had to drop off a package at the ups store next door on an early saturday morning.  i hadn't had my coffee fix yet so i walked right in and was fully embraced with a divine smell of chocolate and coffee!  i purchased a latte and carrot muffin and spoke briefly with the owner, laura.  she gave us a history lesson on beijo de chocolat and how they were awarded as one of the best chocolatiers in america.  our conversation led to ordering a birthday cake for my grandson, maximus' first birthday which was delicious.  btw, the carrot muffin i consumed was moist and full of flavor and went so well with my latte.  the moment of consumption just made the rest of my saturday morning bearable.

7.description: My wife and I bought 10 truffles and cut them in half. What a wonderful sharing experience. Our favorites were The Tropicana (explosion of flavor), The Holy Cow, The Love you long time, Lime, milk beijo. These were awesome. We also had the apple pie toffee which made us feel like we were eating a fresh apple pie. It's our new favorite candy store in Chicago.

49.description: I'd like to give this place a better review. Haven't tried the chocolates or crepes, but I hear they're good. The coffee is OK. Staff is very friendly. Similar to a few other reviewers, I've found their baked goods to be stale at least twice. My husband got a stale donut from them last year and has never gone back. They could also have a little bit more variety, eg. by 10:30 in the morning they were already out of scones. I live close by--hoping they improve!

40.description: What a place!  The chocolate is exquisite!  Hand-made treats, with italian names, you can't go wrong.  Even the donuts are some of the best I've had (make sure to get the chocolate-covered ones).  If you order a medium coffee in the morning, you get a free donut too.  Although the coffee is mediocre, the donut sure makes up for this.The owners of this store are some of the kindest people around.  They'll come and chat with you if you aren't busy, and they're eager to hear what you think.  And try the crepes on special days, cause they're loaded with goodness.  Definitely stop in and get some chocolate!

53.description: {Flashback two months ago}Doctor: "Yea, so you're technically obese so we need to set weight loss goals before it starts to affect your health."Me: "I'm obese?? Shut. . . Up!!"Doctor: "TECHNICALLY you are, but not grossly or morbidly of course!"Me: "I don't see why I would be technically obese. I'm pretty active. Hmmmn. . . ."{Flash forward back to yesterday after coming from working out}Me [gleefully walking out of Beijo de Chocolat with mini ganache covered chocolate cake in hand]: "Ohhhhhh, that's why."Seriously not the place you want to come when trying to become non-technically-obese, because the chocolate here is wonderful. I ate that mini cake over the course of two days, and it kept nicely in the fridge. The cake was the type that's like a 2nd cousin to brownies. You kinda get what I mean? The ganache was smooth and not rock hard or extremely bitter tasting like a lot of other places. Just wonderful, I tell you.Ah, but after my enlightenment I resolved to save this place for treat time which I'm not due for for a while. But I'm sure BDC will be there to deliver the goods when it's time. Mmmmmmmnnnn. . . choc-o-lat.

30.description: Beijo de Chocolat is a a staple in the North Park neighborhood and a wonderful place to hangout, relax, and have a cup of coffee.  The staff there is very kind and willing to go the extra mile to ensure you have the best visit possible, and the goods they offer do not disappoint.  While I have only died the drip coffee there (which is very good), the offer a variety of milk based coffee drinks ranging from lattes to mochas to their own creations.  From when they open their doors till 11 am, they offer a free donut to anyone who purchases a coffee- and the donuts are delicious.  The one item that I recommend to everyone is their cheese scone- and they are to die for.  You have to try one!  Their chocolate chip cookies are also a great treat as well.  With the exception of the donuts everything is made at the store, which leads me to the items that they sell that I have yet to try.  They produce cookies, cakes, chocolates, cupcakes, and bread as well.  This is a great spot to visit in the neighborhood and I highly recommend stopping by!

46.description: Mid-afternoon, weekday, we stopped in for coffee and treats.PROS:1) VERY cute place. Tables and chairs in front of the window, so you can enjoy the winter sunshine. More tables along the wall, facing the bakery display case. Cozy and friendly. 2) Good crowd. Beijo is very close to North Park University. Saw students, teachers, as well as neighborhood moms with their kids.3) Nice display and variety. Lots of chocolates, of course. Some donuts left from morning baking, along with a small variety of cupcakes. Also saw scones. Beijo offers crepes on Saturday, but alas and alack, we came on a weekday.4) Coffee of the day was excellent! If the basic coffee isn't good, you can forget all the fancy stuff. This was really good.5) Reasonable prices.6) The owner, Laura, is charming and informative.7) And, though nothing to do with the business itself, I found free street parking in the neighborhood, and was able to give an etheric middle-finger salute to His High and Mighty Daley and his army of sycophants known as the City Council.CONS:1) My peanut butter cookie was dry and thin. Could have been sitting there for a week (probably wasn't). Dunking it in the coffee helped, a little. Disappointment.2) My chocolate cupcake with ganache was incredibly dry. The few bites of ganache gave it a little moistness. Not good. More disappointment.OTHER:My friend bought several pieces of the chocolate, and took them all with. I will leave it to her to write her own review.FINALE:I'd probably try it again, based on the excellent coffee, and all the other pluses. However, the fact that two treats were dry and not good makes me very nervous. At least one of them should have been good. Neither one was.

1.description: I've been here many many times over the years. I stopped going a year or two ago because, despite some very positive things, I felt it was expensive for the quality and that they really did not keep their items fresh. I'm an avid baker, have some food business experience, and a constant consumer of all treats of all kinds! My husband bought me a bunch of treats from here this week and I was excited to give them another try. The owners are so nice! They are clearly putting in tons of effort and trying to make this a special spot. Unfortunately it's the same old problem.. The cookies and candy were far from fresh. I want to love this place and support a cute local business, but they are doing themselves a huge disservice by keeping products around for way way way too long. From a business perspective I understand how hard it is to throw away product, but if it means you lose customers because no one wants to pay premium prices for week old baked goods... How is it possibly worth it?

55.description: after tre kroner we stop here for chocolates. I dunno that whole area reminds me of montreal (just a little). love the chocolates from here. they are all homemade and the employees are helpful and friendly. yum!

9.description: Do you have a sweet tooth? Me too!Apparently, my beagle does as well. I was walking my beagle and realized this charming store was open, went inside to see doughnuts, chocolates, caramel, candy, chocolate bars galore! I ordered a coffee and was told there is a free doughnut with coffee purchase. Yes please, Wow, the doughnuts are huge! I bought another doughnut, cinnamon-sugar crusted, to be nice to Boyfriend, sleeping in after a very long week at work. Those cinnamon-sugar doughnuts are so big, fluffy, light and delicious that my Beagle wondered what all the fuss was about... even after I gave him a minuscule bite of my own...Then as Boyfriend slept in, Beagle waited for his moment, crept into the kitchen, jumped the counter and devoured the entire doughnut. Yes, the whole thing, which I'm sure was bigger than his beagle tummy. The sugar-evidence was all over his snout, he even dragged the torn and empty bag remains to his bed, where he cuddled with the sweet smell, remembering how good his free doughnut tasted. My beagle is a hungry thief and a huffing hoarder who appreciates fine baked goods a little too enthusiastically. I tried to take the shredded bag and he growled at me. I can't blame him, That's how good these are. Every morning since, I check to see, wishing we have enough time to go to buy a couple doughnuts and share... with deprived Boyfriend, who sadly, is the only one in the house who has not yet tried these remarkable doughnuts... I always seem to be running heartbreakingly late, too late to buy doughnuts. When I have an extra twenty minutes, one of these mornings, that doughnut will be sublime...They are truly a delightful treat. Un-officially endorsed by my beagle.

26.description: This review is written from the perspective of a coffee junkie who walked in with the hopes of finding a great cuppa joe and a decent muffin.The gentleman behind the counter was friendly enough -- actually super friendly to the young ladies coming over from North Park University. Ahem.The coffee was just coffee -- nothing special -- I was surprised it was served in paper/styrofoam and not in a mug as I did not order to go.The carrot muffin was nasty.  It was bland, hard and crusty (not the hard and crusty in a good way either, but in the been sitting out too long way).Yes, I know, this is a chocolate shop -- I will go back sometime and try a morsel or two sometime -- although even some of the candies appeared as if they had been under the lights a long while.  I suggest  this shop clean the coffee maker regularly and start brewing something delicious like Metropolis or another independent local.

25.description: I think one thing to keep in mind when going to Beijo is that their chocolates/candies/truffles are bomb! The service is great too. It is obvious how passionate the owners are about their business from the second you walk in. The coffee, on the other hand, not so bomb. It's not even bad, it just really has absolutely no taste. I love good coffee, and after going to school in this neighborhood for years, I know I would have spent more time in Beijo is their coffee/espresso was 50% better. Maybe I am a bit harsh, but really, college students love coffee and places that are open at weird hours of the night.

12.description: Ok, I only indulged in 2 pieces of chocolate, but they really were 'woohoo!  as good as it gets!'  That award winning dark chocolate that they make is, by itself, worth living for.  I also had a fleur de sel caramel.  Delicious.  I don't know if it was a blessing or a curse that I was already 200 miles away from the store when I ate them.  I do know it is worth seeking out this shop.  My friend who introduced me to them assures me that the brownies are top notch.  I checked the website... it doesn't appear that they ship.  Bummer.Go Green!  Go White!  :-)

59.description: I live in the North Park/Albany Park area, where I often find myself setting up lunch or coffee meetings, so I've tried Beijo out a few times with friends or co-workers as an alternative to Starbucks down the street.The chef (can't remember her name right now) is really sweet and smiley and loves telling you about her newest creations. Her boyfriend Krunch (yes, his name is Krunch! it's short for some long eastern European name), is also very friendly and quite proud of the establishment.As someone else posted, the chocolates here are great, as they should be! If you are expecting a trendy cupcake like you can get elsewhere in Chicago, that's not quite up Beijo's alley. What disappoints me most about Beijo, however, is their coffee. I am a big coffee fan and so far have tried the brewed coffee and a couple lattes (one with flavoring) and they have been a little weak and not quite right. A friend of mine loves their loose-leaf tea, so I might be switching to that next time I go. The ambience could use some help - I'm also not crazy about the glass-top tables and the big flat screen TV. They do have wireless internet, but I can't imagine hanging out there for much longer than an hour. I definitely won't be giving up on Starbucks for the occasional meeting, but I will still try Beijo every now and then as well. Check it out and see what you think!

21.description: We've been searching for a nice chocolate place to frequent since Mr. Canaday closed up shop.  We definitely enjoyed Beijo.  We ordered several chocolate varieties to take home- all were delicious.  The coffee was decent (not perfect) and we also received some very good free doughnuts.  We must return.

17.description: This is a phenomenal shop off foster! It's definitely a hidden gem in the North/Albany park neighborhood. Whenever I go in I am always warmly welcomed by the owner (I think she's the owner, that is). It is definitely my favorite place to enjoy a coffee/treat and study. The atmosphere/lighting is always nice and the music is never too loud. The only thing I would like more is if it was open a little later as I think the college students across the street might come and study more at night.

10.description: Great neighborhood spot. I'm taking advantage of the free WiFi while waiting for car repairs. Krunch and the other customers are very welcoming and friendly to regulars, neighbors, and new faces.

5.description: I stopped by there to get a quick coffee and some sweets before work.  I wasn't expecting much from a place like this, yet the people who own this are genuinely nice people.  I was so warmly greeted by, assuming the owners, upon walking in.  Although I didn't order their "famous" chocolate, I ordered a regular coffee and a chocolate cupcake for my work break.  Nothing I ordered was extraordinary, but I will be back because of the people there who appeared to be caring and kind.  While there's no locally-owned coffee shop or bakery in the Albany Park neighborhood, this place is probably the closest coffee shop (and I'm not talking about the "SB" because that place is never in my radar), conveniently located within the Albany Park and North Park neighborhoods.  I will come back to try their specialities, gourmet chocolates, for sure!

3.description: Ahh.. Chocolate..Today since I had a day off from work I decided to go exploring,I haven't had much time lately to check out some new places I've beenwanting to try so I decided today was the day!Oh, this magical place, which has everything Chocolate and then someis quite Incredible in just about every way.I met Laura, who is the Pastry Chef here and everything that is madehere is designed by the phenominal Laura, I was taken into the kitchen areaand shown where Laura does her candy making and baking.And, they have a special Crepe Menu which they will only serve onSaturdays, and everyday up until 11am when you purchase a medium drinkthey will gift you with a free doughnut!Is that nice or what??Well, I think that's pretty darn nice!They even have a nice mascot/statue up on the counter, and lots of cookies,muffins, candies and cakes.And, I will admit that I purchased the most delicious chocolate mint chipshortbread cookies to take home with me, so all you mint chocolate chiphaters out there talk to the hand cause I ain't hearing it!So, in ending, Beijo de Chocolat is a really nice place, has great employees/associates and lots of chocolate stuff!Located near the corner of Kimball and Foster in North Park,A most popular place for sure!Check them out, you'll be happy you did..

35.description: I stopped by there because I was in the neighborhood and wanted a nice espresso. Very welcoming, friendly service. Decent level of coffee. Nice chocolates. I think It's a nice neighborhood spot.

19.description: Came in to this cute little chocolate shop to escape from the heat outside.  They offer a variety of chocolates in different flavors.  They also have coffee, latte, ice cream, cookies, cupcakes, etc. The owner and his wife (or gf) are super friendly as well.  A must try!

28.description: Right in my 'hood I first experienced Beijo during the Albany Park passport to Albany Park event. It was a great way to check out eateries in my 'hood. This place is so cute. They have a gigantic donut happy hour from opening until 11am with a purchase of a drink. I came in on the weekend just before the end and they were still happy to give it to me and Ryan. The donuts are not that gigantic and are just okay. What you really should come for are the crepes on Saturdays. Those are tasty, most of the favors lean toward the sweet, but did the trick nonetheless. The owners are also quite friendly and will talk about their award winning chocolates. Next time I'm having a sweet craving I'll make sure to come by because I'll actually need to try the chocolates they get awards for.

45.description: My cousin and I were really craving some red velvet cupcakes and didn't feel like driving all the way to Lincoln Park to pick some up.  This place was in the area and we decided to give it a try.The place is really really cute, cute decorations, pretty colors, just everything about the place is cute.  The workers were really nice, very friendly and definitely made you feel welcomed.Everything on display looked delicious, from candy to cakes.  I kind of wished they had more options when it came to cupcakes, but they had a lot of other treats.The red velvet cupcake was okay, it wasn't the best, but it wasn't the worst. The chocolate and yellow cupcakes were out on display, but I guess the red velvet cupcakes were kept separate in the back. Maybe we came too late or maybe too early, but the cupcake was kind of hard.  The frosting was a bit candy like for me and it crumbled.  But after sitting for 20 minutes, it started to soften up. I'm sure if I gave it another try, I wouldn't be disappointed.Overall, I think this place is perfect if you're feeling something sweet. It's right next to NEIU, so if I'm ever in the mood for toffee or chocolate covered pretzels this is the place to go.

33.description: Very disappointing. Have been waiting to try this place and wanted to use my Groupon, but the proprietor said it had expired the day before--when it clearly stated otherwise. She said Groupon made an error --yet they had a year to correct it, and did nothing--except disappoint potentially excellent customers the weekend before Valentine's Day and commit possible fraud.

43.description: I went there today with the family and walked out with lots of goodies!! While I was pregnant my hubby brought me a box of chocolate truffles from there and there were all delicious and very unique. So I had to go there and check it our for myself. I tried some more of their chocolates, My favorite was the caramel sprinkled with sea salt, so yummy!! They have huge peanut butter cups, delicious chocolate covered marshmellows, and twinkies that my kids loved!! We also tried one of their specialty coffees and it was very tasty, better than starbucks, and I love starbucks. The place is very clean and the owner was very friendly. I love that it's locally owned, def going back to try their tea which I hear is awesome along with the crepes.

2.description: Pricey (think about $2.50 apiece), but delicious. Award-winning though they may be, there's a point where I'm not sure how much I appreciate how much "finer" their chocolate is than that of other chocolatiers in Chicago, though.  If your palate is more refined, by all means, try it out.  It's a tiny space, but if you're lucky enough to visit when there aren't too many people about, you will enjoy the quiet, welcoming atmosphere.  A charming place to enjoy some coffee and an impressive array of chocolate indulgences.

18.description: I think one thing to keep in mind when going to Beijo is that their chocolates/candies/truffles are bomb! The service is great too. It is obvious how passionate the owners are about their business from the second you walk in. The coffee, on the other hand, not so bomb. It's not even bad, it just really has absolutely no taste. I love good coffee, and after going to school in this neighborhood for years, I know I would have spent more time in Beijo is their coffee/espresso was 50% better. Maybe I am a bit harsh, but really, college students love coffee and places that are open at weird hours of the night.

41.description: This review is based on only one visit. I only mention this because it's walking distance from Northeastern IL University, where I teach. But when I'm on the bus in the morning, I just want to get to class, and in the afternoon I just want to get home. But recently -- and when I sat "recently," it could be any time during the Obama administration -- recently Beijo ran a Groupon, which was a perfect excuse to treat myself to some chocolatey goodness. Score.I'll start with service, since that was the first impression I came away with, and to save you any mystery, it was excellent. The male half of the team that runs the place was there, and though he was in a meeting and I was still browsing, he took time to walk me through their offerings and make suggestions. While I sometimes prefer to be left alone to explore, in a store like this everything needs an explanation, so I was happy for the assistance. He was not only knowledgeable and enthusiastic, but something you don't see often enough these days -- proud. He was proud of their wares, and excited to bring them to me. God bless the small businessman. And you know that Groupon. He knew exactly how I could manage my purchase so that after the discount, I would owe 37 cents. For those of you whose discounts have been met by a grumpy response or worse, you know how delighted I was.I spent much more than the 37 cents, though, because there were too many things I wanted to try. I bought a mixed dozen chocolates, and could easily have bought two. They tend toward dark chocolate, which is fine with me. Their house specialty is a Brazilian dark chocolate truffle, and was lovely. I forget what else I got, though I know that a couple of champagne truffle, orange creams, and peanut butter cups were in the mix. In addition to the chocolate, I bought some curried coconut brittle, and I've been jonsing for more ever since. They did not have the bacon cheddar muffin featured on their website -- I weep -- but the ham and cheese croissant was a nice substitute.With all the developments of the 21st century, the rise of the artisanal chocolatier may be my favorite. If you feel the same way, and find yourself out Albany Park way, Beijo de Chocolat is a must.

52.description: I've gone here a few times now and I keep being dissapointed.  Their food is often stale and the last time I got a chocolate it was gritty.  If this is your specialty you should NOT have gritty chocolate.  You should be tasting your chocolate!  I really hope they get it together because when it's good it's really good.

50.description: Tasty treats, nice atmosphere, a good addition to the neighborhood. A little pricey, though, and it would be nice if they were open later. The area could use an upscale cafe open in the evenings.

4.description: Really cool little cafe with lots of interesting sweets !! cookies and cupcakes and cakes ! sugar overload ! They have chocolate covered Oreos ! This is what I got but I want to go back and try the award winning chocolate bars . The owner is very friendly and the place is nice for working .

6.description: I contemplated hiding the truth from you all. The truth in that I ate $10 worth of chocolate in a span of a few hours because oh my goodness, these chocolates are amazing. In my defense, $10 will only buy you five pieces of chocolate. WORTH IT. Delicious handmade chocolates. My favorite being the strawberry rose. YUM. While a little far away from my 'hood, it's worth the trip.

22.description: So I decided to drop in again to see if they made any improvements to the quality of food and take their  reviews seriously but I guess they care a dam about reviews. The owner never recognized me, and was very friendly as usual. I decided to try some of  the cup cakes and coffee. nothing special about the coffee, its was regular coffee, the cup cakes were stale or dry could not tell, it just tasted horrible and overly coated with sugar. i got some chocolates to go and the were expensive and not worth the money. Disappointed, the staff and owner are friendly but the quality of food is pathetic.

15.description: i LOVE this place!! Hands down one of my favorite places in Chicago. It's pretty expensive so I usually only come here once every month or so, but it always cheers me up after a bad day. The woman who owns the place is always behind the counter and is so sweet! Definitely get the dark chocolate Brigadeiro truffle, and the Sesame & Ginger Toffee. The boo-boo's are a great deal- truffles that come out of the mold not looking as shiny/ pretty but still taste amazing are offered in baggies for about 5-10 pieces at $5 a bag! Flavors vary, but it's an unbeatable deal.

57.description: The delicious confections - try the sesame ginger toffee and the Brazilian chocolate - and yummy coffee drinks and teas are only outshone by the friendly and attentive service.  A wonderful warm place to hang out with friends or to make new ones.  Free wifi, too.

20.description: I like this shop so much.  I see in some of the other reviews that people did not really like the baked goods or coffee- I cannot speak to that, because I have only ever purchased chocolates here.  I usually get a few milk chocolates and some of the different flavor mixes Laura (the owner) has made.  All the chocolates are really delicious, I particularly love the one that has a fresh and juicy raspberry in the center.  The chocolates are a little expensive at $1 each, but decadent and worth it.  I can also highly recommend the fudge which comes in a jam jar.

36.description: It is a good thing for my waistline and wallet that this place isn't closer. They have amazing chocolates, dessert, and beverages (yummy hot ones for the winter and refreshing smoothies for the summer). I am a sucker for truffles, but the price means they are an occasional treat (the price is fair - I am just cheap). The huge peanut butter cup was a bit of a letdown though - should have been more peanut butter to chocolate ratio (it is tough to beat the Reese's original). This is a well needed component to the area, and between this and The Sweden Shop, it is a prime option for gift shopping.

14.description: They have a great selection of treats for good prices. They've won quite a few awards for some of their desserts. I wandered in looking for a chocolate muffin (which they didn't have, to my dismay). I was going to leave and go somewhere else, but what kept me was the very nice and helpful woman behind the counter. She was telling me about all the different desserts behind the counter. I picked up a couple chocolate covered pretzels and a pumpkin chocolate chip muffin, which were both really good. I'll definitely be going back for more awesome treats!

12.description: Food is awesome.  Service was very poor today.  Waited 21 minutes in the drive thru for three 3 entrees.  I hate when they park you and forget about you!

7.description: Place was dirty. All tables needed to be cleaned. When I told the worker he looked at me like i was crazy. Also very scanty choice of food and what was there did not look fresh.

20.description: Chinese fast food saturated in fat, MSG on steroids and genetically modified substances. Yum. I'm surprised at how busy it gets at this location. There are at least 3 decent Chinese food restaurants nearby. Even for fast food Chinese there are much much better places to go.  Come'on people, with the same money you can afford much better food! People will shovel any kind of garbage into their mouth!Conveniences: Right on the corner so if you are riding the CTA, you can pick up food and see the bus stop from inside. Ample parking since they share the lot with Home Depot. Also they have a drive-thru.Lesson: Advertise in bright colors. Use a cute wittle panda to sell the food.

19.description: service is kick arsestand alone restaurant on the outlot so lots of seating, another kick arse.always FRESH chow mien and rice, got three kick arses nowfountain machine so buy a small and get free refills! ultimate kick arse!i don't like the west entrance because it isn't doubled door so there is always a breeze that blows my napkins away. Yes I am being that picky cause I haven't had enough coffee yet.peace & well chewing

1.description: Took a drive through take out white rice bowl with Kung pao. They forgot to give me a fork or spoon, I came out of my car  and server didn't think I was telling the truth. She had to inspect my bag. No apology. And no fortune cookie in sight!!!!! Where is exceptional dining experience?????

2.description: One of thee worst fast food places ever , I would give it 1/2 star but that is not option on here . Now I know what Gordon Ramsey when he says "BLAND ,BLAND ,BLAND" . The extra charge for a bigger plate was $2.50 I believe and it was totally not worth it . The rice was super bland and also cold . Stay away from the walnut shrimp for $1.00 extra -no taste whatsoever ....And lastly the people working at this location act like they should be somewhere else because they do not care about serving you .

9.description: The fortune that was in my fortune cookie said, "Over indulgence hinders mind & body."  Well, my body and mind won't be hindered from Panda Express since I won't be returning here.First I'll start out with the good.  I found the employees here to be extremely friendly and helpful.  Upon entering I was immediately greeted by a nice young lady who asked if I was ready to order or if I'd like to take a few moments to check out the items available.  Then a minute or two later while I was still looking over the offerings a young man asked me if I'd like to try any samples of the items.  So for one friendly employee I say good job, but to have 2 of them in this day and age of bad customer service is really an accomplishment!Another positive aspect that I observed was that the store was nice and clean even though they had several dine in customers and seemed to be doing a decent amount of business.  One thing I really liked was that the cooler where they store the ingredients has glass doors and you can look in to see where your food is stored.  In addition to the glass doors the containers that the ingredients were stored in were clear so you could see the ingredients themselves.  The ingredients looked nice and fresh and thankfully nothing like the ingredients you see on episodes of Kitchen Nightmares where other restaurants are serving severely spoiled food.  So thank you Panda Express for making it easy to eat your food with no worries about freshness.Now, it's time to get on to the review of the food flavors where unfortunately things go downhill.  The best item I had was a chicken eggroll.  I was really surprised when I bit into it since I was not expecting much from it.  It was not blow your mind fabulous, but it was suprising really good.  For the main part of my meal I had honey walnut shrimp (for shrimp entrees add $1 extra which is no biggy in my opinion), orange chicken and chow mein.  I thought the honey walnut shrimp was good and couldn't really find anything to complain about, but it just didn't blow me a way.  The orange chicken was unusual.  Luckily I like food that has kind of a vinegary twang to it so I thought it tasted ok even though it was very twangy.  It just didn't really taste like orange chiicken so that's why I'm not thrilled with it.  As far as the chow mein goes it was a real letdown.  I found it to be very bland and almost flavorless.  It did have lots of vegetables in it which I liked, but it somehow managed to be very blandly flavored.Next time I get a craving for Chinese food I'll hit up one of the restaurants across the street that from the Home Depot's parking lot.  It wasn't a terrible experience, but it certainly wasn't an experience that would entice me back.

6.description: I have eaten a lot of fast food in my life. I have had many bad experiences across the board this one had to rate in my Top 5 :Worst experiences ever. I don't think I have been made to feel more like an inconvenience.I ordered a two entree meal with honey walnut shrimp and orange chicken with fried rice. The chicken was like rocks, it was so old my fork could even stab it to eat it. The shrimp was on the borderline of turning bad and the rice was rather dry and bland and a little on the colder side. Overall the food was not good.I don't think I was ever made to feel more uncomfortable by an individual. If looks could could kill i would be dead as I interrupted her while she was cleaning windows. No real sense of urgency to help me out - just continued to the windows. Once she did get back to behind the the attitude continued. I just wanted to order my food and get the heck out of therePanda, I am sorry I was such an inconvenience to you and your staff so I do not blame you for serving me garbage and being rude to me. i won't disturb any of your locations any more OK.

18.description: Chinese fast food saturated in fat, MSG on steroids and genetically modified substances. Yum. I'm surprised at how busy it gets at this location. There are at least 3 decent Chinese food restaurants nearby. Even for fast food Chinese there are much much better places to go.  Come'on people, with the same money you can afford much better food! People will shovel any kind of garbage into their mouth!Conveniences: Right on the corner so if you are riding the CTA, you can pick up food and see the bus stop from inside. Ample parking since they share the lot with Home Depot. Also they have a drive-thru.Lesson: Advertise in bright colors. Use a cute wittle panda to sell the food.

10.description: I like the spicy and sweet chicken they have. To be honest Panda express is better than any chinese buffee all over the country! At least we know the quality of the food is always always good.This location is nice and clean.

13.description: I've given this place a few tries, after having a successful try with it earlier this year, and I think they finally got up to par with other Panda Express locations. The great problems this location once had, seem to have been resolved all the times I've visited this year, and the Lincoln Village location has fallen off my 'banned list.' Just think of it as fast food Chinese, and you'll enjoy. If you come here with the expectation of Chinese food like a restaurant, you will be disappointed.BTW, Panda Express does NOT use MSG in any of their food, unlike what Jacob said. Just want to clarify that for everyone.

16.description: Amazing customer service!!! Manager was extremely attentive and made sure my large order was correct, everything was made fresh, and even made sure to provide plenty of silverware and fortune cookies.

17.description: For starters, I will openly state that Panda Express is the poster child of Americanized Chinese food, however I do enjoy this food from time to time.  This is Panda Express' attempt to have a suburban style set up be placed on the outskirts of Chicago, and it does serve it's purpose well.  The place is clean for the most part, and they usually have all their selections out and ready to go for customers.  Their fried rice is delicious, and I am a fan of the Orange Chicken.  However I do believe that their service is more drive-thru oriented- aka get the order and get the food, and pay no attention to the customers.  This obviously doesn't work all that well while dining in.  However they are quick in serving customers their food and a meal will cost less than $10 for the most part.  It is not an authentic experience, but I did enjoy my visit here.

15.description: The McDonalds of Chinese food. Convenient? Yes. I'd prefer a bit of inconvenience and better tasting food. It gave me the wimwams, so I pitched most of it out. What a waste. I won't be back, but I should note that Christopher does not find this place as dreadful as I do, so It gets two stars and not one.

0.description: This Panda Express is located on my route to and from work. If I'm hungry, and craving Orange Chicken this is where I always stop.

5.description: The food was either empty or almost gone. My food was dry with no flavor. They tried to give my granddaughter the bottom dregs of a pan of chicken that was all burnt or just fried batter no chicken. I said no. The Sobe water was connected to carbonation. I was in a hurry so we stopped at what was available.

11.description: I went to eat there last month. Had the worst experience there ever.  Food was cold and staff looks like that don't want to be there.  The manager lady had an attitude the whole time we were there.

8.description: If you go through the drive-thru, they will mess up your order EVERY.SINGLE.TIME. Completely unacceptable. Instead of going all the way back there, I tried to call, no answer. So over this place.

3.description: Service has been "ok" most other times but the owner needs to hire more employees. On this particular occasion we waited about 30 minutes for teriyaki chicken.

14.description: A new place i find out!  Fast !  Good!! Most important that it was really close to my school!!!! I gonna bring my classmate to eat here!

4.description: I used the drive in numerous times. Today I ate in the store. Man! this place is dirty! It was around noon, lots of natural light thru large windows. You can see all the spots, traces on windows, food leftovers on the tables, salty muddy dirty floor... Even the display case was smudged. Everything was disgustingly dirty. The staff was nice, positive and smiling, but hygiene showed neglect.  I doubt I'll eat there again for some time. It takes time to erase the ugly picture in my head.

58.description: Very nice casual pizza joint . The pizza was very good with s nice crispy crust and the right blend of cheese and sauce . The other dishes and appetizers where very fresh and tasty as well . The ambiance is great as well . A warm rustic feel with reclaimed wood and black and white photo graphics that lend a modern touch . I will definitely return. Looking forward to when they deliver!

56.description: We have been coming to this place several times because of its delicious food, attentive service and great atmosphere. The owner introduced himself and gave us complementary gelato, fat fingers( fried dough). He treated us as family. I have been telling my friends and coworkers to give it a try. I am happy to have this delicious lunch and dinner option in the Albany Park neighborhood. Thank you very much

29.description: A great neighborhood spot.  Order at the counter and BYOB.  Pizzas come out pretty fast.  Good food, staff is friendly, and room is really comfortable.

42.description: Great place, good Food,every thing is fresh you must try the panini, Owners are awesome very friendly, I definitely recommend this place.

23.description: I love having this place close by.  The management is awesome and friendly, and they really strive to be a positive force in the neighborhood.  Per the manager 75% of the interior is recycled.  On one wall there's a huge map of the Foster/Kimball area with a bicycle hanging on it.  It's kind of a cool nod to the 'hood.  One of the managers also said they make their soups daily from scratch.  The salad dressings are all homemade, too.  I had a delicious beet and fennel salad last night, but per the manager some offerings may change daily.  The minestrone soup had a nice, light tomato based broth.  It was flavorful without being overly salty.  The vegan pizza with red pepper cashew cheese was really good.  The fresh, hand-stretched crust was thin yet chewy, with a nice bit of char on the bottom.   The Local Pizzeria has good food, and it's heart is in the right place.  Note:  this isn't  specifically a vegan or vegetarian establishment, but there are plenty of options here.  For my next visit I have my eyes on the veggie panini.

47.description: This spot is just down the road so I really looking forward to checking it out. We've ordered delivery from them twice, now, and I'm not sure I'll bother again. On the first go around we got one of their specialty pizzas. The girl who answered the phone had a lot of trouble getting my information right. Actually, she didn't - the delivery guy ended up a block away standing on the front porch of someone else's place. The pizza tasted good, but after trekking around the neighbourhood it could have been hotter. The first time we called tonight the phone rang forever and then went to voicemail. Confused, because it was for sure before their posted closing time, I rang back. Better luck with the person on the other end of the phone this time - I didn't have to repeat myself 15 times and the pizza arrived quickly (at the correct address, even). However, when I opened the box I discovered that my medium (14.5") pizza had maybe 15 slices of pepperoni on it. For $16.50. That's frickin' ridiculous & not worth it.

8.description: So this place was pretty dang good! It's pasta and pizza, nothing too fancy. I thought the sausage was spectacular. The biggest downer was that for a place that specializes on pizza.... They... Um... Didn't have any pizza. The pasta was cooked perfectly, the pesto was fresh and flavorful. Seating is pretty slick. Edison bulbs, maps, fancy calligraphy, maps on the walls -  the works. Plenty of seating, although the parking seemed to be somewhat limited. There was almost no wait and no delay in service. The staff was very kind and helpful to an out of towner Bottom line is this though, this little local joint is right next to a subway. Ten times out of ten you should go here instead of the silly subway next door. I would have loved to give this place 5 stars for the price point, but.... Really... No pizza? Womp womp.

31.description: Delicious food, a decor that has to make you smile (you can't look at the photos in the wall and not!), and hard-working but friendly staff (I think it comes down from the owner, who can almost always be found there, busy but with a smile.).

34.description: Stopped by last week and loved it. I ordered a panini and was satisfied with their quality. Great food, decor, and very friendly people!

16.description: We had a great birthday celebration for my wife. The table, food, service were all great. Luis and staff took superb care of us.

13.description: I think this will be my only time ordering from here. Delivery guy went to the wrong house, the salad we ordered was very small, and the pizza was pretty ugly. The worst part was, I found a large, sharp plastic shard in one of the pizza slices. (If I can figure out how to post the picture, I will.) Clearly this is dangerous and unacceptable. We called them and spoke to the hostess (probably?) and she was nice but very shaken and didn't know what to do. Offered a free pizza, which we declined - don't love plastic pizzas. The pizza itself was nothing special at all. For a couple dollars more I can get a Pequod's pizza that is amazing and lasts a couple days. 2-3 stars without the plastic. 1 star with. Maybe the in-house experience is better?

11.description: I have had the BBQ chicken pizza, the spinach and chicken pizza, and last night had the Carmelized onion pizza. This place is excellent so good that my boyfriend and I are going to try every specialty pizza they have on the menu. Best mozzarella stick and garlic knots as well just beyond amazing sooooo yummy!!!!!

39.description: We love The Local Pizzeria. The NY style pizza is awesome. The owners and employees are very kind and they are always accommodating, happily leaving a slice or two with no cheese on our pizza for my child who is dairy intolerant. They even made her a whole small cheese-less pizza last time at no extra cost so we would have slices to take home for her. It is great having a place with great food and great people in the neighborhood.

37.description: Soo happy that there is finally a delivery option in the neighborhood that is REAL food. I have had delivery and also dined in and was happy with both experiences.  Had the mushroom and red pepper panini which was soo delicious, tasted very homemade.  The pizza is also VERY good, so much flavor.  Looks really clean inside, love it!

0.description: Great pizzas and kid-friendly pastas. Our go-to is the white pizza with wild mushrooms and prosciutto. I recommend the pizzas/pastas over the sandwiches. Both the bolognese and alfredo pasta dishes are delicious. I'm never one to order tomato soup, but it was fantastic.

38.description: Great decorations, great food and better customer service.Veggie pizza is a must!!!Wings were perfectly cooked and the spicy sauce just right.

51.description: This place rocks! My family and I went in and ordered a couple pizzas. The service was friendly, the place is clean, and the decor is super cool, and unique. The pizza sorta reminded me of East Cost style pizza- thin, crispy, and yummy. There is something very different about the dough in that it is thin yet tasty. I am not from New Jersey and definitely not an expert, but very different from the pizza in the neighborhood. It is such a refreshing change. We also ordered the mozzarella balls which my kids loved. It was busy and it only had been about a week that they had been open, but all went smoothly and the staff was very nice and smiled a lot. I was warned that since it was fairly new, they were still getting organized and there might be a wait. We waited about fifteen minutes. That doesn't seem too long to me given that the pizzas need to cook. My kids asked that we go again and we are planning on it. So,so happy they are in the neighborhood and that it is local but not your usual pizza place.

27.description: I have ordered from here via grub hub 3 or 4 times. Everyone the delivery has been fast and the last time it was at my house in 30 minutes!!! The pizza is awesome and I have been looking to a pizza place since I moved in this in November! I am so excited that I finally found my pizza place. The crust is thin and just the perfect amount of crunch. The crust has a great flavor and texture! I can tell the ingredients are fresh and top quality. I have also had the pesto pasta that was also really great. It was a little more creamy than I am used to but it was still good. The fresh mozz and tomatoe salad was THE BEST! They were even smart enough to put the balsamic on the side in a container so I could put as much or as little as I wanted! I will be a life time customer and I wish the owner the best if luck and hope those who had bad experiences give it another go!

32.description: I was so excited to have a new pizza place in the neighborhood.  Since we have a pretty busy evening planned with a home renovation project, so we decided to treat ourselves to two pizzas.  My husband ordered a sausage and pepperoni pizza.  His pizza only had pepperoni on half, and sausage on the other half which would not be such a big deal if he wasn't charged for both on the entire pizza.I ordered the caramelized onion pizza.  According to the online ordering system, this pizza should have Garlic olive oil base, sauteed wild mushrooms, red onion, and feta.   The pizza we received had so few ingredients, it basically just tasted like crust.  There was not a single mushroom to be seen, very few onions and tiny bit of cheese.  At $21.50 for a 14" pizza, I would expect enough toppings to impart some flavor in my pizza.  We were not impressed, but with two hungry kids and bedtime quickly approaching we ate it out of desperation.  My husband just spent about 20 minutes on the phone with them.  They are refunding the cost of the caramelized pizza, but can't seem to do this without his credit card present so he has to stop by in person.  While I am glad we are not paying over $40 for this really disappointing meal, it's still a big inconvenience.I'd have rather had Jack's frozen pizza and spared myself the frustration and disappointment.

54.description: My search is finally over! I've been waiting twelve years for gluten free pasta that carried the same look, taste, and texture of regular pasta. I just finished a generous serving of gluten free penne pasta covered with pomodoro red sauce and shrimp. It's hard to describe how happy my belly is. I'm eavesdropping on nearby conversations about the pizza and it sounds like others are just as satisfied as I am. Prices are reasonable, my food came quickly, and the place (including the restrooms) is clean. I highly suggest you give this new place a try.

48.description: Establishing a long-living pizzeria in the Chicago neighborhood appears to be a very difficult task!  Our once go-to place for pizza (Ciao Bella on Lawrence) has closed its door back in March, so I've been in the process seeking for a new replacement.  Oh by the way, Rosa J. refuses to give her business to Dom*no's or Pa*a Joh*s.  She's all about the local businesses...and there's a place called the "Local Pizzeria" on the northeast corner of Foster and Kimball (diagonally across from the Chicago Public Library-Albany Park branch).  Was that coincidental?  I've been paying attention to some of the Yelp reviews; I've decided to hold off the visit until this evening because some have mentioned that the business wasn't yet full-fledged when they first opened to the public.  I was on the way back home from the Lincolnwood Town Center, and I met hubby who just got off work and headed inside.  Other than pizza by the inch or pizza by the slice, they served lighter Italian fare (pasta or simple antipasti).  I was interested in the pizza, so we went with 12-inch wild mushroom.  The total was $19 and some change after tax.  Once we placed our order at the service counter, we were given a number and found a booth by the window.  We came past 1700 hour so the combos were no longer available.  By the way, their meal combos are offered daily until 1700 hour.  You can either have a slice of cheese pizza, a pop, and a choice of soup or salad for $6.25 OR a slice of single-topping pizza, a pop, and a choice of soup or salad for $6.75.The pizza came ten (10) minutes after the order was placed.  The crust was thin and almost resembled as bruschetta rather than a "thin-crusted pizza."  The entire "pizza" was seasoned just right and ingredients (arugula, red and white onions, mushroom slices, feta, and garlic) were spot-on fresh!  Nevertheless, the entire pizza was on the greasier side.  Perhaps sprinkle some cherry tomatoes on top with the arugula would help absorb the amount of grease.  That was my personal opinion since I could be somewhat critical on food.  Otherwise, I felt the Local Pizzeria was repeated-business worth in my book.  I knew the prices could be considered "high" in comparison to the place that advertises "$5 pizza; ready when you walk in," but I could have easily paid much more if my wild mushroom pizza somehow ended up in a trendy loop-area pub.  I now have a reason to jump on the CTA 92 (Foster) bus after work at the Jefferson Park Blue Line station instead of catching the bus 81 so that I can treat myself some delicious pizza and pasta.

44.description: This place has so much potential. This area is a bit of a wasteland when it comes to good pizza, and I was so excited to have something so close to my house! But alas. No.Pros: cute, EXCELLENT food, reasonably priced.Cons: exceptionally terrible service, long waits.I hate when the service ruins the food. But in this case, it happened. I have been to this place 3 times. The first two times, it took a long time to get my food, even though the restaurant was relatively empty. With maybe 4 tables occupied in the whole restaurant, it took over 10 minutes for a slice of pizza to be warmed up. Today, I knew it would take forever, so I came prepared. The service counter was disorganized, and it was unclear who was taking orders and who you should pay. The "everyone does everything" approach works, when it works. But here it did not work. I paid for my food (a salad and slice of pizza) and was told it would take 7 minutes to cook, as there were no cheese slices ready at the moment. That's fine! I said. I am used to the strangely long waits for a slice of pizza at this point. I waited for the 7 minutes. 10 minutes. 15 minutes. Finally I went up to the counter and asked what was going on. I eyed the 5 delicious-looking slices of cheese that were ready in the display. The woman at the counter seemed confused and flustered, but also irritated with me. I went back to my table. It was another 5 minutes before ANYTHING came to the table. Why? I'll never know. For the record, the food was absolutely delicious. The salad was fresh and the garlic-buttery crutons are amazing. The pizza is salty and satisfying. That's why I give them 1 star. But a slice of pizza shouldn't require this much time, energy, or patience. I hope it's growing pains.

24.description: Not sure why I waited so long to try this pizza. Sausage and pepperoni was great. Got there a little early for pickup so the girl at the front gave my wife and I some gelato as we waited on this hot day. To me that is great customer service. Will be back.

7.description: Amazing food!!! Recommend to everyone and the staff is super nice. I love coming here with my boyfriend for a date night after we go out. This is a family owned business, so everyone is very personable and want to cater to your needs.

49.description: Had a birthday party with 40 friends,  the experience was absolutely great, everyone was extremely happy with the location and everyone one loved their dish, pasta, fish, pizzas,  the garlic knots ...wow....we had the chips, sweet potatoes,  calamari,  wings and salad served as appitazers.  It all went. THANK YOU to the staff for such a birthday experience for all.

40.description: Visited a few weeks ago.  First impressions were wonderful!  Whoever designed the space did so very thoughtfully.  Wooden planks and black and white photos on the wall, rustic, yet modern.  All of the food is displayed very nicely so you can see what you are ordering.  We ordered a cheese and a veggie with caramelized onions slice and some homemade mozzarella sticks.  All very tasty and extremely fresh.  The prices are also very reasonable for the portions.  Seating is plentiful and friendly cashiers walk around and clear your plate, chat with customers and keep the place tidy.  The owner also stops by to ensure you are happy and enjoying your meal.  Great neighborhood spot, we will be back.

53.description: Love this place. Love the atmosphere, the food, the management and the staff.  I had heard about this place from friends and even though this is not my neighborhood I definitely had it on my "try" list.  Well, the other day I found myself in need of finding a place for dinner for 60 - with one day's notice, in the North Park neighborhood.  I thought of the Local Pizzeria and called them.  The young lady I spoke with (and yes, she was young, but professional and courteous) said she'd have a manager call me.  Within 30-minutes Jennifer called me and said she'd do their best to accommodate us.  They did that and more.  The food was delicious, the servers and cooks did a great job and our event was as nice if not better than if I had worked with a venue for a month.  I want to thank them for all they did - it was an evening we will all remember.  I also want to recommend the Caramelized Onion pizza - it was exceptional.  We will be back soon!

30.description: Ordered through GrubHub. 1.5 hours later, only half our order was received. The pizza crust is bland, there was pretty much no sauce, no cheese and no toppings on the pizza.It's now 2 hours past our order time....and we're still waiting for the other half?

46.description: A couple of weeks after my initial review a friend and I came in to get some dinner. Only a couple of tables were occupied around the time we came in, yet it took 25 minutes to get my friend's panini out. Ultimately he said it was too salty. Then it took half an hour for one slice of cheese pizza, then an additional 5 minutes after that to get my garlic knots. Service is absolutely too slow. I won't be coming back again, the quality of the food is not worth the headache the service gives you.

1.description: Full disclosure: I'm a bit biased toward this place because I know the owner. If you go in at a slow time and he comes over to your table, ask him how the place came together. It's a great story.And now, the food. It's wonderful. Everything is made from scratch, much of it from locally sourced ingredients, and it shows. Pizza is sold my the slice or the pie, and the slices are more than generous. Thin, crispy crust, bright sauce, not overly cheesy. They have your standard toppings, but check out their specialty pizzas. The wild mushroom pizza, with red onion, feta, and arugula, is a treat. The BBQ chicken works well with wood-fired oven. They have a kale caesar salad, which is a nice twist on the original, and two fresh soups every day. Ask about the contorini, which is their seasonal veggie side of the day. I just realized I've been writing mostly about their vegetarian items, and for a big carnivore like me, that says something!My only regret about Local is that I live too far away for them to deliver. But I work nearby, so a quick lunch is always an option!

55.description: I would give this a 3.5.  The food was great.  My pizza was a solid 4. However for $3.50 it wasn't worth the price. The flavor and texture were good.  I have to agree with everyone else, the service is really lacking.  I usually don't care about service, but this was just inefficient and made for an awkward meal.  We ordered two slices and a salad.  The slices came out ten minutes before the salad!
