When we went they were busy and I get that, but I have a feeling she just forgot to bring our the salad because once I stepped up to the counter she was rushing out with it.  It is super cute and the food is good.  We will come back and hopefully they will have worked out the service problems.

9.description: I was hoping for a good pizza joint in the hood, and I have found it!  So excited that it is finally open!  For the longest time I thought it was spelled lokal pizzeria (because of the pizza shape in their display)...is that just me?  I had the caprese salad and the vegetarian pizza.  The caprese salad was just okay (a little more balsamic would have been helpful), but the vegetarian pizza was amazing!  My roommate had the wings and the cheese/sausage pizza (will explain in a second), and he greatly enjoyed his food as well.  The wings had more pepper than I was expecting, but it was still pretty good.  My roommate had asked for the sausage pizza, but they didn't have any fresh slices, so he just got the cheese pizza, which was perfect...but then they brought him the sausage pizza without any extra charge!  I thought that was amazing on their part to remember his first request.The ambiance is very chill.  I liked the decor as well, and good/friendly service.  You should check it out!

26.description: What a cute place!!!  Louis Garcia the owner re-purposed old materials to build the decor of this place which I found so quaint and homey!!!  The food is great!  You must try the garbage pizza; pepperoni, sausage, olives, gorganzola, mushrooms, JALAPENOS, and PINEAPPLE!!! Yummy!!!!  I will be back!!!

25.description: Excellent, a hidden gem.  Small, casual, and excellent food!

12.description: I was driving by and decided to grab a quick slice of pizza to go from this place - since I've seen it under construction for a while now and it now looked open.  The +++ first.  Cute atmosphere and good menu choices that appear on the healthier side.  Their lunch combo to get a slice of pizza plus soup or salad plus a drink for $6.25 (cheese) or $6.75 with toppings - is a pretty good deal for lunch.  Food reheated pretty decent, vegetable pizza was nice and crispy (even for take out) and mushroom soup was taste (albeit a little salty).My experience ordering, simply put - was a total disaster.  I put in 17 minutes into the meter, thinking it was plenty of time to run out and grab a slice.  I am surprised that I didn't get a parking ticket, since I was in this place for about 35 minutes.  AND, I was the 2nd person in line to order when I came in.  They really need to streamline their order of operation, since everyone in line around me was so frustrated and yelling instructions at them.   Food was 4 stars, experience was 1 star - averages out to 3 stars. Will be willing to give them another chance once they hopefully get their stuff together.... Maybe.

59.description: Wow, was I impressed! My roommate and I noticed this place while driving by one night and I was intrigued by it's artsy setting, so when my mom was visiting one weekend I decided we could try it out together. It's a casual place and the decorating is really neat, all done with recycled materials according to their menu description. My mom and I each ordered a pasta dish. They brought one out very quickly, almost too quickly we thought. They followed that up almost immediately with an apology because they  accidentally brought out the wrong dish, but they told us to keep it and they'd bring our two correct ones soon. It was a little bit of a wait then, which is what I expected originally, but to apologize they brought out a complimentary piece of (delicious) carrot cake. Our two meals followed that, so by time all was said and done we had three entrees and a dessert between the two of us! Of course we sampled it all, every dish was incredible. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I've already been back since the first visit one week ago! Yum!

21.description: We had a great birthday celebration for my wife. The table, food, service were all great. Luis and staff took superb care of us.

17.description: We have eaten here three times and each time the pizza has been excellent.  The service has been improving over time.  I know the owner wants to hire local kids to work there, and they are still learning the ropes of restaurant work.  That being said, the food is delicious and they seem to be getting the hang of things.  I hope the one-star reviewers decide to give it another chance.  We've been waitng for decent pizza in this neighborhood forever and have had to do up until now.  I really want this place to succeed, like the Bryn Maur Breakfast Club up the street.My son wants to add: "One day a kid offered us ice cream at the end of our meal."

10.description: This place is really what this corner needed.  If you're looking for fancy food go somewhere else, but if you're looking for a cozy place that serves great soup and a not so shabby pizza - this is a great place in the neighborhood.  I definitely like their food and I also like to support neighborhood business.  You can't go wrong with their kale soup.Small tip to the owner - you are the poster boy for customer service and you are excellent with people.  Now you just need to train your cashier to have that same attitude towards the customers.  I edited my post after reading other comments.  Your food is always excellent but your cashier - who also serves as your host - needs to improve.  Considering she is a kid it shouldn't be that hard to teach her some tips.  You have a great thing going here with this joint!

5.description: Establishing a long-living pizzeria in the Chicago neighborhood appears to be a very difficult task!  Our once go-to place for pizza (Ciao Bella on Lawrence) has closed its door back in March, so I've been in the process seeking for a new replacement.  Oh by the way, Rosa J. refuses to give her business to Dom*no's or Pa*a Joh*s.  She's all about the local businesses...and there's a place called the "Local Pizzeria" on the northeast corner of Foster and Kimball (diagonally across from the Chicago Public Library-Albany Park branch).  Was that coincidental?  I've been paying attention to some of the Yelp reviews; I've decided to hold off the visit until this evening because some have mentioned that the business wasn't yet full-fledged when they first opened to the public.  I was on the way back home from the Lincolnwood Town Center, and I met hubby who just got off work and headed inside.  Other than pizza by the inch or pizza by the slice, they served lighter Italian fare (pasta or simple antipasti).  I was interested in the pizza, so we went with 12-inch wild mushroom.  The total was $19 and some change after tax.  Once we placed our order at the service counter, we were given a number and found a booth by the window.  We came past 1700 hour so the combos were no longer available.  By the way, their meal combos are offered daily until 1700 hour.  You can either have a slice of cheese pizza, a pop, and a choice of soup or salad for $6.25 OR a slice of single-topping pizza, a pop, and a choice of soup or salad for $6.75.The pizza came ten (10) minutes after the order was placed.  The crust was thin and almost resembled as bruschetta rather than a "thin-crusted pizza."  The entire "pizza" was seasoned just right and ingredients (arugula, red and white onions, mushroom slices, feta, and garlic) were spot-on fresh!  Nevertheless, the entire pizza was on the greasier side.  Perhaps sprinkle some cherry tomatoes on top with the arugula would help absorb the amount of grease.  That was my personal opinion since I could be somewhat critical on food.  Otherwise, I felt the Local Pizzeria was repeated-business worth in my book.  I knew the prices could be considered "high" in comparison to the place that advertises "$5 pizza; ready when you walk in," but I could have easily paid much more if my wild mushroom pizza somehow ended up in a trendy loop-area pub.  I now have a reason to jump on the CTA 92 (Foster) bus after work at the Jefferson Park Blue Line station instead of catching the bus 81 so that I can treat myself some delicious pizza and pasta.

3.description: Despite having kind of a terrible name, this place is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood. Their pizza is REALLY good, and so are their sides and soup. The space is clean and really cute if you want to dine in, and they are quite fast as well. It's really high quality stuff.Perfect for a date or lunch for 2, or for a big dinner (I've seen groups of 15-20 accommodated nicely). The price point is very reasonable also. Especially recommend the thin crust, wings, and mozz sticks!!!

35.description: Besides its unique concept and interior design, Local pizzeria has a great selection of delicious pizza, spaghetti, salads, panini's, and desserts. If you're in a hurry or want to sit and enjoy your pizza this is the perfect place!

19.description: My guy is training hard for a triathlon. This means he eats everything. I mean everything. Like a starved tyrannosaurus. They are lucky there are not teeth marks on the counter and tables. Anyway, he was hungry and going into the red zone, I was exhausted from work and we had a rambunctious beagle ready for a walk so we strolled over. You can buy a whole pizza or generous, individual slices. Fast, fresh, hot and filling.He had three slices of pizza, I had the salad. They have dessert options but we had the chopped fresh fruit- perfect. No alcohol here, plenty of cans of coca-cola and organic juices on ice. The pizza is really fresh, crispy, not greasy and the taste of the wood-fired oven really compliments the fresh ingredients. You should go and picnic at a nearby park!

28.description: This is a hidden gem that is top notch. The garlic knots are amazing. My husband and I ordered the chicken fettuccine Alfredo and a slice of pepperoni pizza. It was great! The mushroom soup is smooth and delicious. Check this place out-you will not be disappointed.

45.description: My guy is training hard for a triathlon. This means he eats everything. I mean everything. Like a starved tyrannosaurus. They are lucky there are not teeth marks on the counter and tables. Anyway, he was hungry and going into the red zone, I was exhausted from work and we had a rambunctious beagle ready for a walk so we strolled over. You can buy a whole pizza or generous, individual slices. Fast, fresh, hot and filling.He had three slices of pizza, I had the salad. They have dessert options but we had the chopped fresh fruit- perfect. No alcohol here, plenty of cans of coca-cola and organic juices on ice. The pizza is really fresh, crispy, not greasy and the taste of the wood-fired oven really compliments the fresh ingredients. You should go and picnic at a nearby park!

33.description: We have eaten here three times and each time the pizza has been excellent.  The service has been improving over time.  I know the owner wants to hire local kids to work there, and they are still learning the ropes of restaurant work.  That being said, the food is delicious and they seem to be getting the hang of things.  I hope the one-star reviewers decide to give it another chance.  We've been waitng for decent pizza in this neighborhood forever and have had to do up until now.  I really want this place to succeed, like the Bryn Maur Breakfast Club up the street.My son wants to add: "One day a kid offered us ice cream at the end of our meal."

43.description: My wife and I have been there a few times now and its always good! Nice little local place that needs local support so get out there and visit. I was also confused by the sign before it opened as one reviewer mentioned. Looked like is was going to be low calorie pizza, not Local pizza. Anyway, I would recommend it. Bring your own wine if you want to drink.

2.description: The Local P has the best pizza in the neighborhood. What makes it great is fresh ingredients, excellent crust and delicious sauce. I think fresh ingredients makes a big difference, especially with toppings such as mushrooms. The crust is crispy with chewy edges. The tomato sauce for both the pizzas and pasta dishes is very tasty, i.e. you can taste more than just tomato and salt.I have eaten both delivery and in house. Both experiences have been great. The delivery is fast, so the food arrives warm. The service is friendly and caring.We will be frequent customers and you should be too.

18.description: I have ordered from here via grub hub 3 or 4 times. Everyone the delivery has been fast and the last time it was at my house in 30 minutes!!! The pizza is awesome and I have been looking to a pizza place since I moved in this in November! I am so excited that I finally found my pizza place. The crust is thin and just the perfect amount of crunch. The crust has a great flavor and texture! I can tell the ingredients are fresh and top quality. I have also had the pesto pasta that was also really great. It was a little more creamy than I am used to but it was still good. The fresh mozz and tomatoe salad was THE BEST! They were even smart enough to put the balsamic on the side in a container so I could put as much or as little as I wanted! I will be a life time customer and I wish the owner the best if luck and hope those who had bad experiences give it another go!

41.description: Cute place close to home. I had the wild mushroom slice and it was very good, the crust is thin which I like and the ingredients are fresh.  They have a nice combo meal during lunch, slice of pizza and a side salad.  Its a great place for lunch and I'm looking forward to trying the pasta for dinner one day.  Definitely going back and definitely a great place to eat.

52.description: I live close by, so I was excited when I saw a new pizza place in the neighborhood. This place looks nice with an open kitchen and classic pizza place picnic tables.The pizza was pretty good with a nice herby cheese taste, a fairly neutral sauce and classic N Y street pizza crust.Unfortunately this place is going to be out of business pretty quick unless they get organized. Service was friendly but there were 5 cooks in the back, 3 counter girls, 2 bus boys, a manager for 8 customers. It took them 3 pizzas to get my order right. Guys, get a POS system so the cook can see the exact order taken by the phone girl without trying to read her writing.I will try them again the staff was friendly and the pizza good. I hope they're still around

50.description: I was so excited to try a new pizzeria just opened up in my neighborhood. After a quick look at their online menu we decided to try a " garbage". I was a quite surprised that it costs more than my favorite pizza at Lou Malnati's .You  should always  inform your customers how much  it will cost if you don't wanna list your prices .So I was hoping that it's gonna taste as good as its cost. What a disappointment. Not enough sauce , dry , tasteless dough, not enough ingredients.  They don't have paper plates either.I will try again our local pizzeria after they get more experienced.

4.description: I paid $6.08 for an above average slice of pepperoni pizza, a Coke, and a chocolate chip cookie, including tax. What's not to love about that?! Truly, this place is right by North Park University so it caters to the college crowd. Food is good but nothing fancy. Service is just okay. But again I say...pizza happy hour = $2 pizza. I'll be back just for that.

6.description: I would say that the portion is just enough. I ordered two chicken fettuccine Alfredo to go for 23 and done chance after tax. (Not bad) the cashier actually suggested it and I'm glad I went with her suggestion. I thought this was really good and they didn't cheap out on the chicken. Will definitely ode from here again.

22.description: Delicious thin crust pizza - LOVE The vegetarian by-the-slice varieties, not your typical green pepper and mushrooms, we're talking arugula, caramelized red onions, fancy mushrooms.  Delish.  Cheerful service.

15.description: Good Pizza.  A bit pricey but very thin crisp and good.

57.description: I was hoping for a good pizza joint in the hood, and I have found it!  So excited that it is finally open!  For the longest time I thought it was spelled lokal pizzeria (because of the pizza shape in their display)...is that just me?  I had the caprese salad and the vegetarian pizza.  The caprese salad was just okay (a little more balsamic would have been helpful), but the vegetarian pizza was amazing!  My roommate had the wings and the cheese/sausage pizza (will explain in a second), and he greatly enjoyed his food as well.  The wings had more pepper than I was expecting, but it was still pretty good.  My roommate had asked for the sausage pizza, but they didn't have any fresh slices, so he just got the cheese pizza, which was perfect...but then they brought him the sausage pizza without any extra charge!  I thought that was amazing on their part to remember his first request.The ambiance is very chill.  I liked the decor as well, and good/friendly service.  You should check it out!

20.description: The pizza was fantastic. We also had pasta and the chopped salad is a MUST have. The proprietor Luis is such a courteous and fine gentleman. I highly recommend you come with your friends and family

36.description: Stopped by this week with the husband for a slice of pizza and a salad.  Had high hopes and was looking forward to checking out a new place in my neighborhood but was sadly dissapointed.  We both ordered a slice of sausage and the chicken chopped salad only to be told they only had one slice of sausage left so I settled for a slice of pepperoni.  How hard would it have been to give me the option of waiting for them to make another sausage pizza?  The slice of reheated pizza was just ok.  The salad was a mix of black olives, tomato, cucumber, bacon, chopped grilled chicken, gorgonzola and mixed greens.  The chicken was dry and tasted like it was also reheated and the cucumber was not fresh.  Not good.While we were there, we saw a group come in and sit at a booth.  Not once were they acknowledged, or told they had to order at the counter.  It wasn't until one of them got up and went to the counter to ask what the deal was.  I would've just walked out.All in all, 2 slices, 2 salads and 2 refreshments for 30 bucks.  Their food is pricey for less than average serving sizes and average tasting.  We could have gone elsewhere and had a similar but much better meal.

14.description: I am so excited to have this place in my neighborhood! The food is fantastic & you can taste how fresh it is. I ordered the Chicken Parm & a slice of pizza - which was a ton of food, but I wanted to taste everything! (Maybe a little over excited?).  Chicken Parm is one of my heartthrobs, so of course I'm pretty particular about it.  Chicken was so juicy & breaded in house.  The pasta & sauce with it was pretty spicy - right up my alley!After we had our meal - The owner brought over 3 more dishes to sample.  Pork tenderloin & mashed potatoes to die for! served with a Orange Marsala - wow.  The dessert we sampled was also delish - strips of fried dough heaven with some strawberry sauce.  I could eat these for an afternoon study sesh snack.I can't wait to make this one of my regular places.  There seems to be a balance of quick things to grab (salad, soup, pizza by the slice) as well as dishes to sit and enjoy. Little first week growing pains - cashier seemed un-organized and a little confused. And orders were written on a note pad.  A fuse blew at one point - whoopsy. But I'm sure these small system things will get perfected with experience. The atmosphere is great - and the employees were very friendly and excited about the food they served.

0.description: Look out, three-buck Chuck, here is your brewski equivalent. When times are tough, and you can't afford a steady diet of World Class micro-brews, check this out. For $2.99, you can buy a six-pack (cans) of any of the following: Miller High Life, Red Dog, Special Export (my fave low brow brew), Ice House, Old Style, or Busch. Anytime. Yea! And I thought my $5.99 for Tecate was a good deal.So here is your suggested eight-course recession dinner:A) A double cheeseburger from McD's (or another) dollar menuB) A hot fudge sundae from that same menuC) a six pack from Hart LiquorsOh, and they have a selection of fresh-rolled cigars, for those interested! Who said I couldn't write a short review???

28.description: Really nice people and a good clean place.

1.description: Ugly hookah. Because it's really ugly inside. For real guys it's time to spend some money on remodeling and clean this place. Also hookahs are a little dirty you can't feel the taste.Prices are okay. Never crowded. So 2 out of 5. Thanks.

39.description: Been there only once so far. The shisha (hooka) was good but the food was not good at all. The service was ok. The atmosphere was fun. They had some good music on.

9.description: I would say the hookah is good but the atmosphere is really sketchy especially at night there is a weird diverse crowd. I wouldn't come back.

29.description: If you're into a less traditional more urban hookah joint, this is doable.  If you don't care so much about the ambience and just want a good hookah you should check out this no-frills cafe.

23.description: Ive been here a few times with a previous boyfriend and some friends. It is a nice hookah bar despite the name. they have comfortable chairs and card games as well as Arabic music playing. The ambiance is intimate, relaxing and casual. top it off with some Arabic tea and you've got yourself a night!

5.description: Check out this place nice environment great people. There hookahs are amazing, this one place you have to check out.

31.description: Ugly Hookah is just that plain UGLY,Why Sugar Coat it. It is ugly smelly and old.Not really what I am looking for on a Friday ,Sat or Sunday night. I dont know why my friends brag about it, its basically Oscar the Grouch- looking ugly, dirty and ancient. The backyard sofas probably have mold and are so old your ass could probabbly sink right thru them. And if u have been in there recently you will know that they no longer offer food. But u are more than welcome to stop by 7 eleven and bring your sesame seeds and chips.Regardless, I still dont like this palce or understand what the fuss is about, yes its open late and yes it has wi-fi,but the hookah isnt even decent; and it should its  HOOKAH Lounge.

25.description: the name says it all.This place sucks out loud! Worst staff ever. I felt like the staff was watching me the whole time as if we were doing something bad. I was extremely uncomfortable and the prices are ridiculous.

12.description: When it comes to hookah, this is the place you go to. The place is cool and chill. The decoration isn't that amazing but the hookah and service is really damn cool. The flavor they have are really good. I got blueberry and grape and it's soooo nice.

37.description: I was excited when this place opened but I regret to inform the Yelp crowd that the best thing about Ugly Hookah Cafe is it's name. The food is very mediocre, on a good day, and their prices are nothing to rave about. Having been to a bunch of different hookah bars I can say with certainty that the shisha selection here was lacking, as well as lacking in flavor. The servers were very nice, but very slow, and the place had kind of a dead atmosphere. For being so close to Northeastern U they had very few young people in the crowd. This might be explained by the abundance of hookah cafes in the North Park neighborhood and the unspectacular nature of Ugly Hookah Cafe.

21.description: Been Going to Ugly Hookah Cafe with my husband Devin and our best friend Tom for as long as I could remember.  I love going in there to smoke me some great hookah. Plus it helps when you know the hookah master himself lol. But besides that ugly hookah has a great selection when it come to hookah . I usually go for the mix fruit or whatever new experiment they have and it never is disappointing.  The only thing that we find bad about the place is after they hookah is brought no one really comes back to see if you need anything like more coals for you hookah or even something else to drink. And then when your ready to pay they put an extra money on the bill for the waitress when honestly the last time we were there our friend the hookah master showed up and asked us if we needed anything. not the waitress and when they put her tip on the bill they took it off. Because we are not going to tip someone who never helped us to begin with. other then that problem it's a great place to chill with friends and relax.

16.description: This place deserves a zero because we received zero service. I am a Northeastern student and came to this place with my three friends. We ended up sitting at this BYOB joint with no hookah and no service for over an hour and a half.  At the beginning there was a discussion with the waitress over which hookah flavor we would get. She explained to us the minimum requirements and herself suggested that we might not need to purchase 3 hookah. She took our order for two and never came back. It was the strangest thing because other people were being served.I don't know what to say about that. Also, some guy was sitting against the back wall by the register and bathrooms staring at us the whole time. Not sure if he was a manager owner or security guard. But no one ever said anything to us either.Another thing, we were unable to see the blackhawks game properly because at the time they were playing on comcast and the tv stream is stolen off the internet.Don't come to this place. I hear the hookahs are dirtyy anyway.

17.description: My boyfriend and I were browsing Yelp looking for a hookah lounge to visit and we were both in awe to see this place receive such great reviews.It looks like an over-crowded cafeteria full of underaged girls looking for attention and a crap load of gangster wanna-be Middle-eastern dudes straight out of high school.  Besides the lack of ambiance and the not-so-pleasing crowd the tobacco was TERRIBLE.  It had no real flavor and started to burn almost immediately.  I would never go to this place again and recommend that nobody else does either.

10.description: Hookah is great which gives it the two stars available. But atmosphere is very strange and dingy. Worst is when I was given a cold shoulder for not tipping. Since they seldom check how you're doing and all they do is make hookah I wasn't aware that gratuity was necessary.

11.description: Sooo my bf is in love with this place because according to him they have veeerrrry good hookah... Me being not a big hookah lover I see the place for all the other things that it...doesnt provide me.It is cleaner than it used to be, but it would for sure use more clean-ups. Their bathrooms are no longer as awful as they used to be, but not amazing. The cards that they give you to play with are diiiirty and leave your hands black, I kid you not. Yes thank you for providing complementary cards to use while there, but investing 50 cents, even a dollar for a new deck once a month isnt going to break the bank.One thing that I really like, their smoothies are made in the house and are veeerryy good. Have one for sure!

26.description: Nothing special.  It's okay, there are defiantly better places in the area.

27.description: I recently went ot Ugly Hookah and its not like how it use to be. The flavors go bad after just 3 passes and the service has down graded.Im very disappointed.I no longer recommend this location to any of my friends.

35.description: I'm a loyal Ugly Hookah goer. The previous place I went to closed MUCH earlier and after finding out the place closes at 4 in the morning or so. My friends and I have been coming here regularly for the past few months. The tobacco is good-like everyone else says there's a large selection of flavors that you can mix and match, the food is good and the kitchen stays open late. The service is slow at times a lot of times it depends on the waitress but it's a small price to pay.

8.description: Came here last night for the first time in a long time. No bad past experiences, just hadn't been here for quite some time. It may not be the most upscale hookah bar but their hookah itself is good. It's clean, smooth and doesn't burn. It hits really well and really strong for a while, without having to re-charcoal. I consider myself a hookah veteran. I've been smoking hookah for a while so I know what's good and what isn't and this place is good. Lot of regulars there which makes for repeat business. Place was crowded but not packed. Will definitely return sooner than last time.

0.description: Awesome place, I go every weekend with my guys hanging out and haven fun time there. I will recommend to everyone

38.description: Only been here once, but definitely DO want to go back!   Even though the service was super slow (but friendly) and they slipped a couple things on the bill we didn't order.  That tells you how GREAT  the food was!  Seriously loved it.  I didn't get a hookah, but they're $20, so, next time.....

20.description: They have nice hookah's. The one we got smoked good at first, but then began to burn my throat and also my the girl I was with. No one ever came to check on us. They'll charge you $2 for each water bottle you brining in. Totally unacceptable. Alcohol would be fine I guess, but other location have no such charge. The atmosphere is a bit strange. You'll see gangsters and commercial people. It's very bright in there and open. The seats are not too comfortable. We were there for about 40min and left. I will never go back.

19.description: This is an updated review. Before 2010, I enjoyed my time spent there with friends smoking hookah, catching up, and relaxing.  Most hookah bars are usually fairly similar.  What sets them apart is the:1) Atmosphere2) People/service3) Quality of hookah1) The atmosphere used to be nice.  But they changed the color of their walls to a puke green color.  It really looks ugly...just as the name implies.2) Their service was ATROCIOUS.  One of our servers forced us to chug our water bottles we had brought it.  Our other options were to throw them away or give them to her to confiscate.  Mind you, the bottles were only filled with water.  Our bill was outrageous, and the service was terrible.  Whats worse than bad service and being forced to pay tip?  Ridiculous.3)  Their hookah was decent, however it will get you buzzed so fast you wont really be able to smoke it for more than 10 minutes total.I highly advise anyone thinking of going here to avoid it at all costs.

33.description: My boyfriend and I were browsing Yelp looking for a hookah lounge to visit and we were both in awe to see this place receive such great reviews.It looks like an over-crowded cafeteria full of underaged girls looking for attention and a crap load of gangster wanna-be Middle-eastern dudes straight out of high school.  Besides the lack of ambiance and the not-so-pleasing crowd the tobacco was TERRIBLE.  It had no real flavor and started to burn almost immediately.  I would never go to this place again and recommend that nobody else does either.

2.description: By far the worse hookah bar I have visited. I was handed a broken hookah, and the drinks definitely none too delicious. Broken hookah. Poorly made hookah(flavor wise) and disgusting drinks rickety broken chairs. There's only so much you can expect from a hookah lounge. The hookah, the shisha itself, the atmosphere and cleanliness of the place, the drinks and or food if offered.  This place has managed to fail in all categories.

34.description: Only been there once but i loved it. The hookahs are not expensive and the food was amazing. You must try to kefta plate (sp on that!)  I went with a few friends and we had a nice chill time. The server we had, Renata, was really sweet. My friends and i loved her! I'd definitely like to go back to this place again.

32.description: This place is great if your looking for a quality hookah .Due to Chicago laws they cannot serve food anymore but they let you order Pizza and other delivery out as well as BYOB .They have a very mixed crowd which I like and a huge variety of Juices, sodas and drinks. Free Wi-Fi is also included.The guy who prepares the Hookahs has been there a while and really knows how to make them right. Be sure to ask his recommendations he's like a wine specialist accept for Hookas. LOLThe waitress service is so so. Depends  the girl. You wont find any better Hookah in the area unless you have someone from the mid east sending you a private stash of (tumbac) AKA flavored tobacco

18.description: So far 2 times I've been there and I liked the hookah, the place really needs to be renewed because it it not so great inside. The waitress was kind of slow but she had so many tables so she could do what she could.

13.description: If I could give this place no stars I would. My first and last experience here. I stupidly ruined my FIRST hookah bar experience on this place. The only positive thing I can honestly say about this place is their mixed drinks are lovely. I understand this place caters to a much older crowd, preferably 40s and up and Persian. Persian music, Persian television channel all day everyday from what I gather. The interior is rather dingy, the lighting is very different for a hookah bar so girls if you're on a date and you think you look like crap don't come here. The chairs are rickety, and my hookah experience overall was highly upsetting. I was given a crappy hookah contraption that kept breaking apart, and the hose didn't even feel clean. An avid smoker knows if a hose is clean or not. I understand they had never seen me before and I may look like I know nothing about tattoos or hookah, but seriously don't judge a book by its cover. I live right down the street and due to this crappy experience, Carthage and NP see me at least 3-4 times a week and receive generous tips !

4.description: The place was really ugly as the name. No effort to give it a decent decor. It looked like they had some old couches at home that they we're going to throw away, but just decided to put them in there instead and if they used recycled all the chairs from a previous restaurant or something. Also the coffee that I had, was really poorly done had way too much cream and way too like coffee. Not to mention the environment was a bunch of loud middle eastern men throwing small fireworks and cursing at each other!!! Like seriously?.Although the place had a variety of flavors, I will definitely not go back a second time, it just did not cut it for me.

24.description: This is an updated review. Before 2010, I enjoyed my time spent there with friends smoking hookah, catching up, and relaxing.  Most hookah bars are usually fairly similar.  What sets them apart is the:1) Atmosphere2) People/service3) Quality of hookah1) The atmosphere used to be nice.  But they changed the color of their walls to a puke green color.  It really looks ugly...just as the name implies.2) Their service was ATROCIOUS.  One of our servers forced us to chug our water bottles we had brought it.  Our other options were to throw them away or give them to her to confiscate.  Mind you, the bottles were only filled with water.  Our bill was outrageous, and the service was terrible.  Whats worse than bad service and being forced to pay tip?  Ridiculous.3)  Their hookah was decent, however it will get you buzzed so fast you wont really be able to smoke it for more than 10 minutes total.I highly advise anyone thinking of going here to avoid it at all costs.

6.description: Great hookah just wish it was cleaner especially the bathroom. No effort in the design or look but hookah is always good.

22.description: Walked by it all the time going to class...finally went in when friend's didnt want to hit Carthage (the usual spot).  It is Ugly and a bit cramped in there but the safe is awesome and the flavors are yummy!

15.description: My man Nedaal hooks up the hookah very well, try the watermelon mint!The wait staff is very friendly and always willing to help. Great place to hang out and watch the games with friends or just relax.

40.description: One of my best hookah experiences yet.They opened September of this year.  I'd started going beginning of December and been stopping in since, many times.  Hookah, sheesha (spelling unsure), is great.  Always a great treat, never harsh or inconsistent yet.  I was thoroughly surprised that the hummus and Baba ghanouj are very tasty and satisfying.  Next time will have to have hummos w/meat.25 Hookah flavors.  Almost any combination you can think of, they say.., they can accommodate.I like that waitstaff are always around and present.  Also that different people have different duties.  Its not all piled on the server, there is another person that maintains the hookah and makes sure that everything is working fine.The room can suit maybe 100 or less comfortably.  Single wicker cushioned chairs and love seats.   A flat screen on opposite walls pumping out popular middle eastern pop music videos.  They are open till 4am!  Take reservations online at myspace, their email addy and by phone.I remember another patron telling me that on weekends they may host belly dancers or a Dj in the future.

7.description: Bad Hookah bar. Hookah is too expensive and low quality. . They never clean the hookah they use the same old water from other smokers. You can see it especially from rhe duck tape they put on each hookah.  Service is the worst.  They never come to you and ask for anything only that if you want your check.. you have to go up front to ask for anything you need and they still add the 20% tip to the bill. The only reason I give 2 stars is because the owner is a cool guy..

36.description: this is the first and so far the only hookah cafe i've been to.  it may be the only one i've gone to because i don't really want to go to any other place.this place has free wi-fi!!!the service is a bit slow at times but there really is no rush when you're lounging around on what looks like your grandmother's wicker chair smoking out of the hookah.  the menu doesn't have the many different tobacco flavors but you name it, they probably have it.  you can even combine flavors for a yummy tobacco cocktail.  i do not smoke cigarettes but i make an exception for cigars and hookahs.  i think it's because i don't inhale.  haha.  i just taste the smoke.  the food is alright for late night munching.  i get the kabob sandwich (the meat is really tender).  they're opened until 3 or 4 in the morning so it's a nice place to just hang out with friends.

30.description: Err where to start..It's close to my house, i like trying out different hookah bars, so i come here once every two weeks.I don't really like the decor. The hookah is the best thing here!Usually I frequent "Alibaba" on Lawrence and Pulaski. Alibaba's hookah is not as good as it used to be to Ugly Hookah is better in that category..This place is Mehh I guess.. =D

3.description: The menu said hookah was $15 and tea was 6. I ended up paying 28 before tax! She also charged my friend $4 for a can of coke. I am Arab; the hookah was bad and the place was too smokey.

14.description: I don't understand the mandatory 15% gratuity- can somebody explain? How am I supposed to pay this gratuity when the place is Self-Service? ie after they bring your hookah and drinks, DON'T expect anyone to ask if ya need something. In conclusion,  this place is greatly overrated, and highly priced. Surprisingly, they seem to be good at math, as they automatically round up numbers- my after tax, after gratuity bill of 39.5 suddenly became 40.00 WOW!! I need that extra 50 cents for parking :( LOL I would not come back again. The second star is for the friendliness of the staff, and the quality of hookah.

28.description: Probably one of the better Vietnamese restaurants I have gone to in Chicago outside of Argyle. The food came out in about ten minutes, so it wasn't too much of a wait. The pho dac biet is very reminiscent of one that I order from another restaurant in Argyle, which is a huge plus considering this place is much more convenient for me to travel to. My only concern is that their menu did not include a selection of banh mi, but since they've only just opened, this is just a minor setback. I would definitely come back again in the future.P.S. Ask for Tran. Best server ever.

1.description: My parents started going here for dinner about a month ago, saying that it was better than Hoanh Long. I, however, cannot even compare the two. First off, the staff do not speak English and completely messed up our to-go order. Currently missing spring rolls, have a large fried rice instead of small, and my pho was not the one I had ordered. Granted, my sister could've checked the bag before leaving, but still. Right now, I'm attempting to eat my pho sans the unwanted ingredient and it's practically inedible. The broth is unbelievably oily and I find myself having to wipe my mouth every other bite. I can feel my arteries clogging right now.I really don't like writing bad reviews, but this is necessary. I'll be declining any future dinner plans at this place.

9.description: Probably one of the better Vietnamese restaurants I have gone to in Chicago outside of Argyle. The food came out in about ten minutes, so it wasn't too much of a wait. The pho dac biet is very reminiscent of one that I order from another restaurant in Argyle, which is a huge plus considering this place is much more convenient for me to travel to. My only concern is that their menu did not include a selection of banh mi, but since they've only just opened, this is just a minor setback. I would definitely come back again in the future.P.S. Ask for Tran. Best server ever.

29.description: Chicken pho is good. kobe beef pho doesn't have kobe beef but looks like regular beef. spring roll is decent. the salt and pepper smelt was too greasy and the mi sate is bland. decorative and clean place. service is slow when busy. I think their signature dish is chicken pho.

23.description: Good service place is new and clean good food I can be regular customer .. You must try their seafood combination egg noodle soup

5.description: Every time I took #82 (Kimball/Homan) bus northbound to Lincolnwood Town Center, I passed by the strip mall next to the defunct cinema on McCormick and Devon.  I found Pho Nam Lua on Yelp since I have been craving for Vietnamese food, yet I didn't want travel all the way east to Argyle in Uptown.  I didn't expect much, but their dining room was cozy and thoughtfully decorated.  I ordered the large pho tai sach (rare steak/tripe soup), and hubby had pho chay (veggie soup).  I haven't had pho for a LONG time, so I was pretty excited.  I did enjoy my pho tai sach.  Although the broth could go a bit easier on sodium, there was no major complaint from this happy girl.  On the other hand, hubby was more a pho connoisseur than I was.  He did comment on that he preferred the pho chay at the other restaurant by the CTA Kedzie Brown Line station, but he thought the price for the pho here was quite reasonable ($7.50 to $9.00, depending on the size specifications) The service was friendly and polite, so I believe Pho Nam Lua is a solid four (4)-star neighborhood joint if you're running errands in the a North Park/Lincolnwood areas.  If you're a vehicle-dependent individual, there's free parking in the strip mall parking lot.

25.description: Really good pho! The broth was flavorful, definitely one of the best I've had. The shrimp spring rolls were also very good.I also enjoyed the decor - interesting paintings on the walls.Thanks, Tran.

12.description: Really good pho! The broth was flavorful, definitely one of the best I've had. The shrimp spring rolls were also very good.I also enjoyed the decor - interesting paintings on the walls.Thanks, Tran.

21.description: I stopped in last week to grab some carryout Pho Ga and shrimp spring rolls. I got my food and was out the door in under 10 minutes. The prices were VERY reasonable and the food was tasty. (Could have used more basil for the pho tho).

16.description: I really like this place,.flavorful soup awesome egg roll and fried chicken wing also really good Give them a try!

17.description: Been there twice and so much satisfied with food. The place is cozy. Good food for a cheap price. I definitely will be coming back.

10.description: Great music. A Vietnamese friend of mine said this restaurant is not authentic. So I had a bowl of broth, kobe beef, and noodles. I also ordered crab rangoon. The crab pastry was delicious but oily. I thought the beef was okay. It was chewy and in big pieces. Broth was ok. Same with noodles.

11.description: Chicken pho is good. kobe beef pho doesn't have kobe beef but looks like regular beef. spring roll is decent. the salt and pepper smelt was too greasy and the mi sate is bland. decorative and clean place. service is slow when busy. I think their signature dish is chicken pho.

26.description: One star overall for the worst service ever and we did not get to eat.I took my mom to the restaurant because we had known the chef from New Asia restaurant and we always enjoyed chicken Pho at NA when the chef was there. The restaurant was full when we arrived, 10 minutes later the manager sat us down with another family at the same table (how typical). We waited about 15 minutes, the manager (not a server) came over and tried to take our order. I told her how we could order any food if there wasn't any menu, she then apologized and told a waitress standing by to get us menus and water. 5 minutes later, the waitress gave us 2 take-out menus and no water.20 minutes went by and nobody even bothered to check with us, then a Caucasian man came in sat next to us. Immediately, a waiter came over and took his order, it seemed the waiter could not understand what his customer wanted so he asked the manager to take the order instead. Here, we were, being ignored for over half an hour so we got up and walked out of the place then headed to New Asia restaurant on Lawrence.Definitely, we'll never come back to that place. The manager had no clue how to run the place, none of the servers were trained properly. Never again, Nam Lua, we will not be humiliated again by you. To other Vietnamese patrons, make sure to bring a Caucasian friend (or family) with you for ensure a better service. Otherwise, they'll treat you like second class. Check out other reviews and compare with your own experience then figure it out for yourself.I just realized Angelo C. (the poster below) was the Caucasian man sitting next to us. Good for you, Angelo C.

27.description: Service was slow. Everything was sweet. Never got my appetizer so had to cancel. Had to wait for soup to be "warmed up" only to have it taste like the pho broth. Absolutely disappointed.

0.description: Try number 20 good stuff. I'm not sure what 20 is but all the other numbers I tried were good so 20 must be good too. I need not mention I've checked in here over 20 times! That should say enough! This is the third time I've eaten here twice in a day!

20.description: I have been to Vietnam at least half a dozen times.  Living in Chicago, I've been frustrated with the poor-quality wimpy food that passes for Vietnamese.  I think most Americans do not like the intensity and spice.  And the owners are forced to comply.  This place is fantastic!  The pho is authentic, served with the traditional accompaniments.  Other dishes are great as well.  Order the spicy chicken wings and the ground beef stir fried with rice crackers - - both to die for.  I plan to ask the owner if he will build a condo in the kitchen for me.  I'd like to move in.  By the way, my manicurist told me about this place (she is Vietnamese) and I was the only non-Vietnamese person dining there.

19.description: We were first placed at a table and waited 15 minutes before placing our order. The white couple sitting next to us got their order taken and food before us who they have sat several minutes after us.All three of us have ordered pho. One was chicken and the other two were beef. One of the beef soups came first and had our friend awkwardly wait for the rest of us to get food and had her soup get cold. My soup had flank, rare beef, and meatballs. I asked for tripe. When my soup arrived, there was no tripe but instead soft tendon. I asked for the tripe without the waitress telling me that it would be a whooping $2 extra (they gave me a scarce amount of tripe that's hidden in a bowl of broth they gave me).We waited another 15 minutes for the waitress to give us our check but instead, all 3 staff members were standing and chatting with each other. We had to physically get off our seats to obtain our check.I have complained to the cashier that I shouldn't be charged an extra $2. I ordered rare steak, meatballs, and flank pho ($7.50) and asked to put tripe. The combination  pho consist of "rare steak, meatballs, flank, oxtail , tripe, and tendon" for $7.50 ... So why was I charged an extra $2 for tripe if I could have just ordered the combination  and have removed the oxtail and tendon? I asked them how much would I be charged had I ordered the combination and asked to remove the oxtail and tendon... They said $7.50. I asked them to take off that $2 extra and they refused explaining how I didn't order the combo so I can't get charge so and so.We needed our food packed. We had to pack it ourselves, being liquid foods, we would expected the staff to pack it themselves. Will not go back again.I HIGHLY recommend the PHO place that's really on the other side of the street ... Hoanh Long !!!!

2.description: so im vietnamese meaning i have had pretty much had over a million bowls of pho in my entire life. ive been to pretty much every pho shop in chicago. so i guess i think i can tell a great pho after trying one. Anyways. after trying this place twice I"ve had mix results.First time it was great...had the beef pho... 2nd time i was disappointed.the portion and soup from my first visit was no where to  compare to my second visit. it was like they cut the portion in have in order to feed all the other people. im assuming that was the reason. The first time i came there was only a few customer "(like 4) .2nd time was like 22 people. .glad they were busy but food wise not soo much.. whats disappoint me more was the chicken pho my wife had order.. I know she order  the chicken with bone but seriously giving her the entire backbone which is like 5 piece of bone with barely any meat to it. less than a ouch of meat... SMH Will NOt return again.i should have gone to my go to pho place (New Asia for pho chicken) and( uptown pho for beef chicken.)sorry guys i hate leaving a bad review especially when one of the owner is my banker

18.description: I haven't been here for awhile so I thought I'd stop by for some chicken pho. I noticed that the service was a bit faster than before which is good. Service overall was okay.However, my shredded chicken pho was different from before. The both tasted the same but the chicken was very chewy and hard, not as tender as before. The spring rolls were also almost half size smaller than before. I don't know what happened. Did they downgrade the quality of their food?!

13.description: Great place. Very good pho good prices and good service. Their other items are also a good choice. Kobe beef pho is always good here.

4.description: I've eaten at Pho Nam Lua twice. Each time, it took an extremely long time for my order to be taken. I hate when I actually have to ask an employee if "I can order now." On top of taking an extremely long time to take our order, they also took an extremely long time to bring out the food. When the food was finally brought out, they took the wrong order. So 2 of our party was eating while the other had to wait for their correct order to be made. In addition to this mishap, the bathroom wasn't working and my 4 year old daughter reaaaaaally had to go, so I had to take her next door just to use the bathroom. Horrible!

24.description: More like 3.5 stars. I think the Pho is just okay. Bun Bo Hue was better. Both broth were on the salty side. And the noodle was a bit over cooked. But I will give 3.5 stars because I haven't had oxtail in any of my Pho in Chicago before. I wouldn't order the spring roll again. The lettuce was chopped up too fine and the rice paper was too hard.

6.description: Tried this place for the first time as here's what I got. I went with my wife as mother for lunch. We ordered the shrimp and meat spring rolls and egg rolls to start. First off they are pre made so that means they are not as fresh as possible. The starters came out 1 minute after I ordered them and the spring roll was cold like it came from the fridge. We ordered the pho with flank steak strips ad a Saigon special pho. The broth wasn't bad but didn't have the mix of flavors I would get from a great bowl of pho. 2 out of 3 bowls of pho had a good amount of noodles but the 3rd bowl had about half of what was in the 2 other bowls. Service could be better, they seem like they are not comfortable. Not one of the best or even mediocre pho places in Chicago. I guess I would go back to give it another shot but if that goes the same, I wouldn't go back since there are many other better pho places around the area.

22.description: Looked forward to trying place out. Service was ok. Portions are small and not much on menu like other traditional pho restaurants.

15.description: One star overall for the worst service ever and we did not get to eat.I took my mom to the restaurant because we had known the chef from New Asia restaurant and we always enjoyed chicken Pho at NA when the chef was there. The restaurant was full when we arrived, 10 minutes later the manager sat us down with another family at the same table (how typical). We waited about 15 minutes, the manager (not a server) came over and tried to take our order. I told her how we could order any food if there wasn't any menu, she then apologized and told a waitress standing by to get us menus and water. 5 minutes later, the waitress gave us 2 take-out menus and no water.20 minutes went by and nobody even bothered to check with us, then a Caucasian man came in sat next to us. Immediately, a waiter came over and took his order, it seemed the waiter could not understand what his customer wanted so he asked the manager to take the order instead. Here, we were, being ignored for over half an hour so we got up and walked out of the place then headed to New Asia restaurant on Lawrence.Definitely, we'll never come back to that place. The manager had no clue how to run the place, none of the servers were trained properly. Never again, Nam Lua, we will not be humiliated again by you. To other Vietnamese patrons, make sure to bring a Caucasian friend (or family) with you for ensure a better service. Otherwise, they'll treat you like second class. Check out other reviews and compare with your own experience then figure it out for yourself.I just realized Angelo C. (the poster below) was the Caucasian man sitting next to us. Good for you, Angelo C.

7.description: I did a to-go order and got me the Vegetable Fried Rice w/ tofu and no egg- I'm vegan and I even informed the lady who took my order about it. Got my food and I saw the tofu and veggies and I assumed there was rice at the bottom...i got home and opened the container and WRONG. Wide rice noodles with vegetables and tofu. I'm pretty sure I said fried rice and I hope those noodles were vegan.  I'm pretty sure wide rice noodles are vegan but I was not  100% so I didn't eat anything but my friend did  and said that the food was pretty greasy. I didn't call back.  Other than that, the staff are pretty friendly peeps.

8.description: I stopped in last week to grab some carryout Pho Ga and shrimp spring rolls. I got my food and was out the door in under 10 minutes. The prices were VERY reasonable and the food was tasty. (Could have used more basil for the pho tho).

3.description: My family and I wanted to order pho for pick-up because it was one of the only places open on Christmas Day. From driving by several times, we all thought that this place appeared to be a typical Vietnamese place with the usual noodle and rice offerings. However, we had the hardest time figuring out what to order because there was no menu online, and their website seems to be for another restaurant entirely! I had to scroll through some photos on Yelp and fortunately found two pictures of parts of the menu that some other Yelp user had uploaded (thank you!!). Food and prices were both average.

14.description: Food is great as always however, staff mixed up my order, and not only that my pho barely had enough noodles...., I DONT KNOW  IF ID GO BACK. When I got my pho I had to ask for my bean sprouts, basil etc. .. WAITERS/WAITRESS DON'T UNDERSTAND OR SPEAK ENGLISH, which screws orders!!!! I SHOULDNT EVEN GIVE 2 STARS BUT FOOD WAS GOOD.  That's the only thing good.

1.description: After calling several other salons for a mani/pedi and none of them working out, I was able to schedule an appointment with Kaly (like- an "I'll be there in 15 minutes" appointment, so basically a walk-in). She was very nice and accommodating. I chose the $35 no-chip mani/pedi, and she did an incredible job! I sat in a massage chair and read magazines while my feet soaked in warm water. Then she scrubbed my feet with an exfoliating scrub and gave them a mini-massage. Finally, she wrapped my feet and hands in hot towels before she started painting. The color I chose looks great, and it is very smooth! She also gave me a punch card for 6 manicures to get the 7th free!

2.description: I visited this place yesterday after scoring a pretty sweet Groupon-- $14 for a mani/pedi!  I was a little wary at first for their lack of any online reviews or social media, but I decided to go for it anyway.  I called at around 2pm and was able to make an appointment for 5:30pm the same day.The salon is in a bit of dated strip shops just west of Lincoln Avenue on Peterson, next to a furniture store with some really classy and current home furnishings (not really).  The salon itself is on par for what I expect from typical nail salons in Chicago-- brightly painted walls, some wood paneling and a tile floor.  This salon does hair services as well, so the front of the store is amassed by styling and blowdrying chairs.There are 2 pedicure chairs and one manicure station at the back of the salon, along with 2 wall shelves of essie and OPI polishes.  I am a huge essie fan, so I was excited to see this salon carrying them, as not all of the places I have experienced through Groupon do.  I was directed to pick out my color as the technician ran water for my pedi.  The chairs seemed new and in great working condition-- with their foray into Groupon and rock-bottom regular prices, I wonder if nail services are new to this salon?I sat down in the pedi chair and was pointed to some magazines on an adjoining table while the technician hit "start" on the massage chair and I soaked my feet.  The tech got right to work on my toes, and she did a pretty good job!  My only complaint about the pedicure is that this salon doesn't use any type of cuticle softener; oil was used instead, which does an adequate job, but not the best.  I read People magazine, caught up on facebook and watched some Jeopardy! while the technician did her work.  The highlight of my pedi was the massage; honestly, one of the best and lengthiest I have had in quite some time!  After my feet were cleaned up and toes polished, I was ushered over to the lone manicure station.  The pedicure took about 30 minutes.The manicure was pretty basic; again, the lack of cuticle softener was a miss.  The water in the soak wasn't warm at all, either.  Next time, I'll ask for it to be hotter.  The tech didn't talk to me through the whole experience except to ask if I lived nearby and to ask if I had a Groupon.  This is completely fine with me, though, as I enjoy not having to make small talk while I relax.  My nails were soaked, trimmed, scrubbed, buffed, lotioned and painted in about 20 minutes.  I sat at the drying station for 10 minutes, during which time, the tech brought over a punch card for future visits, a price sheet and coupons for me to take home.  I looked over it as I dried, and WOW-- this place offers a mani/pedi for $25 Mon-Wed, no-chip manis for $20, and a no-chip mani-pedi for $35, WITHOUT COUPON!  Those are superb deals, when considering a no-chip mani around the corner from my house costs $25, and a no-chip pedi is $40.  All in all, a good experience.  I think with a few adjustments, this place is going to do amazingly well.  There is still a Groupon available today for $14 for one mani-pedi and $27 for two mani-pedis... maybe I can convince my husband to buy me another for future use?

0.description: Absolutely five star! The shop owner's daughter does the nails. I found this place through groupon and I'm glad I did. She's extremely friendly, she offers you magazines, something to drink etc. Also if my nine year old is with she let's him hang out on the massage chairs and puts something on tv for him. The prices are the lowest I've seen and yet the quality and the job she does is wonderful. I've brought my mom, sister and friends to her and they where all impressed as well. Every other nail shop I've been to in the city there's always a long wait, unfriendly people working in them, and high prices. This is definitely the place to go!

1.description: I was browsing GrubHub and spotted this new place. I wanted to order supper tonight so I could focus on watching the Olympics. I was intrigued by the concept of Korean fast food delivery. The delivery was indeed fast and the packaging was very good. They gave me a few glossy menus, which were nice because they are durable and also show the food options in pictures as well as descriptions. I ordered the Galbi, which is served with rice, jhap chae and sliced radish. I enjoyed it with the knowledge that it is a fast food meal and not fine dining. I ordered the Bul-go-gi for Chris, because he has never had Korean food before. He said it was ok, but he doesn't know if Korean food is his speed. I tasted his Bul-go-gi, and I agree with him. It is ok. My Galbi was a lot more flavorful. We also tried their pot stickers (Man-Doo) and enjoyed them. You get like 8 or 10 of them in an order. It is not exactly cheap eats for being fast food, but for now anyhow, delivery is free. I will definitely order again, but probably lunch for myself, because i don't see Chris getting into Korean food anytime soon. Hmmmmmm .... as I look over he is still eating ... hope springs eternal!!!!!

0.description: I love their jhap chae! The Bul-go-gi is very tender and tasty. Good size portions and worth the price. $10 minimum for delivery and there's no delivery charge.

3.description: I've never had such a disappointing experience in my entire life. We called 7 different times to reserve a game that the other gamestops didn't have (but were nice enough to look the stock availability in this one for) and NO ONE answered the phone. Seven times! We had to call a DIFFERENT GameStop to ask if this one was even open! Long story short, we decide to go into the store and get the game, only to see the customer in front of us holding the ONLY COPY. Needless to say we were absolutely fuming. Had this store simply picked up their phone one time, we would have had the game. They weren't even busy! Such a horrible disappointment. I plan to tell all my gamer friends about this particular store and surely will not go back myself. We ended up going to a different game stop to get a different version of that game, and the employees there even said themselves how much they hate this store.

1.description: Stopped in yesterday to sell my old Xbox and Teresa was awesome helping me out. She was very nice and really quick checking everything out to make sure it all worked. I will definitely come back here

2.description: GameStop is known for its crap service but if there's one location to recommend it's this one, nothing but the best service. And the employees here take their time to at least remember regular faces

5.description: Very nice guy helped us.

6.description: The staff at this gamestop makes it my favorite of the chain's locations. They are very helpful and hilarious. Free parking lot and next to food is also a plus!

7.description: Don't you love the smell and look of a new store.  Displays and shelves are all in neat order.  Used games, don't look all that used.  Everything is right there, ready to be found.  Walked in today, found five games I wanted right away.  But, they're still new games, too pricey.  Tested a few used games in the store, walked out with two used games.  Two associates manning the store, very helpful and offered me some additional info on which stores I could go to, to find the other games I was looking for.  Bliss.. Quizno's and Starbucks next door!

0.description: John P. is the man. We went in to pick up DS games for one of the kids, ended up getting 3 DS games and 3 Xbox games during their Buy 2 get one free sale. Busy day and just listening him tend to customers with their questions was impressive. He was kind, attentive and very knowledgable and honest in his answers.  Great customer service. You can tell he's not there to just make a buck. He likes his job and gaming! We will be back for sure for out gaming needs. He was patient about our questions and gave great suggestions. Seriously, cool dude.

4.description: Great Staff.  Knowledgeable and receptive.  Not abrasive, with a know-it-all, elite-ist demeanor like some come off as.  I was there standing in the rain for the recent Modern Warfare 3 midnight drop.  Staff was upbeat and seemed just as psyched as their patrons. They even tried to hype everyone up further and boost morale as the rain ensued.  Everything ended up well orchestrated and orderly.  Not a hitch to be mentioned other than mother nature's contribution.  Obviously, I loved the way they handled this one and this location will definitely be my go-to for future game drops.

58.description: Having not been here for years, I experienced Martinos for the final time last night.  While I never remembered the place for decor, it is old and dull, I do recall decent food at a decent price. I ordered the broiled chicken dinner with a baked potato. The meal comes with soup or salad. The salad was simple iceberg lettuce, with a pretty decent homemade Italian Dressing. I asked the waitress if I could order all white meat on the chicken. While there was an up-charge ($2.50), I was fine with that until I saw what I received. I ended up with two chicken breasts and two wings that were barely enough for dinner. I honestly have never seen smaller chicken breasts before. When I saw how dry the chicken was, I asked for some barbecue sauce to help out. Now I dine out fairly frequently, I do not recall ever being charged ($.99) for barbecue sauce ... which by the way was a surprise charge when the bill came. Really???

56.description: Let me begin by saying I like Martino's for what it is: a good, old fashioned, neighborhood, Italian place.  It's got all the old standbys, I think, and does a pretty good job with most.  The pizzas are good, although I think maybe I prefer Lou Malnalti's by a hair.  I usually order carryout, although I've eaten in often as well.First the good: Martino's has the absolute best veal marsala that I have ever had.  Period.  I use the Italian bread that comes with the carryout order, slathered liberally with some good cultured butter, and soak up every precious drop of "gravy" in the dish.  (Hint: You gotta do this at home, not at the restaurant, because you can end up looking like a moron, with gravy dripping down your chin.)  This dish is my favorite by a wide margin and you must order it!I also like the ribs a lot.  They are tasty and tender, although they come with french fries which just don't translate to take home--by the time you get them home and on the table they are mealy and cold.Now for what I don't like:  First, not enough veal marsala in the veal marsala.  At $14.95, I'd like to see a little more meat.  That being said, the dish does come with pasta and your choice of sauce (I can recommend my favorite, angel hair with garlic and oil).  Second, they really need to stop putting stuff in their salads that should be thrown out.  I mean, I've gotten some truly nasty lettuce on occasion, wilted, ugly, yellow stuff.  One time I even got the whole damn core of a head of lettuce!  I mean, really, no one eats that stuff.  And they should take a little time to cut up the salad stuff better: tonight, I got a piece of green pepper in my salad that was about six inches long by almost an inch wide. Service is good.  The ladies who wait on tables are efficient and friendly.  Parking can usually be found on Peterson near the place, or on Bernard, which is the side street just to the east of the restaurant.

29.description: Outstanding thin crust pizza. The sauce is sweet and the sausage is tasty. Kristina is very friendly and has an amazing memory.  Been eating there since the late 70's.  Just wish the garlic breadsticks were always given out.

42.description: Martino's. My heart. My parent's like to say that in 1974 when the moved into their house a few blocks away from this family owned local gem, they ordered a pizza and ate it among the moving boxes in a then empty home, and they never looked back. Since then a lifetime has passed, children were had, and raised, and out the door, yet Martino's has been a staple throughout. And all these decades later we still dedicate at least a couple of our family Sunday dinners a month at Mom and Dad's to satisfying our collective need for a Martino's fix. Maybe it's because their pizza and pasta are what I grew up eating, but I have never found a pizza or order of baked mostacholi with marinera could ever love the same. Even eating their mozzarella stix, with hot delicious homemade marinera  turns a fried standard into a near delicacy. Over 28 years, I can count on one hand the number of times that I have eaten inside their comfortable and quite dinning room, so I might not be the best to speak to that, but I will say everyone of those few times was just swell. The waitresses most often handle the front of the house pick-ups along with the owner Rose, or her daughter Carmella, and the service has always been great.  They never mess up our orders, even when they are rather large and we almost always have it delivered. I strongly recommend Martino's. As a matter of fact, when my sisters and I show up with a new "friend" every once in a while for those Sunday dinners, we all secretly judge him based on his reaction to the thin crust pizza, pastas, salads, and whatever else we fill his plate with. If he shares our love for this quality restaurant, he's gained a number of points. Tje only negative thoughts I have about this place come when I think about all the thousands of bucks we have spent their over the years. But supporting quality local business isn't some civic duty here, it's just innate. Your taste buds will make the choice for you. Now, I think that's an endorsement!

23.description: This place is amazing. I've grown up in the neighborhood all my life. I've gone to martinos all my life. I would have to say the thin crust is really good and catering and renting the place out for party's is also very good! Carmella and rose are the owners. Very good.

47.description: This is one of the best pizza places on the North side. I enjoy their thin crust pizza. The crust is always crispy and nice and thin. I have been to other pizza places where once you start pilling on the toppings the pizza gets soggy. Not this place, no matter how many toppings you order the crust stays crispy. However I do find that I enjoy the pizza more if I order extra sauce, which they never charge me for. I love this place and would recommend it to anyone that likes thin crust pizza!

8.description: Great place.  We hadn't been here for a while.  She had Italian sausage sandwich, it was so big she had to take it home.  Their garlic bread is the best from anyplace, make sure to get a side order of garlic bread.

31.description: Easy street parking at this neighborhood staple, despite the snow. Nice selection of standard Italian, all of which is tasty and satisfying. Thoroughly enjoyed the chicken marsala, while my dining companions opted for pizza, chicken vesuvio and italian beef casserole. Everybody came away full and happy.

34.description: I write this review after a hilariously bad experience with this restaurant and their customer service. My family and I have been loyal customers to Martino's for well more than a decade. We had a bad experience with the service we received a few years ago, but decided to continue to order from this restaurant because we enjoyed the pizza so much.I ordered a pizza and gave them my credit card number to pay. I was told the pizza would arrive "within the hour" as usual. An hour passes and I call to check with the restaurant since this was out of the ordinary. I was told the pizza would arrive shortly.  When the pizza arrives we are asked for cash despite taking the measures to pay credit. Luckily we could provide the cash at such short notice. Additionally the pizza is lukewarm! We call to find out why the pizza wasn't paid for with our credit card and we're responded to with blatant lies to cover up for their mistakes. The manager as well as the employee lied about the time we ordered our pizza when THEIR receipt clearly stated otherwise. They also tried to say we had our pizza for an hour when that aligned with neither the truth nor their terribly formulated cover up. The manager also tried to tell me how hot the pizza sitting in front of me was. She never apologized, nor offered a way to correct the issues, she simply created a new lie as a rebuttal to everything I had to say.

16.description: Great stop for homemade food.....to bad they can't figure out how to put a website up so people can see there menu and maybe place a to go order.  two stars for no website and no tv to catch on who is winning the local pro team scores at least.   2nd trip in find the food and pizza to be great, but now have pushed the envelope on the prices....try 3 dollars for a soft drink.

13.description: Love this place. It clearly has a strong regular crowd and was decorated in the late 80 ' s. The staff are genuine and accommodating.

11.description: I really like this place a lot, the food is awesome and the service is friendly.  Not the place to go if you are in a hurry,  but for a relaxed atmosphere and quality Italian food for reasonable prices,  it's hard to beat,  especially the pastas. Parking is readily available on the street,  and it's kid friendly.

39.description: Really good simple Italian dishes. They're thin crust pizza is great, chicken Parmesan also really great. My brother is the pickiest person and loves their chicken tenders. Love Martino's, nearby, good prices, good food.

37.description: The worst place I have ever ordered from! I received my order wrong. Extra random charges. I called and spoke with the manager who yelled at me told me to shut up. I will never order from this place again. Th manager repeated to yell and call me a liar. Was not willing to cooperate with me at all the worst experience ever.

0.description: Just had their thin crust, half sausage, half  pepperoni.Delicious. Perfect amount of sauce with a nice thin crust. The kids ate every last piece.

38.description: I live 4 blocks away from Martinos. I used to get pizzas from them.  A lot of pizza Really, Alot from them.  So much that atleast every 2 months I'd get a free small pizza with 20 coupons. Every time I got the "free" pizza they put almost no ingredents on it.  WTF!!  That was strike 1, The pizza was hit or miss. Sometimes it was really good Sometimes it was okay. Strike 2. I called one time to get a pizza with the free small pizza. Almost no cheese. Very little sauce.  I talked to the old owner. He told me LOUDLY the pizza is free what do You expect. I am a RETURNING customer That means that I shop buy alot from You.  You should take care of them. Strike 3.

51.description: Whole wheat pizza crust now!!!  So this means I can eat it as often as I already love to, but with absolutely no guilt.... right?  Right??

27.description: Awesome family restaurant with the flavors and feel of home.The thin crust pizza rocks a crispy cracker like crust.. yummy buffalo wings and very courteous service. Martino's is definitely my go to place for pizza, friendly service and yummy appetizers. Always a good experience!!!

32.description: Great, great food. Been coming here for years and it's still just as good.

54.description: I love Martino's thin crust pizza!!  The ingrediants always taste really fresh!  I usually get it delivered and the few times that I have been in the restaurant, I was happy to see that it is very clean inside, including their bathrooms!  It feels good to eat from a place that you know has clean bathrooms!!

48.description: I've always ordered pizza to go as a kid from here and loved their thin crust so much I never bothered trying anything else. The other week I took my wife here for dinner so that I could revisit an old childhood joint and try something new as well. We ordered the thin crust special and the Chicken Veusvio. The chicken was good but the sauce was fantastic. When the waitress asked us if we wanted bread to dip in the vesuvio sauce we declined and proceeded to dip our pizza in the sauce instead. Wow. I'm angry I never tried this until now and I'm also glad I live really far away from this place because I'd probably gain a ton of weight if I still lived in the area. I'll have to try the stuffed next time.

44.description: Not 5 stars as I remembered it, but still damn good.Maybe my taste buds have changed since I've been here last, but the dishes were not the knockout dishes that they once were. We're talking at least 10 years since I've enjoyed their food.Linguine with clams...above average. Eggplant parmesan...above average. Baked mushroom appetizer....glad some things remain the same.Maybe if I didn't abandon my go-to place of my youth, I would've added the last star. Looks like I need to start coming here again on a regular basis because this place deserves it.

24.description: Martino's is the perfect example of Italian family cooking and our go to place for pizza. Pan and thin are both delicious, so it is always a hard decision for us! The entrees are great and their catering menu is extensive. We have ordered for all of our son's graduation parties, and our guests leave happy. Go to Martino's...excellent food and service!

7.description: This place has all the good food you like, pizza, spaghetti, meat, rice, everything. Amazing place to take a family out to eat and have a good time. Everything is fresh love this place great service.

49.description: I am a big fan of the pizza.  I have been going here since 1984 and it is my place for pizza.  Thin stuffed or pan you can't go wrong.
