40.description: I don't know. Some reviewers swear by this restaurant, but I think that might be for the retro hamish quality of the place, not so much the food or service. I have eaten there many times and would say it is an adequate restaurant. I used to order delivery regularly - always the same thing, small pan pizza with broccoli, mushroom, garlic. Sometimes they would get something wrong on the order, something small, like not well done when I asked for well done, or the pop would be warm. If I complained they never did anything like give a partial credit. If I asked to speak to the manager a woman who could really care less got on the phone. So yeah, they are generally nice if nothing goes wrong. Last night, after a long time not ordering from Martino's, I ordered again, and the pizza came with the ingredients slid over to one side of the pie, and not only not well done, but undercooked. Voilá 2 stars.

53.description: Good family restaurant, but sometimes not the same quality.I've been there a dozen times with family and unfortunately, when I actually have out of town family(to impress)...they did not perform the same quality.Martinis are always good there, however.

30.description: The thin crust pizza, canolli's and Rick the delivery guy bring this to a 10 star place. Unfortunately, I have had friends that have had terrible arguments with staff when it comes to making any kind of a complaint. So... with a bit of a warning ahead of time, this is good food, good prices and personally, I like ordering for delivery more than sitting in the restaurant.

46.description: LYING THIEVES!!!They did not honor a groupon coupon for $10 off!!! The coupon did not say dine-in only or not take out orders so it was their mistake, not mine! By not honoring my coupon all she did is ensure I will never again patronize this business.When I asked on the phone how many mushrooms were included in an order of stuffed mushrooms, I was told 12. When I got home it was only 6. The eggplant parmesan was so small it was a lunch portion, I had hoped to cut it in half and use it for 2 meals, along with the 12 mushrooms that turned out to be only 6. What a ripoff!STAY AWAY from this unethical lying management.When I told the lady she was wrong for not honoring my coupon from groupon that did not specifically state it was dine-in only she said "It implies it." Then when I tried to leave my order and leave the restaurant she guilt-tripped me into taking the order saying it would be wasted food. Excuse me, how is that my problem when you didn't honor a legally binding coupon I purchased on Groupon? Even if she wouldn't honor the coupon since I in good faith placed the order and showed up to pick it up she then should have given me a ten-dollar discount as for the face value of the coupon.

1.description: Came with a very large group and got quick, friendly service. Filled the restaurant with over 40 of us (we called ahead) and they were accommodating and professional. I sat at a table of six and we all ordered individual meals (mostly chicken dishes, one pasta and one order of stuffed mushrooms in creamy pesto). Chicken marsala was very flavorful and not oversalted, angel hair pasta and meatballs were delicious. Stuffed mushrooms in pesto cream sauce were tasty, although I could only eat two, mixed with a side of angel hair pasta, as the sauce was quite rich. Minestrone is delicious too, and also very rich. I'll be back, and will get a cup of Minestrone, a side salad, and munch away on the heavenly savory pita chips that come in the bread basket (look on the bottom, under the bread!).

55.description: Let me set the record straight.  Most underrated pizza ever.  I've been coming here for years and am surprised to see nothing but five stars.  The thin crust and the deep dish are amazing.  Also, the pasta, appetizers and everything else here is great.  Try the jalapeno poppers they are worth everything.  Although I have been the restaurant lately they do provide a pretty solid delivery service.

9.description: We place orders for delivery a few time a month from here. Prices aren't bad, nor is the food. Wish their food had a little more kick to it, but it does a nice job for those nights when you're really not looking to make dinner.

26.description: I had the best stuffed pizza here!

25.description: Nothing wrong with the food. But they tend to mess up your order quite often. When you call to let them know, the woman who owns the place is BEYOND rude and nasty. Even drops the F-Bomb on you. Enough is enough. It's funny, all the reviews with similar situations are in the "Reviews not recommended" section...

12.description: This place has hit rock bottom and has kept digging. Once a staple, the daughter has run it into the ground. Go to Calo's or Colletti's. I'd go to domino's before ordering from here again. Food is awful and the staff is worse. Read some of the other reviews and you'll get the picture.

59.description: Now everyone that knows me KNOWS I like my deep dish pizza. However, thanks to Martinos, I am now a little bit more closer to liking thin crust almost as much as deep dish. My aunt picked up a thin crust pepperoni pizza and brought it over to Swedish where my grandmother (RIP) was at when she was sick. It was about 10pm at night and maybe it was because I hadn't eaten all day,but it was soooooooooooooo good. The crust was crispy and the sauce was terrific, there was perfect amount  of sauce . There was a ton of cheese which I will not complain about. Il be eating more martinos more often hellz yea!

21.description: Still awesome had a thin crust from there last night done well done it was perfect thanks martinos!

17.description: Great, great food. Been coming here for years and it's still just as good.

10.description: Everything here is delicious. I've been eating here for ten years. The staff is always very nice.

5.description: Been ordering for delivery for almost 20 years; yummy, prompt delivery an easy phone ordering as they pull-up your delivery info via your phone number! My favorites are the classic thin crust pizza, veal with lemon and spinach, friend shrimp/mushrooms/scallops...always hot and great.  I've never "eaten in" so can't rate ambiance, wait-staff etc.  The most recent delivery guys have been extremely pleasant and polite, in the past a few surly characters who scowled at a $3 tip on a $15.00 order!?!?!  Maybe he was having a bad day/week/life.OH, and the Italian beef and sausage sandwiches are also yummy. Skip the coleslaw, and go for salad. Also, their cocktail sauce (for the fried shrimp) tastes like pizza sauce, so just add a squeeze of lemon and some horseradish and voila!

3.description: This is a legend in Peterson Park and has been a family favorite for over 40 years. Best pizza in the world. They also have an amazing minestrone soup. Highly recommend.

35.description: Had food delivered from here last night. I had the Eggplant Parm, Stuffed Mushrooms and washed it down with an RC Cola. I have to say that the eggplant was really good, not too much breading but flavorful. The stuffed mushrooms were tasty but I could've done without the pesto sauce, it just didn't look good swimming in all that sauce. The bread was also soft & tasty, and who doesn't like an RC Cola???

19.description: There was a tiny rock in the pizza that cracked my tooth. I had to get a very expensive crown. When I called to talk to the manager I politely explained what happened. I knew that any compensation was a long shot, but I thought I would get an apology at least. All I got was defensiveness and a rude denial that it happened. She asked which pizza it was and when I told her, she said,"there is nothing like that in that pizza!".  Well, obviously rocks aren't in the ingredient list... She insinuated I was lying and said it wasn't their problem. The pizza was ok, and this rock was so small I don't really hold them responsible for overlooking it, but I'll never eat there again after talking to the rude manager.

28.description: We have been ordering from Martinos for over 20 years. Their quality in good food and service has quickly declined. Tonight as we were cleaning up dinner we had ordered, came across a creepy crawler which resembled a silver fish in our French fries When we called to speak to the owner Rose she went irate on myself telling me to shut the f up claiming we we were trying to pull some sort of scam. Never once apologizing that a bug was found In our food rather attacking me over the phone. Do not eat or get delivery from this place! terrible just terrible. Shame on you Rose you have lost several families in the neighborhood due to your ignorance.

45.description: I've been eating here for years.  Mostly take out & they have never disappointed.  Never had any problems with them.  Best pizza in my neighborhood.  There pastas are also delicious.

33.description: We went there for the first time with family for dinner and enjoyed Martino's food and service. The spinach lasagna was delicious, but THE BEST was service and our waitress Kristina from Lithuania. She was very sincere, attentive and pleasant.  We will definitely be back there to see her. Place bit outdated so only gets 4 stars :)

43.description: I looove this place!

2.description: I have been a patron of this neighborhood family restaurant for over 25 years. I have ordered hundred of pizzas and they are the best thin crust in the city

18.description: Have been ordering from Martinos for years. Their pizza is usually decent for the price, however it often arrives cold if you order delivery. We put up with that and never complained. However, the last time we ordered, the pizza did not have any toppings on it, even though we ordered pepperoni and were charged for it. That's fine, mistakes happen and I can understand that. However, when we called the restaurant to politely explain there was no pepperoni on our pizza, they refused to do anything about it since we already ate a few slices of the pizza. Well we waited an hour for the pizza and were starving, of course we would have a couple slices. Most of the pizza was still remaining. The manager was very rude and plainly stated that she doesn't care if she loses our business, she would not send us a new pizza or offer any discount. I don't think I've ever had such a rude encounter at a restaurant. Due to this rude service, we will not be returning.

41.description: My friend swears by it...........so we came for some pizza the other night.here is my review of each item i had.Bread:  GOOD....soft butter not hard cold butter is key!Cesar Salad: AVERAGE......the side of dressing was very thick and hard to drizzle on my salad......was like plopping glue on my saladBaked Clams:  BELOW AVERAGE....kind of rubbery and the plate of baked clams had NO JUICE on it to be mopped up with bread.  PIZZA:  AVERAGE..........not a fan of their crust, whatever it is........i mean it was good.......but maybe because i was starving. Overall, I think the Pizza is very OVER RATED.  I still prefer PETES's to this joint.  The Pro's is that it's just far enough that I am out of their delivery zone.  That my friends is a GOOD THING.Most likely won't be back.....maybe when I am 75 years old like the rest of the patrons.Oh and a ONE TOILET washroom?  Seriously???  Who has that?Some old man took a dump right before me and I had to smell that crap as I went in after him...............YUCK!!!

52.description: hello everyone i was a good customer of this place and i had orderd atleast every week two or three time at work and home its fair pizza but tell one day im soo busy at my shop and i did the order  and like always 45m tha pizza came to my shop i pay for it and gave tha driver tip like always when we opend it it was like the driver had all his windows open and the cheez got so hard so i call them back they where so nice they told my sorry and that next pizza will be on them ok next time i order i told them abot it and the chack then say to me ok you have free dealivery then i ask when i ask last week they told me that next time its on us she say no so they gave me $4 off and they lost a whole lot family from going back to this place when you order $30  then they give you what you give the driver tip thats not a good place so i will never go or tell anyone to go to this place  all my family know about it so im going to make sure they will never go or order from martinos pizza

50.description: I've been going to Martino's for 20 years now. They have great thin crust pizza and the chicken noodle soup is my favorite! My only complaint would be the fact that it can be over priced: no free drink refills and $2.80 per topping on a pizza. But it's a great neighborhood mom and pop restaurant with great Italian food!

4.description: great thin crust pizza, not overally expensive but also not super cheap...got a xl pizza that i finished my half in a few minutes...

6.description: Delicious sausage-- no gristly bits, no inedible morsels.  Just great, carefully made home made fennel sausage.  Great. Chicken Marsala to die for.  Expertly prepared.  The fish tasted pre-frozen.  If they cooked fresh fish, the line would be out the door.

22.description: The food and service are always exceptional.  I especially love the thin crust pizza. It's one of the best pizza's Chicagoland has to offer.

15.description: Have been a regular for years.  Mom and I always order the calamari...it is TOPS!  Their homemade minestrone soup and chicken with spinach in lemon sauce are delicious.  Plus the ladies that serve you are very kind and helpful!

57.description: I liked it, one of the best thin crusts, will order again:-)

20.description: I love the thin crust pizza! The service is good. Kinda old school looking. Great place for good food with friends. Been coming here over 10+ years.

36.description: The spinach lasagna was delicious They could use a separate area for pick up though. Not a big deal but or order wasn't ready so we had no where to wait but sit at 2 top. The dining room wasn't busy but I could imagine Friday & Saturday this could be an issue ppl picking up order. The waitress who had accent was very nice gave us water while we waited and apologize for the wait.We will def go back & tried pizza due other reviewers.

14.description: We have been ordering from Martinos for over 20 years. Their quality in good food and service has quickly declined. Tonight as we were cleaning up dinner we had ordered, came across a creepy crawler which resembled a silver fish in our French fries When we called to speak to the owner Rose she went irate on myself telling me to shut the f up claiming we we were trying to pull some sort of scam. Never once apologizing that a bug was found In our food rather attacking me over the phone. Do not eat or get delivery from this place! terrible just terrible. Shame on you Rose you have lost several families in the neighborhood due to your ignorance.

0.description: Great staff....it's  new salon just starting so ther'es only one beautician. But great place for a relaxing wash and blow dry.

3.description: Patronize this business if you...(1) are Asian or(2) are not Asian and so want to be treated like crap.

1.description: Less jam-packed than several of the other stores in the area, and thus slightly more expensive.  I'd visit here last after getting the cheap stuff elsewhere (you'll save a couple bucks).  They have some nice stuff that I didn't see at the other stores (giant rhinestone cuff bracelets with dangling rhinestone strands? Yes please!).  Tons of rhinestones, trays of rings (didn't see much of this elsewhere), numerous pretty pearl/rhinestone hairclips (bridal quality), etc. I was a little embarrassed at how much I was enjoying all the bling but just give in.  Wholesale only except the public can shop there on Saturday; a $50 minimum purchase is posted but I'm not sure they enforce it.They did tell me not to open any packages to try things on...but then they helped me with the necklace I wanted to try on.  Unlike some of the other stores in the neighborhood I visited, the staff here will ask if you need help, suggest additional accessories, etc.

2.description: Great deals, huge selection! Always have plenty of stock and always the latest trend.

5.description: This is by far my favorite jewelry store on this block of Clark Street. Here's the deal: This place is a wholesale store that only sells to individuals with a tax ID during the weekdays. However, on Saturday, it's open to the public. That's good news to you, I, and other normal folks, my friend!The jewelry -- think lots of cubic zirconia, rhinestones, pearls, and other colorful stones. Despite all the stones being fake, the quality of the jewelry is actually quite decent. You can get matching jewelry sets (necklace and earrings) starting around $3. Yes. $3.00! I even saw cute matching necklace, earrings, and bracelet sets for $5.00 each. Great place to buy bridal and bridesmaid jewelry. You just can't beat the price, and there are hundreds of designs to choose from. Will be back for bridal hair jewelry!

6.description: Great selection for all kinds of people with different price ranges. They have started selling a really fun selection of headbands. They carry fashion forward jewelry for very affordable prices. Staff are very friendly and always willing to help. I've noticed that some customers think that because it's wholesale, they feel like they can treat the staff poorly, but they are very customer service oriented. Highly recommend it!

7.description: Nice Trading Company has beautiful jewelry. Also, they have really pretty designs in silver and platinum. Not only that, but their prices are low, and they engrave for free if you purchase $500 worth of jewelry.

8.description: Nice Trading has hundreds (if not thousands) of watches and jewelry with cutting edge designs.  They also carry a lot of other items that are ideal for any retailer or individual shopper looking for a great bargain.

0.description: This is one of my first stops at Clark and Wilson. They always have great deals and the hottest trends.  My sister and I first came upon this store last year when she was in town buying for her boutique. I have since gone numerous times after to find the perfect accessories. For an old school party, I got gold herringbone and chain link jewelry, one of those 3D hats with DOPE on it. Then for a wedding, I found a pretty bracelet, earrings and ring. Most recently, I went Christmas shopping there buying scarves, necklaces, and earrings.  Needless to say this is a hidden gem to those who have not ventured to this side of town before.

4.description: Tons of inexpensive bridesmaid and bridal jewelry to choose from.  I got 7 pair of crystal (lead and nickel free) drop earrings and a stretchy cuff bracelet for approx $150.  Decent quality for one night.  They have a ton of fashion accessories too.  You should definitely check out the area with a few girlfriends before you shop anywhere else for this kind of stuff.  The handbags at the place next door are great too!

3.description: I got the vegetarian combo, which was falafel with hummus, babaganoush, tahini sauce, house-made hot sauce, lettuce and tomato, and it came with pita bread. All of it was great! I loved the falafel and the sauces turned out to be amazing! The menu was way cheaper than I thought it would be too. Everyone at my table had food that looked equally delicious! I can't wait to order from them again.

1.description: I started buying a groupon through restaurants.com (I don't get it either...) but once I went in I just ordered normal prices off the menu. The beef shish kabob was $5 and huge. The beef was tender and super tasty.

2.description: The food is amazingly delicious and cheap! Nice clean restaurant with fast service. They have sandwiches for $3.50 which is cheaper than McDonald's and healthier. They deliver too!

0.description: Delicious food and cheap prices. Sandwich $3.50 service great. Girls need a job go there. This place is clean and you can have party's for baby showers. Good luck

12.description: horrible service...old food, messed up the order 4 times in a group of 9, short staffed, mean weird awkward door guy who just gives everyone hard looks, someone's gotta tell him that he's the doorman not a ufc ref...food sucked...service took a long time.  will not go here again with or without a coupon...new owners..their first business venture and its a flop...this place is not gonna last.

7.description: Great music, great crowd (not too many people, you can actually sit down and have a conversation), great service! Location is the only reason why i didn't give 5 stars.

20.description: i really liked this place.  the name is a little misleading because it's not just a cafe--it's a restaurant, bar, cafe, lounge, patio...all in one.  apparently they get guest djs to spin on some of the weekends...we were just impressed that they were able to offer all of this for having opened so recently.  it does seem like they're trying to find their niche--right now it's more of a pub/grille than a cafe, but they could really pull off either.  i can't complain, a bunch of us girls stumbled upon this place last weekend after a day of shopping and there was something for everyone.  coffee, food, beer, bears game, music.  it looks great inside--very chill.  we were there on a sunday night so it wasn't too crowded and the owners stopped by and chatted with us for a few mins.  the waitstaff was friendly and actually entertaining.  towards the back they have a fireplace, and they offer wifi.  the food is good, your standard comfort food with some nice upscale additions.  we liked the risotto, the steak sandwich with garlic mashed potatoes, and strangely--the chicken fingers and fries were excellent.  coffee could be stronger, but the waitress made sure we were ok with everything and would probably have made us another one if someone had requested it!  if you're looking for a coffee shop, they have a nice selection of tea and some specialty drinks.  there could be more, so hopefully they'll add to the list.  since this place is also a bar you could probably make all of your coffee irish--  bonus.i'd definitely come back, it was nice to get out of the city for a chill night and try out a new place/neighborhood.  it was only a 10-15 minute drive from the city, 5 mins from old orchard.  i'm wondering how this place will turn out, but as a girl who likes having options, this place fit the bill nicely.

19.description: ZERO STARS. Just because when we went in the place was full of smokers. When I asked about the no smoking ordinance the hostess was extremely rude. Somehow they think they are exempt. I spent all of 2 minutes inside the door and can still smell smoke on me.

1.description: My experiences are limited to drinks during the time usually designated as "happy hour" which is commonly, late afternoon, soon after 4 pm.  A friend of mine loved hitting this cafe / bar.  He'd befriended one of their bartenders and would grab a drink or two on payday Fridays.  He may have also liked the casual flirtation that comes with ordering drinks from an attractive bartender.  Whatever the case, the daily special allowed for a "decent" pour of top shelf vodka at an affordable price.  Two drinks were all that was necessary before pushing off to Devon ave for great curry.For a few seasons, this was that place for a few friends to catch up.  We were often invited to try their foods but with having our routine, we never got around to it.  Pure cafe is known as a "euro" hang.  A cafe often visited by peoples of Balkan territory, though mainly Serbians, Bosnians and Croatians.

2.description: Great traditional food  love the kebapi here perfect blend of beef and pork and their Palachinki are out of this world. This place is never too crowded which is weird because their food is phenomenal. It's a hidden guilty pleasure in the heart of lincolnwood at the edge of Chicago  :)  keep up the good work guys!! # Lebron James

9.description: My friend actually thought this was a cafe but it turned out to be a bar. We walked in and heard a bunch of shouting. It was Monday night football and the bears were playing the lions. The volume from the plasmas was really loud and the guys were getting angry when the lions started destroying the bears, but overall this was a great place to eat and just Hang out.

6.description: Pure Cafe is basically a tiny oasis in the middle of nothing.  Why this location was chosen I don't know, but it is close to where I live so I won't complain.The night we were there it was quiet, but our server was super nice and the Cosmo I ordered was super strong. I think I am pretty good at holding my liquor but I was buzzed by the time we left, and that was after eating! And speaking of food, the burger I got was pretty amazing.  Big and juicy with blue cheese and bacon on top. How can you go wrong?  I got a side of grilled vegetables and those were charred perfectly and completely delicious. Oh the menu is a tad strange, with a section of mexican food and other things that look like they don't belong.  Stick with the basics and get a burger.  You definitely wont go wrong there.I saw a couple of reviews where people were getting all caught up in the name (I guess if you say "cafe" you are supposed to have some sort of specific look??).  I don't know about that, but here is what you are going to get when you come in.  Its on the small side, has a sports bar look and feel to it.  Wooden chairs and tables, lots of TV's and neon signs for the Bears and various brands of beer. But back to the location.  It is in a strip mall, but slightly tucked off in the back, so you are apt to miss it if you are driving by fast.  If you are in the area, however, I highly recommend it as there is not much else to pick from aside from crappy fast food.  A big plus is parking, and then if you stuff yourself too much there is a gym next door.  Definitely a fan.  Will be back!

18.description: Great neighborhood spot to catch a game or meet with friend over a drink.

10.description: I give 5 stars to Pure Cafe.  The food and drinks are great . I dont care what anbody has to say about them. The burgers are awesome and I feel its chopped the right way. Furthermore, the location and parking is excellent near the mall on lincoln ave. Excellent TV  for you to invite friends and watch a game.The waitresses are courteous, friendly and pretty looking.I also enjoy the multi cultural ethnic balkan specialties from croatia and other parts of former yugoslavia like cevaps.

13.description: I hate to do this, but I have to.  This is a place that wants to be good, but hasn't nailed down what it really is.Eight o'clock on a Saturday...but no regular crowd shuffling in.  Just our party of 7 or so, looking for a decent dinner.  Get the menu...clearly some central European influence (the men's room indicates it's Croatian), but a lot of Italian and some Mex-Tex offerings.I got a traditional Martini, dirty; pretty decent, moderately high price, but OK.The table goes for appetizers--fried calamari, some hummus & sides, and chicken wings purportedly with habanero & sweet sauce.  Well, the calamari wasn't rubbery, but the breading was doughy & soggy; pass after the first taste.  The hummus was watery; pass.  And the chicken wing were covered with a kind of a grey goo.  Taste wasn't bad, but if there was habanero there, it was in homeopathic concentration.Not too hungry, nor too sanguine about the absolutely-nobody-else-in-the-place ambiance, so I figure I'll go with something simple--pasta with mushrooms.  Others went for burgers, with a flatbread and shrimp & rice.Somebody in the kitchen loved salt.  Seriously.  The pasta was way past al dente, and seriously sodium enriched.  The mushrooms--normal white button, pretty tasteless but sparked some debate if they were canned or just oversauteed fresh; the latter won, but by a hair.  Otherwise, it was overcooked pasta, butter, and mushy mushrooms.  Period.  (Hint, guys--cut the salt in the pasta water.  Don't cook it to mush.  Sautee the mushrooms with a little garlic, basil, oregano, and port or marsala.  I love butter, but that can't be the whole thing.)The shrimp & salt--er, rice.  Again, somebody really loved the salt cellar.  The flatbread wasn't half bad, really--although ordered without onions, so the person ordering wasn't happy the onions actually seriously helped it.  And everyone who ordered a burger said it was really good--a bit salty, but that worked with the meat.  (But are you getting a trend here?)The server and other staff we talked were friendly, and they did give some credit for the problems.  But I'd have to suggest this isn't the place to go if your primary purpose is food--the bar looks good, the band setting up around 9PM was promising.  Go for drinks and partying.  Suggestion to the kitchen--drop anything beyond pub grub until you've got the entree thing down, some better recipes, and someone sits on the salt monster.

16.description: I love this place! I've been here plenty of times w/ friends, coworkers, and family. You are guaranteed to find something on the menu that you will like as there are a variety of food items, drinks (both alcoholic & nonalcoholic), or coffee drinks. The prices are reasonable, kitchen is always open, and they have some tables outside, weather permitting.The only thing that puts this place at a disadvantage is the location! As mentioned in the other reviews, it is in a strip mall that isn't all that appealing. Other than that, the place rocks for a cafe/bar. The interior is nice, new and clean and the waitresses are always friendly if not super friendly! They have different events every now and then, such as game nights, live bands, DJs, etc.As for the smoking comment: that must have been a long time ago and has definitely been changed because there has never been any smoking inside all the times that I've been there. The smokers step outside w/ their cigarettes.

17.description: Saw the place while driving past and decided to have dinner with a friend. I think everyone will agree that the location is odd. It's in the same mall with a shady looking tanning salon, Hong Kong buffet, and a horseshoe casino pickup spot. However, the food was very solidly okay. No real fancy ingredients. The flavor was also very decent. I had the pesto turkey on ciabatta and it was too oily and not enough pesto but overall taste was ok. I got it with a side of garlic mashed potatoes which was heavy on butter and light on garlic. My friend had the burger with cheddar and grilled veggies. That was much better than mine! Great charcoal flavor on burger and veggies. Fresh lettuce and good bun. It's half price burgers on Monday nights.The food isn't spectacular but the service is so very friendly and since it's a nice atmosphere and there aren't any places near that like that, I might go again if the opportunity arises, I just wouldn't seek it out, except for maybe on Mondays.

15.description: Really odd location, across from the Home Depot. Excellent lunch all around. The bar seems comfy with great art on the walls; will have to check it out some night. Not into sports, which were showing on the TVs, so sat outside on the great little patio, even with the unfortunate views. Great service. The best tomato soup I've ever had, and a huge yummy salad. I hope this place makes it; it definitely seems like a diamond in the rough.

0.description: Great atmosphere,  even better food at really affordable prices.The atmosphere was good, the owner was friendly.  It was a great place to watch sports on Sunday.  The specials are really quite good.  50 cent wings, $7 burgers and fries, $5 flatbreads.  They have even more specials throughout the week on drinks and food.

5.description: Another review to add to my Strip Mall Adventures list. Pure Cafe is a hard place to find. My wife and I had to weed our way past the Mattress store, the Baby store and the closed Borders to find the place. The trek through strip mall hell was well worth it. Our experience at Pure Cafe was a lot of fun.  The decor is quite minimal. Other than a few flat screen TV's, there is nothing to speak of. No worries, I like a place that keeps it simple. Not only was our server stunningly beautiful, she did a wonderful job. Pure pours a generous drink. The splash of diet coke in my bourbon was just that, a splash. I was pretty woozy when I walked out the door.  The menu is quite odd. The bar is obviously aimed towards a Eastern European crowd, but there was an entire section of Mexican food on the menu. I opted for the safe route and ordered a burger and some wings. The wings were quite good. They didn't have as much heat as I normally like, but they were delicious. The Burger I ordered was fresh and tasty.  Here's the bottom line: Sometimes the good things in life are hard to find, but when you find them they're worth the wait. Pure Cafe is one of those things. We enjoyed great food, wonderful service and a fun atmosphere. If you are looking for a dining experience outside the norm, Pure cafe is worth a try.

11.description: My first experience here, I was there to just order food to go. There was no one there to greet me right away which was kind of awkward and I noticed other people waiting by the bar so I figured someone would. A few minutes later, a guy at the bar noticed I haven't been helped and took my order (although he didn't really seem like he was trained to take orders yet because he wasn't familiar with the men).  I probably waited 7 minutes for my order which was a little longer than I thought considering the fact that there was only 2-3 other customers. I ordered the Turkey Pesto and split it with a friend and it was really good. It wasn't "AMAZING"...but it was what I expected. Their fries though were AMAZING. I really enjoyed the seasoning on them and made me wish theaters served them in buckets. That's pretty hard core for french-fry-wishes.I gave this place another shot on a Sunday night. Again it wasn't very busy, my friend and I were the only ones dining give or take about 4-5 people at the bar. Sunday nights they have $5 burgers which were truly everything I wanted and more. Sunday night football on plasma TVs all around + $5 burger on cibatta-like bun + $3 drafts was exactly what I needed! The waitress was very friendly, a little bit too friendly for me personally, and at times, I had this feeling she forgot we were even there. NOT COOL. But it was hard to get mad at her because she really was very hospitable and warm.I've watched this place grow in the last few months and I have noticed them making a lot of progress. They have more and more people coming now for lunch and have bands come in on weekends which help fill up the place too. I'd keep a lookout on their specials...I've noticed they change them up daily. Like one day they had $8 steak sandwiches which were extraordinarily tempting. They're also making the place bigger and I am curious to find out what's in store for PURE.

8.description: I love this place! I never thought I would go here for a drink and a little something to eat, but here I was on a Saturday night with my homies. =)They have daily specials on drinks and food. Totally get both, because the food is actually tasty. I came when they had draft specials and flatbread specials so I got both. My friend did as well. I got the goat cheese flatbread and he got the chickena and pesto flatbread. My other friend got two steak tacos which came out nicely plated! Snaps for Pure Cafe! My food and drink was about $12 plus tip. It is not too crowded and there are plenty of places to sit by the bar or around it. The servers and bartenders were friendly. A little forgetful about minor things like ranch or ketchup but nothing to vent about in a review. What a pleasant surprise this was.

3.description: NEVER would I have thought this: TV Infused, Off The Beaten Path, Strip Mall, Bar/Restaurant would be SO DAMN GOOD!The food was beyond FRESH! Portions we're GREAT!Prices we're RAD!TONS of vegetarian options for me and a TON of other items for my non veggie pal.The server was FANTASTIC!Can't wait to go back again!:)

14.description: Surprisingly great food.  I have had quite a few things on their menu and never been disappointed.  The reason I say surprising is because the location would not draw you in the door.   Although parking lot is a plus and its easy to be close to the door.  It doesn't look like what it is.  Which is a good restaurant with good prices and great food.

4.description: Decent food. But expensive. The first time I went I was blown away by the food. But that was diminished by the horrible service. The bartender got both mine and my friends drinks wrong. But the second time the food was horrible and I decided that for the money (which they wouldn't comp a mistaken order for the second visit) I decided to never come back again.

3.description: I love  this place. Yes, guys you can get a great cut here. I have given up on my downtown salon, as Michele listens well and gives me a great cut at a better price. He is intuitive and creative. Everyone is nice and very customer focused. Great nail service as well. Olga is good to my feet.

1.description: I just moved back from LA and will be living right down the street from Artista. My sister, who lives a few blocks away, has a friend that recommended Michel, so today I tried it. First, he squeezed me in on a very busy day, and second, AMAZING!!!  This guy knows his stuff and is now my new Hair God. Not only was he very personable and professional, his sister was also very kind as well; it was very welcoming there. My color was matched perfectly and I can't wait for him to do a hair cut.

2.description: I just got my hair done by Michele today and he was amazing!!! I'm so happy I saw him. He was hilarious and did a fantastic job!!! Definitely see him!!!!!

5.description: Artista Salon is simply amazing ,  the decor is very modern , the staff is very friendly and my haircut is always a success , Michelle has an unique way of delivering what I envision , I absolutely trust him with my haircut !

6.description: I had a haircut here and was pretty unimpressed.  I arrived and sat for nearly 5 minutes before being greeted.  It was not crowded at all.  The salon seemed to be out of sorts.  Things were very messy.  My stylist spent about 10 minutes trying to find her comb through a mass of used towels.  The floor was filled with hair from previous clients, which grossed me out.The girl who shampooed me had very little personality.  I don't expect deep philosophical discussions but at least chat about the weather or something!  Finally sat down for my cut.  Every thing was going fairly well until the stylist's phone rang then she chatted with whomever for nearly all of the rest of the cut.  I was pretty floored by this and have in the past changed many stylists because of this issue.  There is NOTHING that could not have waited 10 minutes for her to finish up.  The cut was ok.  My hair wasn't butchered but I felt like my business was not being appreciated.  I'll be taking my dollar elsewhere from now on.

7.description: I love Michele. He is the best. I only trust him with my hair. Anytime i cut my hair short i go to him. Actually Any time i cut my hair i go to him. He is friendly and its fun getting hair cuts cause he actually talks to me. Its Always clean.. Weekends can get a bit hairy though, Saturdays and Sundays are really busy days for him they are always booked a week prior. I usually go in the weekday its less hectic and less busy.I once had a really bad dyeing experience with my hair my hair was blue and green on the back bottom part. He fixed it in a jiff and it looked like my normal brown hair.Michele is the best stylist. I Hate to say it but if hes not in on a day you want your hair cut i suggest you wait for him. He is very professional but also very fun and friendly. The price isnt bad at all its something around 20 or 30 for cut and style and shampoo and stuff and blow dry All in all it is my best experience at a hair salon

8.description: After leaving California, and a great stylist, two years ago I have struggled to find a stylist I can trust with my hair.  My search finally ended when I went to Artista.  I decided it was time for a cut and so I decided to make an appointment at Artista, a salon I had passed many times.  I was able to get an appointment the next day without any hassle.  When I came for my appointment, I was greeted with a friendly "family-like" atmosphere.  The salon is small in size, but big in heart.  Not only did I receive good customer service, but I also found a stylist who could cut my hair with little instruction and give me the perfect cut.  This salon is great and I would recommend it to anyone.  It is moderately priced, but worth every cent.  A haircut runs about $35 but is comparable to cuts up to $75-80.

0.description: Michel is simply amazing! He is the best in the city for color and cuts.  On a personal level, his personality so warm and welcoming.  He makes me laugh.I always leave feeling happy and beautiful.  Summer does my daughter's hair and always does a beautiful job as well. I am a customer for life! Love this salon and all of the wonderful people that work there.

4.description: Michel does a great job with cut and color. I have had smae color for over a year and get TONS of compliments! I trust him always.He's great. Quite busy salon and very hard to get in last minute. Make sure you have an appointment well in advance!

58.description: I had heard that Mee Mah had the best Mongolian Beef in Chicago - that's a bold statement.  Especially since I've had some pretty freaking good Mongolian Beef in the past.  I can attest to the fact it is the best I've had anywhere!  The quality of the beef is a large part of it, but the flavoring/seasoning was fantastic as well.  Very friendly staff, awesome egg rolls (and MASSIVE TOO).  Definitely a new fan of this long standing restaurant.

56.description: We were coming back from Chicago Botanic Gardens with our two good friends and their son when we decided to get Chinese food.  This place is their go to restaurant and so we decided since we were going back to their house, why not!  Am I glad that we did!  I ordered the duck and was instantly in heaven!  It was delicious.  It was the whole damn thing cut up nice and pretty for me.  The other dishes ordered were Mongolian beef, orange chicken and crab rangoon.  I didn't try anything else because I only wanted the duck.  It was so much food that I had it again the next day.  I can't wait to go back soon.  I need me some duck!

29.description: I've been eating from Mee Mah's for quite some time! I'll start with the positive... My typical order is Veggie fried rice, Sweet N Sour chicken and Veggie egg rolls in which are the best from Mee Mah's!!!! My boyfriend had the Mongolian Beef which he thought was delicious as well! Here's the kicker... we ALWAYS order their food for carry out.... Which I can reccomend highly!I decided to dine in one random day and to my surprise I had THE WORST experience EVER!!!! The waitress was so confused and a bit slow. But we managed to get through our order. A friend of mine ordered Orange Chicken and I ordered the Sweet N Sour chicken as usual. When she received the Orange Chicken it looks extremely unusual! So she tasted it and to her surprise it was terrible! This "Orange Chicken" was Sweet N Sour chicken cut into strips smothered in Sweet N Sour sauce with a bunch of orange peels and slices thrown all over the dish!!!! Clearly NOT orange chicken you'd get anywhere else! My friend who does not like Sweet N Sour chicken so naturally did not like the "Orange Chicken." We asked the waitress to take back the dish and replace it with Mongolian Beef. She called the manager over and here's where the fun begins!!!!! The manager asks what's the problem and we explain our issue with the dish in which she states...  "Orange chicken is exactly the same as sweet n sour chicken and you should know that, everyone knows that so we can take it back but you have to pay for it so I'll wrap it to go". We were not having that! We told her we were not paying for Sweet N Sour chicken disguised as Orange Chicken! The manager then tells us "so because you don't like it you do think you have to pay for it, you can't do this anywhere in the world". I was frustrated by this point so I told her were sending it back and not paying for it and that's that. She tells us "you're not my kind of customers so don't come back" walks away and asks the table right next to us and the table next to them "do you guys have any problems like these people" the tables respectfully said everything was fine. She proceeded to tell them "they're not my kind of customers can you believe them" right in our face!!!!! HOW RUDE!!!!!! I would never dine in again!!!!!!!

42.description: After much hype about the Mongolian beef, I had to try it. The beef pieces are large and charred with good smoky flavor. It does not have the sweetness or spicy heat nor the "glaze" like the mongolinan beef dishes  you expect at other northern chinese restaurants.  Still a very good dish and by far the best dish at this restaurant. The Kung Pao chicken was bland. The hot and sour soup was very good as well.

23.description: This is the worst Chinese place EVER!!! We ordered Orange chicken which had a gelatinous consistency with cherries!! (WTF) and no orange whatsoever. Batter was 2 inch thick and barely chicken. Fried rice was not good, how do you make a bad fried rice owning a Chinese restaurant? Tofu sucked, it was slimy and bad in flavor. The sesame chicken was really bad as well, the sauce didn't taste anything Sesame....it was just BAD. Flavorless and horrible. Maybe if you go to Mee Mah by accident, order a cookie, those are not that bad. NEVER COME HERE! It's expensive and horrible.

47.description: My wife found this place on accident.  Families of all sizes welcomed.  The staff we excellent.  I had the Mongolian beef and it was delicious.  Also, order the eggroll - it's huge and very tasty.  Definitely going back

8.description: This place was very good. Nice service and the owner took care of us good. Good stuff. Check it out.

31.description: I will start by saying i cant believe this place has even managed 3 1/2 stars! I only give it ONE because i have no other choice. it actually kind of frightens me that people give this four stars. Called in for delivery.  First , food took over an hour to arrive and it was pretty much all downhill from there. Crab rangoon was all won ton and cream cheese. egg rolls, meh, they were huge but meh. i ordered chicken almond din meal. Not too sure what the "Din" part meant but pretty much assumed it was almond chicken and rice? instead what i got was a tiny container of gross looking chicken, some almond slices all swimming in a rotten fishy garbage liquid/oil?  no idea what it was and gagged after one half bite that only consisted of a piece of water chestnut/some of that garbage fishy oil. yuck.  i actually was kept awake that night by the gross after-taste of that half-bite. Then to make matters worse i came here to good old yelp and seen some of the disturbing hair in food reviews and am grossed out even more. Thanks mee mah!

34.description: Stopped at Mee Mah, with my road crew, and was very pleased with the lunch specials.  Each special was reasonably priced, an came with a soup(which was excellent), an eggroll(home made full of meat ect.), and the main course, and tea with cookies.  For around $7 each, the meals were fresh, and service was friendly and quick.  I will definately return.  Some of my crew were so happy, they already have reurned with thier families.  I will return when I am working in the area.

16.description: I should have my head examined. After several years, I decided to give Mee Mah another chance. Truth be told, I was so in the mood for pressed duck, and years ago, I used to have it there on a regular basis. So, I broke down and put in an order for delivery.This time the delivery was prompt. Mom had the chicken lo mein which was ok. I, of course, had the pressed duck. It was so salty, as to be inedible. I ate one piece and pitched it out. NEVER AGAIN, this time for sure, pinky promise. I will NEVER order from Mee Mah again. Period, end of story.

13.description: This restaurant is close to my husbands work and I wish it was a whole lot closer to our house.  It is by far our favorite chinese food around - the egg rolls are delicious and HUGE! and we have never had an inferior dish here and we have sampled much of their menu.  The XL fried rice is enough to feed an army for a reasonable price.  If you like delicious chinese take-out then this is the place for you!

11.description: try the Mongolian beef!! Ordered for take out and it was ready in 15 minutes

39.description: I go there for the cold seasons and only for their sizzling rice soup. It is by far the best rice soup I tried in the city and definitely different. One of my friends always orders sweet and sour chicken and swears by it. The place is poorly lit and has the small dining feel, but I can't see it after the soup is in front of me:)

37.description: Its an OK place for Chinese, we tried the meal for 2 and i think it was 23 dollars. Food was alright i really liked the crab ragoon and the egg rolls are huge. Will go back if we are in the area again.

0.description: We moved to the area and was looking for a Chinese restaurant. We drove past a number of times and thought we would try it. Loved it and going back tonight to try something new. Quick pick up delivery and arrived home hot! Definitely a must!

38.description: have been wanting to try this place for  a long time now. so finally we gave it a try on monday afternoon. got there around 530, were sited right away since there was people on 2 tables only. no background music kinda threw me off a bit because i do not like people that are loud in restaurants. i go to restaurant to enjoy a meal, NOT to listen to some other older folks complaining about their miserable life. food is good it comes in good portions, it is cheap. maybe we picked the wrong day/time to go there but i think next time i will just order a carry out

51.description: I never knew this place existed until a classmate asked me join her on a chilly day. We went for a lunch and offered lunch specials which is always nice. I usually stick to my non healthy sweet and sour chicken because I then force myself to work out twice as much the next day. The dish was excellent, I also appreciate the ladies going by refilling my water and hot tea. Will go back without a doubt.

27.description: After several years, We last week decided to give Mee Mah another chance. After all having been in business for so long it must be good? We ordered take out for 6 surprise visitors including egg rolls, moo shu pork, vegetable fried rice, tomato pepper beef, chicken with mixed vegetables and a large won ton soup. The egg rolls while large were mushy and off tasting and came with no mustard or sweet sour sauce. There were no vegetables in the veggie fried rice. The beef had the consistency of rubber bands. The Moo Shu was bitter. The chicken dish was edible. The only decent item was the soup. Most of the food went directly to the trash can. I have to say Never Again! and that will be the Last Time! Trust me, You don't want to go there.

32.description: What.Continuing my adventure of trying to find worthwhile places to eat in North Center - I turned to Mee Mah. The closest eating establishment short of the vending machines in our cafeteria. I was feeling leery about going to somewhere with just 3.5 stars but it was so close ...Well, it was terrible. 3.5 stars is extremely generous. If this was the first time I'd eaten Chinese food, I would never eat it again.I got:egg drop soup: bland, but at least it was warm and had actual egg flavortea: flavorless hot liquidegg roll: it is, as several people have mentioned, very large, but lacking in flavor. The sweet & sour sauce was also bland.mongolian beef with steamed rice: I ordered fried rice, but at this point I'd already given up. The rice was over cooked. The beef ... tasted more like "processed beef substitute" than something that actual was part of a cow once. Completely bland. The waitress had asked if I wanted it spicy and my "no" was apparently taken to mean that I didn't want any flavor at all.A profoundly watered down "Chinese food" experience. I wanted to call in sick for the rest of the day so I could go to Lao Hunan/Schezwan/Beijing and restore my faith in the cuisine.

54.description: Carried out food from Mee Mah the other night.  Should have known better when one of the owners was hacking up a lung and hawking up loogies for about 15 minutes while we were waiting for our food - it was absolutely disgusting!!!!!!!!!!!  I seriously thought I was going to puke.  The food was awful.  I ended up throwing it away.

48.description: I have been eating at Mee Mah's since i was 12, i am 32 now.  During this time i have had the pleasure of the same waitress the entire time.  They have a back room which is great if you have kids and want them out of the main dining area.  I also took my wife on our first date here many years ago.  From the Poo Poo platter to the Shrimp in Lobster sauce i have never had a bad meal or bad service.  They have delicious egg rolls and the combination fried rice is good.  I am also a big fan of there sweet and sour chicken.  They dont over fry the chicken at all and give big chunks of pepper, pineapple, and tomatoes.  My wife really enjoys their chicken sub gum with the cantonese pan fried noodles.  The pricing is not expensive compared to other places with similar quality.

44.description: Always a great meal.  the mongolian beef is the best and empress shrimp is another good bet.  I also enjoy the hot and sour soup.

24.description: Their Mongolian beef and Mongolian chicken are the best I have had.I like that there is an option for smaller eggrolls.  Potstickers are good.  Sops are good.  Egg foo Yung and crab Rangoon are very tasty.A quiet place.  If you are free during the day, this is a very nice place to have a quiet lunch and they have special pricing then also.Limited parking.  Bathroom is ok.Very friendly staff who will substitute or do whatever they can to get you what you want.

7.description: mongolian beef, egg rolls, chicken fried rice are all SPOT ON fantastic.i've tried a couple of their chicken dishes and they were just meh which is the only reason i can't give them five stars.seriously though, get the mongolian beef. you MUST.

49.description: It was nice to be able to sit down and enjoy a Chinese take-out style meal in a cozy, old-school setting.  Our waitress was an absolute doll, and the service was super attentive, our water glasses were never empty.  The huge, fresh egg roll, Mongolian beef, and shrimp friend rice were exceptional; the other dishes were a little more hit-or-miss.  Fun evening out, definitely worth another go!

40.description: It's ok. Thats all i got.

53.description: I absolutely LOVE the Mongolian beef here (spicy please!) and egg rolls.  Their egg rolls are always fresh and crunchy and their Mongolian beef is VERY  tasty.  The vegetables are fresh and the meat is tender.The owners and waitstaff are wonderful as well.  I never ordered carry out  because they don't deIiver  to my area. :(  Seems like I may not be missing much after reading all  these negative reviews about their delivery.  I wouldn't want to be disappointed by this place I like so much.  I give it four stars only because I have not yet found any other dishes on the menu that match the Mongolian beef.

30.description: Solid Chinese food and great egg rolls!  Order the family style meals for larger groups...ton of food!

46.description: I sure wish I would have read the reviews here before ordering.  I've never ordered delivery from Mee Mah before, only dine in.  I now know why.  I placed my order via grub hub at 5:21pm with an estimated delivery time of 6:28pm.  At 6:50 I called Mee Mah to see where my food was.  The young man who answered the phone said my order would be there in 10 minutes.  I then said "my order was supposed to be here at 6:30 please tell me that my food hasn't been sitting in the delivery guys car for half an hour."  The young man responds with "oh no, he just left the kitchen NOW".  Seriously????  My mongolian beef BETTER knock my socks off or I'm going be one unhappy girl.

1.description: Tried this place for the first time (for takeout) a few days ago based on the recommendation from a friend.  The owner greeted us upon our arrival and asked us if it was our first time visiting.  When she found out that it was, she gave us a free container of soup...very nice touch...We're kind of on an odyssey trying to replace our old stand-by chinese place that closed last year...this could be our new place.We ordered the following:Crab Rangoon - perfectly fried, not oily with the perfect ration of cream cheese to crab - very delish...Egg Rolls - yeah, we went heavy on the fried stuff but it was a weekend...they were ok - a bit too much cabbage without any other filling - one or two shrimp and that was it.  We'll stick to the crab rangoon.Mongolian Beef - excellent taste on this dish - great sear on the beef and a nice spicy-sweet taste.  Portions were nice, good green peppers as well as green onion and there was a side of noodles for a topper which was a nice feature.  We ordered it "medium spicy" and it was right on target.Sesame Chicken - not our favorite as it simply was a bit sweet without much flavor.  It could have been that I didn't order it "medium spicy" or "spicy" but not that great.  Chicken Fried Rice - a big hit with our kids who can be finicky about their fried rice.Wonton Soup - just fine but nothing extraordinary.We will definitely be back for the Mongolian Beef, Rangoon and fried rice and will also try some of the other chicken or veggie dishes.

55.description: Local Chinese restaurant which has served the neighborhood for a couple decades now.  Tiny dining room with dated decor reminiscent of the 80's and a parking lot that suits four cars.  Service is lackluster just as the food is and the wait time for food whether you dine in or out is typically tedious.  I've tried to like them on many occasions typically joining locals for dinner.  I think it's neighboring folks that think their food is worth mention, I travel and have transportation and therefore do not share the sentiment. What it comes down to is the type of Chinese food you are wanting to eat, Cantonese & Mandarin styles are whats served here.  Their flavors and tastes have never worked for me, always being too bland and flavor less.  I consider Mee Mah a step better than the typical take outs found in any strip mall near you with the outrageously full colored picture menus and food served in Styrofoam.

9.description: When I think of what great Chinese food should be, I think: comforting, fresh, and delightful. Meals from Mee Mah are all of those things! This might sound like bs, but I believe when someone puts love into food, you can taste it. Mee Mah's food is full of pride, care, and love. It's true, Their Mongolian beef is the best. It's soft and tender, with nice heat, and even has a subtle char which I LOVE.Their eggrolls are enormous, more like 2 eggrolls. I couldn;t finish mine but I look forward to finishing it for lunch :)Another favorite dish of mine is the Mee Mah delight. It's shrimp, pork, and chicken in a light garlic sauce with veggies. Just perfect flavor without being too heavy. Bottom line, after my 2nd meal from Mee Mah my boyfriend and I are now loyal customers. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because their egg drop soup was pretty watery and bland. But every other aspect is so great, I don't care.

26.description: Reliably good food - fast, friendly service.

25.description: I have been going to Mee Mah for years and up until the last few times every thing has been good.  The last couple of times we have ordered we have found the food to be bland.  We had taken some time off from there but decided to order tonight.  I ordered the beef and broccoli and my husband ordered Seasame Chicken what we got was Beef and Broccoli and Cashew Chicken and on top of that both were very bland. And for the price you pay the amount of food was small.  The egg rolls and pot stickers were good but we will not be going back anytime soon.

12.description: I ordered several items for pick up.  When I got back home with the food, I found that my white, round container of Shrimp and Broccoli was only 1/2 full.  That was supposed to be the Large order.  I wonder if the Small order would have even completely covered the bottom of the container.  I also ordered the Sweet and Sour Chicken for my wife.  The chicken breading was tough and the chicken was dried out.  It's as if it had been sitting under a heat lamp all day.  On the bright side, the Shrimp and Broccoli tasted good.  I wish I could say I had a better experience.

59.description: Mee Mah is one of my favorite places to eat north of Argyle Street. Good food & relaxed atmosphere.They do have lunch specials, but I still tend to order off of the menu.  The dish that I like the best is Szechuan Eggplant with Shrimp.  (If you are a vegan, I know they'll prepare it without...but the shrimp sets it off.) Another dish that works well is the Orange Beef.It isn't very Chinese, but I also like the pineapple sherbet when I finish the meal...especially in the spring and summer.I'll agree with reviewer Pete K. when he says that after spending time in Asia, the food isn't 100% the same.  The staff here is nice and the only time I run into a delay is during the lunchtime rush.There are two dining rooms.  During the nighttime, it seems that 17th District plain clothes officers likes to hang onto the back room for planning their strategies needed to make Sauganash safe. Their off-street parking is tight, so be aware.

21.description: Went for lunch last week.  Lunch menu very cheap. Ordered vegetable delight.  Bland, bland, bland.  Vegetables drenched, smothered with thick sauce that was tasteless. Looked unappetizing and could hardly eat it. I had to pick out the vegetables drowning in the sauce.  Partner ordered cashew chicken, had the exact same sauce on it, smothered and drenched also.  It was really tasteless.Egg roll was good though and vegetable soup just o.k.Basically food was icky.  Couldn't understand waitress.  Had to repeat order over and over, and couldn't understand a word she said either. I kept asking her to repeat what she said over and over again.Won't be going back again. Have no desire to give another chance, or try anything else on the menu. It is very clean inside though.

17.description: Love this place! Egg rolls are Aaamazing (yes, aaamazing)! I usually order their orange peel chicken, but have tried other items on the menu which were very good. We usually drink more than one pot of tea with our meal, it's delicious! The decor is vintage and very well kept up for its age, which shows the care they surely put into their food.

10.description: Mee mah's serves really delicious food. It's no wonder everyone raves about their eggrolls (which are divine)! I quite enjoy the ambiance, it reminds me of a time capsule of sorts. The service is always friendly and fast. Their hot and sour soup leaves something to be desired, but the broth is good enough to make it acceptable. Love the tea!

5.description: This place is sadly pretty bad. Especially disappointing because it's probably the closest restaurant to my new house, but we are learning that we now live in delivery no-man's-land. I guess I had high expectations because my favorite chinese restaurant by my old place (as I mentioned before, we recently moved from Lincoln Square to Sauganash) was awesome. Pretty much everything we ate from here was bad. I ordered some basic chicken chop suey, which I figured was a safe starting point, but it had an off taste and I was almost nervous to eat it. My husband had the organge chicken, which was oddly fried and then sliced with a weird sauce. The egg rolls and fried apps that we tried were also not even worth the calories. Sorry Mee Mah, we won't be ordering here ever again. I would hope we just ordered the wrong things but we went pretty basic so I won't risk trying others. The place looks really cool and old-school Chinese restaurant loungey, so maybe it's a better experience if you eat there

3.description: I'm not generally a big fan of Chinese food, but this place has a lot of dishes I won't normally order from anywhere else. We've been going here for a long time. The owners are always so friendly. My one complaint is that the smoothies are a little on the watery side. Flavor is good but they melt down really quick. My favorite thing from there is the Crab Rangoon. They add onion which most places dont. They aren't as sweet as most places either. Delicious.

35.description: I should have my head examined. After several years, I decided to give Mee Mah another chance. Truth be told, I was so in the mood for pressed duck, and years ago, I used to have it there on a regular basis. So, I broke down and put in an order for delivery.This time the delivery was prompt. Mom had the chicken lo mein which was ok. I, of course, had the pressed duck. It was so salty, as to be inedible. I ate one piece and pitched it out. NEVER AGAIN, this time for sure, pinky promise. I will NEVER order from Mee Mah again. Period, end of story.

19.description: We love this place. The food is solid, the drinks are very good, but the service and people keep us coming back.  It is decorated like a place you'd find in NYC circa 1975. It's a cult favorite. Try the Mai Tai and the Mu shu pork. And blast the Streisand.

28.description: This should be order, Sizzling rice soup and mongolian beef! Done. Amazing! friendly staff! I can't say i've had better mongolian beef anywhere else.

45.description: Mee Mah! I love the name, it just rolls off your tongue! Their food always comes fast and fresh! The crab ragoons are homemade and well worth the fried food guilt:) The Mongolian beef is by far the BEST I've ever had, I'm disappointed when I order it any place else, because it doesn't taste like Mee Mah's.

33.description: We met our friend close to this location and randomly choose this place. We had a wonderful dinner. The staff were very nice even though we were still eating well past the closing time. The egg rolls were awesome , so was Kung pao chicken and fried rice. I would definitely go back.

43.description: Dinner special for two is awesome .... It can feed four people their mongolian beef is superb I recommend it....and the ambiance of the place is very welcoming ...

2.description: I'm not one to write a review about anything....But for this place I HAVE TO!!First off we ordered for delivery we are literally 10 minutes away from the restaurant. I placed the order at 5:47 PM and the delivery didn't arrive till 7:15 PM. I called twice to ask what the status of the order was and both times I was told it would be in the next 15 minutes.The quality of the food is nothing impressive. Very bland, very plain, missing salt and seasonings. The best part had to be the fortune cookie that it came with.Won Ton soup tasted like water, Chow Mein was so watery the noodles were basically swimming in it. Mongolian beef was over cooked.Crab Rangoon barely was filled.I got full although I was not happy after my meal.Someone call Chef Ramsay and have him visit this restaurant cause its a bloody disgrace what they serve.

18.description: My usual lunch place. Good ambience and friendly staff. Nice food.. Few options but good for a quick lunch.. Usually quick service.. Lunches never took more than 20 mins for me

41.description: I really think it should be three and a half stars, it was pretty good, the waitress was nice, the atmosphere was ok, there was NO music of any kind, which i do kind like some backround tunes while i am eating.I got the ginger beef which had a lot of that pickled ginger in it, not fresh grated ginger like i was hoping.  It was not bad, but dad liked his ok.I will update this review, i think this pace deserves another shot.

52.description: Haven't eaten here for ages, for good reason.  The first and last time I ordered carry out from here, I couldn't believe what a soupy mess I got!  Look, I know my Chinese food.  I've had some of the best all over the world. I've also had some of the worst--and it may have been from this place.    My Chinese friends tell me that Americans like their Chinese food this way. If that's the case, how sad.

50.description: I've lived near this place for years and never went in. I always thought it was a cute building, but never stopped by. Maybe it looked closed or something. One night, we changed that. We were looking for a place that was open for dinner after 8 pm in the Saugnash area. After reading fabulous reviews here about the Mongolian Beef I had to try it and boy I was not let down one bit. First off, when we walked in it was a half hour until closing time. Some places get annoyed when they have last minute customers right before closing time. The staff at Mee Mah were completely over-joyed to see us. The decor is like a pink floral explosion and could really use some updating. However, decor doesn't effect my opinion of a restaurant. I'm really way more interested in the food to be honest. As long as the place looks clean, which Mee Mah did, I'm happy. As soon as we were seated, we were brought hot tea (on the house). We did the dinner for two, which was a little over $20. You get crab rangoon, eggrolls and pork pieces to start. It also comes with wonton soup. The wontons tasted homemade and the broth was tasty without being too salty. We opted for Mongolian Beef & Pork Egg Foo Young. The Mongolian Beef was easily the best version of this dish I've had. The meat was charred nicely and not mushy and tasteless like most places. It had a good level of kick and there was no MSG-filled sauce. The pork egg foo young was good, but this type of dish is very old fashioned. The real winner was the beef for sure! The meal was followed up almond cookies and forture cookies. Service was great too. Our server was so happy we were first timers and told us a little about the restaurant and it's history. I will definitely be back for more Mongolian Beef.

4.description: Cheap good lunch Chinese food I loved the huge fresh egg rolls and the fried rice was a little smokey but really Tasty. Everything came out quickly, hot, and done perfectly. Super friendly people too... Go here now!

6.description: I ordered via grub hub and at 1 hour and 45 minutes they told me another 20 minutes. The crazy person on the phone even argued and lied to me about the time I placed the order. I cancelled the order and I will never order from this place again. Instead of being apologetic she told me that they were too busy, like that's MY problem.

22.description: I'm very surprised about some of the negative reviews.  I just hopped on to get the number for pick up.   It is our favorite Chinese food!  We live far out of the delivery range, but we had a massive craving.  My husband is making the 25 minute drive - in a BLIZZARD - that's how good it is!

15.description: I go here often for lunch and I must say they always gratefully cater to my garlicky spicy special requests!  Great, friendly staff as well!

57.description: This place has some odd pink lighting. At first you feel like you're in a pack of bazooka joe, but I guess your cones get saturated eventually and everything looks normal again. However, I'm glad because it seems I've finally found a decent Chinese place north of Argyle, and I live north of Argyle so that works out perfectly. This place isn't perfect, but it's solid. Food: Egg drop soup was slightly better than average - you can add some soy sauce for a richer, more flavorful bowl. The egg rolls were very good, greasy as hell, but good. The entrees were mixed: one was amazing and one was was pretty bad. These reviews are spot on when they rave about the Mongolian beef. It's in the top 2 I've ever had. I don't know what the Mongols do to their beef... but it was a great dish. (obviously, I doubt that any Mongols know what Mongolian beef even is, unless they've been to a Chinese restaurant in the US.) The Kung Pao chicken was a travesty. It seemed like they forgot to sear the chicken, so you got these amorphous blobs on your plate. Moreover, everything had that intense chickeny smell and taste; again SEAR THE CHICKEN BEFORE STIR FRYING. One thing I have to say is that I"m very impressed with the condiments. They obviously make their duck sauce, mustard, and chili sauce from scratch and it shows. They're all delicious. Compliments for that alone...Service: The ladies are very nice. Kept my water glass full and were very friendly. Doesn't get any better than that. All in all, I'll be back. Just stay away from the Kung Pao.

20.description: Why i am not able to leave zero stars?  This place serves kibble and bits.  If u want to burp up msg all afternoon by all means swing on by.  Its vile.  3.5 stars?  Lol.  Its zero stars.

36.description: I LOVE this place.  It is really great for simple, non-heavy Chinese food.  You leave this place feeling good and satisfied and not heavy and guilty.  The dishes are not overly sauced or too oily as many Chinese restaurants tend to do.  They serve drinks and have a super friendly wait staff.  I would highly recommend this place for someone looking for HIGH quality Chinese.  It is definitely not your average take away restaurant.

14.description: I'm not a fan of Chinese food, but this place isn't to shabby. Picking up lunch to celebrate a coworkers birthday today! Yummy for my tummy. #chinesefood

3.description: Update: I've been back since and have had much better experiences. Maybe it was just an off couple of days.

1.description: It isn't Starbucks nor is it relatable to any decent cafe.  It's merely a coffee stall located within Northeastern University.  They serve coffees, teas and some light breakfast items, ie pastries.So long as I order a cup of Joe with low expectations, my needs are always met.  Deviations from this ordering method end up in long frown sessions.They are most likely worth three stars, however, I cannot allow myself to do it.

2.description: I keep thinking hard at what school I went to that had a fantastic coffee shop. I cant find one. I am not a coffee expert. I find coffee to be a necessity. You are sleepy, you have coffee. You are bored, you get coffee. You are Easten European, you wear a puma track suit and you get coffee. Thats what i know about it. Issue is that i cant think of anything awful to say. I have set my expectations low and thats it. Its not a "you get what  you pay for" kind of a deal. You pay alot for very little but its a school coffee shop and we are students. Odds are against us anyway. They tent to rip you off in every way possible. Stars go for convinience, good vanilla chai latte and sexy looking bagels (that i sadly never touch) and very hot tattooed barista with green eyes....that is all folks.

9.description: Good place for a quick cup of coffee while on campus.  Although the lines can sometimes be very long and the wait time lengthy.

10.description: The drinks are expensive, taste bad, and they dont have lemons for teas! What kind of coffee shop is this? And they run out of certain sizes of cups. They charge you for the size they have and give it to you without telling you.

4.description: This Cafe Descartes is hidden within Northeastern University's Student Union.  I came here for one reason, and one reason only: Oatmeal Latte.  I was excited to know that there was this Cafe Descartes close to my home ever since the Lincoln Square location closed.  I loved the oats with blueberries, walnuts, almonds, golden raisins, and spices blended with a fresh latte.  It is breakfast and coffee in perfect unison.  Who wouldn't love one?!  Well, these college students I guess.  Unfortunately, they don't offer the Oatmeal Latte.  This location is more of a "mall-type" Cafe Descartes.  No craving satisfaction here.

6.description: The summer term is a tricky one for Descartes. On one hand you get intermittent business at best. On the other hand, you usually only have one employee to handle the brief between-class rushes.I visit this cafe almost every day I'm at NEIU and the service has always been exemplary. The employee(s) are fast, efficient, and friendly. The prices are reasonable and except for the brief period of time when they ran out of plastic knives, nothing has been lacking.I feel lucky to have such a nice little cafe so close to my classes. Bagels, and snacks/lunch options are a nice change from the grease festival that is the cafeteria selection during summer. The vending machine coffee alternative is also a poor one.

12.description: Nice enough people work here, but nice doesn't cure incompetent.  I go here at least once a week and nary a time goes by when they don't mess something up.  Seriously!  Usually I just get hot tea and the last two times they got my order wrong.  It's overpriced too, but they have the monopoly at NEIU.  The two stars is generous.

5.description: Yeah, no. The quality and good service didn't last. I've had to throw out all of the drinks  I bought this week. Just when I started to regain faith in this failed cafe.

13.description: The coffee tastes like cardboard so why three stars? It's convenient, it's fairly cheap, and did I mention it's convenient? Although the coffee could use a serious upgrade, the soy chai lattes and the cookies taste pretty great.

11.description: Coffee is ok but they have some of the most disgusting sandwiches I ever had

8.description: Why is this coffee so expensive?

0.description: Okay coffee to have when no time to leave campus. For the price that you are paying I would expect more quality in the product.

7.description: This location is inside of NEIU where I go to school. The first day I went, it was 7:30 PM and the guy at the cashiers said he only had teas and coffee but flavored he couldn't sell cause they were cleaning up. Okay, so I passed. A few days later I said, okay I have a break from class, let me get something. So of course I asked if the cookies and muffins were still fresh since it was already 8:15 PM, the guy said yes they were and that the coffee was all they could sell right now no specialties at this time (haven't I heard this before)? So I bought the muffin and coffee but when I got to class, the coffee tasted like hard core grounds that have been sitting for at least 20 days! The muffin (and I swear I am not exaggerating), made a thump when I BANGED it on the wall, and the other students laughed so hard due to the muffin was supposed to be "fresh". I couldn't go back cause I was in class but next time, I am coming for you cashier! I don't recommend them since I like to have variety and freshness, go to the school book store to get your snacks. These are WAY over priced for what they are. Ehhh ME REALLY THINKS NOT! Bagels and muffins that can put a nail on a wall is not my idea of good.
