39.description: I didn't know that this place even HAD a buffet. Needless to say, I haven't tried it.Since I last yelped, I've given-up meat, and I've found solace in Hunan Wok's fried eggplant. Dear THOR, it's delicious. A classmate brought a group of people to try it out and I'm very happy that he did.Regardless of whether or not you eat meat, you should seriously try the d*** eggplant. I was in heaven. You can order your egg rolls without egg, too, if you're vegan. If you prefer meat, I haven't eaten any but I've smelled it (and it smells YUMMY).The interior is a bit rundown, but the food is good enough that I don't care. Though, I've never seen it busy, so if you want to try it out, I'd bring some friends. Unless you like awkward meals. ^.~

37.description: I just got back from this restaurant. Holy, they have 20 + youth inside when I walked in around 2pm. I noticed it is close to North park univ.It is pretty dark inside. You can order the individual food patch just like others.The buffet is only $5.99 + Tax. As for the food, I remembered they have 8 dishes for the buffet, 4 dishes for the fruits, 2 soups and that is all.  The Tao's chicken is tasty, pretty sweet. they have bean curds but I did not see any egg plant or other vege. For sure, not shrimp.The service and atmosphere is friendly. The owner's daughter handed me a cup of ice water right after I sat down.I was told they gonna set the same menu Mon. to Fri. I recommend they at least change the menu once a week for buffet since they only have eight dishes and after 1:30, there is literally not much left.

0.description: I used to go to NEUI in the nineties and I still remember coming here and eating lunch or dinner. The food was quite good and the people were nice.

38.description: This place has very friendly service, and the food here is pretty good I'd give the food here 3/5. I like some of the dishes here but I mainly judge it on the fried rice, I don't really like it; one to many spices. I like this place because the price is RIGHT and the nice people that work here. Also the buffet here is cheap too. If i was on a budget I would go here because of the price. Best of a bad situation as I would put it.

27.description: I've been by this place a thousand times, but never walked through the door.  I may have ordered delivery from them back in 1994.....Anyway, I finally walked in and saw an almost perfectly preserved 1970s style Chinese restaurant...just like the ones you see in the Bruce Lee movies. AWESOME.The food was tasty, but you can tell the recipes have been Americanized. My dishes were delicious, but not full, bold flavors like you would get in Chinatown. Maybe they cater to the college crowd & play it safe to maximize customer base?Whatever the reason, its good food for a decent price. The young woman taking my order was pretty cute too, but I'll be back only because of the food....I swear.

32.description: Good prices and really good food.. I like to go there whenever I'm in the area.

48.description: The food is average, nothing to make it stand out.  But as others say, it is predictable and affordable.  In my case, very close and convenient.The bright side to this establishment is the customer service.  They are very nice and customer service-oriented.  Heck, they already know my order once the see or hear me on the phone!

44.description: i wouldnt eat here because it looks so sketchy but i always order out. I gotta admit the decor is very stale and it doesnt really look like a chinese restaurant but the food is surprisingly good and consistent, plus the lady who owns the place is really nice. Lunch specials are under 5bucks so its great for us college students

24.description: Bad. Bad. Bad. I'm sorry, but this was just barely edible. Not even okay.Their rice was orange and awful. My husband claims it was the worst food he's ever eaten.

7.description: I go here a couple of fridays a month for lunch. It's really convenient being close to NEIU! I tried their General Tso's Chicken and it is so good! I even tried it in shrimp and it was delightful! The lunch specials are generous enough without overdoing it! The service and prices are great too!

49.description: I lived in this neighborhood for years, and Hunan Wok is a great standby.  Stereotypical Chinese food but more important it's predictable.  Wait time for your pick up is always 10-15 minutes.  The owners speak limited English but are super-sweet & very hospitableThey do have a lunch buffet  when NorthEastern is in session, which is cheap & all you can eat, but might not always be the best example of their food.  Gee, is it b/c of the nature of buffets? This is a mom & pop store that is not rolling in the dough exactly.  If you are in there and the buffet items look, well, stale - tell them!  They are nice people & will make you fresh stuff!  They're NOT going to keep cooking food only to discard it just to it looks full for the 3 people in there at that time.My only complaint is that  the girl's (11-13 yr old?) daughter sometimes takes your order & consequently sometimes things are forgotten.  Just check your order before you bounce & things will be groovy.My faves: pork fried rice, garlic pork or chicken, general tso's chicken, fried wontons & teriaki beef.Support Mom& Pop businesses!!

40.description: Nice lady.  Pity about the food.The buffet experience here is not that great.  Not recommended.

30.description: Great food and great service. It is easy to drive right passed this place and totally miss it. However, once i went in i was HOOKED! The Mongolian Chicken (Cantonese Style) is AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS! The dish is even beautiful to look at. I highly recommend the Mongolian Chicken (Cantonese Style) you will NOT be disappointed!

46.description: I'd have to disagree with a lot of the reviews here. This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood. I don't recommend eating there -- carryout is the best. I've ordered so many times from here that they've stopped asking for my name and phone number because they know my voice!! Sometimes I wonder where all their business comes from because no one dines in. My fiance and I joke that they have an undercover Mob business there!I would recommend the General Tso's dinner special (comes with fried rice and egg roll). Also good on the menu is their hot and sour soup -- best hot and sour soup I've had anywhere! Their sweet and sour chicken or pork is not bad either. My fiance likes their chop suey and Mongolian beef. This place is really affordable and has good Chinese food!

1.description: This is a generic chinese restaurant.  I am giving them 4 stars because of the price/quality compared to other chinese restaurants in the area.  $16 for fried rice, eggroll, general tso's chicken and a large lo mein is a great deal.  That is enough to feed 3 people.  Yes, the flavor is Americanized as others have mentioned, and more salty then what I am use to, but with multiple high schools and colleges near it, they need to adapt.  Prep time for the food does take longer then usual.  Depending on the time of of the day, they might have turned off some kitchen equipment and needed to turn it back on.  Took 45 min for my order, so you need to plan ahead.  I will not take off stars for that because they are upfront with you about it in the beginning.  Other restaurants will say 10 min, and will force you to wait another 30 min after you get there.If you want authentic chinese, go to Chinatown.  If you want to go to Panda Express down the street, don't.  Place an order here, support a local business, pay less then Panda Express, and get better food.

9.description: Have been going to this place for easily 15 years. Hope it doesn't get absorbed by NEIU. Get the Sesame Chicken combo, so good!

26.description: The food was at best mediocre. It was dry and had an air of antiquity about it. Much of their food had clearly been sitting for some time drying and cooling despite the presence of heating lamps. The service was appalling to say the least and one of the employees was eating in front of customers in the back of the eating area. At best this establishment has no respect for customers and their appearance for customers who might come to dine in the future.      I would not recommend eating at this restaurant to anyone who has a love for Chinese cuisine. This embarrassing display of food is hardly worth of the tile Chinese food. With unprofessional service, severely mediocre food this restaurant is hardly worthy of even one star!!

25.description: Waited for 45 after I put my order in for moo shoo pork that was over-priced and extremely dry and undersauced. This place was so much better 12 years ago when I I first started out at Northeastern Illinois University. So glad it wasn't me paying for that meal bc I don't think I would have wanted to. Not coming back.

12.description: I have a big problem with my cravings for Hunan Wok:-)  Absolutely the best Chinese takeout in the city (in my opinion).  The garlic chicken is my jam!  General Tso chicken is also amazing.  I live in Humboldt Park and drive all the way to Bryn Mawr for this stuff - definitely worth it!

21.description: I've eaten here since 1996.  In that time, the food has changed.  I recently had the shrimp & chicken with eggplant (it was bland).  The shrimp chop suey also lacked flavor.  The hot & sour soup was FULL OF WHITE PEPPER AND SWEET.  It was not spiced with the hot oil, etc., as it normally should be.  The lady at the counter is very nice, but the food has seriously fallen off.  This would not be anywhere near my first choice for Asian/Oriental dinner or take out.

17.description: Really good food, but some odd and annoying policies RE paying with credit cards and sharing or splitting dishes. Otherwise amazing.

10.description: I try not too eat too bad, but at the same time i always wonder what places has the best type of whatever food.  In this case, I can honestly say this place has THE best General Tso's Chicken AND Crab Rangoon.I don't make a big deal about the rangoons because I dont eat them much outside of Chinese Buffets.  But eat these fresh. awesome.But their General Tso's Chicken??? All i can say is i dont order them anywhere else any more.  They just dont measure up. I eat at Chinese places quite a bit and i can say i love this stuff.  The chicken is never dry.  The sauce they put on it has a nice kick to it, and its not too spicy or salty. Better than the Orange Chicken at Panda Express.Anyway this will probably be the only review i ever write.  I usually like everything so i dont think my opinion helps.  But damn when i want to treat myself i definitely go here.Oh, and the people who work there make an effort to remember you and are super friendly.  They make time to talk to you and make you feel very welcome.Why not 5 stars? Because i only order one thing from their menu.  So not their fault.Go Bulls

5.description: The best Chinese food my family and I have ever had. The crab rangoons are a must have. They must be experienced at least once in your life. I have never found a Chinese restaurant as good as this in my new residence state of AZ, so this is definitely a must have on every visit back to Chicago. The place is not the most updated place. But it has a great family-feel to it. The owner still remembers me and my family and always asks about their well-being. Great place and and amazing food.

3.description: I used to get delivery from here very, very often. Always consistent, always good. I usually get the Garlic Broccoli and veggie egg rolls. I'm writing this review now to wish the family who owns it the best of luck, as Northeastern University will be forcing them to sell the property where they have been for more than 60 years, using Illinois eminent domain laws. To the owners- I hope you can relocate close by.

35.description: Your basic run of the mill chinese take out joint would warrant three stars in my book.  And I feel as though Hunan Wok is deserving of those three stars.  There is nothing out of the ordinary that they offer.  But on the same token there is nothing that is notably horrible that they serve up.  The only two points I have to acknowledge...-the chicken dishes utilize boneless white meat chunks.  While many may be a fan, I favor more of the dark meat persuasion.  I found the bites dry and unappealing. -Crispy white noodles in Mongolian Beef.  Argue about the authenticity or not..but, in my book mongolian beef isnt quite mongolian beef without the accompaniment of such.  And theirs is lacking the appearance of them.I truly do hate to give a bad review..as I am a stickler of giving the positives the limelight.  But the one thing that is unforgivable is delivery.  I literally live about a 15 minute walk at a lazy pace or a 5 minute drive.  Its a straight shot down Bryn Mawr.  But it took over an hour for the delivery order.  Its not like I ordered for a party of 10+.  It was a dinner for three.  And Ive sat on writing this one up..but I just couldnt get my head around it.  So I regret to inform you that Hunan Wok, you are the victim of my first bad review.

19.description: I'm generally pretty snobby and impossible to please as far as dining, but this place tripped up my perpetual negativity. It is literally the best value of any restaurant on the north side. Good tasting dishes, very large portions, and their prices are what everyone else's was in 1998.I haven't had every dish, but the potstickers are definitiely some of the best in the area. I look for spicy things usually, sesame noodles and szechuan chicken are both solid.The primary factor that makes this place worthy of a review is that there isn't a molecule of pretention involved (until I walk in to pick up the food, but it's gone once I leave).

28.description: AMAZING!! I drive by this place all the time and I finally decided to check it out. The dinner combination platter is enough for me to eat for a few days so that is a bonus! I am officially hooked on this place!

45.description: I've been going to Hunan Wok for about 10 years off and on. The food has always been consistently good, for a great price. They have lunch specials under 6 dollars which includes the classics: Mongolian Beef, Kung Pao Chicken, General Tso, etc I think they have some of the best Pork Fried Rice around. It's not a place to dine in, but if you don't care about the 70s paneling, then why not visit and hang out in one of the empty booths.

33.description: I came here a handful of times during my college education at Northeastern Illinois University, which is of short walking distance. A fellow classmate turned me onto this place, as we grabbed lunch a couple of times. Surprisingly, most of the time, it was rather quiet. In any case, the food was a-ok. I usually just went for their buffet deal. Typical Chinese food, nothing stood out all that much. The decor basically dark and simple, while you can tell easily that it was family ran (kids running around the far corner of the restaurant with their desktop computer and table for their use). Now that I've graduated a couple of years ago, I'm not in the area all that much, but if I ever do happen to be in the neighborhood, I'd go here just for something quick and simple.

43.description: When we need a quick Chinese fix or a cheap one, or better yet, cheap and quick, we order from Hunan Wok. Over  many years we have had food delivered, we have settled on a few staple items. I get the hot and sour soup and garlic chicken and Christoper gets the won ton soup and pork fried rice. Cheap, simple and fairly yum and not having to take off my fuzzy slippers to go out and fetch up dinner.... priceless!!!

2.description: A very quite restaurant which is great for a college student studying. Service was surprisingly fast. I had the wonton soup, which was fantastic, and the general tsao with fried rice. The chicken was superb, the skin had a slight crunch but the meat was moist and juicy. This was all part of the lunch special which with tax only cost $6.30!! The proportion was a perfect amount for lunch and helped me get through the rest of the school day. I'll be coming back again and again! Great food, cheap prices, friendly workers, all in a wonderful atmosphere... what's not to love?!?

18.description: Tasty little cost effective Chinese place in NW Chi-raq. Easy little $6 lunch or something special. Quick and filling.

41.description: I think I got take out from here years ago.  I don't remember it being bad or really good.  But I had a lunch meeting here today and had the buffet.  In a word: swell.  The buffet was stocked with soup, egg rolls, fried rice, lo mein (or some kind of noodle), crab rangoon, and a variety of chicken based entrees.  I sampled a variety of almost everything.  None of the entrees were disappointing, and the General Tsao chicken was pretty darn tasty.   Hot and sour soup was okay, as was fried rice.  But surprisingly I thought the eggroll was sublime!  Crispy on the outside, the perfect amount of chewiness on the inside, and stuffed generously with tasty BBQ pork and vegetables.I'm a fan.  If the buffet is this good, then I can imagine that freshly prepared dishes are even better.  Looking forward to going back sometime (or ordering out from them, atmosphere left a little to be desired).

50.description: What?  OMG this place is awesome!  It's a family owned/run place, and the lady is always so nice.  The buffet is only around during the school year, but it's all you can eat for like $5 or something, and it's SO close.  I'm so in love with their garlic chicken, and their pork fried won tons, and the pork fried rice.  Ok, so their eggrolls will probably kill you, but eggrolls are actually all the leftover bits anyway, so I really think health nuts should just stick to spring rolls, and I'll have mine deep fried and heart stopping, anytime, thanks.You can keep the price down, unless your eyes are way bigger than your stomach!

4.description: Hands Down .... Best Chinese Food ever. I've never had a meal from here that was bad. The owner is super sweet! I honestly have to say as a New Yorker this is the best place outside of NYC and in Chicago!!!!A must try !!!!

6.description: To get a good glimpse of the business you need to filter through reviews and see those by their fans.  Many have the correct story and that was, that years ago it was pretty damn good but as time went on (like some businesses) they began to lack in quality.  For years, people came for their General Tso's chicken, I can't imagine anything else of any worth.You can see my previous reviews, but at one time they had one of the best General Tso's entrees on the NW side of Chicago.  As I stated, over the years it just got worse and worse.  Now sometime in the past year there was a new owner.  A person or group that started out as fans of their food and hoped to reignite that passion they once loved to taste.  Unfortunately the business didn't take off quite as imagined and previous ownership took it back.  There is probably one reviewer that is ecstatic about the old ownership coming back.  I'm not and that was the look I gave to the owner when she was happily telling me about it.  Way back when, during a random visit or two, I got to meet one of those new owners and let me tell you the food was fantastic and there were new offerings in what they were doing.  You could tell from the quality of the food, presentation and new changes via their new menus that there was a new excitement in the kitchen.  When those new owners left, with them the old owners sent out the new menus.  WHAT A FAIL!!  The new owners had a nicer way to preparation, their take out containers were nicer, the presentation looked tastier, everything was better!But now they're gone and I miss them.  The last time I ordered a General Tso's chicken lunch special was about a week ago and you know what? It sucked.  The prep of the chicken pieces, the sauce.. the rice.  I am so done with this place.If fast food Chinese is up your alleyIf inexpensive Chinese is up your alleyIf, if large portions for cheap value is your thing..Enjoy.

22.description: I'm generally pretty snobby and impossible to please as far as dining, but this place tripped up my perpetual negativity. It is literally the best value of any restaurant on the north side. Good tasting dishes, very large portions, and their prices are what everyone else's was in 1998.I haven't had every dish, but the potstickers are definitiely some of the best in the area. I look for spicy things usually, sesame noodles and szechuan chicken are both solid.The primary factor that makes this place worthy of a review is that there isn't a molecule of pretention involved (until I walk in to pick up the food, but it's gone once I leave).

15.description: Yes they have pretty good food and was a lunch spot for me and my wife,but never use a credit or debit card there cause they act like its a new thing to them.Alwsys use cash ansd yes spliting a dish is no problem cause they r a plentiful restaurant

20.description: Tasty little cost effective Chinese place in NW Chi-raq. Easy little $6 lunch or something special. Quick and filling.

36.description: Awesome food & affordable tooo. Perfect for near by student like my self

14.description: Been going here for 16 years. Coming back from a Dr appointment I wanted to sit down and eat. Got there at 930pm only to be told she closes at ten and I should get to go. Sorry no I wanted to sit down and eat. Last time this happened I was done at 955pm and tipped very well for any bothers. You would think loyaltty pays off but no. This time I left and the lady was laughing. Well I always refer people to them about 5 went this last two weeks. Never again lost a long time customer! Ok ok never again!

58.description: Went after seeing them on Check Please. Menu and prices don't disappoint. They said they served Intellegensia coffee but honestly didn't taste like it, tasted like regular ok coffee. I can't give full stars due to way underestimated wait time. We were told 30 minutes and an hour later we were seated. We realize it gets busy (went on Sunday) but a more realistic number would have been better - we could have come back later because honestly for as good as it was, I wouldn't wait that long again. Sorry but it's true. Also, they don't give out wi-fi password, which is weird considering they expect me to sit there for an hour. What gives? Finally, BYOB would be nice but that may result in even longer wait times so maybe not! Anyways, the stars go to the food, which is really the standout of this place!

56.description: This AM was our first time there.... Featured on CHECK PLEASE.30 minute wait.... But well worth it.We were a party of 4Fresh squeezed OJ other juice choices available too. Friendly and attentive wait staff.Our meals were delicious a repeat for sure.

29.description: Took a gamble while visiting Chicago for 2 days, picked up relatives and looked on Yelp for a place to have breakfast. Bryn Mawr sounded interesting. It was busy, noisy, lively, groups of friends chattering, tasty breakfast with lots of variety on the menu, 10 minute wait. All in all great place!

42.description: Omg breakfast was amazing here!!!! It was our first time and we go out for breakfast every Sunday! The restaurant is small but we were seated right away even though they were busy!  I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because we were seated at a high table and they had these black metal backless chairs and I kept sliding off of them they were weird and uncomfortable luckily I had a jacket with me I tied it around my waist and that helped me from sliding. I will definitely be having breakfast there again!

23.description: Literally the BEST breakfast I've ever had! My husband and I come here every Sunday for breakfast and we absolutely love it. Everything on the menu is phenomenal (my current obsession is the cinnamon hotcakes with a side of potatoes), the presentation is always precise and the staff is extremely friendly. If you come during brunch time there is typically a 10-20 minute wait but it's absolutely worth it. (If you hate waiting I would recommend coming from 7am-8:30am to beat the rush) I live 5 minutes away and I never even knew this place existed but I'm very happy we decided to stop in months ago!

47.description: Like most recent reviewers, we tried BMBC after seeing it on Check Please! We went on a Sunday at 11:00. As expected, it was packed, but to be fair, the restaurant is a shoebox. There was one hostess scurrying about taking names on a spiral notebook. We waited (because there is literally nothing else within walking distance of what's never been the most appealing neighborhood) and were seated by the open kitchen area. If you have the patience, I would recommend being seated away from the kitchen as our clothes reeked of food for the remainder of the day. With that said, I tried the verde chilaquiles with scrambled eggs. I was most excited for the plantains, but was disappointed to receive two dried out plantains, dry Spanish rice and scrambled eggs that had congealed into one big lump. If you know me, you know that I finished my meal, but not without some level of buyer's remorse. Plus, the mole was biting back all day long. My wife, who was not at all pleased with the long wait, ordered the salmon plate - a safe but dull selection. Service was great, price was about right, but I failed to see why people were so gaga about BMBC.

8.description: Well Maybe this is just not my breakfastclub .  I got the french omelette.. it looked good but tasted really bland... My coffee was great... the pancakes were just pancakes..& my service kinda sucked... I went here because of the yelp ratings.. not sure how it got 4 stars... mediocre at best.. maybe I should have been more adventurous w/ my food choice... which I will... just not here...

31.description: In 5 words: not as good as expected.Here are 3 reasons why:1) The brussel sprouts and pork belly component (I considered it more like chopped bacon than the cut of meat with crispy skin) of my pajun pancake dish was overly salted.  Did it really need to sit in a pool of (soy-ish) sauce?2) While the colorful plating was pleasing to the eye, my brunch ended up looking better than it tasted.  The potato cubes and eggs were pretty basic, and the scallion pancake was a bit heavy handed on the onions.3) The waiter made it a point to ask me what kind of toast I wanted to accompany my meal, but it was forgotten.  Check and check!

34.description: We just finished our first breakfast here. It was SUPERB! We ordered the Chilaquiles Con Rojos and the Veggie breakfast skillet, both were as good as anything we have ever had at a breakfast restaurant. The atmosphere is very charming with a lot of unique and original design features. The service was excellent and we could not give this a higher recommendation.

16.description: If you like good food and horrible service or willing to deal with the bad service, then come give this spot a try. The food was nonetheless really good. A lot of people recommend the skirt steak skillet and it did not disappoint. Every bite was delicious. The pico de gallo really suit well with the skillet. There were even avocado underneath. Yum!But the service was really bad. We were really patient group but the food took so long to come out and when my friend asked about our order, she told my friend be patient child. And we clearly saw her babbling to her coworker about us. Then when the food came, she told us how we should have been patient. Then when we were waiting on the bill, the machine rebooted. I can understand that it is out of their control but by that time we were clearly already prepare to leave because of how horrible the service was.

13.description: What a great little place!  The food is fantastic and service wonderful.  They've recently been featured on an episode of "Check, Please!", so it seems to have brought in a good amount of business.  We've been there two times, and both have been great.  They have a wonderful selection of breakfast specials (black bean cakes with poached eggs and avocado, sweet potato hotcakes, waffles, omelets, etc.).  We went recently and tried their spiced banana waffle...OMG.  It's hard to get a waffle right, people, and this place has it down to a science!  It was perfectly crispy on the outside, but also tender, moist, and super flavorful on the inside.  Heaven.  Service is wonderful, attentive, and genuine.  If you're looking for a delicious local breakfast spot, this place is it!

11.description: Woohoo! My friends and I made the voyage over to North Park after eyeing Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club on Check, Please. And thank goodness we moseyed in because it was a phenomenal experience.Making it to Check, Please typically pushes an establishment to the brink of collapse due to the onslaught. However, the entire staff handled it with such grace that I was truly astonished.  We went on a Tuesday late morning and it was reasonably packed. We were greeted immediately and grabbed seats at the communal table in the rear. Before sitting down, I took a photo of the specials board at the front, just in case we didn't get the entire spiel. Service was on-point: coffee/water was promptly refilled, waitress was highly knowledgeable of the intricacies of the menu, and appropriate condiments were delivered to the table before even asking for them.We got the chorizo skillet (overwhelming amount of deliciousness), chilaquiles verdes (yummy, perfect for hangovers), and rancheros borrachos (literally demolished in mere minutes). The first and last dish features chorizo and it was marvelously seasoned and hot. The rancheros came with a side of the plantains and they were just luscious. Price point was perfect. Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club is an international diner-esque food in a wonderful setting.

39.description: Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club has some of the best breakfast food I've ever had. Many classic options and many specials. And the coffee is amazing.I can't recommend any one dish - from my experience pick anything and you'll love it. That being said expect a hefty wait time if you come during peak hours. Servers are always friendly and I've never had a wrong order. However - the speed leaves a bit to be desired. I feel like my server is always on the other side of the restaurant and not readily checking on tables. Each time we come in it does take some time to get our food ordered, and then some time to get our check. Overall would definitely recommend.

37.description: This place is absolutely delicious. I had the lump crab eggs Benedict and it was incredible. Great atmosphere, great service, great prices. LOVE it.

0.description: Great place for Sunday breakfast. Rich menu. Delish dishes.Love their coffee mugs. Someone got a good eye for a detail. Servers and busboys are awesome. They really know what they are doing. Very friendly and helpfull. On the other hand, the girl who host there shouldn't run any restaurant. No smile. Not even the eye contact. Feels like she is there only cause she have to. I guess the restaurant is about food and servers, not a hostess so still 5 stars!Will be back soon :-)P

38.description: Woohoo! My friends and I made the voyage over to North Park after eyeing Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club on Check, Please. And thank goodness we moseyed in because it was a phenomenal experience.Making it to Check, Please typically pushes an establishment to the brink of collapse due to the onslaught. However, the entire staff handled it with such grace that I was truly astonished.  We went on a Tuesday late morning and it was reasonably packed. We were greeted immediately and grabbed seats at the communal table in the rear. Before sitting down, I took a photo of the specials board at the front, just in case we didn't get the entire spiel. Service was on-point: coffee/water was promptly refilled, waitress was highly knowledgeable of the intricacies of the menu, and appropriate condiments were delivered to the table before even asking for them.We got the chorizo skillet (overwhelming amount of deliciousness), chilaquiles verdes (yummy, perfect for hangovers), and rancheros borrachos (literally demolished in mere minutes). The first and last dish features chorizo and it was marvelously seasoned and hot. The rancheros came with a side of the plantains and they were just luscious. Price point was perfect. Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club is an international diner-esque food in a wonderful setting.

51.description: wow. This place was awesome. I got here around 10AM to kill some time before my flight back to DC after staying with some friends. I arrived and the place was absolutely packed. Went in and put my name on the list and she said it'd be about 25 minutes. I went back out into the snow and hung around for a while trying to keep warm since there's really no place to stand inside, it was already packed to the gills. I was finally seated and already knew what I wanted. The sausage gravy with a side of 1 bread pudding french toast. The sausage gravy was really good! My only recommendation was to dice up the sausage instead of having round slices, and use a little bit more sausage. It was really mild so it did get lost a little. The french toast was really good! Something I'd never had before and definitely enjoyed. A great spot but make sure you get there early so you're not stuck sitting out in the rain!

27.description: Where do I start? This place is AMAZING!! the pancakes are so delicious! It's only my second time here and I love the place! The food is great the service is kind of slow but overall the food is amazing I love the atmosphere and the setting of BBC! It's a great place I just wish it was bigger! It gets packed so quickly but the food is always great! I would recommend this place! Amazing food you won't regret it!

32.description: We arrived right before 11 to a 15-20 minute wait, but you could tell the early crowd was wrapping up and the lunch crowd was about to show. We were the first people waiting, and it was a mess as they just tell you congregate around the host stand/entrance/exit.  This is poor planning and as we left it was a crowded mess. The servers showed little urgency to clear tables to drop off checks, it was annoying as there were lots of tables ready to leave. There are too many items on the menu, I felt like I was at a mini Cheesecake factory. It leads to confusion.  Brunch, breakfast, sides, lunch but on Sunday, etc, not well thought out.The content of the menu seemed interesting as there was a lot of unique blending of ingredients and styles.  However, the looks were deceiving as nothing tasted as good as it sounded.The steak skillet was a bountiful amount of food, but in the end was just kind of forgettable.I asked the server for help between the pajun pancake and the sweet potato hotcakes. The sweet potato was described as sweeter over savor so I chose that. What a let down. Literally the most boring hotcake I've ever had. They were basically grain flavorless pancakes with chunks of sweet potato in them. Terrible dish.  The blueberries and pecans didn't go with this.  Total miss. The apple maple sausage was pretty good, but too expensive at over $1.30 per link. Maybe we got the wrong items but this is nothing more than the average generic brunch spot in Chicago, except its at least a 20 minute drive north of Chicago in the middle of nowhere.This is a skip.

54.description: Always delicious. Come early!! It will be a real shame if NEIU goes forward with their eminent domain suite and takes over this property

48.description: I wanted to like this place! There was a 30 minute wait, which is typically a good thing. +cute place! +fresh squeezed orange juice was good -biscuits and gravy were ok. Biscuits didn't taste homemade and the gravy was very bland. -chorizo torta was just missing something. My boyfriend said it was like eating a sloppy joe, it just needed something to hold everything together. -while the potatoes had decent flavor, they weren't as crispy as breakfast potatoes usually are. Maybe we should have picked other meals, but I had really high hopes for this place.

44.description: Ordered the sourdough stuffed  French toast and literally only took two bites and was very full. Saved the rest for later and was just enough for dinner. Cute place right next to northwestern. Hometown vibe. The menu is brunch with a Mexican twist.

24.description: A cute small restaurant...We went on a weekday around 12 maybe? It wasn't busy. Staff wasn't anything extraordinary...they have specials so I got the salmon Benedict....the bread pudding French toast was also really good. My friend got the steak..he thought it was over cooked. Not a restaurant I'll crave to go to. But definitely worth going to at least once.

7.description: BUZZ- Chorizo Skillet (7/10)I ALSO TRIED- Pork Sausage Gravy Biscuits (5/10)An old friend was visiting us from Korea, so another one of our friends scoured the internet to find a place for us to eat, and somehow came up with this place. I've never even heard of this place, and the word "club" had me thinking there was actually some kind of membership required. Well, luckily there is no membership. The place is not that big, but it's apparently pretty popular, because there was a 30 minute wait when we got there on Saturday morning at 10. By the time we left, the line was just as long. I checked up Yelp to give me some guidance, and even though there weren't that many reviews, most were pretty positive. Problem is, I didn't really know what to get, since, like most breakfast places, their menu is pretty big and everyone has their own favorite.CHORIZO SKILLETThe item with the just slightly more mention than most on Yelp was the Chorizo Skillet, and on top of that, the ingredients were really close to the Mexicana Skillet at Wildberry in Schaumburg, which is one of my 10/10 dishes. Obviously, since I love that dish, every bite of this was going to be in comparison to that.Let's start with what's in it: chorizo, onion, tomatoes, black beans, avocado, sour cream,  chipotle sauce, roasted potato hash, 2 eggs, and cheddar cheese. I replaced cheddar with Chihuahua cheese in mine, which is what I do at Wildberry too. Now, a few of the differences here were the addition of black beans, diced potatoes instead of hash browns, and chipotle sauce. It also was missing the jalapeños. They did give a few leaves of cilantro, but it was more like garnish than it was for actual flavoring, which was a problem. Cilantro really helps flavor the dish with a flavor of freshness that only it can provide.Now a thing about chorizo...it's salty. It's delicious, but too much uninhibited chorizo and it just because a salt mine. It's the job of everything around it to balance it, but not to snuff it out (like omelettes usually do). The loss of cilantro hurt it a bit, but the black beans, while I think of as sort of a neutral addition to the dish, cut it a bit too. The potatoes I think were seasoned great to eat by themselves, but if the goal was to cut the saltiness of the chorizo, it actually made it worse. The avocados and sour cream helped quite a bit too, but there was just a little too much chorizo at the end of the day, and it ended up being a bit too salty for my taste.Now the biggest thing is this chipotle sauce. Wildberry gives you the spice in the form of jalapeños and salsa. That gives you a nice clean spicy kick. The salsa and cilantro in Wildberry's skillet give you the air of freshness and the salsa and jalapeños add a little bit of sour instead of salt. The chipotle sauce here gives it a little too much bold and salty flavors and just sort of ends up dulling the peaks of the chorizo, but again, adding salt. I can probably explain it like this. If you like the taste of Tabasco (clean, spicy, pointed, sour, sweet), you'll like Wildberry's better. If you like Cholula (bold, salty, smoky, steady) then you'll probably like Bryn Mawr's. I for one am definitely still Wildberry!BISCUITS & GRAVYI only had a taste of this, but while I can't say a whole lot for the gravy, I can say that the biscuit tasted too doughy for me. Not really a fan of that flavor. I want more buttery and creamy flavors. McDonald's biscuits I think are pretty top notch.BEING BAD FEELS PRETTY GOOD, HUH?I dunno...not so creative right now. That's a line from the Breakfast Club. Anyway, the place has a lot going for it. The menu is pretty decent, so I'm sure you can find something to eat here. I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but if we happened to meet here again, I wouldn't complain. I'd definitely try something else though.

49.description: Great breakfast place!   I've lived in the area for 20 years, I'm glad a place like this is finally in our own backyard.   Between this and the Local Pizzeria - I no longer have to drive far for good food.

40.description: Went there on Sunday and were lucky to arrive at Noonish so we didn't have a wait ( there was one at 1ish when we left ).  We got seated right away and the waiter gave us time to review the menu.  I asked for suggestions as it was our first time there and I received both sweet and savory suggestions.  I ordered the Chinchillas with verde sauce and it was wonderful!  We got a side of the potatoes ( hash - but not really hash ) and that was great too!  This will definitely be a regular place for us to go!

53.description: We were there just before the Check Please show ( and, unfortunately, the day of the Paris shootings but that has nothing to do with the restaurant), before the crowds were expected to hit. I like it and will go back again.Prices are in line with other nice breakfast places. Portions are generous. I had the dish with Brussels sprouts and pork belly and a soy/?teriyaki sauce and eggs and really liked it. My friend had the curry chicken salad and was equally pleased.The Specials board is in the front and I missed it coming in. I would have wanted to try the cream of poblano soup: that sounds  tempting.Service was friendly.They are trying to develop "regulars" in addition to just "drop-bys' " and I think they will be able to do that, especially with Northeastern Illinois University so close by.Parking is on the street, meter boxed  and plentiful .I like the place a lot.

30.description: Saw this on Check Please and waited until the onslaught passed after the  broadcast to give it a try.  The food was just okay in my opinion.  I had the sourdough french toast with scrambled eggs, canadian bacon, arugula, and asiago cheese.  The sandwich was as dry as a bone and the roasted potatoes were also dry and needed salt.  My husband enjoyed his bread pudding french toast and my son said that his biscuits and gravy were good but the scrambled eggs, potatoes, and sausage were just pedestrian.  The portions were generous but overpriced.  The coffee was just so so.  The food looks amazing on the plate but it's just ehhhh.   As much as I wanted to love this place, I didn't.  I won't be back. My son said it could have been an off day and he would try it again.

46.description: This is an amazing neighborhood breakfast spot.The food can be best described as standard American breakfast fare kicked up a notch (or three).The coffee is sourced from a local roaster and is excellent.The service is outstanding.   The servers are all on their game and you can flag down any one of them (not just your server) to get you anything you need.It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is all deep grainy woods and is very homey.

1.description: Been here twice for breakfast on a Monday. Our first visit was unfortunate in the sense that it was a holiday, they had just had their Check Please episode aired and it was the coldest day of the year. There's not a whole lotta standing room in this restaurant. My mouth was watering as we watched plate after plate of yumminess get devoured. Kudos to them for getting what seemed like 40 people seated withing our 20 min wait. For the record I don't wait, this was worth it!Delicious, fresh, well presented is the least I can say for our meals. I'm a waffle lover and my date is a skillet kinda guy. It was all excellent. Good coffee as well. Service was attentive. Love the decor. My mouth is watering just thinking about this place. I wish it was closer to home, we pass at least 9 breakfast joints/family restaurants on the way here. Fair warning: No free parking in the neighborhood. Metered parking on Bryn Mawr, but its only a couple of $.

55.description: First time eating here. Place was packed when we arrived, but did not have to wait long. Sat at communal table which wasn't to bad. Food was good, good portions, service was nice. A bit pricey but the everything was fresh and of good cuality. No parking, had to park in the street.

9.description: A cute small restaurant...We went on a weekday around 12 maybe? It wasn't busy. Staff wasn't anything extraordinary...they have specials so I got the salmon Benedict....the bread pudding French toast was also really good. My friend got the steak..he thought it was over cooked. Not a restaurant I'll crave to go to. But definitely worth going to at least once.

26.description: Cute little neighborhood place with good food. The chorizo skillet is wonderful. Nice for individuals or small groups, but not enough room for a large group.

25.description: Fantastic breakfast menu. Unique and absolutely delicious   Very long wait on weekends

12.description: Really great breakfast experience.   Nice diverse menu.   (I had the chorizo skillet and really enjoyed it.)   Prices are reasonable.  Very good service (although it took the food a bit longer than expected to come out of the kitchen).    Kid friendly.   Opens early (7 am) and the place had plenty of seating available when we were there from 7 to 8 am on a Sunday.

59.description: I haven't enjoyed a breakfast like this in a long time! I had the vegetable skillet, my husband had the steak skillet and our son had the Oreo cakes. All delicious and added plus the coffee was some of the best I've ever had! Our server, Kevin, had great suggestions and was just overall GREAT!

21.description: In the future, YELP will eventually establish star rating criteria..  After seeing this on Check Please, I went WAY out of my hood to meet someone here (note--this very interesting neighborhood seemed to have tons of interesting places to eat).  As fellow yelper Tricia D noted In 5 words: not as good as expected.Place is fine--nothing special--PLUS MY CLOTHES SMELLED LIKE GREASE WHEN I LEFT--fine neighborhood spot--very expensive for what it was--Don't believe the hype.  Also, no free parking on side streets.

17.description: Just ate here this past weekend after being denied expedient entry to other brunch places. Dude, it's so hard to have tasty brunch things in my belly when starting out at 10 on a Saturday.  Luckily, this place is close to home and offered seating for two in under 15 minutes.We had so many things-- a steak skillet, a Caribbean-inspired omelet, french toasts, waffles. Everything was good, some things more amazing than others, but I wasn't disappointed with a thing we had. Thumbs up for relatively reasonable prices, fast service, and creative options that are filling. I'll be back.

10.description: Excellent food. This is a nice restaurant with great service. We had the lemon crab Benedict and the banana spiced waffles. Both dishes were excellent and well prepared. I highly recommend this place for brunch.

5.description: Amazing AS USUAL!! Do not leave here without trying the bread pudding French toast! The portions are always great and I typically leave with enough for another meal. My sister and I both got skillets and shared the bread pudding French toast  so good!! I clearly have a problem I've been to this place more times than I can count

3.description: This was one of the best breakfast places I've been to yet! Passing by I kept seeing long lines outside the door on Sundays so sure enough I had to try it on Leap Day! The service was excellent! Place small and cozy! And food was amazing- I'm talking about the famous bread pudding French toast- it's the best toast Ive ever tasted in my life! I also liked the breakfast torta which had a good kick to it! The steak skirt was good but I felt some of the potato's were well done...I appreciate the waiter giving me a generous amount of cream cheese! I will definitely come back to try the other foods!

35.description: This is the best breakfast restaurant I have ever gone to. The food is exceptional. I have yet to have something I don't like. The severs are all friendly and the atmosphere is very positive! I have a hard time saying what my favorite is but the breakfast burrito is awesome. Yesterday I had the Balsamic Poached Pear French toast and it just got better with each bite! I love to sit at 1 if 4 counter seats and watch the kitchen in action. I am amazed at the fluidity in the small space, they seem like they are extensions of one person. There is a wait on weekends but it is well worth it. I hope Manny and his crew are here for many years!!!

19.description: I really like this place. Its too bad its soo small. It was about a 45 minute wait, which was fine since it was nice outside. Everything our table ordered was great - I had the veggie skillet and it was amazing.  I will be back again.

28.description: First time in Chicago with my husband and this was our first stop and it did not let us down! Amazing food &awesome service!

45.description: We got the caprese omelet and the bread pudding French toast. Both are a must! You will not be disappointed I promise. Reasonable prices.

33.description: Had the crab cakes benedicts special. It was delicious and unique. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves the food life.  I hope to come back soon to try the rest of their menu! Also shot out to Kevin our waiter for those funny jokes which made my morning better!!

43.description: Sat next to the counter where all the food was coming out. Literally everything looked incredible.

2.description: Came here for brunch the other weekend with a few girlfriends. It was a long wait, almost 30 minutes. Honestly, the food was just okay and wasn't really worth the wait.I wasn't a huge fan of anything on the menu (which was a little limited, in my opinion), so I just got the two egg breakfast. Two eggs, scrambled, with breakfast potatoes and toast. I subbed pancakes for toast. They charged an extra $4 for this. I've never been up-charged for subbing pancakes for toast at any breakfast place I've ever eaten at before...Like I said, food was just ok. Eggs were ok, nothing special. The breakfast potatoes were pretty good, but mine were cold by the time I got them, which was a little disappointing.The pancakes were super delicious! Very light and fluffy, served with a few fresh blueberries and some powdered sugar. However, was 2 small pancakes worth an extra $4? Probably not.Overall, I wouldn't go again. My meal was $15, and I don't think it was worth it. My girlfriends said the same thing, that their food was just okay but nothing super special.Overall, probably not worth a long wait on the weekend.

18.description: For those of you who use yelp to find great places to stop and eat. This is one of them!. The breakfast was very filling. And very pleasing. I love it when people are creative with the foods that we eat. Because when they are, this is what they come up with. They mixture of different taste blend delightfully in you mouth. The staff was very friendly and easy to talk to. Made you feel welcomed. And not rushed to place an order. So again, if you're reading this, stop bye. I would definitely recommend. I would guarantee you will not be disappointed. Because I sure wasn't.

41.description: What a great little place!  The food is fantastic and service wonderful.  They've recently been featured on an episode of "Check, Please!", so it seems to have brought in a good amount of business.  We've been there two times, and both have been great.  They have a wonderful selection of breakfast specials (black bean cakes with poached eggs and avocado, sweet potato hotcakes, waffles, omelets, etc.).  We went recently and tried their spiced banana waffle...OMG.  It's hard to get a waffle right, people, and this place has it down to a science!  It was perfectly crispy on the outside, but also tender, moist, and super flavorful on the inside.  Heaven.  Service is wonderful, attentive, and genuine.  If you're looking for a delicious local breakfast spot, this place is it!

52.description: Excellent food.  I gave 4 stars because I'm stingy with my stars.  Lemon crab cake benedict, blueberry multigrain pancakes, omelets were all good.  Definitely worth the hike from the west loop.  Innovative and really delicious.   Word of caution,  if you're all about that BASS not the Wait, don't bother coming here on a weekend.  Try a week day because that wait is ridiculous,  especially if you're starving

50.description: For those of you who use yelp to find great places to stop and eat. This is one of them!. The breakfast was very filling. And very pleasing. I love it when people are creative with the foods that we eat. Because when they are, this is what they come up with. They mixture of different taste blend delightfully in you mouth. The staff was very friendly and easy to talk to. Made you feel welcomed. And not rushed to place an order. So again, if you're reading this, stop bye. I would definitely recommend. I would guarantee you will not be disappointed. Because I sure wasn't.

4.description: In 5 words: not as good as expected.Here are 3 reasons why:1) The brussel sprouts and pork belly component (I considered it more like chopped bacon than the cut of meat with crispy skin) of my pajun pancake dish was overly salted.  Did it really need to sit in a pool of (soy-ish) sauce?2) While the colorful plating was pleasing to the eye, my brunch ended up looking better than it tasted.  The potato cubes and eggs were pretty basic, and the scallion pancake was a bit heavy handed on the onions.3) The waiter made it a point to ask me what kind of toast I wanted to accompany my meal, but it was forgotten.  Check and check!

6.description: In the future, YELP will eventually establish star rating criteria..  After seeing this on Check Please, I went WAY out of my hood to meet someone here (note--this very interesting neighborhood seemed to have tons of interesting places to eat).  As fellow yelper Tricia D noted In 5 words: not as good as expected.Place is fine--nothing special--PLUS MY CLOTHES SMELLED LIKE GREASE WHEN I LEFT--fine neighborhood spot--very expensive for what it was--Don't believe the hype.  Also, no free parking on side streets.

22.description: We love this place we come here at least 2 Mondays a month on our day off. We live along the lake so it's a drive to get over here. One time we came on a sunday and the line was out the door. It's worth the wait weather permitting. If the owners are reading this i would  like to suggest the perfect location a former bar and restaurant with huge outdoor patio off the back and side. Multiple rooms. The location is grace and clark. Please open a location there my business is 2 buildings away and I'll eat there everyday.Back to the food. I have tried multiple things here. I am a creature of habit and always order the same thing. I see servers bring out food to other tables and have to ask what's that. It's so hard deciding when you see the presentation. I have never been disappointed in anything. Top notch love this place. I will always come here.

15.description: This AM was our first time there.... Featured on CHECK PLEASE.30 minute wait.... But well worth it.We were a party of 4Fresh squeezed OJ other juice choices available too. Friendly and attentive wait staff.Our meals were delicious a repeat for sure.

57.description: A very cool room and extremely pleasant service. Off the beaten path, so a really pleasant surprise. The food was good and nicely presented. The servers were truly terrific, and our gorgeous waitress never stopped smiling. I doubt I'll ever forget her or the great experience I had here.

20.description: BUZZ- Chorizo Skillet (7/10)I ALSO TRIED- Pork Sausage Gravy Biscuits (5/10)An old friend was visiting us from Korea, so another one of our friends scoured the internet to find a place for us to eat, and somehow came up with this place. I've never even heard of this place, and the word "club" had me thinking there was actually some kind of membership required. Well, luckily there is no membership. The place is not that big, but it's apparently pretty popular, because there was a 30 minute wait when we got there on Saturday morning at 10. By the time we left, the line was just as long. I checked up Yelp to give me some guidance, and even though there weren't that many reviews, most were pretty positive. Obviously, since I love that dish, every bite of this was going to be in comparison to that.Let's start with what's in it: chorizo, onion, tomatoes, black beans, avocado, sour cream,  chipotle sauce, roasted potato hash, 2 eggs, and cheddar cheese. Now, a few of the differences here were the addition of black beans, diced potatoes instead of hash browns, and chipotle sauce. It also was missing the jalapeños. They did give a few leaves of cilantro, but it was more like garnish than it was for actual flavoring, which was a problem. Cilantro really helps flavor the dish with a flavor of freshness that only it can provide.Now a thing about chorizo...it's salty. It's delicious, but too much uninhibited chorizo and it just because a salt mine. It's the job of everything around it to balance it, but not to snuff it out (like omelettes usually do). The loss of cilantro hurt it a bit, but the black beans, while I think of as sort of a neutral addition to the dish, cut it a bit too. The potatoes I think were seasoned great to eat by themselves, but if the goal was to cut the saltiness of the chorizo, it actually made it worse. The avocados and sour cream helped quite a bit too, but there was just a little too much chorizo at the end of the day, and it ended up being a bit too salty for my taste.Now the biggest thing is this chipotle sauce. Wildberry gives you the spice in the form of jalapeños and salsa. That gives you a nice clean spicy kick. The salsa and cilantro in Wildberry's skillet give you the air of freshness and the salsa and jalapeños add a little bit of sour instead of salt. The chipotle sauce here gives it a little too much bold and salty flavors and just sort of ends up dulling the peaks of the chorizo, but again, adding salt. I can probably explain it like this. If you like the taste of Tabasco (clean, spicy, pointed, sour, sweet), you'll like Wildberry's better. If you like Cholula (bold, salty, smoky, steady) then you'll probably like Bryn Mawr's. I for one am definitely still Wildberry!BISCUITS & GRAVYI only had a taste of this, but while I can't say a whole lot for the gravy, I can say that the biscuit tasted too doughy for me. Not really a fan of that flavor. I want more buttery and creamy flavors. McDonald's biscuits I think are pretty top notch.BEING BAD FEELS PRETTY GOOD, HUH?I dunno...not so creative right now. That's a line from the Breakfast Club. Anyway, the place has a lot going for it. The menu is pretty decent, so I'm sure you can find something to eat here. I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but if we happened to meet here again, I wouldn't complain. I'd definitely try something else though.

36.description: Excellent food. This is a nice restaurant with great service. We had the lemon crab Benedict and the banana spiced waffles. Both dishes were excellent and well prepared. I highly recommend this place for brunch.

14.description: This is an amazing neighborhood breakfast spot.The food can be best described as standard American breakfast fare kicked up a notch (or three).The coffee is sourced from a local roaster and is excellent.The service is outstanding.   The servers are all on their game and you can flag down any one of them (not just your server) to get you anything you need.It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is all deep grainy woods and is very homey.

12.description: Went here with my sister after our movie on Sunday. We ordered typical taco bell stuff and ate it there. It took a little while to get our food but that's because there were so many folks ahead of us. Before we left, I ordered a bunch of stuff to go for everyone at home. It was ready so quickly that it made my head spin. Fast! The employees were ok. They were nice and respectful (to their elders, lol)... In any case, I parents whom never had taco bell before that night, are now addicted to it. My dad kept asking about the chalupa - their Greek, it's the closest thing to a gyro without the heartburn, they're in heaven!

3.description: Alesha rocked the drive thru again!  Great visit, great breakfast, great hospitality and without question,  great staff!

1.description: My favorite Taco Bell spot! The location is always very clean and neat and I love the decor! The staff are attentive and nice! The bathrooms are always clean and the food is Taco Bell quality! I've been coming here for years!

2.description: Yeah, it's hard to get excited about a fast food joint so this will be short and sweet.  The first thing I noticed was that their air conditioning was working very good which on one of the hottest and muggiest days of the summer is a very good thing.  Next I noticed that the restaurant was nice and clean which is of course important.  Next the food was exactly as it should have been and was put together with care so it actually looked like it does on the commercials and not just an unappealing pile of ingredients.  Lastly the flavors were good.  It's not authentic Mexican flavors, but of course nobody going to a Taco Bell would expect it to be authentic Mexican flavors.  I'm sure I'll be back many more times over the time I live in this neighborhood.

9.description: Everytime we head for the doctor's we stop over here for a quick fix of American-style tacos.  Their drive-thru is pretty quick and painless.  No complaints so far....  but what ever happened to the chihuahua?

10.description: Yes, I'm a closet Taco Bell addict. There was a time in my life during my college years that Taco Bell would be my dinner place 3-4 times a week, not counting the occasional late night "run for the border." Authentic or not, something about their bean burritos and soft tacos keeps me coming back. Some people have White Castle or Arby's as their vice, this one is mine. I've cut my addiction down to 1-2 times a month.I normally don't review fast-food places unless they are really bad or really good. Located just 2 miles from my workplace, this one falls in the really good category. On a recent visit, I realized that I have been coming here for 9 years now and I can only recall 1 time they got my order wrong.The cashiers have changed over the years, but seems they are always polite, accurate and efficient. Go in, get what you ordered, and leave satisfied is all you can ask of your typical fast food joint. The place is well-managed by a hands-on store manager who goes out of his way to see that every drive-thru, eat-in or carryout is ready quickly. The tables and floor are clean, and their service is quick. December is an interesting time to visit since they have both Hanukkah and Christmas decorations displayed at the same time, giving it that Judeo-Christian feeling you don't get at any other restaurant I can think of.

13.description: You can't beat the price of Taco Bell. I particularly like the drive through at the Devon location because I have never had a problem. Anyway, in general, it is the best tasting (non-sub) franchise fast food out there. I have had nachos at many a bar, and Taco Bells Nachos Bell Grande is still one of my personal favorites. Again, the price is hard to beat. I knocked my review down a star because the amount of food has shrunk over the past few years. Further, the amount of weird combinations and innovations has gotten too far out there.

16.description: This kid I mentor really likes Taco Bell....this is the location we usually visit. Eh...it's Taco Bell, they are all generally the same. The customer service here isn't abyssimal, which you generally can expect from fast food. They're fast, cheap and the kid likes it, so what else can you really expect?

6.description: Only Taco Bell around here and  I'm glad it's near me. Service is good depending who you get.  4 outta 5 times you will get a good cashier. Love the Baja Blast Mt Dew. Only place where you can get it. As for prices, it's good and most of the time they have the prices that they advertise on tv.

15.description: I come here all the time. It's amazing how Taco Bell can take the same simple ingredients and come out with something new every few months. Some of my favorite items are the nacho cheese chalupa- who remembers when these were .99? I also love their chicken ranch gordita and cheesy fiesta potatoes. Me an my friends come here all the time and the only complaint is that we have had our orders gotten wrong frequently at the late night drive-thru. My friend also should avoid the beefy bean burito lest we turn his car into a gas chamber once again! They also have baja-blast a tropical, pineapple mountain dew that seems to glow with artificial color and tastes like candy.

0.description: Taco bell. This is something i am an expert on. They have been feeding me all over the country  for more than thirty years. I'd like to think i have seen the best and i have seen the worst. This is a solid four star tbell. Clean enough but sometimes smells like they used old mop water to clean the floors. Sometimes i order twenty burritos just to test them out. From time to time they have forgotten one in the drive through. Ok. This will happen, what matters is how they deal with it. Of course they hooked it up. All i had to do was call. Pretty good spot. Inside and out

5.description: W orst service I've ever experienced. I was hungry after a long day at work so I decided to stop at Tao bell. After pulling up to the window I asked a simple question since I rarely go to taco bell to be responded by a very rude employee michael. After placing my order I drive up to pay and he rudely snatches the money out of my hand and when passing me my drink almost drops it after I asked to speak to a manager yells that he is tbe manager so I drove off threw my food out scared to eat it I don't understand why he was so rude or angry especially to be a "manager" . But I NEVER be going back to this franchise!

11.description: Great service, I bought a meal that costed me less than $3 total with tax included. Never knew any place where I can get a meal for such a price.

8.description: It's hard to get excited about Taco Bell. But if you just have to eat Taco Bell, this is the one to go to. They never skimp on ingredients and always use just the right balance of ingredients.

4.description: OK .... I am NOT a Taco Bell fan, BUT ... there are times when it is extremely convenient. For example, today, Christopher knocked a cap on one of his teeth loose. I did have plans to make steaks today because of the Memorial Day Holiday. Needless to say he wants to avoid anything that needs extreme chewing. It suddenly hit me to get some Taco Bell soft tacos. I went through the drive through and got the 12 for 10 bucks. (With tax it came to exactly 11 smackeroos.) I brought them home and offered one to Mom, who of course hates Mexican food. Well now I have proof that Taco Bell is not Mexican food because Mom really liked the tacos. She said she could understand why young people like Taco Bell and because of the shredded lettuce on top proclaimed her tacos as "nutritious". She actually ate 2 of them. Saints be praised!! I did have 2 myself, doused in hot sauce, and Christopher is working his way through the rest of them this afternoon. So, I have to pronounce this Taco Bell as OK, because it bailed me out of a lot of cooking and Mom liked it. I will put my personal taste on the back burner for now. Taco Bell, I owe ya one!!!

14.description: They Have Very Slow Service and Staff Are Rude

7.description: The last time I ate there I got sick. I felt like shards of glass were moving thru me.  I tell everybody that.  I am not the only one who got sick. Save Your money and go to a normal taco place.

12.description: I will give this place a lot of slack because it appeared the ahjumma (literally aunty, but in this case referring to owner), seemed to be the only one working the place (both in the kitchen and in the front) the night that we went. We wanted to order this chicken stew dish but was told that they don't make it anymore, not that they ran out of it and stopped for the night but it seemed that they just stopped making it (if you no longer serve a dish please please please remove it from the menu so as to not tease customers like that). We ordered other dishes and I have to say that they were okay, not the best but certainly not the worst and the banchan (side dishes) was not that impressive. She did take a long time to fill water glasses and such and I think it was because she was the only one there working which is why I'm giving this place 3 and not 2 stars...

3.description: Below average food and customer service. Would not recommend to anyone. Came for lunch on a Wednesday between lunch and dinner rush. Place was completely empty besides two employees working. My three companions and I were forced to seat ourselves. The waiter was not friendly and didn't introduce himself. I ordered the mixed rice bowl. It was bland, not well seasoned, luke warm. They served our drinks from soda pop cans while the waiter touched our drink glasses around the rim of the glass. The waiter didn't take the time to explain any of the Korean dishes. Ambience was equal to that of a doctor's waiting room. Played Korean news loudly on the lone TV.

1.description: Ordered Seafood hot pot for 19.99 and spicy rice cake for 10.99. The hot pot was small and it seems they just threw ingredients and didn't really care. The spicy rice cake is not spicy. It has a tomato paste, ketchup flavor. Not athenthic korean flavor. If you want really spicy try tofu house.

2.description: Great Korean food. Reminds me of home cooking. I really like Korean restaurants for the side dishes and they did not disappoint here! Had the dak gae jang. Chicken was tender and the soup was perfectly spicy. The fried mandoo was amazing as well!

9.description: I couldn't trust So Gong Dong Tofu House to prepare a carryout dinner for my husband after being served under cooked food there, so I went next door to Mee-na-ri to order some take out.  The lady owner was super welcoming and cheerful, which is a totally different attitude from the SGDTH's owner's attitude.  I was a little nervous about ordering from here without reading the reviews first, but for some reason I thought it was okay to take a shot in the dark that night.  I ordered marinated beef spare ribs and grilled mackerel.  My husband enjoyed both of these dishes.  The fish was especially fresh and juicy.  Although the variety of banchan sides were not abundant, the sides were very tasty and in generous portions.  The rice here was not your regular Korean white rice.  It was sticky sweet rice with different types of legumes such as red/black beans and garbanzo beans, which was quite tasty and had a unique texture.  I look forward to returning here and trying more dishes!

10.description: Came in here b/c So Gong Dong Tofu House lady felt like she would close early at 8pm.  Kwoky L is correct, there is no English sign, just Korean words in neon lights and the smell of bbq when you walk in the door.Came in here for a simple meal...I enjoyed my dolsot bibimbap and my gf really liked her kimchi jeegae.  Less banchan than most places, though they did include good kimchi and fermented egg.  No sprouts or dried bean curd though.  Similar to SGDTH, there were few people here, though the owner/server didn't seem to care.  Sitting near the windows though, the neon lights buzzing was a little discomforting.  And it was hot inside, we killed a mosquito when we sat down.  Still, food was good, and were we to venture back here with a larger group, there is quite an expansive menu to try; the blue crab entree looked tempting.  Probably 4 stars for food, but the mosquito and heat in the place get a minus one.

4.description: It's legit, authentic Korean food, cooked home style. They only make/prep a certain amount of ingredients for each dish, so you might not be able to order some dishes towards the end of the night. Their banchans are amazing, especially their seasoned cucumber! I got the ahgujjim, and omg it was just the right amount of spicy with just the right amount of bean sprouts! Service was great, food was great, it's baby friendly.

6.description: I'm a Korean American college student, it was my birthday, and I absolutely insisted on eating seaweed soup (meeyeokgook) as per tradition. Discovered this place after calling 15 other Korean restaurants in Chicago that all said they didn't make seaweed soup. When I called Minari, the owner lady said that she could make seaweed soup (she didn't even ask why I was looking for it), even though it wasn't on the menu and I had called the day of--turns out, there's a Korean market across the street, so she went to get the ingredients just for me. I Uber-ed from Hyde Park with a Chinese friend, but when I got there, the owner lady had packaged our meal to go because she thought we were taking it home. When I explained that we were going to eat there, she nicely and quickly unpackaged the food and served it to us in bowls--the food was still hot (or maybe she reheated it?). Also ordered bulgogi for my friend, who liked it a lot. Best service I've ever encountered at a Korean place. The owner couple were so friendly and attentive to our needs. Definitely will go again, despite the 30-minute Uber ride.

15.description: I live right near this restaurant and I'm glad I do. We've gotten takeout and dined in. The food is good and the owner is very nice. I only have a few complaints. They don't have some dishes that I like, like the cold noodle soup, and they don't offer a huge array of panchan. The restaurant is clean and comfortable and again the owner is very nice and friendly. Another plus is that they have a tv which is tuned sometimes to gossip shows. ;)

0.description: One of my fav Korean spots. Love their banchans (small dishes)! Good service. Try their Abalone congee soup and ttok bok ki

5.description: We stopped by this place in the last closing minute for a quick snack.  This is a regular Korean dining place, but not a late-night drinking lounge, so there was basically nobody and the owners were almost ready to go home.We ordered one ddukbokki (spicy rice cake).  for 9 dollars it was adequately cooked, but the dish lacked some ingredient, most prominently fish cake.  Also, the rice cake wasn't perfectly cooked, but some of them were a little hard.  On top of that we were able to feel that the owner is so eager to go home.  Nobody would know if we would have been given more time for a comfortable dining if we ordered more food.Anyway, I think it's not fair to bash on a restaurant after visiting it at their closing time and ordering only one dish for two people.  So I will write a more fair review to the restaurant after my next visit, but I have no idea when that will happen.

13.description: While a small and informal establishment, the food was phenomenal and so fresh. I enjoyed the grilled white fish and liked our side dishes. The extra rice was appreciated.Service was prompt and attentive.I need to work on my Korean.

11.description: This place has the best korean food hands down. I love this place, the food is so tasty i love it! A+++

8.description: This place has been around forever and they seriously keep it so traditional. The owner is the cook and has always been this way. You can expect the same great tasting food each and every time because its prepared and made by the owner. Awesome food. Their side-dishes are delicious as well.

14.description: This place was so hard to find, partly because the sign is in Korean. Thank God I saw the photo before I went there. Otherwise, I would be lost. The reason I wanted to try this place is because I had really good Gam Ja Tahng in Vancouver and I found that Minari serves seafood spicy soup. So, I kinda wanted to relive the whole experience.I ordered pan broiled squid, grilled white fish, and a deluxe seafood pot. The squid was excellent -- sweet and spicy but the whitefish was just okay. It did not seem very fresh to me. There were a variety of stuffs in the seafood pot: crab, prawns, fish, radish, and even brains or brain look-alikes etc. However, the soup seemed like it was made 10 minutes ago. A good soup base is boiled for hours and it's hearty and flavorful. Clearly, this is not. The side dishes are great and my favorite is the anchovies. The server kept giving me more side dishes when he saw that the dishes were empty. And there's no charge for extra rice! I was kinda disappointed though that kim chee weren't part of the sides.The service was not bad but the server was not very good at speaking English. There were only two people working in the restaurant: the cook and the server. It makes sense because there are only 9 tables. So, do not expect fast service. I think I was the only non Korean in the restaurant. The signs inside were mostly Korean except the menu. If you want to try some cook-it-yourself Korean BBQ, this is not the place to go because they don't serve any. I would rate them a 3.5 but I can't. That said, this place is definitely worth trying.

7.description: I went with a friend of mine last night I loved it.  I had Hae mool Duk Bok Ki (Sea food spicy rice cake) even though it was very spicy. It was sooooo good.  I also had Bi Bim Bop.  The owner was so nice and friendly also.

0.description: I use my Oster 76 CrewMaster clippers about 4-6 hours a day 5-6 days a week.   Last week they stopped working.  I decided to try and find a local repair shop because Oster is expensive and too much of a hassle.  I googled and found Jay & Kay and I'm very happy with their service. I dropped them off at 2 and by 3 they were finished.  Originally I was quoted at $25 however my repair was simple so they only charged me $5.  They have very convenient hours including Mondays.  It took me no time to drive up Peterson to Pulaski.  Easy street parking.  Experience was very nice.  They repair guys are all knowledgeable and friendly.  I'm now a big fan.  Jay & Kay also have salon supplies and I noticed a few clippers for sale. They were all very competitively priced.  If I ever need new clippers/combs/blades/supplies I'll be back.
